Although I was bummed about NO WIFI, & NO FRIDGE IN THE ROOM, and really bad lighting, I was trying to stay positive. 
The one thing I was upset about and will be the reason for me not returning to this hotel is the fact that there was NO HOT WATER Sunday morning. 

"You get what you pay for.

Got here and awful service! 
We stood in line for 40 mins on a Saturday to check in (why are there not more people working during such a busy time??)
Paid $160 for one night - the view is awful!!!!!
Looking at AC tunnels etc..
Then they wanna charge us extra for wifi etc! 

Do not come here and waste your money!!!

This hotel is only partially renovated and it seems you have to specify that you don't want one of the repulsive old rooms. The front desk staff were not helpful when we tried to address the problems with the room immediately after we checked in. We went from a gross room that was smelly to another room that was just gross.

The line at the front desk was so long for the duration of our stay that we never went back. I called down once about our bathroom sink because it was not draining. I called again about late checkout and was told it would be $20 to check out at noon as opposed to 11am. When I pointed out that the room was disgusting, the man I spoke to noted that I had not booked one of their "updated" rooms. I explained that I want aware you has to specify that you did not want a filthy bathroom that hasn't been updated since 1960. They also don't have 24 hour room service, stupid in Vegas. 

I didn't take many pictures but I've added a few shots of the bathroom to give you a sense of the state of the room...

I've stayed here a few times but this will probably be my last. 

Pros: Location! Absolutely love the location as we enjoy being around the high roller and Gordon's fish and chips. 
It's in the middle of the strip party. Also there are a lot of good food options available inside. Casino is nice and payouts are okay. Flamingo garden is gorgeous. Breakfast buffet is affordable and has many options. Price is relatively cheap. Rooms are clean and the views are nice. Check in and check out is easy. Most of the staff is very polite.

Cons: They recently started charging for parking, which I would be okay with if the garage was remotely nicer. The elevators in the parking garage are dirty and slow.
Pool closes extremely early and they don't let you bring in drinks or anything. Internet sucked the whole time we were there. 

Overall the hotel is a nice place to stay based mainly on price and location. Will be staying else where next time due to the most recent changes that they have done.

Stayed here for a two nights with a few friends. We were looking for cheap options to crash for a few nights, and this seemed to fit the bill. The location was incredibly convenient. 

The check-in\/ check-out line was absurdly long. For how many people were working at the front desk, it seems that the line should have moved at least 6 or 7x quicker than it actually did. Not sure what the holdup was, but from the lady's expression, this seemed to be normal. Yikes. 

Our room was decent- not quite up to what I would consider normal hotel standards, but it was alright, because we really were only looking for a clean place to rest our heads. The room was lacking almost all amenities. Very different from what we saw online when booking our room. Updates haven't been made here in quite some time and it is VERY obvious. 

If you are comparing places to stay and you have other options, I'd say go with those other options. Unless you're willing to fork out a lot more money for an actually nice room.

What a BIG disappointment !! Went there for a one week stay and this place has gone down in sooooo many ways. So sad, the rooms are not CLEANED when the maid comes in for "service", 3 days in a row my friends bed was made , mine was NOT !! This place is a dump and there are so many nicer places to stay on the strip.  I'll leave it at that.

Pounding Loud Music until 3:15!. I reserved an upgraded go room with a strip view.  Room was fine, but the problem is that all rooms that remotely face the Drais Night Club will experience loud pounding music until 3:15.  It was near impossible to sleep.  The hotel knows about this problem very well, as the operator acknowledged numerous complaints.

I Loved My Stay At THE Flamingo . We we're  close to everything the rooms were upgraded which was nice.
 Love the tv in the bathroom . I also loved the pool it was awesome . We had a blast at the flamingo . Loved the restaurants and the staff was nice.

Our room was on the worst side (if they have a good side).  They post better looking pictures on their website.  I felt like we were in the parking garage.  The lighting was poor in the room, there was a tear in the cover, tiles broken in the bathroom, lamp shades has holes, no fridge, no coffee pot and the walls in the hallway were dirty.  Would not stay here again.

So during my most recent trip to Vegas we booked our stay at the Flamingo thru Travelocity. Please keep in mind I've stayed there before and did not have any issues, hence why we stayed here again. Well everything started off crappy when we got to the hotel and were informed that the hotel did not have our reservations. So in order to stay there we had to give a credit card number to cover charges for that night, since this was a holiday weekend they charged the going rate which was well over $200\/night (no way is any room at the Flamingo worth over $200\/night).. We were told that the hotel was going to get a hold of Travelocity to confirm the stay and everything should be taken care of after that. 

The following morning we go down to the front desk and were advised that the hotel was not able to get a hold of anyone at Travelocity. So we contacted Travelocity directly and they informed us that they faxed over the appropriate paperwork twice and that the confirmation number that we had on our reservation and that WE provided to the hotel when we got there was the one that was originally provided by the Flamingo so they had no idea why the hotel did not enter our reservation into their system. We informed the hotel manager, Andre, that Travelocity had submitted the fax. He claimed he did not have it, so we called Travelocity AGAIN and stayed with them on the phone as they faxed over the paperwork to the Flamingo AGAIN. Once we confirmed the hotel got all of the necessary paperwork, WE were told to check later in the day or the following day to make sure reservation was entered in their system and that they room was charged to Travelocity and not us. Fine whatever (this is now day two of dealing with this mess). So we checked and were advised everything was OK. (We also had to go down to the desk EVERYDAY and get a new set of keys because for whatever reason, ours expired every 24 hours)

Our last morning at the Flamingo and we go to check out and we are asked for a credit card so that they can charge the last night stay since it was not covered by Travelocity. At this point, all niceness was out the door. Our reservation clearly stated how long we booked our room for and for the Flamingo to screw up entering our reservation for a SECOND time was unacceptable. We refused to give any credit card information as this screw up was theirs not ours. We also had a flight to catch that morning and did have time for Flamingo to figure this mess out last minute, which was CLEARLY their fault from the beginning. We demanded to see Andre the manager we were originally dealing with and (shocker) he was unavailable as he was on vacation. The other manager was spoke with Aaron went to his office or whatever and sent out one of the front desk ladies who advised us we can go and that they will have to figure this out with Travelocity.

So bottom line, WE had to deal with and stress over this reservation thing for the 4 days we were there, WE had to call Travelocity and have them resend paperwork to Flamingo, and WE had to demand that they straighten out this mess and check daily to make sure that the Flamingo staff was doing their job. 

It is very clear that the Front desk staff at the Flamingo and their management has no clue what is going on nor do they know how to properly troubleshoot their issues. This should never have been a situation where we the customer had to do all the leg work. We came in there with proper paperwork, confirmation numbers, etc. Flamingo is a joke, their management is a bigger joke, and I will never stay there and will make sure that everyone I know never stays there. NOT WORTH THE STRESS!!!

My friends and I booked this hotel knowing it wasn't going to be the Bellagio or the Venetian, but we were left very disappointed. Check in takes forever and the customer service staff were not welcoming at all. Day one my friend's phone, credit card, and ID were stolen at The Flamingo Pool. We were able to cancel the card, buy a new phone, but not having an ID for her to get into places ruined the trip. Pool security is only there for show. They do a thorough search of you going in the pool but not going out. Hotel security was even less helpful....saying they would not be looking at camera surveillance. Police do nothing in that city besides turn a blind eye. The phone had not been turned off and we could track the location with "Find my iPhone" and still the police were unbothered and unwilling to help with a stolen identity. The Flamingo only use surveillance for their own benefit. Wifi costs extra and is still so slow. The carpets are filthy and everyone who stays there looks very low class. Housekeeping would not give us fresh towels or bag liners since we did not want them in our room after the theft at the pool. By the way no one followed up with us after the theft and we went out of our way to make sure they had our contact information in case at least the ID showed up. Our dirty towels laid in the hallway for days since housekeeping wouldn't take them from us. Walls are paper thin and you can hear everything next door which of course was disgusting. An alarm was blaring for hours next door and the front desk did nothing after we called them and physically walked down to complain. No vents in the bathroom....it was clogged and moldy. When we went to complain about how horrible our stay was we got a business card with the wrong information on it to contact someone. The e-mail was invalid. It was so awful we checked out a day early and still did not get our money back for the night we didn't stay there. A very scummy place that does not seem safe. I loved Las Vegas on prior visits and am now afraid to go back. Please do not stay here. There are so many other options and the city themselves have some soul searching to do about their inaction.

You get what you pay for.

Roughly 120 per night with all the added fees. The room had a gross musky smell right when you walk in. 

Cons:
No fan in the bathroom.
Old building with old rooms.
Sheets are rough and uncomfortable.
Dusty, very dusty. You can literally see it on the lamps and fixtures.
No fridge.
Huge vents in our room that produced a lot of noise even when the AC was off.
Giant spotlights on the building pointing at our window.

Pros:
Price before all the fees.

I only paid $35\/night to stay in July, because I booked it on Vegas.com in April.   Cant beat the price for the location (across from Caears) and the POOL. Love the pool. Good music, water volleyball, nice little slide, and a 21+ area to escape the kiddies and go topless.  My sis and I went in there, but did not go topless and actually there was only 1 gal topless. Guys have to pay $10 to get in, girls are free, either way, its a lot nicer quieter pool with better waitress service and nicer chaise lounges.    The room itself is nice, got one overlooking the pool, but it was a hike to the elevator.   We valet parked everyday and if you do that, remember to take the shortcut thru the pool area to get to the valet. Much easier and more pleasant that schleping thru the casino.  Checkout was a drag, it took 1hour and 15mins from the time I called for a bellhop til the time I got my car packed up from the Valet.    If I went in winter I would probably stay at Harrahs instead because it seemed funner, the carpets were nice and clean, and the rooms had nicer trim and touches( but were a bit smaller). Also Harrahs is a tiny bit closer to the Carnaval Court, Chipotle, Panda Express, and best of all, it has the Dueling Pianos in the casino area!!!

Stayed at the Flamingo Hotel over the Memorial Day weekend, Sunday and Monday was okay.  6:30 am of Tuesday we were awaken by sound of jackhammers!!! There is a construction site next to the hotel. And the best part is at 9:00 am, no water!!! There was a water issue in most of the towers at the hotel and they are looking at it getting fixed in 3 hours. The front desk advised us to take a shower at the fitness center but there they run out of hot water. Continued on with our check out at 11 am. We will never stay at the Flamingo Hotel ever again.

Initially very excited to come to Vegas until I checked in and was told at the front desk the only room they had left was pet friendly room.  The room smelt like dogs and front desk said they could change my room the next day. They did switch my room the next day which did smell less like pet store, but as I entered the room, this is what I found!  They transferred me from pet store to insect infested room!  Gross!  Never stay here unless you're fine with cockroaches in your room.  Will never stay at this hotel again!

To compensate us for the water being off, a nice front desk clerk gave me $30 credit and reminded me that the package I bought already had $30 on it, so we had free lunch and i got souvenirs to take home; one clerk in a gift shop misunderstood what I was trying to buy and overcharged me by $41, and the refund was not in the yet when I checked out, and i was going to have to pay for it, but I got a clerk from the Gift Shop to straighten it out.  I would come back again, for sure.

Decent room for being "comped", can't complain much.  It accommodated our stay comfortably, as long as, we lose all our money to the casino lol.  Either way, we broke even & in Vegas that means winning!  Great location with various casinos nearby to hit up or watch free shows on the strip.  Front desk was somewhat rude when it was time to checkout, as they demanded I wait in the longest line ever with the check-ins.  I opted for the express check-out & drop box.  Hopefully, I will receive an electronic copy.  Bell desk was extremely friendly & efficient.
I love going here, and looking at the Flamingos!

Ok, let me reface some of this review with a little story. 

I was there for the CONEXPO, this is the convention that makes CES look small. My company organized the hotel situation. When I learned that we were at the Flamingo I confess I let out a gasp. Not my first choice. 

I arrived a bit before my clients, so I could check everybody in and set up the rooms accordingly. I was greeted by something of a concierge who ushered me around the waiting throng of people. Must have been all the logo gear I was toting around( I work for one of the largest domestic manufacturers in the world). They proceeded to spit out all the room keys and the associated materials. I went up, room by room to place all the swag I had for my clients. I got to the room they had assigned for me, oh my heck. My group was 22 rooms and then mine. I had the 2 story suite with the living area and the associated facilities. I had never expected any of this. The staff brought the rest of my stuff to me, unpacked all of my things and never said boo about something for the effort, dropped the lead bellman a c-note for his time and effort. The whole thing reminded me of old Vegas, back when I would stay at the DI, sit at the Black Jack table for a few hours and get a free room. The room was so well set up we ended up using it as a hospitality suite. 

I could not have been happier nor could my clients have been.

Man this place sucked. We stayed here because we read the Flamingo has one of the top 10 pools and it was my birthday "girls" trip. We arrived at 3pm and check in wasn't until 4pm. Can we check in early? If we want to pay a $15 fee or buy a room upgrade to check in early. The cashier was a real snoot about it too. I said we were excited to get to the pool and wasn't there a vacant room only one hour early? Nope (BS). So we wandered around on principal alone and checked out the scene. The pool was crazy busy and we saw a sign saying the pool was open 10am-6pm. 6pm?? I stopped and asked the security guard who said that when its "in season" they'll close at 7pm but for now its 6pm. In season??? Its June! Its 105 friggin degrees! 7?? Thats still too early!! We could have stayed at the Gold Nugget and swam next to sharks till 11pm every night! So then we wait till 4 to check in, and the bell guy of course can't get the dang luggage to the room (probably due to the huge amount of luggage dispersed at 4:01pm) until about 445 pm. Needless to say, day 1 - no pool. 
NEXT. the toilet spun\/flushed itself every 11-14 minutes (we timed it while we waited for the Bell boy) and the pipes groaned so I called and asked hotel to come fix it. There was no way to turn the water off because the knob was gone. The man who answered was a smart ass and I thought he was blowing smoke up my..ya know... and yep he was. That night we returned from our outing with the toilet flushing and whining. Next day I called and asked if they'd checked it out. The lady who answered said there was no request for a fix. Of course. So I don't know if it got fixed. 
We went out to eat for breakfast at the cafe thinking of getting something light. The food was small and cost just as much as the buffet. At least the coffee was decent. I ended up going to Tahiti Village to stay and it was pretty nice. Had a cool lazy river, but was a bit off the strip. I have stayed at Harrahs too and that was fine, but I don't remember checking out the pool.... I don't recommend Flamingo.

A solid 2

Let me start off by saying that I only stayed here because my entire family did. I struggled with booking this hotel based on the reviews and for the cost. I booked through the hotels website, it was the same price as all of the "booking" sites. We could have stayed at a 5 star hotel for what we paid. 

We arrived before check in time (4pm) so we paid for an early check in ($20). It was worth it. The Flamingo sent me an email and I did it that way. I also got a pre-check in email that allowed me to skip the long check in line when I got there so that was a total win! 

The hotel is pretty run down. The elevators are wonky, you may be trapped in one. Our room wasn't bad at all. It had been renovated but the bathroom had not. We don't spend much time in the bathroom so it wasn't too awful but at the price you pay to stay at this hotel you expect certain standards. Our maid was great. 

*It smelled like cigarette smoke in our non smoking room. It was seeping in from the vent in the bathroom. It was awful.

The pool was a lot of fun! Great music, clean, and there was active security. Only downfall- not enough seating. We just put our towels at the edge of the pool and hung out there. It was what everyone was doing. I didn't mind it. You aren't allowed to bring any food\/drink in but it's like that everywhere. 

We really liked that it was located by the Linq and its new "strip" it was great. Clean and lots of shops, restaurants, etc.

Unfortunate events that occurred while staying:

1. On our second day the hotel alarm went off probably 4 times. They came over the speaker and said they were researching what was happening and it came back as all clear. All 4 times. It was really loud but whatever. 

2. My uncle got trapped yes TRAPPED in an elevator for over an hour with 15 people in it! They were stuck between floors and the fire department had to come and get them out. They had to be rescued lol just like in the movies. He wasn't given any comps or anything like that. 

3. The  water softener went out in the entire hotel. So if you were taking a shower anytime in the morning you wouldn't be clean. Shampoo wouldnt rinse out soap would stay on your body.  

Stay somewhere else if you could. Like I said, we only stayed here because our whole family did.

The buffet here is absolutely disgusting. I came here with my girlfriend because we had a $10 off coupon. Big mistake. As soon as I started eating I wanted to puke and felt like I had diarrhea. In addition to making me feel sick, the food made me want to cry - this is the closest you can come to eating shattered dreams. The interior decor is a throwback to an era that would have been better off without furniture. I wouldn't recommend it to Tiger Woods if they had a mistresses station.

Why I wound up staying here aside (valet lost our car keys!), I suppose I do have to admit that the rooms are 3 stars (er, the new ones at least). We had a nice view of the Strip (including the Bellagio fountains). Good comfy beds. Decent bathroom (though, no tub, just a shower). The decor was decent too. No robes, no minibar. But for a place to rest your head at night in Sin City, you could do way worse. And it's a pretty good central location too.

However, there isn't much else to do at the Flamingo. There's a couple of ok shows, but it ends there. The restaurant options are sucky. Room service is no more than 2 stars. The stores are sucky. Etc.

So for the right price, it's a good room, but not much else.

And then, of course, there's the issue that the valet lost our car keys. Yep, lost our car keys. What are the friggin' odds of that happening? Either way, can't say I would recommend valeting your car here. Why take that gamble?

I do have to admit, though, that I like their pool. Somewhere between 3 and 4 stars. It's free for locals (after a certain time). And the adult only pool is pretty good too.

FAQ

Q: Ew. What's wrong with the Flamingo?
A: I'm pretty sure they get their distinct color from the shrimp that they eat. If they're not eating fresh shrimp, they're not pink. If you're asking about the Hotel\/Casino, then there's nothing wrong with it. Great location, awesome history (Bugsy!), great prices, solid pool, clean, comfortable, vegas, baby, vegas.

Q: Remember that time when everything shocked you? Literally?
A: Yah! It gets really dry (it's a dry heat) and I would shock myself on every metal object.

Q: A new coat of paint could help this place, no?
A: I mean, sure, your face could use a new coat of paint too. Simply put, the Flamingo is in a great location, a good place to stay, clean, comfortable, home. Okay, not quite home. But, say, a home away from home!

FYI ... Don't come back from a night of drinking, start playing Caribbean Stud while the sun starts to come up, standing and leaning slightly against the table so you won't tip over, tell the dealer that you'll play her game "you rogue" and throw cards towards her (not AT her, mind you), Flamingo security doesn't take kindly to that sort of behavior.

Listen, everyone is grouchy at 6.30am.

The remodel looks nice, however eventhough it was 80 degrees out they still shut down the other pools and when my mom put her feet in the one functioning pool the life guard came up to her and said "I don't think you want to do that...someone just threw up in the same area"  After that we just decided to go back to the room...so gross! and the fact that they didn't try to clean up the pieces of throw up floating in the pool is even nastier...

Their customer service is like that movie Brazil where the guy is driven to psychosis by all the meaninglessness and futility of a massive impersonal bureaucracy.

I've developed a tick after several stressful months of trying to book a family reunion.  As a result people think I'm winking at them, but in reality it's just a symptom of my neurons committing suicide each time I get the runaround from these incompetent boobs.

Second stay at the Flamingo was similar to the first.  I had a "GO" room with Strip view and that was nice as you can see the Bellagio Fountains do their dance from the comfort of your room. ...Room has a shower but no tub. ...Loved the i-pod dock and real stereo complete with a subwoofer. ...Comfy bed. ...24 hour room service but one night the wait was two hours for a simple breakfast for one. ...Internet access is $14 per night. ...Good and fast Valet service. ...Lines to check -in can be very long around noon to 2 PM (unless you have status at Harrahs Casino's). ...Good value relative to other Strip hotels.

This review is from the point of view of a Vegas local that has never stayed in the hotel but has gambled and dined at Flamingo several times over the years. Also, I am a poker player, so I will also review the poker room as well. 

The Flamingo has a long history in Las Vegas. Originally opening in 1946 then closing and reopening in 1947, it was the 3rd resort on the Strip and is one of the very few remaining original old school properties. The original buildings have all been torn down and what remains has been remodeled several times. The current casino and hotel rooms are pretty modern, though there is definitely an aura of "Vintage Las Vegas" throughout. 

The poker room is comfortable and nicely situated for walk-by traffic and is located near a Strip entrance. Though it is quite far from self parking, it still is one of the only rooms that offers consistent 2\/4 LHE on the Strip. It also offers the standard 1\/2NL. The comp rate is $1\/hour and the rake is the Caesars Entertainment standard of 10%\/$5 max plus $1 jackpot. 

The front desk always seems to have a gargantuan line at night, with several guests just sitting on the floor in the lobby waiting for their group to check in. This creates a lot of crowds in the front desk area. 

The casino has a fairly low ceiling but offers a variety of the standard carnival games, 21, and dice. Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville is a popular bar hangout with a balcony that overlooks the strip. 

As far as dining, we liked the Steakhouse but the Mexican restaurant is horrible. The café is pretty standard though a bit overpriced. There is a beautiful outdoor courtyard with a view of live Flamingos, which is a nice feature. Self parking is pretty inconvenient as it requires a pretty long walk but is sufficient. 

All in all, I do recommend Flamingo for a nice center-strip middle market property. Plus, they are part of the Caesars Entertainment Total Rewards program which is easily the best loyalty program in the industry.

Aside from the place being old and dirty their customer service is severely lacking.  Would never stay here again.  

There was nasty stuff all over the ceiling like someone sprayed ketchup or murdered someone.  

I would stay off the strip before I stayed here again.

My husband and I stayed at Flamingo Casino on a comp.In Feb.2015  I am very disappointed with the service since Caesars entertainment filed bankruptcy. now they charge resort fees I have been a Platinum card holder, but that isn't good enough.... My loses last year nearly $4000.00 they want more money. We were put in a handicap room I surely didn't request, but was told I did when reserving. We did receive Rod Stewart tickets very good show, but would have been better off just purchasing the tickets. I don't enjoy this resort anymore, but I did win and walked out with $400 of slots winnings only 1% of my loses.

Money hungry company We will be taking our business elsewhere

Welp. I don't know where to start, but if you were considering staying at the Flamingo...DON'T. (Bryson Tiller voice.)

When we arrived, there were people sitting in the lobby and the self check in was down. We were notified by a hotel employee that the entire system was down and there was no way to know when the system would come back up.


After about 30 mins, we were given the option to drag out luggage down to be locked up until our room was ready. Now...we flew from Ohio and had a layover at ATL..so needless to say, the last thing we wanted to do was sit in the lobby. But now we have the option to take our own luggage downstairs.

...okay...

Some more time goes by and we are offered room temperature bottled water. Still sitting on the floor in the lobby..

Around that time, we were given the option to leave a phone number and receive a call when the system comes back up. We opt for that, but still stay in the lobby.

After 2 hours, and no phone call, we see people using the self check in and people flooding to the check in line. So we get in line and wait..and wait..and finally go to check in. 

We are not offered any compensation, so we ask. 

We are offered a $50 food and beverage credit. For 3 people to use. We ask for additional compensation towards our room, but we are told no. After 2 "managers" and my friend insisting that we receive an apology\/compensation, we are finally offered a $75 food and beverage credit, and a $75 credit applied to our stay. We made it into our room by midnight. 

One of the issues I have is the lack of apology and the use of statements like "I see you're upset" "I know you're upset" etc. those are isolating statements-like I know that YOU'RE upset, but I don't accept any part in this, and I think you're overreacting. It was almost like we were shamed for asking to be compensated. 

Our room was a smoking room. Which wasn't that bad. But there were missing room signs all over the hallways and the numbers were written in sharpie. The hallways were trashy. There was a fruit bowl sitting outside of a room for 2 days and every time I walked past it, there was more fruit missing. I still don't understand that. 

Our room also wasn't cleaned for 2 days. Had to ask for towels and for our room to be cleaned. 


Overall, I wouldn't stay again. The location wasn't bad, but I would have rather saved my time and money and stayed somewhere else.

Great location on the strip, reservation was easy to book and they processed me during check in and check out pretty quickly. If you're looking for a place to just keep your stuff while you're out and about, and to crash at night then Flamingo is a great option. You're not going to find some of the amenities that you'll find in some of the more modern hotels but that's okay for the price you're paying. Remember this is one of the oldest hotels on the strip so make sure your expectations are in line with that. I'm the type that wants to spend as little as possible on a hotel so I can spend the rest of my vacation dollars on food\/drink, shows, and gambling. If you're like me then check out the Flamingo. I'd definitely come back here.

We stayed at the Flamingo for my birthday last month. We received a free room through Total Rewards and when we arrived Damon helped us and he even gave us a free upgrade to a bigger and better room just because it was my birthday! He was incredibly helpful and sweet! Our Go room with a view was awesome, we had a dead center view of the Bellagio fountain and the room was cute and remodeled. The TV in the bathroom was handy and the tub was pretty huge. 

They have some pretty cool slot machines too, try the Aladdin game, it actually moves while you play like a ride! 

The staff was crazy friendly and came within minutes of being called for whatever you need. 

I stayed here before the remodel, and the lower floors ahve yet to be remodeled so be sure to ask for a higher floor and ask for DAMON he is the best!

Pros - 
Room was fine.  Bed comfortable.  Uncarpeted but quite clean as was the bathroom.  Great location on the strip.  Grounds have nice gardens with several animals living in the habitat including Flamingos. Great historic pool area.  Elevators are pretty quick.

Cons-
Most upsetting were all the hidden fees after you arrive, if you are the regular folk without special gambling status.  Whatever you pay for the room, you can add another $42+ for each day you stay if you drive to Las Vegas.  Internet hookup is bad.  Yes they even charge full price $8 for self-parking if you are staying in the hotel.  

I doubt I'll be back.  There are too many other places to stay that are not dipping into your wallet the whole time during your visit.

Checking in, oh boy. Be prepared for a wait! Everyone waits until they arrive at the desk to begin room negotiations. Everyone who visits Vegas thinks they have an inside track that will give them free whatever just by dropping their name or flashing the free card that everyone receives just by asking. Maybe it works, maybe it doesn't but be prepared to wait!

The location is great! Perfect for strip-goers. 

The food court in Flamingo is lacking. Not bad for a quick bite but nothing special, either. 

No coffee makers in the non-suite rooms. Be prepared to pay $3 for bad coffee downstairs.

HORRIBLE! I feel like I got ripped off. They advertise that their rooms have been upgraded, and it's not true. The furniture is outdated and the bathrooms are VERY small and from the 70's. The light fixtures were old and rusty and the bathroom floors were filthy. There was still hair from the other guest who stayed in that room before us. The toilet was running and running, and my husband had to fix it. When I arrived to the hotel and checked in at the kiosk, I was asked if I wanted to upgrade my room for $19.04 a night. I chose yes, thinking I was going to get a better room and it was disgusting. I could only imagine if I didn't upgrade, what I was going to get. I immediately called the front desk to complain and the girl who answered had the nerve to ask me if I wanted to upgrade again. REALLY? I already paid $700.00 for two nights. She did absolutely nothing to compensate for the horrible room I was given. I will NEVER stay at the Flamingo again and DO NOT recommend it to anyone.
Everything was great until we got to our floor. Entire floor including our room reeked of marijuana. Guess non smoking didn't include pot.

I shouldn't give this hotel a full star!  Rude staff, when I complained to a manager, I received no apology and I felt belittled!  I filled out a complaint form and sent an email with my phone number, email address and rewards number and never heard back from anyone!  I don't want a free room or any comps because I would NEVER stay here again...free or not!  My rewards card is now cut up in a trash can, there are too many GREAT places that are new and treat you well to put up with their monatany!

Pleasantly surprised that our room was nicely renovated. Great rates for location. 

Biggest CON: the lack of efficient operating elevators made in and out access very frustrating. The floor buttons are very faulty. You have to push them more than once or it'll skip your floor. If you're checking out and walking over to the garage, you have to manually open the doors to get through with all your luggage. People forget, valet is free - just tip! Take advantage

Even "online express check in" was done in the morning, it made no difference in getting a reasonable room checked in at night.  The so-called "express" check-in required you to wait at least 25 minutes with only a few people working at snail pace over the counters.  The room was sizable but has a few old and small furnitures.  It was like a warehouse dressed up at the night of Halloween. Then it got better with blinking desk light making zzzz..noise, coupled with running toilet as soon as one flushed the toilet.  Numerous phone calls for help were made, but no help ever arrived at the time near 11pm.  Stripe hotels at this price level during the week offer lots more.  Don't think this is a "value" hotel.  It's below motel 6 level, and do watch out for bed bugs.
My co-worker would always brag about the Flamingo and I decided to check it out...boy was that a mistake. The room I booked was "renovated" except for the bathroom that seemed to be from the 70's.

I asked for a smoking room when I booked my reservation. Yet, a smoking room was not available when I checked in, which is weird because I thought the whole point of making reservations for a particular room was so it would be RESERVED particularly for me! Luckily I didn't go all Seinfeld on her and just took my non-smoking room with an artificial smile that wasn't fooling anyone.

Aside from that little mishap:
+Super cute Go Rooms :) 
+Express Check-out by phone is convenient 
-Bathtub in Go Rooms too small
-Check-in lines are ridiculous
-No "Do Not Disturb" placards for the door, thus, in the morning, I was disturbed. grrrr

I always enjoy staying here. It only took us 15 minutes to check in, even with a long line. We checked in and were informed that we couldn't get a room until 10am. No big deal, we left our bags with the bell hop, went to the store, wandered around for a couple hours and even though it was a slightly longer wait, we were still moved to the front fairly quickly. We decided to take the option for early check in because we had a lot of bags and didn't want them to sit at the bell hop all day. We went up to our room, which was in immaculate condition and relaxed while we called the bell hop to bring our bags up to our room. It only took about 5 minutes before they arrived. We were greeted by an extremely knowledgable employee named Dante. He gave us useful information about the hotel and asked if there was anything more he could do to make our stay more comfortable. Needless to say, he got a very good tip. During our stay we spilled a drink on one of our beds. We called down to the front desk and informed them we needed new sheets. Within 10 minutes 2 maids arrived at our door, were as polite as can be, and had the sheets changed in no time. The rest of the stay was very comfortable, and checkout was a breeze, just leave your keys in the room. All in all the hospitality this hotel showed us was over the top. We will definitely be staying there in the future!!!

We just got back from staying 4 nights at The Flamingo and we were very disappointed!  There were 6 people and all of us have stayed at better hotels in Vegas!  The only good thing about it was the location, being in the middle of the strip was ideal so was having the monorail nearby and also the Fashion Show Mall was in walking distance.  The rooms and bathrooms were ugly, I would never take a bath in the bathtub we got.  The hallways were ugly, may have been just the area we saw but still not impressed.  Our taps both leaked all the time we had to wrap towels around everything!  It was bad.  I will never stay there again and would not recommend it to anyone.  The pool opens to the public so it gets super busy and so I didn't even bother to go.  Next time I may try the Linq which is right beside it.

Check In\/Check Out
We used the kiosks and avoided the long 30+ min wait time, make sure you have the confirmation number or you won't be able to get a room.  We did get a random $100 dollar charge prior to check out but it all ended up okay.
Room
We got the fab deluxe room which is their standard room.  There is definitely a very long walk from the elevator to our room, which could be due to the kiosks.  So if you decide to wait in the lines,  I would request a room closer to the elevators.  We got lucky and got the rooms for $35-$40 a night.  The rooms were clean, to an extent.  But I did later notice that the sheets had some dirt marks on them. The beds were both sunk in and also very squeaky.  Also in the shower, there was a random hole in the top corner of the bathtub which was weird.  At the price we got the rooms for, this hotel is definitely worth it if you don't mind roughing it out a bit.  Other than the above mentioned, the room was nice with the new "renovations". 
Pool\/Casino\/Exhibit
I wasn't able to visit the 21+ pool, but the family pool is nice but fairly small.  Chairs are pretty limited but there were plenty of towels to use.  The casino is definitely smokey, and I typically wouldn't walk around in them by myself.  They also have some birds near the pools that smell really bad, it was cool but nothing that you absolutely must do.
Overall, the hotel was worth the price we got it for but I wouldn't want to pay more $70+ for the room.  Also the hotel charges an $18 resort fee which doesn't include WiFi.  We had to purchase that separately for around 15 dollars a day.

I checked into my room at the Flamingo and something seemed funny... just not right. The room smelled like it had OD'd on Calvin Klein CK One, and a chair was turned over in a sinister, random fashion. I advanced cautiously through the room by the variable light from the giant pink neon Flamingo sign on the wall just outside... not wanting to turn on the lights. There seemed to be someone in the bed! "Hey, wake up." I shook the unmoving form cautiously, but there was something wrong. I pulled back the covers. It was a dead guy. 

Okay, I made that up. There wasn't a dead guy in the bed... not even a mint (unless I didn't notice it), but everyone needs an exciting Las Vegas story. My entire stay was rather drab and uneventful, so I thought I'd better make something up for the benefit of the people I had to borrow money from to get back to New York. Some nagging journalistic code, however, prevents me from not coming clean... I know I should just get over it. 

The room at the Flamingo could have been a Holiday Inn just outside of Kansas City except for the view... the view, to the west, Caesar's Palace, The Palms, then mountains, was what I was paying for. They may as well not have bothered with curtains, as far as I was concerned, or a TV. The window took up the whole wall, and it was worth the price of admission, 24 hours a day. 

The rest of the hotel I could do without. Every time I walked into the lobby, whether it was midnight, daytime, or breakfast-time, Eighties rock was blasting from the sound system. I guess they know their audience, but come on, what happened to Sinatra? If I want to be constantly serenaded by the crooning of STING, I'll check into a room in HELL. 

Of course, there is also the endless drone of electronic slot machines, whether real or manufactured... and I guess nothing here is real... but anyway, that sound is ever-present everywhere in Las Vegas, and if you can't stand that sound you'll probably end up doing something inappropriate. I sort of like it, at least it occasionally distracted me from the Eighties rock. 

Anyway, I spent most of my time in Bill's Olde Time Rootin' Tootin' Gambin' Hall next door, which is a much more human scale kind of place.

The experience at Flamingo was a good one. Everything went very well. The room was nice and clean with the view at Cezar Palace . The lady at check in was very nice and helpful. The hotel is clean and very well organized . Also it is set up right in the middle of the strip. We ate most of the time at buffet , food was delicious and good. The only thing is you have to stay in line for crapes. It is only one person who is making them and I think she doesn't have enough experience to move fast. Everything else was a good adventure.

Ok So i am a review hog! i will read reviews on an establisment months in advance of staying somewhere. I went for a three day weekend for my birthday a trip to LV from NY and i knew this time around i had to be in the middle of the strip. last time i was here i stayed at excalibur also not  a bad place but defianatly to far down the strip for my taste.

FLAMINGO FAB LUXURY ROOM: NOT bad at all this is why;
1. My room was cleaned everyday i was there and i had fresh towels
2.i stayed in the habitat tower not sure if there are any other towers but this tower was close to all exits to move around easily.
3. the decor is what it is updated to an extent but really lets be serious how much TIME do you really spend in your room in vegas?
4. i did understand the old bathroom reviews for this room and i did see the chiped paint and wished there was a fan in the bathroon (i hate a foggy mirror) but again for a short fun weekend jumping in and out a shower before hitting the strip takes under an hour right? i loved the full leghth mirror in the bathroom while getting ready great feature for anyone.
5. ok so my view of the strip from my FAB Luxury room was not the most fab i was able to see ceasars across the street a bit of the mirage and a bit or the street again i was not wasting my fun time in a room glaring out a window instead of being outside. i did liked the fact that i can see club PURE which i hit up from my room window before going :).

So the food court not bad there are a ton of places to eat in vegas but when you just want to have some wings or a good burger Johny Rocket was ther to save the day for me. i tried the BUFFET at the FLAMINGO for BREAKFAST and let me just say IDK what is wrong with people and there reviews but its really hard to mess up breakfast. The buffet was not bad it was not fabulous but it was ok be prepared to wait on a line for that as well, as everyone has stated the best part is grabing a seat by the windows to enjoy the early sunshine and koi fish swinmming around great view to start the day.

THE FLAMINGo GO POOL:

1. i read the reviews to go early i did and grabed 2 seats left something on them and when i came back my stuff was gone and someone took our seats than argued with us smh if you know me security had to be called :\/ but offered me any 2 seats for the next morning and i could come down after the early morning rush and have the seats i want thanks Mr. Security guard( i didt make it down the next day but thanks).

2. the water was a bit colder than i expected.
3. i did not see any beer bottle are cups floating around the pool.
4. Music was  not bad not great but not the worst.
5. Didt stay for the booty shaking contest and the party crowd i was expecting was not as live as i was anticipating.

Overall not a bad place to stay in the middle ofthe strip the staff was friendly and i had easy checkout with a guy with an ipad it took less than a minute to check out and drop my cards in a little box, i was also givin a free hour longer for check out which worked out great :)

Nice downstairs....

Room was pretty beat-down, and I thought they re-did them not too long ago.  Carpet was bumpy all over the floor to our room, and bathroom... well, it needed a LOT of work.  Peeling paint, rust, nicks, etc....

Thanks for the cheap room and great location, but damn, there's nicer Motel 6's.

For an iconic property, it sad to see and now say the Flamingo is not capitalizing on its storied history. The property is in desperate need of a bath, and overhaul. It should be restored to its heyday.- the golden days of Vegas. Would love to see a Teri vibe and supper club. Would love to walk down the hallway and wonder if "if these walls could talk" but instead...The hotel is dark, dingy and dirty. Service is still with a smile but not stellar. Our pillows were rock hard and flat, and the bathroom wallpaper was literally peeling. The pool area used to be a hit but the water slide (one of the main reasons we selected this property for our girls) didn't work the entire time we were there (Tuesday-Thursday). The buffet was closed for dinner one night (no reason given). Great location, great potential but until it's rehabbed the smell, standard of service and lack of amenities will keep this local from returning.

Not happy at all. Booked my room a couple weeks ago, Fab King non smoking, pet stay. What do I get? A non fab double queens with a leaking faucet in the shower and a non draining sink. The description and pictures were not anywhere close to what you actually get. 

The doors are either chipped on the bottom or dogs have chewed on the doors. Smudges on the headboards, that could be anything. Damage to the shades on the lamps. Bathroom towels were thin and had holes. 

The comforter could be anything but.  Both beds had dog hair and human hair between the layers.  Super itchy as well. I guess what can you expect from low rates.  

Layer of dust on the night stand lamp. Cracks in the ceiling and in the hallway leading to our room from the elevator there was water damage starting from the ceiling and going down to the baseboards. The curtains have stains. The shower curtain had DRIED BOOGERS!! So disgusting...

No you do not get a welcome treat or food\/ water bowls. Thank goodness I brought my own. I have pretty well behaved dogs, but I wonder about some pet owners who let their dogs do whatever they want. The front desk guy was surprised that I brought my own crates. 

No handy hotel information binder like most hotels offer.  I couldn't find anywhere to issue complaints. The Guest Services gal was not helpful and she didn't care that there were issues with the room. Right now it sounds like it is pouring inside the bathroom. What a waste!!

For me to pay $125 for one night, it better be good and it wasn't. Back up at valet and registration. So then cars were getting unloaded in the middle of the thru way. People pulling illegal u-turns. Parking garage being mainly made up of valet spaces.  Check in took over 30 minutes, couldn't use the kiosk self check in. 

These rooms are in serious need of a remodel and repairs. This is unacceptable.

What a dump!  Paint from ceilings peeling in the hallways.  Trip on the carpet in the hallway from where it needs restretched or replaced!  Truck stop quality bathroom.  Very dirty and just nasty place, even by cheap vegas standards.  Parking garage can't be safe.  There are much better places nearby for similar price.  This hotel is not very nice and the check-in line took 40 minutes!   Nope, this place sucks. Never again.

Shame on you, Flamingo for honoring the great Bill Cosby. Really?  There weren't any OTHER performers who have graced your stage who should be prominently displayed and celebrated?!?!  This is simply bad taste.  And for the people who are reading this - please note I did not stay here, I am ONLY writing this review for this particular thing I observed in their Valet hall. Really interesting facts and pictures of the history of this hotel, but I could have done without seeing Bill Cosby up there.  Seriously, Flamingo...what were you thinking?!?!  Do you not have an Executive team with the sense to take this down?  Clearly not!

I have stayed in several Las Vegas hotels and this was surprisingly the worst. I brought my little sister here for her 21st birthday and thought the Flamingo Hotel would be a nice and luxurious stay for us. They put us in room 8023 which is right outside the elevators. We had people screaming all night and the couple in the room next to us had the loudest sex I have ever heard. I called security AND the front desk...NOTHING! The noise continued. I went down to the front desk and the manager could do nothing to help us She said Every room was booked and they could not move us, I find that very hard to believe! 
They were not accommodating at all. I will never stay here again. We stayed here 4 nights and not one room was available? That is insane! The rooms were clean but I am still very disappointed in the treatment we received while staying here. Also when we arrived they charged us an additional $150 and a $28 a night room fee? That is very ridiculous! NEVER AGAIN!

This is one of my favorite casinos to play poker. Although the casino could do with some work the poker dealers are awesome!!

My husband and I have stayed here many times and we love the poker dealers.

The only bad thing about the Flamingo in my opinion is the buffet, it is overpriced and needs a revamp.

A solid 3 in my opinion
Room was hot as hell, the ac man couldn't seemt to fix the problem. .

I didn't stay here, but hung out in a friend's suite, which was pretty nice.  Another friend won big at the slots, so that was good too.  The pool is super neato, and the location can't be beat.  We went to the house burlesque show and found it to be ridiculous and highly entertaining.

http:\/\/www.hilton.com\/en\/hi\/hotels\/index.jhtml?ctyhocn=LASFLGV

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in April 2013 and it was reasonably priced and in a great location on the strip. We booked online and then were able to upgrade to a GO room for $20 extra per night so thats what we did. There was a very long line at check in but I noticed the kiosks available for us to do check in. That worked great and Greg ( awesome employee at Flamingo) assisted us and we got our room in 5 minutes! Greg was a great help and very personable! We got strip view however we coule hear music till 4 am on Fri and Sat night. The music is from Harrahs Carnival Court and very loud even on the 21st floor. The rooms were somewhat updated. There was even a tv in the bathroom mirror. Overall a good experience. 

Negatives-
elevators take forever and the doors close quickly
time share people are very annoying and bother you when you get on\/ off the elevators
strip view rooms are super loud till 4 am on weekends


Positives-
location is great
buffet is good and you can watch the flamingoes while you eat
nice pool- gets crowded- chairs fill up fast
affordable
maids let you sleep in
Greeg- he is in the lobby and very helpful

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Flamingo this past weekend and we loved it! I had stayed there in the past in the standard room and it was okay. I did not like how thin the walls were and could hear EVERYTHING happening next door. This time I booked the Go room and it was well worth it. Agoda had a deal for only 30 bucks more and I thought why not? The room was super clean and modern. Everything was brand new. There was a shower with side jets and a separate bath tub. The walls were pink\/white and the ceiling had a fun pink lighting with a mirror. The mirror in the bathroom had a tv in it. This went along with the flat screen in the bedroom. So in other words, hearing the lebron NBA news was not an issue! Our friends stayed a few floors down in the regular room and it's nice, just not as new. The bathroom is half the size. The view was just as great though. The entire hallway smelled like pee unfortunately on their floor. It was gross when you got off the elevator. The hallways on their floor were crap and did not match what the room entailed. (Which was way better). Overall having the upgrade was fun and you got a daily 20$ food & beverage credit. The pool at the flamingo is so much fun too!! It's free for guests and great since it's so hot and had an awesome Dj. Definitely recommend booking!

Get a GO room or don't stay here!! 
The Fab rooms are anything but Fab. 
Furniture is old and dinged. The bathroom is horrible. The shower leaked all night, so much so that I had to keep the door closed to sleep.
The hotel itself was great, the pool fantastic, staff was okay...

I'm not sure what all the complaints are about... If you want Luxury, go across the road, pay double and stay at Caesars! If you want a good room at a decent room price, in a clean casino, with an awesome location, stay here. Yes, the hallway carpets and elevators could use an update (hence the 4 stars). Yes, the bathrooms weren't renovated when the rooms were, but it's not the end of the world! We stayed in a Fab Deluxe room with a Strip View. The room was clean, the bathroom was clean. We didn't spend a lot if time in there.... It's Vegas. The location is here is key! You are in walking distance to great shopping, dining and nightlife. There's a monorail station at the hotel. Was this casino as fancy or impressive as Planet Hollywood or Paris? No!!!! But, it didn't really matter to us since we could just walk to them....

I was hesitant to stay here since I read reviews and some were saying the place is dirty and cheap but I was really pleased with our rooms and our prices! We reserved the Deluxe rooms which included 2 queen size beds with super cute girly decor. Everything was very clean and the room looked recently updated\/renovated\/modeled. The floors were a nice dark wood. The bathroom was nice and clean and simple. 

We came out here for a friend's birthday and it was great because we were pretty much in the middle of all the clubs we wanted to go to!

One bad thing I have to say is definitely the service and this is based on one lady at the front desk when we first checked in. She wasn't very pleasant and treated us like we didn't know anything. We initially reserved two rooms under one name but the website asked for another name (which we thought was for emergency purposes) but it actually reserved a room under each name which didn't make sense. She then found out we had another room but after we had to tell her and our rooms were down the hall and around the corner from each other. It wasn't a big deal, but she could have cancelled the transaction and put us next to each other..but she didn't.

Besides that little thing, I love the Flamingo and will definitely stay here again.

Worst experience my boyfriend and I have ever had at a hotel. Our room got flooded because of a broken pipe next door and everything that was on the floor got destroyed and the hotel manager didn't want to do anything about it. He was basically saying there needs to be an investigation as to how it happened before any further steps. This is not what we came to Vegas for. Our day was set back 4 hours trying to take care of this situation. From moving rooms to complaining to the manager to having to shop for new clothes really put a damper on our weekend and we will never stay here again. Worst guest service ever.

CONS:
Parking situation sucked.  VALET WAS FULL but when we self-parked there were tons of spaces at 2:00am.
They layout is odd, so there's one bank of elevators and they are small elevators.
$6 for a draft beer? 

PROS:
Laminate flooring in renovated rooms.
Very clean.
Good price ($99).
No resort fees.
In the heart of the strip.
Desk staff was nice.

I would definitely stay here again because the location and the price appeals to the gamblers and non-gamblers in our group.

I came here because it was cheap. Very cheap. And it was dead center on the strip. The bed was a slab of granite. The air kept cycling on and off and never cooled the room. Even though we kept it at it's highest setting. The ants in the tub were quite amusing. Although they got annoying when they moved to the desk. Dinosour decor. I would not stay here again.

I was using the bathroom here and when I was washing my hands a lady washing her hands beside me noticed a lady in the first stalls iPhone was laying on the floor near the edge of the stall, we tried to tell her she dropped her iPhone and she didn't respond, we tried to tell the bathroom attendant and she said, "she's been like that for an hour" we peeked over the stall and she was passed out, we asked the attendant to call someone and she said, " who do you expect me to call?!?" So I went to the closest bar and asked them to call security. About half an hour later security showed up, I asked if the lady was okay and they said , "you never even knew a lady was in trouble." I told them I did cause I jumped the stall and unlocked the door so someone could get her out and they said nothing. Pretty damn sketchy if you ask me...asked to talk to a supervisor was told to the casino supervisor, she didn't seem to grasp what I was saying but hopefully they will train there employees to recognize someone in distress...

The pros on this hotel are the location and the rates.  The rooms are decent, but everything else about the property is pretty bad.

They'd have to knock down the hotel to get the smell of smoke out of the walls and hallway carpets.  If you've ever been in the home of an old relative who has chain-smoked for 50 years, you know what that baked in smell is like.  It's never coming out.

The beds were so fluffy and pillows so thin that my neck and back were sore all day after a restless sleep.

The room floors are composite tile that is made to look like hardwood.  Cheap and tacky.  The furniture was all beat up.

The water never got hot in the shower; it was just north of lukewarm.

Finally, they put some awful pink shag throw on the beds that looks like a cross between grandma's bathroom mat and Cyndi Lauper's muff.
Outdated room, dirty carpets.  Room did not get service. thin walls. Get bang on the wall from room next to us because my son was crying.
Very clean, nice rooms. The food court and buffets were nice. Different choices all in one spot. Front desk was very quick to solve our problems.

first of all.. elevators in the garage is very shaky, felt like the elevators were going to break down at any second. 2nd, my room was on the 11th floor, and literally half of the elevators didn't work. Every time I pressed the down button, and it didn't do anything, ended up waiting for 15 minutes, so I had to goto the other side to use the elevators. Very very inconvenient. I don't think I'm ever going to stay in this hotel again

Even though I don't think writing this review will do any good, I am doing so just to get it off my chest. I've been a loyal customer of Caesar's Entertainment for many years and have never had an issue until last week during our visit to the Flamingo. It was supposed to be a fun trip to celebrate my husbands birthday. When we got to our room, we found it to be extremely outdated (even though we paid for an upgrade) and the carpet was stained and dirty. We were moved to a different room which had a little cleaner carpet but soon found that the sink was clogged. Not a good start. 

We made our way down to the casino and we were playing video poker. My husband was seated two machines down from me. He asked me to sit at the machine next to him so I walked over and then quickly realized I didn't get my voucher. When I looked over, my voucher was gone -- stolen within a matter of seconds. I called security who reviewed the security footage. They said the voucher was cashed within minutes and they recognized the man who stole it. They wouldn't give me any other information but told me to call their loss department. I did that and was basically told that I was out of luck. 

I told Cesar's that I thought their security was lacking and that I didn't feel safe. I proved my point by experiencing two further incidents. I was approached by a shady looking man trying to sell me something. Then a different man sat at the machine next to me and was so angry he was losing that he started to pound the machine with his fist all while spouting obscenities.  All this with security no where in sight.

To say I am disappointed with Cesar's is an understatement and will seriously reconsider staying at any of their hotels again. I suggest that you do the same.

Go Rooms overall have deteriorated a ton in 8-9 years.  Have to stay in the higher level suites now.  They'll be renovating the FAB rooms soon so that may be an option next year for a modern room.  One of the best things about the Flamingo was the showers still had good water pressure compared to most new strip hotels but they recently replaced all the heads with 2.5 gal per minute now.

Long Lines, Bad and Rude Service. Hotel Hallways smell like sewage and carpets are dirty. TV didn't work in room took them three days to fix it. Pubic Hair in bathroom, and AC unit sounds like a drill over head.

This was my 1st time in Vegas, so we went the economical route. I realize when booking packages through travel websites, you get what you pay for. However, when going to our room (10th flr) all of the hallway carpeting was dirty and should've been replaced 10 years ago. It was also coming up in some areas, to the point where you could've tripped and fell on your a**.  With the type of money flowing into Vegas,  there's no excuse for dated and unsafe conditions.

Check in process was awful waited over a hour in line and their self check in system doesn't work. The room was disgusting; shower head broken off wall, hair everywhere, carpet was filthy, seamen stains on couch, holes and footprints on walls and doors. I'd recommend staying elsewhere. Not worth the price they charge and the fees they add on.

Stayed at the Flamingo this last weekend for a little stay-cation with my boyfriend.  Got to the hotel at about 430 and was up in our rooms within 15-20 minutes.  I was expecting a long line at check-in because it was a Friday afternoon but quick and painless.  I booked one of the upgraded rooms and we were in the Habitat Tower.  Corridors need some work but all you are doing is walking down them.  The room was really nice and I didn't book a strip view but basically from our room we could see TI, Mirage, Harrahs, etc...  So kind of a strip view so I was happy.

The room is hard wood flooring, big comfy beds and flat screen TV.  It looks like they only upgrade the room and not the bathroom.  The shower water pressure wasn't too great.  House cleaning was in and out fast and did a really good job.

I always enjoy the Flamingo when I would come to just go to pool or get some drinks.  Its right in the middle of the strip, so great access to everything.  That is one reason why I booked here because of location.  I will continue to visit when I am on the strip and will def book here again if I want a stay-cation!

I got a really good price on 2 rooms, they were the same price as Harrahs, although Ive never stayed at either one prior to this....I absolutely love Harrah's atmosphere but I figured Flamingo would have better rooms. So anyways I was told Id have to leave $100 cash deposit, when I checked in, they didn't ask for it. Awesome! but then I went to go get a players card with my girl friend, the woman behind the counter was so rude!!! there was no one in line and she was taking her time to call us, then she started talking to the other women behind her and ignoring me. She made my players card and threw it at me.!!! then my girl friend walked up  and she did the same exact thing to her!!  we told our boyfriends about it, they walked up W\/O us and her attitude changed. she was so polite and she offered them sum scratchers i guess. One of them got  $20 in slots and the other a free Tshirt! she didn't offer us anything like that. Don't remember her name but She was older and looked Filipino. Very poor customer service.!!

 I also hated the location of the rooms, we were in the way back...of the building where we literally had to walk towards a dead end of the hallway and the elevators were sooooooo far!!! I hated it!! I wont be back to stay, but I definitely will be back to gamble.

 I found a great table where the guy Don was at, he was the one spinning the wheel and he was sooo nice. My fiancé doubled up first spin...Dons attitude was amazing. He had positive vibes which gave us positive vibes, we kept winning with him and we kept tipping him everytime!! Hes the most nicest guy\/worker ive ever came across in Vegas. If it wasn't for him, I wouldn't be coming back to the flamingo.

The worst of the worst on the strip.  Roof leaks, couches and furniture in rooms are stained.....trust me I tried 3 different rooms and they were all disgusting.  I HAD to stay here for a conference.  Next time I will skip the conference if I have to stay here.  It's a shame too because it seems property has potential.

100% sucks. Crappy room, light fixtures were broken, room was 90 degrees, heater was on blast and unadjustable. Desk service was extremely rude. Nothing positive to say. Not one. Told to go down because no one would be up to check the room within any timeframe.

owe.

I recently just got back from a whirlwind 2 night stay in sin city. The flamingo is so nice!! I really would not have thought the rooms were so cute, with pink and black decor everywhere, as well as it appears the entire hotel may have been recently remodeled. The pool is the selling point. I had a couple of friends staying at the venetian and they both raved how much better our pool was (with plenty of eye candy you wont remember once your picking your self respect off the bathroom floor of an unidentified hotel room...FYI- the bathroom floors are like REALLY hard T_T) Maybe i havent been to vegas is a while but HOLY WHOLE IN MY WALLET, everything is expensive! The first night we went pretty hard and needed to grab some eats; we headed to carlos n charlies (i think because it was the first food place i saw out of the elevator...) and ordered a chicken quesadilla and a cheeseburger. That was a $42 dinner. The next day I enjoyed a $13 lunch (for panda express type stuff). Pretty redic

Oh, you cant bring outside food or drink to the pool, NO BUENO. The drinks are $17-$24. And even if you buy it in the 'souvenir' cup you cant bring that cup back in the next day, you have to get a new one. Thats pretty weak yo. 

I've also never experienced a louder hotel room. We were on the 17th floor and could hear the street traffic all night. The floors are hardwood so maybe that played a roll but it was an odd sound since most of those hotels have sound proof windows...

All in all i really enjoyed my stay (that I can remember) and will return; probably soon since someones going to need to pay that VD bill from the doctor I will undoubtable have thanks to the pool. mmmm salty.

Worst hotel I've stayed! It doesn't even deserve a 1 star, I just don't have a choice bec that's the lowest selection. It's my first time to visit Vegas and I no longer plan to come back anymore because my worst experience in this hotel...parking even in the  valet alone is a nightmare, worst the checking in, hotel service and the room itself, forget about it! One nightmare is enough!!!

I was pleasantly surprised with the Flamingo.  It is not the nicest or classiest hotel, but it is fun.  The rooms were fine.  The bed was a little firm for me and the pillows were some kind of foam--they were not down pillows and that is what I am used to, so whatever the pillows were I did not like.  The decor is nice, but a little gaudy; lots of pink! It is what you would expect from a hotel in this price range.  Flamingo's location is great!  Right in the middle of the strip.  For this hotel you really get what you pay for, nothing more and nothing less.  There are certainly nicer hotels, but for the money, the Flamingo was a nice stay.  I will go back there again if it is the best value.
We visited for my 40th and were happy with the hotel.  The standard room was clean and had a decent view. It was great for the price. Center strip location is ideal for walking around the strip.

Make sure you ask for the renovated suites. We tipped the front desk hoping they'd give us a decent room. We ended up at the worst hotel room I've ever stayed in. It's worse than Motel 6. The room was extremely outdated. No refrigerator, no tv in the bedroom, 1 small tiny bathroom. It's absolutely horrible.

I had to stay here because I needed a last minute room and I was not a fan. They charged my credit card for something I don't even know. I called to ask and it was useless. The bathroom wasn't the cleanest, so it made me feel kinda uncomfortable. We had a nice view but I definitely wouldn't stay here again. It is a cheaper option but I rather pay more if it means I'll get an elevator that works and doesn't sound like it's about to break down. ALSO, THERE'S NO FREE WIFI. And parking was a little hard to find (it's behind the hotel).

I recently celebrated my Birthday in Las Vegas at the Flamingo. Two rooms were booked back in February and we chose the Flamingo because we like to stay at a different hotel every time we go to Vegas. BIG MISTAKE!

First, We got there at about 2pm and tried to check in. After hearing that they charged $35 for an early check in fee, we decided to wait. As they collected credit card information from us, they also asked if my sister and I wanted connecting doors. We were stoked we could all be connected and they told us to come back from 4-6pm to get our room keys. We came back shortly after 4 to find my sister's room ready and ours was not. We found this strange since the rooms are right next door. We put our belongings in her room and went to walk the strip.

We came back at 7pm, only to find out that they had a problem with the locks in the room they had saved for us and they could put us in a room with one bed. I had 4 guests staying in one room with ONE BED! They offered us a cot, and told us we could move to a room with two beds the next morning. After speaking to the manager about my frustrations, he told us to come back the next afternoon to switch our rooms but everything would be taken care of. 

Saturday morning comes around, The day of my Birthday when I planned on spending the entire day poolside with drinks. At about 1pm I went to the concierge desk to get my other room and there wasn't a room available yet. They then told me to come back at 3 to check if it's ready. At this point, I was livid because it was taking time away from my birthday celebration so we said screw it and decided to stay in our room the remainder of the weekend. Luckily, I had understanding friends who didn't mind the cot, but this whole situation was a huge hassle and a complete waste of time. 

Not only was this process annoying, but the room was disgusting. Our sink was clogged the whole weekend and it smelled horrible. Also, to get towels was a huge pain in the ass because if you asked a house keeper they responded with "you need to call the front desk to put in an order" excuse me? I am vacationing at your hotel and you want ME to call the front desk. Not acceptable.

The only enjoyable memory of my stay at the Flamingo was the crowd at the pool and my bartender Rigo! He was awesome, made strong drinks and he was a great time. He made my birthday complete!

As for the rest of the hotel and casino, I will never return.

Well for starters the location is great -right in the middle of the strip no complaints there, the pool area is nice too. Now let's move along to the events that took place during our stay. 

#1 the damn keys- they never fucking worked!!!!
(And we have hotel experience -we know not to put them agasint other cards-celluar devices- etc
The first two days we walked our happy asses down to the lobby  (fyi it's a fucking hike-literally a 10 mile walk and back & with the shitty elevators oh my god u wanted to take a gun right there and blow your brains. The third night we used someone's room phone to call security to come open the door for us- no way in hell we were making that long brutal walk down there - and not to mention wait in a long fucking line - the last night we had to walk down there due to our phones being dead and no one's room door was open so we could of asked to use their phone,  we did see a staff lady and she just said "oh just go to the lobby" like it's no big deal. She could of used her walkie talkie to call security but NO her rude ass didn't )

#2 the fucking hallway carpets- duct tape all over and huge ripples in the carpet. We could of tripped and broke our necks- laughing but very fucking serious! !)

#3 trash everywhere - and a security person heard us and he mumbled to himself "That's not my job"
Fucking d- bag

#4 the elevators i kinda mentioned in # 1. 1 elevator was busted- and then it always took forever to get a elevator to open. One time we waited about 10 minutes and that elevator was going up but we still hopped in it ee couldn't bare to wait another minute- so we took the ride all the way to the 28th floor and then all the way down to floor 1

#5 most of the staff we encountered were pretty rude. Especially the folks that work at the front desk

#6 we stayed in 2 different rooms - room 2 had luke warm water... not to mention the bathtubs in this joint are a dumpster-even the Riviera we stayed at 6 months ago had nice bathroom. Nice large tub. Laminated counters -etc etc 
 
Regardless of all this- it's vegas & vegas is always a good time. Met some cool funny people in the flamingo and of course had a blast on the strip. 
But will i stay here again? No thank you. Possibly provide me a scooter to to drive back and fourth in to get new keys every fucking day.

***(They did refund our resort fee so thanks for that)**

Do some updating on the furnishings 
Make sure there is not trash all over the hallways
And fix those damn carpets! Someone will break their neck or ankle

Ohhh and the ice maker closest to our room was busted -had to walk 10 miles to the next one.
And i guess one of the floors didn't have an ice maker because the guest in the elevator said he has to go a floor down to get ice.

Casino Review:

The Flamingo has a huge casino area and it can be very confusing if you make the wrong turn. We came here to have dinner and see the George Wallace show. The casino has an overwhelming number of slot machines and not too many tables for gambling.

WHAT A JOKE. We spent the last 5 days in this crappy joint. I have been to LV 18 times now and find the Flamingo & Balley's to be the biggest dives on the strip. I will never stay here again. DON'T buy into the "upgraded" rooms (The Go rooms) as they only offer the following as an upgrade: coffee maker (that you will not drink from when you see it), mini fridge (that fits all of 4 cans of pop), and a pillowtop bed cover. All that and a little bigger bathroom that was last finished in the early 60's can be yours for $20+ per night (on top of the normal room rate). 
 I read on the web-site that they just did a renovation to the standard rooms and when I spoke to the guy at the front desk he told me to take the upgrade as I would be much happier with that room. I checked-in and quickly called the front desk to switch back to the standard room as I wasn't about to pay for that junk I wasn't going to use. Oh, and if you want to look out the window to the strip, grab some paper and poke a lot of small holes in it. Then put it up to any window in the house, then try to look though it. That is the view you will get as the entire front of the hotel is covered in dot matrix as a advertisement. 
 If you need a low cost, budget minded, not so clean place that is very well dated. Then the Flamingo is the place to stay.....
Oh, did I mention I found ants in my room.....20th floor room 20129. They live in the doorway between the hall and the room. 
 And be aware they cleaning people do NOT care if you have the DND sign on your door...

And from what I heard from everyone standing in line, if you buy from ANYONE other than Harrah's group online for reservations you must stand in long lines to check in and out! I booked on the Flamingo website and left my key in the room rather than standing in a 30+min. line just to sign my credit card bill. (That was the only plus of the trip)
Visited the Wildlife Habitat at the Flamingo Hotel. Guess what............NO FLAMINGOS. Only approx 15 different avian species and fish. Great place to bring your lunch here or to relax.

Upon first glance, I was impressed. For a supposedly "old" hotel, the Flamingo was surprisingly clean and brightly lit. And to my surprise -- it was crackin! The casino was always filled, people milling about.

Unfortunately, my high hopes soon fled after realizing there was no level of customer service. When we went to check in on late Friday night, the line was long and took forever. Now, I understand being an avid Vegas goer--lines will be long on Friday. But I'm amazed at how little concierges were available to welcome a heavy traffic flow. There were about three concierges total, by far the lowest I've seen at any hotel. It took far longer than necessary to get through.
