All my friends who go to Las Vegas to have fun have never ever mentioned Flamingo, I now know why. If the rooms are comparatively more affordable, that's fine, since it was my first time I wouldn't have known the difference anyway. 

My mom booked a room with 2 queen-sized beds, I'm positive we were given full-sized beds. Is the bed-sizing system different in Nevada?

No fridge. No bathroom vent. No coffee maker. No extra blankets. One of the lamp lights burned out.

Apparently we were suppose to set the room to one temperature and keep it there even though it was hot during the day and freezing at night.

Wi-Fi is $14 a night.

On a more positive note I did win money in the slot machines in their casino and the hotel is located in the middle of all the other, better, hotter, way more popular hotels and resorts. This made it easier to adventure and explore.

Maybe I should have stayed in a suite? I have no intentions of coming back, but I can't predict the future.

Not bad.... Not bad at all! I stayed at the Flamingo in December for my birthday. First time in Vegas and I would have to say I had the best time of my life! The lines are really no different than waiting to buy movie tickets at the theater. I got there around noon time and I did not pay for early check-in. I did stand in line to try to partially check in and to let them know I was there. I was told check-in wasnt until 4:30pm. I was thinking WOW!! They told me to come back a little closer to check-in time and that I would not have to wait in tge Check-in line , I could just pick up my key. I tipped the guy for a bag check and once your room is ready they will bring it up for you. I mean thats a whole let better than walking the strip or casino with all your lugagge. The casino area is pretty nice and big. The places to eat are ok just stay clear away from Carlos and Charlies resturant , they are horrible. (You can read my review on that). The one thing that did disappoint me was the fact that when I did come back around six to check-in , my room was still not ready. So I sort of caused a small scene. They front desk staff were pretty nice and they gave me money to use for food or shopping for my inconvience. They have plenty of elevators to get to your room. Let me speak on the carpets in the hallways..... Its really not that bad like alot of folks say it is. Maybe different floors have different issues but I was on the 10th floor and the carpets were just ok. Reading other reviews before going made me nervous as heck. I thought I was going to see chalk outlining dead bodies and smell urine etc... That was not my experience at all. My room was one that was updated. I got a luxury Fab room. This room was a strip view, nice comfy bed and very spacious. The bathroom is the one thing that could have been updated but it wasnt like a motel 6 bathroom. It was still very clean and everything was working. Water pressure and water temperature was completely fine. All in all the bathroom needed some paint and newer floors. The actual room was just great. No bedbugs... I always check when I stay in hotels. (I always fold down the  fitted sheets at the corners of the mattress to check if I see any black specs). If you dont know... you should always pack dryer sheets with you to put in your actual lugagge and to put in between the sheets and mattress to keep all the bedbugs, bugs and other pest of that kind away. One big reason I landed on this hotel is because they do not charge a resort fee. I really do not understand why alot of other hotels charge these fees but hey its Vegas!!! The buffets are just ok but the best buffet is the one in Ceasars. (Sorry, I do not remember the name). House keeping does a pretty decent job but they are kind of slow and my room was cleaned kind of on the late side. Checking out was a breeze and they are very helpful with getting you back to the airport. I would stay here again.

We stayed at the Flamingo in January for a weekend get-away.  Never again.  At one end of our floor was construction and there were patrons complaining about that.  Our room was big but it was by the elevators which  sounded like a tram all night long.  The biggest surprise was the fee per night hotel tax.  $25 per night that wasn't expected. Nothing was mentioned about it when we booked.  What do you get in return?  Useless coupons.  I would, and will, never stay here again.  Too many nicer places with lots of friendlier check-in staff.
The hotel needs a big update on various aspects! Besides that its nice cause its in the middle of the strip! For a newbie in las vegas strip i found it useful!

The Flamingo is one of the oldest properties on the strip and is definitely showing its age. As one of the iconic originals it is in need of a complete renovation, but I am one of those types that it does not bother me, especially since I only need it to sleep, shower, and grab a bite to eat. I stayed here recently on a business trip and my company put us up here. As I have stayed here before I know the ins and outs of this place pretty well.

Super cheap rates
Above par gym if you are into fitness while away
Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville attached to it
Cheap gambling on table games
Located right on center strip
Monorail station makes it super easy and cheap to get around
Beautiful manicured grounds
Exotic birds and sanctuary on grounds 
Terrific pool area - huge and fun

I have stayed in both an older standard room and one of the updated "GO" rooms. The standard room recently was ok by me. Clean, neat, hot shower, comfy bed, no problems. The "GO" room is a trip - bright white and pink motif, tv screen in bathroom mirror, flat screen with dvd\/cd player and stereo, very cool decor, almost like a porn shoot set.

Check in and check out lines can be long, but I always try to get in early so lines are not too bad, and you can check out on the tv. Also, no need to really wait on lines if you are a Platinum\/Diamond Players Card member as there is a VIP check in room to use.

Restaurants and bars here are just average. Nothing great but nothing too horrible either. On weekends there is a fun bar in front with loud pumping music, gogo dancers and hottie dealers set up. Other then Donnie and Marie there is an X-Burlesque show on site. Not too much other entertainment here. Tables games are ok, and they have the standard slots, but gaming area is on the smaller side. 

Overall, the Flamingo is decent choice if on a tight budget. Good location on the strip, great pool, easy access to monorail, and never seems too crowded. Just don't expect the "wow" factor that you get at the Wynn, Bellagio, or Venetian. You get what you pay for - a cheaper hotel\/casino. If you have a larger budget to play with go with another casino as there are great room deals to be had in Vegas nowadays. Still, I have no major complaints about the Flamingo. It is what it is.

I always try to remember that everyone gets what they pay for. This hotel was clean overall. The room was a little dusty but that's to be expected in the desert. Brunch buffet was a great deal in the hotel. Location was great as well. The pool was superb!!! However, the pool had very expensive drinks and you can't bring ANYTHING in with you. All bags are searched at the entrance. Something that was a huge downfall was that housekeeping came knocking at 9:30 a.m. even though we were staying the next evening. We put our "do not disturb" sign out but it was disregarded. 
Overall, not bad, and I'll probably stay here again.

I really enjoyed this place. It was cheaper than the nearby hotels, the little food spot right outside the habitat elevators was decent for breakfast sandwiches and pizza. Not to mention their rad staff there who were always pleasant! I had a stellar view of the high roller which looked beautiful at sunrise. I will definitely stay here again. Thanks, Flamingo!

Stayed over weekend and we had a great view of the strip. But that is the only positive of this place. Elevators were horrible, half of them were not working and very old and dirty, one of them even had electrical wires sticking out. Parking lot was full, and overflow parking structure that we had to use was the employee parking lot a million miles away from hotel. One night we witnessed a bunch of gangsters beating up this guy and kicking him in the head. Not one security guard in sight for quite awhile until they took off running through casino, only then did we see a couple guys looking for them. Thankfully they didn't have guns. This will be the last time we visit this casino.

This review is not for the hotel but the casino and food court. We stay at our Hilton grand vacations club which is conveniently located right behind the casino which we love. 
We don't have to deal with parking which is located behind the casino and is always very full and we end up on the 4th floor or higher. 
The casino is on the small side but we like that because some of the big casinos can be a bit over whelming. 
There is a food court with a Bonannos pizza, Johnny Rockets, LA subs and salad, and a Pan Asian. We like the Bonanno's the best.
The casino is located in the heart of the strip so you can walk outside and get to a number of other casinos if you get bored.
Multiple customer service problems, and bad attitudes galore. With so many hotels to choose from, why go here?

So we have stayed at the Flamingo the past 3 years, the last week of July. This year will be the last. I should have listened to all the other recent reviews. We got the GO room floor 20, it stunk so bad like mold or who knows what, and a bucket sitting in front of the elevator for leaking water from ceiling. We called down to the desk and told them and they moved our room one floor up , with no smell. They charged us 80$ resort fee (they never did that in the past) for wifi etc. Had NO wifi connection the whole time I was there , and needed to check into my flight. Spent another hour at the desk complaining about this. Then the next day we had no air conditioning in our room. Yet more time at the desk trying to resolve another issue. The last thing I want to be doing on my vacation is complaining at the service desk. Oh and don't forget the food court was closed due to the plumbing issues and constructions going on in the casino stunk like sewage from an incident a few weeks ago. They did resolve our issues in a timely manner however , refunded our resort fees, free breakfast etc. Next time Ill be staying at the Hard Rock for the same price.

What I love about the Flamingo ... 

The pool is always a BLAST !!!
GO rooms are really nice for the price 
and you cant beat the Flamingos central strip location!

They just really need to work on the rest of the property.

I'm a repeat customer and have stayed at the Flamingo many times. It's not super fancy, but the rooms are comfortable, the air conditioning was kicking, and we absolutely love the pool. We spent an afternoon being taken care of by Sarah, Chris & Eddie in an amazing cabana. We enjoyed the newish Carlos & Charlie's restaurant and the old standby, Margaritaville. Neither were fancy, but the service was great and the food filling and tasty. Thank goodness for the in-room coffee makers, because the line for coffee at casino level vendors is beyond tolerable in the morning.

Our only real problems were getting up and down from our 23rd floor suite. Three of the six elevators were out of order in our tower, so the process was long and frustrating at times. Also, we had no hot water one morning, making for a VERY quick ice cold shower...but it was quickly fixed.

I'm giving the hotel's staff (particularly front desk manager Eric Z.) 5 solid stars. During a weekend trip to Vegas, I had to suddenly vacate my room due to a medical emergency and left most of my belongings behind. For obvious reasons, I was unable to notify the front desk for almost 24 hours. Long story short, I was hospitalized for 3 days and Eric at the Flamingo held my room for me the entire time at no cost. I am beyond satisfied, not to mention taken aback, with the service the Flamingo and its staff provided during my longer-than-planned stay in Vegas. Eric, you're a true gem and I'm very thankful for you!

Positive:
- great location on the strip.
-  reasonable prices for rooms.
- remodeled\/updated fo rooms were very nice.
-  wedding chappel manager was able to pull off my anniversary gift for my husband in a very short span of time.
- wildlife habitat was pretty interesting.
- margaritaville was pretty happening. 
- no resort fees.

Negative:
-  casino is smaller, even when the margaritaville casino is included.
- very pushy timeshare people located throughout the casino, at every elevator, etc. hard sell and pressure to buy was way too much.
- the rooms lacked sound insulation. the few times we wanted to take a nap at 2am, the room next door had a huge party that sounded like it was right in our room and this carried on for hours for several nights.
- never had a warm shower while there. No matter what time of day or night, the water pressure was low and water never got better than luke warm. 
- they could use a better selection of restaurants. We ate at hamada of japan and margaritaville. Nothing special. went to planet hollywood for better restaurants.
- wi fi is $15 a day for in your room. if you want to use wi fi on their extended property, it is $25 per day. 

It is a decent value for the money if you can overlook the negatives.

Elevators were slow. I loved my view 32 floor in front of ceasers palace clean quiet
My tv didnt work
Casino was good went to the bar charles and something downstairs it was fun. Animals were cool to look at also.

Stayed at the Flamingo for my bachelorette. Prime location, decent rooms. We checked in late Friday afternoon so there was a line but it moved fast and staff were very attentive and sweet. Dennis was the sweetest guy ever, he checked us in and made sure we knew the best spots in town and gave us the fastest route to our room. Highly recommend!
Stayed here again June 21-24. Elevators are fixed. Most rooms updated. I really like this hotel :)

When we arrived the checkin process was horrible. Not enough people for such a long line. The rooms I give 3.5. I did like the fact you could push a button to open and close the drapes and that you could look out but knowone could look in when drapes are open. There should also be a hotel phone in the lobby of each floor. My friend walked out the room and the door shut on her and she did not have her key card or purse. She should not have to walk all the way down to the front desk to get assistance. Overall, with a little xtra paint on the walls in the room I would come back and stay a couple of nights.

BOOOOOOO! I stayed here a few years ago and had a great time but this time around was been a completely different experience.   I received an offer to upgrade my room via email so I called and accepted.  I checked in and paid for upgrade but got to the room and it wasn't the upgraded room. I had to go back and stand in a line again (just to check in was 45 minutes) and it took 20 minutes to stand in line to get the correct room.   The staff were not friendly and not apologetic or accomodating after their mistake.  

The new room wasn't very clean, a used band-aid was in our bed!  If you plan on sharing the "luxury" Go rooms, think twice.  The bathroom door doesn't even close all the way and you can see through the frosted glass!  The sound system didn't work in our room so we couldn't listen to music and we were excited that the room had the iPod dock.  The pillows had feathers poking out of them and stabbing us in the face while we tried to sleep which was difficult since we heard base bumping from outside until about 4 in the morning, not sure where it was coming from, maybe a club nearby or ??   

We have another trip planned in a couple months and I had already thought that if things went well, we'd probably stay here again but no chance!  Sometimes you get what you pay for.

I booked this room through the hotel website and got a better price than if I booked through Expedia or Orbitz, etc. When I arrived  the front desk staff was nice and accommodating to our request to have adjoining rooms. The room was nice and seemed updated with laminate floors, flat screen TV and comfortable beds that were clean. However, the bathroom was old, dirty and in need of a remodel and\/or deep cleaning. I have pictures I will post. We decided to let them know at the end of our stay, which we did. The manager listened to our complaint, wrote notes on what we said and looked at the pictures I took. In the end she refunded us our "resort fees" that was about $100 and comped us breakfast at their buffet. The manager said she wished we said something when we checked in instead of waiting until we checked out. She assured me that she would have moved us right away. She also said she was gong to put both rooms out of service until it was fixed. Hopefully that is true and not just said. The location is great, but it seems they need to pay closer attention to the rooms. I may stay there again just to see if they did anything with their bathrooms. I will post pictures.

We have stayed here quite a few times in the go deluxe rooms with the strip view and we love the room. It's updated, cozy, you get a mini fridge, and I love the view of the fountains. Only thing this year that bugged me was the elevators. Some were closed, some were creepy with the lights out, and all the ones we got on didn't make us feel exactly secure. Hope they fix that for next time. The customer service is great and the guys at the go pool bar are hilarious. I always have a blast. I definitely recommend this place.

Well - I am SO glad I didn't read any reviews on Yelp before booking, because I would have missed out on a fantastic weekend! My heart goes out to all you Yelpers who had horriffic experiences, but I must have hit the jackpot because our stay was so wonderful!

I arrived early - 12pm - and check-in didn't start until much later. I got in line with high hopes. The lady up front suggested I register for a Total Rewards card which would allow me to bypass the early check-in fee when they had a room available. I left my bags with the bellhop and made my way into the casino. It reminded me of the casinos back home in MN, kind of old, and wasn't terribly flashy like I had fantasized them to be. However the (free) drinks were strong and there were PLENTY of people around which gave me reassurance this was still a great place to hang out. After an hour of day-drinking and gambling away $10, I decided to try for a room. I got to stand in the TR line (versus the regular line with about 30 people in it). I was helped immediately and went right up to my room. 

Our room - was honestly fantastic. I wonder (reading previous reviews) if all of the rooms are in a state of renovation of some sort, whether it is the bathroom or the beds or whatnot - but ours was pristine. The bathroom was huge! The shower was large as well, the sink was clean and enough counter space for 3 women.

The beds were almost too-comfy and kind of sank in the middle - but I didn't come to Vegas to SLEEP! The stereo system worked well, and the view of Caesar's Palace was perfect. My only complain in the room is that the outside of the windows were pretty dirty, but whatevs.

My checklist for a Vegas hotel is as such:

1) good location - CHECK (very central to all the action)
2) clean room - CHECK (make sure to get at least a GO room)
3) moderately priced - CHECK ($590 for 3 nights and 3 people = ~ $200 each)
4) pool - CHECK (the GO pool had lots of space, clean, good music)

Really the Flamingo has a lot to offer - if you want a Resort-type feel of luxury, I would not recommend. But for a good price and awesome location in the middle of all the action, you can't do better in Vegas.

**OH! And a Strip View is COMPLETELY WORTH THE UPGRADE CHARGE! Trust me!!

Booked room do to price and location. I would've paid more to stay at another place.
I had to deal with a malfunctioning elevator, lack of hot water, cleaning service that didn't come in time, rooms not looking as good as advertised, and after talking to customer service they didn't bother to help. Would not go back.

It's in the middle of the strip which is why I keep coming back. They have done a lot of renovations since the last time I was there. The rooms are nice. They aren't super fancy or anything but I mean really, how much are you in the room anyways. They moved Cut and took away one of my favorite little crappy "get steak and eggs at 3 am" place. The rooms are very accessible as far as getting to the strip and back. Honestly, best bang for your buck! For 6 nights, it was $380 and that was me making reservations 3 days in advance and in summer!

So don't do it. What a shithole. The rooms are very tired and outdated. No coffee machines, water or plastic glasses. The bathroom had mold in it and the tub had a leak that would not stop running. The check in process was so long. Avoid lines and do express checkin\/check out. Also the machines are so tight. Budget travelers beware......spend the extra money and go some where else. Forgot to mention my bed linens had human waste all over them and when asked housekeeping to switch out, they never showed up, really low class.

I guess they have upgraded the inside of the casino, when you walk in, looks a lot brighter and cleaner, come here to watch a magic show in their showroom, which is a half round sitting facing the stage, the magician Tim Gabrielson is a very funny guy, interact with the audience cracking jokes, playing magic trick, very entertaining show.

Probably not the best Vegas hotel I stayed. Here's the reasons why...

Parking- They have the smallest parking lot ever. And half of the spots are reserved for Valets and hilton vacation clubs. We couldn't find any parking for 30+ mins, so we gave up and parked in a open lot far far away. I never run into parking situation like this ever in Vegas.

Checking in- They have a check-in deadline for midnight. We called and they said the front desk will be open till 1am. We got there and waited in line for another 45 mins just to check in.   There was only two registration opened. I understood that it is almost 1 am and you're won't expecting this kind of crowd.. But when you see so many people waiting, can't you have more people help us?
 
Rooms- the room were only half renovated. It still feel really old and rusty especially the bathroom. I thought I was staying at some cheap motels.

The only good thing about this hotel is the location. It is in the middle of the strip and easy to access anywhere. Other than that, I can't really find a reason to stay at this place!

It's really hard to give this place a bad review because they people working are so nice. However, it's really dirty. It's honestly disgusting how dirty it is. It was very expensive for how dirty it was. Not to mention, nothing matched. The curtains, sheets, ect. weren't nice. We had an upgraded room and the TV was small. It just sucked. I wasn't expecting it. HOWEVER, it did seem like they were refurbishing it. Hopefully they are.

Stay away during holiday and\/or peak seasons. You will be disappointed. Simply put. They can't handle the volume. We had reservations and couldn't find a place to park. Valet was not even available. My husband dropped me off so I could check in and the reservation specialist wouldn't give me the keys because he said my name was not on the reservation even though I had a confirmation number, my husband's credit card and other qualifying information. It took over an hour to check in and the room was nowhere near as nice as the pictures on their website. What's worst was the ambivalence of the manager Jarrod. He said this is the norm for the hotel and literally offered no recourse. Jamison, a regular employee over heard the manager speak to us and pushed him to offer something in exchange for a very bad experience. Very odd customer service. This was truly a disaster especially after driving 4+hours to get to the hotel. I know Vegas is all about the money, but your reputation goes farther than the dollar bill. I suggest spending your money where it'll be valued and appreciated all the way. 

OH BY THE WAY....They get you on their rooms. Unless you initially request it, you will get one of their old antiquated rooms which are absolutely gross. We had two of them and one room had cum stains on the sofa. When Jarrod upgraded us, he said the new suites are investigated by management. He's absolutely correct because there was a BIG difference in the level of cleanliness from the upgraded suites to their traditional rooms. Boy I tell you, this hotel has serious game. Never again will I stay here.

12.1.16 Mom's slot machine wouldn't pay us, somehow it malfunctioned & it took the attendant over 30 minutes to get to us!  We were late for other functions. 

Then, the Diamond lounge sucked. 11.11.16 was better than before, but it is never consistent, which I separately reviewed, but it is part of the hotel & casino.  I also waited to post some of my review in hopes that the Flamingo Hotel & Casino would redeem themself cause I'd like to take advantage of my free room offer.  No thanks.

The pool is ok, nothing special w\/ super old plastic lounge chairs.  Horrible smoke ventilation & the bar carry's no nice wine or champagne.  Not one single bar.  The showroom has no cocktail waitresses & the bar is in the far right hidden from everyone.  I've seen three shows there.

I would say four except that the show we were scheduled for was cancelled.  The Flamingo Box Office is absolutely the worst also.  It all depends on who you get, however that too should be consistent.

As I mentioned on 10.13.16, Flamingo couldn't even call us or email that Jeff Civillio Comedy show cancelled for the rest of the year.  They email me over free rooms etc to mainly get my play, but as a courtesy they should email that the show has been cancelled. I moved my schedule around & planned on meeting friends in the Linq as mom & dad were going to attend the show. 

As I waited for the Flamingo box office manager, Sherice, the Jeff Civillio performance behind Jerrin the Diamond\/7Star rep, was being advertised. Also I informed them that the cancelles show brochures were still on display.  Jerrin was kind, but the manager Sherice was of no help at all.  Paul another manager finally informed us that TR would help us better. 

Sherice never informed us of any of this until I asked her for higher management cause I'd never had such unnecessarily, rude & bad service.

Finally, I speak to a real person who should teach Sherice some customer service skills, Antoinette in TR. Now, she is the only person I will speak to at Flamingo. Five stars or 'seven stars' for her. She has what it takes to keep a client. She turned the whole situation around for us. 

Overall, I give the Flamingo one star cause there is only one of her & that is sad. I had the worst service until I met her & have given them a chance to fix it until posting this such as my Diamond lounge check ins.  They also need a remodel.

The best part of this place so far, is the bird exhibit & access to the strip & Linq.  They also have a dog park & a beautiful Makau who speaks as you enter from the valet.  Valet is also wonderful.

My husband and I spent last weekend at the flamingo as we were there for a wedding. The experience was horrible. The lobby smelled like a mixture of cigarettes, sewage and cheap cleaner, and our room was filthy. The carpets had cigarette burns in it, and there was hair on the bathroom floor. Since we didn't spend that much time in our room, I wasn't extremely worried about it. I checked the sheets on the bed and they seemed to be fresh so we went about our weekend. It wasn't until we were on our way home Sunday morning that my husband realized he had bites all up and down his arm. BED BUG BITES. We immediately called the hotel and were transferred around and were ultimately told that someone would contact us in 1-2 days to discuss our claim. Here we are 4 days later and we have not heard back. I am disgusted and pissed. Thank you for charging my husband and I $600 for a weekend in a piece of shit, dirty, bug infested room.

My company put me here when I flew in for Electronics Consumer Show and of course I was kind of disappointed that I didn't get something nice like Mandalay Bay.

It was standard, but the lobby was much nicer than I had expected. The service was ok, the staff was ok, the casino was ok, the food choices were poor (hence, didn't eat there. MGM has a great variety of restaurants though).

I am giving it two stars because it's smack down in the middle of the strip which saved me a lot of money on taxi since I could just walk across the bridge. And another star for making an effort of remodeling numerous rooms..however if I were to book a hotel in Vegas with my own money, I would still make another choice.

This place is not what it use to be. However, it is pretty clean, has a great pool, best location, and the price is right. The decor is kind of fun and our view was of that huge Ferris wheel; so pretty lit up at night. The clerk that checked us in was very nice, however, all restaurants were mediocre.

This was the first time I really got to explore the Flamingo in Vegas. 

While it's an older hotel and casino, the gardens and grounds are GORGEOUS. There's a koi pond that is to die for and has fish that are 25-40 years old in it (I asked). 

The wedding chapel was beautiful, if a touch warm, and the mermaid statue on the rocks was a hidden treasure.  The pool was hopping,but a woman in a wheel chair was having a very hard time getting in due to the elevated areas around it. 

I would consider staying here.

Review is for the Garden Bar.

We stopped by for a beer and a Lemon Drop. Mmm, nicely made!  Great view of the tropical garden area too!  Very relaxing!

Wish I could rave about this hotel like I used to. After my drive to Vegas, I arrived a little past midnight. I hunted around in the Self-Parking lot for about 20 minutes, but couldn't find a single space to park. I decided to try valet...which was also full. I was told that, even though I was a guest at that hotel for 2 days, that I would have to park in a neighboring hotel's parking structure. I schlep my luggage from across the street at Bally's to front desk where I am confronted with an incompetent desk clerk who informs me that I am not to check in until the following day. I let her know that is inaccurate and she stares at the screen, scoffs, then proceeds to say "oh, right." An apology would've sufficed. I ask to speak with the Reservations Manager to vent about how unacceptable it is that I had to park two hotels down even though I was a guest at this hotel. He doesn't express condolences or apologize throughout our entire conversation, instead gives me a litany of excuses as to why I had no place to park... including that some of the valet are reserved for Diamond Members. This makes sense but he has to include, in a particularly obnoxious tone, that if you want to be treated like first class, you have to pay first class prices. Gee... if I was paying first class prices, I certainly won't be paying them here! I let him know that I am a California resident and visit Vegas at least 4-5 times a year. This wasn't my first time staying at this hotel but that it was most likely going to be my last. He literally shrugs his shoulders, lifts his hands and eyebrows and turns and walks away. Awesome. As if this weren't enough, to top it off, we get to our room and are confronted with a massive water damage mark above one of the beds (I thought this place was just renovated?!), a make-up smeared towel in the bathroom and fixtures that looked like they were about to crumble. I am generally a very easy-going person, however, when I feel that people who are specifically in the customer service industry are downright rude, you may as well go poke a hornet's nest. If at any point in my entire interaction with the hotel staff had someone genuinely said "I'm sorry", I would have saved myself the trouble of writing this entire comment. Needless to say, I will no longer rave about this hotel or suggest it as a place to stay to anyone.

Absolutely WORST hotel experience ever! 

Booked a block of rooms for my sister's wedding (she got married there at the Flamingo). The rooms we were told we were getting for the wedding package (pictures online) were not what we actually received. They were so dirty! All of them! I'm talking pubes in the bathrooms, dust all over the beat up furniture, crusty sheets, etc.

There is no insulation on the door. Actually a good inch and a half of open space between the door and the floor. You have to hear everyone in the hall. And not just the loud drunk people either. Every word anyone speaks. I resorted to shoving towels under the door to reduce the noise level. 

My smoke alarm spontaneously went off at 6:00 am. Called the front desk 3 times and no one came to fix it. After 45 minutes of having to listen to the screaming alarm, a carpenter happened to walk by and called someone to fix it. He said the front desk never called it in. 

The alarm clock in the room next to mine went off at 1am every day on the loudest volume and blasted until 4 am. I called the front desk multiple times 3 nights in a row before someone finally went and turned it off. No one was even checked into that room. Again, the front desk clearly doesn't give a crap. 

The hotel treated my sister and new brother in law very poorly especially considering they spent so much money to get married on their property. (I will say that the people that performed the actual wedding ceremony were very nice).

There are far too many options of hotels when in Vegas. I highly suggest you never waste your time or money at the Flamingo.

Stayed in a very clean & spacious room on the 10th floor overlooking the pool\/bar area. I went with my sister & cousins, we are all newly grads\/in college so for us, on a somewhat limited budget, this was perfect although the hotel itself has some improvements it could make to be better. The decor was modern with sleek hot pink curtains although the furniture (dressers, desks, nightstand) were all visibly worn. The best thing about this hotel is the location right on the strip with easy access to many of the other big hotels like cesar's palace. The second best thing about this hotel was the 24hr pizza delivery service from the hotel's pizza place. There is nothing better than coming home slightly (or very) intoxicated at 4am & having the convenience of ordering a fresh pizza that will also be delivered straight to your door. One good thing to know is that they don't provide any extra amenities like toothbrushes, razors etc. Those kinds of things are available downstairs in a seriously overpriced convenience store\/gift shop so don't forget any of that from home!

Go to the Flamingo if you need a cheap room in a good location...because really...who spends time in their room in Vegas?!  Got a FAB double queen.  Room wasn't ready at 10:30 pm the night we checked in so they stuck us in a FAB king with a nasty bathroom about two miles from the elevator.  Got into our real room the next morning, right off the elevator.  The pool rocked, though...one of the top 10 pools in Vegas for good reasons...be sure to check it out.  Probably won't stay here again.

Upon arrival it smelled like marijuana smoke in our room and continued to smell,  it was one of those rooms with a door that opens to the next room and I'm sure our neighbors were smoking marijuana and we could smell it in our room.... So we get home to a message from flamingo threatening to change our card an extra 500 because our room smelled like smoke.  WHAT!?  We weren't smoking in our room,  why would they charge us for somebody else's actions. If they try and charge us then we will have to take legal action. Wtf!  I'll never ever stay there again and I'm going to make sure  everybody I know doesn't stay there either. They also recently started charging for valet parking too!  It's not worth it.

I'm really teetering between 3.5 and 4 stars.

So, my fiance's mom & aunt are gamblers. Atlantic City gamblers. Yep, they're serious. And they've got these "diamond club" cards that get them free shit in all of the Harrah's hotels. This equals sweetness for all of us. We got FREE rooms (in the newly remodeled side), FREE drinks, front of the line service for cabs & restaurants in the Flamingo, etc. 

The hotel itself is oldy Mc oldster...but that's kind of cool. Knowing the old skool gangsters used to roam the floors here is nifty.....BUT because it's old, the ventilation sucks balls. My eyes were so red that it looked like I'd smoked enough weed to put Bob Marley to shame. Really gross. The rooms, however, seemed to be smoke-free. They were clean, newly remodeled & had large flat panel TVs. My beef with the TVs was this: you turn them on and they would reset the volume level to oh, I dunno, level 4,000!! SO FUCKING LOUD & ridiculous. Don't they normally set them to be lower in volume? Whatever....the decor in the room looked like a futuristic Baskin Robbins. I know it's the Flamingo and you're gonna see fucking PINK everywhere you look, that's fine. But did they need to put white vinyl headboards in the room? Why vinyl?? I suppose it's easier to clean jizz off......eeeeeeew HAHA. Ok, back to the rest of the room. The beds were very comfy, there was ample hanging & drawer space, an iPod hookup & the bathroom was spacious and had separate bath & shower. If you can get past the Flamingo pink everywhere, you might like it.

I will say this: I had some of my best luck gambling at the Flamingo. I rode my $20 for TWO days there....playing my Wheel of Fortune spinner game. Yeah, that's how I roll. Big time.

The check-in at 1 am took more than an hour. The check-in kiosk machine doesn't work and there are only 4 staffs for over 100people waiting in line. I talked to the manager and he said there is nothing he can do. Worst hotel check-in experience ever!!

My family went to the Flamingo for our vacation. The rooms are clean and the location is good. However, I am not sure if all Casino hotels operate like this but I was very dissappointed that I had to pay $12 for a pot of coffee brought to me through room service. So ofcourse I did not want to pay this so I went downstairs to get a coffee..A CUP OF COFFEE! and the lines were forever long! When you finally arrive to get your coffee the cost wasn't much better. I though Las Vegas would be a place where you can eat and drink COFFEE at a low cost! Not so! I guess if you but a $5 in the slot machine they might bring you a cup of joe. The hotel was okay but I find it very dissappointing they can not but a darn coffee machine in the room! You are going spend a lot of money on food too! 4 of us was an easy $60 for breakfast. My recommendation for a family vacation is not Vegas and Kids.

DONT STAY HERE! Pay the extra $50 and stay at Ballys or Harrahs next door. The Flamingo has really gone down the drain. The rooms are disgusting and filthy.  I'm pretty easy to please and didn't move rooms because I didn't want to waste my time so just giving you all the heads up.. don't do it. I stay here for the location but never again.

Apart from being one of the Oldest Casino & Hotels on the Las Vegas strip, I and My Husband Love Flamingo Las Vegas as the service you receive there is amazing, we recently got Married in Down Town Disney ( now renamed Disney Springs Orlando) and then flew out to Las Vegas for Our Honeymoon, we was given the Top Floor and an Executive suit, the views over the strip is exactly what we wanted, requested and got. the room was clean and fresh towels every day, we are clean and tidy people but they still and cleaned every where again, the Casino apart from the great choice of slots, video poker and black jack machines, there is the tables, the staff are always friendly and always happy to help. the restaurants, Diners, Bars and price range from cheap diners to exclusive, we like to eat at Johnny Rockets and also the Flamingo Garden Buffet where you can sit and look out over the Flamingos, and ducks and fish, the beautiful waterfalls, we was going to get married here then decided to get married in Florida where we live as we wanted friends to be there, but they have an amazing wedding area's and would recommend to every one thinking of getting Married in Las Vegas speak to Flamingo as they you can get married for very cheap at Flamingo by one of their amazing Beautiful Waterfalls. we like to go to Different Casinos on Our stay and try our Luck some where else, but we always end up back at Our Favourite Flamingo, its more comfortable, Staff more Friendly, waitresses are so cheerful (remember Waitresses work for tips so I recommend tip $1 per drink you get, and $1 for a beer or whiskey and coke is still awesome price!) Join the Players Club well worth it as you get rewards for playing that you can use to lower your hotel bill! they even Have a Rewards Credit Card where you can build points that will pay for your whole stay if you use it properly. Buggsy's bar is great to sit and drink and gamble, the bar staff are friendly and helpful, there are many Casino's, Bars, Cafes, Diners, Restaurants, Hotels in Las Vegas but there is only one Flamingo, Oldest and in Our Opinion the BEST!!!

Quite possibly the worst hotel we have ever stayed in!! Absolutely filthy! The hallways smelled, half the elevators didn't work and it took us half an hour in line just to pick up our key AFTER we registered! Never again!!!

I like it here I think because it's iconic! The pool is beautiful and so much fun ( expensive if you want to be comfortable and have drinks). The new walkway outside is amazing... It is perfect! But the flamingo needs an update badly! The bathrooms suck in the rooms. I have to open the shower curtain to have enough light to shave. The habitat elevators are scary to say the least. One I would say is haunted...lol... It opens on every floor, and drops out from under you when you step out. If it weren't for my sister being a platinum member, I wouldn't stay here. The check in line in never less than an hour, even at 1 am. And with her platinum membership I let her book and check us in... I wish they could get that figured out! Yikes that like sucks!

I wasn't really impressed with this hotel. I'm really not that hard to please but I guess I had set my expectations a little too high. It was my first time in Vegas and I was expecting grand hotel entrances, big lobby's, and fancy rooms with updated technology. That isn't exactly what this hotel was. 

When the taxi first dropped us off the main circle entrance to the hotel we got out and didn't know where to go... there was no grand main entrance, we found a glass door with a small staircase inside, no elevators or escalators and asked a man if this is how we get into the lobby... maybe it was under construction but it was just a really weird main entrance to something and we had to lug our backs up all the stairs. We got there at 4:30 and thought it would be fine checking in since our room was to be ready at 4:00. It took over an hour to check in! There was a GIANT line in the lobby to check in. The line was so much longer than the line for TSA at the airport... When we got to our room it was completely dark. There was also an hour long line to check out. Just for those reasons I'm not sure I would want to stay at this hotel again... I would rather pay a little more money and not have to spend two hours in line. 
But I think you can actually skip the long line if you check in online and check out online? I just never thought to do that since I've never had to wait in line to check in at a hotel before, and I've stayed at hundreds of hotels, even in NYC. 


PROS: 
The biggest thing this hotel has going for it is that it is literally right in the middle of everything... all the good Casinos, clubs and shopping are right next door! Good for walking to stuff. 
Giving it three stars only because they upgraded us to a bigger room 4 doors next to our friends on the top floor. 

Cons: 
The hotel is old and a lot of stuff such as plumbing is out of date (drains were clogged in room) 
1hr+ line to check in \/ out
Large Hotel Fee ($50 for two nights)
Floor numbers written in sharpie next to elevator buttons. 
Old out of date look to casino.

During a night of heavy intoxication myself and a few friends had the bright idea of driving to Vegas from LA in the morning. You would expect that once we woke up the idea of driving the 4 hours to Vegas would have diminished! But not with us! After looking up prices we were able to get a "luxury" room for only $100 night, split between 4 guys. By Las Vegas hotel standards, the Flamingo is outdated. In fact by most standards the Flamingo is outdated. However, unless you want to spend $200 a night for a much nicer and more elegant hotel, the Flamingo will do just fine. The hotel has a surprisingly young clientele, not surprising given its cheap rates. The Flamingo is also right in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. Its really a prime location. The biggest pro of the Flamingo is obviously its pool, which has an lush tropical theme and indeed has real Flamingos walking around. The gambling is also a plus! $10 minimum bets on most games, as opposed to $20 minimums at places like the Venetian or Bellagio. If you're looking for luxury, skip the Flamingo. If you're looking for a good time and plan on spending little time in your hotel\/hotel room, the Flamingo will do just fine.

Check-in\/out was quick and easy.  Check-in was done at one of the kiosks and check-out was done online.

Valet is a charge here now.  Wasn't when I booked and no honoring that.  A little off.  I let it slide.  Or do I.  I gamble most at other properties.

The Room.
Go King room with a view of the High Roller.  
The room was OK.  A standard Vegas Hotel room.  
The bathroom was ok as well.  The room had a shower with a separate tub.  Not what I wanted.  Again, my reservation said this was an option that I did not want.  I wanted the larger shower.  The shower was decent.  No water pressure at all.
Now the view was laughable.  It was off to the extreme side.  You had to be at the window looking to the side to see it.  Semi-Partial View at best.  A false upsell.

I really disliked the hustle and the hounding of the promotions\/ticket people.  Even if I wanted what they were selling, their attitude kept me away.

Didn't really eat here.  Not too fond of their options.  The food court is good for late night munchies and the such.

Didn't really interact with any employees.

I traveled there alone with my son so all I wanted was the good location in the middle of the Strip. I was a little afraid of the aging Casino and the demographics. 
I must say that I was pleasantly surprised. The newly added wheel (the Linq) really has given a facelift to the hotel. There is a pedestrian street on the side of the hotel which leads to the Linq with great restaurants, bars etc...
The check in line was too long. There were not enough staff to accommodate the arrivals. I was charged $20 for an early check in. Unheard of before....
The room was great with an awesome view of the Linq which fascinated my baby, with the colors changing, blinking etc...
The star I remove is for the flooring. There is no soundproofing whatsoever and if the person on top of you drops a pin, I promise you you will hear it. That is such bad design!!! Also the noisy headboards are not necessary. 
The housekeeping stuff has been amazing with the baby very helpful, and kind.
There is a food court which allows you to order take out which was great in my case.The pool was closed but we went to the Paris pool which is heated all year long (you just have to present your key)
Overall a great experience.

I believe people have to understand that this a very old hotel! One of the oldest. There are negatives and positive outcomes to it.

Checked in on Thursday around 11pm. The line was long and definitely took forever. I recommend checking in on your phone or the kiosks by the front desk, then go to the Keys and Mail pick up to receive your keys.

The room I receive was the Fab room with a king size bed in the Habitat Tower. The room was big with a habitat\/pool view. 
Two negative things about the room was that there was no refrigerator or bathtub. 

Pool was packed but that's part of the Vegas experience. 

Elevators were sketchy! Be careful!

Overall, I will stay here again. Great price & big rooms!

i was there for the world series of beer pong and they double booked my room.. granted i did recieve an upgrade but my friends had to wait 4-5 hours to get their room and they did not even have blankets alot of people were smoking weed there and you could smell it in the bathrooms because they have these wierd hole type things in the shower.... the head boards for the beds are attached to the wall the place is a total dive..... AVOID AT ALL COSTS....  THE PICTURES ARE EXCEPTIONALLY MISLEADING THEY DO NOT HAVE LCD TVS UNLESS YOU ARE IN A SUITE OR SOMETHING LIKE THAT

This was an awful experience. My sister and I booked a room with a view for an extra cost.  When making the reservations, I told them our flight would be arriving later in the evening and to be aware of that.  I was assured it would be noted.  We arrived to be put into a room with no view and a Queen bed with a visible dip in it.  We called down on both issues and were not dealt with in a nice, professional or pleasant manner.  This was nasty customer service.  We spoke to a manager who was not helpful nor cared until we said we were checking out to go to another hotel. They then moved us to a room in the aninmal section of the hotel.  It was ok in that it did not smell of animals and the view was actually what we had paid for minus being where the pets were.  The doors going into the rooms are filthy and the furniture is knicked and old.  The bathroom was tiny.  There is no coffee maker or a refrigerator. The rooms are just plain ugly and honestly, we both agreed, on the caliber of a Motel 6.  I will say that the pools are very nice but heads up....they are opened to non guests of the hotel (for a fee) and you do not get primary treatment such as a special line for hotel guest. You are all in the same line (and believe me, you are, to get into the GO Pool) on a first come first serve basis.  Hotel guests do not pay to get in but that is the only difference.  We will not be returning to this hotel.  There is also a humongous line to check-in\/check-out at this hotel.  I have never seen anything like it.  I also wonder how many of these people are returnees and if so, what's the draw?

This hotel is over priced and very dated.  They have an inefficient check in process and are not customer service oriented.

I called the front desk to request a couple of things and nothing was ever done or delivered to my room.  I stayed here for business so it's not about the price.  This isn't a great place to stay when in Vegas.  I wouldn't recommend.

Yup. Dos.

This place is garbage. It gets one star for the times I had to deal with their staff. Each was a pleasant experience at least. It received a second star because I did enjoy the pool.

Our bathroom had a staunch smell of urine despite being clean and no white-girl-wasted people in my room. So no one missed the John.

My friends were two floors above my group and the AC wasn't working. Let me remind you that it was August in Las Vegas. No AC = epic fail. We all had non-smoking rooms. Someone in an adjacent room had the bright idea of lighting one up and came through all the walls making us think someone was standing over our head, force feeding us smoke. The carpets were coming up in the hallways and it was just a damn disaster. 

This would never happen at the Wynn or Cosmo. I only stayed here because the group chose it. My suggestion - stay elsewhere. You get what you pay for!

Checked in and the host was friendly. Got a room that looked like it was recently remodeled. I had read bad reviews on TripAdvisor so I wasn't sure what to expect. But for the deal that we got for long weekend... this place was good. Almost all tables were in play at 2 am. The minimum bet was 10 dollars at 2 am for roulette and 25 for black jack

The max straight up bet for Roulette was 200 and outside betting was upto 5000 max, 2500 in a column or single cell outside.

They also have a decent choice of cuisines in food court which was fully open at 2. There are a couple of in house coffee shops that looked good but were closed when we checked in.

The hotel will hold on to your baggage for upto 24 hours after check out at no extra cost. This is really a boon for those last days when your flight leaves at night but you don't want to roam around with ur bags

1 star for location, 1 for friendly staff\/ relaxed security, 1 for actually having flamingos in the court yard

oh and the bath tub is was big enough for two people

The location is good and the rooms are spacious but that's basically it. The room was kind of old and they didn't have the basic things like a coffee machine or a mini fridge. Also, the first day of our stay there was no hot water, the left the water on for a while and it wouldn't get hot. Probably won't stay here again.

This place sucks! the first time I went there (reluctantly), the power went out for 4 hours and we couldn't hang out in the room and watch TV\/listen to music while we pre-party.  Also, the girls couldn't do their hair\/makeup, etc.  
Then a couple years went buy and for New Years 2011 I decided to give them another chance since their rates were so cheap! (The phrase - YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR really IS true).  There was NO RUNNING WATER for almost the entire day.  Then when it came back on - IT WAS FREEZING COLD!...
They didn't offer anything for us when we checked out except a $30.00 credit towards a meal!!!...I was thinking F*** Y** manager!  Spoke to me in a condescending manner because I'm only 28 years old!!...Bastard!!!
NEVER GOING THERE AGAIN!...

That's definitely the worst hotel experience ever! I don't even want to give my one star review because they did not even deserve it. We booked a double king size room on July 4th and it took us 30 minutes waiting in line to finish the check in. Their customer service just sucks ! When we finally went to the room we found out the room we just got is locked from the inside, the room is not being cleaned and someone is apparently in this freaking room! WHAT IS WRONG with this hotel? How could you not know that room is still occupied and just give the door key to other people? Right now I am really doubt the safety and I believe that even a motel is way more better than this place! Mark my word, just stay away from here to save your time and your money.

I just checked in after long day in Nevada. I used to stay at Wynn or Venetian. And I thought: similar price, so why not? And I made a mistake.

Dirty room, leaking bathroom (even with tons of leakseal tape), incredibly dirty windows, lack of even a paid minibar. Lots of rust.

The quality of room I'd describe as: if someone offers you that for rent, run away.

So my recommendations: STAY AWAY. 

Wish I could give one star. Should've stayed elsewhere...

Recently stayed at the Flamingo. It was a very mixed experience.
Dislikes:
Because parking spaces were reserved for the Valet service, the Hilton, and Hertz, it was very hard to find a parking place in the ramp.
The check-in process was very slow. I've never waited that long to check in.

Likes:
We thought the buffet was very good.
Our room was clean.
The location was great: middle of the strip.

Although this is a very old Hotel in Vegas, I still love it. The rooms could be better looking, but its an old hotel lol. I love the pizza spot they have there, its really good and inexpensive. Customer service is on point too. The pool is great and they play good music too.

Let me start this off by saying, we loved the Flamingo and now we hate the Flamingo. We, my husband and I, have been going to the Flamingo a couple times each year since spending our honeymoon there. I'd say we've stayed at the Flamingo a total of 10 times in both the GO Room and in their Fab rooms. We loved the rooms, the staff, the cleaniness, the casino. We even overlooked the elevators and the hallways which we knew would eventually be renovated (by the way, they haven't touched the elevators or the hallways in the last 6 years and they looked crappy and smelled even back then). Our last trip has changed us forever. 

Since our last visit, The Linq and the great big wheel of death (aka The High Roller) has opened. You'd think this wouldn't affect the parking situation or the employees of the Flamingo. WRONG! We drove about 6 hours to get to the Flamingo, when we arrived it was late - about midnight. We drove up, like we always had, to valet our car - so it would be easier to get our luggage upstairs and to the lobby. Nope. Valet was jammed full and ONLY open to Seven Star platinum and up members. This is new. So, plan #2 was to park in the parking structure next to the hotel. We've done this before and the walk isn't bad. Too bad there's no parking spaces! Valet took about 1\/2 the structure (and 1\/2 of those spaces were empty so who knows WTF valet was doing with a full valet area in front of the lobby!) and there's about an entire floor dedicated to rental cars (again, only about 1\/2 full). So, driving up and down the parking structure - twice! We gave up and decided to check out where the overflow parking was. In the back FAR, FAR, FAR away from the hotel and practically full! I don't know WTF they were thinking when they built The Linq and The High Roller but they obviously didn't think about people wanting to visit the thing and how it was going to impact paying customers of their hotel. Furious at this point, I just had my husband drop me off at the valet area with all of our luggage so he could park 2 miles away. I went inside the valet drop-off area and found that the escalator going up was out. Got into the elevator. Broke. Tried to ask a valet person on how to get upstairs without taking the actual stairs (my back was sore and I could no way carry my luggage up myself), the 1st and 2nd valet person ignored me. The 3rd valet person finally told me to go to the other entrance and waved his hand in some direction. I went back outside and guessed my way to the other entrance, which was to the right. At this point I'm not only furious but on the edge of tears. Oh, and it's about 2am by now. So with my back aching now, I walk over to the other entrance IN THE STREET BECAUSE THERE IS NO SIDEWALK with cabs honking at me while they're trying to get to this other entrance also, I go inside and guess what? The escalator going up is broke. I find the elevator, which is a winding walk in corridors and doesn't feel like it's for public access. When I finally get to the lobby, my husband shows up and he's now furious because of all the crap I've had to go through to just get to this point - which I'm in a line to get my keys because I had already checked into the room online. When I'm finally at the check-in desk the employee asks about my night - I unleash my story. She's not very sympathetic (which tells me alot of other hotel guests have gone through this same thing which makes it an issue that NO ONE is dealing with!!!!!), offers me a $30 food & beverage credit which I take just so I can get my key and go to my room. No upgrade. No apology. Nothing other than a F&B credit. So, we get to our room and it just doesn't feel clean. We try to call about changing rooms but we couldn't even get the front desk. The Flamingo had us beat. 

The final kicker came when we got the bill at check-out. Their resort fee covers only 1 device on wifi. Both my husband and I agreed to the T&Cs on our phones to use their wifi. It was faster than our cell service. Sure, you can say this was our mistake but I feel their policy for only 1 device is unbelievable!

During our stay, we decided that the Flamingo had let us down and we were never staying there again. I'm not even sure if we'd stay at another Harrah's property again. We were previous MGM properties people and changed over to Harrah's properties back when they didn't have resort fees. Now that all Harrah's hotels have resort fees, not to mention some of the highest on the strip, and due to the service we received during our last visit, we are gladly returning to being MGM property people.

 Good bye Flamingo! Way to let us down!

It started out BAD... ENDED HORRIBLE ! 

I don't care what anyone says,.... This place is not a legend and not history. It I a hole in the wall on its last leg. WAITED in line to check in for 45 mins. WTF

It started bad,... When we drove into town and up to the flamingo we could NOT GET IN ! There is construction surrounding the hotel and there is NO front entrance for check in on the strip to drive your car up. After calling and sitting on hold FOREVER, we was directed into the back check in. I was dropped off while my sister went to FIND parking. Turns out its either parking a block away on the street or on the last floors of the garage. Imagine walking with your bags.... 

Got the room, and opened the door...SMOKING ROOM, and horrible décor. Called down and changed rooms ( sat on hold for 10 mins ) . Bellman came up but with no carry all..so we waited for him to come back...The bellman talked about the cosmo hotel THE whole time ..I now know why. It was a hint to run not walk somewhere else. 

New room upgrade ( we paid) was fresh the go room was nice . White décor and flat screen TV's are a bonus . 

Hotel elevators are a long wait and one broke down. The flooring was HORRIBLE and walls are dirty. No real club in this hotel, and the bar club had locals in it trying to pick up drunk chicks. 

Room key didn't work..went down to get another... STILL DIDNT WORK, went down at 1 am on a Saturday because we couldn't get in the room. Back out and came back to NO PARKING and we had to park dwn the street and walk. DANGEROUS MUCH ? 

Pool party was nice, no real shade areas neither man made or real,in 100 degree weather, this is a no no. but, a good mix of music.

20's 30' crowd and cheap older adults. Class is NOT a option here. 
Lots of kids and not a place to eat a high end meal. 

If your are going to spend 150 a night, you may as well spend another 50 and go for a room at the palazzo or something. Lesson learned. Will never go again.

I loved the Go Deluxe room and if it wasn't for it being super cute and cheap I'd knock this sucker down to one star cause the Room Service is god awful.

3:00PM: Arrive and call for extra towels, blankets, toilet paper, pillows and cups.
5:00PM: Call again for the same items
7:00PM: Call again and I'm flipping pissed this time because I said it's been 4 hours since I've gotten my items. They told me that it'll be right up within the hour.
8:00PM: STILL NOT THERE. So I got my ass down to Guest Services so I could speak with whoever was in charge of Hotel\/Room service but they said that they don't even have that! WTF? WHO THE FUCK AM I SUPPOSE TO COMPLAIN TO THEN? So I had them call those fuckers again and they were like "Oh apparently you only called once?" So I flipped out on them too. I even told them the times I called and how I was patient with them, allotting them at least 2 hours to get the shit up to the room. Anyways the guy said I could write a letter to them and they'll see what they can do.
8:45PM: We got our stuff but the bastards forgot the blankets. 

I've been to TONS of hotels and I've never had the shittiest hotel service ever.

SO STUPID! Even Hooters was better with their service but their rooms were gross hahaha.

Absolutely horrible. We've been waiting in line to check in for almost an hour and it's nearly midnight. They have only 2 people working the check in & check out counter and there are about 100 people in line. When my friend called and talked to the front desk manager they did nothing; not even add more staff to help.  Never staying here again!

The check in process on its own is enough to stay anywhere else in vegas. It takes more than an hour to move through the line. It takes an additional 20 minutes to check in. The front desk is understaffed despite being "one of the busiest hotels in the world". 

Not worth whatever you think you're getting out of this

Pros:
Clean room, nice views of the fountains at the Bellagio. 

Cons:
False alarm sirens that went off twice during our stay, at 3:30am.  This was not just a little beep. Full on siren mode, scare the piss out of you.  Then once it stopped, no explanation. 

Not turning over the room daily.  They just give us enough towels for one day. We booked for seven days.  I expect fresh towels every day. No brainer. Did not happen. 

Three out of six elevators do not work. This caused delays during peak hours.

Next expectation:  When your in room menu says you deliver room service until 11pm, we expect that to be true.  But nooooooooooooo, we were told the menus we're outdated and that was just too bad for us.  

Flamingo, I like the room we got, I like the view.  But you failed on soooo many levels I doubt I will return. 

The saddest part is, that I held on the phone for a better part of 20 minutes to speak w a supervisor and there was no one available. 

Stayed here because of a conference. One of the speakers made fun of the duct tape patches on the carpet leading into the conference area. Flamingo, you should be embarrassed. The upstairs conference room was ridiculously cold and not enough chairs were available for most of our sessions. We were told at one session to grab some from a room next door.  Why are your paying patrons doing the job of your banquet department?

All of these things separate would not make me consider giving a poor review.  I think the room service menu was a deal breaker for me. I can't believe a multi million dollar casino cannot afford to update their menus.

Second time at the flamingo and I'll be coming back.

The second best part is the awesome pool area, however, you have to get there early to get good sun beds.
The best part is location, location, location. The flamingo is located in the middle of the Strip which means the best parts of the strip is in the surrounding areas (best shops, best restaurants). It can be a pain to walk long distances when it's 110 degrees outside. 

The cool thing with the flamingo is that the flamingo is the first hotel on the strip. This can also be a bad thing since some rooms aren't yet renovated which means they're worn out. This is the reason why I give the flamingo 4 out of 5. 

Although, the location and the pool area is reason enough to come back here. You're in Vegas, you barely even spend time at the hotel room!

Stay here if you want to be continually harassed by timeshare vacation sales people. Not kidding.  Five times between my friend and I in the first hour.  One rep was standing in the elevator doorway as if she was a bell person\/greeter\/security and grabbed my friends luggage handle shaking it  asking how long are you staying, how long are you staying!  Meanwhile another male sales rep acted as if he was an usher for the hotel and wanted to give me directions and grabbed my room key from my hand "let me see" and then proceeded to give me directions to my room (which differed from the front desk directions) but not before trying to give his sales pitch. I was uncomfortable that this stranger now knew my room number!  This bothering continued for the two days we were there.  I let concierge know but they clearly did nothing.

Valet pretends that valet is "free";  while the guys work on tips - it really is part of the resort fee.

There is no fridge in the room which is standard these days.  The bathroom sink hardware was rusty and didn't drain properly; there were only three towels (we had 4 people in a double room); there was only one standard plug on the nightstand shared by both beds; WIFI (part of resort fee) is limited to two devices per room (um most people have at least one device so this is unreasonable for 4 people in a room); the outside windows were so dirty, photo taking was awful.  We had a do not disturb sign on our door but housekeeping still proceeded to knock on our door at 8:45 the morning of checkout.

Also, I noticed another poster posted a photo of cockroach larve.  This is concerning since I found a dead cockroach in my home (never saw one before!) a couple days after returning and attributed it to coming from some bags from merchandise purchased from swap meet.  Now i wonder!!  I will update post if I find anymore.

Awful is the word, my wife and I visited for a family wedding and stayed in this hotel, we should have known the price was too good to be true....

The room was in the dog friendly wing.....we did not have a dog....

The room did not have shampoo or towels when we arrived.....we like to shower and be clean....

The room had multiple stains and sticky things in the carpet.....we do not like sticky things on our feet....

The room attendants took over an hour to bring up towels\/soap.....we are not good tippers after 15min....

Out of a dozen hotel elevators, only 4x appeared to be working.....we are not triathletes who can run up 19 flights of stairs with two suitcases.....

Would we stay at the Flamingo hotel ever again? We would not!

While the hotel was fabulous (love the pink everywhere!), the customer service was horrendous! Specifically, the check in\/out process was the worst I've ever experienced! The front desk attendant provided us with wrong information at check-in and was complete incompetent. He could not accurately explain charges to our credit cards and made the process messy and confusing. Upon check out, our front desk attendant noted we were double charged resort fees! This was an "easy fix" at check in, but had been overlooked because the front desk attendant was awful. 

Another unfortunate situation we experienced dealt with cleanliness. The room service a guest across the hall ordered was not removed for over 24 hours. I literally had to call down to guest services and ask them to pick it up because the ranch dressing had spilled everywhere. It was disgusting. 

Needless to say, we enjoyed our room and pool at the Flamingo, but will never stay there again because of the terrible customer service.

So . . . this hotel was totally fine. Not spectacular, but perfectly adequate for our 3 day stay. I booked a cheap hotels.com room for our trip. When we got there, they immediately wanted to upgrade us to one of their "Go Rooms". Apparently their "Go Rooms" are a little bit more modern with flat screens with nicer bed linens, etc. I declined, as we were on a budget for this weekend getaway. After I declined the offered to bump us up to a handicap "Go Room" for just slightly more than what we were paying. Being the pushover that I am, I decided to go for it. After all, it was my first time in Vegas. The room had an amazing view of the Bellagio water fountains, plus we had the cool flat screen and nice bed linens.

The location of the hotel was nice in relation to the other big casinos on the strip. The Flamingo pool and casino itself weren't that great (a little trashy, actually). I found myself spending most of my time at the Bellagio, Paris and Ceasar's Palace.

By the third day of our trip, I was completely over Vegas in general and just wanted to hang out in our room and watch tv, but something happened to out tv and it wasn't working all that well.

Overall, my stay here was fine. The location was good, but unless I get a really great deal, I might find another hotel to stay at.

Where do I begin! 
1. We were not told pool was under construction. At 75+ degree weather, why wouldn't it be open. 
2. Check in line way to long!
3. Resort fee of $36 a night compared to stated $29 online. Fishy.
4. We were charged a deposit of $100 at check in. We were again not told about this when reservation was made.(No deal we had that covered).
5. Gave us a 2 queen bed view away from the strip. Which we were reserved for.
6. There was a hole on lower bottom, inside of bathroom door.  (Management had the nerve to ask me if hole was there before we checked in or after. Someone forgot to check & I have videos
7. The WORST on our second night, we had little roaches coming out of bathroom sink. I know I should of reported it but we got back at 2am from a club. Beware: room 10142
8. The next day, which is check out day. I got ready in the bathroom and while blow drying my hair. Another roach popped out from behind wall mirror. The heat in bathroom made them crawl out. I quickly got my stuff together and checked out! 
9. At check out management tried to comp me a day's resort fee. Said its because of weather change, what caused the bugs to crawl out? She a knowledged that they have bug problems.   
I'm like excuse me!! We slepted in that room for 2 night's & only comped one night. No way Jose. I asked management for a free room voucher. Answered No!
Then i said well comp me for the two nights. To no wait they agreed.

Conclusion: I would of not reviewed them low if it wasn't for the little critters visiting the same room as us!
Also, the pictures online do not match what you get. Furniture is old, at least update the handles & headboards which will make furniture look nicer. And of the bathroom. Old style, one sink, off white toilet. Tub was gross. I guess you pay for what you get. We are not returning to that hotel again. I mean trying to be an upscale motel...
Not working people....

Even though this place is ol' skool, this is what the casino's in vegas used to look like before the bellagio, venetian, wynn, etc... raised the bar on luxury and spendings..  Just have the good ol feel to it!
The room was clean it first appearance after I move the bed a few inches to plug my phone in the grime and debris under the bed was absolutely disgusting I couldn't believe the filth.

This is the worst hotel on the strip. The rooms are dirty, the decor hasn't been updated since the 1990s. The whole hotel smells like ass. The only redeeming aspect of the hotel is the outdoor pool. But even that is sub-par with the rest of the strip. So you'd think that the room rates would be significantly cheaper. But you'd be wrong. At $180 for a weekend daily rate in May is not a deal. Pay a bit more and get a significantly better, more up to date experience.

Centrally  located and moderately priced for The Strip. 

This time we paid for a high roller view, which was spectacular. The one negative to this is that the building is "wrapped" in a Donny and Marie advertisement, so if you stand close to the window and look out, it appears to be just a bunch of dots. You have to stand back to see the view. 

Our room was clean and bright. Be aware that many of these rooms have a sliding glass door to the bathroom, which doesn't make the bathroom particularly private.

Room was disgusting even for the smoking section. Found a half smoked cigar behind a chair. Carpet in the hall was dirty and lifted so it almost tripped you as you walked. Friends room had a Roach in it, even the upgraded room the gave him was crappy. Seventh time in Vegas, fifth hotel I stayed at, will not stay there again.

Grrrosssss.....sorry only way to describe this place! Did anyone else have the worst shower??? No water pressure and just disfunctional. It was like pulling teeth to get an extra towel. I'm glad...

 A. I only was there for one night
B. There was a burger joint downstairs that served $2 burgers after midnight (YES!)
C. I did not leave with cooties

This hotel is a waste of money. There was a flood in our bathroom and when the hotel moved us, they DOWNGRADED us!!!!!! It was not a major weekend and the hotel was NOT booked to capacity! The manager was unproffessional, had a ghetto attitude from the beginning of our conversation and she disrespectful when we left the hotel.  I think her name was Anya and there was no higher manager at the hotel on the weekend, they only work during the week. She was HORRIBLE. Not to mention, the staff all smelled of cigarettes and they had so customer service, let alone, hospitality. 

dont downgrade because the price is right, the headache is not worth it.

I haven't stayed here, so I can't comment on the rooms, but I can definitely recommend the Sunday morning champagne brunch (I think they have it on Saturday as well).    $18 for all the champagne you can drink, as well as breakfast entrees, lunch entrees, an omelet station, a carving station with excellent roast beef, a crepe station, and a wide assortment of desserts.   The ambiance is really nice too, especially for a cheaper place.   We sat in a sunny room looking out on a wildlife preserve with flamingos and fake rivers.   Very enjoyable brunch experience.  Be prepared to wait in line for 20-30 minutes to get in, though.

We always stay at Harrah's (or I guess Caesars Entertainment now) properties due to the great prices and no resort fees, although I guess that will be changing now...

Anyway, we love Paris, but since this was our 3rd trip to Vegas in 5 months, we tried to keep a tight budget, and since we were staying on the most expensive nights (Fri-Sun) we chose to check out Flamingo.  

We arrived at about 10:30pm on a Friday night, so check in was a little busy. I had requested a standard room, nonsmoking with a king bed, but when we arrived they said that all was available was 2 queens. Now, I am not ok with this, especially since I vacation to Vegas usually for romantic getaways with my honey. I sleepy on a queen bed at home, it is nothing special. In Vegas, I want a king. The hostess was finally able to get us a king in a wheelchair accessible room on the 6th floor. 

The real problem is was when we went to bed (1 am ish). We stay in Vegas a lot and are aware that hotels are not silent, but you could seriously hear everything. You know the noise that iPhones make when you plug them in to charge? It is not a very loud noise, and we could hear it clearly from the next room over. We could also hear every word of EVERY conversation. After waking up to "oh my god I forgot my toothbrush" and "you are 27? You are so much older than me!" at 6am one morning, I decided to complain. We were then moved to the 14th floor without much trouble, and upon exiting the elevator it was obvious that the 14th floor was in much better shape. The noise level was much better, and the walls were obviously thicker.

The rooms are a fairly decent size and there is plenty of rooms for bags\/dressing\/doing makeup\/etc. I myself am a fan of the fun pink décor. 
I would not recommend the flamingo for a romantic weekend getaway. Try Paris or even the Rio for that. I would recommend it for a friends or family trip, as it is definitely a budget hotel. Not a bad experience, but not the same as some of the great Vegas experiences I have had in the past.

LOCATION IS EXCELLET THOUGH!

The Flamingo is banging! I came to VEGAS in 2009 == TWICE. The first time i stayed in the FLAMINGO and its definitely the hotel to be at on the strip! IT's live in here all day.
