I paid extra for one of my 3 rooms to be upgraded to strip view for my nieces first Vegas visit. The problem is the view is obstructed by the Donny & Marie sign that covers the building. You can't even take a clean picture! Why pay extra for an obstructed view???
The man who was assisting with those in line was rude yelling to people that they had to pay $30 more to check in before 3. 
The pool is great but security people are rude as well. 
The pizza place is convenient and really good. 
All in all not a positive experience. I like the hotels location but won't go back.

For the price, it was an okay hotel. Everyone here is very nice. The hotel room was an average room. But to be honest, I've stayed in Hamptons and Marriotts that had a lot nicer and cleaner rooms than this place. It also took 45 minutes to check in. Two people were checking people in and the line was so long. Finally more people came after a half hour. 

The bathroom was gross. Not very clean. I definitely didn't want to touch the shower curtain. The tub was rusty and the faucet and shower head leaked the whole time. The sink had rust and chips all over it, too. 

The beds and pillows are hard, you will wake up with a sore back. Our one lamp was out and the other had rips all through the shade. 

The elevators are old and a lot of the buttons don't even light up. I didn't trust them! The carpet is also super outdated. 

I know they have renovated rooms but why not do ALL of them?! I know this is an old hotel but come on! If you can upgrade half of your rooms, why not do them all? 

The pool was nice. But it sucks that you can't bring your own drinks. Of course they want you to spend an exorbitant amount of money on their drinks. I suppose that's at every hotel, though.  

When booking the room, it said my view was the High Roller Strip view, so I paid extra. Yeah, there was no Strip in my view. Just the high roller, and parking lots. Also, I don't like that you have to check in at 4pm and check out at 11am or get charged. Next time I come to Vegas, I will definitely stay at a different hotel. I suppose you get what you pay for.

Well, let's start with the good. Location. The Flamingo is dead set in the middle of the strip and the rates were super cheap. 2 stars, 1 for each good point.

The rest... the casino's ventilation system is in need of a major overhaul. The cigarette smoke saturated the casino to the point where I could not keep my eyes open. The walk to the room via the elevators was gross. The elevators were dated, worn and the floor lights did not work. The carpets were dirty and the ice maker on our floor was broken. It's an older casino, so not a big deal.

The rooms were what was expected for the price we paid and I was going to give the Flamingo 3 stars, but...

On the way out of the room, we saw a bed bug. This is my first experience with a bed bug and who knew they were so fast! We stepped on it and looked it up to confirm. Yep, bed bug. We saw none in our room, but we thought we would still let the front desk know. The woman behind the front desk responded with a synopsis of what a bed bug was and its traits. Thanks, Wiki, but maybe you needed to be more concerned with this guest's experience. She then proceeded to tell me they were nocturnal and implied I was making it up by stating the time of day. The hallways are always dark, you boob, and bed bugs don't wear watches. I wasn't looking for a comp, just someone to acknowledge and do something about the guests if it became an issue.

This lack of customer service dropped my rating from a 3 to a 2 star.

Not very nice... I've been in nicer Motel 6's.

Arrived to the hotel at 12:30, the line to check-in took about an hour and half. The room (Fab Deluxe, double queen) was dirty, and the water pressure in the shower was not great. Saw cockroaches crawling up the walls in the hallways and the elevator was sticky and buttons were missing. My key deactivated several times and I was unable to get in the room The Flamingo really smells like cigarettes, more so than other hotel\/casinos I visited. NO WIFI: costs 20 dollars per night.

Pros: great location, right in the middle of the strip. The flamingo habitat is beautiful and the GO pool looked amazing although I didn't go. Exits to the Linq, a great mini strip with retail stores and restaurants. Tip: go to the starbucks right outside for free wifi. 

Went to Vegas for a conference so the room was paid for, but I understand that the Flamingo is one of the less expensive Vegas hotels. You get what you pay for, I guess. If you're going to Vegas for fun and won't be spending too much time in the room, it's just OK.

A friend and I decided spur of the moment to head to Las Vegas and stay at the Flamingo this go round. When we got the LV we headed straight to Flamingo and the check-in counter. It took us maybe 15 or 20 minutes too get throught the line but it didn't seem so long since there was a lot around us to distract us. When  we got too the counter all went smoothly until the lady who was helping us told us they had too put a hold on our credit card of something like 100-150 per night. I was shocked but we put the CC down and then left for our room. 

When we got too our room we were very dissappointed. We got a very plain room that had not been updated in some time. I called the front desk and asked if we could get a different room and they not only gave us a different room but also upgraded us to a GO ROOM. Now when you get off the elevator to your floor the first thing you notice is that everything is bright pink and it takes some getting used too but its okay. Now when we got to our GO ROOM we were very impressed. Again very pink but so nice. The room was great and very comfortable. We really liked the TV in the mirror in the bathroom but best of all we loved the beds. These beds in the GO ROOMS are too die for. Hands down the most comfortable beds in all of Vegas. It was very hard to even get out of bed each day because we were so comfy.

We didnt spend much time in the casino but we did go look at the pool and it looked very nice. We also ate once at a cafe I cant remember the name of but it was right next to Flamingo Habitat. As I remember it it was okay, not great but okay.

Besides the 150 per night we had a nice stay at the Flamingo. I will stay here again know doubt....especaially if im just looking for some R&R in them fab beds.

We loved staying at the Flamingo, except the fact that my brother woke up in a pool of mouse pellet. Damn the rooms are swank and the service exceptional. Rodents ruined it for us, but what can we expect, the building  is one of the first casino's built in Las Vegas.

Location is good. We were upgraded to a suite bc they ran out of regular rooms before our arrival. Only problem was it was one bed and a couch. We had 4 adults. They brought a roll away bed after we called. The suite is well worth the upgrade if an option. Got a peek at a few other rooms and they weren't nearly as nice as the suite. Only complaint is the room smelled of smoke. It was so bad we had to remove the covers. 
One note, person who reserves the room must show ID to check in even if the other adults are listed. It took us a few tries to get enough keys, etc for all 4 adults on the reservation. 
This is only a 3 because of the suite otherwise for the price I'd select a 2 for a regular room. 
Be sure to get the Total Rewards card BEFORE you arrive. This can save hours on check in. No joke the line was insane when we left in the morning. Total Rewards has an express check in line.

This was my first time in Vegas and I wanted to stay on the strip for a fairly decent price. The Flamingo did not disappoint. 

Our room had an awesome view of the strip. We were on the 24th floor and we were able to see some of the outside shows from out room. The beds we're comfortable and the sheets were clean. My only complaint is that the beds seemed a little small. We asked for 2 queen sized beds and they felt like full-sized ones. The bathroom was clean and we always got good room service. We would leave for a while and when we'd get back our beds would be made. Fresh towels and empty garbage cans.  Overall the rooms were great.

The service from the employees was good. They were all very helpful and gave us good directions and helped us get our moneys worth. The valet always had a taxi and\/or limo available for us, (we were a group of 8). While in the casino, the attendants would bring us drinks and were very attentive. We ate at one of the buffets for breakfast and the food was all very good. It was a little limited in the variety but the quality was satisfactory. 

I had heard many horror stories about Vegas hotels but I am happy to say that my first experience there was a good one. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people and I'd stay here again.

After having heard great things about the Flamingo and also having fun at Margaritaville I thought that it would be fun to stay at the Flamingo. Thank goodness we only stayed one night. The room was dirty with trash under the bed,black stains on the sheets,several burn marks all over the carpets and the bathroom...oh my goodness. The ceiling had some weird panel that was rusty ,a hole that looked like it used to house a camera and a disgusting vent that was covered in dirt. Why are all of these thing in the shower? I am glad we only stayed 1 night. Apparently if you do not spring the extra $$ for one of their "GO" rooms you will be guaranteed a stay in a old,dirty,seemingly forgotten about room. I am a huge fan of Vegas and know there are much better options than the Flamingo for similar cost.

This place is by far the worst place I have ever stayed. The service has got to be the worst I have ever experienced. The front desk will make u wait in line for about an hour due to lazy receptionist.The valet is the worst I have ever experienced. For a paying customer I will Never Stay here again. The only reason I gave this place one star is for people trying to find a place to stay I read this and NOT stay here. By the way the upgraded rooms are as big as a closet. Word to the wise, DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Was in Vegas a couple of days ago and had some relaxation time at Bugsy's Bar inside of the Flamingo Casino.  The drinks were comped of course and the entertainment there was lovely. I will definantely be there again soon. Thanks for the beers and my winnings Flamingo!
Checked in at 6:00 pm, opened door to unclean room!  No rush to send up housekeeping!  They gave a 30$ food\/beverage credit that NO ONE WOULD HONOR!  Will never go back.

My boyfriend and I booked a room at the flamingo for the 4th of July weekend. Listen, the pictures are deceiving. I was expecting so much more. For starters, when we checked into the room I immediately noticed that the bed had no blankets (just a fitted sheet and 2 pillows). The bathroom was dingy and the shower floor was slippery (maybe from not being cleaned correctly). The bathroom sink was also clogged resulting in the water to back up. I also found hair in the sink..ewww! I called the front desk and the lady said that they will send someone up right away. About 20 mins later, someone arrived with blankets. However, NO ONE EVER SHOWED UP TO FIX THE SINK!!!!! The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that the staff was nice and courteous. Would I ever stay here again? NO!

Get a "GO ROOM" or don't stay here.  Great location on the strip.  If you book a Go Room, try to get one with the view.  If you happen to stay here in a normal room, you will be greatly disappointed.  The bathroom is a downgrade from a Travel Lodge.  I had no water pressure in the shower and the shower curtain appeared to be from the 99 Cent Store.  I had multiple cig burn holes in the sheets and blankets.  The carpet was filthy and the stopper in the cink was broken.

Long line to check in at 4pm but they have a self service Kiosk, made check in much faster, I was done in about 5 minutes and the other line had hardly moved, and there was a friendly helped at the self service Kiosk helping anyone with problems, he directed us to the elevators to use and pointed us in the right direction. Elevators looked pretty worn but they got us to the 27th floor ok. Go down the hall looking for our room and see the maids cart, yes you guessed it room is not ready yet.....Ahhhhh..... So we push her cart out of the way so we can drop or stuff in the room and get some dinner, maid is nowhere to be seen..."Hello, we are just going to drop our luggage off", no answer, I try again, this time she answers, she was cleaning the bathroom , about this time we start looking around the room and figure out that it's a bit larger than your average hotel room. Heck, this room was almost as big as my whole house, yes my house, your could fit 4 normal rooms inside this one suite, 1 Bedroom with a king size bed and room to spare, 2 bathrooms one with a two person tub, a wet bar, and a living room, with a view of Caesar's Palace and the Strip, the living room alone was almost 1100 sq feet, add another 600 sq feet for the bedroom, bathrooms and bar and you have a sweet room.
Wife wanted to know what I paid for the room, $54.00 + tax, I guess it was just the luck of the draw and no one wanting to pony up the money for the room so they filled it with a lucky winner from the self service Kiosk line or who knows how, all that matters it that it was mine for a night, kind of sad that I didn't book it for the week. But then I would have gotten a small room.....
So -1 Star for the room not being ready when we check in, -1 for the old elevators, -5 for the people trying to sell timeshares in the Casino and + 10 for a killer room at a killer price.
But in all seriousness, the hotel is older and the elevators are showing their age but for the most part it was a very nice stay and the room was way above our expectations for the price we paid, yes the room was showing its age but nothing out of the ordinary and the staff was great so There is no way I can give the Flamingo anything less than 5 stars for this stay.

Awful!!!! We were in one of the top floors directly next to the stairway outside. The rooms were loud you could hear music all night long from the strip. But the worst part was someone pulled the fire alarm At 1:30 am when we were sleeping and completely freaked us out!!! We didn't know what to do! What was going on!! So scary. They didn't even come on the intercom for like ten minutes to tell us what the heck happened. And the alarm stayed on for over ten minutes. 
It was terrible. They didn't offer us anything to make us feel comfortable either. So I just didn't sleep that night. I Hate Vegas!

I wish I could rate lower then one star. My room was beyond disgusting. The mirror and window had finger prints and face marks everywhere. There was dust on everything, poop stain in the toilet, reeked of smoke and was honestly the grossed room I've ever been to. The bathrooms are hideous. When I complained and asked for a refund they tried to keep my security deposit. Which was bullshit! Don't stay here it is a horrible time. Nice pool however. Stay at the Hard Rock it is so affordable and clean!
Don't use the Flamingo valet... just now noticed new shoes missing from my car. So unfortunate...gotta love thieves!

I am starting this review of the Flamingo with an apology to MGM Resorts International:

I  am sorry I cheated on you with The Flamingo! I let their cheap rates sway me from your wonderful hospitality! 

With that said...on to the review!

I stayed at The Flamingo over Christmas and have never been so disappointed with  a stay in Las Vegas. It started at Check In and never got better. I gave the clerk my Credit Card and she said it was declined. I knew there was a problem because I always check my balances before trips and this card was at Zero. I gave her my Debit Card instead and proceeded to check in. I think one of the reasons we had trouble was that the clerk was extremely reluctant to talk to me. She kept talking to my girlfriend even though the room was in my name and I was paying for the room. It was so obvious that Diane actually walked away at one point.  When we got upstairs I called my Credit Card and was told that the first charge was accepted, but when they received 3 more requests in 2 minutes they declined all the charges. So back down to the front desk to straighten things out, which we eventually did with a different Staff Member.

The next day we tried  to go to the parking structure but the elevator was out of order. When we tried to find out what we should do, no one who worked there would or could help us. One front desk employee actually suggested I take the escalator! Totally wrong advice to give someone who uses a wheelchair. What if someone followed that crazy advice and got hurt? Eventually, I did get an answer, but not from a Flamingo employee. A salesperson from the Jewelry Shop near the elevator showed me a path through the wildlife habitat that led to the valet parking area where my girlfriend could just pick me up. I have no idea why the hotel staff wouldn't know about this option.

The next night things went from bad to worse. We got back to our room at 12:30 am. Not late by Vegas time at all. We turned on the TV and were talking about our day when someone started banging on our door. My Girlfriend went to see who it was. They said it was security and that we had to open the door because they had a noise complaint.  We told them it couldn't be us because we just got there. They were insistent, but we continued to say no because we knew we had done nothing wrong. Eventually, they left threatening us with, "You better keep it down or we will be back." We did verify that they were Hotel Security through the peephole, so we knew it wasn't just some punks trying to pull something. I have traveled quite extensively and stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas alone and never heard of simple noise complaint being handled like this. A simple phone call would've been enough.

The next morning, we went to talk with the hotel manager with our laundry list of concerns. She apologized and gave us $30 Food and Beverage Credit for our trouble. The weirdest thing was when she told us that Security probably went to the wrong room and that it happens a lot. Really? What if something really bad was going on at the room they were supposed to be at?

If I could split up my review I would give The Casino area 4 Stars because The Staff is always nice and accommodating. I am also quite lucky there including this trip ;) ! Zero Stars for the hotel + 4 Stars  for the Casino = 2 Star Average.  I used to say that I stay where I can get the best deal and play where I want. The Flamingo has convinced me to change that philosophy. I don't think the best deal in the world could convince me to stay there again!

Franchement rapport qualité\/prix\/emplacement top ! Et la pool party est top
Demander une chambre en étage élevé avec vue sur la piscine

Bueno estuvimos del25 al 28 de junio, que puedo decir nos toco el piso 27 y la verdad  la habitación estuvo confortable , la moza de limpieza dejaba brillando la habitación eso nos gustó mucho , el único problema fue mi vecino que se emborrachaba y todos los días a las  2 am se traía a su esposa y unas amigas a platicar cómo si fueran los únicos en el hotel pero por lo demás todo ok , el buffet sigue cerrado los domingos y no recomiendo el buffet del harrash el flavors pues la comida es limitadísima . No agarres pisos altos se siente ligeramente la música de la disco.

My room was a joke...I slipped the front desk lady a 20, asked if she had any upgrades she could do, and she said we were in a "nicer" room, blah, blah...our room was old, the couch had white stains on it, if you get my drift, the smell of smoke pours into our room every time the a.c. turned on, the shower pressure was a dribble at best, our WiFi, which is supposed to be included in our ridiculously expensive resort fee, didn't work at all. I called down to inquire about the internet, was out on hold and transferred several times...we went to use the pool Saturday and we were told we had to pay an extra 20, even though, this was also supposed to be included in our resort fee, the second day there, I went to the front desk to talk to someone, I was told that I could pack up my stuff and move, but that they "couldn't" refund my resort fees for the whole time, only partially. I paid nearly 450 for 3 nights and got a motel 6 quality.

Also, now that I'm back, I'm sick, oddly enough, only 3 out of our group of 9 got sick...and guess what, we all slept in this terrible room...probably from the ventilation and smoke that came into our room all night long!

Flamingo must have done some major upgrading in the last couple of years, because I loved every minute of my stay!  It wasn't nearly as tacky as I remembered it - in fact, my hotel room was pretty serene.

I spent the majority of one day lounging outside at the 21+ pool, drinking 32-oz daiquiris ($18) and listening to great music.  This pool is small-ish, and will charge $10-15 for guys (girls get in free!), but it's awesome.  There are cabanas, daybeds, and couches for rent as well, if you're willing to cough up the dough.  I also took advantage of the sports bars in the lobby to watch a World Cup match and drink a few beers.  I had brunch at the buffet place downstairs, and it was pretty decent for $10.  I also love the location - right across from Caesar's, next to Bally's, and pretty much in the middle of everything.  

Definitely not the trendiest or swankiest or hotels (go to the Aria for that)...but it gets the job done.

The rooms are horrible and need to be updated!
Our room had a hole in bedsheet, paint peeling off the walls and bathroom door!, the chair inside the room was absolutely filthy!! No coffee maker or a frig!! Not even a lousy bottle of water! Pipes rattle at night making noises! Its just a deal for the rooms, Hotel is just dirty and would never stay here again!!

This place sucks. We spend a boat load only to get BED BUGS. To top it off, they failed to provide timely cleaning services through out our stay.  Also, during our stay (early May), the power went out one day every thirty minutes or so, prompting us to avoid the elevators for fear we would get stuck.  They promised a part refund - three months ago.  

Their claims adjuster denied our claim, stating that they could not find bed bugs! However, when Flamingo reps came to our room to inspect, they stated that bed bugs were common in travelling and that "clearly" our bodies exhibited signs of bed bugs. How convenient.

We will NEVER again visit the Flamingo or any of its affiliated hotels.
DON'T bother staying there... horrible service.

This budget hotel is located in a traditional building in the heart of downtown Las Vegas. This budget hotel is renovated and has provided us with comfortable accommodation and spacious rooms. Rooms are modernly equipped with high ceilings. On the reception offered the room with the kitchen. It was nice. Our room had a beautiful view of the city of neon fun that the guns through the windows. We enjoyed the fun and relaxation. On the internet, we booked this hotel on the for next year, because its budget hotel.

DO NOT BOTHER - THE WORST SERVICE ANYONE COULD IMAGINE!!!
We had to stay at this hotel for a convention.  The worst part, is that there are actually kind yet professional individuals who work here...just not at the front desk or in management!

I called to confirm ALL of our [9] rooms and check-in times two days prior to our stay.  However, it rained the night we checked in, so the manager was slammed with guests complaining because their ceilings were leaking.

Although we checked in with no one in line at 1245 am, we had to wait almost 45 minutes for our rooms because they said they had none.  Then, they "gifted" me an upgraded room and told me that I could move to my originally booked room the next day in the afternoon.  My work colleague was told to check-out from his upgraded room at 10 am and then stow his belongings at the bell desk only to re-check-in at 4 pm.  I found this arrangement ridiculous and inconvenient especially since we got to our rooms at 130 am and had a meeting at 10 am that same day.  I was then told I had to do the same.

After waiting for a manager, we decided to head to our rooms.  The front desk could not call to send my luggage up from the bell desk.  The hotel's LAME policy is to call from your hotel room which I get had it not been after midnight.  

I waited a LONG time and finally called back to see what happened to my luggage...turns out, someone forgot to relay the message.  I received my bags almost an hour later!  At this point, I was boiling.  I would finally get to bath and go to sleep at 330 am...almost 3 hours after checking in and NOT by choice.  

Of course, I called the manager who was hoping that I would enjoy checking out at 9 am so I could be on time for my 10 am meeting.  This was not happening.  [I had boxes for our convention.]  She then allowed me to stay in the upgraded room which you would think would be a perk.  It really didn't counter the fact that the hotel service is poor.

The lobby elevator bank was always busy because it seemed that only half of the elevators worked.  It was so bad that the staff told guests to use other hotel elevators because it was faster.  The elevators near my room - the Spa Elevators - was markedly better, but got busier as more guests "caught on" to the fact the the main elevators sucked.

If you want to see where all of the miserable, seemingly enslaved personnel works, then hang out at the front desk.  We had a lot of interaction with them, and with great authority, I can say, that NOT ONE PERSON SMILED.  NOT ONE!

You know who the personable, friendly people are?   The housekeepers and people who work in banquets.  Those employees were happy to help with requests.  They all did what they could and would apologize if they couldn't.  Sadly, they are probably the most under-paid and unappreciated of the hotel staff.

So, back to my new line of thinking.  I now prefer smaller hotels - like the Westin - because you don't have to deal with miserable front desk personnel and managers or long waits for something simple like an elevator.  STAY AWAY FROM THE FLAMINGO, it's NOT WORTHWHILE!

Stayed here on comps recently, and enjoyed my stay immensely.

Ok, everything that people are complaining about is probably true.  But...  don't pay Flamingo prices and expect Wynn or Bellagio facilities and amenities.  

If you're a seasoned Vegas traveler you will know that the only thing that matters most if you're not looking to drop a fortune on luxury is exactly what the Flamingo offers:  great location and clean acceptable rooms.  Who cares if it looks dated.  Are you going to spend your entire time in the room?  Why are you even in Vegas?!  

Your view sucked?  Walk outside.  It'll look the same.

It smelled like smoke?  You're a moron.  Welcome to Vegas.

The bed in the Deluxe room does suck (unless you're a hard mattress sleeper, in which case, you'll be satisfied.)  But as long as I can continue to crash here for free while having easy access to the entire strip and the monorail in my backyard..  I'll be back time after time.

The hotel and rooms were nice. Definitely not one of the nicest hotels in Vegas, but for the cheaper price that we booked it was worth it. The elevators suck. You'll spend 5 minutes waiting for the elevator every time you ride it. And every elevator will be crammed. Anyways, a decent hotel, but a great location.

One of the best over all Hotel experiences on The Las Vegas Strip. First of all very family friendly experience Flamingo Habitat to see various birds, turtles, Waterfalls and of course Flamingo, it's also a mere 2 min walk if that to the Linq promenade, and the high roller, both family friendly experience. The Flamingo pool has water slides for all ages and the pools are truly grand. There's also a party pool for the 21+ crowd. The gardens are open both day time and night as the water falls and koi ponds, plus easy access to the Monorail will take you almost anywhere you want to be on the strip. Location is prime as well as it surrounded brief walking distance from Caesars Palace, The Ballagio, The Venetian, Paris, Planet Hollywood,The Mirage, Harrahs, The Cromwell, The Linq, and Ballys. Plus if you're in town for a convention you can avoid the hassle, the cost and the traffic as the Monorail drops you off at its door step, I believe the monorail is $5 or $12 all day. Over the Room itself is beautiful very spacious and very high tech, it's pink hue in the restroom add that extra flare of Vegas delight. If you have trouble sleeping you have to try these beds so comfortable and majestic you'll feel like you're sleeping on air. Plus a tv in the restroom excellent for football season, I will return here again and again.

Gross!
So, I labored over picking the right hotel for my three day mini vacation to sin city. My top requirements were a clean room, a pool with slides, and a hotel located on the strip. All of my searches for the best pools in Vegas came up with Mandalay Bay and Flamingo. The Flamingo is a classic and it boasted newly remodeled rooms and was significantly cheaper than Mandalay Bay.
As my title says, this room was gross! The first night I went to pull the sheets down, and I am not lying here, there was a used band aid in the BED!!! I called guest services and they sent a maid up immediately and changed all of the bedding and cleaned the room thoroughly. I should have upgraded or checked out right then. Because it only goes downhill from there...
The bed was hard as a rock. There was mildew in the bathroom. The TV was tiny and was so dim, it was unwatchable. The wallpaper was tearing. The furniture was scratched up. The sink fixtures were rusting. The ventilation ducts were filthy! Where in the heck was the Re-model? The carpet and Flamingo picture on the wall? Seriously? This "remodel" looks worse than Motel 6's remodel down the street that I stayed at last year because there were no other rooms available in the city.
If that wasn't bad enough, I find out that same evening that The Flamingo charged me $239 for the room. The problem is that I already prepaid for the entire vacation a month ago. I went to the front desk and asked why I was double charged and was told "that just happens sometimes." Really? Well, that's a huge problem! That should never happen. Since I used a debit card, it took two days for that money to go back to my account. Sadly, for the Flamingo, I could have been gambling with that money in their casino, but I avoided their casino after that on purpose.
I also was pretty disappointed that I had to walk so far for the shuttle drop off from the airport due to their construction. Where are the bellboys? I toted luggage so far from the lobby that it was ridiculous!
The first two days the weather was bad. It was cold and drizzling. So, I understand that the pool was closed. However, on the third day of my stay, it had warmed up nicely. The main adult pool was open and going strong with gambling poolside and alcohol sales in full swing. Unfortunately, the water slide area was not open. Why not? It was hot enough and there were tons of people.
I just lived with it all, since I was out of the room most of the time and I was to check out the next day. I did stop by the front desk and informed a Supervisor of all of these issues, and he apologized emphatically. He offered to credit me back two days worth of "resort fees." This is a pittance. I very politely asked for the hotel manager's card and forwarded this to her as well. I am certain that the Caesar's company can do much better than two days of resort fees compensation.
As of this review, the Hotel Manager has credited me back with the third day of resort fees and offered a free upgrade from a standard room to a "Go" room on my next visit. This is the difference between a regular (crappy) room to a fully renovated room. I do appreciate her efforts in what she has done, however, I think it is not above Caesar's Corporation to comp three days of a future visit IN FULL, in one of the fully renovated rooms or at another property of theirs.

Service was terrible, took 4 phone calls and a trip to the front desk to get towels. 2 out of 12 elevators were working. 0 out of 12 were working on the last day. Took stairs into a construction site with all our bags. Parking lot was full. Don't stay here.

I stayed here labor day weekend last year. Great price. I got a beautiful modern renovated room overlooking the park, black and pink themed. Only downside was that they had us in a non smoking room on a pet floor because the others were full. Great old school casino and modern mini mall. Knowing Frank Sinatra and the mob used to run this place gives it a special feel that no other casinos have. Plus it's in the middle of the strip.
And it's very cheap compared to the other strip hotels aswell. I don't know why so many bad reviews. You get what you pay for. If you wanted 500$ a night new hotel treatment with new rooms that don't smell like smoke you should have stayed at the Wynn or something, dumbass. This building has 60 years of Vegas history. The staff are very busy at all times and do what they can. The check in desk is always packed so you can't blame them. All in all everything was what I expected it to be, even better. It really made my first adult trip to Vegas wonderful and memorable. Bartenders are especially great.
I'd stay here again someday but I really want to explore some more parts of Vegas first.

Sure- it's not as classy as say Bellagio, the Wynn, or even Paris. However, it's nicer than say Imperial Palace and at a comprable price. It's in a great location, right next to my fave casino Bills. 
    It has clean rooms, an adult only pool, and a perfectly cheesy casino, what more could you want??

I just came back from Vegas the other day and my 2 night stay at the Flamingo was okay. The interior where you check in was beautiful, if only the whole hotel was renovated like that too. The gambling area looks outdated. I stayed in a mini suite on the 25th floor and the carpet in the hallway definitely needs to be replaced. The carpet is old, dirty and loose. My room was okay, there was enough space for everything. In the bathroom there is no air ventilation so you might want to bring some air refreshers in cases of #2. Also, every time I turned on the sink it would smell like sewer. Towels were not very clean. I had one towel with a big black spot on it. House keeping needs to keep an eye out for dirty towels and sheets. Wifi access is 2 devices per room. Cable was not great, there's not many choices to choose from. Parking sucks. Guest parking is on floor 3-7 so come early before they run out. Took me 30 minutes to find parking on a Saturday night around 5:30pm.

Actually this review is for the buffet. Hidden jewel to us. We did the Rio buffet (pretty good), hit Harrahs that was good but Flamingo for lunch had no line and the food was on point. July 4th and no crowd? Nice

I am rating based on casino customer service.  We did not stay at the hotel.  Sharon the gaming supervisor was a real delight to interact with, she answered questions without rushing me or hesitation.  A true delight.  Debbie serving dunks in the slot area was fast and friendly.  
Jamal and Clifford at the bugsy's bar were top notch.  They made our experience fun and we didn't want to leave!   Thanks for great service! 
Flamingo is one of our favorites to play and today did not disappoint.

Saturday night at the Flamingo a man broke into our room and robbed us. It happened to other guests on our floor too.  It was by far the scariest thing to walk into our room and have my young daughter see a strange scary man in our room. Shortly after we realized everything was gone; purse, all cash, wallet, phones, laptops, watch, IDs.. everything. The security staff was amazing as was the bell and cleaning staff but the manager and desk staff could have cared less.  Also noted security and bell staff are not employees of the Flamingo so maybe the Flamingo staff could learn something from their customer service ways.  We had no cash to even buy gas to get home and she was not willing to credit us anything other than a resort fee. Perhaps getting our deposit fee back in cash would have helped but she was not willing to budge on anything.  Worse yet the gal behind the desk stared at us rudely like we were just a bunch of whiners. Honestly? We just had one of the most frightening experiences to date and we get that kind of response? We also learned that some of their doors are faulty and don't close all the way although they appear to and make a loud click... if you push hard enough - some will open and ours was one of them.  Maintenance came in the morning to fix the problem door after we were up all night with security, other victims, and the police.  A bit late?  I have since read the Flamingo is one of the highest crime hotels due to their lack of cameras in the halls and stairways. The manager could have made things better even though the experience was bad enough at that point. Shame on this manager and shame on your lack of video security.  Please do not stay at this hotel.  I plan to post reviews everywhere I can and perhaps legal advice is a good idea at this point.. I'm quite sure filing an insurance claim with them is going to be another serious headache.

Here is my opinion

This place sucks. Been standing in line for over an hour just to check in. My flight from LA was shorter than that...

Do yourself a favor, go somewhere nice.

In the past I have only written reviews to compliment businesses that have done a great job, never to criticize, but I really felt obligated to warn others after our experience. There are much, much better deals in Vegas.  The rooms were dirty and smelled awful the minute we got there; there was actually moldy food left in the drawer of one of  the nightstands.  They  then "forgot" to clean our rooms 2 of the 4 nights we were there.  We were somehow checked in under the wrong name and told we had to stand in line (an hour) to correct it; we were then overcharged for internet and told we had to stand in line again to correct it.  When we called and asked for towels (because they hadn't made up our rooms) it took almost two hours to get them.  The walls were so thin I could hear everything in the next room, including the 24 hour construction going on.  I could go on, but I see many of the other reviews already covered many of the disappointments we also experienced.  We chose the Flamingo for the location and the price, but we were completely disappointed and absolutely didn't get our money's worth.  We will choose another hotel for our next Vegas trip, but its very sad, the Flamingo has the potential and the history to be an icon in Vegas.  They clearly don't care to be though.

For all its faults Flamingo is a fantastic hotel. You couldn't ask to be in a better location on the strip, directy across from Cesaer's at the center of the city, the Flamingo is Las Vegas. Sure it is not as modern or as flashy as some of the newer hotels, but you can't beat the price. Valentine's weekend I paid $75 a night and they upgraded us to an executive suite, the room was very modern too except for the bathroom. The view was breathtaking (see photos), alone well worth the money.

Why am I giving the Flamingo four stars?

Let's establish one thing first - this is not one of the nicer hotels on the strip.  It can't compete with the likes of Wynn, Bellagio, Paris, etc..  It's not luxurious, and it's not trendy.  

HOWEVER if you're looking for a decent hotel with a clean, safe room in a great location, Flamingo fits the bill.  Change your expectations and you'll enjoy it.  Your room will not have a flat screen TV or a big soaking tub.  Now, I did notice that it seemed a little dingier than when I'd stayed here several years ago.  Maybe they're sinking a lot of money into their "Go Rooms" which from the web site, remind me of rooms at some of the W Hotels I've stayed at.  As a bonus, the nice front desk clerk gave us two upgraded rooms instead of the one regular room we though we were getting.  Nice!  I recommend the Flamingo if you're going with a group and don't plan to spend lots of time in your room.

I'm working an event here today booked by my company.  The whole hotel and staff has been extremely accommodating and welcoming from the moment we pulled up in Valet.  The banquets managers met us in our ballroom, introduced themselves and offered any assistance we may need to ensure a successful meeting. I am overly grateful for their help and professionalism throughout the entire property.  Will definitely keep this place as stop on my Vegas routes in the future!!

I stayed here while traveling through Vegas and it is a very nice hotel. The rooms are cheap just watch out of the "hotel tax" that for me ended up being over half the price of the room. Other then the tax it was a very enjoyable stay and the hotel and room was very clean.

I will say I had my doubts but then our taxi drove up & I saw the location on The Strip & I saw our room for myself (not just online pics) & I was hooked!  I had originally wanted to book a room at the Luxor (see my review on them) & boy am I glad I didn't.  We stayed in the "GO" rooms.  Some say they are tacky but they are actually modeled for that chic quirky throw-back look & I loved it.  Doesn't hurt that there's an inlay TV in the bathroom mirror with a Bose speaker in the bathroom ceiling either.  And the location right on The Strip right across from Caesar's Palace ... OMG!  So much fun.  ... ... ... All the tremendous benefits with the low low price means ultra high value.  I don't know how they do it but I hope they keep it up.  I will be back :-)

I'm so disappointed!!!! I came with a person that was visiting USA and wanted to stay in one of the older casinos, but I was very disappointed. The bathroom were moldy and dirty, fan  not working. Bathroom was so small that each time I trod to close the door I would hit myself. TV had bad reception, and was very small. The room was very basic. Didn't even have alarm clock!!! Only telephone and envelope for tip for housekeeping!!! The whole 4th floor smelled like poop including our rooms!!!! I'm glad I only booked one night!!! And when I went to bell desk to rent a motorized wheelchair- lady asked me: "like the one for old people?" My reply was "yes like old people, can I have one of those?" It made me feel very bad since I'm only 27 and I hurt my back long ago and can't walk much at all - she had no right to implement that motorized wheelchairs were  made for old people only !!!! This made my trip very bad:(

Location is about the only perk. I'm not one to normally write bad reviews. First off the sound of the club from the hotel on the south side of the hotel is so loud in room good luck sleeping. BOOM. BOOM. all night long. It is ridiculously loud. I would never stay on thks side again. My first impression the elevators in the parking garage are REALLY ghetto. Stinky, broken buttons and missing buttons. Needs updated. 
Check in lines are Crazy!!!! Most all the time. Like Wal-Mart 30 check stands 2 cashiers. My quick express check in was alla go until I got there put my I'D in and said go to front desk  my husband sites up for the credit card only to skip the line. The restrooms in the casino and lobby YUCK. Super tiny stalls and just very outdated. 
So 26 floor smoking room. Yuck. Not impressed. Nothing in the room was impressing, nothing caught my attention to say wow! Felt like a motel 6 to be honest. The view was the only other good part. Honestly disappointed but I did save $60 and an upgraded room, by shopping around a few days prior. If this was the upgraded room. I'd never want to see the other rooms. Lots of bars in casino. Multiple 24 hour places to eat. Which so ridiculous expensive. $18.90 for sandwich chips and soda. But like everything people pay it so they charge it. Pool is closed in November. Loved the flamingo area. Ugh back to the horrible boom boom next door. I would be glad to change rooms. Bunch of crap. I can't sleep. I should give it one star.

If you are on a budget stay here. The only good thing about this place is the location. If you have to stay try to stay as high as you can or pick a room away from the strip. It can get really loud. Also get a renovated room
What a dump.  (Compared to all other hotel \/ casinos).  Don't let the pics fool you.  The old 70's casino tables and the mold in the bathrooms was enough for me.  Time for an extreme makeover..

Have been staying at The Flamingo every October for 13 years. The people there have always treated us very well. The property is dated and a bit worn, but is undergoing a slow, but steady renovation. Biggest disappointment was that after 13 years, we no longer got a free room upgrade as we have the past several years........I would think that someone who has been staying there regularly for over a decade would have been treated a bit better in regard to room upgrade. Seems like someone in a "suit" decided to cut corners and save a few bucks at the expense of a regular customer. So, yes, I am already starting to research other places to stay for our annual October trip.

stayed in the newly renovated tower and the rooms were much better than expected.  the room size was a little cramped but the flat screen tv and the tv in the bathroom mirror made it better.  :)

however, the 4 star review is due to the view from our room which was absolutely AMAZING.  we looked right into the strip and we were able to watch the bellagio fountain show from the comfort of our room.  loved it.

also, the cafe at the hotel was a good lowkey breakfast place with reasonable prices which was much needed after spending too much $$ elsewhere in the city.  :)

I don't even know where to begin. Had a HORRIBLE experience here. Two of my friends and I stayed here late Friday night to Sunday morning. On Saturday (our only real day there) we tried to go enjoy the pool here. They had a bouncer at the pool, and we waited about 30 minutes in line to get up there. When my friend went up, the bouncer looked at his ID and said nope, you're not getting in. We asked why and he said "the shade of blue in the background of your picture looks different than hers." (We are from Arizona) We told him it was a real ID and asked who we needed to go see to prove it was real. Long story short we went through a million different managers and security employees. One took one look and said "Nope I'm from Arizona and this is fake, end of story. You are not getting in." Finally we ended up in the basement of the hotel talking to the top of security (Russ Roak) where he took the ID for about 15 minutes and finally came out and said Yes you are right, the ID is real. But you still can not go to the pool because of everything that happened. We asked what exactly "happened" besides us trying to figure out who we needed to talk to so we could go enjoy the pool that we paid the resort fees for when we checked in. He said he didn't know but nothing was going to be done and we could not go plain and simple. He even said to us "sorry my guys aren't experts on reading ID's" what??? you work on the Las Vegas strip and your job is a bouncer?? Thats your job!!!!!! At the end of the day they were not professional AT ALL and when we left and told him clearly they were not going to be able to solve this problem so we would contact his manager and he then said "and that is exactly why you aren't getting into the pool!!"

Have never experienced such poor customer service.

I love the Flamingo!  For our August 2016 trip we didn't stay here but I really wish we would have.  The last two times I stayed here, before this most recent trip I was able to use my comps and get us into an awesome Go Room Suite and then a Fab Room with a strip view.  It was so amazing to look out and see the Bellagio fountain going day or night!  From the electronic window treatments, to the TV in the bathroom mirror, and extremely comfortable beds, I loved all of the modern touches and addition to details they've done.   

Not only are the updates to the room fantastic, the casino is a great size allowing you to be able to find enough different table games and slot machines.  I was upset to see that they got rid of our favorite cafe where we could eat and play Keno, but those are gone from all the casinos so it's just something I have to except now.

So when passing thru (it's in a great location on the strip) or staying here, be sure to go out back to see the real flamingos, and tons of cool fish in the ponds.

This hotel was ridiculously awesome when I stayed for EDC last year. The best room to get is the deluxe GO room. Fortunately, our room had a clear view of the Belagio water show so that was awesome to watch when we were ending our fun filled nights. 
As for the room I couldn't have asked for a more dope set-up. 2 massive beds with a full on Bose sound system that had an Ipod deck. That alone made our room the party room for all our friends. Best of all we didn't get any noise complaints! It was also pretty sweet that we had a tv built in the bathroom mirror. Dopest most affordable hotel in the middle of the strip where things get poppin!
I give it a 3.5. Great location, friendly staff, cheap, and much better than the others in its class. Will go back .

The hallways were gross (don't go barefoot) and the room was soooo far from the elevator, but other than that we were very happy. Comfy and clean room. Very well worth the $40 a night to be in the middle of the strip. The POOL is the best part, no kids allowed! They'll even bring you a disposable ash tray pool-side ;)

I have had some really good experiences here, and some very poor ones.  

Some of the rooms have been awesome, and some needed some serious maintenance.

I will give this place props for working hard to make it right if your bring a problem to their attention, but it seems I have had to call for maintenance issues almost every time we have been here.

Most of the times I have been here it was with others who picked the place, or honestly I would not have been here so often.

Up to you if you want to risk it.  Worth it if you have a deal.

The worst experience I have ever had in Vegas. I've stayed at plenty of hotels on the strip, NY NY, Excalibur, Treasure Island, Planet Hollywood, etc. just to name a few. First, the room given was not the room that I booked, when I called the front desk I was told that it was not their problem and that I need to call Groupon since it was book through them. I called to have the room aired out or cleaned as there was an odor in the room, no one ever showed up. On day two I went to the pool and ordered $91 worth of food and drinks. Upon checkout it was revealed that the Flamingo charged both my room and my debit card, when I mentioned it to them they said they will remove it from my bill and credit my debit card back the money, to date they haven't done so. The deal breaker for me was when I went to go eat on my way to the pool at the breakfast buffet after being ignored for about ten minutes a manager finally approached me and said I could not eat there because I had on a bathing suit top. I went up stairs to my room and called the front desk and asked to speak to the manager. I was transferred to a ''manager" names Frankie who refused to explain or fix the situation. I asked him to meet me downstairs, he refused. I asked for a refund on my final night and to check out early, he refused and then he explained to me he didn't have to do anything to accommodate my stay as I booked through Groupon and not Flamingo hotel directly and as I was responding he hung up the phone on me. When I called back and asked to speak with Frankie I asked him "did you just hang up the phone on me?" and he replied "Yes, I have better things to do than to talk with you." I WOULD NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN. I would suggest you all to look elsewhere before considering this hotel. Frankie is bad for business. B

Terrible. All around. 

The room was disgusting. There was a 5" long pubic hair on the ceiling. I know it's Vegas, so I'm not that surprised or impressed that someone managed to get a pube on the ceiling, but it was disgusting. There was also mold and cracks on bathroom walls. So gross. 

They gouge you for more money every chance they get. Want to have WiFi and a gym? $28 a night. I can get those basic amenities at a Holiday MoF'ing Inn. 

The staff was completely incompetent. I don't even want to get into it. I'll get grouchy.

By far this is the worst hotel I ever stayed in. Save your money and book somewhere else!!! 

We checked in to celebrate my sister's anniversary. The lady that checked us in barely smiled. My sister & I had separate rooms bit we booked the same type which is the Go room, for some reason she ended up with a fab room which is the cheapest kind they have. The room had no air conditioner working, smelled really bad and felt like it was not sanitary. She called twice for them to fix the AC and went to the front desk to fix the issue and all they did was move her to another "fab" room saying that they were over booked. That took them over 6 hours!!!

The issue is that even the manager all he did was tell her that he will waive the resort fee. We wanted a decent room that she can enjoy while she is celebrating!! 

Look for another place if you are looking for a pleasant stay. Yes they are in the middle of the strip & they know it, so they do not care about customer service.

This is the dirtiest hotel and their customer service is terrible. They almost want you to not be there so they don't have to so any work. They checked us into a room that was previously occupied had an unflushed toilet with lots of stuff in it and tv on and scuffed sheets. Then the moved us to a room that did not have proper shower drainage. We did not get any blankets and when we asked for some we were told they ran out...ummm how does a hotel run out of blankets?! They gave us extra sheets to make it through the night and come to find they were dirty sheets! Don't so this place unless you want to get disappointed.

My only complaint of Flamingo is the early pool closing and lack of family pool on weekdays.

All the food was amazing I especially like breakfast at the TROPICAL BREEZE cafe..My french toast was so delicious.  Their pancakes, I heard, were especially off the hook and good!

Loved the friendly staff, all the shops, the extra large rooms, the cleaning ladies were all super, super sweet, and the location was perfect!!!!!  Wish I had spent more time exploring the hotel and it's amenities but I PROMISE to return.  That's how great my stay at Flamingo was!!!

Do not stay here! Customer service & hotel sucks! I wanted early check in and paid $30 for it.  Room was not ready at 11 as promised, I was put on a list & I was told I would receive a phone call when the room I originally paid for was ready.... 6 pm comes along and I got no phone call! I was stuck in a basic room, which was NOT what I paid for!  only to go back to check-in to see what was going on with my room to find out they had just given it away to someone else! Anyway, they messed up my room two diffident times in one day! How is that possible?? Staff was unapologetic & careless.

for the price of the regular room here at Flamingo, I think I could get better staying elsewhere. the room was old and honestly for the price of the GO room which looks really nice from the pics, I think I would stay at a better hotel. the Flamingo casino is not at all impressive and the room doesn't even make up for it. the one thing I was a little annoyed about was the fact they didn't have a room service menu in the room. I don't know if the maid forgot to put it in there but I had to call the front desk for it. I just got back to my room after a long day and it was late to go out to find something to eat, I would appreciate the fact that there was a menu available to me in my room. the menu made it up to my room 40mins later, which I woke up to from a knock on my door. how annoying? I ended up just going to sleep. I won't come back, regardless how affordable and conveniently located this place might be. for Vegas, it is not worth it in my opinion.

Although the rooms were decent, something about this hotel makes me cringe. Maybe it was the nasty buffet in the building, or maybe it's the hideous pink walls they have everywhere, or maybe it's even the older clientele--I don't know, I just won't come back here. They definitely need to revamp this place and make the casino nicer...it was definitely one of the less nice ones on the strip. The location is great, though (right in the middle of the strip).

I debated between three and four stars for the hotel but I just can't quite bring myself to give them the full four stars. Let's call it 3.5 stars instead.

My boyfriend and I booked a room at the Flamingo for a weekend in Vegas. Our friends were staying down the street at the Paris but the Flamingo ended up being $50-$60 a night cheaper so we went with it. When you're in Vegas, you don't spend much more time in your room than to sleep and shower anyway and location is the most important element. The Flamingo has an awesome central location on the Strip and most of the major casinos (Bellagio, Paris, Caesar's, Mirage, T.I., Planet Hollywood, etc.) are a fifteen minute or less walk away. 

Check-in was quick and easy on a Friday night around 8 p.m. There's even a shorter line for Total Rewards members, which is a free player's card that is good at several of the hotels\/casinos on the Strip. Although both lines were short at check-in, it's nice to know that this option exists.

The biggest headache was trying to find a parking spot. We drove around the labyrinth of parking garage several times before we happened to see a car backing up. It was amazing how few parking spots they have available for hotel guests. It seemed like most of the garage was reserved for valet or another hotel. 

As for the room itself, we got a standard room with one king size bed. You can tell that the rooms have been upgraded and they look nice with the new fake hardwood floors (always a plus compared to carpet in a hotel room). The pink throw on the bed might look funny in another hotel but it fits the flamingo theme and my boyfriend even commented that they skinned a flamingo for us. :)

But if you look closely, you can see that not everything has been upgraded. The doors looked cheap and some of the walls could use a bit of touching up. The countertop of the bathroom looked nice but the cabinetry looked incredibly dated and the bathtub\/shower combo is definitely not new. Everything seemed clean though.

We had trouble with the TV remote and not all the buttons seemed to work. I could only scroll through the channels in one direction, for instance. Speaking of the channels, there really could be a better selection. There was nothing interesting to watch. I need my HGTV!

One other complaint, the walls seem to be very thin and I woke up on Saturday morning to a very loud conversation in Spanish happening in the hallway. Considering the length of the convo, I'd assume it was the maids gossiping and not fellow travelers passing down the hall. 

All in all, I'd consider staying here again for the right price. But I've had nicer rooms on the Strip in the past.

This hotel was ok. It was good value for being in Vegas especially located in the middle of the strip.  The room was not too good.  The beds didn't even come with comforters and at the end of the bed was a rug like thing that was pink.  The bathroom was alright the shower had a little rust in it and there was a soap under the sink and the maids never picked it up while I was there which was disgusting.  The casino part of the hotel was pretty good when you have a low budget where table games start at 5 dollars and blackjack is 10.  You will get some good benefits if you have a platinum total rewards card or higher which can jump the buffet line or get discounts off of the hotel store. Overall this hotel is below average. I probably won't be staying here next time.
I stayed here a while back during a Karate tournament. Pretty nice hotel, but if you look younger than 21 cops start yelling. I highly recommend the pizza place next to the pool area.

This is my second time staying at the Flamingo this year and I enjoyed myself more back in April.  The check in process was great but that is thanks to my soon to disappear platinum status which allows me to check in via the VIP room which never has a line and they are more likely to upgrade you to a better room.  Anyway, still some problems with the elevators, nothing too bad but once or twice I got on the "tower of terror" one that stops on ever floor and closed on my arm which kind of hurt.  The room was decent and clean and was ready for us earlier than the check in time which is always great.  The most disappointing part of my time there was the experience we had at the pool.  When I stayed at the Flamingo for my first time back in 2007 I was 12 and the pool was great, really big with waterfalls and smaller water slides, they had a 21 and over pool that was in a smaller more secluded part of the complex.  The situation now is reversed, they have the larger pool as the 21 and over pool and the smaller one is now the family pool.  The family pool is kind of small given the fact that people with families are more likely to actually be swimming vs. groping each other which was all that was going on in the main pool.  The main pool's music is far too loud, it would be one thing if it was actually good music but instead it is just new rap music that people in their late 30's can pretend to like in an effort to feel younger, but that's another story.  There are far too many people there as well, they should limit the pool to guests of the hotel only.  It's a real shame because Las Vegas is now designated as the biggest party spot and anyone else can just get with the program or get lost.  To really shove it in the face of people staying here, they close the pool at 6pm.  hmmm I wonder why? maybe because they only care about making money off of cabanas and outrageously priced drinks and they know that the crowd that actually falls for that hits the clubs around that time, but what about the families or older couples that want to go for a quiet swim after dinner? It's the Flamingo's condoning of this "screw you to anyone not interested in partying" attitude that I am only giving them 2 stars.  BTW I am 21 years old and was probably the only person at that pool actually in the age group those people were pretending they were in.  That music though, it's so loud I can still hear it, I would have loved to have hooked my iPod up to it and started playing some classic rock. PS. if you smoke a cigarette in a pool you are a fool.

Just returned from a company sponsored trip to Vegas and stayed in the Flamingo for 3 nights.  We were set up in the "Go" rooms, which have pink lights in the bathroom and a t.v. within the mirror (pretty rad!).  The bed was extremely comfortable and I enjoyed the sliding drapes option - was probably hungover two mornings so it came in handy.

The room-service is 24 hours, which is a plus if you're hammered and starving.  The prices were pretty steep but that's to be expected.

We rented a cabana by the family pool which was PACKED.  It happened to be during Memorial Day weekend so I wasn't shocked.  I didn't take part in the festivities being from FL (we have pools in our backyards) and the crowds.   However, some of my coworkers stayed all day and loved it - to each his\/her own.

It has a great location (right on the strip) so no complaints in that department.

The only thing I will say is that some of the bartenders downstairs in the casino were extremely rude and nasty.  I had never been in a casino and was asking some questions about the drinks offered while playing at the bar.  Apparently, you should ask you shouldn't just KNOW.  When I started being rude back to her one of the casino managers stood beside me, which I can only assume is an act of intimidation.  It worked (I'm a tiny girl).

I'm a little depressed that I left without buying something from the Sin City Brewing Co. gift shop (I'm a beer snob), but perhaps maybe next time.

If I could give zero stars...worst place ever. 2 hour check in. Valet lost my car and now my key doesn't work and it's back to waiting in line. NEVER AGAIN. Trust me, spend the extra $50 and get treated right somewhere else. Unbelievable!!8

It's sad to have to post and place a negative review on a hotel that is so iconic for Vegas as the flamingo Hotel. As a family that has diamond level players in the Caesars entertainment system we hoped for some sort of improved service however the front desk staff didn't seem to care, probably because they are always understaffed, and the reception process is far from efficient or well thought out for 2016.  I'm sure it was fine in 1979.  Really, a 45 minute wait at midnight, to get a malfunctioning keycard replaced? Even when I approached and asked politely for a reprint since they didn't key it right in the first place and it didn't work? They had 8 people on shift and only 3 windows were active in helping customers. Even so, the place was sold out, and since we booked a double queens room, they gave us a king, which sucked, because we had the groom for tomorrow's wedding crashing in our room, because his bride to be was having a party thrown at home.. So we figured he would hang with us on bachelor night.  Tried to change, told sold out, couldn't buy another room, and had to force him into a roller bed.  Really? 6.7, 240lbs, on a roll bed on his night before his wedding.  They didn't fix it even when informed by my wife.

The majority of rooms are outdated, with the furnishing your expect at a roadside motel, like paper thin towels, paper thin walls, doors that slam and thinner toilet paper. Carpets need cleansing, and the price is around 80-$120 all in, on a Thursday . 

Without being too specific, I'd say that at least 3 dealers, and a blackjack pit boss were rude, short, and unfriendly.  I guess people are just not happy to work here, and it definitely shows that they have lost the couture of servicing the customer with a smile, and politeness.  With a little attitude change from management to thier down line, I'm sure a warmer couture could be fostered...   Location is awesome, and since they have a great location by the Link and Brooklyn bowl, they feel they can get away with crappy service and quality.  I bet if they upgraded attitude and rooms, they could charge twice the price at least, and be envied instead of avoided.  Flamingo is most often the last hotel you pick.. Because no others are available...  So grin and bear it, and hope to avoid it next time. Luckily.. No bugs.

EWWWWW! disgusting hotel! was planning to stay for this weekend with family members. Changed my mind as soon as I tried to valet parking. Very rude valet attendant, refused to valet because I was NOT a diamond member WTF!  self-parking garage was full, I had to park on the street behind the hotel, very scary place, had to walk on heels for a block or so, very painful. The minute I entered the hotel, it was under construction with old wood boards, elevators were dirty and smelly. I used the elevators to go meet my family members and OMG it took like 1\/2 hour for elevator to open, most of the elevators were broken. The hallway smelled like weed and carpet old, wrinkled, black dirty and smelly. The room was old, outdated and dirty carpet. Had to take the elevatoragain to get down to the lobby, ewwwww, someone had puked! I GOT OUT OF THE NASTY PLACE as fast as I could. DO NOT stay in this hotel. I drove 15 minutes outside the strip and stayed at Hilton Lake Las Vegas, what a change!

I went for the WAKA national kickball championships.  I have never been hosed as bad as this in my entire life.  First off the person I talked to on the telephone while making reservations made me promises he could not, apparently keep.  

He gave me a quote on a total rate and then I paid the entire stay up front on my credit card.  He sent an email confirmation I did not read and three weeks later I arrived at the hotel.

the clerk told me I had only paid for the first night.  I started to get worried, and then they dropped the bomb, I was supposed to pay DOUBLE THE RATE AGREED TO!! after talking to the "Guest Services Manager" Joaquin Osorio expressing my belief a different rate had been agreed to he told me if I would wait and hour he could listen to the tape.  I asked he do so.  (He also lied and said their was no one else I could talk to even though there was clearly other people available).

50 minutes later he returned and told me he hadn't listened to the tape but the department told him they had sent an email confirmation so tough tamale.  I then decided him calling me a liar, his dishonesty about listening to the tape, his first attempt to deny I had made the date the rate locked in and so on that I would rather stay at another hotel.

He told me that if I did so I would forfeit, the "deposit" I had put on my credit card.  That was what I had been told was for my entire stay.  So now I had to pay DOUBLE the rate or lose ALL my money already paid.  

I had a friend who came the same weekend and paid HALF of what I paid three weeks in advance.  I asked the clerk if I could just transfer the rate I was charged at to the rate THAT WAS CURRENTLY BEING OFFERED FOR THE SAME ROOMS AT THAT EXACT MOMENT ONLINE.  I was told no.  

Joaquin told me that I had no choice and that I would sacrifice the deposit and try to find a new hotel elsewhere the Friday of Columbus day weekend at 7:30 pm.  RANSOM.  the whole thing took 2.5 hours just to get ripped off.


***Also I was told over the phone the rooms had two beds in a bedroom and a couch and living area like at another much better Vegas hotel.  That was a lie.  I got the classic tiny beds and a tiny chair.  Also it took 45 minutes for me to get a plug for the drain in my bathroom.  I have had better service at the crack hotels in Sacramento.  Seriously.

*****CHECK THE FILTERED REVIEWS!!! THEY ARE ALL 1 STAR!!!

By far the worst hotel in Vegas, do NOT stay here my credit card is being charged for money that was charged by external web @expedia" the hotel will not reply to email or are interested in resolving the situation Via email.  


Stay AWAY from this place do your self a favor.  

It also has a sicking smell to it.

Very disappointed. Customer poor; unclean rooms. Called down to request humidifier 6 times before someone took action. Need a better process in place for requests. No checks and balances or quality assurance if you are in the queue.  Our room had drink stains on the desk and night stand and dirty floors. Wear socks! Gross. Room service cart still out the next night from morning service. Night stand light didn't work, so took bulb out so they would replace and never happened. Hmmm. The only good thing was check in by kiosk. Fast and prints your keys. I used to pick this hotel but will choose another next time. Bummer. Always loved this property.

This is my first night here... 

Room is not as bad as i thought it would be. The service is slow but gets done. 

I was gambling at the blackjack tables and the dealers were nice. 

This is the only con i encountered but needs to be addressed. 

I ordered Johnnie walker black and the lady brought me something else.  I asked it to be changed nicely and was brought back the same exact drink and she said she said she saw the tender pour the correct drink.

Now... im not a fool and i have been drinking the same drink for 5+ years.  I was thoroughly dissapointed when i asked the drink to be changed and was brought back the same exact one i was given,  the one i gave back to her. This is one of the lowest customer service experiences ive encountered for a while.  Shame on you flamingo employee for having such lousy service.

Yes, the Flamingo is in a great location.  However, the rooms, especially the furniture are OLD.  It really needs remodeling.  People were friendly.  However, the restaurants are poor.  We ate next door at the Paris twice during our stay and only ate breakfast (coffee and muffin) at the Flamingo.  No, I wouldn't stay there again.  When, I'm on vacation, I'd rather have a cleaner and nicer hotel.

I've been going to the flamingo for two decades and i think it's time to find a new place to stay! Maybe old downtown. There is no more customer service. To see works chatting with Co  workers while the lines  are growing... No American Cafe in the hotel... Denny's was packed LOL Tired of the casinos charging for everything. The resort fees were the beginning of the end. Charging for parking and late check-outs now? Amazing! I'm sure they're going to start charging for drinks any day now!

Very disappointed, we stayed on the 14th floor at a Deluxe room, and our room was not very clean.  The restroom didn't work and it overflow twice!!! Definitely will never stay here again.  For the price we paid I expected better!!!

This was my 3rd visit to Las Vegas, staying at different hotels each time. This stay happened to be the best. Not only due to the better hotel I picked but the reason I went.

First, the resort fee, which was not an option for us, wound up to be fine with me since it covered the fitness facility. Had we not had that charge, it would have been a $10 for each visit (x2 people). Now, sure, many people are not in Vegas to work out. However, we did. And not a bad facility either, considering it is located in a hotel. The spa... excellent. Every hotel seems to have these fees, so I guess- whatever.

Air conditioning\/heating was a bunch of bogus. Thermostat read 65, permanently. It was far from that. It was too warm in the rooms and we could not change the temp. We were in Vegas for a marathon and it would have been great to be cooled down. We bought a fan but that didn't seem to help either. 

Not much of a gambler, but it I was it would not have been my kind of place. 
Old. Stinky. Did I mention old?

We ate at the buffet with the 24 hour buffet pass they have. We also ate at 2 other buffets. The Flamingo was at the bottom. Selection was just ok but there wasn't enough of the items included. Things were gone in seconds it seemed. 

I could have totally done without the fat slob with the plate of bacon, standing behind me chowing it like a flippin cow, while I waited for my eggs. Seriously, there will be more, slow the hell down before you have a coronary.
Oh, but that wasn't the hotels fault, I know. I just wish I had an eject button for that pig.

We ate at Margaritaville and Carlos and Charlies. Both were good. Margaritaville had an awesome band that played 80's and early 90's. Service was a little nicer at Carlos and Charlies, but that seemed more of a restaurant and not just a bar anyway. C&C gave a discount for runners in the marathon, small one, but still an effort. Great guacamole! (for $12) 
The steakhouse looked great, but we didn't eat there.

Check in and out was fast and nearly painless. We arrived at a good time and there was only one couple in front of us, otherwise no line.
Tip for anyone- get the Total Rewards card, not that the service you get is extreme or anything, but you do get points and discounts that help a bit. It's free.

We upgraded to a strip view for a small fee ($15\/night), worth it though. Loved watching out the window, Caesar's is a great view!

To sum up, great location. They have beds to sleep in, a shower to clean yourself, and a toilet. If you get the basic room, expect the basics. If you want it all, get the best room they have, or go somewhere else.

What a surprise. When my company told me we were staying at the flamingo, I had to check that it hadn't been demolished-I wasn't expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. It was a manageable size, room was well decorated good bed - down pillows. Casino was friendly aproachable and wasn't the circus you find in the big hotels. This is my new favorite and I will be back. Great job.

This is my first time in Vegas and i LOVE it! Been staying here since Thursday, august 18. I enjoy staying at The Flamingo hotel on the 28th floor. The pool is very nice and there is a beach club for 21 and up. Time to soak in the sun and listen to some music. I had a good time in the casino and i definitely enjoyed the many restaurant options. My only issue is that the elevators have broken down that lead to my room. There are only 2 elevators that work now and neither have air conditioner in them. Since the second day we've been here we have had to walk to far for and elevator and again because we then need to walk all the way around to our room. Other than that I LOVED MY VISIT!

Stayed Thursday through Sunday.   Was glad to get one of the remodeled rooms (laminate floor), but dated bathroom.   Room was clean when arrived and housekeeping service was good.   AC was noisy.  General areas (hallways) of this hotel are very dated, but all-in-all we were pretty satisfied with the stay given the cost\/value and especially location.  Would stay here again.   I was concerned about it given some of the more recent reviews but we had a good stay.

This hotel is pretty worn out.

Parking was hard to find - and even the entrance to the hotel, really, because of the renovation. Check-in was quite slow and not very friendly or helpful. The service was kinda bad and the maid didn't even clean our room, so we had to go and ask for extra towels ourselves.

The breakfast is a $6 dollar certificate to the cafe - problem is, there's nothing you can get there for $6 that includes both something to eat AND a coffee, which means that you have to spend extra in order to get breakfast. Besides, the place wasn't really that nice, so more or less seemed like a sales trick to get you to buy something in their cafe.

Only plus is a nice location right on the Strip. 

Good if you're on a tight budget and are not planning to stay much in your room.

Vegas!!! That's right, Vegas is Vegas. 

Now for the Flamingo itself. I admit that I am most definitely overrating this place because of the great experience I had here the weekend of Sept. 20th. (Second time in Vegas this year. Previous stay was in August at the Platinum). But hey, at the end of the day the experience is what counts the most right ? 

So I came with my gf for her birthday. We stayed in a "deluxe" room which had little to offer other than a bed and bathroom. It was small but since it was just the two of us it was alright for us. We really enjoyed the pool. It was basically a big party that had a great crowd with good vibes. I forget what it's called, I think it's called the Habitat but either way it's the area you walk through to get to the pool when you're coming from inside the hotel\/casino is really nice. They had flamingos (of course) and other animals. This place made for a really romantic pizza dinner I had there with my gf. We walked a bit and sat at one of the benches with drinks in hand. Really romantic right!?? Lol
