Again the rating is a bit more than I would otherwise give if it wasn't for that romantic pizza dinner I would say 3 stars! Haha but anyway it was definitely a great location on the strip with lots to offer. 

It's Vegas! It's up to you to make the trip great not so much the location. So cheers my friends! Have a great time!

Great price and location but overall a dump compared with other properties.  Our "deluxe" room had filthy carpet, chipped furniture, stained bathroom fixtures, and an old TV with a broken control panel.  

The hall carpeting was worn and repaired with duct tape; trash such as pizza boxes were allowed to sit in the hall for up to 24 hours before being removed by housekeeping.  

The pool was great, but I wasn't a fan of the crowd it attracted and how they were allowed to behave and dress inside the common areas (I thought shirts and shoes were a general requirement in most places).  

My advice is to go to the Flamingo if you want a college pool party atmosphere and a room you can't really damage much further, but look elsewhere if you have children with you or want a more adult experience.

My friend and I spent last weekend in Vegas, at the Flamingo.  Our "upgraded" room wasn't nearly as nice as I expected...yes, it looked like the picture, but the materials used were cheaper than they appeared, and the furniture was scuffed.  

The bed was too stiff, and so were we when we got up each morning.  Pillows were also too hard and stuffed.  

Parking was also difficult when we left on Saturday for a few hours and had to drive around the parking structure several times to find a spot.  Even Valet parking was full.

I did NOT appreciate having my cell phone's internet BLOCKED while inside the hotel, either.  They probably do that so they can get you to pay for Wi-Fi.  Other casinos didn't block my access while I was inside gambling, but I had to go outside or off property to look up directions or get to Facebook.  No bueno!

It wasn't a bad experience, but I think we could have done better for the price.

We stayed here over President's Day Weekend and it wasn't too bad.  I'm not a girl that neeeeds to stay at a 5-star hotel..yet..so I can pretty much stay anywhere as long as it's clean and creepy people aren't lurking around the corners.  We checked in pretty late because of traffic and all that was left on the floor all of our friends were staying at were the two-beds-in-a-room, which kinda sucked, but the view of our room totally made up for it.  

I give it 3 stars only because our bathtub leaked and our door sign was kind of ghetto (written in sharpie marker...).  Plus it's just a 3-star kind of place, not like the Bellagio or anything.  But you get what you pay for, and for the Flamingo, we got a pretty good deal!

The staff are all pretty punctual and nice at the Flamingo, so if you ask for something they are good at getting you the answer, or extra towels..whatever.  I wanna say I'll come back here in the future, but hopefully I'll soon be a high roller with lots of money staying at some place like the Wynn instead!....ok fine, I'll probably be back.

The only place I stay in Vegas. Great prices. I don't need a fancy room since I only use it to sleep 3 hours. 

The pool is nice. I love the slide. I love the drinks. I love Vegas!

Well, I knew it was a cheap hotel before I arrived but work is trying to keep budgets low. 
I'll start by saying the staff is really nice. Big win for them. but...

It has zero class, fun... anything. It's not even like it's cheap but fun. It's just horrible. 
My colleagues and I did a group 'bed-bug-check' if that gives you any idea. On a positive note, we didn't find any but you shouldn't be so worried upon entering your hotel room that you feel the need to check. 

The wifi is slower than dial-up. I can't believe they charge a $20\/day fee for it. I don't think $20 is bad- I think waiting 10 min for a page to load is bad. It's more cost-effective to get an increase on your data plan for the month. 

The restaurant 'Center Cut' isn't so bad.  Not quite worth the money but the staff is nice. The only decent restaurant in the joint. I guess Margaritaville wasn't so bad either.     

Ok place to lay your head (they are on the bed bug registry so take a moment to check your mattress) but go elsewhere for...everything.

Hope that helps.

This is truly the worst experience I have ever had at any hotel, not just a LV hotel. First, my room key didn't work, so I had to trek back to registration which is about 1\/2 a mile away and they made me stand in the registration line again. That took about 35 minutes. Once I got to the front desk, the lady assisting me told me that this happens often and issued me new keys. Went back to my room and again, the room keys didn't work! So I then called the front desk to call security to come and bring new keys. I waited in front of my room for about 20 minutes, crying from frustration. Once security came up, they let me into my room. But wait, there's more! Upon walking into my room, it wasn't house cleaned! All of the bed covers were thrown on a chair in the corner of the room. I called guest services who said they could send house cleaning up but it would take about 45 minutes. Keep in mind that it was 2:40am and I had an early flight. I requested a new room and the guest services lady told me she could switch me rooms but not until 10\/11 am and there was nothing else she could do. She advised me that I would need to speak to the front desk manager and proceeded to transfer me. I waited on hold for 7 minutes only to be notified that the manager was busy dealing with other guests' issues and would call me back. I have yet to receive a call. Oh and wait there is still more! The bathroom had no towels, no shampoo or conditioner, open soap, no flamingo stickers on the toilet paper, and the drain cover was not on the drain. The inside of the door has masking tape around it. Will update review once I speak to someone. In the mean time, I'm being very careful not to touch anything or sit on anything. Basically my room is still under construction. UPDATE: spent 45 minutes downstairs waiting to speak to a manager. Teresa Bradford finally made it out to the front to help me out and was rude, condescending, obtuse, demeaning, and was of no help. I requested a different room and Teresa said there was nothing she could do because it was too late. She then called me a liar and said that I had told house keeping that I approved the room as being "satisfactory." I informed Teresa that this was untrue because we had just left the room when house keeping showed up. Teresa continued with her attitude and stated that she would have the house keeping manager meet me at the room to ensure that I was satisfied with the room. She also then demanded that when I upon arrival to the room, that I have the house keeping manager call her to ensure that the room was clean - basically to make sure that I wasn't lying about the room being cleaned. I checked in at 1 am and it is now 4 am and my room is still being cleaned. Claudia, the house keeping manager and Marcela, the house keeper were the only helpful people in the entire hotel.

I really want to give Flamingo 5 stars. This is my third stay here in three years. 

I've been patient and stayed through the renovations and mess in previous years. I've recommended the hotel to anyone I know who was coming to Vegas. 

The rooms are clean, casino is safe and friendly, room service is efficient, hotel staff are professional. The lobby is bright, clean and happy!

But the parking. OH GOD, THE PARKING. 

The self-parking carpark is multi-level but the first three levels are for valet only. Every time I try to park after 11pm, I have trouble finding a lot. The carpark is dark and narrow and full of blind spots. 

So I valet. 

But after 11pm, the valet service gets full and only accepts Total Rewards 7 star something or other members only. No luck even if you are a hotel guest. HOTEL GUEST!

Now I have to go into the full carpark and get into all kinds of trouble only to find that the carpark is still full. And have to park at an "over-flow" carpark much further away. 

So angry. 

So so angry.

The Flamingo isn't as shiny and pretty or as spacious as some of the newer casinos like the Cosmopolitan, but it provides good rooms for a moderate price. . My folks enjoy the slots there and the casino rewards them consistently with free rooms, with $15 a night upgrade to deluxe rooms. The new remodeled "Go" rooms are well-done - flat-screen TV's, fancy showers, nice beds. The views aren't that usually that great from the rooms I've been in, but that's a minor drawback in my opinion. 


All in all, I would recommend the Flamingo to anyone who can't afford the swankiest hotels, but still wants an enjoyable place to stay on the Strip (unlike crap like the Imperial Palace). And the buffet is pretty good!

Arrived at 11:30pm there was a very small line to check in and  4 people working the front desk, but contrary to some reviews we retrieved our keys from the kiosk and there were no issues.  Our room was on the 16th floor- FV. 

I was extremely relieved and pleased.  The room was updated, clean and very nice. I was pretty nervous after reading several reviews but there were zero cleanliness   issues.  The bathroom was very little and that was the  only room complaint.  Barely enough room for one person in the bathroom. 

Zero issues with the elevators to our floor. Easy to get an elevator and they were fast. 

So far from my experience this place has gotten a bad rap from the previous reviews.  But I guess everyones experience is different. 

There is a small food court in the lobby with 4 places to chose from including   a Johnny Rockets (serving breakfast all night until 6 am they close and re-open at 10 am). The LA Subs has tasty sandwiches.  Plenty of bars in the casino everywhere you turn.  Carlos n Charlie's is also inside, they have an outdoor patio too.  It's next to the sports & racing betting room. 

Hotel has a great location on the strip too. Easy walk to mirage, Paris Bally's and Venetian.  Monorail access is around the back.   

The pool was closed for the season but we walked it and could see it's a nice size with several  slides and plenty of open water to relax. 

They have a fitness center located inside the hotel spa (lobby level).   They have 7 treadmills 4 elliptical's  4 bikes. Exercise balls, mats, free weights, and plenty of  weight machines.  Access to the fitness center for 2 people per room is Included in the resort fee. They provide towels and water.  But if you want access to the Spa, shower and locker rooms it's an additional $10. They are Open from 7-6pm 


The habitat is beautiful. Definitely check this place out the flamingos are beautiful, look healthy and the grounds are very well maintained.  In addition to the flamingos There are awesome waterfalls, pelicans, ducks, huge koi fish and even a turtle.  It's free to view so go see it even if you don't stay here.   


There is  a station set up for massages.  2 masseuse are available to serve until midnight.  No appointment, first come first serve.  They have a menu for chair massages,  as little as five minutes for $10 up to 30 mins. Neck & shoulders, neck & back, feet  and several other options and price points. Took advantage of the neck shoulder and back massage. It was wonderful.  You are in the middle of a crowded hotel\/casino lobby but I was so relaxed it didn't matter.   


Check out was a breeze. We had an early flight (like 6 am early) so basically checked  out the night before.  Paid the bill and just left key cards in the room that next morning.   Zero wait for a taxi at 4:45 am  and the hotel valet workers were bright, alert, peppy and ready to help. 

Overall this is a Great casino and hotel. Excellent stay.

I am an Interior Designer and was excited to attend KBIS the big kitchen and bath show. So big special pricing offered for Flamingo. But on way from airport in cab I asked the driver about the Flamingo... He hesitated and told a story about two gals who stayed there and had him in stitches about a nasty sofa in the room that they actually had staff take away. Hmmmm
So this made me nervous. Upon checkin with all the cigarette smoke and noise I said I was concerned. They offered me an upgrade at plus $50 a night and I took it. 
But basically my room had a super nasty sofa that was super dirty. Very retro in a bad way. Clean sheets but bed was lopsided. Stayed but was reluctant to touch anything. 
Not reccomemded

今回の旅行で一番最悪なホテルでした。
まず、チェックイン時にチェックイン機を使って手続きをしていたのですが、カードが読み取れず何度もやり直しているのに、スタッフはじーっと横で見てるだけ、カードが通らないのだけど相談すると「反対なんじゃない？」と一言。嫌々、間違ってないし(念の為反対でもトライした)また何度もやり直し、これは絶対おかしいと思いもう一度確認「日本のは使えない」ってまた一言。何それ？！
結局無駄な時間を過ごしカウンターでのチェックインに、カウンターで自分達の順番になったと思ったら、スタッフが「今無理待って」と、パソコンみながら何やらイライラしながら作業し始め、結局数分待たされた挙句に別のスタッフに回され、やっとチェックイン

そのスタッフは丁寧でしたが、なんとも嫌な気持ちで部屋に向かうことに

部屋は、2部屋中の1部屋が煙草の臭いが凄く、頭が痛くなるレベル
部屋が古いことはわかっていましたが、うん、本当古い。勿論テレビ以外何もありません(わかってはいたけど)

もう、テンション下がりまくり、ここに2泊、間違った選択でした。

因みに、カウンター横の売店の水は高く、確か＄6位、それだけなら良いけど店員は横柄な態度で最悪。

良かったのは、立地‼
本当これだけです！
もう絶対に泊まりません。
こんなにスタッフの教育がなっていないホテルは初めて、ある意味良い勉強になりました。

My gf and I went tues-thurs and we had reserved a GO room, which I had heard good things about. When we got there there to check in there was a long line, luckily there are kiosks that you can use to check in. However when I went to check in the room wasnt the GO room I had originally reserved. This is where the Flamingo gets the 4 stars instead of just 3 they upgraded us to a neopolitan suite. Loved the location and there are no resort fees, O'sheas is next door (good deals on drinks)

Last leg of our 5 days trip to DIsneyland was ruined by the GREEDINESS of Flamingo Hotel .
I booked a room for March 25 , our 11 hr layover form Los Angeles to Vancouver  through booking.com . They send me through email a confirmation number , they charged my credit card , I even emailed them to inform that we will be checking in late because our flight from LA to LAS will arrived at midnight . When we got to the hotel the front desk said that we don't have any reservations. I showed them care confirmation email , and she said that it was just a confirmation from booking.con and not the hotel . Then I showed her my credit card mobile statement wherein flamingo already charged me as amount of CAD$170+ for a night  on February 27. The front desk asked me to talk with booking.com which I did , and booking.com said that the hotel is fully booked .
NO ROOM AVAILABLE  , after more than an hour of arguments and since we have kids with us and exhausted from a day from LA  we just decided to go back to the airport at 3am  so that kids will be able to sleep at least . 
And booking.com can't even booked us to other hotel . They want us to look for a room and the will reimburse the difference . 
At this hour with kids with us that's too much trouble for us . It's been a week now no refund yet and not even a compensation for the trouble and inconvenience they've caused us . Not another business with these companies. Wasted time and money .

The hotel was pretty subpar. 

The good: 
- Centrally located on the strip
- The flamingo habitat is neat and they offer daily feeding "shows" for free 
- Clean rooms
- Price, the Flamingo is one of the cheaper hotels on the strip, which is great if you're trying to save money

The bad:
- Rooms are dated and lack many amenities I would expect in a hotel (i.e. a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, etc.)
- Common areas are trashy. Ripped off floor number plaques, graffiti in the elevators, torn up walls etc. 
- Price, being one of the cheaper hotels on the strip tends to attract a certain crowd. Be prepared to deal with a ton of drunk college kids and rednecks. 
- Timeshare hawkers, these people are stationed right outside the elevator banks and bombard you with a sales pitch EVERYTIME you try to go to your room. 
- The buffet was mediocre at best. Chefs were rude and a lot of the "warm" food was cold, their mimosas were weak, and their options limited. Their desserts were good, but not $21.99 good. 
-Late checkout is $60 dollars (due to the price we made sure to check out on time).

I just departed Las Vegas yesterday. I am a plus model and came to LV to do a couple of photo shoots for designers. I have stayed in the time shares at the flamingo and thought that the hotel would be just as lovely. But I was wrong. The room was outdated. With minimal furnishings and wood headboards. There was no coffee makers. Which you at least get at a motel 6. The room was flawed in so many ways. Next the hotel pool closed at 6? Crazy. Especially for a hotel that is known for their pool. I requested information on getting a cabana and never heard back from anyone. And it took us an hour to check out because of the overlap with people checking in and out and they were not properly staffed. I am just very disappointed in what I seen. Especially things being so different from pictures. I come to Vegas often for business and pleasure and i just can't see returning to this hotel. So with that I give my one star. Thank you

Ok. Where to start:
This is a great place to stay for the price. This is actually the only place I have stayed in my few times to Vegas. I keep coming back because I am a fan of the location, price, and service. I have to admit, I was a little nervous to return after seeing all of the bad reviews, but here is my most recent experience: 
First off, I never experienced ANY issues with the elevator. There are 3 sets of elevators at the flamingo, the Habitat Elevators, the Spa elevators and the Lobby elevators. Because of the location of our room, we always used the Lobby elevators and never had an issue at all with them. The most we waited was maybe one minute. I saw someone else's review, and they mentioned the elevator line being long at the spa elevators, I didn't experience this, but I also used the Lobby elevators so keep that in mind. 
Next, our room. It was great! When we walked in, the first thing we noticed was that it smelled clean, so we were happy with that. Also, we had a view of the strip and Bellagio fountains from our room, and we just had a standard room, and didn't even pay extra for the view. So, that being said we were happy. I asked the guy that checked us in how the view was from our room, and we had the choice of a room on the 24th floor with no view, or 9th with a view. We chose the 9th and were so happy with it. 
There were a couple things worth mentioning. The bathroom is small. Not really the flamingo's fault, but for two women to try and get ready in, it did not work that well. Also, there were some obvious signs of aging. But, hey its the flamingo! The door was dirty, like it had shoe marks on it. There was a black hand print on the ceiling over my bed (super odd), and the bath tub could have used a good scrub down, as there was some residue in the cracks of the tub. 
All in all though, we were super happy with our room, and our stay. 
Also, I think our neighbor ordered a prostitute. She knocked on the door and they introduced themselves at the door, and she was dressed like one would expect. I could be completely wrong, and miss judging, but that is what it seemed like since the two didn't know each other prior. Again, this is no fault of the flamingo. 
Also, another hint, check in time is 4pm. They charge you an early check in fee of $30 if you check in before 1pm. So, if you wait until AFTER 1, but still before 4, you wont be charged the fee. I think we checked in at 2:15? I can't remember, but I do know it was before 2:30 :) 

I traveled with my mom who is a hotel snob (her favorite is the venetian), so that opened my eyes up to the attention to detail aspect of this hotel so that is why only 4 stars as opposed to my previous 5. But, let me just say, I still LOVE the Flamingo, would still recommend it to anyone traveling to Vegas, and WILL be back.

This is a difficult review to write because I was pleased with the outcome but frustrated the the process and the way they handled it.  

We booked to night at the Flamingo and arrived around 4pm which is their standard check in time.  I parked in their garage and unloaded all our bags to go check in.  When I arrived I found out they didn't have a room for us.  So the moved our reservation to the Harrahs, which was no big deal, had they at least called and informed us before I waisted my time unloading, reloading, and unloading the car.  

It did make it all better when we got to the Harrahs and found out we were upgraded to a suite at no extra charge.  

Flamingo if you cancel or move someones reservation make sure you inform them.

WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!!

This hotel deserves zero stars! One our first day our hotel key is not working only hours after checking in. I spend 30 minutes on the phone with the front desk and security,  while my boyfriend  waits in a long line in the lobby to speak with someone in customer service. Over 30 minutes later, somehow we were accidently checked out of the hotel. How are you accidentally checked out of your hotel room?!?! After this outrageous blunder you would think nothing else could go wrong. WRONG!!! The lovely people at Flamingo charge my credit card twice for 1 room, not only did they me twice the second charge was at much higher rate. So here we are again me and my boyfriend waiting in another 30 plus minute line at customer service to get issue resolved. The people at the front desk were completely lost and had no idea what was going on and tried to convince me the extra charges were just resort fees. Right, resort fees that cost more than the actual room?!?! 

Our room was completely outdated. The house keepers do not clean the rooms!!! They literally only made our bed and put fresh towels in the room NOTHING ELSE WAS TOUCH!!! Over half of the elevators did not work!!! So we have to wait and wait and wait before we were able to go up to our because they always was a crowd waiting for the few working elevators. The working elevators were not in great condition at all missing buttons on the control panel, malfunctioning doors, very scary needless to say. Stay away from the benches in the valet area unless you want to be attacked my multiple cockroaches. The valet was so unorganized and always backed up. We were stucked in the valet waiting line for over 15 minutes because unparked cars and people wanting for their luggage. 

Do yourself a favor and stay far away from this place!!! Needless to say this was the worst experience I ever had at any hotel. Our Vegas vacation turned into a Vegas nigthmare. We checked out today, and will never return to the Flamingo!!!

When you think of Vegas, there are a few things that come to mind. Some of them being..

- Casinos
- Stripers and Hookers
- Drugs
- Oh and the Flamingo girls

Isn't it one of the things that makes Vegas? This too is an old old casino. I think there are some upgrades that are needed or at least some cleaning. C'mon TLC for one of the classics! 

You definitely don't get the same kind of service as you would at some of the newer hotels. The service and overal ambience of this hotel is subpar. Just take you tourist pictures and leave. Also, do NOT bother with the shows here. Lame, just lame.

At first I was really scared to stay in this hotel I know these hotels look pretty on the outside but we all know what can happen in the rooms.

My boss told me that flamingo has just redid their rooms and I said why not let's book it and I was very happy when we checked in and saw our room.

I upgraded for 30 extra each night and it was totally worth it the room was nice the bathroom was nice and everything came out great!!

Overall I totally recommend the flamingo and for sure upgrade if you can its so worth it. The customer service was amazing towards me and the cleaning service was amazing as well very trust worthy.

I would for sure come back to this hotel. I had a great time and the location was perfect right in the middle of the strip.

We stayed stayed at the flamingo  for a long weekend. The room wasn't that good. The shower head was way to low, you had to bend down to take a shower, The toilet was really loud when you flushed,  the lighting was poor, and the clock kept going out.
The food court didn't have very good selections. I had the pizza, it was like cardboard and over priced. 
There are no $5 black jack or craps tables at all.
Every time we walked through the lobby we got harassed by staff trying to get us to sign up for something.  That was worse than getting bothered by the people on the street. 
The best part of the flamingo was the location.

They've made a bunch of upgrades to the rooms since the last time I was there when I was a kid. Located on the Strip, this place is easy enough to find, for the price you pay, it's definitely not bad.

I was here October 10-14 for kickball - it was our big tournament weekend. The Flamingo was our designated hotel, so imagine kickballers from all over the US packed in one hotel (think shit show). I got my own room because my friends' room was already packed, but I didn't mind since we got a pretty good deal. I got there Friday morning (right after the big Yelp OC party) at around 4 in the morning, but I wasn't able to check in til around 11am. My friend let me stay in her room that night since our other friends weren't coming til late Friday afternoon. The guy we talked to when we got there at guest services was awesome - he made it possible so that my room was directly across from my friends and got me early check-in, in addition to letting my friend have a key to my room in case I got locked out. 

When I got to my room the next morning, I was really surprised with how big it was. I guess it was one of those mini suites. I had a nice view of the pool\/flamingo area, hardwood floors, a king sized bed (you can bet I took up the whole bed by sleeping at an angle), nice sized bathroom, as well as a little couch.

I didn't really take advantage of anything else in this place. I had a staff meeting in the conference room downstairs so I didn't get the chance to go to the pool with all the other kickballers, but from what I saw from the pictures, the pool area was really nice. They had cheap tables and lots of different kinds of slots machine downstairs as well. I liked that the hotel was really close to all the parties we went to that weekend. It's on the strip and pretty much in the middle. The only downside really was all the construction going on. It took us about 30 minutes to figure out where the valet was and it also took a while for valet to get our stuff when we left Monday morning. Overall, this place is pretty sweet for the price I paid. I would definitely get my own room again next year if this is the sponsor hotel for our tournament.

Love their buffet! Fairly pricy but luckily my friends and I had Groupon so the entry price to get in was cheap. Flamingo had a pretty good range of food, especially seafood! Alcohol were unlimited. They had an amazing view of real flamingos, ducks, variety of fishes, etc. I wouldn't mind coming here again to eat.

I seriously have never experienced anything like this in Vegas before. Everything here was so outdated and yes it even had that old stale smell to it too. So the only reason I stayed hers was because friends of mine got the room for free, and their excuse for accepting the offer was that they were going to pool party on Saturday where they had a cabana reserved. So anyhow, I don't really know why I'm giving this place 2 stars and not 1, perhaps cause there were some good things about this place, like the fact that the spa\/fitness was a pretty good size and had a decent selection of weight lifting machines\/ free weights; however they lack in variety of cardio equipment. And not to forget that the staff that I did come across was friendly and helpful, however the big part, the main part... The rooms... Were SUPER outdated, our AC would come on like every 5 minutes and it was the loudest distracting noise ever! There was no coffee maker and pretty much no outlets to plug anything into besides the 1 in the bathroom. We had to crawl under the bed or move furniture to unplug something to charge our cell phones. Our room didn't have any carpet and the door had a chain latch that was super sketchy and old looking. Lastly I just wanna note (though I could go on) the lighting was horrible in the room, we could hardly see ourselves with ALL the lights on, making it hard to get ready . With that much said, never again... Even if free, been there done that!

Deluxe Room = Crappier than Motel 6's 

This review is for me and 10 of my other coworkers that are having problems with this hotel.  We're staying here for CES and each of us is encountering some sort of craps with our room.

The first room I had is horrendous.  The furniture are old, the mattress is sagging in middle, the bathroom corners have mold, and the sink didn't drain.   I switched to a different room the next morning and it's somewhat better.  

When I shared my story with my colleagues, they all expressed similar horror stories about their rooms.  One has bed bug bites, one shower doesn't work, one saw a cockroach inside his bag, and few said the floor is really dirty.  

Well, that's why I'm here to give this one-star review!

The Flamingo is sinking fast!

I've had several great stays here in years past but the hotel needs a lot of work! Most of the elevators don't even work and the ones that do stop at almost every floor for no reason. The hallways in standard rooms section are in very poor shape.

The standard rooms lack any sort of ambience and the bathrooms are old and dingy. The upgraded rooms are obviously better but the hotel has a 3.5 star rating at booking sites which is grossly misrepresented. They offered an upgraded room for $20 at check in but felt a 3.5* room should be sufficient. Boy, we we wrong! If you have to stay here, go with an upgraded room unless you have very low Vegas standards. $22 floor the resort fee but wifi doesn't even work!

To top off our stay, a cockroach bit my wife while outside by Carlos and Charlies. I realize it was outside but she wasn't happy none the less...
O
I'd stay away at all costs!

INTRUDER BREAKS INTO ROOM WHILE WE ARE THERE SLEEPING!!
For the most part, Flamingo hotel served its purpose: a room with five walls and two beds. Other than that, the experience was a nightmare! Before I tell you how there was an intruder who broke into our room at 2am while we were sleeping, let me tell you how dated this hotel is. First, don't go Fab. There is a reason why they say Fab and not Fabulous: they short you on anything that could be great. The rooms were clean but have major wear and tear for something that was recently "updated". The non-smoking room linoleum floors had burn marks (Hmmmm, burn marks in a non-smoking room...ok). The bathrooms were clearly not "updated". It looks like they still have the original bath from back in the day. They clearly have the same ancient plumbing, as on the second day there we had NO HOT WATER! I called front desk to inquire about my ice cold frozen shower and was told they had to shut off the hot water to fix a leaky pipe. Really? On a Saturday morning you are going to fix a leaky pipe? I can understand between off hours of maybe 3-6am but at 10am and with NO notice? They were so gracious enough (insert eye roll) to deduct one day resort fee. ONE RESORT FEE $30 for a day without hot water? A day where I am paying over $100+ just to stay in this "updated" room? Fast forward to this morning. Two of us had an early flight so we called it an early night. Imagine, sleeping in bed, in a far from Fab room, and be awoken by a strange man. This lazy, good for nothing, can't get a damn job and work for their own crap, poor excuse of a boy was in our room apparently going through purses. Wtf? If it wasn't for the quick action of a girl in the room, this mofo might have done more damage than taking a credit card, bank card, and cash from a wallet. Mind you, in the SAME hallway, a family caught this mofo's accomplice in their bathroom! They had it far worse than us. Their computer, phone, credit cards, and money were all taken. The security people there were phenomenal. They responded quickly and apprehended one of the two suspects. They were very supportive through out this ordeal. Unfortunately, the same could NOT be said of the front desk manager. I asked to speak with the manager as we felt violated. How can someone come into a hotel room in the middle of the night? I asked to get refunded our entire stay. The front desk said she would get the manager to come and speak to us. Mr. (Could be Ms. with the no balls\/cajones the way (s)he handled this) Shaun Lawson is a very poor excuse for a manager! How he got this far in life amazes me. He told the front desk lady that there is nothing he can do until the investigation is complete. Mind you, I get it and understand if you could not give me a refund on the time spent there but at least come and talk to me as a manAGER who should be concerned this happened under your watch. He even had the nerve to walk by me and not even acknowledge me standing there. A manager should NEVER do this to a customer after such a traumatizing experience. You as a manager should be the one to talk to me, be the one to tell me what you can and cannot do. This boy had the nerve to pass this on to his staff. This is not something staff should handle - manager skill 101. They need to train you first to be a manager and second to be a man. I will never stay in this motel again. Oh and to add even more insult to this. They had the nerve to ask what reward level I was. What the hell did my reward level have to do with any of this? How dare you use my reward level as a factor in how you will solve this incident. If I was a platinum vs. a gold would I receive different outcome from this situation? Don't stay here unless you want to be a robbery victim and a manager who clearly does not care about the guests.

3 stars for my stay at the Flamingo. 

It was our first time in Las Vegas, and my boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights. We arrived at about 10:15pm on a Monday night, and WOW, the check-in line was long. 

When we finally got to the desk, we were informed that there weren't any non-smoking rooms with king-sized beds available unless we were willing to have just a shower instead of a shower\/tub combo. We agreed, not realizing until we got up to the room that this meant the room was a handicapped-accessible room...and that the "shower" was just part of the bathroom enclosed with a curtain and a low-hanging showerhead. Sigh. 

We dealt with this tiny snafu and went down the next morning to see about changing rooms. Again, the check-in line was a mile long so we decided to try again later since we both had appointments at the spa. We got the spring fling special: a 25-min body scrub, a 25-min facial, and a 25-min massage for $150. Worth every penny. 

After our visit to the spa, my boyfriend stopped by the front desk at about 1:20pm to see about changing rooms and was informed that they only do room changes between 11am and 1pm. Oh, and that you can do it over the phone so you don't have to wait in line! Good to know. We stuck it out another night and called the next morning and got a new room on the 20th floor. At this point I noticed that some of the rooms on this floor looked really, really cool....much cooler than our room, at least. I assume that these are the GO rooms that I read so much about -- next time I will have to spring for one of those!

The pool was fantastically large, and the hot tubs were great, but be forewarned that ordering a large drink to enjoy poolside will set you back $18.

Not much good food or entertainment inside the hotel, we ended up going elsewhere a lot, but that wasn't so bad because the Flamingo is very centrally located.

I would stay here again, but would upgrade to a GO room next time.

The elevators don't work....which result in guests swarming the few that do (I waited in a mob of people for almost 15 minutes to catch an elevator!); you hear base from outside parties that keep you up at night; crappy rooms with beds that have worn out mattresses;  all for the lovely deal of over $300 a night. There are so many other options in Vegas.... the Flamingo is NOT one of them.  As I write this, it is 12:55am, and I'm on a mattress that is slumping to one side while a pool party is raging outside my window (and I'm on the 24th floor and STILL can hear it)....the sound insullation of these rooms is terrible! Spend your money elsewhere!

This was my first time staying at the flamingo. I was nice enough to rate this hotel a two star only because the housekeeping staff was the best thing on this resort.
Originally we we're staying at the Venetian (hands down the best high secured hotel on the strip) however, last minute bookings we missed out on a room big enough for 5 people. Fight weekend lots of hotels booked.
Driving up you could already tell it is OLD. Walking in same feeling. Walking through to get to our building ( the habitat tower) I didn't expect anything but slots machines and gambling tables. Duh it's Vegas. The habitat tower has not been renovated! The carpets in the halls were stained and looked like that have never been changed. Our room a two queen bed room had out dated lamps (never been dusted) literally took my finger and wiped off dust from the bottom of the lamp. Our view was horrible overlooking the resorts mechanical things (not sure what's it called). The beds had no comforters just some ugly fur thing big enough to cover your feet. The bathroom was the worst. Shower curtain too long for the shower rail many times got wet! The toilet and vanity were so old that the paint on the vanity looked like someone was sanding it and forgot to repaint it.
The restaurant that serves breakfast their staff were rude and not very nice. Maybe it was too early in the morning and who knows what ass hole pist them off before we got seated but other then food being very yummy and satisfying that's all I have to say about that.
The pool gets crowded quickly! Great dj and fun atmosphere. Bartenders hook you up if you hook them up with a GREAT tip! Don't be cheap people. However, for my friends and I this past weekend was one that we will never forget. While in the pool we noticed a male turned over in the pool like if he was playing dead. After a few minutes some of the swimmers near him noticed he wasn't playing dead. He basically drowned and my friend had along with about 5 other guys help push him out of the water into the deck. Lifeguards and no clue what to do. Some other girl began to give him CPR. The man came back and began to have what seems to have been a seizure. I jumped in since I'm CPR\/first aid certified to grab his tongue and no one would listen to me. He bit his tongue badly and bleed all over the pool deck. EMS finally got there after 15 minutes and I think his fine.
All and all I know you don't go to Vegas to sleep however, when you are enjoying the resort it shouldn't feel like this. Just saying. And it's still expensive so don't do it.

This is a very decent hotel for the price and location.  It's almost right on the strip and very close to the main attractions.  We stayed here mid June during EDC week - four nights for $440 is not bad!  The room was very clean, although not new and remodeled like the website confirmation promised.  The bathroom was a bit dated with old yellow tile floors and an ugly bath tub, but still very clean.  There's a food court in the hotel with fast food and pizza.  The pizza at the food court is a bit pricey, and I recommend getting pizza at the place right next to the elevators.  One slice is HUGE and they're pretty good.  

My main complaints are that it can get pretty loud during the day from the Drais pool party right next door and that you have to wait a lonnnnggg time for the elevators.  

I would definitely consider staying here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

Check in took around an hour, then they decided to charge an extra fee of $100 on top of what I paid on Expedia. Cold showers all three days of our trip. The bathroom is missing tiles. Nothing like what was shown in the pictures online. The maid turned the heat down to 60, and we were left coming back to the room freezing with not even any blankets on the bed. And the room always seemed to have a smell of vomit.

good for the price! book asap tho. we had dates in mind a couple wks prior to our visit when the price was $28\/night on flamingos site but didnt.actually book until the day before we planned on coming and the price bumped up to $35. we ended up booking thru expedia and was happy to find that we got a great view of the strip! we didnt get a crap view because we booked thru a different site! 

our visit was good. sure some of the chairs in our room looked like they need to be re upholstered and the floor could use a steam clean but my main concern is clean bedding and I was happy to find stainless sheets and a variety in pillow firmness. I was a little grossed out that there were a couple clipped toenails on the bathroom floor when we arrived and the next day found them merely brushed into a corner after house keeping came by. oh btw they are unpredictable! one day they came past noon and the next they came knocking at 9:30. 

check in\/check out was easy and i love that this hotel is on the small side. i didnt have to walk far to grab a bite to eat or to run to the lobby or box office. we just left yesterday and im already missing the convenience of having food and fun just a minute away.

I have experienced way better hotels in my travels around the world. I was very disappointed with pretty much all aspects of this hotel. We arrived very late on Thursday evening of last week about 24 hours before I was going to be married, and had to wait in quite the line to get checked in. The most annoying thing was not the line but the fact that they could not find any of the reservations we made, there were 4 rooms booked in total under our name.  
    Finally after much trouble my Fiance found the conformation number in an email on his phone. After showing it to the attendant at the desk she slowly entered our info and passed over our keys. What I do not understand is how our info was so messed up when we made our reservations through their website, all rooms were assigned by us to our guests and their info was typed by us. The attendant botched all the names and rearranged it so that a few of our guests last names had been switched with others. How stupid do you have to be to not listen and have us repeat everything three or more times. We also specifically booked non smoking rooms but were informed that they had none available. How is that possible? 
   After finally settling at the counter we made our way to the bank of elevators that she had directed us to in the lobby and up 23 floors. After a dizzying walk around we finally found a random security guard who informed us we had been directed to the wrong elevators. Seriously? How can you mess up directions to a place you work for? 
      When we arrived at our suite, we were delighted at the style and furnishings, and an impeccable view to boot. These attributes and the go pool are this hotels only saving graces. More on the pool later. 
      Everyone else seemed to be happy with their rooms too, except for one of our asthmatic friends who could not tolerate the smell of smoke that permeated from every inch of their room. I was also very upset that the four rooms we booked were on completely different sides and floors of the hotel. We were there to celebrate a wedding and wanted our friends to be close. 
     Anyhow, on our first morning at the hotel we were rudely walked in on by the cleaning staff despite the fact that we not only had the do not disturb sign provided by the hotel but one I made for all our guests and us for our wedding. 
      Our Second morning started the same way. We decided to go hang by the pool and let me just say this was one of the best pools I had been to in awhile. Also one of the reasons why we decided to stay there, it was voted one of the best pools in Vegas. The pool did open 15 minutes late and they started kicking everyone out 15 minutes before they closed. A half hour of swim time is a lot to miss out on, especially in the heat that is Vegas. After leaving the pool, EARLY, we went to our room and ordered room service. We ordered a cobb salad and a plain cheese quesadilla. It took and hour and forty five minutes to be delivered, they said they always get flooded with orders when the pool closes. If they know that little tidbit of info, don't you think you should put more staff on at that time. We could have gone out to eat and been back to the hotel before our food came. 
    At this point we were so disenchanted that we pretty much stayed away from the hotel until we were too exhausted to stand and needed to sleep and prep to go back out. We went to the Aria and it was awesome, decided next time that is the hotel to stay at. Even the employees were happy and helpful. The flamingo employees were angry, terse, and pretty much seemed liked they hated everything and everyone. 
     We asked for a late check out, considering we just got married we thought this would not be an issue, plus we offered to pay. They rudely informed us that we could not due to being fully booked. I was curious so while we went to breakfast I got on my phone and searched for available rooms. The interwebs said they had plenty of rooms left. So someone was lying, I wanted an hour max, not another day, I had just been married for F's sake!  
   Since we couldn't check out later we made the decision to leave our bags with the bellhop service while we went to eat some breakfast before the long drive back to LA. The bellhop was so cold and short. It was like he was doing us a favor instead of doing his job that he was getting paid to do. I understand everyone has bad days, but keep that shit to yourself, especially when you're at work. 
     When we went to pick up our luggage and load it in the car we were faced with a long line due to the disorganization that obviously runs rampant at this hotel. What is management doing while their employees are giving such terrible service to paying customers? If I wasn't on the high of being deliriously happy due to just being married this experience would have ruined my vacation completely. I will never give my hard earned money to this hotel EVER AGAIN!!!! 
  
    
EPIC FAIL FLAMINGO!!!! EPIC FAIL!!!!!

I stayed here in a regular room with some friends last December. Expectations were not high considering how cheap we got the room for, but gosh did they let us down even more. The hotel smelled like coconut milk, which wasn't appealing to our group. I guess they were trying to work with the tropical theme? Uh huh. We showered in cold water for most of our stay at the hotel. We called the staff to have someone come by and fix it. A man came by to "fix" it. We tried the water again- still COLD. We then complained to the front desk, who was quite courteous. The front desk woman gave us a change of room and $30 to use for room service (enough for 2 measly breakfast orders for the four of us). The first round of showers in the new room finally had warm water, but that's it. All the showers after that ranged from very slightly warm to coolly cold. Maybe we had bad luck. Maybe the water system was understandably affected by some outside force. Either way, I ain't gonna step into this coconut milk-smelling hotel again.

It was noisy from the bathroom and construction (quite bother me), food was left in the hallway from early am to late pm so what? As long as it isnt in my room or in front of my room. Staffs were ok. If you guy mean room service staffs were rude, give them some tips pls. (They cleaned your room didnt they. Give 'em a break). 30 bucks\/ night on the strip (I'm not a high roller nor a gambler, just a vacationer) wasn't so bad after all.

My girlfriend and I checked into this hotel on July 25th, 2014 and left on July 27th. The vacation was for my birthday and it was also my first time going to Las Vegas. So we were hoping to have a good time. We checked in, with no problems. We came to this hotel with the information on their site that it was in fantastic shape and at a great price. My review of this hotel is as follows:

We were directed to the Habitat Elevators, upon stepping into the elevators, we noticed it was quite dirty and nasty, hand rails were missing, paint was chipped and missing, along with gang symbols scratched into the walls. We got up to our floor and as we walked down the never ending hall we noticed the carpet was pulled up and completely messed up. We walked past the ice machine next to our room that didn't work and had cigarette butts in it, there was a giant hole in the wall right next to it. 

We get into our room and turn the lights on. Everything looks good walking in. I lay down on the bed and automatically I have springs sticking into my back on one side of the bed and the other side of the bed was just fine. One of the pillows had stains on it and there was some mold on the pillow case. I immediately tossed that pillow on that floor. There were stains on the sheets. Removed those. The drawers in the dresser barely worked. 

I walked into the bathroom and noticed quite a few nasty things. There was a vent in the shower that was caked with dirt, dust, and mold. There was a hole in the ceiling above the shower the size of a golf ball, that was filled with dirt, dust, and mold. There was rust on a door above the shower. The shower curtain was stained at the bottom. There was dirt, dust, and mold on the crowning above the sink.

We went downstairs to the front desk, we informed the lady of what was going on. She honestly could care less, like she was expecting us to have complaints and was ready with "Sorry to hear about that.", "What would you like me to do about it?", and "Sorry we are booked full for the night and tomorrow night, you can try for Sunday night." I informed here that we are really disappointed and again she didn't care. I asked for a manger, and there wasn't one available, she simply stated that she will put it in the notes for my room. So I kept my cool and we hit the strip.

July 26th, my girlfriend and I walked the stripped and had a blast, we walked in the hotel and asked to speak with a manager. While waiting I looked around and saw a broken beer bottle with beer all over the floor in the check-in line. I finally got to speak with one, I told him what we had going on and the treatment we got from the night staff, he apologized, but it sounded just like the standard script that is practiced when you have to deal with an unhappy customer. So to make me feel better, he gave me a $30 food voucher and took $20 dollars off my room bill, and said he would have someone come up to address the dirt and mold. We went back to the room, to prepare for our first event of the night. When we walked in, the pillow case that I had removed off the dirty pillow was still in the room, draped over the chair. Room service didn't bother to hang any of the towels, they just left them in a pile on the sink. There were still stained sheets on the bed. And room service didn't replace any of the soaps or shampoos when they cleaned. So we called down to the front desk, told them we need toiletries asap please. Nothing came before we left, and nobody came to clean the dirt and dust. 

We come back from our show and decided to eat, we opted for the Tropical Breeze Cafe . The menu didn't look great, but the special did. So it took a while for our waiter to come over, he was busy trying to pick up on the older woman sitting behind our booth. When he did he introduced himself as Jairo. He could barely understand English, I got passed this and explained to him what I wanted. Apparently it was too difficult for him to understand that I wanted both Coleslaw and Fries with my order. He took my girlfriends order and he disappeared. He brought out our food about 10 minutes later. He had gotten my order wrong, but I wasn't going to fight it. I only got the coleslaw. I took a bite of the slaw and it was spoiled. I ate the rest of my food in silence. He never came back to check on us, just gave us eye contact and walked on by. We finally had to flag down a member of the bus staff to get our check. We utilized our $30 credit and left.

We got back up to the room, room service stopped by again, and left a trash bag full of soaps, lotions, shampoos, conditioner, toilet paper, and tissue boxes in our sink. The dirt, dust, and mold were still there. We slept for a bit, got up and left for our next show. Came back and slept.

Checkout was 11AM. Housekeeping was knocking on our door by 1030. Was never so happy to get out of there.

The grounds and location are beautiful here and the pool is awesome. Those are the only positives I can think of after just spending 3 days here. The main reason we stayed here is because we heard great things about the pool but we had to wait in a HUGE line and we ended up walking away. I can't believe hotel guests don't get a different line to stand in. Instead, we have to wait with people who paid to stay in other hotels but want to go to this pool. Well, i guess those people are smart. Next time, we'll stay at a different hotel and just come over to this pool since you don't get any kind of special treatment for being a guest. 

We got early check in for an extra $30 which was great and they said it's a handicapped room with a walk in shower. Awesome right? Hell no. Don't ever agree to that room if you're not handicapped. The shower head wasn't attached to the wall and I took a shower that completely flooded the bathroom. I had to use all of my towels to clean it up. There aren't even coffee makers in the room! Don't waste your time or money here. There's too many other good hotels for good prices.

My review is for their buffet! It was HORRIBLE!!!!!! The food was bland and stale and the drinks we're flat. The orange chicken was spoiled we told the waitress she went got the cook he had the nerve to say it wasn't spoiled it was ginger we was tasting! WTF? We all got up and left. We paid $54 at Harrah's to do the 24 hour buffet and wanted to try all the buffets thats included in the deal. Never again will I eat there. And it wouldn't hurt for them to redecorate the place!

Horrible!!! The rooms A\/C was motion detected so that when your sleep the temperate shortly climbs to 90 degrees no matter what it's set on!!! Unless someone is moving right under it it turns off. Stupidest power saving idea ever. The hotel is in the desert wtf with the horrible AC.

Ew.  My husband is staying at this hotel for a conference.  This morning he sent me photos of the cock roaches all over the floor in his bathroom.  DISGUSTING.  

He stopped at the front desk before his meeting, with luggage in tow so it didn't get infested.  The man at the front desk was not phased by his cock roach problem and just stared back at my husband.  Duh.....  My husband had to ask if they would change his room.  They're not sure if they can - even though they are not full.  How disgusting....

Don't stay here.  It's run down, infested with cock roaches and not worth it.  I would give it 0 stars if I could.

It's hard to decide how many stars to give the Flamingo.  Location it's a 5, quality of room was a 3.5 (I was in a remodeled room), price is a 4 and hidden fees and services a 2.  I stayed here for 9 days for a convention so I wore out my welcome of walking through a Casino every night and dealing with smoke and noise.  The first 3 days were great and I would definitely stay here again for vacation because how often are you in your room?  I've also heard their pool is halfway decent in the summer.  Nothing wrong really but a lot of better options in Vegas.

Ended up here because of a conference. 

Pros: I must say the staff was entirely gracious during our visit; they really do a great job of attending to your wishes. Comfy beds and pillows. Large shower and tub. Plush towels. Maids did a great job of cleaning each day and were very friendly. Please remember to tip your maid each day; they work hard.

Cons: very smokey casino in need of better air exchange system; it just stinks. Very strange furnishings in rooms; not what I would call tasteful. Headboard is some tacky plastic button-type thing. Nine recessed lightbulbs above the bed - so weird. Bathroom door is just a sliding frosted glass, not much privacy there and let's a lot of light through when a person is using it. TV in the bathroom mirror = just silly, imo. Dirty carpeting by elevators and hallways. Lock didn't work on the room safe. Needs overall updating. Not classy. Have to pay for Wifi each day.

Breakfast buffet:  average, and rather slow service. 

Ended up spending a fair amount of my spare time at other hotel\/casinos to enjoy a nicer atmosphere.

We stayed at this hotel on the week of June 18, 2012. We decided to book this room because it was at the center of the strip. 

We arrived at the hotel around 5pm. The check-in process was extremely slow since there weren't enough employees working. It took a total of maybe 3 minutes from the time I gave her my I.D to getting my room key. 

Our room is located in the Habitat tower. Our room was located all the way at the end of the hallway. 

As for the room itself, it looks simple and modern. I love the hardwood floor. This is my first time staying in a hotel room with a hardwood floor. I love that they use hardwood floor instead of carpet.

I had an opportunity to swim at the GO pool and recorded a full tour of how the GO Pool looks like. So if you guys want to see how the pool looks like click on my video below:   http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=NbYqrzkfSjQ

They also have a family friendly swimming pool with 2 slides. It quite small compare to the GO Pool for adult..

The new fab-rooms are nice. The laminate floors make it feel clean, which may have given them bonus points.  And we ended up with a room facing the strip so the view was pretty good... could kind of see the Bellagio fountains from the window.  The bed was probably the best I've slept on in a hotel. Not as good as home but damn decent.
Downsides include the noise. Noise from the street isn't terrible but it is audible. Until the air conditioning unit kicks in, then that noisy bugger is what you hear.
While we're talking about the air conditioner: it drips water. I'm going to assume it's like the compressor on your vehicle dripping condensation... or else I'm going be really grossed out by what dripped on me.
The bathrooms were not renovated when the room was. Wallpaper was peeling. The chromed fixtures were rusting. The fan didn't work. The shower head had crappy pressure.

We really had a good week here recently! We arrived in town early on a Sunday, checked in (surprisingly short line!), but rooms were not ready yet as they had had a busy weekend. No problem, we checked our luggage and went to get something to eat. We checked back in at the desk and were given our rooms (we always upgrade to GO Rooms), and shortly after that our luggage was brought up to us! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were very nice, cleaned daily and always while we were out. I loved our view, best we've ever had in countless trips to Vegas. The bed was very comfy. We even had a fridge in our room! There are plenty of elevators in this hotel and you can use different ones to get quicker access to different parts of the hotel\/casino. We loved meeting for breakfast on the patio in the gardens where we would sit with a muffin and coffee and plan our day. The pool was nice too. We did not get a car due to traveling with a group this time so it was nice to be so centrally located with access to everything we wanted to do. We tried the new Carlos N Charlies' restaurant and it was good. We also like the food court, very handy with plenty of options. Our only complaint was with the restaurant, while the food & service were pretty good the problem was when it was time to leave we had to wait in a long line to pay our bill! They could have used a few more staff people to expedite this process.

Terrible! There are literally 2 working elevators in the lobby. I can hear each word of our neighbors quiet conversation amongst themselves. 

This place is terrible. I will never stay her again and neither should you.

Me and four girlfriend stayed here during our first trip to Vegas. We had a great time. We stayed from Saturday-Tuesday in a GO deluxe room. I would recommend one of these rooms, as they are spacious and very nice. We got ours for the same price as the regular rooms through Expedia.

Honestly, there was nothing bad about this place because we weren't here to spend our time in the hotel room. Our experience, however, was totally fine and even (by my picky standards) good: The rooms were clean and spacious, the air worked well, and the bathroom was clean. 

We arrived in Vegas around 10 a.m. and checked in early. We couldn't get into the room until 3 p.m. or so. They let us check our luggage in some back room and gave us 4 passes the pool. We changed in the bathroom on the lobby floor and went out the pool. They only gave us 4 passes since it was technically a 4 person room, but we had no trouble bringing an extra person in. They only check IDs--they don't even check the passes. We bought drinks (expensive, but we expected that) and lounged all day. It was great!

We didn't experience any poor customer service and we didn't have any complaints. The location was perfect. We went to clubs at the Cosmopolitan and Bellagio and they were very close. 

The best part about this place was the adult pool. SO fun. Honestly, that made the trip. A lot of club promoters were at the pool, and they were walking around and putting people on lists. DO THIS! You will gain express entry and even free cover. This was amazing and totally made our trip worth it!

This place is cheap and in an amazing location. I removed one star for our view: construction and a crappy part of town south of the Strip as well as the strange leaking that was occurring all over the hallway from the floor above us. Otherwise, the experience was great and it was exactly what I expected in Vegas: gaudy and over the top.

The good: Great location, close to everything. The rooms are a decent size. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and courteous. The TVs (one in the bathroom, a nice touch) were nice, though I wouldn't want to spend enough time in the room to enjoy them.

The bad: Everything else. The casino is small and incredibly smoky. I've spent enough time in the other casinos in the area to know that it's worse here than other places, and it's not just in the lobby and in the casino. Even though smoking isn't supposed to be allowed in rooms, ours reeked. People were smoking in the elevators. Everything is a bit dingy and outdated. One of our towels had a stain on it, as did the bedspread. The internet barely worked, despite the fact that we were paying a ton for it. 

I definitely wouldn't stay here again, despite the price and location. It's worth an extra $100 to not constantly smell (and smell like) cigarettes.

Great location! It seriously is located in the middle of strip. Cab rides were no more than 10 dollars to any location. Perfect walking distance to Bellegio and Ceasers!!

Stayed here for 3 nights in the Martinique Suite. The suite was amazing! Strip view, mini kitchen, full living room, dining room, guest bathroom, his and her sinks, big screen tv (old fashion box tops ones!! lol), vanities, closed bathroom toliet and a whole lot of space! On top of our suite we booked a connecter room that was a standard room. Martinique suite had a blue and silver theme. Nice and comfortable. We hardly left our ''apartment'' the whole weekend!

Flamingo hotel itself is outdated. Pink everywhere and the casino floor itself is not that big. Seems like the floor hasn't been changed in years and is more geared to older people. We played craps and note to others not all drinks are free. Premium drinks are $3-$5..  Flamingo is also connected to the monorail. They serve TCBY, a full bar, coffee, muffins, and extra snacks downstairs. 

I would consider coming back here for future Vegas trips. Only for the suites and GO rooms. Standard rooms ehh not so much!

Two stars might be generous. Our room was okay. There was a dirty throw rug, but otherwise it was fine. But the common areas are filthy. The carpet in the halls is very dirty and it is all stretched out making for hazardous walking. The elevators are scary - making all kinds of odd noises as the doors close. My niece had ants in her room on the 14th floor. I will never stay here again. Definitely overpriced for the quality.

The room was dated and showed lack of maintenance. Bathroom is so small to today's standards.   The drain in the sink is rusty and It is so cheap to replace it but the hotel did not even bother to replace.  The bathroom floor is so old that it shows an yuckee black grout.  The room is probably just little better than a motel 6 room .  One of the elevator's floor is smashed up  but did not get fixed.  The towels are thin and cheap.  I think the hotel is not profitable enough to perform basic maintenance.  The pool is not heated enough because they are so cheap to heat it up.

I was kind of terrified to experience The Flamingo after reading nightmarish reviews, but I survived a 4 day stay there and this was my experience. First of all, this isn't a super fancy hotel. You're not going to see sparkling chandeliers or swirling marble floors. The rooms don't have fridges or microwaves. You get what you pay for here. It's a little outdated and not all the elevators are working which makes for some annoying waits when you're trying to go upstairs (staircases not easy to find either). They are working on those apparently. 

Our first room got taken over by ants after one night there (and also didn't have very hot water in the shower), and I quickly called down to the front desk and was helped immediately by a friendly desk attendant who moved us into a nicer room in the Habitat tower right away. This room was much better. As for the pool, it's a party pool for sure. We enjoyed the music and drinks at the bar, and the fries and sliders at the pool are actually really delicious. 

All in all I give it a 2.5 star rating.  It's not great, but...it'll do.

I stayed here for business. The linens were clean, although I don't believe they were changed during my stay. The furnishings were very worn; especially in the bathroom. Although the toiletries were replaced as necessary and the divan in front of the window was moved, I am uncertain whether or not the room was actually cleaned at any point during my 4-night visit...the same soap stains in the sink and on the shower curtain that I noticed when I checked in were there when I checked out, too. 
Check-in is a nightmare...endless lines and inadequate staffing. 

Unless you pony up the resort rate, plan on spending $10\/day to access the gym.

The best part of the entire experience was complimentary wifi, which was accessible from most areas of the hotel.

Bottom line: if you're looking for a decent place to crash with no frills, book at The Flamingo. If you want ambiance, you'll find better camping on the Strip.

Stayed here 3\/6\/12-3\/8\/12

Got the room comped, 1st time staying here. NASCAR was in town this Sunday and it was a long line to check in.  I say roughly 40-50 people in line and about 5-7 people working the front desk.  Our room was at the Habitat Tower so it was a long ways to get to.  Rooms were decent but the beds were not "Queen" sized.  More like Full.  Dont think we stayed in an updated room.  The good things are that it was smack in the middle of the strip.  Walking distance to everything.  And at time of check out they have kiosks for express check out on the right.  I think it was a manager who helped me check out.  Very patient white man, being I never tried the kiosk check out.  I like more of the piece and quiet type of place so definetely not staying here next time.  I will for sure stay at my Time Share at the Cancun Resort South of the strip.  Very peaceful and super friendly staff.  If you are the party type I would recommend this place.

Just checked out of Flamingo.  Not a good experiance!!!!  Fifth year in a row going to Flamingo with same three couples.  We are the last couple to still be at Flamingo due to bad customer experiance. This is our last year at Flamingo.   Room not clean at checkin, glass shower doors leek, pool smells like a sewer, long lines at check in and only 1 person working behind desk the rest just standing around, asked for an additional hour after checkout and charged $20.  Last year had to move rooms because of water leek in wall and water running down the bathroom wall and all over bathroom floor and room carpet.  When ask for something for the trouble of moving rooms sorry against policy.  Would not recommend this hotel.

Is there an option for zero stars ? This place is celebrating its 70th year, and let me just say ... You can tell its 70 years old. We upgraded to one of the better rooms and there was nasty brown carpeting, stained couch and yellow rusty walls where the air vents were. But fine, we are in Vegas, and we dont really spend too much time in the room- oh but wait , the staff for baggage check in were so rude, half the elevators didn't work, and the wait staff at the casino floor basically ignored you. My friends stayed at encore for 40 dollars more. No thank you Hilton, I'd rather pay 40 dollars more anywhere else and get treated like an actual human being .

I stayed at the Flamingo 4 nights. Check-in took forever. Three people were at the front desk. Of those 3 people, only two were checking-in regular customers. The third person was only taking 'Elite customers'. While I was in line, I didn't see a single Elite customers check-in. Please, a customer is a customer. Use your discretion when necessary. About 20+ people were waiting to check-in.  

I got a decent room. It had basic amenities: tv, desk, bed, couch, iron\/ironing board, hair dryer, and toiletries. No tea\/coffee or a coffee maker. I asked for a non-smoking room. I walked into the room and the room smelled smokey. One call to the front desk, they sent someone with access cards to a different room. We got a nice room with a view of the pool area. Wifi is not included, so get ready to pay $13\/day for it. I tried the food court and it had some limited choices. The bell desk held my baggage for free. At checkout don't forget to ask for the air port shuttle. It's only $7 and comes by every 20 minutes (runs until midnight). Overall, I got what I paid for. No complaints! The best part is the hotel is centrally located on the strip. 
 This is an old property so I'm not going to compare it with the other hotels.

The pool is amazing! Here celebrating our 9 year wedding anniversary and relaxing at the pool. So much fun!

Love Las Vegas!

Super disappointed in my stay here.   The lines to check in were ridiculous and moved at a snails pace.  The lobby was filled with a bunch of loud, obnoxious people who blocked the doorways and the kiosks.  

We finally got our key and went to our room as we had to weave our way through hoards of people.   The elevator area is always packed and there was garbage on the floor and spilled drinks.  I was stunned.  

Our room was very far from the elevators which we thought would be good.  Not so much.  We had large groups of people staying near us that were up all night moving from room to room.

Our room was ok, nothing special and not one I would care to stay in again.   If you are in your room when the pool is open, the music shakes your window and you can hear it clearly.

The casino is very smoky and overall feels dirty.    

We have stayed here before, but this trip certainly has made it the last.   Too many better choices in this city.
for what it is this hotel is awesome for the value. Comped drinks very generous. Newly renovated rooms are very nice. If I get another comp on my room I would stay there again. Great value.

An older resort hotel? Yes. We all know this hotel's history with Bugsy Seigel. A dumpy hotel? Gotta disagree, although this place could use a few improvements in certain areas. Yet considering this hotel's location, price point and amenities, there is one word that I can describe it by: convenient. 

First off, location. 10 minutes (if that) from McCarran airport, adjacent to Westin Las Vegas and across the street from The Linq hotel, Caesar's Palace & The Bellagio, as well as the High Roller Ferris wheel. It does not get any better than this when it comes to accessing these Vegas Strip staples on foot. 

Second, the room. Honestly, the room was a bit spartan and plain for my tastes, yet it was somewhat spacious for a property that has over 3,600 rooms on 28 floors. Internet is not free here, yet that was expected (check your resort fees). During my 4-night stay here, the elevators on the wing that has the Paradise Garden Buffet worked infrequently. Half of them seemed to be broken, so expect a wait either prior to entering or during your elevator ride. It will seem as if you are going to every single floor. 

Third, valet, baggage claim, and check-in. I actually thought that the first two were remarkably easy, while the check-in process has challenges. I and my wife (yes, some of us bring our wives to Vegas) waited about 10 minutes between the hour of 8:30 and 9 PM, yet some others were not so lucky. There appears to be 7-8 front desk agents at a time during peak hours. For those checking in or out between 11 AM and 3 PM, expect a line that will go all the way past the box office. This is not an exaggeration (see my photos). Highly recommended to do the express check-in\/check-out or via Internet. 

Fourth, restaurant + amenities. The Flamingo has the Paradise Garden Buffet, which is one of the best in town. Its not the Rio, yet its good. Prices range from $17.99-21.99 per person, depending on if you have a Player's Card (get one at the both across from the front desk), active duty military, senior citizen, etc. The Pizza Joint, + mexican restaurant have reasonable prices. Yet if you want even better food at reasonable prices, you'll have to exit the Flamingo and walk towards where Margaritaville is located (highly recommended). The hotel's resort area has quite a bit of wildlife on it, from Chilean flamingos to ducks, geese, turtles, and exotic birds. While in season, there are at least 4-5 pools here.

Fifth, the casino itself. What can I say, its a casino. The casino employees are remarkably nice (even the dealers that took cash from me), and the machines are in good repair. There is a good security presence here, and I never felt threatened despite the weirdness of some Vegas patrons. For those that aren't used to it, expect someone smoking a pipe, vape, nasty cigarette w\/o filter or even a joint in almost all areas of the floor. Drink prices tend to have that standard 25-30% markup. Also, the permanent show seems to be Donnie & Marie Osmond, for all of you Baby-Boomers out there. 

Overall, the Flamingo met my needs while here on a conference. While it may have been annoying to get offered a time share property at every opportunity that I walked down the hallway (as well as riding the perpetually slow & broken elevators), the property yielded a very good Vegas experience.

Let me start off by saying our group is extremely easy going and didn't need anything extra. Just wanted a place to sleep and a place to leave our luggage. I wanted somewhere on the strip and this was the cheapest. I had a really great experience! The check in line was ASTRONOMICAL, would have taken 40+ minutes, but the kiosks you can use to check in took me literally 2 minutes. That was a huge help! Our room had a view of a random garage but we opted out of the extra charge for a strip view so can't complain! The beds were comfy, the room was clean, that's all we needed! 

When we went to check out I saw the line, again- astronomically long! BUT again you could check out using the kiosks OR with your cell phone via an email they sent. I used my cell phone and checked out during a nice relaxing breakfast at a nearby brunch restaurant. I didn't need to speak to any concierge or anyone because again, we're low maintenance and didn't need anything from them. I can only speak to that and if you have requests then maybe the experience would unfortunately be like other reviewers, but for us it was great! I will agree that I did experience a lot of people in the lobby asking if you wanted to partake in "special offers" but they were easy to ignore (we used to live in LA lol). I will definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the Flamingo for two reasons:  1) we have a young son who wanted to do the big water slide pool at the Flamingo -- and he did, all day long; 2) my wife wanted to see Donny and Marie at the Flamingo.  The Flamingo water slide pool gets 4 stars and Donny and Marie get 5 stars (even though I am not a D&M fan, the show was very entertaining and well worth it).

Otherwise, we would have stayed at the Wynn or Encore because, for roughly the same price, the Wynn gives you a much newer, cleaner, nicer room and hotel.  The Wynn has a big pool, but no water slide like the Flamingo.

But the Flamingo hotel and rooms get 2 stars.  The Flamingo felt white trashy.   We stayed in a GO room with a view, which is supposed to be a renovated upgrade from their standard rooms.  The hall way carpet was covered in stains.  The bathroom smelled and the sink was clogged when we arrived.  There are no tubs.  Just a shower stall.  The shower is supposed to have jets but if you use the jets the entire bathroom floor gets major flooding because of the lame lame shower design.  The bathroom also has a weird sliding glass door that is see-through, sound-through, and smell-through.    There was a flat screen TV.  The hotel guide in the room is insufficient and does not give you a map or directions or hours to get to any of the stuff in the hotel.  If you try and call the front desk, it is just like trying to call a 1-800 customer service line. There was a small fridge in the room.  The beds were comfy enough but bedding (and ceiling - this is Vegas) had hot pink stains all over it.  Internet access was like $15\/day and did not appear to be wireless.  Checking in or out is like waiting at the airport luggage line.  

The buffet has okay but nothing better than a Chuck-O-Rama really.  The cafe, was good, but served the exact same food for the exact same prices as in-room service.  

The pool was good.  What used to be the 18+ pool (a boring oval surrounded by statutes) has been changed to the family pool.  Now, half of what used to be the family pool complex (including the largest open part with the water fall) is closed to children under 18.  Starting at 10 AM, they open up the half of the water slide complex that kids can use, which has the big slide.  

Until they do a serious renovation, we will not return to the Flamingo because the hotel\/rooms are too nasty.
