Room was just ok (3 comps), nice view of courtyard, pool and high roller. Elevators were the WORST, i experienced the "ghost elevator" and the elevator that "harlem shakes". Pool was poppin, food court was cool for late nights. Did well on slots, but after 12 am cocktail waitresses are hard to find. Great location for everything

Stayed in the go room and really enjoyed it . 
PROS: 
- Room had a mini fridge, two counters on the sides of the bed, window curtains that opened with a switch, Bose speakers with stereo, flat screen tv, tv in the bathroom, nice shower and seperate bath tub, and a couch next to the window.
- updated look 
- in the middle of the strip so easy to get to a lot of places
- had a view of the pool and linq 
- GO pool was really nice 
-had great customer service at the front desk when adding another night 
CONS:
-Most of the elevators our first two nights were not working so took a really long time to get up and down
-check-in\/out line was really long at all times of the day which made it difficult if you had any problems 
-buffet was very disappointing . Went for lunch and all they basically had was some Chinese, fried chicken , shrimp,  beef , sandwiches, not so good salad bar , and desserts. Just wondering were the Mexican or pizza or orange chicken was haha. 

Overall a very good experience with the room and customer service. Restraunts in flamingo and check in not so good.

Maybe its cuz it was my first time in Vegas, but the flamingo treated me well! We got the rooms at a very good rate and the room wasn't bad at all. We had a nice set up that had a good view of vegas. We did try the room service and the food wasn't bad at all. We had no issues and check in\/out was easy

As a Harrah's member, we were given an upgrade to a GO room for $25 per night. I've been wanting for a while now to stay in one and finally got the chance. I guess i expected too much because we were a bit disappointed with the execution of the cool concept. 

The good: 42 inch LCD, BOSE system with hook ups for ipod, automatic window blinds, and large shower.

The bad: bed was way too soft - you sink in, shitty looking vinyl pillow backboard, pink lights \/ decor, and porn mirror on ceiling over the bed.

The bathroom takes up almost a 3rd of the room and the concept of having a tv in the bathroom is cool but the shower glass steam covers the screen when you are taking a shower. I really wanted to love our room but as i said before the execution failed miserably. I would have given it 2 stars but since we got the room for $25 per night i bumped it to 3 stars.

Pros:

-price

-location

-shorter check-in line for total rewards members


Cons:

-thins walls in room (very very noisy). I could hear the neighbors and their tv, neighbors across hall, and guests walking and talking in hallway. There was also some construction noise or something late in the middle of the night.

-under construction near by

-entrance to park was hard to find (took an hour w\/ traffic circling the hotel 3 times over). We called the hotel asking for directions and even they didn't know that the small entrance they directed us to was temporarily closed. We had to make another u-turn and the. turn onto a small street. We passed that small street twice and there was no sign or anything to help visitors find the entrance to park at Flamingo.

-calling guest services took long (had to wait 5 mins before getting in touch with a person) every time we called

-pool closes too early (6pm)

Heavenly at the Concierge Box Office made our evening by giving us the best customer service we could have asked for. Eleven of us girls in a bachelorette party had booked separate tickets for a show (per incorrect instruction from another company) and she was able to return them all, find seats together, rebook them, and run to get the new tickets, all with a smile on her face. We greatly appreciated her patience and hard work!!!! Without her our evening would have not been such a great experience.

Have been extremely disappointed with service here to this point. Will see how next 36 hours go. So here is my review:
   I had my eye on the Flamingo for a long time because of the pools. I was very disappointed. Many of the pictures of the pool show an oasis of room to swim. When I got there, I noticed that there were all these palm trees on islands around the pool. That made it most challenging to swim in big areas. Every time you think you have a little room to swim, another island with a palm tree, obstructing.
    Checking in, I never saw something like I did. There had to be 2-300 people checking in. The line extended way back into the hallway of the hotel from the reservation desk, twisting around. I had already paid for my trip, so I went to the Kiosk to check in, automatically. When I was finishing up with the Kiosk, I wanted to change Credit card that I paid with and put a new card on file for charges. The Kiosk did not have the technology to do that.

    I went up to the reservation desk and saw a guy named Benjamin. Short, cru-cut style hair. He told me that my only option was to go to the end of the 2-300 person line. To change a credit card? When my vacation is paid for, you want me to wait 2-3 hours in the blazing heat to 30 second change my credit card? How is that good customer service? Benjamin seemed as if he could care less.  He also did not tell me that there was another line called Key and Mail. Although we waited 75 minutes on that line, it was much shorter than the regular check-in line. Over an hour to change a credit card on check-in. Every person on the Key and Mail line was dumbfounded as to why nobody seemed to care that people were waiting hours to check in.

     Also, at the Total Rewards desk, I went to get a copy of my card. I saw Anthony, who was working with the line for the high rollers. He said that he was in able to help me because I wasn't a high roller member. He said I had to go to the other side for the lower-tier members, which had three people on line and he had nobody on his line; and he couldn't be bothered helping me. I can't be a high roller if I can't get a card.

     The Wifi in the room was a disaster-never synced up. I was at Disney a week prior, and it was free. It was not at the Flamingo. 
    We were charged $300 for resort fee and room fee combined-I just don't know what services I got out of those charges. The buffet cost money every day.

Pros

The Flamingo in Las Vegas is in a convenient location on the strip a stone's throw from some of the major casinos and resorts. The staff is extremely professional and amicable. We dealt with Brian at the front desk and Jeanette in guest services both of whom were friendly.

Cons

Despite it's nice location, the room itself was rather gross. To start, the rates online were different than those that we paid. We wanted to pay in cash so we figured we would be better off making the reservation in person. After watching 3 desk agents get up and never come back there was a crowd full of people with only 2 staff members present. After finally making it to the front after 35 or 40 minutes the rates that we ended up paying were not those online but we were both so tired it wasn't even worth bringing up. Five minutes after putting our bags down we realized we made a mistake booking the hotel and wish we had only paid for one night upfront instead of two. There were black stains on the white shower curtain, hairs on the ceiling, mildew in the shower, no fan in the bathroom, no towel hooks in the wall and nicks on the wall. I was looking forward to taking a bath upon arrival but as soon as I saw the tub I knew I would wait until I went back home. Some of the appliances in the room were unplugged forcing us to move the furniture to plug it in ourselves. The sheets were coming off the bed and continued to do so for the rest of our stay. In terms of the WiFi, it was decent but on the slow end and only allowed for 2 devices to be connected at once. The room did not come with a refrigerator or microwave and if we wanted a fridge it was an additional $15 per night not including taxes. There was a constant and unpleasant odor that permeated throughout our room for the 2 nights we stayed. The walls are rather thin so when the people staying to the left of us were in their room we could actually hear the conversation clearly...from our bed...across the room. To top it off the air conditioner was extremely loud and rather irritating. The pools were alright. The pool for those over 21 looked fun but busy while the beach club pool was extremely overcrowded. We left before we even sat down after considering paying the $200 for a cabana just so we would not have to sit an inch away from strangers on either side of us. In addition you weren't allowed to bring water and bags are searched. If water is found they will make you throw it away or the security will not allow you in. Despite the friendliness of the staff and it's location I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Overall it was a rather gross experience. Honestly if I could have I would have gone back downstairs and immediately after check in and asked for a refund but we couldn't do so without a cancellation fee so we decided to stick it out. I wish we had though. 

The two nights before, we stayed in Tuscany Casino just off the strip and both of us wish we hadn't left. Even though it was 10 mins farther by walking we were better off with a more low key pool, and a room 3 times the size for a better price. Don't make the same mistake we did. Either pay more for a better hotel or stay at Tuscany if you don't mind walking farther.

I actually think Flamingo is one of the best resorts on the Strip. First of all, their strawberry daiquiri is the bomb. It's frozen with whipped cream on top, unlike some of the other casinos on the Strip that serve it as a shaken drink (and that's if they have strawberry flavoring at all. Whaaa?). The flamingos, parrots, and fish out back of the hotel all add to the experience. You can take pictures of all the animals and pay a small fee to hold the parrots. All in all, I really enjoyed Flamingo and I'll be back!

This hotel was way better than I expected. We got an awesome deal that could not be passed up so we booked it and scheduled our trip. We needed late check in and the hotel was very accommodating. When we got in, check in was a breeze and we we were in our room within 10 minutes. Only problem was that somehow we got a room that was nonsmoking but really smelled horrid (like someone had smoked there recently). We let the front desk know and they were able to change the room without much hassle.  Once they switched our room we got some neighbors that would call security because the TV was too loud, WTH?! Whatever, it's Vegas... if you go there to sleep then you have issues. Other than the little incidents, we had an awesome time and the hotel wasn't half as bad as I imagined it would. The pond with the flamingos, fish and ducks was a nice little addition. I can recommend this place, just don't expect too much!

Also, the location wasn't too bad. Just a little walk to the strip.

This hotel definitely needs some updating; the rooms were drab and the casino was old and quite smoky.  The check in line was really long, but the staff checked people in very quickly - that was impressive.  We stayed in the classic room which was very spacious, but dreary.  I think I will try a different hotel the next time I go to Vegas.

Trust me, splurge on a Go room.   But be prepared for plenty of pink.  And a very, very long line at check-in.

For the money, on the location, the petite Go Room is all you need as a home base in Vegas.  Mine was immaculately clean upon arrival, with crisp sheets and a comfortable coverlet on the king-sized bed.  

The Go Rooms aren't for everyone, though.  I was puzzled at first about the frosted glass surrounding the bathroom, and the ambient pink glow that diffused through the glass.  I ended up using the bathroom as a tacky Flamingo-pink nightlight.  (Since I usually end up leaving a light on in a strange place to keep from having a 3AM "Where the hell am I?" moment, this worked for me.)  The bathroom door was on a slider, which kept the room from feeling cramped.  

A lot of the room's space is taken up by the bath, and there's a lot of little touches to make this space feel upgraded.  The shower has some additional jets, but, they can't be angled, so at my short height, they were more awkward than luxurious.  I would have liked a tub, but, my room didn't include one.  There was tons of hot water and great water pressure, so no real complaint about the shower other than the lost opportunity to have it be just a little more fabulous.  The hidden television in the mirror was an amusement, and kind of neat when getting ready in the morning.  Toiletries supplied were a touch better than average, but I'd recommend hitting the Walgreens up the street for an upgrade.  

The luxury room faced the strip.  The 17th floor had a spectacular view of Caesar's palace and the Bellagio fountains.  But, a strange screen material made the view hazy -- it took me a while to realize that the screen was the building-sized advertisement for the Donnie and Marie show.  One of the best parts of staying at the Flamingo is that unlike Caesar's, you don't have to stare at that eyesore of an advertisement!  

Soundproofing was reasonably good, though I could occasionally hear a loudmouth next door.   The bed was comfortable.  And despite my repeated attempts to tip my maid, money was never, ever removed from the room. I felt that my belongings were secure, though, if you've got really valuable items, there's an in-room safe for them.  

Deeply disappointing, though is the $13.99 wired internet charge despite a premium price for the room.  Wireless is also available for a similar charge. Internet access is charged per device, so, choose wisely.  Phone service, like most phone service in Vegas, is insanely overpriced - bring your cell phone.

The Flamingo has a small garden with its namesake birds and a few other unusual specimens, a relaxing refuge from all the casino action.  The Vegas ghost tour stops through there at night to tell some spooky tales.  But, late at night, I was approached in the garden by far spookier panhandlers looking for a cigarette handout.  I doubt that'd happen at Caesar's, and it make me question the overall security of the property.  Each night, fliers were slipped under the door - timeshare promos, pizza parlors.  Nothing terrible, but, it appears that the Flamingo doesn't necessarily monitor things quite as vigorously as some of its sister properties.  

I spoke with a few other guests when relaxing in the garden, watching the wedding parties take their photos.  From what I heard, some other guests encountered uneven service - a diabetic unable to obtain a refrigerator for a regular (non-Go) room, others complaining of sub-par linens on the beds.  So, not all rooms at the Flamingo are created equal, and special requests might go ignored.

But, I'd stay in a Go room again in a heartbeat.  The close proximity to the Strip and the relatively petite size of the property compared to a lot of the other megacasinos nearby makes this a great launching pad for your Vegas adventures.  Stock up the minifridge as your own personal minibar with a trip to the Alberson's up the street, and you've got your own personal haven from the noise and the bustle below when you need an escape.

if you are going to stay at Flamingo -- be sure to stay in their Go rooms. Seriously. The Go rooms are super nice. The room kinda reminded me of Austin power and a little porno vibeish but in a good way. 42 inch flat screen, surround sound, big bathroom, electronic curtains, plenty of room for even two people and a great view of the pool and the strip. Plus the elevators to the Go rooms are few feet away from the pool. Flamingo opened a separate pool for hotel guests but with a fee of $10. Paying for the additional fee is very worth the price because you literally have the privacy of your own pool and its not crowded at all.

Thank you flamingo for making my trip memorable.

Oh my where do I begin? This hotel is the worst resort that I have stayed in and I have been to Vegas four times already this year. The fabulous deluxe room was nothing close to being fabulous. It was more like ridiculous. Thank God I got a weekday special rate on Expedia for 40 dollars because I would have been livid if I had to pay a penny more. The bathroom was dated and filled with mildew and dirt. The room decor was very cheesy and cheap looking. The staff was awesome, and the casino gaming area and food court was the only thing worth seeing.

Flamingo Hotel room 5154 was freezing cold. We couldn't control room temp. The Hotel offers NO amenities. The Hotel offers NO room service past 1 am!!, really, in Vegas. The room faced north and was extremely noisy because of the music being played between Flamingo and Linq. I called front desk and was politely told they didn't care the room was paid for! I would never recommend staying at Flamingo Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas to any one.

I've stayed here many times before, but this would probably be my last stay here. The hotel is extremely disgusting. Checking in was painful since the employee who "helped" us was really unhelpful. We asked for a good room near the buffet, and what we got was not worth it. As I got into the elevator, I could tell something was obviously wrong. The elevator was really old and it felt really unsafe inside it. The elevator doors had almost closed in on my brother if i had not pulled him in. If any Flamingo employees are reading this, you should really check out elevator #14 and renovate all the elevators.The room was dirty, restroom was disgusting, smelled like smoke and other horrible things, and the room was overall really small. Breakfast items were insanely expensive. We then went down to the lobby to ask for different room. The employee who sat there, simply rolled her eyes, while looking at the floor and her hand and nails said,"Oh I'm sorry, but you can't change your room after you paid for it. Its just our policy." I could have been more disappointed. I would not recommend any new visitors to stay here.

We love staying at the Flamingo! Have stayed here a few times, upgrade to a GO room, its a quite a bit better than a standard room.  The location of the Flamingo makes it one of our favorite places to stay in Vegas, right in the center of everthing at a pretty good rate.  We also love going to the pool, have been in both pools, if you want something calm stay in the family friendly pool, if you are in the mood for a more party like atmosphere go the GO Pool.  The drink prices are comparable for Las Vegas, they do have some nice souvenir cups there.  The casino itself is for the most pretty lively at times, the sportsbook is ok here, and they do have a few good options here in their food court.  The convience stores in here are decent too for anything you need or forgot at home, and they do have a entrance to the monorail system here.  The Flamingo is one of the better places to stay in Vegas, it may not have everything a person wants, but fits my needs great.

Unlikely that we will stay here again... Check in line was ridiculous, had a NON SMOKING room but every time we turned the air on it reeked of cigarette smoke both at the time the air was on and smelled as if someone had just smoked one in there every time we returned. Valet was full the second day we were there & the bellhop was extremely rude & demanded a tip when we were obviously going to give him one anyway for loading our luggage. Salespeople advertising in the lobby constantly hounded us but then backed off because we weren't "married" or "over 25".

Booked a room here months in advance.
Got an email a week before saying they were doing renovations.
They told me they'd move me to another hotel.
I requested that I be fully refunded my deposit and charged no further.
They refunded me.
Then they charged me again.

I actually really like this casino, but the hotel is TERRIBLY run.

Stayed for 3 days in last month, it was midweek so the prices were on the lower side but that didn't lower the experience.  I had a king room, which was pretty good. Had decent food choices and the best thing was it was right on the strip. The only complaint that I would have is the AC, the noise was on the higher side. But all in all, it was worth the stay.

I give this four stars because it is four stars for what it is--decent rooms, great pool, PERFECT location.

Yes, I agree, it's not the Bellagio.  Yeah the hotel is nothing over the top.  But you can't beat the location, especially if you've never been to Vegas before.  Being right in the middle of the strip, everything is within reasonable walking distance.  

If you do stay here, you MUST go across the street to Serendipity for sandwiches!  A wait for a table for four people for lunch on the weekends would boggle your mind, but if you are there during the week (or you can wait to eat!) then it is sooooooo worth visit!

Perhaps the best deal on the strip for a room.  If you want a room in the middle of the strip and not want to pay high prices...but don't want to stay in a dump *cough* the Quad *cough*, then stay at the Flamingo.

Rooms are clean...not many bells and whistles.  Rooms are cheap...not the greatest casino and the casino kinda smells like the inside of your Grandmother's purse (mixture of makeup powder and ribbon candy).  Speaking of makeup...there is this one place that sells makeup there and the employees are extremely pushy.  One grabbed my fiance and attempted to sell her over $500 dollars worth of product.  He said his "wife loves it."  The dude was speaking with hand motions and a high pitch voice.  You have no wife Carlos!  So is my fiance supposed to trust you about the makeup you are trying to sell her?  

The flamingos are neat to look at.  Did you know they are pink because of the stuff they eat?  Imagine if people were like that.  Half the country would be the color of a Big Mac.

Stay here and save money.  Clean, decent, in the middle of everything, and cheap.

Flamingo Las Vegas Hotel and Casino stay between May 24-28:

Thank you Flamingo staff and my personal VIP total experiences group host, Sheri Schreiber -Total Experiences\/VIP Manager 3570 Las Vegas Blvd. South; Las Vegas, NV 89109 - Direct 702.731.7451 | Office 702.731.7238
sschreiber@caesarspalace.com | Fax 702.888.1835 

Now to details. Over arguably the busiest weekend of the year, nothing was missed. I had more than 10 rooms assigned to my birthday party. Every request and detail was fulfilled. I needed some people to be in adjoining rooms and others I just wanted on my floor. It worked well. 

I am so pleased with how well everything worked out. Seriously, if I had to do it all over again, I wouldn't change a thing.  Sheri was really comforting, understanding and resourceful.  She was challenged by the fact that I knew the landscape of Vegas more than most tourists - but she still was willing to go the extra mile in any and every circumstance. 

Hotel Room:  All of the resort rooms have now been updated to Fab rooms. They have hardwood floors and I believe the bathrooms have not been updated, but seriously it's a bathroom - if you spend too much time in here - you are doing the wrong things in Vegas. The bed was comfy and the AC worked well. I was very pleased given that I stayed here like 5 years ago for a wedding and I wasn't happy. This time I am so happy to see the improvements they've made. 

Pool: What can I say about the pool which hasn't already been said?  It is just fun and you will have a great time.  I like the fact that you can have a spot to party your a$$ off and you can also find a place to lay low and relax. 

Food:  We didn't eat inside Flamingo so we can't comment on this. In the past, we have enjoyed food at Margaritaville. You won't go wrong there for food or a party environment or both. 

Gambling: The tables are the standard going rates for middle of the strip.

Valet\/self-parking:  This is a super busy weekend, but I was very disappointed how many times the valet was full unless you are a seven-star member (gambling\/entertainment card through Harrah's) 

I will do this again in a heartbeat.  Don't read the older reviews - read this one and know it is completely accurate. This hotel has learned from the past and they have invested a good amount of money to make it better. 

Lastly, they were smart to use self-checking kiosks because the lines at times were extremely long - just a tip if you want to bypass the regular check in line. 

Have a great time and be sure if you have a group event - reach out to Sheri - thanks again!

I actually really enjoy staying at this hotel. Being that it's one of the oldest hotel in Las Vegas, it's a nice place to be at. My room wasn't too bad either. It had a bit of a feminine vibe to it. Polka dot couch in the corner, pink shaggy throws on the bed, and some other pink decorations in the room. The rooms gave off a nice, clean, smoke-free environment. 

This hotel is better than most of the other hotels I've stayed at. They offer more places to eat at. There's a food court as well as other small coffee joints inside the hotel. There were cafes as well as pizza parlors. 

Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Couldn't really ask for anything better for the price I had paid for. The only thing that had scared me a little were the elevators. I find it odd that there's no 13th floor on my building!

The Flamingo is definitely A-OK in my book. It's definitely not the nicest hotel on the strip, but for the price you get prime location and a pretty nice pool.

I paid $300 for three nights in a suite last weekend, seriously can't beat that price. But, it's true - the amenities are lacking. While there was lots of space in the room, the beds are meh (although very clean), the carpets are pretty dirty, the bathtub is straight outta 1981, and there's no minibar in the room.

I've stayed in the go-rooms before, and while they are much smaller than this suite, there are definitely a nicer experience. 

The service was nice throughout though and I really really enjoy the Flamingo pool. It's adults only (except for a small, very separate pool elsewhere for kids), it's pretty huge, they play good music, and they have cheap craps tables poolside. 

Would I stay there again? ...meh, I'd probably suck it up and upgrade to a Go-Room if I did. While I don't spend a ton of time in the hotel room when I'm in Vegas, it is much nicer to have a big plush bed and a schmancy shower waiting for you when you do get back to the room.

Greatly Disappointed

 We spent 3 nights at this hotel during our stay for a conference in Las Vegas in September 2005.
The room was adequate...but we expected much more for the amount of money we paid.
The pool is always crowded - to a point where it's unpleasant. It's a beautiful pool, however, they close it frequently to cater to private parties - as early as 5PM.
During our last night, the hotel decided to have a party for, what the security department said was 10,000 people in the courtyard, which about 50% of the rooms face. It started at 8PM and continued until at least 1PM. They had the sound system blaring and it was unbearable. They are more interested in making money off of private parties than keeping their customers happy. In order to have 10,000 people - you need a VENUE - not a POOL outside of everyone's windows.
However, upon our complaint (since we had an early flight to catch we had to sleep!) they did find us a new room quickly. They didn't offer to move all of our stuff for us, but they did bring up the key. The room we were moved to was almost worth the $230 a night they charged. Almost.
So, if you're planning a stay on the strip, I have two pieces of advice:
1. Book EARLY so you're not stuck, and
2. Do NOT stay at the Flamingo.
The Hilton Company should be ashamed!
P.S. Our last stay was at the Luxor which was great...check it out!

I wish I could post black holes instead of stars! I really wish I could post this with 0 stars.

When we checked out they tried to charge additional fees because we were there on a holiday. I was already paying holiday rates! The supervisor became snippy and turned her computer screen towards me so I could read the fine print. At this point 5 employees before her had the opportunity to tell me about the "fine print" including the person who booked our room. No one had uttered a word about increased package fees until that moment. Really Flamingo? You are so desperate that you have to rip off your customers? Along comes the manager who eventually credits my account the overcharge. She acknowledges that the property is aware of the room problems BUT OFFERS NO APOLOGY for the issues.

Stay away from this place!!!! And Harrah's in general!!!!!!!!!!!

The spa is horrible! I have nothing bad to say about the rooms and staff at the flamingo. the rooms are great and the staff is amazing but the spa is an entirely different story. 
Their price is 45 dollars for a wash and blow dry but what they don't tell you is that is for a pixie cut! I have fairly long hair so mine cost 130 dollars! And she didn't tell me this till she was about to wash my hair! Then she tried to charge me 20$ for conditioner! Last time I checked that's part of washing my hair! After that she tried to get me to color my hair, highlight my hair, cut my hair, do my eyebrows and try to sell me product! I felt harassed! At the end I had a horrible cowlick and I looked like a poodle! It's not very hard to blow dry someone's hair straight! And if all of that wasn't enough when I was done the makeup girl pulled me aside and tried to sell me another overly expensive product for 10 minutes! I will NEVER go back again, I know Vegas is different but I've never had a worse experience in my life! I have come to this hotel 2 times a year for the last 3 years but this made me so disappointed!

We were going for a girls weekend and the flamingo was the heart of the strip. We got in around 11pm and parked in the parking garage $10 a day. We walked into the main lobby (extremely far from the garage) and waited in line. It was a line of maybe 10 people and it took us one hour to get to the front of the line. We booked on Travelocity for the upgraded room and the told us they didn't have one and they couldn't make sure we had  that room since we didn't book directly through them. So they gave us a $30 resort credit. The next day we had to wait till 12 to change rooms. I highly recommend to pay the extra $25 for the better room. So much nicer than the basic room we stayed in the first night. Overall we had a good time once we switched rooms. We wee told our room key would pay for parking and when we tried to use the room key it didn't work. You have to be an upgraded customer to get free parking. All I can say is we probably won't be staying here again

Came here for a work workshops and I'll probably not come back until they upgrade the basic necessities to please a customer.  I was assigned the 27th floor in the habitat elevators.

cons:
-arrived 1130pm to check in.  while waiting for an hour in a long line, my buddy had enough time to buy us two slices of pizza.  We finished it and we weren't anywhere closer to the the front of the line.  There were 3 employees at the front desk checking in a line that was more than 25 people long. -- take advantage of online check-in if you can

-elevators go to every floor.  What does that mean for someone on the 27th floor?  Stops at every floor imaginable going up and down.  Watching people hop on and off while I wait to reach for the skiies.  It's worse going down because it stops at every floor for everyone trying to get the heck out of their floors.

-Advised to keep keycard away from phone.  Um. . .it's 2015 and everyone has a phone.  I'll need my keycard and phone while I wander the strip and need to return to my temporary abode.  My consequence? Keycard denies my entry to my room and I stand in front of my room like a reject.  Then I proceed back down the elevator to get my card fixed and go back up.  Precious time wasted.

-hot water takes a while to flow

-heater didn't work

pros
-they offer a $7 shuttle direct to airport, picks up every 15 minutes
-central to the strip
-peaceful fish ponds and flamingos

Litterally the worst hotel I have ever stayed at why foam pillows with dirty pillow cases I get what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas but not the after math of the bed sheets ac didn't even work and the bed was shit along with the room and staff

My friend and I stayed an extra night in Vegas so we decided to book a cheap hotel room. $60 for a Monday night in Vegas. Wasn't too bad, the hotel looks ghetto from the inside and outside (compared to the nicer hotels on the strip). We hadda room on the 28th level, right across from Caesars Palace and hadda decent angle of the Bellagio fountains. The room is pretty small, but I guess you get what you pay for. I would give it three stars for being one of the cheaper hotels on the strip...but for some reason, the hotel reeked of ass and urinal cakes.

Good location, cupcake shop, Yardhouse Restaurant right outside the door. Quiet room. 
What was annoying:
Not enough seating in room. There was a small desk and chair, and a backless faux leather bench to sit on. We like to make drinks in our room and it wasn't comfortable at all. What if you order in?
I guess you have to eat on the bed.
Went to breakfast buffet downstairs $26.95 pp. The heat was out of order in the restaurant. It had to be 50 degrees F. The cashier should have asked us if we still wanted to dine there even though the heat was out of service. The staff was wearing heavy jackets while working.
Smoke\/Fire alarms in lobby\/casino were malfunctioning from 7-9am. My husband and I were awakened by it and we could hear it from 8 floors up. 
No coffeemaker in room.
The $25 per day Resort Fee should include a coffeemaker.

Do not stay in the rooms facing the Off the Strip alley side - the music down there plays until 5am and it's louder than anything I've every heard in all my years visiting Vegas.

Carpet is buckling in the hallways, only one or two elevators seem to work and the food here blows. This place needs a major make-over.

II reserved my room months ago.  I have a bathtub and high floor as part of my standing requests wit Caesars' hotels.  I was given a room with the shower only, but the view was good. It was given to me "for my birthday",not because I am Platinum and my boyfriend is Diamond in rewards status.  As this trip was to celebrate my birthday with my son, I chose this hotel over other hotels due to the pools.

I let the front desk know that I wanted a bathtub. Unfortunately they did not have anything with a decent view and the bathtub. This highly unfortunate for those of us raised in Europe and others who prefer baths over showers.  The front desk associate said that she would see what could be done.  I am over 2\/3 of the way to Diamond status myself, and they could not give us a room upgrade for our patronage or my birthday.  Boyfriend was already pushing to drop Caesars and go to the M-life casinos more often.  This made us both angry, as our privileges have been cut drastically.

Our room had a great view, and very persistent housekeeping.  However the wallpaper is peeling from the entrance of the bathroom, and the bathroom door does not slide closed completely. The handle was also falling off the door.  Beware if you flush the toilet it will not flush again for another 2 to 3 minutes.

In a city where nothing closes, the pool at this hotel closes at 6 PM and the water slides close at 5:30 PM, and are open only seasonally and on weekends.  Apparently 110 degrees on a Wednesday does not warrant the slides to be open.  Part of the water slide area has been given to the adult area.  Uncool.  No one can use the slide as there is no access to it.  To make matters worse, there is a temporary iron barrier that is not bolted down.  First day I saw this fall on someone as they snuck under. The lifeguard at the end, in the adult area sent the teen girl back.  It actually fell on her as she was going under it.  The second time I went to the pool it did not go as smoothly.  A teenage boy went under the barrier and pulled it down on the foot on one of the mothers in the area.  We requested her ice.  They should have offered it before being asked.  They did not offer her a chair. Apparently chairs and small containers of eye drops are dangerous but slippery steps and walkways and falling barriers are safe.

Another major issue for the any age pool is the stairs to the slide and down to the pools have no nonslip surface. They are extremely slippery when wet.  I slid and dropped my cell phone. Fortunately they cover protected and it popped off only leaving myself and my phone wet.

On the first trip down to the pool my eyes watered and burned from the chlorine.  The second time I went to the pool a security guard would not let me in the pool with my 1\/2 oz. bottle of dry eye tears.  I have dry sensitive eyes.

I have not stayed at the hotel in a couple years, but we use the Margaritaville craps table the most. I don't think I will be coming back to this hotel anytime soon, as there are other Caesars hotels that are much better in regard to quality of rooms, management, pools and customer service.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights, and while it wasn't what we expected we did leave pretty satisfied. The room itself was very spacious and accommodating. We ended up upgrading at the desk for $30 extra a night which wasn't too bad. Unfortunately our toilet was leaking water everywhere for a day and a half and their solution to fix the issue was to give us lots of towels until the maintenance guy came to repair it. Also housekeepers don't knock before entering your room which was very awkward and uncomfortable. We were fortunately clothed and decent but it would have been weird if we weren't. Lol we had a great view, super comfy bed and great speakers to play music while we were getting ready. Front desk were really friendly and refunded us both nights on the resort fees. Baggage storage guy was really rude and obviously didn't want to be there but expected a tip. Didn't catch his name unfortunately. All in all it was my favorite hotel out of the five I've stayed at in Vegas. And even though it wasn't a perfect stay I left happy, same for my boyfriend.
Great hotel! So clean and nice! Right next to everything on the strip.

We specifically searched for Las Vegas hotels based upon their pool facilities.  We found a site which listed the Top Ten Vegas Hotel Pools, and the Flamingo got the #2 spot.  So, we plunked down the bigger bucks for rooms in this hotel.

Pool experience....bunk.  

Strike one: the hot tubs and adult areas are segregated from the family friendly areas.  Which means that if you are a family or a group with families and childless couples, you may have to choose between being able to let the kids have fun or let the adults have fun.

Strike two:  Closed for "wind".  Sure it was a bit windy and cool, but when better to enjoy a cocktail in a hottub.

Strike three: some kid threw up in the water slide area so they CLOSED THE ENTIRE pool complex for the rest of the day!  

Basically, after spending hundreds of dollars to stay at the #2 pool in Vegas ended up being reduced to 1 hour of pool time for the entire 4 night stay.  Big disappointment.

l like this hotel but I found  that they  have a lot problems having a good hospitality. The customer services is really bad if you are not agree on what they say they start acting  rude. The pictures that appeared online when you reserver room is completely  different than you actually room. The sanitation of the room is   really poor you can find dust and mold in the bathroom  especially in the fan or AC . The service  room takes 3 hrs before the bring you a clean and fresh towel. May be no more Flamingos for me. There is not free water or Ice.

I recently stayed at the Flamingo Las Vegas. On the last night we stayed, our room was broken into while we sleeping in it and our phones, cash, and my engagement ring were stolen.  When we woke up we realized that someone broke into our room because the door would not properly shut all the way and the night latch was also broken.  We called security and he did his "inspection" by looking at the door and taking photos of the broken latch with his CELL PHONE (not an actual camera for incidents).  He also only had us fill out two incident report forms even though there were four of us whose property had been stolen.  When we went to speak with the manager about the faulty lock and that someone had been in our room while we were sleeping which was a threat to our safety; the manager would not do anything but say she was sorry and only the risk management and security would be able to further help us.  I was outraged to see that as a customer who had just been through an inconceivable event that I was so quickly tossed to the side.  I also believe that because it happened on our last night and everything had been paid for, they did not care one bit about helping us; only to move us along so they could help the next customer checking in.  I told her that I did not want to pay for room that was damaged and obviously put our safety at risk.  I asked several times if she or another manager would come to the room to see the damaged lock and she refused and continued to say that only risk management and security take care of these issues.  In the following days, I contacted the risk management.  Once I finally got a hold of him (being that my phone call was never returned and), he informed me that because there was not any other key used to enter the room (a maids key for example) he sides with the hotel and sent the incident to a third party.  When I asked him if he ever saw the photos that the security guard took with his cell phone of the broken night latch, he said he had not received them but the report said that there were photos taken.  I asked him to send those photos to the third party as soon as he received them and he said he would.  However, once I was in contact with the third party, she said she had not received them.  I realized after getting off the phone with him that was not right for him to have made a decision about our incident when he had not even seen the photos.  In fact I am currently trying to get a hold of him to find out if he obtained the photos yet or if I may send the ones I took to him.  However, whenever I call I only reach an answering machine and am never called back.  I could never have imagined having such a horrendous experience at the Flamingo Las Vegas.  I also never thought I would be treated to badly and unprofessional by people that are in in upper management or are in charge of handling important issues and customer service.  It shocks me that these are people who should be representing the Flamingo and all of Caesar's the most.  They should have been helping me, the customer who had just been offended in their hotel while sleeping; instead of giving a continuous customer service reply of "We are sorry that happened but..."  It truly demonstrated that this company does not care about their customers or what happens on their facilities.  

Not only did the hotel refuse to reimburse us for the hotel room that was damaged, after arguing with the third party about what was lost, we found out that due to "Inn Keepers Laws" in Nevada, only 750.00$ could be given for any lost or damaged items. Which is no where close to replacing cell phones and and engagement ring.  

Overall, if you want to be treated with respect and professionalism for the $100's your putting in to your trip, don't plan your staying at any resort that is associated with the Flamingo (Harrahs, Caesars, Ballys, ect.)

Beautiful rooms. Loved the pink themes. Gorgeous views of the bellagio fountains and Ceaser palace fountains. Conveniently located mid strip. Amenities galore. Best than most hotels on the strip. Coffeemaker. Fridge. Iron. Hairdryer. 

I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at the flamingo hotel. My room was fabulous and more superior than my rooms at the linq, Paris, palazzo, venetian, Tropicana and even comparable to the Wynn.  Yes you heard me. The flamingo go rooms are in that league. 

Newly renovated with posh white pleather and pink walls. The chic rooms were clean and well taken care of. I was surprised that there were the most amenities available than any of the above mentioned hotels. A fridge, and coffeemaker were the best to have in my room. And made my stay more enjoyable. With cold water and hot coffee available anytime it really saved me money every single day. I loved the double shower head with one specifically for your back. And the iron and hairdryer were great additions for my nights out on the strip. WiFi was fast and I never had any problems being kicked off or with lagging Internet. Remote controlled curtains were a nice touch if you wanted to block out the fabulous view of the bellagio fountains.

The location can't be beat unless you are staying at Ceaser palace. Which I believe has the best location on the strip.  But it is easily accessible and walkable to all parts of the strip. Being mid strip meant less walking and no real need for a car during my stay here. Like I said...staying here saves you money.

The bed was comfortable and comparable to the lovely mattresses at the Wynn or palazzo. The room was new and cleaner than most hotels I have stayed at. There was plenty of space. I found the hotel to be quiet and I had no problems with noise during my stay. (See my horrible experience at the linq). I had no issues with the elevators. It was fast especially going down from your room on the higher floors (I was on floor 26)

The pleather and pink walls made me feel like a princess and the entire room was beautifully decorated. There was a TV in my room and my bathroom. Which my son appreciated. 

There's flamingos on the main floor. Very cool and relaxing vibe in hectic Las Vegas.  The go pool is a large 18+ pool with plenty of booty shaking madness. There's also a large slide too. Room guests get in on free despite a charge on Saturdays. 

Tips: 1. Ask for a room in the lobby towers facing the fountains at bellagio. 2. The go rooms are worth every penny. Despite being comped during my stay. The resort fee of $29 a day is worth the fabulous WiFi you receive. (Hey you pay $30 a day at encore or have to put up with lagging Internet everywhere else). 3. Tip $20 on check in. I'm pretty sure that's why I was upgraded with my comped offer.

Fabulous stay. I think I'll have to come back because my room was that fabulous. Don't believe all the bad reviews. Because I can't rave about this hotel any more. It's sooooo much better than Paris,  linq and palazzo combined!

My boyfriend and I just stayed here, I paid for a "remodeled" fab deluxe room and there was nothing fab about it. The bathroom wasn't remodeled, there was mildew in the tub and the shower was luke-warm at best. The carpet in the hallways was stained and rippled. The electricity was out for several hours and we had to walk down 24 flights of stairs to get out of the hotel with constant fire alarms ringing. There was room service trash sitting in the hallway for two days. At the pool we waited an hour and a half before they would let us in the pool (because of the power outage), and we couldn't get any service for food, despite asking someone several times for a food menu. We also gambled for several hours at the electronic craps table without any drink service. When we checked out, I requested to speak to a manager, who didn't even bother to come and apologize for the terrible experience, but instead just offered a credit of the resort fees, which doesn't even come close to comping the terrible experience we had. Next time we will spend more money to stay at a hotel that actually cares about their guests' experiences because it's clear that at the Flamingo the customer does not come first.

I would definitely stay here again.

It's not the nicest and most ballin place on the Strip, but the rates are good, the casino is decent. The pool is nice. Don't go to the GO "adult" pool, its $15 for guys and is a waste. Everyone is hanging out at the free pool anyway.

The upgraded GO room is funky and nice. We had an incredible view of the Strip (Full on view of the Bellagio water show, although I was too drunk most of the time so I missed it)....

Anyway I recommend staying here.

First of all, for all you guys criticizing this Hotel, you guys are expecting too much.  What you should expect is a decent, well-priced mediocre hotel, with a perfect location on the strip.  Any higher expectations than that and you might as well stay at the Wynn for 4 times the price.

As I'm writing this review, they have a special starting from $35\/night I found at http:\/\/www.mycheapvegas.com\/.  Also, there's a coupon for free buffet with a Nathan Burton show ticket, which is a pretty decent magic show.

All this with a poker room that has a great atmosphere and a decent cocktail service and what you get is a pretty good vacation.

Go for the location, go for the price, just don't go expecting a 5 star world class hotel.  Cheers!

Stayed here on a last minute Vegas trip since it was pretty inexpensive. First problem that there was no parking in the garage. All the spots were for valet, car rentals and hilton grand vacations. Finally found a spot on the roof and took the ghetto elevator to the lobby. Checked in and had to drag all our luggage through the casino with a bunch of steps to get to the elevators. When we finally get to our floor we have to walk forever to get to our room. I've heard the rooms were renovated but they're not that great. It's like when a house is flipped and they're trying to do the least amount possible to make it look better. The floors in the room and the countertop in the bathroom are new, and the rest is crap. Also the pillows are crap which is a sign of a crappy hotel. The pool area is pretty nice and that's about it. Still good enough for the price and location though.

I highly suggest you get a "GO room" because they are newer in comparison. Thumbs up for being pet friendly as well! You can get discounted rates if you and your guest are Total Rewards members. That goes for any property listed under the Total Rewards card!
Yes, Flamingo is an older hotel, but for it's location on the strip + cost = not terrible. I opt to gamble at the casinos nearby anyway. I've personally never had a bad experience with the front desk, security or customer service.

Disclaimer- Since I live in LV....This is a review from going, not staying at the Flamingo Hotel.

Had a friend visiting that wanted to go to the Flamingo to play 3 card poker. So I tagged along. I don't remember the public areas of the hotel being so nice. I think they renovated recently, and you can really tell. It was clean and bright and cheerful. And shockingly did not smell like old shoes and cigarettes, as some of the older casinos do.

Walked all around, and discovered an adorable food court area I had never seen, Little coffee cafes that had sitting right next to the pool area, and an easy walk through right into "The Quad" ( A fun shopping street in between the Linq and Flamingo)
This place was awesome!  Reasonable priced, great location, kick ass pool and very few meat heads.  Next time in Vegas I will be there!

Staying here as a come on for a time share.  Room seems clean except for the vent in the shower, ick needs to be cleaned.  No water pressure in the shower.  No fridge. Bed is hard as a pine board, guess they don't want you hanging out there.  TV is also there to tell you to not be in the room.  There is a dire lack of handicapped parking. The resort fees, considering the crappy bed and lack of dining, were outrageous.

The room was rather nice, and clean with a comfy bed. But it smelled like smoke. 
I was woken every day by housekeeping because my Do Not Disturb sign disappeared 3 times. On the last day I was yelled at by housekeeping to leave at 11 even though their own web site allowed me to check out at 12:30. The person in the phone accused me of lying. Front desk clerk offered no apology when presented with a screen shot. 
The buffet is not very good, and Costa more than first-class places like Bellagio and wicked spoon. The wifi is absolutely terrible and the elevators are filthy, slow, atrocious death traps.

Stayed at the Flamingo w\/ a friend who had a room here for a conference (so I didn't pay, but I can still Yelp, can't I??!?).  Anyway, I was thinking I'd give this place 3-stars.  I mean it's alright.  The room is adequate and fairly basic.....but c'mon!  This is Vegas.  Everything should be at a higher level here.  

The bathroom was a little junky and there were some rusted fixturing in the bath tub.  Internet access was not free.  The walls weren't terribly noise-proof.

It was a decent place though.  The hotel is HUGE!  It was like a maze getting to our room---the room was so far from the elevator.  

All in all an average experience at one of Vegas' historic hotels.

I love wildlife, fountains, greenery, and the color pink, so naturally I was charmed by this place when we found it by chance as we explored The Strip. The buffet is affordable, about 20 per person, and it has everything-- seafood, California rolls, American dishes, fruit, desserts, and all kinds of delicious items. The Wildlife Habitat right by the restaurant was enchanting. I saw flamingos (obviously), ducks, and even a BLACK swan swimming along with the bright-colored fishes. A true delight for the transcendentalist soul and photographers alike. I'd definitely consider staying here in the future.

April 24-28, 2012

Las Vegas hoteliers have not learned how to run a registration desk. The Flamingo was no different from my experienced at the Bellagio, Wynn, Monte Carlo, etc. Under staffed, lengthy lines, inordinate delays on check-in. Note to management: Nevada has one of the highest unemployment rates in the U.S. Place a classified ad!

I was, however, offered an upgrade to a remodeled room for only $10.00 additional per night. I took a room on the eighth floor overlooking the casino roof and, more importantly, the flamingo nature preserve. Comfortable beds, clean, good air conditioning. Negatives included no shampoo initially, faulty sink drain, unusable safe, and exceptionally poor 4g wireless connection. Phone service was essentially 2g including Android service. Unless you pay extra for house broadband.

Hallways smell of cigarettes, carpet seems left behind by Bugsy himself. Ancient, not in a collectible way.

In the lobby, hawkers of show tickets block entry on occasion to the elevator banks. Bring aspirin for headaches from smoke and noise in the casino.

So far so great! We arrived Vegas around 7am so we killed time by looking around the strip. Played a couple rounds at osheas. Then once it was time to check in the front desk guy was pretty dam nice to us and upgraded us to better room with a magnificent view, (only 25 bucks more a night). Which really isn't bad. This hotel, so far, is fine with me and my group. Since it's my husbands birthday, he is enjoying it very much! I totally recommend people to stay at this hotel, it might be oldest building out here, but it sure is keeping us in great smiles. Thanks flamingo, keep it up!

Checked in on a Friday, checked out on a Sunday. Valet closes their services to their guests, will only help you if you have a diamond rewards card. So this leaving you to self park. Except, it's not that that simple. The parking structures were COMPLETELY full. I was instructed to go park about two blocks away, by a dark alley (full of panhandlers). Normally, this wouldn't be a big deal if I didn't have my two kids with me and if it wasn't dark. Beware of the parking issue as it's not secured even as a guest!! And their plumbing sucks. The sink and tub need some serious attention. Be prepared to take a bath while you're taking a shower. And sink fills up if you're trying to wash your face. I am NEVER staying here again.

As anyone who reads my hotel reviews knows, I'm not super discriminating. I'm usually in Vegas for trade shows and don't spend much time in my room anyway. So, provided my hotel has easy access to whatever convention center, hot water and a comfortable bed, my complaints are typically minimal.

I stayed at the Flamingo for 2014 CES and don't really have anything bad to say. It's on the monorail loop (two stops to the LV convention center), there's some pretty decent, if not easy and convenient dining options, lots of bars and shops, and friendly staff. 

The Total Rewards program is worth it - my rate for 4 days at the Flamingo was less than one night a hotels that were a bit closer to the CES venue, but with a huge show like that you've got to expect jacked up prices.

The only really negative thing I'd say about this place is the hallway carpets have seen much better days - they need a steam clean, stat. Also, it didn't seem like the staff was too quick to grab room service trays and empty glasses out of the hallways. Not a deal breaker, but kind of off-putting.

I'd definitely stay at the Flamingo again - it's reasonably priced and pretty comfortable - and that typically fits my needs in sin city. If you're looking for value, it's a great spot. If you're looking for luxury, this probably isn't the place for you.

Very nice room!  Allows dogs. You have to give a little deposit but if your dog doesn't do anything crazy then you get it back.  Very trendy. 

Casino was kind of trashy.  The whole girl on a bar top dancing.... :\/

THERE. WAS. A. USED. CONDOM. IN. OUR. ROOM. 

DISGUSTING.  Unfortunately, my bf and I didn't discover the used condom on the floor behind the door until the 2nd day.  When I first walked in after checking in, I looked around and saw a bobby pin on the bathroom sink, makeup streaks on the mirror, and white stains on their chair\/lounger thing.  I decided to ignore them since the hotel was cheap and we only wanted it for a home base.  But after seeing the used condom, we freaked out and immediately went to the concierge to let them know.

Concierge: We let them know, they apologized and said they'd take care of it.  We asked if we could change rooms, they said to talk to front desk.  

There are a bajillion people standing in line waiting to check in so we waited in the keys\/mail line for 30+ minutes as the next in line.

Front Desk: apologized, changed rooms, and offered us a $50 food\/drink credit at their approved locations.  Really? Not to be greedy or anything but that's it? You were negligent enough to let me sleep a night in the presence of someone else's bodily fluids and that's it?? By booking on Yelp, I get $20 in food and drinks!

Back to old room to get our stuff: condom still there, by now it's been 45 min since we've told someone. Don't you think that this is something you send someone up to take care of IMMEDIATELY?  What if we couldn't get our room switched, we would have to put up w\/ this disgusting thing for longer? I sure as **** won't touch it.

Other things wrong with this place:  

Hair drier didn't work, half the outlets didn't work, phone couldn't call front desk, elevators didn't work half the time, hotel hallways had empty bottles of gatorade, trash.

Construction on the floor blocking off our route to our room, we had to take the elevator to the 7th floor w\/ our luggage, walk all the way to another elevator, come down the stairs with luggage to get to our room...  

Our new room had a wonderful view of a roof. Whatever, don't care... until I woke up one morning, opened the blinds and find a bunch of dudes staring back at me because they're working on the roof.  I wasn't dressed for the day yet. Ugh.

Food: we used our credit on their buffet, so not worth it and they almost weren't going to honor it because we had checked out literally 10 min ago until my bf was so pissed he just yelled BULLSH*T.  "How are we going to charge you if you checked out already?" Um you don't, $50 is more than enough to cover your crappy brunch buffet.

TLDR: Sure, 2nd room was cleaner, and location of the Flamingo is convenient
 but don't gamble on the cleaniness of this place, go elsewhere.

This is our first time staying in Flamingo. We overall satisfied with our room. It was on 21st floor facing the High Roller and it was romantic and we highly recommended than the strip view.

For the price, is reasonable and fit to our budget. Location is very nice and convenient right in the middle of the vegas strip. 

The guest service agent was helpful when I called and asking about ice machine on the floor.

Check in process was a little disappointed since they said that our high floor with high roller view (as requested & booked) was not available at first. On the other hand they offered the vegas strip view instead. Eventually, my wife got the room that she wanted after few chats.

The only thing flamingo needs to improve from our prospective:

- Turn down service every day
- Refilling up the toiletries
- HVAC that contaminated with cigarettes smells (everytime We turn the AC at around 11-3am, it smells cigarette in the room and smells is gone by 7am in the morning)

Cheers Flamingo!

This hotel was nasty.  Rooms were dirty and staff was rude.  Complained and got another room and it was marginally cleaner.  When the staff says that there is no working vac for the hallways makes you wonder.  I would NEVER EVER stay here again  And I would NEVER recommend it to anyone.  They should be charging 19.95 a night.

I had been to the hotel before and had a wonderful experience so I was excited to return with my boyfriend and hyped up the place for him...he was really looking forward to it. We couldn't have been more disappointed! We paid for an upgraded room that was offered to us. The Habitat Elevators were so beat up! The buttons in a couple of the elevators that had NO FLOOR NUMBERS on them so your gambling starts there! Our room had a nice view of the Strip but the TV wouldn't stop pixilating, the thermostat broke, and the faucet in the bathroom was broken. When I called for the TV we waited forever but no one came. I called back to ask for help with the faucet and see how much longer we would have to wait and was put on hold forever and no one ever answered. 
Several complaints and requests were made by the both of us later on still (starting at 11.30 pm) and lack of communication and disregard for good customer service were of no concern to anyone.
We had to move rooms to our dismay at 12 am. The new room seemed fine until my boyfriend noticed the toilet seat had urine all over it!!!!! Sick! It wasn't until 1.11 am that housekeeping FINALLY decided to come clean it up!
I was so frustrated at how the management treated our situation and the excuses they gave us so I wrote to corporate. The rating moved up to three stars because Vanessa from corporate DID see how unacceptable the situation was (I made sure to send her a picture of the disgusting toilet seat) and refunded our entire stay. Though I had to wait a week for a resolution, I am completely satisfied with the very FAIR results. Not sure if we will return but I do hope that the departments that dropped the ball change for the better for YOUR stay.

The Go room with High roller view is really nice.....housekeeping is terrible along with their customer service, I had to call at 8pm  2 days in a row after being out all day for my room to be cleaned, stocked etc.....some of my takeout trash was there Tues through Friday even with housekeeping being called.....A female housekeeping supervisor is very rude, unprofessional and unwelcoming and forget about the Guest Services Manager.....I noticed alot of street walkers in the facility aswell.....nice rooms.....poor service.....NEVER AGAIN.......

I received an express check in option via email from Flamingo and when I arrived the kiosk said my room was not ready yet and it would email me when available. WHAT?! It was 1:30am and my room isn't ready. Even worse was the line to check in was loooong and not moving.

Been to this hotel and casino probably twice. The first time, we had a pleasant experience. The room was very clean. The second time, we had a horrible experience.  We didn't upgrade the room so much like the first time,  the rooms were in a bad condition.  I wouldnt stay there again.

Tiny parking lot with half reserved for valet, Hilton vacation and there's no sign or whatsoever to tell its guest where to park when it's full.  

EXTREMELY SLOW check in process.  The front desk attendants seem to only care about the preferred members when they are present.  Waited for one hour plus to check in even when there were only about 10 people in front of them in he general line. 

Never again!

Just don't do it! I stayed at the Flamingo 2 times for cheap(no resort fees) last summer and I wasn't expecting much and it was really fun. My friends and I decided to stay here again for price, location and past experience..oh what a mistake! First of all the remodeled rooms have really taken a nose dive in 1 years time..the hallways were dirty and stained and our stay was NOT cheap...they charged us for having 2 extra people and a ridiculous resort fee! Room service stops @ 2 am.& coffee shop waitress full on ignored me and my friend..we were starving! .The elevators were breaking down & took 20 minutes to go up & down..unsafe and took too long! I'm saving the best for last...my girlfriends (4 of us) called housekeeping for towels & were chatting and relaxing in bed when all the sudden a man walked in our room (no knock) with towels. We screamed and yelled at him "we're naked!!!" He put the towels in the bathroom and then proceeded to stand in front of our bed and stared at us! at this point I I hid under the covers. We said "bye" and he stared at us and then he asked us "where are you from?" We were so scared we said "bye" and finally he left! It was so scary and uncomfortable. Then we called the front desk and explained to them what had happened and they put us on hold waiting to speak to a housekeeping manager for an hour!!! It was truly so upsetting! Then they said the manager would call us (never did)!! We spoke to a manager about out horrible experience and she could have cared less!!! We spent the rest of the trip with the door padlocked..no housekeeping service..and we knew if anything scary happened we were on our own and would call 911. This was a disappointing experience at such a famous Las Vegas hotel. I would rather stay off the strip then at this dumpy overcrowded and unsafe hotel. Sad because I used to like it..no one keeps this place up and most of the staff does not care at all about customer care.

The room was a pretty good price for NYE so we booked one for the spa tower. I loved the gorgeous pool view and the room was totally 1950's retro. It was relaxing and quite.  I will definitely go back.

Worst Shit I have ever been to in my life there was 1 hour wait for valet parking then there was a 3 hour wait to register then didn't even allow me to use my military discount ... I will never come here again I will tell all my friends about the bullshit they pulled .

This used to be our Vegas spot but after our last experience, I will be looking for a new hotel. First of all the girl at the front desk sold me on upgrading to a better room with a bathtub. Well I've stayed in a frillion hotels and have seen some magnificent tubs. So I'm thinking YES I could use a good soak! When we get to the room it's a normal ass bathtub. Not worth it at all! 
So now here we are ready for bed and at the expense of our strip view, DRAI's was so loud that we might as well have taken our mattress down to the club and slept there. We called the desk to get our room changed. They would not move us and promised to refund our upgrade and resort fee's (which they never did btw). The next day we had to switch rooms not once but twice because each room they gave us was busted in one way or another. So we end up on the top floor. A huge storm rolled in and I am not exaggerating when I say that it was raining in the hallway. Literally water pouring from the ceiling. My husband even found a room that used to be for an ice machine that had electrical wires and the room was completely flooded. It was DISGUSTING!!! We will never stay here again!!

I stayed at one of the renovated Go Deluxe room for about $65 a night with a garden\/pool view. The room had a contemporary Art-deco style decor with white,brown and flamingo pink accents; a small refrigerator and coffee maker; a separate tub and walk-in shower; an iPod docking station; CD\/DVD player; window treatment with electronic drape and sheer; a 42" flat panel television with HDTV and a built-in mirror TV in the bathroom (cool)! The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in. The hotel also has seven restaurants and a food court. I only ate at Carlos 'N Charlies, a Mexican\/American restaurant, which had pretty good food.  Some of the public areas may have also been renovated. However, don't expect anything luxurious like the Four Seasons, The Wynn etc. Perhaps the best thing about this hotel though is the location - it's right smack dab in the middle of the Strip within walking distance to most of the other big casinos. If you need to get around the Strip quickly, there's a monorail station at the back of the property. I also liked that they didn't charge you a resort fee.  And, if you sign up in their Total Rewards program, you get a few perks like discounts at restaurants and gift shops, and an express line at check-in. Overall, it was a good stay and would consider staying here again for the convenience and value.

For being in the middle of the strip and the price they want, how can someone NOT stay here? Not to mention the rooms are really nice! 

My husband and I booked our minimoon here over the weekend before Christmas. I love Vegas during Christmas time, its so pretty! 

The rooms are great, we stayed in a general 2 queen beds room and now a Go-deluxe room. The deluxe room is our favorite. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud the entire time. We kept the room about 65, it was perfect! The blinds are on a switch so that was pretty cool, we had a great view of the Bellagio fountains, and the room was huge!

This has become one of our go-to spots in Vegas.

Yuck... I have stayed at the Flamingo about a dozen times over the years but have always been upgraded to GO room. Well The grumpy man behind the counter saw my son and rolled his eyes. Then when I asked if there was any available upgrades and he said if we want an upgrade its $30\/night. My husband only booked this hotel because it was under $300 for 3 nights. Not a bad deal... Or is it?!?! The room was dingy, old and dirty looking. There was make up and pubic hair on the bed when we arrived. Gross. We were in town for the Britney Spears concert, which is amazing and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!, to go snow tubing at Lee's Canyon and for some amazing Vegas food. It was my husband, 3 1\/2 year old son and myself and I could definitely feel the difference in the way we were treated by the staff because we had our child with us. We have stayed at Mandalay Bay, Venetian and Hilton in Vegas with our son and felt like we were treated much better and even offered activities for our son. This hotel is centrally located on the strip and tends to be cheaper than those surrounding it but I would suggest paying the extra to stay somewhere else. Especially if you bring your little loved ones with you on vacation.

I can't say this was my favorite hotel experience. My room key died twice a day and had to be reprogrammed- and I was certain to keep it far away from my cell phone and any other cards. It wouldn't have been so bad if the elevators were closer to my room but they weren't. The location of the hotel was great but I wasn't impressed with guest services over all- not the actual guest services booth but the overall mentality of the hotel itself. When I did let the agent know that my keys has died a 4th time she just said it's probably something I am doing. Poor customer service. I was really excited to stay here because it's a legend- and I'm sorry to say that my experience just didn't live up to expectations. If you have an older hotel\/casino I would think you'd really shoot for a great customer experience.
Sick. Gross. Bad customer service. Not worth the money or bad treatment by staff. Dirty. Filthy. Stinky.

Overall, Flamingo isn't really a 5-star property in the true sense of the word.  It's not Bellagio, Wynn or any of those...but it doesn't pretend to be.  For what you get, you can't beat the Flamingo.  First, convenience.  The location - right in the middle of the Strip, with easy access to cross the street to Bellagio or Caesar's Palace.  To make things even better, there is a Monorail station located in the back of the hotel, which saved us alot of walking time.  They've definitely been working on upgrading the place too , as the elevators, hallways and our room were all modern and quite nice.  We stayed in the GO Room with a view of the Bellagio fountains.  This room was more affordable than many hotels right here in my small town in upstate New York!  And you really can't beat a bathroom with a TV built into the mirror.  All employees we encountered were very friendly.  My only complaint about this place would be the long wait to check in - the other reviewers are right on about that.  We waited for a good half hour in line when we arrived.  Checking out was a breeze at least.  Based on convenience and affordability, this hotel is a great choice - I will absolutely return.

Nothing good to say about this hotel. I had a voucher for a free weekend from the hotel chain, of course they sent me to the cheapest one instead of putting us at Caesar.  Claim "all rooms were gone". Really?  Of all 5-6 hotels, only Flamingo was available.  Fine, arrived at 2pm, room was not ready, but an upgraded room was ready, "for a fee". Ok, I'll pay the fee. Then get hit with a resort fee, wtf. So much for a free weekend. 

Got to this upgraded room and it was filthy. Dirty carpet, room reeked of smoke even though I asked for a non smoking room. One of the lights were broken, had to send maintenance to fix that.  Use the tub and it wouldn't drain, maintenance again needed. Thin walls, could hear the neighbor speaking and blasting their loud music. Bad insulation, could smell the weed they were smoking as the smell crept into our room. 

Next Vegas offers you a free room, don't stay here.

Don't go to this hotel. It really is OLD. The room carpet was dirty. There is no fresh air as the entire room is enclosed in walls and glass. The toilet flush doesn't always work. The bed was okay and shower head didn't always have enough pressure. The only positive was the price which was $41 a night on weekdays, but weekends it shot up. Horrible rooms. The casino was not bad, but my clothes always inherited 2nd hand smoke when i got back into my room. I guess for the weekday price it can't be beat with a room that felt like a higher quality motel. They did also have some nice eateries downstairs like Johny Rockets.

My sister stayed here on a recent trip and I visited her room on a few occasions.  The room was pretty nice, with great views, but the bathroom was a bit on the small side.  As far as the casino goes, I had excellent luck at the roulette tables here.  I'll definitely try my luck again on my next visit.

Okay, I wasn't expecting anything fancy but yikes. This hotel has great location right in the middle of the strip, and I did love their nice 21-and-up pool. Booking rooms was affordable, but the rooms themselves were borderline gross. I've heard they re-vamped the place, but I guess it didn't reach into the guest rooms or the casino. The beds and the view were nice, but our bathroom was in need of a re-do; it was tiny and cheap-looking and the shower curtain was obviously stained with something. The carpet in the hallways was dingy, dirty and wrinkled and ripped in some places. The elevators were really sketchy and dirty and we were concerned more than a few times that we'd get stuck in one. Some of them would even slam shut before anyone could get into them after letting people off. 


The most disturbing thing was that on one night, other guests were involved in some kind of loud fight outside our room. Disruptive, but everyone's drunk here so its not surprising. The surprising thing was that we looked outside our room the next morning to find blood on the carpet and dripped all over the walls. Gross. Even more gross was that we left for the day and came back late that night to find that none of the blood had been cleaned up. I don't see any excuse for that one. 

We also had multiple issues with rooms keys not working and the safe in our room breaking and having to wait over an hour to have someone come open it so we could retrieve our belongings. 

Won't be returning back.

This review is 100% based on the registration process.  I have stayed at this hotel 3-4 times.  I was optimistic that a check-in at an off time may make a difference (I was completely wrong).  It doesn't seem to matter if there is a short line with 1-2 people or a very lengthy line to check-in, the registration desk is understaffed, incompetent or both.  If you have an opportunity to stay somewhere else, take it.  Even if you have to stay off strip you will save yourself time with regular rides back and forth in the long run based on how long it takes to process check-ins.

In addition, there were people that skipped the line altogether and were called and assisted before those properly waiting in line like civil and decent humans.
It was alright. Nothing special. I'd rather save money and stay at a cheaper hotel and use the savings to get a fancy dinner instead. Though this place is in the center of the strip.

This review is souly for the Go Rooms, which is an upgraded room and you pay a little more than a standard room.

Man, I remember when we were rushing to check-in because it was minutes away from the start of our The Beatles Love show at the Mirage and the front desk lady offered us if we wanted to upgrade for a Go Room, and was like who cares! check us in quick! and guess what? I'm glad that we made that rash decision because these Go Rooms are nice!

I kinda felt like Austin Powers staying in one of them, striped pink walls, hot pink lights in the bath its psychedelic! We even had the view of the strip (of course the view is amazing!) and to top off our nightlife we went dancing the night away at the Carnaval Court Bar just outside the Harrah's, not too far from the Flamingo. Our main event was to be at Beatles Love and Im glad that we where able to make it to the show on-time!  

Staying at one of the Go Rooms complimented our overall experience to remember. Checkout the Flamingos outside the courtyard, beautiful.

Pros - Easy access to the monorail and Caesars Palace. Parking was still free as of 4\/4\/17, though they were installing the pay stations while we were there so I doubt that will last much longer.
