Pool party you still have you pay 10 dollars when u are booked here

This is not a fancy hotel, but if you need a central location on The Strip and don't want to pay a ridiculous amount for a room, the Flamingo isn't too bad. 

The pool is pretty nice. But they don't enforce guest-only access, so anybody walking off the street can enter. When I was there last week, a bunch of drunk, disgusting fatass guys were loudly commenting about women's bodies. Klassy. 

Back to the hotel. If you can afford a little extra, request to stay in the GO rooms. This section of the hotel was recently renovated (mid 2006), so it's a lot nicer. They have 42" tvs, drapes that open with a switch, a stereo that you can plug your  iPod into, and oddly, a small TV screen that's built into the bathroom mirror. You can watch TV while taking a shower or bath! These rooms were constructed & decorated quickly and on the cheap, so don't be surprised if you see wall paper starting to peel or have lights that don't work right.  The rooms are fairly small. And they don't have mini-fridges. The bathroom doors are sliding frosted glass - not the most private set up for a bathroom. 

Room service is decent , 24\/7, and relatively inexpensive. They serve breakfast at all times. The gym is small but they have treadmills and elliptical machines. 

I stayed here for a conference. The facilities were decent, nothing extraordinary though. It's a huge hotel and I found myself pretty lost at times. 

I'd return only if I had to. I'd rather pay extra money at a nicer hotel, or stay further away from the strip if I needed to keep costs low.

Stayed here Friday night and it was very disappointing. We rented a basic hotel room mainly because you don't spend much time in your hotel room on vacation anyway. I did not expect what we got, which was a dirty old room that had not been updated since the 90s. The bathroom was really gross with a tiny shower. I try to pack light so I normally end up using the hotel shampoos and soaps. Their shampoo was so cheap it was the same consistency as water and left my hair feeling like shit. Very disappointing stay. And I did not just run to post a review on Yelp. I actually tried to resolve this issue with management and they were not at all accommodating. Basically I was told that this is what to expect from their basic rooms, which is sad because I've stayed on holiday inns with nicer rooms!  We originally were going to book another night there too because we arrived in Vegas a little later than planned, but decided we wanted nothing more to do with the Flamingo and headed to the Luxor which turned out to be exactly what we wanted and were very happy there. Will never go back to the Flamingo and advise others reading this review to go elsewhere as well. I will say though that the best part of the Flamingo besides leaving was talking with Jasmine the table top dancer near the blackjack tables. 5 stars for Jasmine, 0 stars for Flamingo.

Woah-uh. Stayed here because a friend was getting married at their wedding chapel, and I must say the hotel is quite nasty. Supposedly we were getting a group discount because like 30 people from the wedding group were staying in the hotel. My room for a Saturday night was $118, and that was the cheap room. They tried pitching me on the upgraded "Go-Room" over the phone, the main advantage to that being that it had a TV in bathroom. I declined. 

The room I did get was old, nasty, and had some very questionable stains on the carpet right by the bed. I'm glad I left my black light at home, because god only knows.... 

Needless to say I never walked around with bare feet. 

I did see the "Go-Room," as some of my friends who were staying there got one. It had a nicer TV and nicer furniture, but also a nasty-ass Neapolitan color scheme. Not worth it either. 

If this hotel is cheaper then other places on the strip, there is a reason. I recommend spending a few more bucks and getting a decent room, or staying at Sam's Town and driving all the freaking way across town to the strip. Either option is better then the Flamingo.

This hotel is a large waste of time, do not check in here if you want to check into your room quickly and efficiently. Management is indifferent of customers concerns, Daniel the front desk manager was completely uninterested in my questions regarding the check in kiosk.."you can stand in the back of the line and find out" was his response to my question. I checked in online and then when I got to the hotel the kiosk didn't  work. I waited over 45 mins...I will never stay here again and I do NOT recommend anyone stay here. With so many options. Why would I return here?

The one redeeming quality of my experience was Judi at the front desk. She should be working management as she knew how to answer questions regarding the faulty kiosks and had great customer service. She told me it was busy at night and sometimes the kiosk could not handle the customer volume, and room changes. That's all I needed to know. I understood her answer  and it made sense. 

I think Daniel the manager should take lessons from her on how to be courteous and listen to customers. He's the reason for my one star review. All the good in the hotel was overshadowed by his lack of customer consideration.

Stayed here 5 years ago, and liked it although could use some upgrades. Stayed recently and rooms are upgraded, look a lot nice.  Would be nice if they upgraded to carpet in the hallway as well.  Casino area not the best, seen better games elsewhere.  Best location on the strip (right in the middle).

Was expecting the worst but had a good stay at Flamingo.  It's nothing fancy and there's a huge lack of dining options in the hotel itself (a big negative for the foodie yelper in all of us).  The room was clean (enough).  Prices were reasonable for the prime location on the strip.  The hotel rooms around us were surprisingly quiet enough to sleep.  That could be because we were the last ones getting in though...

I would spend a bit more on a nicer hotel next time around since the only thing this hotel had going for it was the pool and I didn't come to Vegas for a pool.  

They had a decent poker room which was a bonus for me.

Great location, nice staff, updated rooms. Loved the Flamingo.

We let the girl at the front desk know we were celebrating our honeymoon and she so kindly upgraded us to a strip view room. 

Pool is awesome here as well. Location cannot be beat

Honestly this hotel is getting 4 stars because I truly believe its the best bang for your buck hotel in Vegas. 

Positives:

GREAT location
Good value
Clean and comfy room
The hotel has amenities (casino, coffee bars, ect)
It smells like coconut\/vanilla in the lobby


Not so positives:
BYOB - No not booze but BLANKET!!! I was freezing in the room and had to call to have a blanket brought to the room. (They lack a real comforter in the room)

LONG wait to check in- however they have an express check out kiosk to the right of the check in lobby!!! Can be easily missed so ask someone that works there where it's located if you don't see it! it'll save you 45+ minutes!

I would definitely stay here again if I am looking for a good value

It's true you get what you pay for but wow this was terrible. I would give this a negative review if I could. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. The only service worth mentioning were the bellmen and some of the valet staff. The hotel charges for EVERYTHING additional. If you want to call valet from your room to get your car you have to upgrade and pay to a member status. You have to pay extra for a refrigerator in your room and doesn't come with a coffee maker. 2 of the 3 rooms we got didn't even have ice buckets. Cleaning service didn't give new towels after 4 days and left dirty cups in the rooms. 2 of the 3 showers would get clogged every morning and the plumbing made noises everyday from the other rooms in the hotel. You would think with all the competition on the strip they would want to do their best to secure repeat business. This is the WORST hotel that 8 people agreed we had ever stayed in. I could go on and on with everything that was wrong but I don't want to waste my time on this hotel anymore. We will never go back to that "dirty bird" again.

Where do I begin...Stayed at the Flamingo Hilton a week ago and was astonished to see the deterioration of the hotel. The elevators were disgustingly dirty from top to bottom, ash trays over flowing with cigarette buds and above all the worst room I have ever stayed in in Las Vegas. The non smoking room reeked of smoke, the furniture was out dated, scratched, and had pieces missing as if bought at  a second hand store. However, our bathroom was by far the worst the towel racks were rusty and were dislodged off the walls. The bath tub was old and looked unglazed.  I  slept on top of my bed in fully dressed clothes. Could not wait to check out, only reason for staying was sold out rooms everywhere due to national debate.  Lastly, no ice maker on floor. The pipes were  there but no dispensing system. Stay away!!! Only reason I give it one star is because of location to strip.

I love the pool at the Flamingo.  It's never over crowded and a relaxing atmosphere.   I've stayed here several times and always enjoyed it.  They have great rates and the tram is located right behind it.

The Flamingo Las Vegas - you can check out but you can never leave

The Flamingo is definitely not the charming art deco hotel I stayed in a decade ago. 
The reception area is drab and the front desk staff unfriendly.  The initial room my daughter and I were assigned was already occupied.  The desk clerk blamed the computer, muttered an "I'm sorry" and assigned us a different room in the "un-renovated" section of the hotel.   
The elevator made random stops to floors that no one had selected.  By the end of our stay it had become a running joke with other guests.  The ceiling light in our room did not work and we soon discovered that the running water in the sink had only one temperature...  ice cold.  If you wanted to wash you face with warm water, you had to use the bathtub.  The room furniture was old and mismatched, and the floor was a brown vinyl that was supposed to look like wood.  Everything seemed dirty.  The bed had a cover across the bottom that looked like an old shag rug from the 60's.  I later found a fingernail (not mine) in the fibers.   

Later in my stay, when we were in the pool area for a short time, our room was robbed.  There was no sign of forced entry, but housekeeping had cleaned the room while we were gone.  After dialing repeatedly, I was finally able to get the Guest Services button on the phone to work.  After calling three times for security, and being told they would be up right away, we finally went to the security office in the basement of the hotel. A security officer took our report, and that was it.  Although management gave me a $50 food credit after I expressed my displeasure, overall my concerns were met with indifference and hostility.  A report was filed with CCMSI,  a Third Party Risk Management firm retained by Flamingo Las Vegas to review and administer incident reports.  By using a third party, the hotel management will tell you that it is out of their hands.  Apparently it is out of my hands too.

Kids pool with the slide was closed which really sucked since we went there to celebrate my daughter's birthday. I called in advance to be SURE that it would be open, and they told me it would be. Got there and the pool was half drained. Asked security and he said it would be open in a couple of hours. It wasn't. HE said it would be open the next day, so we stayed another night... Nope... I want my money back.
I came in here to use their bathroom. I must admit, the bathroom was definitely A-OK as far as casino bathrooms go. I'd definitely use it again for my micturating needs.

I recently stayed here for three nights on a work trip. It was actually my second time staying here- the first, coincidentally, for a trip in grad school.

This is an older hotel, with an interesting mob history. It's not luxurious, but it does the trick for a relatively inexpensive price. I recommend doing early checkin then picking up your keys and room directions at one of the kiosks instead of the front desk. In today's day and age, why wait 20 minutes to check in when they give you that option?

Negatives: Very few amenities here. No fridge, which would have been nice for my stay. The room wasn't great, dirty floor, safe locked with door open (had to get a guy to open it), etc. but it wasn't horrendously awful either. In my quest for cheap hotel rooms I have certainly seen worse. Lots of resort fees and a $50 deposit per night, but they are upfront about it. I'm guessing most Vegas hotels charge you a couple hundred in fees as well.

Worst: the Wyndham timeshare people! I kept getting harassed by them. Practically a dozen times. "Excuse me ma'am where are you from?" They will hunt you down from across the casino and start an unrequited conversation with you. I did some research and it's all a scam, but that's pretty obvious from their marketing techniques and persistence. Flamingo please get rid of these shady, annoying people!

Now positives: parking in their garage is free, which was nice. Location is central to the strip, and right off the Linq area of restaurants and attractions. It's part of Caesar's, so your purchases go towards Total Rewards if you're into that thing. Also, the birds and fish outside are pretty cool. I got covered in ants while watching them though so watch out for that.

Next time, if I'm traveling for fun I will book a nicer hotel but for the purpose, it worked.

The go rooms are really nice!  This place has one of the best pools in vegas.  They have palm trees and waterfalls all over.  I especially love the little waterslide, Thats always fun.  Im a diamond member so I get to walk right in. Be prepared to wait in a long line on weekends if your not though!

After being fond of this hotel for years; having stayed here myself and referring others here - I doubt I will ever return here.

I had multiple problems during my stay. When I called downstairs to talk to a Manager, that I thought may try to resolve some of them, I was told to go downstairs and fill out a comment card. When I call to talk to someone, I expect them to take down the information and try to bring some resolution to the situation.

Brief summary - about 75 people in line to check in, yet only 3 live agents and 1 self service machine to check people in; Noise was horrible - I could hear my neighbors having relations, people in the hallway talking, and my other neighbors talking in the bathroom; Room wasn't just old, but actually looked worn out; Bed and pillows were horribly uncomfortable; They send you canned sales voice mails everyday that flash a light on your phone until you listen to them; I asked for an extra blanket but never got one; and last but not least, the one time I did not have bills to tip with, the Valet stood there and awkwardly starred at me thinking I would come up with something.

On the plus side, it is a good location. Overall (except for that Valet) the staff were friendly. I appreciated the "no resort fees", but I think it is ridiculous to charge $25\/day for internet access.

Flamingo is part of the Caesar's Entertainment company, and for what is worth one of the best placed casino on the middle of the strip.  

PRICE RANGE- I checked in on a Wednesday and check out on Friday for the price range under $240.

ROOM- I got a GO DELUXE room (non-smoking)  and it had what I think is a beautiful view of the the pool and the mini zoo. It had modern styling and amenities such as a flat screen t.v., radio with IPOD adapter, internet (but with a fee) The bathroom had a stand up shower and a tub which was on the small size.  Another nice feature is that that was a mini t.v. inside the mirror and if you wanted you can watch cartoons while sitting on the throne =P.     

SERVICE- When I got to Flamingo, I decided to use the quick check in kiosk that is located next to the check in desk.  When I got my keys and check into the room it still needed to be cleaned.  So me not wanting to settle for less walked my happy ass back down and talk to an actual receptionist and got the problem rectified and she was nice enough to "comp" a dinner for two. 

CASINO- The Flamingo might have been the premier casino to go to back in the day, but compared to the newer "super" casinos the look is dated.  Which is why it did not have the volume of players in the other Casinos.  Like all the casinos in Vegas, alcohol is free and plenty.  I got my drinks from waitresses ten minutes from the time I ordered it.  The blackjack dealers\/floor personnel were friendly and talkative, and were willing to help newbies to the game.

Pros: great central location on strip, perfect if on a budget but want to be in the middle of everything, room was clean, liked having hardwood floors as opposed to typical carpet, floor to ceiling wall of windows, thermostat was not working and room was a sauna, but they fixed quickly after we called, pretty view of pools and mountains from our room on 16th floor 

Cons: check-in line was long and no sense of urgency from staff in moving it along, halls are dingy\/smelly and don't feel clean, you can hear everything going on in hallway from room, bedding is paper thin - literally felt like we were only sleeping with a sheet on top of us, could use more\/brighter lighting in room - gets pretty dark in there once sun goes down, no mini-fridge, bathroom was really small - only one person could get ready at a time

Horrible, Horrible, HORRIBLE, Horror-show at Hotel Hell!!

I do not know where to start. This was our 3rd stay at this hotel but the 2 other times were over 14 years ago, so I don't know what  has happened to this place but it was God awful. I don't know where to start.....

First off the staff is cranky, rude and unhelpful.  We booked 5 rooms on expedia.  Each room was booked with the person's name who would be staying.  When we called ahead because a person in our group got ill on the flight to Vegas and we asked about early check in, the rude reservation clerk stated "no one is registered under that name" we asked her to check different spellings and before we could even give her a suggestion, she rudely said "I ALREADY CHECKED IT THAT WAY, NO ONE HAS A RESERVATION UNDER THAT NAME!!!"    We explained to Miss Rudy-pants that we paid in FULL at the time of booking so, "if you could, please check again"   She disconnected us. We called back, asked for a manger and was on hold for over 35 minutes.  Finally we called the main reservation line and the customer service was able to find the booking. Our party was  able to check in early, for a small fee, which she tried to give cash but it was not accepted.  Our friend used her debit card and was charged a  $100 deposit without being told this would happen and that of course made her short in her bank account. (college student).

We checked into our room and almost slipped and fell on a large puddle on the floor. The AC was leaking.  A call to the front desk was met with another snotty customer rep who was more interested in the fact that 2 in our party were 19 and 20 1\/2 and  had their own rooms. Her suggestion was we should all sleep together in the same bed like hillbillies.  Not to mention we were charged a $100 deposit for each of the rooms occupied by those under 21 and the front desk NEVER  mentioned any problems or rules about under 21 guests occupying a room.

We were never offered another room. The maintence guy showed up and said "oh that is just a little condensation"   It was about 12 inches around and on a dark floor. Guess Flamingo does not care if we break a hip in a fall in their room.  The condition apparently has been on going as the room smelled of mold.

Problem fixed we moved on to the pool area.  They have a section for 21 and over. Just a heads up, prepare to undergo a full body search by an armmed guard. Oh...if you buy a coffee at Mrs. Fields prior to going into the pool, better drink it fast cause, as the guard said "NO FOOD, NO DRINK FROM OUTSIDE"  WTF??   We bought it a few feet away inside the hotel.   The guard also does not like tampons in your purse or he was a total moron because he pulled out the package and asked "what's this".

Next night at  4am, the A\/C again dripped and dripped.  Call to the front desk, waiting 45 mins, no show.  Call a second time waited 2 hours, again a no show. Finally gave up.

Staff is untrained, rude and nasty.  We asked one employee what time the restaurant was open til and was told "oh it closed" only to find out it is a 24 hour place!!  

I guess the Korean tourist summed it up best when he let one smelly fart rip  while we tried to enter our room!         THIS PLACE SUCKS!!

So me just get this out there -- I'm a hotel snob.  I like a little luxury when I travel, and so I'm not typically booking the bargain rates.  However, on a short notice trip to Vegas, we decided to give the Flamingo a try.   They were conveniently located to all the spots we wanted to visit and the price was right.  Plus, the photos of the GO rooms on the website looked modern and fun!

Flamingo is not a new hotel, and overall the place does show a little wear here & there.  But the room was pretty much as pictured.  Unfortunately, little things sort of rubbed us wrong (like the snazzy ipod docking radio they had didn't work) but overall, it didn't feel like we were slumming it.  It sort of has a weird layout that you'll either love or hate (like glass sliding bathroom doors) but overall we liked it.   Plus our view just happened to be of Bellagio and those dancing fountains, so that made up for a lot. Also, the pool was really awesome.  Tons of chairs to lounge on if you get there early enough, lots of bars, good music and beautiful trees and waterfalls all around.  

Overall, we will still shop around when it comes to Vegas lodging, but I'd definitely try the Flamingo again.

The hotel is in a great location 
Walking distance everywhere. The ladies at the check-in were super friendly and fun
The rooms are clean for the most part. We looked for a plug behind the bed and it was super dusty

The pool area is great...but the bartender that served us was rude. I reached out for a pink straw and he yelled at me i front of my friends saying that i dont touch anything on his bar, embarrassing me i front of other people and made a big deal about me reaching for a straw.  It was kind of a turn off... My friends and I will go get drinks elsewhere.

The Flamingo hotel is an older hotel, but still enjoyable to stay at if your not wanting to spend a whole lot of money for a fancy hotel. Location is PERFECT! This hotel is in the hotspot of the strip located close to all the good hotels and clubs which was convenient. It has an enormous pool open during summer for pool parties which is a lot of fun. They have an alright casino area, food wasn't that great and rooms are clean. Our biggest problem with this hotel was the ELEVATORS! They were practically falling apart and breaking down. The elevators are super old, dirty, slow and most were not working correctly. I think this hotel could easily achieve 5 star reviews if they revamped and updated it. All in all I will stay at this hotel again for the location, pool, and clean rooms. Thanks Flamingo!

My boy friend and I spent the weekend on the strip and we stayed at the Flamingo. I liked our room, bed was comfortable enough, clean, nice linen and ok view. I like the little dashes of hot pink.  Check in line was long but they had self check-in machines so it wasn't too bad. We didn't eat there or see any of the entertainment there. We did gamble for like $3 minutes but after losing $20 in 3 minutes we left the casino and went in saw Beatles LOVE. 

Someone was banging on the door at 3am trying to get into their room. It woke me up, but hey its Vegas, I bet there is a lot of that.

The only complaint I have about the place is at check-out we were trying to get on an elevator and it literally took 20 minutes for one to open that was not packed; with 5 bags it felt like a life time.

Would stay here again

Booked a Flamingo FAB room through Vegas.com for the Wrangler NFR and got an AMAZING deal (about $38-$45 a night on the weekend, can't beat that!!) Would HIGHLY recommend this deal package. Room was on 10th floor with a great view. Super clean, simple, comfy bed with no comforters YEAH!!! I loved the hot pink accents and the laminate floor that was like textured wood. I did some research and found the GO rooms have been updated throughout while the FAB rooms don't have an updated bathroom, .which was fine with us. How can you beat $40\/night for a nice hotel room in Vegas? It was clean and very affordable and that was all that mattered. Room service was great and the hotel eateries were good. Would definitely book this deal again.

I stayed in one of the Go Rooms for 3 nights. I was very happy with the room and the hotel. I got in around 1:30pm and made reservations for a restaurant with the concierge as soon as I got there and the lady was very helpful and nice. She also told me that I should be able to check-in no problem even though it was way before 4pm which is the check-in time. The line was fairly short and I was able to check-in no problem which was great!

The room was very nice for the price and clean. There was a nice large flat screen TV, automated curtains to a lovely view of the pool area, a mini fridge, a hairdryer, an iron, and a safe in the closet. 

Unfortunately the pool area was being remodeled so there was just one small pool area. It was ok though since my bf and I went to Bally's or Ceaser's Palace's pool no problem. The official summer season for Vegas doesn't begin until next Friday which was a bummer since a lot of the pools were closed, the service wasn't great at the casino floors, etc. 

Also a great location! The flamingo is right across the street from all the big hotels such as Ceaser's Palace, the Bellagio, etc. I was able to walk everywhere without having to take a cab. If you're looking for a nice basic room I would highly recommend this place. Honestly, you don't spend that much time in your room while at Vegas. 

I also noticed that there was a lot of older people at this hotel so if you're looking for a younger atmosphere this is something to keep in mind, but like I said the prime location makes it easy to go just about anywhere within a short walk.

I know Vegas is not traditionally a family destination so my comment may seem silly. The Flamingo opens their pool area at 8:00 AM,  the adult pool at 9 AM, but makes all kids wait until 10AM for their pool. Seriously, are adults up at 9 AM at the pool? No they're still sleeping but us families with kids are counting  the 2 hours we have to wait. I do not understand this at all.

Meh. I wouldn't say we got a deal on the two rooms I booked - two rooms for two nights cost over $325 total, and I had to cough up another $312 when I checked in for these two rooms ($100 per room deposit - even though I used a major credit card? And $28 per room per night resort fee). Granted, I got the $200 back when I checked out but still. This was the weekend after Christmas. The gentleman who checked us in was very nice and helpful. Like the other have said, check in at 4pm, the line is LONG. They used to have check In kiosks, not anymore. The rooms were basic. Like others said, paint chipping off the walls. In my brothers room a piece of the headboard had broken off before they got to the room and the appropriate solution was to just prop it against the wall. 
Thought we would give it a try since we allegedly had gotten "Black Friday" deals on our rooms. Think we may stick with our tried and true next time.

Check-in and check-out are terrible, may take over an hour for each one. Furthermore, despite the fact that we arrived right at check-in time, our room choice was no longer available.... of course... The fact that the staff at the counter was extremely rude didn't help either.

The so-called "Fab Deluxe" rooms are plain cheap. Bathroom is small, outdated and, in our case, not so clean. In addition, if you get a room on the lower floors, close to the HVAC units, the level of noise is unacceptable.

As the previous reviewer noted, "They will nickel and dime you to DEATH." Possibly the only hotel that allows only 1 device to be connected to wifi after paying the expensive resort fee.

With all the choices available in Las Vegas, you can pass on this one.

I booked my stay directly through the flamingos. Was able to check in in the morning before I got there and my room is ready right at the time I requested. Only had to wait in line about 10 minutes to get my key and was able to avoid the long, long, long line. I do agree with everyone else the elevators or horrible. Ended up walking down 14 flights of stairs because the wait was too long. Would think they would have fixed the elevators by now

The first room we were given had used soap and hair all over the floor and toilet in the bathroom.  We immediately called to complain and it took a bellman about 30 minutes to bring a key to another room. The second room was smaller, but at least it was clean. These were both Fab rooms. The second night we were there the fire alarm went off at about 1:30 am and stayed on for about 15 minutes. Check in took at least 30 minutes.  One good thing: the cocktail waitresses kept the drinks coming in the casino.

For those of you planning a trip to Las Vegas, don't even think about staying at the Flamingo.  

I booked a room for 3 nights. No hot water 2 of the nights, and the third and final night no water at all.

When guest services was contacted, they were rude and unwilling to place us in any other room or Caesars property, and unwilling to even credit the charges over the phone.  When asked why the charges can't be credited over the phone, she kept demanding I would have to come downstairs!  I was about ready to take a shower! Is this service?

We booked the FAB Strip View Luxury and when we checked in- there was no strip view. The person at the reception did not even bother to mention that the strip view was not available. This is the level of customer service.
It is probably easier to give a list of things that worked in the room rather than the ones which did not. Shower was broken, housekeeping did not even replace the empty tissue paper box. At times we had to wait for 30 minutes to get a elevator. Definitely not worth the money

The one star is for the location.

This is our favorite casino. An excellent location with friendly dealers, and good payouts. Lots of fun happening everywhere like dancing girls on platforms. Masseuses roam and massage your shoulders while you play. The rooms are very nice too. The buffet is decent. Some older decor but they put the value in the room, employees, and casino.

What can I say. I hope it gets better. So they can't valet my car after 12am??? Wish they would have told me that when I asked them what route and entrance to take back to the hotel if I was coming back late After a wedding. Never heard a valet tell me NO I can't take your money to park your car. Coffee at the cafe was great and late night pizza was good. Slow to fix elevators, like 2 days slow. Very poor communication from staff overall. Nice but whatever. Plenty other places to stay for me.

I haven't arrived yet so I will give another review after I stay, but this is solely based on making reservations. 

I'm from Atlantic City, NJ, am a total rewards member with Caesars Entertainment Group, and I frequently get comp's in the Atlantic City Market- free slot play, free rooms, free buffet etc.  

So you can imagine my surprise when I call to see if I get a deal or comp in Vegas and the person assisting me on the phone tells me that I do not qualify for any total rewards comp's and that the room was $20 more per night then I clearly saw online for any Joe smoe-  I immediately hung up the phone.

I proceeded booking online... For $20 less per night. I also think their hotel resort fees are ridiculous... The fees and taxes cost more then the room itself.  

I'll be there in 2 days, hopefully better customer service then my phone call- I chose this property because #1 I am loyal to the Ceasars Entertainment Brand #2 it is centrally located.

I came here to celebrate my birthday and chose The Flamingo because of the pool and the price. You can't beat it! I loved staying here, we had a blast! I love that there is an over 21 pool where you can party and have fun. Everyone we met at the pool was so nice and the booty shaking contest was a riot.

The rooms are nice and the location couldn't be any better! You are located right on the strip where all the action is happening. In my opinion, you're never really in your room anyways so there's no reason to pay to stay at a fancy hotel. I live in LA and have been to Vegas at least 30 times. I've stayed at so many places and I would put the Flamingo in my top 5.

GROSS!!!GROSS!!!GROSS!!!!-- This place is a total dump- There was old food that had been sitting out for days in the hallway and old band-aids on the carpet. There was a faux fur something on our bed that had more stains than I would like to admit to seeing!!!  The pool according to orbitz was great but it wasn't. There were dirty towels on the bottom of the pool and they shut down the 2 little water slides they had open at 4:30. IT WAS A DUMP!!! It smelled of mildew and fish. It was really Gross. If  you can afford to upgrade we left there and stayed at the Luxor and it was AMAZING!!!!  I wish I could post pics-
It's gross. Needs an update. Charged $30 to check in before 3pm. Pool has NO umbrellas. I think there are better places to stay in this price point. Location is great. Can walk to everywhere easily.

I have only stayed in one other hotel in Vegas, but this one is definitely well worth it!  

Although a few people have said that its "tired" or "old," I think that it pays homage to the way the hotels and casinos were when the strip was first being built.  This is a 50s-era hotel that still has some original furnishings.  The rooms are great.  I'm not sure what a "Go Room" is, but we just had a standard two-double bed room.  Great prices (much less than the other hotels on the strip) and every amenity you can imagine.  Our rooms were big, the beds were super comfortable and the bathroom was really nice.  The hotel service and staff were super friendly and very prompt with the cleaning of the rooms or room service.   The front desk staff were also very friendly and helpful in suggesting things to do during the day if we didn't want to hit up the casinos.  

The casino itself is really great - it's big (almost like three separate rooms) and there's all the card tables and slot machines you could imagine.  I found that the service here at the machines\/tables was much faster than at other casinos.  Every time I started playing something a server would come and take a drink order - it was great.  It was often slower or non-existent at other casinos.  

The pools were also great.  There was a pool for everyone (including kids) and a pool for adults only - the adult pool was great because there was prompt bar service and very few people.  The area around the pools is also great, as well.  It's kind of like a crazy rain forest jungle with some wildlife hanging around and a path to walk through and see everything.  

I will definitely plan to stay here again the next time I visit Vegas.  It's an expensive, great hotel right on the strip.

To start off, this hotel, like all hotels on the strip is hard to get to. It's not easy to park, we ended up doing valet parking. The check in line was very long and took forever, and that was self check in!

Cons: We got the cheapest double queen room. We took the habitat elevator to get there. I wish we had upgraded. The beds were nice and it was clean but the furniture was old. The bathroom was pretty gross. It was clean. But the ceiling in the shower was moldy and disgusting. I didn't walk in the room without my sandals.

Pros: the hotel is on the strip and close to many of the best hotels. Also the monorail picks up just outside the hotel. And the hotel is the cheapest one except for Harrah's which had worse reviews. We had the Do Not Disturb on the door when we got back the phone was blinking. The ed out that housekeeping had called to see if we needed anything. It took awhile to get the message, but I thought that was pretty nice.

There is a bird habitat with flamingos, parrots, rescued pelicans, turtles, and fish. 

The pool is really cool, there's an all age pool with a waterslide, and there's a 21+ pool with a waterfall and club music. 

Cons: The pool is only 3 ft deep! You have to pay for a cabana or day bed. It's not relaxing with club music playing the whole time, and it closes at 5! I am still in shock that it closes at 5- I wanted to swim at night, but no the pool's closed.

Tips: Upgrade your room (hopefully it will be nicer). Go on the waterslide. Go to the pool before 5...

The location of this hotel is great and I liked the look of the room even though it was cheaply done. The bed and pillow were NOT comfy and you can hear everything single noise in the halls and rooms next to you. If you don't plan to sleep at all (not even a quick nap) this is the place for you, but it you need a few hours of sleep this will not work. Besides the walls and doors being paper thin, check in took 45 minutes. I will not be staying here in the future. Oh, even though the room had been updated they did not update the bathroom, weird.

We came here for the vegas part of our honeymoon roadtrip and the people at the flamingo did everything to make our stay there more comfortable. I slipped in a 20$ bill when we checked in for our three night stay and the girl at check-in made sure (even asked for help when she couldn't find one) we got a nice room! We ended up with a suite in the old part of the hotel and we had a really nice view of the swimming pool. There was construction going on all around the hotel but we didn't notice anything from our room. Parking was pretty good once we found out how it worked, used valet for the first two days.

This was built in 1950's and it shows. Its dirty and the floors were designed for midgets.  When we checked out for the Caesar, the person working at the office whispered to us, "I know why you want to go somewhere else."

This hotel needs to be blown up for a new one.

I got a nice deal at this place. I stayed for 3 nights at this place. They have nice outdoor pool area. Only problem is the waiting in the line for hours to checkin.  I know it's very old hotel in LV. But definitely worth what you're paying for this hotel. Busy place.

Rooms were nice, but getting to them is the worst in all of Vegas. Valet for people who pay for the rooms are still sometimes over 30 minute wait just to get someone to take your keys. I would never recommend this place because of this. self parking is still an option if there is any openings for you.

after the check in fiasco where they demanded to hold an extra 300 dollars on my check card for "incendentals", my shower door breaking and having to stand there soaking wet for over an hour, the blow dryer not working and no help with either situation for a very long time...i was pissed the fuck off and ready to walk out...

then i got drunk so i calmed down. 

the new room remodel was cute, it was a bit like a candy store...a little to much pink. 
the new ipod dock was really sweet. comfy  beds etc...

i did fear for my life everytime i got in an elevator. the noises they made sounded like they havent been oiled since bugsy malone died. 

on the plus side..the new italian ish place that is there rocked my socks. and amazing me, great service....that saved this place. its location is cool..but next time im heading down town. i guess im a little more comfortable on the dirty side of town.

3.5 stars 

My friends and I had a fine stay here. Our room was clean and neat. There was plenty of room to spread our things around. The room had two huge windows with a great view overlooking the "resort." The location is pretty perfect -- literally on the Strip! 

The bed was sooo comfy! Each bed came with 4 pillows -- 3 fluffy and 1 more flat. I like sleeping on flatter pillows, so this was a huge plus for me! The room was nice, but quite dated. You can see the paint peeling and chipping on nearly everything: chairs, cabinet, drawers, etc. We were able to look pass this because everything was CLEAN, which is top priority for us. We are also very disappointed that there was no fridge in our room. Luckily, we brought our own cooler. Also, no free wifi?! Really?! Those are two very big negatives for me... 

Would I stay here again? Maybe. I wouldn't completely dismiss it for next time, but I would look into other hotels too.

Room was cheap and I know why, hallways are dirty and smelly.They tried to fix the rooms but they still look dingy.
Worst customer service ever. My toilet in the room overflowed at 2am all over the sleeping area. Was on hold for 20 minutes just to try to talk to someone to come fix it asap and no answer! I had to walk all the way down to the hotel lobby just to get things taken care of. The customer service person that finally answered had to put me on hold to try and contact their front desk cause they are not onsite. Their calls were not answered either. What's the point?!
They couldn't give me a different room- fully booked they said. We had to wait an hour to get the whole situation fix and also had to wait for housekeeping to come clean the room before we can sleep! They did give us a later check in after I demanded in person at the front desk that they're taking away our rest and we had a long drive ahead of us in the morning- it's not worth the 2 hour sleep we lost in the middle of our night!!
Ugh, will never stay in this hotel ever again!

I have had two more visits to the Flamingo and my experience was much improved. Flamingo honored their word to take care of me on my next visit. I was given a complimentary room for a much needed night's test on my road trip to Montana. 

My two complaints are that I had to put together their entertainment system to enjoy it and they need to work harder at keeping casino bathrooms clean. Odd because there is always a cleaning attendant,, but they mostly seem to stand around instead of cleaning.

Overall Flamingo is a great value with nice mini suites a great pool and ideal strip location.

I think the renovated GO rooms are a sweet deal. My friend and I called it our little cute pink room since the interior was a cute hot pink color with candy stripped walls and a decently sized flat screen TV. Two comfortable queen sized beds, mini fridge, good sized bathroom with separate tub and shower. The shower even had extra jets for massaging which was nice. Might I add the bathroom had a tv built into the mirror and I enjoyed watching TV while getting ready and taking a shower. Awesome. The flamingo is really located in the middle of the strip which is convenient, and will definitely be on my list for future stays in Vegas.

This classic hotel has comfortable rooms with floor to ceiling views, a beautiful garden with flamingos, koi, turtles and ducks. The pool has islands in the middle and a fantastic DJ.  The back walkway between the flamingo and the Linq provided food options as well as people watching.  Every staff that I encountered was warm and helpful   I will definite stay here and recommend the flamingo to my friends.

I must be nostalgic over the Flamingo Hotel because it was the first place I had ever stayed in Las Vegas back in the 80s when I was way too young to gamble and wasn't allowed in most casinos. So it's not the happening place now, but it's not terrible despite the reviews.

Most people want to be in the newest casinos, but for a place to rest your head this is a good option if you're easy to please. It's all a matter of perspective, but the Flamingo is definitely perfect for the college student or someone on a budget. And you really can't beat the location.

I was really disappointed by the Flamingo Hotel in reference to their pet accommodations. While the hotel is pet friendly, the pet relief area was really gross- I didn't even want to walk in there because of the stains on the turf.  The room was also really disappointing because there was mildew or mold in the shower and stains on the bed skirt. Additionally, three elevators were out of service which resulted I the other three elevators consistently being really full. 

However, the worst part of my stay at the Flamingo was the really bad check-in experience. I had to wait in a very long line with my dog. My dog was already excited by the crowds, drunk people and noise in Las Vegas, the customer service personnel made no effort to expedite my check in. If they were to make an extra effort, they would have won more points with me and would have made the other people in line much more comfortable.  

My recommendation for other people traveling with a dog to Las Vegas is to stay somewhere other than the Flamingo, their customer service is awful and their maintenance of the pet relief area is very bad.

This was the first and last time I stayed at the Flamingo.  First of all, they do not properly keep track of your play at the tables.  They had less than half of what I played at the tables, which resulted in nothing for comps.  I am talking about $2500 and getting credit for $1200, which was a total loss.  
The rooms are not clean and kept up.  The elevators take a long waiting time and some don't work at all.  Getting service on the floor takes too long.  This is the worst casino I have ever been at and you will not get comped like any other Caesars casino.  You can go to any other Caesar casino and get comped for play, get a better room, buffet, and shows, but not at the Flamingo.  

This was the worst stay in Las Vegas.  If this was my first stay in Las Vegas I would wonder how the other casinos treat their clients.  But, coming to Las Vegas at least 5 times a year I know what you should get at the casinos for play.
This place is a complete dumb. They need to tear it down and build another hotel. No need to say more. You can find out yourself, but proceed with caution!!

Pink.  Lots of pink.  Like cornea searing pink.  You'll only see more pink if you were front row at a Lady Gaga concert.

One of the remaining OG hotels on the strip.  Everything reeks of smoke.  Tore up waitresses.  Greasy cafes and buffets.  Half dead animals that would scream kill me if they could to take pictures with.  Definitely a step down from the luxury resorts, but I like it here.  My kind of Vegas, at least until I hit that Wheel of Fortune jackpot. 

Great center strip location.  Easy to get to everything.  Standard rooms are decent, GO rooms are actually amazing and worth the upgrade, though still small.  

Good vibe in the casino, people are usually here to have fun.  They have a gogo area with the...slightly more attractive dealers up front.  But I don't really like gambling here too much since the limits are a little too low, like $10 pai gow.  It sucks to be losing hands while someone else on the table is barely betting anything and constantly winning (yeah I'm gonna hate like that).  Good to come here and kill some time though, better than the IP.  Dear God, anything but the IP.

Most likely the last time we will every stay at Flamingos! We had booked 2 rooms for Thursday- Sunday. I had put down the room under my name with my credit card and I gave them a call the day before to change the rooms under a different person just for the first night because I couldn't get the day off at my work for Thursday night. I clearly told billing customer service I was going to arrive Friday night. She had told me that was fine that when I arrived just to go to the counter with the other person to change the credit card to mine. I asked her like three times if she needed the other persons credit card for the reservation and she clearly told me no that as long as the other person showed up and that she would only pay resort fees at the counter. Perfect that sounded like a good plan. I get to the hotel Friday night my friend comes down to remove her credit card and put my credit card which was no hassle. But for them to tell me that one of the rooms was cancelled because I didn't check in on Thursday night. The only reason why I had called the day before is for this little mix up not to happen and they end up telling me they had cancelled the other room because I wasn't there. Ok! What's the whole point on calling and them telling me one thing and ended up doing another thing. At that point I was so fed up with the manager, he was no help at all and was not reasonable at all. He had told me there was no record of me calling when I clearly showed him my phone with the number of costumer service. He didn't even bother checking like ok sir, I'm not quite sure how he's even a manager there. At the end I didn't even want to deal with it any more and I told them him one room was fine BUT that I hoped at the end we don't get double charged for the 2 rooms, I honestly told him like 3 times and he stated that we were only going to get charged for one room and only on MY credit card. Sunday morning comes we check out and I had told the lady one more time I just wanted to make sure we wont get double charged and she said no you're fine you're only getting charged for one room for 3 nights to your credit card and not your friends credit card. She gave me my receipt and everything to find out today 4\/11 morning that my friend also got charged for the 3 nights. At this point we are both really upset that Flamingo doesn't stick to their words of not getting double charged when I clearly asked them like 3 million times about it and they had confirmed that I wasn't going to get double charged. So irritating never again we will stay at Flamingo's.

I'm not going to take much time to write this review as it was the WORST hotel experience. Spend tons of money with just staying at the hotel, on a room and service that isn't worth it. I would never recommend or stay at this place again. 

Make sure you read the fine print as there were hidden fees! I talked to the manager and she told me it was the rules of the hotel. Needless to say, I will never stay there again. Definitely better places in Vegas to stay at!

Went here because I had the buffet of buffets pass and fingered might as well give it a shot. First off they sat us in a section where we could see the fish and the flamingos which was nice to look at with eating and that is going into consideration with my rating. The food was nothing special out of the 6 buffets I think this one would be the 4th best. I did come on a Monday for lunch so maybe dinner or a weekend might be better.

This is probably the WORST hotel room I ever EVER been in. It was so bad that I wouldn't even stay there and my room was comped! The toilet paper holder was about to fall out of the side of the vanity, the dust on the vent in the bathroom was unacceptable in so many levels and the dresser appeared to have been kicked and banged. I was in the room for about three minutes, maybe less and walked out and never came back during the 3 Comp nights I had it...it was that bad. Go SOMEWHERE else, spend another few dollars and go somewhere else.

The rooms are tired. We came because they said they had a kiddie pool, they don't. My toddler had a little ledge to play on in the one small crowded family pool. The nice pools with all the space and zero entry pool, waterfalls etc is only for adults. The family pool is equivalent to like a Best Western size pool. So disappointing. We just needed a family friendly designed pool, is that too much to ask for. The location is good, next to the Linq, by doesn't make up for what a dump the Flamingo is, we are looking to leave early.

This place is a Dump!   I like the location and the pink flamingo's are cool but those are the only things this place has going for it.   Check-in starts @ 1:00, which we tried to do only to be turned away due to our room not being ready...no problem we thought, so we gambled a bit and toured the grounds, came back in an hour like we were told and the 2nd person tried to upgrade us to another room (we had to pay extra of course) so we decided to wait and come back.  Being tired and just wanting to check in we went back after an hour and finally our room was ready but we received Major attitude from the lady checking us in.  These people don't understand the meaning of customer service obviously.  I was ready to ask for a manager but figured I'd get the same run around from them.  Went to the room which was a maze to get to and far from the elevators (more on that later).  Room was dark and horrible.  Dirty tile, dirty grout, old bathroom fixtures, paint peeling off the walls and ceiling.  A raised panel in the room which you could see the....not sure what it was behind it, construction glue?   The glass doors to the closet were warped so you couldn't close it.  On one elevator ride, it went to my floor, the doors didn't open and it went back to the lobby.  Got on another elevator and it clunked, clunked, clunked to my floor.   This place needs a Major overhaul!   I will never stay here again and most likely won't play here either.  I feel sorry for the wild life in the "preserve" area, poor little ducks, turtles, birds and flamingos.

Can't beat the price for a great location on the strip. Rooms are motel-esque, but if you prefer to spend your money on gambling, food, alcohol and shows- the flamingo is the place to stay!

Got a free upgrade to a strip view room for only $35 a night!

ZERO STARS!!! 

Just came back today from vegas.  We stayed at the Flamingo since we found a great deal online for the Go Get Wet Pool Package that included 2 complimentary frozen drinks or beer and a pool kit with the new Go rooms. Upon arriving it took us 2 hours to check in since we ran into some problems.  The package I booked was for 3 days and was booked straight from the actual hotel site.  After checking in we noticed we were charged for an extra night which made no sense since when you purchase any packages thru their hotel site it must be paid in full.  They told us that the package only consist of 2 days and that we had to pay for the 3rd night.  TELL ME WHY WOULD I BOOK A  2 DAY PACKAGE IF I AM STAYING FOR 3 NIGHTS?!? are u stupid no where said it was a 2 day package...i even busted out the itinerary and confirmation for them to look at.  After giving us the run around for an hour we finally talked to the front desk manager and she was stupid as hell too. Finally everything got straighten out because these people that worked at this hotel didnt know what the hell they were doing. I will defin be contacting Harrah's Entertainment, Inc. and WILL NOT BE RETURNING.

now for my review on the room.  dont even get me started.  came here for me 25th bday and with the problems checking in my birthday was starting to become shitty.  we got the go room since it looked really nice online...too bad totally not. 

-5 cigarette burn holes in the blanket.
-Remote was missing back cover.
-The door handle to the bathroom was broken and swinging back and forth.
-The vinyl pink wallpaper was peeling off the bathroom wall.
-No extra toilet paper.  there was like less than half a roll on the holder.
-3 big dark stains in the carpet
-Caulking in shower was coming off and all moldy
-All 3 lamps in room did not work
-Ceiling light had 3 dead bulbs.

Pool here sucks butt.

Headed to the pool Saturday morning.  Pool was packed full of people just drinking and mingling around.  You really cant even swim just post and drink.  We went to claim our free drinks so we got 2 strawberry margaritas which consist of no alcohol.  We should of got beers instead.  Then went to go get our pool kit ( Vegas Hat, Sun Block, and aloe wipes) which we actually is charged to the room and you get a receipt and when u check out u give the front desk the receipt and they reverse the charge. How inconvenient.   Pool sucked so we all decided to go to the Go Pool for the 21 and up with European sun bathing.  Thought it was be less people since girls do get in free but guys have to pay.  It was pointless since the minute was walked in we walked back out.  There was nothing but old people there and heavy set woman with their boobs all out I DO NOT want to see that.  no offense but damn!  I wasn't there to see boobs I really just wanted to listen to music and hang with friends where there wasn't going to be tons of kids and people.  

I defin will not be retuning to Flamingo. Worst Las Vegas Hotel I ever stayed at.

Got 7 days for $350 versus Caesar's right across the street walking distance away where they wanted $1200 

Rooms were ok, bed comfort was good. Carpet in room needed cleaning felt a little gross, but for the $$ saved it was ok. 

Hotel and casino itself was very good. Casino was always hopping !

We love staying at the Flaming Hotel. It's nice and no one tries to knock down the door at 8am trying to get into clean. The only issues I had were: no "Do Not Disturb" sign (had to make our own), they did not resupply us with clean glasses, no free WIFI, and no pen or notepad to write on. Other than those three, we had a nice stay. Hopefully we can stay an extra day to enjoy the pool area.
very nice location  great rates  nice pool rooms are huge and clean and customer service (front desk) are great ;) will come back soon

Surprisingly nicer than I expected... but still a bit janky. 

The casino was fun... but the hotel had a pretty bad layout - I don't think I've ever had such a difficult time navigating around to fine my room. 

Beds were ok... blankets kinda scratchy...

I am giving this place 5 stars because I stay here for free and Im a Diamond Card Member..As a matter of fact I am in the Diamond Lounge right now drinking some Johnny Walker Gold Label watching the Warrior game while logged on this cool Dell Computer all at the same time.... Oh yes!  Free drinks and finger foods! The Go Rooms are pretty sweet.. And they opened a new restaurant here called Voga... I had the scallops which rested on a crab cake topped with asparugus and rich hollandaise sauce... Its really good.. Im just glad this meal was gratis because this place is pretty expensive.

I stayed at the Flamingo from Tuesday October 1 to Thursday October 3 in a standard room. I was weary because of some of the negative reviews written on here, but I'll be honest, I'm glad I stayed here. Is it the Bellagio? Of course not, so to everyone complaining about how it's outdated, or the nearby construction, or the hallway carpets, just keep in mind you get what you pay for, and that's meant to be a dig on the Flamingo, but when you're paying anywhere from 30-70 a night, whereas Caesar's charges at least twice to three times that, well... there's a reason! 
Yeah, the hallway carpets need to be replaced. But are hallway carpets really going to hinder or enhance your stay?!? The elevators were fast and reliable, the staff was very friendly, and the showers were nice (excellent water pressure! unfortunately, in my room, the water built up a tad in the tub, don't know if the drain was partially plugged up or something but whatever). The best part was the bed though, it was super soft but still firm (almost like a tempur pedic). 
However, there are a couple of things that prevent me from giving it 5 stars. The walls are thinner than an aspiring New York model. Luckily I don't think anyone was booked in the rooms to the side of me, but I was on the 24th floor and could hear the music coming from a little patio bar down by the hotel shops and pool around 9 pm, and I also heard people coming and going as if my door was wide open. And the hotel itself makes weird little noises, almost like an old house, at night. I think its the A\/C unit in the bathroom making the little creaks but who knows. If you're a loud sleeper (or drunk) you'll be fine though. Also, if you're about 6'3" or taller you wont fit in the shower.
I had heard the tables at the Flamingo were quite generous, but I didn't experience any of that. I didn't lose my shirt, but never really got on a roll and never witnessed anyone really excited to be gambling there...
All in all though, the Flamingo really is a good value. It's got a great location, as you're within a couple minutes walking distance of Paris, Bally's, Caesar's, Mirage, etc...
PS. If you aren't a Total Rewards member before you check in, GO SIGN UP! Just sign up for the Gold membership (free to do) They have a separate line for Gold members to check in. I waited for maybe 5 minutes then was checked in in a couple more minutes. Saved me at least an hour. There's also a self-serve check-in kiosk that might save you time if you don't care about what type of room you get.

Booked this hotel because it was close to a lot of food choices and had free parking.
I liked that it had self check-in and check-out so you can avoid the long line at the counter.  

When we were trying to check-in, one of the reps asked us where we were from, and told us to line up, then ignored us.  Afterwards, I went to the test the self check-in, and had another rep that was much nicer in her customer service.  As we were leaving, the first rep that we encountered came back and tried to sell us on some packages, and tried to entice us with free stuff.  We were being nice and followed him to see what he was talking about, but then it confirmed our theory that nothing is free in the world because he was trying to get us to spend 2-4 hours listening about something similar to time shares.  We booked it out of there quick since we had better things to do, like sleep.

The room that I got looked like it got updated, but I won't really know since it was the first time I stayed at this hotel.  The walls and door was thin so it wasn't great because we could hear people yelling and talking outside our door, and the water running and door close to the room next to us.  The bathroom had wall paper that you can see what older, and the water from the shower didn't fully stay hot the whole time I used it.  It also had trouble fully shutting off too.

Don't know if I'll stay here again.

I didn't stay here so am writing this review only for my experience visiting the hotel.  I read a few reviews from people who stayed at the hotel that were not favorable and that is disappointing....I love the old world elegance of this hotel that has stayed true to the test of time.  The home of the showgirls.  The gardens or habitat as they refer to it was upkept wonderfully well and we were lucky enough to have an opportunity to see the feeding of the resident pelicans Bugsy and Virgina named after the former owners of the casino. In addition to the pelicans who are both rescue pelicans the Flamingo features many (you guessed it) flamingos and also a respectable Koi pond.  This was definitely a nice oasis to take respite in while walking on the strip.  We went once during the day and another time at night. They had some cute shops with friendly personnel.

This place is an absolute sink hole. Awful customer service and the rooms are in shambles. Our bathroom light was busted all night even after numerous calls to have it fixed. Pretty much had to get ready by phone light and couldn't shower. Caused us to be late for dinner with friends and ruined the night. We also were supposed to have a fridge in our room and we had to call a few times for that to be delivered. 

We were not offered another room until we had to call again the next morning and even then I finally had to debate with them for 30 min to get only $100 off the room. They wouldn't even comp it for the awful experience and for ruining our plans. They told us either to wait for it to be fixed or to just deal with it because the only other rooms they had were smoking and they were not going to upgrade us for their poor excuse of a hotel room. Plus they didn't even give us another fridge so all the food we had, needed to be thrown away. 

Ana R. (Previous review was removed for privacy concerns so I can't post the last name but maybe if she wasn't so awful at her job she wouldn't have to worry about her name being in my review) was the manager on duty at the time and had absolutely zero customer service skills and offered no help. She told us that since we used the room to sleep in(we couldn't move because no other rooms were available other than smoking and we shouldn't have to subject ourselves to a nasty smelling room) she wouldn't comp it and it wasn't the hotels fault our plans were ruined. Are you kidding me?! That is the level of customer service you hire especially from a manager? How has she not been fired yet?

That is just the room. The rest of the hotel is falling apart. All of the elevators stop at every floor whether their is someone there or not, most of the elevators have white out drawn numbers because they are too cheap to buy 25 cent number plates, the casino smells awful, the carpets are fading and curling up on most of the floor, the buffet is a joke for $40 that has sub standard food and nothing of value. The most upscale thing they had their was a salmon filet and it was over seasoned and super fishy smelling and tasting. 

This deserves its own mention as well, they block your cell signal in most of the rooms and then force you to pay for WiFi.

With so many new casinos on the strip that have the same prices as this place, I really do not understand how people will still use this casino. Everyone from the managers to the employees are rude and have no care for the guests or the state of the hotel.

Rooms have been partially renovated so that's nice.  New tvs and floors.  We stayed in a room over looking the strip for free on Wednesday and Thursday night.  Only had to pay the $20 a night resort fee.  Wifi worked.  I went to the spa for a $10 fee, it was just ok.  You can't beat the location!

Stayed for New Years 2015 and a couple of us from our group got stuff stolen while our items were at the Bell hop waiting. We left our stuff there while having breakfast before leaving.  Someone actually went in and stuffed our luggage with blankets and took out our expensive winter coats to fill in the space. Valet was also a ridiculous mess. Upon filing a complaint\/report, I got nothing but "filed paper!" For future trips, I'd rather stay at a motel off the strip than at Flamingo! If you decide to stay, please check all your bags before leaving. Unfortunately for us, New Year's was crazy and we checked out with stolen valuables.

We got a GO room which was nice but 2 stars off for:

1. Our toilet overflowed at 3am
2. No late check-out, not even at noon!

I was looking forward to the bed since everyone raved that you couldn't get out of it but for me, I got out of it with no hesitation. My bed at home is waaaaaay better.

I did enjoy the built-in TV in the mirror in the bathroom. My BF thought I fell in the toilet because I was taking so damn long but I just had to reassure him that I was just watching TV LOL! And I didn't mind the pink florenscent lighting in the bathroom. Pink is my favorite color!

Sure the casino floor can be smoky but I really didn't care because as a smoker, I was contributing to the smokiness.

And boo to the cocktail waitress that wouldn't give my BF 2 drinks because she was insinuating that one was for me and I wasn't playing at the time. Um, missy can't you see that I have 2 drinks already that are keeping me rather busy?

The pool is the highlight of the whole place. So much fun!!! The slides connecting to the pools were great and the turn around of people was pretty good so you will find a lounge chair. Sure there were kids but not as much as I expected. And they were about 12+ years old and watching them have a blast made me feel like acting 12 years old again and go down the slide over and over and over and over again. The waterfall is nice too.

And how LUCKY was I when I lost my DL in the pool and one of the lifegaurds was able to spot me out and give it back to me! Lifegaurd you ROCK!!!!!

2 for 1 Dos Equis at the pool bar! Drunk swimming! Hell yeah!

I definitely would stay at the flamingo if you're going for just a quick trip to Vegas! It's right in the middle of the strip! You get for what you pay for so don't expect rooms like Caesars palace! Haha the entrance to the parking was closed so we had to grow through the back!

Never again will I stay here! Room smelt like cigarettes soon as I walked in, check in line was wrapped around the lobby and the refused to let me in to the pool on my 27th birthday! Over a paper id after I went to the exact same pool the day before... NEVER AGAIN!! So embarrassing to be grown as hell and turned away from the pool ON YOUR BIRTHDAY!

I needed a place to ststay for a few hours.  It was early in the morning. I'm up for military member. The strip was sold out and I just need a place to crash. Sean the night manager hook me up with a room at a great price make sure I was thinker. From now on anybody that comes to Vegas either myself family or company are going to stay at the flamingo. Shaws definition of customer service the flamingo is lucky to have him!

This was my third and last time staying at the Flamingo. Stayed here for my friends Bachelorette party and everything about our stay was HORRID! 

My friend called the hotel to book a Suite for 8 people. When we checked in the gave us two connected rooms when my friend specifically said she wanted one big suite. Our two rooms were a Fab Room and a "mini suite" we had one updated room and the other was disgusting and old! The couch was for DISGUSITINGGGGG. With white mystery stains and all. 

We were all pissed and dissatisfied with this room since we spent more than a pretty penny on the room. They did nothing for us. The supervisors Josh and Ramon were the most unhelpful human beings I've beer talked to in my life. When we told them we had 8 people in the room they said "that room does not hold eight people. We charge $30 extra a night per person" WTH!!! We called and asked for a room for 8 people and you want to charge us extra for YOUR MISTAKE??? 

Also none of the ice machines worked on our floor, the floor below us and the floor above us. The front desk wanted to charge us EIGHT DOLLARS FOR ICE. 

All they care about is getting as much money as possible. I hate you Flamingo. I used to love you but now I'm a sad angry customer.

Good location ,but they are under construction now and will not move you to
another room. Should have been posted on their web site and told at the check
in desk prior. Noise before 8 a.m. and after 5pm....no water 10-2 pm?????Really.
Was affordable and right on the strip.  Room had clearly seen better days but was clean and we had a great view.  Definitely recommend, good hotel and casino on a budget!

Pretty nice hotel. Use the kiosks to check in for sure. Service was actually really friendly here. Some parts of the hotel are kind of ghetto but even in that part the rooms were nice. We also had a great view. Location is great and price was too.

This hotel is now very tired. Got there through CES 2015 and will NEVER go back. Tiles in the shower broken,, mold in the bathroom, chipped doors with paint missing, holes in the ceilings of the bathroom. ATROCIOUS  is the best thing to say about it.
There is nothing good about this hotel.

Great hotel for a girls weekend! Very clean and accommodating,and the updated room we got was nice!We had a great view to top that off!I would definitely stay again!
The staff was great as well!What else can I say Vegas Babbby!

Well, we didn't want to agree with the reviews about the hotel, but they are all true. One hour check in, 45 minutes to get luggage, great room looking down the strip and watching the Bellagio fountain but right above The Cromwell and rooftop party till 4am! Damn, that sucked. .their response. ..wait for it. .it's Vegas sir.
Never again, please stay anywhere else. 
Just stayed last weekend 7\/31 -8\/2 2015

I will start this review by saying that we stayed may 7-10th (a Saturday through Tuesday) and only paid $320 for our room!  I am going to base my review on that alone.  You are not going to get 5 star accommodations for this price!  We did not stay in a GO room.  It probably would've been worth the extra $30 a night for the upgrade.  The rooms are outdated, carpet is stained, bathroom floor is disgusting (but the toilet bowl and shower were clean).  

The pool is beautiful!  We purchased a cabana and day bed and had a great day at the pool.  Our hostess, John was great!  Unfortunately the weather did not cooperate, so only one day was spent at the pool!  

The location is great!  Walking distance to all the great attractions!  So, if you are looking to spend your money on eating, gambling, shopping, and basically just need a place to sleep and shower, this is the place for you!  However, if you are looking for a 5 star hotel experience, this is definitely not the place for you!  You definitely get what you pay for here!

And the breakfast Buffett was pretty good too.  Fresh crepes!  And cotton candy for a later sweet tooth attack!

3.5 is my official review score!

Staying here for NYE. So far, except for the parking situation, the Flamingo has been a pleasant surprise. I have a Go room with a view of the High Roller. The room is excellent. Maybe the best non-suite I have ever had in LV. The room is spacious with a great bed, big closet, and nice bathroom. But yes, the sink drains slow. The casino is just okay. It is a little run down and the crowd includes some people you may not want to hang with. I guess that's the price you pay for a $10 craps table.

Love The Pink Chicken . re done rooms are nice.Great location , Good poker Room, nice dealers . Love the new Margaritaville casino.


only bad thing is the GO Pool. It should be in a trailer park, wall to wall drunk  white trash , beer cans and trash in the pool. couldn't wait to get back to my room to shower off filth . - 2 stars
will be back next month and will crash pool at Wynn or caesers

Stayed in the luxury go room and it was really nice for the price.  This isn't the Wynn people so don't expect as such.  But if you looking for a nice clean room for a decent price on the strip then this is the place.  Location is great as well. The pool was nice with separate  adult only and family friendly pools.

My boyfriend and I did a spontaneous Vegas trip a couple weeks ago and booked a room at the flamingo. Prices were awesome at the time. We got the 17 or 18th floor with a view overlooking the pool and flamingos downstairs.  Oh and you could see that new Ferris wheel thingy too. 

There was a queen size bed, very clean and well kept (even after the remodeling of the hotel) and had switch controlled blinds. Best part ever! We get kinda lazy lol. 

The casino and everything was well kept and everything just looked nice even if it was an older hotel on the strip. Now my tip: don't wait in the long line for checking in. Head over to their I believe players counter and get a membership. Then you can ditch that long line you're in for non members and wait in the much shorter faster line for members only. My bf has the best tips and tricks he pulls. 

All in all it was a good stay.

Very disappointed this time around at the flamingo. I remember staying here years ago (since I've tended to stay at 5 star resorts i.e. Wynn, palazzo, encore) and for some reason they've warped back in time. Upon check in the front staff was very helpful until I asked about the swimming pool which tentatively should open March 3, but they stated they weren't sure and it depended on the weather. Upon checking in into the room the first evening we had a mishap where our shower went from cold to hot and had to Area for warm water. We called the front as we were preparing to head out for the evening and the faucet was never fixed. I spoke to an assistant manager the next morning at this point and once again offered to send an engineer which I disagreed to and asked for a room change. I asked for a complimentary upgrade at this point and she stated no, simply no with no apology that we had to move all our luggage to a new room. I'm not sure if I'm used to customer service at upscale resorts but as I've stated and various hotels throughout the United States I feel the Flamingo is no where up to par with their counterparts. I have on more night here and honestly at this point I will never stay here again and seeing the quality of the room and customer service attitude is all in dismay, I dread staying here another evening and the mold spores in the vents and smell from the heater is seriously a health hazard. Please me mindful.

We came here to grab a bite of pizza and play around in the slots for a bit before ending our trip. We had fun. The food was decent, ok. The slots were good, definitely played for a while on just a few bucks. Will be back!

I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Bottom of the barrel for a Strip hotel, for sure.  Rooms were decent size but everything is just so rundown.  Carpet coming up, multiple stains, bathroom is gross-feeling...you get the picture.  I was embarrassed to even tell people where we stayed, it's that bad.  The casino portion isn't great either.  We only gambled there for maybe an hour or two the entire duration of our stay, even though our hotel room was there.  

The absolute worst to me were the thin walls.  I could hear ENTIRE conversations, word for word, as if the person was in MY room.  Our room neighbors had parties every night and were screaming banshees acting like idiots.  I have no problems with partiers, I like to get crazy too, but damn.  They screeeeeeamed the entire night, every night.  We made up for it by having a lot of loud sex, so +1 in the win column.

Seriously though, don't stay at this hotel.

We stayed here last month and had a pretty good time.  We chose this hotel because it was close to where our friends were staying, but at half the price.  This is a great location on the strip, almost right in the middle of it all.  I have always heard about the Flamingo, and decided to give it a shot.  I've grown to understand you don't stay in Vegas for the hotel room, cause you're not in it very often.  I will say this, the bathroom is very small, so if you're with a couple girls, it may be kind of hard for them all to get ready at the same time.  We stayed in the standard room, so the price was really nice, which made me feel pretty good about it being mediocre.  We actually ended up staying one more day than we had planned, however we switched hotels.  I would definitely recommend this to college kids on a budget or someone else who enjoys spending most their time outside the room in Vegas.

I just stayed at Flamingo over the weekend and it had literally the worst hotel service I have ever seen Vegas. And I have stayed at almost all of them at the strip and downtown Vegas. My first complaint is when we asked for something as simple as extra pillows and blankets at 10:30PM.
