We were supposed to have a view of the strip and it was simply a back view . The price of the hotel was very reasonable but in this case but you get what you pay for in this case clearly . It was ok for one not but would not reccomended for your entire stay in Vegas

I was just checking this site for my previous review, but it has been removed.  I noticed that a lot of others have the same impression I did when I stayed here.  It is a real "dive" although they claim they are one of the best in town.  It is totally unbelievable!  When I stayed here, they turned off the water in the hotel - not even the toilets worked.  They informed me when I called down to the front desk and waited 25 minutes on the phone, that I could go to the casino floor and use the restroom there.  What did I pay for?  The room had half of the floor in carpet and the rest was concrete where they had pulled up whatever was on the floor before.  The bathroom had wallpaper hanging off of the walls as if it had been steamed off.  The shower was covered with mold around the enclosure.  Needless to say, we didn't  stay there and went to another facility.  When I returned the next day to cancel and receive a refund, the rudeness at the front desk was the worst I'd ever received.  Since I didn't give them enough notice, they were going to charge me for my full stay even though I wasn't staying there.  After escalating my complaint through management, I got my refund, but I made sure that all the people now waiting in line would know that service to them would not be acceptable.  I will never stay here again, no matter if they offered me a room at no charge.  They do not deserve any kudos when they cannot keep up with the large flow of people visiting Las Vegas and to not have control over their staff.  I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Smack in the middle of the strip - Can't complain! We had a great room on the 17th floor! Had a great deal! $65 for the night! No problem with parking at all. We talked to other couples in the elevator that love this place and everyone just seemed really stoked to be there. Bathrooms are pink, tv in the mirror, flatscreens, boombox stereo with all the modern connects, remote drapes, desk, fridge, etc. I'm glad I didn't pay attention to the negative reviews. I was worried my girlfriend would think I was a cheapskate but she was really impressed with the room. Check it out guys!

This was my first trip to Vegas and I picked The Flamingo due to its location on the strip and the price.

I arrived at the hotel late in the evening and did not have to wait long to check-in, however I did see extremely long lines at peak times on other days.

I stayed in the Go Deluxe room, which I highly recommend. The room was clean and very modernized. The bathroom door does not offer good privacy, so hopefully you're  close with whoever is staying in your room. 

It would have been nice to have Wi-Fi, however that is not a deal breaker.

So sad to have to write a negative review on a hotel that I always enjoyed, it being in the center of the strip and has great tables we usually win on. 

Unfortunately we stayed here twice in the last two months and both times it was unpleasant,  and a nightmare experience!

On 3\/12 we stayed here for my birthday and stumbled upon a freakin' ROACH in our bathroom!!!!! We were on the 8th floor staying in a Mini Suite. I was so sick to my stomach and I called the front desk immediately. Management switched us right over to their Neapolitan Suite at no additional charge. They also brought the room key down to us since they had a very busy check in during that time. Although I appreciated them accommodating us right away I am still not over this. Especially since this was our second horrible experience.

During our last stay in February I got bed bug bites in their Go Room!!! I was in so much discomfort and disgust I did not even want to go back and stay there this trip. However, since we were there to see Olivia Newton John for my birthday we just sucked it up out of convenience. Never again will we stay at this bug infested place. I'd share pics of my bed bug bites but let's just say they got me in places I can't post due to being a classy chick.

Flamingo....get your crap together. Read other posts here and other various sites. A lot of us are experiencing this and having unsatisfactory experiences at your hotel. 

I am now dealing with upper management regarding my ugly incidents. If anyone needs to voice their concerns here is their customer service email Totalrewards@custhelp.com   So hard to locate contact info online, thanks Twitter for being so informative!
Great location and a great price. Our room had an awesome view and being able to walk out into the action of the strip was just awesome. I will definitely stay here again.

Love this place. But......
If you get Paula at the front desk you might as well wait for the next available teller. Holy shit she is terrible! Zero personal skills!

I always liked the flamingo, but given the past 8 yrs with all the new hotels around I feel that sometime you can get a better deal at another spot. I got a room on the 14th floor. Looks old. No fridge. No microwave. 25inch tv. No vent in the bathroom after a hot shower. Air condition seems to never reach the coldest temperature. 
I'm just not happy here anymore.
Pool, I was here for EDC weekend and had to pay 10bucks to enter the pool at the flamingo. Didn't understand that one. Should be free for actual guest here. It's not like they opened later or had a special event going on. 
Keep searching for a better deal.

i was having a good time at the Flamingo until i spoke with hotel guest service manager Juan David.

i had an inquiry about the resort fee, informing him that at the time of booking i was unaware of the resort fee amount.

i let him know i did not use any of the items included with the resort fee and he immediately began to degrade me.  saying "i know what you're doing, you want a compensation."

Juan David and i went back and forth disagreeing with the reason for a resort fee but then he began to LIE saying "your deposit is the resort fee and you know that."

i told him he was wrong and was now speaking to me in a demeaning manner.

he told me "i'm done with you, goodbye" and walked away.  i'm positively certain his rude hand gestures and walking away was captured on surveillance video.

i called him back and asked for a business card and he handed me a female manager's (Yolanda) card.

i asked him, "are you Yolanda ?" and he said, "whatever, write a letter, do what you want, i'm not giving you anything, goodbye." and he walked away.

i called him several times back and checked him on his lie and bad service, and asked for a supervisor.

Juan David told me he was the manager and "no one higher is coming."  "come back in the morning and get in line if you want a complaint."

i asked for a complaint form instead and he said "no, i don't have one, goodbye."

halfway thru this indecent treatment i began to record the 'conversation' so if anyone is interested in listening, please contact me.

Walked throughout here to check out their gambling scene and they seriously need an update!! Everything looked very old and worn out. The atmosphere was very dead and dull. Was not excited to try and gamble here at all!

This place is a gem for the price you pay. 
-Yes, it's older
-Yes, The parking and valet can be a PIA
-Yes, the tv in the room is not user friendly
But I still enjoy this place every time.
The location is close to everything I enjoy most about Vegas. We did a cabana at the pool. This pool is vibrant, and more my speed as opposed to some of the other pool parties available in Vegas. The servers are all friendly. The music is good. One thing that does SUCK is the restrooms. There's even a line for mens (unheard of). I understand its by the pool, but I hated going to the restroom because you always feel like you're standing in a lake. The pool party itself was pretty good. I had a blast. Despite the many options available in Vegas, I always end up just going to the Flamingo.

The room (Go Room). Check the website for a hotel description. My thoughts: Fairly clean. A deep cleaning of the carpets in the room (and hallways for that matter) wouldn't hurt. The TV programming sucks. Obviously I didn't come to Vegas to watch TV, but even while in the room (in between outings) the channel lineup makes no sense. Also, I don't think they've ever had cords to plug in your Iphone for music. Knowing this, I brought my own speaker. The fridge (not available in the fab rooms) is clutch if you plan on bringing your own libations, and\/or taking back leftovers for future consumption.

I would and will return. Do yourself a favor. Don't go in expecting the Four Seasons or motel 6. Accept the experience for what it is, and you'll enjoy it that much more.

The room is just ok... but the flamingo exhibit is awesome. 

Friendly staff... evening willing to walk into the street and hail a taxi for you :) 

The pool closes at 8pm... WAY TOO EARLY!

Nie water fall scenery for a wedding.

Fun place! I'm no hotel snob so I found the Flamingo to be really reasonable for the price and location. The driveway to get into the hotel parking is kind of dumb - you're fighting the foot traffic between the Flamingo and Bill's so we waited for what seemed like forever before flooring it and almost knocking some people out the way. Once at the parking structure we almost weren't allowed in because we didn't have a room key because we hadn't yet checked in, but seeing all our luggage in the backseat was sufficient enough, thank goodness. We had booked a Go Room with two queen beds for myself, my husband and a friend. Check-in was slooooww with only one line for people checking in and out. The woman who was supposed to be checking us in was RUDE. Her name started with an "M" and she had black hair.. just try not to end up at her window if you can help it because she gave us the hardest time.  

Finally we got into our rooms. After waiting 30 minutes for the bellboy to bring up our things, we called down to see what the holdup was. "10 more minutes, there's one more guest ahead of you," we were told. 30 more minutes and another phone call later our bags arrived. That put a small damper on our eagerness to start partying right away but we got over that quickly. Our room had the most amazing view of the Strip and the Bellagio fountains. With small mirrored panels above each bed complete with those naked Hollywood bulbs surrounded by an all-white bed frame and headboard, the room had a bit of a retro-futuristic feel. The bathroom was cool with a sliding frosted door and a TV inside the mirror. 

The pool party on Saturday morning was just as we expected it to be - an overly warm pool overflowing with drunken 20 somethings. The vibe was energetic and fun, and the grotto area with the waterfalls was really fun. There was also a booty shaking contest which really got everyone riled up... I see a Vegas baby boom from that weekend in the near future. 

The WiFi here sucks. The hallways trip me out - I don't know if it's the colors of the huge number of rooms stretching endlessly, but when you're intoxicated beware! It could be hard to find your room.. personal experience.The lobby and casino were constantly bustling - quick tip: buy your bottles of water and other drinks elsewhere because the beverage shop inside the casino on your way out to the Strip charges about $4.50 for a bottle of water. Although desperate times call for desperate measures.

Overall, the Flamingo is a decently budget-friendly hotel and we would stay here again!

The renovations were nice to the Flamingo, the new rooms are pretty cool, especially, if you've been inside some of the older ones.  We had several floors of the Go rooms, and love the tv's in the mirrors in the bathrooms - great way to kill time while getting ready.

 The Euro (Go) pool was awesome, we had a great time down there, and it's nice cause it's adults only, so no snotty kids jumping and splashing.

Great dj at the pool, ok drink service, although a little spendy for what you got.  The cabanas were excellent & reasonable.

Hate the lobby format, and the way the casino is situated, it seems to draw the smoke smell in, and it just lingers, I have a hard time breathing in that, and it almost killed me every time I would walk down to try to exit the building.  I didnt even walk thru the casino part, but felt like I had smoked a pack of cigs.

Flamingo Las Vegas fits nicely into the overall scene on The Strip.  Of course it has been VEGAS forever and there are a lot of vintage photos in and around the hotel to remind you of its roots.
     The accomodations are a-ok and what I expected.  5-star?  No.  4-star?  It begins to touch the basement of a 4-star.  My personal opinion is Flamingo is a satisfactory 3 to 3.5-star stay.  The pool is just adequate.  The casino is large and has some "Whale Areas" for the high-rollers.  I didn't view Flamingo as a true Vegas-style nightlife stop as is Caesars or Bellagio or Arias and the likes.
     Flamingo gets it done with common fanfare, good food and buffet offerings.  The room are basic in my range of stays.  I wish it has a 24-hour food shop in which to quench the thirst or grab a snack or something hot.
    Location?  It's perfect.  You can stay for less at the Flamingo - not be disappointed - and have access to all that is diamonds, gold, platinum and the likes to your north, south,east and west.

Is bigger really better? this hotel is hugh and busybusybusy. lines to check in and sometimes out  people people every where elevators always full. lucky i am a early riser so i had a few hours to wander around w\/out a mass of people. we did not get a go room we were in the old part of the hotel the room was clean,comfortable  and quiet for the most part. but was a 3 minute walk to the elevators usually a 4\/5 wait for a elevator you could squeeze in. It was a chore to get to the casino.It was the 4th of july weekend but i have a feeling this property is always busy. got a good price on the room but i can see why just because of it,s location in the hotel. staff seamed fairly congenial for the all day kaos they see and deal with.   ps they charge 13.95 for internet connection

For the sole purpose of having a place to sleep, shower and keep your stuff dry, 
Flamingo is more than fine. I wouldn't take my wife here or let my parents stay 
here but I went to Vegas for a bachelor party and crashed in a Fab Deluxe room 
for three days without incident. 

The hotel is most definitely worn down. From the room furniture to the bathroom 
fixtures to the elevators, it ain't classy. But it's safe enough and the price 
is usually right. Location is outstanding; I could get on the strip in minutes 
thanks to my room being right off of the Habitat Elevators (that north exit into the 
Linq is sweet!). 

Stay at Flamingo for the convenience, price and nothing else.

The ONLY reason this place got two stars was because of LOCATION. Location, location, location. That and the rooms aren't THAT bad once you actually get through the casino but oh my WORD. The entire place smells like old people and rotten eggs and farts. It's truly horrific. The other downside is that there aren't that many options to eat, they're pretty pathetic and the other flamingo area is lame. Again, LOCATION. It's smack in the center of the strip so it's pretty close to everything.

Just got back from Vegas...what an awesome fun time! Too bad I can't say the same for the customer service at the Flamingo Hotel on the strip! Let me first say during my experience with the front desk personnel I was completely sober...they just lack in tact and professionalism! People send a lot of money to enjoy their stay in Vegas and because of this they should get the professional help that they deserve! Won't be staying their again! I recommend the Luxor...that was a better experience!

You get what you pay for. If you go in with the mindset that you might only be paying $20 a night, you can't expect 5 star service. Great place if you can sleep through noise or want to go to Vegas with friends.

Very disappointed! Refrigerator that was promised was not in the room upon my arrival, I had to wait until one was delivered! The carpeting was dirty, the windows need replacing,window screens peeling and looks like moisture between double pained window, it was nasty!

My friends and I stayed here during a last minute, impromptu Vegas trip--and that will be the absolute last time any of us will stay here. We arrived late Friday night and were told that the non-smoking room we booked was not available. We had no other option but stay in a smoking room that reeked of cigarette smoke. What is the point of reserving a room if they are going to give away our room to someone else? Doesn't it make sense to reserve the non-smoking room for the people who booked and pre-paid for the thereby requested room? We were told that because we arrived late, all the other rooms were taken. I'm sorry but if I reserved and paid for the room, it does not matter what time I get there. Upon arrival in our smoke-infested room, we tried to call the front desk and alas, the telephone does not work. Wifi connection and reception is horrible in this hotel. Although, the rooms are not so horrible, it is definitely dated. The bathroom is very small and even more dated than the room itself. The stellar reviews for the Flamingo must be referencing the Go rooms which they have only available as an upgrade, and was sold out upon our arrival. The casino itself was not bad, but I would never, ever stay here again. We paid nearly $300 for two nights for a room we didn't want that didn't even have a working phone.

Ok.  So there are some really, really great things to say about this hotel.  Perhaps some of you will say I'm crazy, but nothing went wrong during our stay (July 29-31, 2016).  

Check in:
We arrived at 2:30pm on a Friday afternoon and waited maybe 15 minutes to check in (our choice not to use self check in - it was offered to us by an actual human - and a very polite human I might add).  Shari at the front desk was absolutely amazing.  Super friendly, great energy and very helpful.  Steered us from our studio room into a Go room because of the age of the furnishings - but she only did this after asking us a series of questions and showing us pictures of rooms.  No pressure was applied for us to change rooms and there was an extremely nominal difference in price so we decided to change to the Go room.  Our keys were created and we were sent on our way - no early check in fee, no hassle.  In our room before 2:50pm....

Elevators:
We were on the 21st floor in the spa tower and never had a long wait or an issue with the elevators.  True that only 3 of the 6 elevators were operable in the bank, but they seemed to run smoothly all weekend.  Our friends were staying in the main tower and each night that we visited them, we had short wait times for elevators in their banks as well.

Go Room:
Newer furniture, a small fridge, great view of the Bellagio fountains and quiet.  No real complaints at all.  Blankets and pillows were clean, plenty of towels, and a nicely appointed bathroom.  Two TVs.  Housekeeping was lovely and very friendly.  I also saw management on the floor and he was polite and smiling.  Yes, the hallways could use come updating (shampoo the carpet and paint the doors, but really not a big deal.  Just looks a bit unkempt.  Not disastrous or offputting.

Pool:
Two pools - one family, one 21+.  We had a cabana at the family pool.  Plenty of space, decent towel service.  Not enough servers\/hosts - there were only two people working for the entire pool.  They were clearly understaffed but truly, the pool area had a bar that never had a line so you could easily go and get your own water (free) and order other drinks from a bartender. Food needed to be ordered from one of the two working on the deck.  No cover charge, not a lot of kids, decent music (not fabulous, just decent).

Casino:
Meh.  Needs some glam to bring this back to its heyday but you can always swing next door to another casino for more ambiance.  Regardless, it's a casino.  Has all of the games you'll need.  Enough said.

Checkout:
Online, you can set your own time and an email pops up with a receipt.  Easy peasy.

Overall, it was a very nice stay.  I usually stay at other Caesars properties but wanted to stay at the same hotel as all of my friends (there were 20 of us for a party).  I was pleasantly surprised.  Bottom line, be nice when you check in and you will be rewarded with a nice room and probably have a great time here.  You reap what you sow.

Namaste

Okay a little better this time around. I understand that Harrahs Entertainment can't do construction on every place but some things can be done to improve the existing conditions. The customer service was way better than last year. The room was old looking but ok. They ruin the view with the screen tape they put on the windows. Needs: carpeting in hallways in towers, elevators to be cleaned, and a better sportsbook area. Most of the dealers are decent however there are a few exceptions. One person that will be unnamed in the poker room is a moron. He needs to be put on the Keno machine. The dealers are very diverse which I enjoy and appreciate. On the main floor during the 8pm-4am shift are Mikaela from Bulgaria-she is excellent and fun when she deals 3 card poker. There is also Lissethe from Nicaragua-she is my all time favorite dealer. I wish she dealt at a Harrahs property closer to Chicago.

The Flamingo is a misunderstood hotel.

Sure, the rooms aren't the best (often the interior, beds, bathroom, etc... is lacking or dated) but you don't know how good you have something until you don't have it anymore. The Flamingo is in one of the best locations on the strip. It is connected to the monorail, right across the street from Caesar's Palace and Bellagio, and gives you access to a lot of convenience stores\/amenities located on the same part of the sidewalk. (Walgreens, Dennys, McDonalds, the list goes on).

It's just in a fantastic location. If you really want to enjoy "being on the Vegas strip", then Flamingo is a great spot to do it. Don't forget - there is an independent (not a hotel lobby one with absurd prices) liquor store literally a 3 minute walk from the location. Try finding that at the Mirage.

Not to mention the Flamingo is an iconic hotel from famous movies like Fear & Loathing in Las Vegas. And don't forget the pool. It's quite literally one of the best in the area.

Definitely room for improvement in some departments but it's a fantastic hotel and one of the best in the area that easily enables you to experience Vegas.

Overall had a mediocre stay here. I agree with others that the hotel needs an upgrade\/update but I gave it a few stars for the price (very cheap). There was no parking when we got there so we had to lug our bags pretty far and then wait in the madhouse that is their lobby for a check in kiosk to be free. They put a $50 hold on my card for incidentals which is still on 5 days after check out...also check out was a disaster because their kiosks were down i.e. there were about 25 people waiting to check out (and this was at 8 am...)

This isn't your Grandpa's Flamingo anymore. I would even venture to say this isn't your overweight Chain smoking uncle Larry's Flamingo we all knew and didn't love from 5-10 years ago!

Before My recent trip to The Flamingo, the thought of staying there would immediately trigger thoughts of Depressing 1980's decor, overweight fanny pack wearing gamblers & The over exuberant expressions of Donnie & Marie as they stared longingly into each others eyes trying to forget about that one night back in 77' when things went a little to far. But to the contrary I must say the Flamingo has really cleaned up its act. The new decor is nice and the casino floor is clean and 80% fanny pack clear. 

Now saying that I have yet to stay in a room, but I will say that , where as before I would've only taken a side chick I was slightly ashamed of. Now I would be ok with taking a side chick I was not ashamed of, as well as possibly a girl that I have been dating awhile, all the while  insisting "Why do we have to put labels on what we are" here without hesitation!

All in all The Flamingo is an OK place with a GREAT location that I would recommend anyone walking the strip to try out. Hey, who knows you may finally be the first person to see Donnie and Marie finally consummate 35 years of tension and frustration!

Worst experience of my life staying at a hotel in Vegas. We come out here at least once a year for my son's soccer tournament and this is the 1st time at the flamingo. I checked in and my room wasn't even clean, my bathroom had feces in it (from the person before), the cleaning staff was late everyday to clean our room, the valet was full so we were forced to park on a side street..:: This is the most horribly managed hotel in Las Vegas. Don't stay here!!!

The place is very old, we got a suite and it's huge, but very old, carpet damaged, stained, shower is awful, bathroom is very old, scratches and all. Bed is ok, one TV must be 20 years old, I heated they are remodeling, but not sure when. They need capital. So 70's. 

The pool area is awesome though, lovely and lively. Looks good, live DJ..
Nice hotel, friendly staff. Stayed at the GO room. Nice view. The only issue is that people don't respect the non-smoking section. You smokers suck!!

This review is long overdue but necessary to post in order to warn others of the unethical practices and extreme distaste for customer service this hotel holds. Left my iPad in my hotel room and did not realize I did so until after checking out. Within an hour of checking out I called the front desk and the receptionist told me room service had found it. Yay! Called back an hour after that and suddenly *poof* "the iPad had disappeared"! Yup folks, the iPad grew two feet and walked away on it's own. After going back and forth with management numerous times and a police report later my iPad remains in the hands of some Flamingo employee; you're welcome. Merry effin Christmas. It is so disturbing that management engages, supports and appears to encourage the immoral doings of their staff. I will never stay here again as I cannot trust leaving MY belongings here and I warn others of the same. Do not support this hotel and their shady and incompetent staff.
Liked this casino! Cool things to look at, loud muic playing. Fun place to visit. Plus black jack at the bar. Hard to find.

I visit Las Vegas a couple of times each year, and I'm gradually working my way through the major hotel properties along the Strip.  I was looking for somewhere new to stay this time, and I figured: (1) the Flamingo is centrally located on the Strip, (2) there's a monorail stop in the back of the property, (3) my mom likes flamingos, (4) the rates were around $40\/night, and (5) the reviews weren't all negative... so how bad could it be?

I reserved a non-smoking room with two double beds.  In true Vegas style, they "ran out of non-smoking rooms" and wanted to put me in a smoking room.  I'd slipped a twenty in between my ID and credit card when I was checking in, which is a trick that usually gets you something nice - and this time, it saved me from a smoking room.  Alas, it didn't save me from the ensuing nightmare.  I was assigned a mini-suite on a high floor.  Superficially, it's a nice room.  Much bigger than a standard room, with a decent view of the Flamingo's famous nature habitat and pool facilities.  The decor is somewhat modernized, though a little bland.  But when you looked a little closer, the room left a lot to be desired:  Weird spatters and dents on the walls.  Stains on the ceiling.  Mildewed grout.  Shower curtain torn in half.  Sink that takes 5 minutes to drain.  No washcloths, bathmat, soap dish, or tub stopper.  Broken light fixture.  Outlet missing its cover.  General grunginess. 

The next morning, I called "guest services" (which took a while, since the button for "guest services" on my phone was - yes - broken!) and they said someone would come up during the day and fix everything.  I left and came back.  Half of the problems were still there, and I had new ones - they'd left filthy plunger-water in my sink, taken one of my rolls of toilet paper, and left a note advising that the hotel was out of toilet paper!  I was irate.  I went down to the desk this time and spoke to a manager on-duty.  He said they couldn't change my room because the hotel was full (meanwhile, they had rooms available for booking on their website), but they could fix everything in the evening.  Okay.  I left and came back around midnight.  Still not all fixed!  I did have toilet paper now (whew) but called maintenance once again.  They came around 1:30AM and finished my repairs.  I got an offer to change rooms for my last night, but I didn't want to repeat the process now that I'd been through all of this ridiculous nonsense.

I suppose you get what you pay for, though that doesn't quite ring true when my horrible $40\/night room has a regular rate of several times more.  I doubt they came in and made it worse because I paid less.  I took photographs of all of the broken stuff and am writing a letter to the Flamingo management about their crappy old hotel.

From 11\/15\/15
 
We stopped in here looking for a quick place to grab a bite to eat but didn't find anything we want. The Flamingo is right at the Linq Promenade and has a slew of shops and, of course, gambling. The food places look okay it just wasn't anything we were in the mood for at that particular moment, I will definitely stop in again to try some of these places out!

Customer service here is not so great , the hotel rooms are usually dirty and elevators make you feel like your going to get stuck overall the experience was ok I'd prefer to stay at a different hotel , this was my first stay staying at the flamingo and my last .

I've been coming to the Flamingo for over 10 years and the Go rooms are really cool!  The pool areas "open to the public" club philosophy has got to change!  Were staying here and can't even find a couple of lounge chairs!? Were carded for an 18+ pool and were 35.  Give me an effin break!  It's fun here but not classy!

As a "Total Rewards" member I booked my hotel for my Vegas trip many months in advance. I visit Las Vegas once a year & I thought it would be fun to experience the strip with a bit of vintage flair~ boy, was I wrong! 

On the day of my visit I confirmed my reservation via an automated email that had been emailed to me. This confirmation offered a reservation number. 

Upon arrival and eight hours of travel I visited a self-serve kiosk. It was shared with me "My room was not ready". I waited thirty minutes in the check in line. The guests in line had a college spring break vibe. Coolers in tow & cases of beer. People sitting on the ground all over the lobby.

I explained my concerns to a very nice front desk attendant & she gave me a very nice view on the strip. I was also the first door off the elevator. I was extremely thrilled to have that view. 

The downside. Upon entering the room I noticed a puddle of water. The air condition is in the ceiling & it dripped constantly. I was in the older tower as the cost to upgrade to the other tower was an additional $30 per evening. My stay was complimentary so I was only responsible for the $30ish "resort fee" imposed by hotel. The furnishing felt like those in an off-freeway motel. They were worn, beaten & old. The lamp on the side table does not have a plug so you must move the nightstand to retrieve a plethora of wires leading to the power strip. I've never seen a power strip in a hotel room. I just wanted to charge my cell phone. On day three I went to work at 7am & returned around 10pm to a room that had not been cleaned or attended to. This was frustrating as I had a long work day & didn't expect this upon return.

The next day I realized I did not have a bath mat as the maid must have taken it. I spent the next few days using an oversized towel as a bath mat.

The elevators seem to be a topic on Yelp. While I recall waiting some time for the elevator it's strange to note that nobody ever seemed to be in them. Perhaps I have strange hours? 

On the final day of my stay I attempted to check out online & was given an error message. I attempted to check out on the television & was given an error message as well. I had to call to check out as I wanted to ensure the $250 deposit was returned.  The Flamingo just missed the mark each & every time.

Checked in and the hotel rooms were horrible!!! There were ants in there room!!! And my wife got sick and it took 20 mins for a manager to respond to my situation due to he was busy with another customer. I was acknowledged 15 mins later saying I will be right with you!! I booked rooms with the high roller view and got s room facing a flat wall which did not have any view of the high roller. Very disappointed in this kind of service!!  They could have something much more faster and respond quicker to my need due to my wife being sick. For everybody who goes here please don't waste your money coming here pay a little bit extra and get a newer hotel.

The pictures of this hotel on Travelocity was so nice. Its like Instagram vs real life if u get my drift. First of all, I arrived in Las Vegas very early (8am) and check in was at 4pm. I wanted to take a nap. I ended up upgrading my room ($25\/night extra) Bc I wanted to lay down. The smell..... I'm going to describe this as heavy perfume trying to cover up cigarette smoke and sex smells. It is disgusting. If u have a sensitive nose, you will hate this place. There was no bar soap in the bathroom. Then the sink clogged up and the water would not drain. And I noticed that the bathroom door is a sliding glass opaque door. My advice..... if this is a boyfriend\/girlfriend trip and it's a new relationship, the sliding glass door provides no privacy. So if u have to do dirty business, he will hear u and smell u!!! You're welcome. 

The design of this place with all of this pink and white, looks like a Victoria secret store in 1992. And the smell is stronger than Abercrombie and fitch but not as pleasant. 

My shower had luke warm water. I don't know if that was Bc I was on the 27th floor or BC this hotel  was built in the 1950's. 

There's a large mirror in the room but no plugs next to it so that I can get ready and curl\/ straighten\/ or blow dry my hair. Design flaw!! 

As far as wifi, they only allow 2 devices to be connected to the wifi.  Notice I said 2 devices and not phones. So if someone signed on to the laptop, that means one other phone or computer can sign on now. We tried to use the wifi when we got into the room, it was down for a few hours. 

I'm going to save money and go to Walgreens\/ CVS and stock up on water and snacks. The prices for water here is RIDICULOUS. $6 for a bottle of water. 

I regret booking at this hotel since this is my first time in Las Vegas. Next time I'll do more research and read yelp reviews. If I were to come back here I would consider staying at the newer hotels like Aria, Cosmopolitan, Palazzo. 

Since this was my first time in Las Vegas, I learned that some hotels have a separate area for uber and Lyft than taxi.  This hotel has a sign on the wall outside for uber and Lyft. I found this info out on my last day here :(

Last and most importantly, the phone signals are terrible. I have Verizon, I had a friend to had Att and another T mobile. Inside the hotel, Verizon and At&T had poor service but there was still a signal. T-Mobile HAD NO PHONE SIGNAL inside the flamingo.

This place has definitely seen better days. My elevator stopped 6 inches short of the floor level, but opened anyway. I didn't want to get sliced just in case it decided to move, so I jumped out.

My window did not even provide a view of the strip because there was an ad banner made of this mesh that was pasted on my side of the building.

Don't waste your money here, stay somewhere newer. It takes about an hour to check in, their front desk is atrocious.

Crappy slow expensive wifi. Even Vagabond Inn has free wifi.

Stayed here with some friends. It was my first time in Vegas! 

This definitely wasn't a super fancy shmancy hotel but it suited our needs! It had TVs in the mirrors which was ultra schway and my usually aching back loooved the beds. The rooms were stylish and cute too.

The pools were fun and definitely where the party was at. My friends and I entered the limbo contest, kayaking contest AND booty-shaking contest. It was a lot of fun. My only complaint is that the pools closed at like 6-8. With our busy schedule we wanted some night-swimming. Oh, and they didn't allow you to bring your own food or beverages into the pool area. 

There were lots of food options down below. For breakfast we had a pizza and beer combo at the pizza place below. Nom!

This is the worst hotel ever. I stayed her for Memorial day weekend and will never come back. The buffet is overprices and is terrible. I had my wallet stolen the last night and went to talk to the manager. I told him all the information about my room (name, address of the credit card, etc...) and he still would not let me in the room. He said if i could provide ID from the room he would let me in the room. I showed the security guard an envelope with my name and address in the exact location of my bag in the room where I told him it would be. He said this wasn't good enough and still wouldn't let me stay in the room. I watched some girl complain that they checked her out of her room early and took an item out of the room. He offered to give her cash for this lost item. He then told me there was nothing more he could do for me and asked me to leave. Even though i booked the room myself and gave him all the information that he asked for.  The management is terrible. The hotel is terrible. The only good thing about the hotel is the location is very centrally located. Spend some more money and stay somewhere else! I wish i could give it a negative 17 stars

Let's just say we all know this is the CHEAPEST place to stay on the strip... We already know the Rooms are Below Average, as well as Customer Service.

BUT to put someone who has asthma in a smoking room AFTER we had asked explicitly for a NON SMOKING ROOM is redic. I'm actually now curious how many times they've been sued.

Anywho, great place to stay on a dollar budget, but don't expect luxury or curtesy with that.

This casino\/hotel gets three stars instead of two because I'm giving them a pass for being an early casino and being on the strip.

It's also the only cage I saw the whole trip where I got money back.

This is a way late review but it seems when I look for reviews for any Las Vegas hotel that isn't the Bellagio or Venetian they are always really bad.  Well, I stayed here last November because my (now) husband and I decided to elope in Vegas and wanted to do it on the cheap.  Honestly, we chose the Flamingo solely because it was, at one, time Bugsy Seigel's hotel so we thought that was kitschy.  Our room was clean and cute.  Not much of a view but when I'm in Vegas I'm not really there to hang out in my room and stare out a window.  I was so bummed the pools were closed but the garden area was still nicely manicured and a pleasant spot to hang out.  The location is awesome.  Checking in and out was fast and the staff were friendly.  I got my hair done in the salon in the lobby and the girl was awesome.  The folks running the gambling were nice, too.  No, it's certainly not fancy or anything but I guess I'm the only one who went in knowing that.  I liked it and would possibly stay again.  i'm leaving tomorrow to go back to Vegas for our one year anniversary.  We're staying at the Paris this time.  That got a lot of bad reviews, too, so I guess we'll just have to see.

Stayed here over final 4 weekend.  Prepaid room and reserved a specific room.  Did online checkin which is a scam... when I got to the hotel the room I reserved\/paid for\/ checked into online earlier that day was "not available!
They offered me a downgraded room at the same price or I could walk and still lose my prepaid money.   Service agent wanted to get manager and he kept me waiting 30 min before coming out to tell me I could have a different room or nothing at 1am.  
I took the room... the bathroom was dirty and the TV was broken.   No more flamingo or Caesars properties for me.  Management doesn't apparently just want to screw u over gambling... it's now metastasized to the hotel.
I checked out after my prepay was over and am happy at a better place for less $
zero stars if it was allowed.
Great hotel I always stay here when i visit Las Vegas

I have never in my life been to a hotel that will charge you for every little extra you can imagine.  $15 a day for internet\/wi-fi access and $10 a day for access to the gym.  If you are on vacation for 4 days, do the math, it adds up quick.  And you pretty much need wi-fi access because neither me nor my wife could get a cell phone reception in our room even though we had windows facing outside.  Wait a year and pretty soon they will charge you for towels, the pool, and cleaning your room.  Oh, and this was our honeymoon, which the hotel did NOTHING special or comp'd us anything on our special occasion.

The casino has a good variety of slots and games. I also really enjoyed walking through the courtyard and looking at the flamingos, koi, and other animals. The casino is located in a really fun part of the city. I didn't stay here on my trip to Vegas but I would like to next time. I wound up spending most of my time on this trip there and in the surrounding area because it was so much fun.

Decent middle of the road hotel on The Strip. Good location, but needs some fine tuning in the rooms. Huge stains on the carpet skeeve me out. Also, I do not understand the need for the sliding frost glass door on the bathroom that has no lock. If I want to feel like I am taking a dump in front of people I will go outside. Good customer service though.

First of all let me tell you that the Flamingo is very affordable, around $80 per night including taxes and a bogus resort fee. 

The Good:
1. The newly refreshed rooms are very nice. Bamboo flooring, flat screen televisions, hip decor.
2. Location. Absolutely in the middle of everything. Reason alone to stay here.
3. View. If your room faces out onto the strip, it's incredible
4. Pool is huge. In summer its a mad house of 20-ish partiers. Fun. 

The Bad:
1. Some parts are just so rundown. My first elevator had half the buttons missing. Instead of replacing them, they wrote them in with a Sharpie.
2. Resort Fee. For $20 you get to use the pool, a small rundown fitness center (but not the steamrooms, sauna, or spa) and Internet. All this should be included in the price.
3. Penguin exhibit is long gone.
4. Sheets are scratchy. This is no Westin
5. Bathroom are old and tired. Water coming out of tap smells like feces.

Bottom Line:
In spite of its shortcomings, it's still a heck of a value in Las Vegas. It's just with all these new and beautiful hotels being built you can really see the shabby-ness of the Flamingo. They must still be making a fortune or they would have demolished it years ago and built a new Flamimgo. The property is huge. But you can only put so many coats of lipstick on a pig.

Just got back from a long weekend trip and stayed at Flamingo. Honestly, a great hotel for the price. 

Pros: 
-Price
-Rooms were nice and kept clean daily
-Casino was good atmosphere and we had some good luck here!
-Buffet was delicious and food court convenient 
-Location strip was perfect
-Attached Margaritaville was a nice departure from the main casino

Cons:
-Members card barely earned benefits (and we spent a lot of money there!)
-Elevators crowded and slow
-Coffee place was always too busy, and too pricey for the quality. 
-Sales people constantly hitting you up in the lobby for something
-Casino drink girls were often no where to be found

Overall though it was a great experience and I would definitely return!

I don't want to give someone a negative review unless it's justified and this is sadly justified. I've never felt a greater sense of disgust in a hotel greater to this one. I spent $667 for two nights here. FILTHY room!! We were trying to find an extra power outlet for our phone chargers and stumbled upon a very old, dirty, bloody condom! Not to mention the dirt and dust that has accumulated in the room made me not even feel safe staying here. Also found a weird bottle that was squirted out on top of the safe. Didn't even want to look to see what it was. I never usually complain about service but these pictures speak for themselves.

Went there for craps and stuff, nothing fancy.  Just a regular casino with regular games.  It was a while ago and I don't remember what I actually did there, so that just shows you how regular and normal it was....

I am VERY disappointed and NOT satisfied with my stay at Flamingo.  Particulary on how the staffs handled my situation.

I arrived on April 1 and checked in around 6p only to find my room is a completely mess.  Beds are not made, and no clean towels at the bathroom.  I called the front desk that I'd like to switch room, but I was told there was no available rooms at the time.  Front desk said they will send someone up right away to make the room and provide clean towels.  My bf and I waited for an hour before someone finally showed up to clean the room.  We missed half of our show because we couldn't shower and get dressed right away.

I talked to someone at the front desk and expressed my concern and disappointment, and I was offered a refund  for the first night which I never reveived.  When I called back again a month later, no one seems to remember this and there was no "notes" or anything that Flamingo supposed to refund me the first night to compensate the trouble I had to go through.  

I also contacted my credit card company and only to find that Flamingo refused to refund me because I "stayed" in the room "that night"  As far as I'm concern, the refund was supposed to compensate me for missing half of the show and the hassle I had to go through with your hotel.

I would not stay here or recommend anyone to come here again
We got a Go Suite and it was great. Great views of the water show at Belagio. I would stay here again.

First question you need to ask yourself when you are staying in Vegas -- what kind of amenities do I want in a hotel? If you are not going to be spending much time in your room and want a great deal, the Flamingo is a good option.

Pluses:
- Affordable nightly rates
- Easy check in\/out - can do it all without talking to a human!
- Hertz rental car within the lobby, and can pick up a car at the hotel
- AWESOME pool area. We were here in winter, but it looked really neat. Also, they have a little bird sanctuary with actual flamingos, ducks, swans, and other exotic waterfowl. 
- FANTASTIC location. Easy to walk to just about anything near central strip, and attached to the monorail! Cool restaurant\/shopping area in between Flamingo and the Linq next door, as well as proximity to the High Roller. 
- Cool history. One of the oldest on the strip, and still has that 'old Vegas' feel with the neon lights and old bulbs in the fixtures. 

Negatives:
- Loud, smoky casino. Ambiance at this casino is not as desirable, and also seemed really crowded in the evenings. Attached to Margaritaville, which was both a positive and a negative.
- Rooms are totally blah. Amenities are lacking. Our beds were comfy and clean, but our tub faucet kept slowly dripping out all of our hot water. The room just LOOKED old and kind of dingy, but it had a nice view. We got clean towels every day, but the maids kept taking the glasses and not bringing them back...
- In house restaurants are kind of blah. BUT there are so many others nearby that this didn't really affect us. 

Overall, I enjoyed my stay. I really liked being SO CLOSE to everything, so the convenience and good rates were the biggest deciding factor in choosing this hotel.

This hotel is getting very dated.  Great location and that's about it.  Parking in the garage is horrendous.  All the way up to the top and no spaces.  Plenty reserved for the valet and Hilton Vacation Club though. 

Once inside you will most likely be accosted every time you walk through the lobby by very aggressive sales people trying to sell you time share rooms.

The rooms need a major upgrade. The walls are thin and anything going on in the hallway or 2 or 3 doors down, you can hear every word.  Not the best at 2 in the morning.  The paint is peeling and the night table and desk drawers are too narrow to hold anything 

Check in\/check out - do the express otherwise you could be waiting on line for 45 minutes.  Then of course it's about another 10 minute wait for a very crowded elevator. 

As with many other reviews, there are plenty of other hotels to select and that would be my recommendation.

I wish I could give the hotel a good review but we showed up on a Thursday night after specifically reserving a non smoking room because my sister has respiratory issues. We fought with them for over an hour to get a non smoking room. We ended up paying the same amount for a down graded room where the keys never worked correctly. Housekeeping even tried the keys and they couldn't get them to work. The front desk got upset with us for telling them our keys wouldn't work. The room seems clean but the front desk staff is completely incompetent. The bell hops are sweet but this is the most frustrating hotel we have ever stayed at. The front desk staff is rude and unhelpful. You are on your own if you stay here and may never get into your room.

There is nothing like a weekend in Vegas with some of the wildest chicks (that I just so happen to call friends) to send off one of our own into marital bliss.  Yup.  Bachelorette Party weekend.  

We chose the Flamingo because:
1) It's on the strip, relatively close to some of the swankier hotels
2) It's cheap
3) It's fantastic

When it comes to hotels, for me, as long as there is a comfy bed with clean linens, air conditioning, a toilet, toilet paper, a sink and a shower with some good water pressure, I'm completely satisfied.

They were kind enough to switch some rooms around for us so that we were right next door to each other.  When we asked for extra towels, no problem!

The bride won $250 and one of her bridesmaids won $90 at the craps table.  The dealers were a lot of fun and encouraging of our rowdiness.  I lost $25.  I've never been a big gambler so whatever.   

My favorite part of the room?  The dark, heavy curtains to keep the blinding desert sun out so I could recover and be ready for night two.  =)

Stayed here for two nights. Room wasn't properly cleaned before we got there - empty beer bottle in the room, bathroom half cleaned, ice bucket full of water, and the kicker - mold growing in the trash cans. They sent up security to take a statement about the mold, not sure what that's going to do, but I guess if we get some sort of weird illness, we know why. An apology or free something would have been nice, but I guess that isn't their style.

This was our first time in las Vegas and my friend and I decided to get rooms at Flamingo for the "Vegas " experience. Loved it here, the rooms are clean, nice view, staff super friendly. Oh, and the pool! It's massive!

Typically we like staying here. It's in the middle of the strip which is great. Stayed here last year with no problems. This year, very disappointed. Waithef 40 minutes to check in on a Saturday. They were training employees. On a busy Saturday!! Makes no sense! The room they gave us was apparently remodeled, hilarious if they call it that. The room itself was OK, but the bathroom was DISGUSTING! Nasty floor, nasty shower, ceiling had crap on it....Maybe mold. The room was also facing the court which had loud music playing till 4am. Elevators were very slow and also disgusting! Complained when we checked out and the response I got was, I can't do anything about it & no supervisor on duty. Probably won't stay her again because of it. That's too bad!

The Flamingo has become my New Favorite Hotel to stay at in Vegas (on the Strip). And I've stayed at most of the hotels, so that's saying something.

Mind you, the Flamingo is not the newest hotel, or the nicest. And I've heard that some people have had some bad experiences there, although mine have always been pretty good. So what does the Flamingo have going for it? One word: Convenience.

I've stayed in hotels where you have to walk 20 minutes through the casino to see sunlight and breathe fresh air (ahem, MGM Grand). In Flamingo, I can go from my room and onto the Strip in under five minutes if the elevators work in my favor. This is huge to me.

There are also a lot of convenient options for eating, drinking, and cheap gambling. Of course, you're doing these things in places like O'Sheas and Bill's, so you have to expect that you're not exactly going to be hob-nobbing with the visiting celebrities. But if you want to high-roll, you can cross the street to Bellagio, Caesars, or Cosmopolitan with little trouble.

If you're the type of person who comes to Vegas and doesn't plan to spend much time in your room, Flamingo is the place for you. They also have a great pool with outdoor blackjack and craps - low limit! (Or at least they were when I was there in July mid-week.)

I liked this place a lot actually. The room I stayed in had a great view and good enough space for 2 people. My only complaint would be the elevators, unorganized bed making, and not-so-good eating joints inside. The tv cable was awesome because it ranged through a bunch of great channels and the slot machines were decent. I didn't like how depressing some of the areas were inside the casino though. I would want to come back and stay here again but in a better location and higher level of room type.

I see we are not covering anything here so have a great evening, and I will copy and paste this on yelp. David:  I see we are not covering anything here so have a great evening, and I will copy and paste this on yelp. Thank you
Stayed here for 1 night only. IMO, the rooms are a-ok for the price. I wouldn't mind staying here again. I wish the bathroom were bigger though.

The first day we were there, the down elevator from the garage walkway to the casino didn't work.  On the day we left, the up elevator from the casino to the garage walkway didn't work.  The room itself was very clean, but the decor was....  Let me just describe it.  The color theme of the room is white.  There is a vinyl headboard which covers the entire part of the wall behind the bed...what era is that??  There are 9 round fluorescent bulbs above the bed which generates white light...from the 80's??  The bathroom has a frosted sliding door that has no lock.  Another wall of the bathroom next to the shower is also frosted glass.  This glass wall is mounted to the wall (of course) with a gap between the wall and the glass, so you can actually look inside and see the entire toilet from that gap.  The sink is a small round bowl sink on top of the counter which has no place to place the soap.  There is a TV inside the bathroom though.  The drapes are controlled by switches next to the bed.  Overall, we didn't like the room because it was weird.

We stayed here for my girlfriends bachelorette in 2004.  Rooms were clean, bed was comfy. Pool area was nice.  Hardly in the room anyways so basically not much negative to say about it. Price was decent.  We all enjoyed our stay here being it was the best location on the strip.

When I first booked my vacation to stay at the Flamingo I had a regular deluxe room. I had read reviews from other fellow Yelpers that all pretty much agreed to get a "GO ROOM" but I am stubborn and thought what the heck I will just keep my deluxe room. 

WELL..............we first check in after getting attacked by the timeshare people who can't seem to take "NO" for an answer. Anyway I digress. 

So we get our room and the lady tells us she has a room available but it is far from the elevator and we will have to walk a little. So my husband and I are in pretty good shape so we say no problem and get the room. We walked prob 5-8 minutes to get to the room. We open the door and turn on the lights and the carpet looked like it had not been cleaned in YEARS! Then I check the bedding for "bed bugs" and I don't find any but I do find a half pint of whiskey someone. This might of made some happy but not me. We left our room right after that and when down to the lobby and requested that we be upgraded to a Go Room. The lady tells us they are booked and it's a busy weekend being Superbowl and UFC. I tell her I know they have to have a Go room available. After having a stare off she tells me that there is a GO room available. We were not able to get the room free but she did give us the discounted rate so it was like $25 a night. 

We get to the GO room and things are much, much better! Very happy and the room is great just like all the fellow Yelpers had indicated. We had a great view and the beds were so soft. We will def go back to the flamingo just for the Go rooms. It was in a great location and we had a great time. 

I am giving the Flamingo a 4 star just for the go rooms and did I mention there were go-go dancers at night?

We stayed over Halloween weekend in a Go room. We probably wouldn't stay here again, but it was perfectly acceptable for what we needed. 

Pros:
-Center strip so very easy to walk anywhere you desire.
-Front desk was very helpful! We had a partial payment in cash and wanted to upgrade from a Fab room to a Go room, and the woman at the front desk was incredibly friendly and helpful. 
-Room service did a good job at cleaning our room every day and providing fresh clean sheets and towels.
-Bed was super comfortable
-The cafe's downstairs were very tasty
-cheaper than most hotels on the strip
-Go rooms have coffee makers and refrigerators for storing leftovers
-Very easy to store luggage with bell desk + they have lockers for storing laptops before check in\/check out.
-Real flamingos!!!
-Our bathtub was huge and perfect for soaking after walking for 4 hours everyday.
-We had plenty of hot water, unlike a lot of the reviews for the hotel??

Cons:
-check in took FOREVER. Probably 30-45 minutes waiting in line, I would recommend the express check in if you can.
-Walls are THIN. We could hear the people next door having a good time and later snoring. Bring earplugs if you're a super light sleeper!!!
-Water pressure was horrible. Took probably 15-20 minutes just to fill our bath tub.
-Check out took forever since the express check out machine didn't work for us.
-Buffet is horrible
-Minor damage on the furniture and wallpaper, but this is purely aesthetic.
-WiFi costs extra


**Some of the reviewers on here complain about the timeshare people.. just walk on past them. Yes, they suck, but you are 0 percent obligated to talk to them at all. Be a little bit brave (or rude) and just walk right by them, or just politely say "We're not interested, thank you" and keep walking. It's not hard, I promise!

Fact of the matter, you're staying at an old hotel. Don't complain about the wallpaper in the halls not being spotless since this hotel has been around for quite some time. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable, and that's really all you need when you're in Vegas, right?

Hardwood floors in the room, now that's something that I really detest. When I go to a hotel I expect a bit of comfort in the room. The phone's socket was hanging out of the wall. I had to plug in the clock and set the time myself. There was a hole in the wall where the door handle had collided with it once too often. The TV was an old-fashioned CRT and not a flat panel. I had an ant infestation, they were all over the bedside table and floor. To compensate they couldn't knock anything off the room rate because of the way I'd paid (Expedia) but they gave me a free breakfast at the buffet. 

Speaking of breakfast, the lines at all the eating establishments were a mile long in the morning.  I had a wedding to get to and I was not expecting to have to wait in line for breakfast, so I had to get some yoghurt parfait and a croissant at one of the little stalls and eat it in my ant-infested room. I got breakfast at the buffet the next day and had to wait about ten minutes to get a seat event though there was plenty of empty tables.

I would not recommend staying here, unless you get into one of their new renovated rooms. Their older rooms are straight garbage. Nothing like the description for the room online, janky shower, holes in the drywall, cheap sheets, NO MINI FRIDGE, also if you happen to get a room with a door to the room next to you. You will hear everything the other people are saying and doing because there is about 2 inches exposed under the door, we had to put a towel down by the door. 

Also if you're extremely unhappy and want to switch rooms the staff and managers don't care, they will basically tell you that you're shit out of luck. They obviously don't care about people coming back

THE LATE GREAT FLAMINGO HOTEL!  No longer worth it.

Use to be the best pool on the strip and that's the only reason I stayed there for years since the rooms are crummy.  I didn't use to mind the outside fascade looking war torn with big chips out of the building, oldest & longest wait elevators in town and everyhing in the casino needs a face lift big time.

Now they've even ruined that!!!  

We had to stand in a line 20 minutes to get into the adult pool to be told we needed our IDs.  No one told us that so we had to go all the way back to the room to get them.  Not a hotel key, nope, ID's.  Other people in line had same complaint after getting to the front of the line, why not tell people this!!!???

Oh and now everyone is allowied in even if not staying at the hotel so it's an over populated ZOO with too loud of music.  Couldn't even relax!  This pool closes at 6pm!!!

The other pool doesn't need ID's only your room key, but closes at 5pm!!!!

Oh and don't take anything into it even your own water as they'll have you dump it and no food can be brought in either.

The pool areas are not serviced at all.  We never had a waitress the whole 2 days we spent at the pool even though we saw them walking around here and there.  And, spewed with empty bottles and cups every where so that wasn't really being serviced either.  Expensive drinks at the pool too, over the top expensive.

Our room was nice, they've face lifted those, but the bathroom old school big time.  The bathroom vent had so much caked dust and grime it was gross not to mentioned the bubbled ceiling that looked like the floor above was leaking ready to burst into our bathroom! Our view HA what view, was a ladder, trash and the next building 3 feet away.  

Every time, and I mean EVERY TIME, you walk to the pool, out of the elevators to the casino or out the side door you will be accosted by sales people trying to "give" you free show tickets to the point you want to scream at them, "Leave me freaking alone already as I've been asked already hundreds of times each day and I've only been here 2 days!"

Who in the freaking world closes their pools before nighttime especially when you pay to stay there?!  Then one that needs a face lift so bad.  And have sales people hound you constantly to boot!  As one comment mentions too, the "Resort Tax" that all hotels are adding now so price looks cheaper than it comes out to be.  RUN!

The hotel is great if you want to be on the strip since it's located right in the middle. The view is nice (we were facing Caesar's palace). Staff was friendly. Cons were that it's an old hotel... our lights went out in our room and on our last day (thankfully) our hot water wasn't working. Overall is was decent and nice looking inside the room.

The last time I was at the Flamingo was in 2012, and I had a bad customer service experience and decided to never use that hotel again.  I decided to try the Flamingo again because we were traveling with friends with children, and felt that they would all enjoy the pool.  I should have picked another hotel.

When we arrived at the hotel at noon, we were all eager to hit the pool.  The front desk informed me that if I wanted to check in before 4pm, it was an additional fee of $30!!!  I asked if my room was ready and they said yes, but unless you pay the additional fee you cannot check-in until 4pm.  I couldn't believe what I was hearing.  I have only heard of this at one other hotel.  I could not believe after paying the nightly rate, and $30 per night resort fee, they wanted another $30, so that I could enjoy their resort and start having fun on my vacation.  If you want a late check out it's another $20 per hour additional fee.

The Flamingo is located in the center of the strip, walking distance to many strip attractions and show.  It's across the street from Caesar's Palace.  Parking is free.

The Flamingo has restaurants, shops, a very nice pool, a gym.  There is no business center but they have several pay to use computer kiosk throughout the hotel.

The fitness center is at the spa and is open from 6am to 7pm.  There are 3 different pools, the main pool is adults only.  They have the beach club pool for families, which is just a standard pool, and they have a water slide pool.  The pools are open from 9AM -7PM (in the summer) except for the slide pool, which is only open from 11am -5pm.  One of the negatives is that they allow smoking at the family\/kids pool, second-hand smoke is the last thing I want my kids inhaling when they are trying to have fun at the pool.  Make sure you bring your ID when you go to the pool, not sure why, I asked 4 different security personnel and lifeguards, none of them knew why they have to check for ID.  They don't ask for a room key to confirm you are a guest at the hotel, just ID?!?!  You cannot bring any food or drinks into the pool area, even items that you bought in the hotel or hotel restaurants.  They will not let you in, you have to purchase everything from the bar\/snackshop inside the pool area.  The drinks and food are very expensive and not worth the money.

Our newer "GO" room was small to average in size.  It had a sort of retro 60's decor, with marble counter tops.  It was clean, but maintenance could have been better.  The walls needed painting and the mini-frig was dented. It had a spacious closet iron\/board, medium size flat screen television with cable channels and PPV for $13.  It also had a stereo system, coffee maker, mini-frig, desk and chair, and a room safe. The resort fee included WIFI for one device, and the signal strength was good.  The bed and pillows were comfortable.

The bathroom was medium sized, with a walk-in shower with multiple shower heads, a separate tub, a marble sink, and a television in the bathroom mirror.  The bathroom was clean and also included a blow dryer.

Overall this hotel is not bad.  Before a negative customer service experience in 2012, I had stayed at the Flamingo for 20 years.  Ever since the Harrah's and now Caesar's Properties have taken over they have gone down hill. The very annoying part is that you never feel like a valued customer, but rather just another person who the corporations want to continually up-charge for basic items that are free at other hotels.  I would have given it 3 stars, but because of all the hidden fees it's going to be 2 stars.

The constant additional charges and poor management will ensure that I never stay at this hotel or any other Caesar Properties again.  I would advise my family and friends to not stay here also.

I stayed here for 3 nights over 4th of July holiday on the 15th floor which is a remodeled floor. The remodeling is cute - and nice to look at. A bit kitschy but fun. BUT, the positives end there. The walls are thin - it sounded like our neighbors were in our room so if you want privacy, this is not the place. Bed was hard. Wifi was limited to one device per room which isn't realistic given how people use devices today. The pool was completely overrun with people. There literally was no space anywhere in the pool where you could stand and not be an arms length away from several other people ( and for the most part, the people in the pool were Jersey Shore TV types which isn't my thing). But the absolute worst part was the smell -- we were supposed to have a non-smoking room but our room smelled like smoke. Last but not least, there weren't enough 'do not disturb' signs. Maids didn't have any so every day we had to call downstairs to get a new one, then every night it was stolen while we slept so were awoken up by the maid in the morning. UGH.

Absolutely the worst experience we have ever had in Vegas.  We walked in the room to find poop stains in the toilet and smeared on the wall next to the TP dispenser.  Not the mention the ants crawling all over the room.  When we called to have it cleaned, they were annoyed with us. All the employees were EXTREMELY rude at every turn.  The second day we arrived back to our room at 4pm to find it still dirty!  After paying for Valet for the day, we returned to find the Valet lot full.  Then the parking garage is off limits to general parking so we had to park a couple blocks behind the property in the ghetto.  I could go on and on.  One positive note:  we won some $ on one of the penny slots.

Good luck.  I hope our stay is not representative of the norm.

So the hotel is great and they did a great job with the remodel. It's still old Vegas with a modern twist. My only complaint and why I did not give 4 stars is....  There is a Mexican restaurant that turns into a club in Saturday. They charge 20 for all you can drink and it sucks. It feels like TJ with the music and 1 bartender for 100 ppl. I asked for shots and was told he didn't have time to make them. I had cash and wanted to give it to someone. It sucked and wasted my time. Other then that it was good.

This place was okay.  We got a king room here because the other nearby hotels were either sold out of ridiculous.  I was surprised to see a hardwood-esque floor in there, which I actually liked since hotel carpet tends to smell.

This being Vegas, we didn't stay in our room much except to crash and shower, but it did have a nice flat-screen TV and nice firm mattress, just the way I like it.  There is also express checkout, and you can even check in from a kiosk downstairs.

Minus points for: below-average (for Vegas) lobby area, long front desk lines, thin walls in the hotel room that caused me to hear folks talking about old underwear on the floor at like 8 AM in the morning, as well as all their hair-drying and showering and who knows what other noises, ugh.

Worst experience!!!!! I have stayed in many hotels but never had experience like this. For July 4th long weekend they had only one staff for check in. No arrangements were made to fasten the check in process. They have around 6 Kiosks which weren't working or after filling the details which took 20 mins it advised to go to main lobby. I wish I could give 0 stars. Utter ridiculous to be honest being in Las Vegas and during peek season they didn't ramp up their staff to look after the customers who had prebooked their stay.

This place is a total hole.  We had reserved a room with a king bed with refrigerator, but instead were given a double room no fridge.  When we called the front desk, they basically said too bad, it's all we have!  Strike one!  On to the room- best up furniture, bathroom vanity with cracked door, hair and something else in the sink, mold in the shower peeling wallpaper (see pictures!) you name it!  The only redeeming feature was the bed was comfortable.  Again, we went to the front desk about these issues, and again were told that yes, we could change rooms, but it would cost us extra to do so!  Glass remained in the hallway for the three days we were there until we told the cleaning supervisor, the elevator doors look like someone vomited on them, and our view?  Piles of garbage in the corners of the outside area.  Do yourself a favor, and stay far away from this place.

This hotel sucks ass ! So let me break it down. Check in is at 4:00pm, the pool closes at 5:00pm...... in the middle is summer at 117 degrees and this shitty hotel closes the damn pool. That's like only letting you take one bite of a delicious steak then taking it away from you. I know other hotels close their pools around that time as well but not all of them do. Front desk acted like they could give a shit that the pool was closed. That was the first incident with this worthless hotel. Then we all go out on the strip for a few hours and had a blast. We get back to our "non smoking" room and it smells like the van in cheech and Chong's up in smoke.... the adjacent rooms also non smoking are blazing up like the world weed supply is about to run out. So my wife calls the front desk to complain and mentions we have our kids in the room and a baby. Again the front desk could give a shit less about our problem and sends some clueless idiot to our room to spray some air freshener. I have nothing against marijuana or people who smoke it but I do have a problem with a hotel that has no regard for the well being of children or the fact that it's a "non smoking" floor. Not only will I make sure none of our friends ever stay here but I will make sure that on every social media front I let everyone know that this shit hotel has no regard for children or their safety. I hope this hotel goes under and they demolish it to build a hot topic or something.

I normally don't do this, but I'm giving a 5-star review to compensate for the (too) many terrible reviews I've seen on this hotel. If you're reading about cockroach nests and paper-thin walls or terrible service, know that it's an exaggeration.

Compared to the newer hotels on the strip, this pink bird is losing its luster; it's a Vegas classic that's showing its age. The furniture is a bit shabby and it lacks some amenities like a fridge, but it's the cheapest hotel for its central location on LV Boulevard.

I've stayed here multiple times and the only real downfall is the bathroom, a bit small with mildew in too many places. The room itself is very spacious and many of them lack carpet. 

You can tell the cabinets and desk are from another era and the TV is small, but size doesn't matter if you're partying in Vegas.

It's biggest advantage is location; it's right in view when you come off the freeway and is within earshot of the best Vegas attractions like the Bellagio fountain or the Forum shops. In the summer heat, walking distance means a lot.

Don't let the bad reviews scare you off. It's the best value for your money on a quick Vegas getaway. For special occasions or romance, splurge on something else.

My husband and I decided to hit up Las Vegas for our 10 year anniversary. We found a great deal online for the Flamingo and we decided to try it despite the reviews. Our flight got delayed by 4 hours and when we arrived it was pretty late but the line was still pretty long. We asked the reservation agent helping us about an upgrade and she was very nice and helpful about it. She was able to get us a mini suite for 1\/2 the price because it was one of the rooms that had not been remodeled yet and in a pet OK floor. Upon entering, our room was nice, very outdated but nice. It had a living room, shower & tub, a nice view of the pool area, mini fridge, coffee pot, and a king size bed. However, the slide door to the bathroom was broken leaving no privacy when needed and the dressers provided were also broken. It was almost near impossible to find the light switches, ours was tiny button by the bed, and to top it off the light was super dim. Our tiny room at the MGM west wing was way better than this and way cheaper. Not to mention that the no free wifi was a big turn off. The staff we encountered was nice but not nice enough to make me want to come back. 

During our stay we also decided to get our pictures taken to celebrate the occasion. I was in a rush and decided to go to the Alexandra Noel Salon in the hotel. In Chicago a blowout runs me about $40-$65 depending on the location. This place charged me $95 and that's because they gave me a "deal." I also needed makeup and no time for MAC so i got it done here too. The lady was really nice but tried to make me look like Snooki after I told her I prefered a more natural look. I had to ask her to remove the eyeshadow she had applied up to my eyebrows and all the bronzer she put on my cheeks, I'm a plus size gal and she made me look like I had defined cheek bones. 

At the end it all worked out but I definitely will not stay here again.

Stayed there the second weekend of April 2013 and I was pleasantly surprised. Great location on the strip. Bit slow of a valet process though considering we checked in around 6pm or whatever time the day clubs closed for the day.. but I think that might have had to do with people leaving the hotel too for dinner\/shows. 

The rooms were ok sized for 2 queen beds. The floor to ceiling window was cool and pink suede curtains were cute! Room was super dim though, I took the lamp shades off the 2 lamps in the room so the girls and I could do our hair and make up with out looking like clowns!!

This casino is classic old school Vegas.  We play slots, and the Flamingo is always a crowd pleaser for us because of the wide variety of slots there. 

The last time I was in the Flamingo, I lost my wallet on the casino floor.  Once I realized it, I headed back to the Flamingo, trying not to panic, because I needed my ID to fly out that evening.  Several employees rallied together to help me find it, ultimately directing me to the lost and found.  The guy at the lost and found was beyond unhelpful and told me he didn't think it had been brought in.  I asked for security because i had read online that I'd need a report from them to show the airline.  At first he refused to call them, saying they wouldn't be able to help, but luckily I persisted.

When the security guard came down, I told him I had lost my wallet. He proceeded to verify my name and then told me someone had turned my wallet into them! I'm so very grateful to the security team and helpful employees at the Flamingo!
horrible check in!!! friday night and there are clerks doing nothing - the manager standing around looking bored - and a long azz line that we gave been standing in for i er an hour!!!!!!!

My husband and I stayed at The Flamingo the second week of October. Their self serve-check- in -computer kiosks didnt work, so had to stand in a line for 25 minutes due to having only 3 clerks behi d the front desk.  Our room was on the 24th Floor, with a view of the strip.
The light fixtures in the bathroom were rusty and were in need of replacement. The bath tub filled up with water past your ankles when we showered. The thumping Bass resonating from across the street at Ceasars Omnia outdoor nightclub all night was annoying.
