The location on the strip is the only thing to like about this place, but unfortunately that is heavily outweighed by our interaction with a couple of the staff members

I had to wait to check in which took awhile, I understand that.  But when I pre registered because my room wasn't ready for early check in.  I was told a $50 deposit for each night I stay here would apply. I went to Planet Hollywood in June and they are the same company did not charge me a deposit to dysau there. I was only charged a resort fee. Now at a lower star hotel it's a resort fee plus a deposit. I can not bill to the room and my wifi is restricted. I literally have to call to have the ability to use the wifi, which is ludicrous.

Being one of the oldest hotels in Las Vegas, the place was not bad. The room was fairly clean, but the bathroom definitely needs some upgrades. The water pressure in the shower was a little low, but other then that the room was OK. The room had a great view of the strip and a large flat screen TV. 

The Flamingo had a lot of pretty good shops, but like everywhere else was super expensive. The best thing about the hotel was the burger bar, from midnight until 3AM, you can get a cheeseburger with fries for $3. Much to my surprise this place was not packed, but its one of the best deals in Vegas for your late night eating pleasure!

So if your in Vegas and do not want to spend a lot of money on a room I would suggest the Flamingo!

We stayed here 4th of July weekend. First impressions were great, we attempted to use the self check in kiosk, with no luck as my guys ID is scuffed and the machine couldn't read it. An extremely nice older gentleman whose name escapes me was very helpful and sent us to the much shorter "checkout line" and said to use his name and they'll check us in. The woman who helped us was very informative, gave us information on near by clubs and pool party events. She also upgraded us to a remodeled room with a great view for no charge! Wow! Only thing she mentioned is the bathroom had not been re modeled. No biggie.

Got to our room no problem, the elevators were slow... Yet bare able I guess. Our king room was nicer than expected. Clean (no bed bugs btw. Always afraid I'm gonna get bed bugs.) Hardwood floor, great size flat screen, central a\/c, very spacious. I will say however, if you're the kind of person that has an eye for detail you probably won't be pleased. Mainly in the not remodeled bathroom. Yes the wall paper was peeling. Yes the tile was cracked. Yes the shower was cramped and tiny for my tall self and taller lover. The room was set to the lowest temperature however was never really cool. I broke a bit of a sweat in the middle of the night. Sure the halls smelled of marijuana occasionally but I hardly see how that's the hotels fault. 

My main issue with this hotel were the highly discussed elevators. I thought people were exaggerating when they complained about these but MY GOSH I'll tell you.. Once July 4th hit we were waiting more than THIRTY MINUTES for an elevator. You think I'm joking and I wish I was!! Every time an elevator came by it was packed like sardines!! When we finally were able to squeeze in one a half hour later, we were forced to stop at every. single. floor. on the way down. The elevator would ding and slide open to reveal bright excited faces of fellow travelers, only to quickly lose their smiles and switch to crushing disappointment after seeing there was no more room. About 15 floors of this. Over and over. I'm not kidding. It's because of this reason we probably won't be staying here again. Just much too inconvenient. 

The staff is absolutely wonderful and helpful.

The room was clean and nice for the most part.

Oh and btw the pizzeria inside the hotel gave us massive diarrhea the night before we left. Eat at your own risk!!

Well, I wanted a location on the strip that was centrally located.  Flamingo qualified, but isn't a very nice hotel, especially once you start walking around.  The casino floor is similar to Harrah's; is smoky; has a line at check in (at all times, I saw) - and for whatever reason the electronic check in machines don't work; and the pool was packed on Saturday, both the party pool and the family one.

The hotel room itself was nothing special.  Had an old style boxy TV and a king bed made up of two twins (with a King mattress on top).  The bathroom was old style and dark, it also didn't have a fan, causing me to think about mold growth... ick.  Oh, and the carpet was stained everywhere.  Really?  Steam that all out, please, or replace it!

Next time, I'll spring the extra $50 for a more pleasant hotel.  

A quick list of positives, just in case you thought I had the worst time ever...  Free Parking, an easy walk from the garage to the elevators up the room\/check in, a short walk from the room to the pool areas, and a navigate-able casino floor.

The absolute worst experience staying in Las Vegas. Will not go back to this hotel EVER again. Customer Service was horrendous. We booked the rooms through Expedia and exclusively selected rooms with a view of the strip. Did not get them when we initially arrived and it took about two different tries for the staff to actually execute and give us what we initially asked and paid for. The vents and air conditioning units were not in any decent working condition: in one of the rooms the system did not work, the other worked but smelled like cigarette smoke the entire time (it was a non-smoking room mind you). Housekeeping did not clean our rooms for two consecutive days during our stay. After calling the front desk and requesting that our rooms be cleaned, the staff were beyond rude when they arrived to do so. 
Overall, really disappointed. The rooms had an awesome view of the strip but it is NOT worth staying there ever again.

Just got back from a weekend trip to Vegas with my husband (who took me for my birthday). We thought the Flamingo was awesome! We have only been to Vegas two other times and this trip trumped them both. We got the Go Room (which you need to book if you are staying here) awesome young funky deocor. Sweet flat screen tv. A tv inside the bathroom mirror. Ipod hook up and automatic curtains. We had a great view of the strip looking directly at Ceasars Palace. Only downside of that was the huge outside advertisement of Donny and Marie that is stuck to the buildings window obstrcucting a clear view that kinda bumbed us out and hurt our eyes to look out too long. Otherwise we had the best service. Extremly friendly staff. If we stood looking confused more than two seconds a staff member was in our face asking us if we needed help. 

Great location just about middle of the strip and good places to eat. The Burger joint was so good. Gourmet Burgers and a killer martini called the "Flamango" yummm.....and the Tropical Cafe for breakfast was tasty too. Again, great service at both.

Price, location and service was just right! We were impressed.Would stay again! Now if they would just take down the annoyingly gigantic Donny and Marie advertisement it would have been absolutely perfect.

An iconic landmark in the middle of the strip, you're almost required to stay at the Flamingo at least once in your lifetime. Sure, it's showing its age a little, but they've done a decent job keeping it from getting out of hand.  We were on the 28th floor facing Caesars, which made for some great views.  

Hits:
- amazing views from the towers facing the strip
- rooms were large, clean, and comfortable. Loved the couch by the window. 
- friendly and helpful front desk and housekeeping staff
- great location

Misses:
- the elevators. They just plain suck. I'm pretty sure they only had 3 working in the Habitat tower (out of 10, I think), and two of them were FUBAR. I actually refused to get back in Elevator 41.
- the buffet is kinda meh (although the staff were all nice)
- there were like 20 TV channels, and they all sucked. Clearly, this was designed to get you out of the room and down to the casino as quickly as possible.

I stayed at the Flamingo this time to check it off the list, but I'll be back. Hopefully after they fix the elevators.

It sucked.  Room was ok.  Check in on line was cool but they have employees there whose sole job it is to approach you and do "cold sells" of their ticket promotions etc.   I had the same dude approach me within one hour.  Happened a bunch of times and we were only there for one night.   They want to sell you the world in Vegas but a little more of shut the heck up is needed.  I don't want to be bothered by salesman on my vacation. Totally unneeded

If you're going to stay here, get the Go Room. Not the Fab or the Fab Deluxe room, get the Go Room. They're newly renovated and on a floor that is separate from the cheaper rooms, it's worth the cost increase. The Fab rooms have walls as thin as paper and the adjoining doors between rooms have a large gap under the door, so you can hear your neighbor clear as day. So don't be me and book a Fab room because it's cheaper, and you won't have to try and sleep with a loud, pot smoking (not that that's a bad thing), up all night, crazy drunk neighbor. With that aside, the Flamingo is a great place to stay for the money, middle of the strip, lots of places to dine early or late. The X-Burlesque show is GREAT! But buy your tickets at Tiks-Tonite down by Ballys. They're half the price all day every day!

I love this hotel. Pink everywhere!!!!

The Go Rooms with a view are the best. The lighting in the bathrooms is fun, the shower is to die for, and the view of the Bellagio fountains is breathtaking. The rooms can be a bit pricey but they are so worth it.

FAB rooms are ok...they're cute. Slippery floors, outdated bathrooms, comfy beds, decent view of Caesar's. Love the old Vegas pictures on the wall.

Deluxe rooms are crap. Nothing else to say about that.

As far as location on the strip goes, you can't get any better. Smack dab in the middle of everything.

Customer service at the front desk is very hit and miss. I can only imagine that dealing with obnoxious drunk people is a little difficult ;-) 

The pool is ok. A lot of people think it is one of the best pools. I tend to lean towards MGM Grand's pool complex...much,much better.

I am a big fan of the casino. More pink!!!! And always full of entertainment.

The buffet is ok. Not the best food but the views of the waterfall and flamingos make it worthwhile to go at least once.
Sitting in room waiting on Bell Desk to answer.   Would like to gamble.  Bugsy might want my money, but his bell help apparently are busy.   25 plus minutes waiting....

For the price I give it 5 stars...
I room I had electric curtains The bathroom had a TV in the mirror Great view of the strip all freshly remodeled... for the price you can't go wrong. Beautiful pool, fun to see the flamingos and other wildlife they have.. I will say I was very skeptical about staying here because it's an older place and the price but very happy we did.

I realize that the Flamingo is an older hotel but that's part of what I love about it... that and the actual flamingos.  

The check-in line tends to be a little long here, but staff is always very friendly.  Unfortunately we had a very difficult time with the elevators on our recent trip, it sounds like there may be ongoing construction on these so if you mind ten minute waits for the elevators, you may want to call ahead.  

The pool for families is small, really until it started raining it was over full and people could barely swim at all.  Wish more of the "21 and over pool" would open up to the rest of the hotel.

Parking is currently still free here, but it's packed and a little confusing to navigate.  The monorail is right out the back door which is just perfect for us.  It is in a great location, right in the middle of the Strip action.

We will be back. :)

Never again am I staying here it all went downhill from the very beginning I was yelled at by the first attendant for going into the wrong round about it says baggage! Thought that's where we dropped out stuff first time here could be a little more helpful. Valet parking yelled at us for going onto the wrong lane it's very confusing they don't have a lot of staff to help you out I understand it was 4th of July weekend but they need to staff up; when we were eventually help the bell boy was nice. 

To check into our hotel room was the second nightmare huge huge line very very very slow staff and once we got to the front the concierge was not very friendly. I think it's ridiculous that the rooms host four people but they only give you two keys and if you want to additional keys its an extra charge per key that is a first time for me in Vegas never have I been charged for asking for four keys we are  four adults we would like for keys I don't understand why it's an additional charge. 

The room itself was dirty and probably because they give you the option of opting out of having your room clean for a $20 credit total which I did not take because I rather have my room cleaned but it was still very dirty dusty completely outdated this whole room needed renovation just look at the pictures and you'll see what I'm talking about. 
I know it's convenient because the hotel is in the middle of the strip but my recommendation is take your money go elsewhere I rather take an Uber or Lyft or cab then staying in this hotel again.

The one star it's because the bell boys were nice and the people that try to clean our room were very polite to us.

Everyone says this hotel is so outdated and more for old people. I actually loved it! After reading reviews I upgraded our room to a GO king room because they are newly renovated. It was very nice. The drapes open with a flip of a switch and there was a tv in the bathroom with a shower and a tub separately. The bed was very comfy. The only thing I have to complain about is the food selection at the casino. But luckily, the location is at the center of everything so walking to other options wasn't an issue. It is cheaper than other hotels on the strip for its location, so I recommend it!

Extremely disappointed w our stay here. Came for a friends wedding, which by the way she had so many issues w errors they made on her special day. But what was ridiculously the worst? Sitting at their bar patio, trying to enjoy the beautiful weather,  with a drink in hand, and beimg greeted by COCKROACHES. BIG COCKROACHES!!! 

Ive stayed in Vegas at many hotels, and never, never experienced it firsthand. So gross!

Just got back from Vegas. Three trips there and stay at the Flamingo each time. The first two times were great. We had a Go Luxery room with a strip view. WARNING...if you want the strip view, do not get a room on the front of the tower. The window is covered by mesh from the Donnie and Marie ad on the outside of the building. Also, there is a club somewhere close by and we heard the thumping of the base way into the night. Ask for a room on the side of the tower, facing Ballys. It is a better view of the fountains at Bellegio and no music from the club. We like this place because it is so old school. You can imagine Bugsy and the boys walking through.

Nice location, room was nice clean bed clean bathroom, pretty much quiet, nice view of the City and casino and restaurants are pretty good. 

Con: No wifi after the 15th floor, no microwave, refrigerator, and small 32" Tv (been to cheaper hotels with all these things included) no 24 hour in house food service\/room service.

My wife and I live in Vegas and we have to say this hotel is one of the most beautiful one we have spend time in and great service they don't have a lot restaurants but the Carlos and Charlie's is a great place to stop by and have a great time

I have never done a Yelp review, this is my very first one. I stayed at the Flamingo Aug 5th-9th for my 21st birthday. What instigated me to write this review was the outstanding customer service I received from one of the front desk clerks, Jamison. My boyfriend and I walked up to check in and you could tell this employee absolutely loved his job (or was VERY job at pretending he did) either way, I have never received such phenomenal customer service. He was so friendly, knowledgeable, and truly went above and beyond for us. He made sure all of our friends that were staying at the Flamingo as well were on the same floor as us, explained the bill precisely and thoroughly, and just made our check in as fast and easy as possible.  We were lucky enough to have Jamison again to check us out of our hotel and again, he made it a very fast and easy process. He even allowed us to keep our keys so we could hang out by the pool to kill time before our late flight.  I really hope someone above Jamison sees this review and can acknowledge what an exceptional employee they have. I stayed in the Fab Room: High Roller view and was very satisfied, big room with an awesome view. The hotel itself is very fun with a lot of great restaurants and bars, and very convenient location right in the middle of the strip. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because the elevators desperately need to be remodeled.

Honestly, this is not the best place on the strip to stay.  True, its location is good, but that's about all it has going for it.

The rooms seem very nice at first, but the more time you spend in them, the more you realize that details have been overlooked.  Although a recent renovation has certainly freshened up the rooms (keep in my that I have no idea what it looked like before the renovation), it appears to be more like someone slapped a band-aid haphazardously onto a wound.  A lot of the hardware is outdated and damaged.  For example, the faucet was displaying signs of advanced rust, there were unpatched cracks in the walls, and the bathtub was missing a stopper.  The carpet in the hallway was coming up and a metal covering on the ceiling and floor had become partially unscrewed.

The actual casino and accompanying grounds had little to offer beyond really cheap shopping and a passable food court.  It looked dated for sure, but was not falling apart.  The tables are lower priced than many nearby casinos.  The pool was the nicest thing.  I loved the shady grotto.

Honestly, if you're staying here, it's for the low price.  Other than that, I wouldn't bother.

My friend arrived the night before so I cant talk about check in.. The room was very big and we had a little refrig in it. It was very clean and the beds comfy.. my friend complained a bit about the pillows , to me they were ok.  The bathroom was clean and had a tv on the mirror. The shower stayed hot and it had 2 jets so great pressure.

I've stayed at this hotel many times, and it varies from being the perfect vacation to an absolute disaster. It has definitely gone downhill in the last couple of years, from the elevators not working to the disgusting food to the average customer service. 

The basic deluxe rooms are pretty dated, but if you stay in a GO room your Vegas vacation will be worthwhile. We don't really hang out in the room, so I can't be too critical but everything is pink and white, which my friends and I have always enjoyed. The pool is pretty fun but you can definitely do better in Vegas (hint hint Mandalay Bay).  My worst stay here involved them booking us in a room that had already been occupied!!! We literally walked into a room filled with stuff and people and felt awful for them!  We were relocated to a different room, but for some reason, housekeeping bothered us to clean the room at 3:00 in the morning!!! What? Unheard of. I know some people aren't in their rooms at 3am in Vegas, but we happened to be that night, and we were rudely awakened. Not cool.  

On the other hand, the GO room has an amazing view of the pool or the Bellagio fountains.  Also, newly remodeled Margaritaville is worth walking through. You'll feel like you're on vacay walking through the tropical decor and taking whiffs of amazing coconut. The restaurant and gift shop are boring unless you're into Jimmy Buffett, but the 5 minute walk-through is fun. Overall, the Flamingo is in dire need of nicer staff and more remodeling, but it's central location and affordable pricing are a few of its perks.

Disgusting visit. Could. Not get internet. Took 5 hours to change rooms. Air conditioning unit did not. Called front desk twice. After. 1 hour gave up. Bathroom was filthy. Had hair in the tub. Blood on the curtain. Grime and filth on bathroom floor. They charge for valet but have limit space for self parking. 105 degrees and only one pool open for guest under 21 years of age. No coffee shop for breakfast. Not sure how this place can stay in business.

I will never stay here again. Stayed in the FAB room and it was not fabulous at all. It looked like they gave up on the room. Bathroom wasn't upgraded, the rug was missing, dresser falling apart, and mixed matched furniture from GO room and FAB room for the desk, and comforter throw at the end of bed was missing. Wasn't even given the do not disturb sign. It did not look anything like the pictures on the flamingos website. One star because the pool is nice but not worth it to pay $445 for 3 nights in a dumpy room.

Had to make an account just to review this nonsense. Express check in and check out took an easy 40 minutes to get 6 people through. Playing like you don't know there is a mold problem when you have places gated off and hazmat out front. Flooded room and you want to argue about giving me a new one. After asking for a manager we finally got it fixed and comped. The room was beautiful and the pool was awesome, but the really bad first impression left me wondering why I didn't stay somewhere else.
Ghetto, dirty and very rundown. one star was placed for location. that's pretty much it.

Elevators with smudged and rusted brass controls, missing buttons, numbers written in in white-out, the place is bush league. My shower curtain had holes in it, lots of holes, like it was moth eaten, and it is plastic! The shower also had a vent it in it just covered COVERED! in dust bunnies, like no one ever even LOOKED at it!

Tired worn out hallways, long and yellow. The place does NOT live up to it's use of the word it used ("fabulous") in any way.

And they charge a "resort fee" whether you use any amenities or not, on top of room charges, for a place that no one seems to take care of.

Getting booked in the 1st night, I was in line for 25 minutes. Staff was pleasant and only offered the explanation that they were, "understaffed." Like no big deal, or business as usual, making guest pay by standing and sanding in line, for owner's lack of adequate staff. Are they keeping costs down or what?

Maybe the property can be renovated, but as it stands, it is better to become one of those YouTube videos where they show it being demolished with controlled and well placed dynamite.

Only two stars because 1.It's in a great location 2.The go pool was really fun. Other than this it sucks. The room was out dated. The "high roller view" was bad. It smelled like cigarettes in a non smoking room. Mold. Peeling wallpaper, And the list goes on. Don't stay here.
Cheap rooms and gross. Really smoky and paper thin walls. Price is good, but didn't make for a good Vegas experience. Considering how cheap the other hotels are I'd stay at another place.

The valet situation here is a joke. Their structure is full of spots reserved for the valet, but not nearly enough for self-parking. And the valet dudes do not know to direct traffic when their valet pull-in spot gets full. WTF??

Stopped here to play some beer pong and gamble.  We ended up staying here the whole night and had a blast.  Really lively crowd, especially in the beer pong area, and tons of beers going around.  $5 minimum on the tables and $1 cups of beer, this is place is definitely a good spot to have cheap fun on the strip.  Yah the place isn't as clean, with watermarks and cigarette burns on the table felt, and with dealers who had issues counting chips, but I didn't really care.  I ended up playing for 3 hours straight on the craps table and had a blast.  The table operators were funny (some didn't know all the rules) and weren't as strict as other casinos (like not caring about non-playing people leaning on the sides).  I might've been the beer, but I didn't mind and had a great time playing with some fun folks.

The entire hotel looks like it should be condemned. The base boards of the hallway walls are removed and it looks horrible, like mold is growing. We checked into our fresh room to find toenail clippings on the floor and dust everywhere. After seeing this we decided to further inspect the room. We went into the bathroom to find hair on the sink and ceiling. We went downstairs to complain and we were told we could be moved to a slightly bigger room with a better view in about an hour. This was at 11AM. I returned in an hour and was told it would be another hour. After that hour I was given the option to take another room with a lesser view since the room STILL WASN'T AVAILABLE. So I accepted the room...the bellman helped move my things. As I'm settling into the new room I find leftover things from a previous guest's stay. Obviously THIS ROOM ISN'T CLEAN EITHER. At this point I informed the front desk and was "upgraded" to a GO DELUXE room. It's was beautiful.....until I looked at the bathroom. It looked like someone had EXPLOSIVE DIARRHEA and no one cleaned it. There was a dried BOOGER or some sort of food on the side of the tub. We noticed dried food on the decorative headboard. We basically had to stand and point out all the things that needed to be cleaned to the housekeeper. AWFUL experience....2 ridiculous resort fees were credited back. That's it....after spending my entire day trying to get a clean room

Pros: great price (~$45\/night during a major holiday), great location (middle of the strip), interesting history (bugsy's ghost apparently haunts the presidential suite)

Cons: ran out of parking spots for people living at the hotel (ultimate fail), poor water pressure, bad ventilation system (one of the rooms we got smelled perpetually of stinky feet)

Ok, Tue & We'd nights late November 2017.  $49 a night, then the fun begins, 38 a night for a resort fee, 19 a night for a valet fee, sales people hounding you by you elevator trying to sell you stuff.  Traffic is a nightmare, people are rude.  Can't wait to never come back again.

Room Condition
1.  Toilet is hard to flush.
2.  Shower has no pressure and warm is as hot as you can get it.
3.  Rooms have no carpet?
4.  No coffee maker or fridge.
5.  It's Motel 6 at best.

Yet it's $13 for a mix drink and 8 oz water!

I give this place 4 stars because of the good value for the excellent location.  The hotel overall is 3 or 3.5 stars on the typical hotel scale but the price for the location is a bonus star.  Rooms are average size for the strip with a small bathroom.  Pretty basic as far as room decor and furnishings.  Make sure you book early or on Vegas.com to get a rate.  I would never pay more than $70 during the week or $120 weekends.

I have stayed here twice now.  It is a perfect venue if you are looking to party and drink like crazy with friends.  If you're looking for luxury, maybe the GO rooms, but I'd do another hotel if that's what you are after

The casino has a distinct smell... the odor of air freshener mixed with carpet cleaner and smoke.  Not obnoxious... but it just makes me laugh every time I walk in.  I could pick out this place with my eyes closed.  The size of the casino is average for the strip but it's entirely possible to get lost walking around.  Most everyone is having a good time in the casino.  You can find $10 tables most times of the day, except weekend evenings.  Did I mention the smell?

I've walked in the pool area once and it looks great.  The buffet is entirely adequate.  Sports book is smallish with a few dozen comfy leather chairs.

We stayed at the flamingo this past week and were pretty happy. We had one of the renovated rooms so it was a cute pink color which I loved. I did not like that the bathroom had a sliding door so not really any privacy. We had a decent view of the pool and the room was clean. The pillows were way too fluffy and had to sleep on the bed without one :\/ Also. the last day we were there house keeping came into our room without even knocking so not really happy about that. 

The location of this hotel is awesome and right in the middle of the strip. They recently renovated the hotel so it has a food court and a mexican restaurant. The food was ok but of course pricey. The buffet was also alright. 

The line for the pool on saturday was ridiculous and every day we were there (wednesday-sunday) we couldn't find a place to put our towels so had to keep our stuff next to us on the floor and sit in the pool which was ok. It got packed on the weekends. The drinks were expensive by the pool.

The part I was really annoyed with was the parking. We tried to park saturday night and half the parking lot is for valet while the other half is for the hilton guests and trying to get around in that parking lot is a nightmare. Also, valet was lined up that night and was told we'd have to wait for valet... well isn't that the point of having a valet so you don't have to wait? Had to park in some sketchy parking lot a bit of a walk from the hotel. 

Oh, and check in is an absolute nightmare. Thank god i'm a total rewards member and didn't have to wait in a line because if I wasn't it would probably have been a good hour and a half.

Not the nicest, but not the worst hotel I've been in. We came here for new years eve, so it was pretty affordable considering the time of year, and it's not like you spend a whole lot of time in the rooms while you're here anyway. Although it was pretty cold when we were there (snowing cold), so being indoors was a nice thing. We ended up just hanging around in other hotels since the bars and casinos were nicer and had better drinks. All in all, it wasn't bad. I think a lot of people probably would find it a more distasteful place compared to the newers hotels that have been built in recent years, but the bed was comfy enough and it was affordable. I think if you get the upgraded rooms, it's a much nicer stay

The only complaint I have is that our bathroom ceiling had water leaking from it  in the middle of the night and we called someone up to fix it, and I think they just had the maids soak up the water with towels. I guess that's what makes this hotel one star less quality than the other ones. I guess when people set up a really bad impression of a place you plan on staying at, and then it's not nearly as they describe, it ends up being a more pleasant experience.

Worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Hands down. Gave us a room with garbage on the bed and ice in the bucket. Was it already occupied? Switched us to a fresh room and gave us a $30 drink voucher to shut us up. Can't walk 20 feet without being accosted by a jackass from Wyndham trying to get you to sit through a half day presentation in exchange for show tickets. We ordered 2 sandwiches via room service. When they didn't show up after an hour and a half we called and they knocked 20% off and it still took another half hour to get our food. 20%? Just comp it, you idiots. Every time I talk to the staff, while I remain pleasant and reasonable, they're obviously so used to complaints that they interrupt and talk over me before offering some insultingly small rebate or voucher. I'm never staying at this or any other Wyndham property again, and I'm telling all my friends. Shame on you people.

I had a two night reservation at the Flamingo Casino and I will not recommend this casino to anyone. I arrived a little after midnight, pulled up to the valet where there were two employees talking to each other, looking in my direction, so it was obvious they knew I was there. It was 10 minutes of waiting before I was even approached by an employee to leave my car at the valet. I immediately went to the hotel check in express kiosk to attempt to check in, as I received an email earlier in the day to do the self check in, and a confirmation thanking me for starting the check in process. As I tried to complete the check in process at the kiosk I kept receiving the message to go to the counter. The line to speak to a representative at the hotel check in had about 10 people ahead of me with 2 employees actively assisting guests with 2 additional employees standing behind them not assisting guests. The wait to be assisted was over 40 minutes! When I was finally assisted, I was told the room that was originally reserved for me was not available and I was offered an alternative SMALLER room and the employee asked me to come back later in the evening to get my original room I reserved which was a complete inconvenience. I accepted the room now that it was closer to 1 am, but specifically told the employee that I needed a fridge because I have a baby with me that I needed to store milk in, which the employee said a fridge would be delivered to my room. The fridge was never delivered. The hotel itself has plenty of elevators, about 9 elevators just in one section. None of them seemed to work as it took about 10 minutes just to get the elevator to the lobby level. I would not recommend this casino to anyone, service was not great, wait times are extremely long, and the location is very dated.

So far not a great experience.  The bathrooms being outdated I can look past, not a big deal.  This is my first time in Vegas and obviously at the Flamingo, and I was expecting great service and accommodating staff.   First there was a charge to get into the pool area, I get that there was a "DJ," but honestly it was just someone playing top 40.  Makes no sense to charge your guests to use the amenities.  We also grabbed some wine as it's my 30th birthday and needed a corkscrew,  the front desk and room service said they will not provide it as room service closes at 1:00 pm. ... our menu in the room says 11:00 pm?   They advised us that we had an old menu.  I asked to go just pick one up from downstairs and they said I can go buy one for $15.00.  Probably wouldn't go back.

This hotel was better than I expected, but there were still some serious downsides.

For one, they didn't change our sheets or provide blankets. That's super lame.

Second, our room keys stopped working halfway through our stay. Like wtf?

And you have to leave the hotel in order to get to Margaritaville. That seriously sucked because it was raining when we went.

But, on the bright side, the hotel hallways were really pretty and well-kept. And the prices were reasonable. Oh, and there's a Java Detour downstairs.

Too bad there was less food choices than the other hotels I had been to on the strip though.

We got a newly renovated room, I mean broom closet. There was seriously a foot around the bed to walk. That's it. In the bathroom, the dust hanging off the vent looked like a scary horror movie. 
In the 18 hours we spent at the Flamingo, a neighboring room's room service tray of used dishes never moved or was picked up. Gross. 
I've stayed at the Flamingo quite a few times and this last visit makes me never want to return.

I don't know who the people writing bad reviews of the Flamingo are, but I assume that they are all millionaires with very high expectations. When I pay $100 a night for a room on the strip, I expect a clean room and decent service. At the Flamingo my room was very clean and nicely updated. I felt like I got my $$ worth. I would definitely rather pay $100 here than $200 at Mandalay, Paris or Planet Hollywood. Besides, the location is ideal. The only thing- stay far away from the buffet- it's overpriced and terrible. Any buffet on the strip will be better. I have been to better potlucks.

There are good points and bad points about the Flamingo.  I will list the good points:
Location: this is on the center strip, which is close to a lot of other hotels (for shows, conferences)
Margaritaville: A nice restaurant with an upper deck view
The garden: The garden has Flamingoes and is very peaceful
The staff: very nice, polite
Cons: This hotel reeks of smoke, everywhere,  I used to smoke, so I understand and am not condemning. But when you ask for a non-smoking room, it should not smell like someone has nuck into your room and is hiding to smoke a cigarette. This resulted in a miserable stay (allergies). 
If you are catching an airport shuttle in, you will have to walk a block with your baggage to the hotel, back entrance, 
There was a roach near the ice machine--but this may be secondary to the fact that someone dumped a salad on the floor, and it sat there for two days--after all, natural selection dictates that you need to do what you can to survive--and this roach was doing what he could to get to that salad.
When the room was booked, I booked a room with a refrigerator, and was provided with a styrofoam cooler.
 There was a leak, in the first room . This leak was coming through the light fixture in the bathroom. This was due to a problem with something upstairs. The room was put out of order which meant that baggage and belongings had to be carried to another room.

I have stayed at flamingo over ten times. I have always raved about the hotel to my friends and family. 

Today's experience was bad. So I checkes in with the kiosk which was quick and easy. I am to the room. It was all the way in the back the very very last room. I decided to go with the suite. Something different. I usually stay in the go or the Fab room. What a disappointment!!

I called downstairs to let them know my issue and the receptionist put me on hold. When she came back to the phone she told me I cannot switch my room. She can only call service to clean. I told her there are stains on the furniture and the ironing board etc. She didn't care. I also told her I stay here all of the time but I stay in the other rooms. S uphe told me she can change it in the morning. I know she can see my reservations and I am only staying for one night. So I said forget it. 

I hope they see this review. I will not stay at this hotel ever again. I am taking my money somewhere else. I could have stayed at planet Hollywood or luxor for a better price. They just lost a customer.

I love this place...had a suite...with one king size bedroom and 2 twins in another room with a jacquizzi bath and tv and microwave plus as living room and kitchen...heavenly!!

the review about cockroaches was a shame she expeienced that!  was her room in the basement or what??

The history of the Flamingo intruiged me..Bugsy Seigel statue in the garden pool..so cool and outlandish at the same time (after all, he WAS a criminal)  lol

another thing...the real Flamingoes  in the pool area are a sight to see and the pool and pools area is so much fun!!

Stayed here during my 21st birthday festivities in one of the newer upgraded rooms. It's pretty decent for the price you pay. Located in about the middle of the strip. I noticed that not a lot of young people stayed at this place (Go figure, haha) since it's one of the older hotels. One of the lights wasn't working in our room and we had requested for maintenance to check it out but they never did, haha. I'd definitely stay here again though if I want to stay on a budget but still stay in a decent room. 

TIP: Stay in the newer rooms!

Despite the 3-star overall review of this place, I thought this place was great!  My parents got a great deal for a 5-night stay, so they loved the price and I loved being in here every minute of it.

The room was so clean.  Carpet, free of dirt?  Check.  Bedsheets, pure cleanly white?  Check.  Bathroom, free of dust, fingerprints, etc.?  Check.  View?  Fantastic.  We were on the 28th floor, right over the garden they have in the back with the flamingos and birds and koi fish and what-not.

The prime showcase of the room?  The bathroom.  It didn't have walls, it had thick white panes of glass.  The pink walls matched the pink light that lit up the white glass.  The sink was one of those bowl sinks.  The shower was pretty nice too, except the water was definitely not hot enough for me.  I had to take fast showers if I didn't want to freeze to death.

I thought they kept the rooms super nice.  And I loved the view.  Big TV.  Quiet, convenient, inexpensive.  Love, love, love.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  If you want to stay in a hotel where they don't provide a working air conditioner in the room (when it's over 100 degrees outside), staff that aren't helpful and don't give a crap about their guests, and management that are arrogant, rude, and do nothing to make up for their wrong doings, then this is the hotel for you.  Seriously, screw this place.  I will never ever spend a dime here again.  Thanks for the worst hotel experience Flamingo!  Worst customer service ever.

Old school Vegas reduced to mediocrity due to mismanagement and the vast corporatism the city has become.  This was once the epicenter of the Rat Pack, Fun, Vice, and everything society accepts about Las Vegas.  Now it's full of 3 star rooms, dumb marketing gimmicks, and a lack of ingenuity.  Times have changed and newer venues are competing and winning.  If counter measures are not implemented this hotel could easily find itself a candidate for demolition as it fails to grasp the concepts that made it so Iconic.

Where do I start with this review? Hmm. Well we reserved a room with this hotel since June. JUNE! That's 5 months ago! We are here for the Marine Ball and refused to give our rooms. We had paid since June. So they refused because my fiancé and I are not 21 yet. If they knew we weren't 21 why in the hell would they accept my money for reservation. We had paid in full. So i asked for management and a young lady (who I asked if she was the manager) approached me and i told her what had happened, she right away came at my fiance and I with a Strong and unnecessary attitude and refused to give my money back. So, my fiance and i decide to leave and find another hotel, we ask valet for my car and as im getting inside my vehicle, the valet guy without me even giving him the chance to tip yet says... "just so you know, there is self-parking" and walked away. First time coming to Flamingo hotel & casino and it will absolutely be the last time we EVER come to this hotel. Dii will not be recommending this hotel. If I could I would rate this hotel with ZERO stars. 
(Ballys Hotel, diff recommend. Beautiful hotel & amazing service)

3\/27\/15: Got here around 12:30am and checked into the front desk. Booked a 2 bedroom room and talked to the front desk and they could only offer us a 1 king room when we paid for a 2 bedroom hotel... Was kind of disappointed on the management here. They told us that we will get a new room in the morning. 

3\/28\/15: Moved to the new room with 2 beds this time and one of my friends wanted to shower and guess what? The shower head was broken... Called the front desk and someone came up and gave us an upgrade to a better room. 

Later on that evening when we were getting ready to walk the strip we noticed that someone was at the front unlocking the room into our hotel when we were all in the hotel already. Turns out another family had the same key card and the same room as us. We didn't want our belongings to get stolen so we called the front desk and they told us they would check it out. 

Couple of hours later another family unlocked our door and came into our room... We called the front desk again and this time they changed the codes on the keycard. Turns out the room that we were in that was upgraded had nobody booked inside it so the front desk kept sending random families into our room. 

This maybe the worse hotel I've ever stayed at. Ruined a couple of our weekends due to always having one person stay in the hotel room so our belongings weren't stolen... Definitely never coming back to flamingo. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Spend the extra money for a better hotel people!

This is a good hotel to stay at.  If you are looking for new and flashy, stay somewhere else.  It was one of the first on the strip and shows, but is clean.  Staff were good and always there to help.  One of the really good things is that it is centrally located.  We were able to walk to most everything we wanted to do.

We would stay there again, but likely try something else newer on the next trip, that really was the plan before we even came.

Very outdated...the elevators are in such bad shape, I felt unsafe in them. The rooms have no carpet so it had a cold feeling. The bathroom had stained tiles, some broken. Small tv and when I wanted to use a corporate card, they wouldnt let me. I will not return.

I know before I booked it that this hotel is one of older generation building. Keeping that in mind, I heard they remodel the rooms. 

When I walked in the lobby...it was crowded. They had the self check-in machine. Which is cool. 

Room was the normal but wow.. I got a really nice view of the wheel. At night, we leave the curtain open. It's amazing view when you lay on the bed. Definitely have to request a good view. 


Con: i saw 2 cockroaches in my room. I don't know where they came from. But they just appeared out of no where. They were small. So I know.. there are more. I was pretty gross out. I was hoping they don't go in my luggage and I end up taking it home with me. My nightmare seriously would come true. I didn't want to make a big deal abt it but totally make you think twice. 

Overall, my experience wasn't so bad. Elevator was quick. Gaming area was roomy. Dealer was nice. Environment felt the good old days of Vegas.

I stayed here for a week for a conference...and it was...disguisting.  I think my major flaw was that I was sober.  If it hadn't been for a lack of drugs and alcohol during the days, I probably would not have noted the mismatched furniture, stained couch, lack of a coffee maker \/ refrigerator \/ or any modern conveniences.   Since I was on a business trip, I needed to access the internet--which would have been easy if I could find their advertised wireless internet access "for a nominal fee".  The wireless access was attached by a cord, and the "nominal fee" was $12 \/ day.  
Reading other reviews, it seems I might have been more impressed with a Go room...didn't really know about them.  Oh well.

This was our first time staying since they updated the entire hotel and casino. I am beyond impressed! They did a great job capturing that "old Vegas" feeling while keeping everything modern and sleek- Bravo Flamingo!

The new GO rooms are fabulous. They feel fun and sexy but aren't too cramped like the "sexy" updated rooms at the MGM (My closet is bigger than your rooms MGM- what the H?) I do not like that you can't lock the bathroom doors which are only frosted so you can still see silhouettes through it. No privacy whatsoever there so I do not recommend sharing a room with friends or a partner who you're not comfortable knowing every bit of bathroom business they do- yeah you can also totally hear everything in there since it's just a slim sliding door with no seals on the top or bottom. 
BUT- if you're like me and my husband who don't give a hoot then you'll be right at home here! But if your home was a fancy luxurious hotel room you never had to clean.

They have also extended Margaritaville into their own cute island-y casino on the side of the building. I know it's silly and kitschy but I LOVE LOVE LOVE Margaritaville! They are so smooth and icy cold that they just melt in your mouth like buttah. Perfection!


Good job for keeping up with the times Flamingo! Staying here is not only more affordable than the newer hotel\/casinos neighboring it who are trying to recover some of the billions they spent on their launch, but you will feel just as fancy and hip as if you were at the Cromwell or the Linq (don't stay at the Linq- yuck!) and know that you are in the hands of the only classic Vegas joint left on the strip.

Book it now and enjoy your stay! 

Also don't forget to catch the wild animal habitat- they let you pose with the birdies and they are so cute!!!

Total dump!

Recently stayed at the Flamingo for a work function. Horrible experience. Don't let the pics on the website fool you-only some of the rooms have been renovated. Mine had a running sink, lumpy carpet and the smell of smoke made my nose run the entire time I was there. On top of all that you have to pay to use the gym and the internet and there is no breakfast provided (which to be fair, I've heard are all to be expected for Vegas where you pay for everything.) Outside is nice but inside is totally depressing. The other hotels have a much better atmosphere. The Flamingo seemed to be filled with a much older and sadder client base. The worst part was the woman in her wedding gown sitting at the slot machine. Ugh. Want to enjoy your trip to Vegas? Avoid this place.

Giving one star is generous. Too bad this place has gone so downhill. Checked in late (flight delay) and our confirmed 550 square floor suite was given away. So we got an "executive room." The room we got was disgusting.  And no strip view, was  corner room with a beautiful concrete view.  The furniture I wouldn't even have at a garage sale. Basically ruined our stay, we were on top of each other. (Three people).   Have stayed there plenty of times in the past (even got married there 13 years ago), I dont care if I ever set foot in there again.

This hotel is so adorable! First off it has a BIG pink flamingo outside of it. Secondly it is decorated with a lot of pink, AND they have live flamingos! You can see them if you walk around that is so cool! Very kid friendly because of that. 
The hotel rooms are decently priced. You can stay here for as little at $79\/night during the week & about $149\/night on weekends.

If your on a budget and want to stay on the strip I guess this would be your place. I stood here before and my. Second time staying here my experience wasn't all that great.. 1st of all parking is horrible. If your lucky u get valet parking or even parking in the structure.. If you don't then you have to walk about two blocks down to park your car and walk with all your things.. Then elevators felt like they were gonna break getting stuck. The rooms hardly have any lighting, restroom look all yucky. Lastly the cleaning staff. Will knock on your door if your aren't  by 11 am or they will call down stairs so they can warn you  to check out.. I give it two stars bc there pool parties are okay have great music and it's free it your staying there.

Finally stayed here on a trip at the end of June, 2014.  Overall it was an OK experience.

CHECK-IN\/FRONT DESK - 5 Stars
Our flight landed at McCarran at 7:30am local time, so we were at the Flamingo by 8:15 with probably no chance of our rooms being ready.  However, we decided to check an.  The lady at the front desk was very polite, and offered to have us 'automatically' checked in as soon as our room was available.  She advised us to return to the front desk anytime after 2pm to pick up our room keys, which was nice because this was a separate line from check-in.  So upon returning approx 3pm, I waited a minute or two in a very short short 'keys only' line, picked up our room keys and I was on my way.

HOTEL ROOM - 2 Stars
FYI, we did not stay in an upgraded 'GO' room. For the most part, the room was nice and probably should get 3 to 3.5 stars, but since the bathroom seemed really outdated and was obviously not re-done with the room itself, I'm unfortunately giving it only 2 stars.  As for the beds, desk, misc. furniture and the TV, those all seemed pretty nice, and the floor was not carpeting which took me by surprise.  It was actually a fake wood (laminate?), which seems to be easier for cleaning purposes.  ON A SIDE NOTE:  The corridors\/hallways and elevators in our tower were really, really really outdated and need to be upgraded badly.

CASINO - 4 Stars
FYI, I'm including the Margaritaville Casino in with this review.  Overall the casino is nice, and you have the infamous 'Flamingo' fragrance that is always pumped throughout the casino, which I actually like.  You can usually find lower table limits here compared to Caesars across the street or the Cromwell next door.  There are always $5 blackjack tables inside Margaritaville and the main Flamingo casino itself has a variety of table games with lower limits, even on the weekends and in the evenings.  Also have a variety of slot machines, which I like as well.  While the decor in the casino may seem 'outdated', I don't think it really is.  It still has that vintage Vegas feel and look to it.

DINING - 2 Stars
Ok, this is where the Flamingo could step up it's game a bit.  Carlos' and Charlie's is a smaller chain and not unique to Vegas so I've opted to steer away from there.  The Buffet could use some work as well.  Went there for breakfast twice on my past two visits and it was not good at all.  The selection was very limited (didn't even have pancakes) and the food wasn't the best of quality.  Want a better buffet?  Check out Harrah's down the street.  And as for the Cafe' at the Flamingo, I've eaten here once and the service was horrible and the food was very bland and tasteless and took forever to come out.  Even if I stay at the Flamingo again, I will not be dining here.

BARS -  4 Stars  
Ok, for starters the casino bars are average, just a few bars in the middle of the casino.  But what I do like to give this area 4 stars is Margaritaville, the 5 O'Clock Somewhere Bar inside the Margaritaville Casino, and the Corner Bar which is located outside on the southwest corner of the building (right by the Cromwell casino entrance).  The corner bar offers up $3 Miller Lite Pints everyday (16oz aluminum cans), all day, which is really cheap on the strip now that Bill's and the original O'Shea's are gone.  Not a lot of nightlife here, but The Flamingo does have a few good spots to grab a drink. 

SPORTS BOOK -  2 Stars  
The Sports Book at the Flamingo is really small and sits next to Carlos' and Charlie's.  Definately not one of the Sports Books I would prefer to catch a game in.  While it's clean and looks decent, I would just prefer a larger sports book such as the one at TI, The Mirage or my favorite, Caesars Palace.

POOL - 5 Stars
Ok, behind The Mirage and Caesars, The Flamingo has my third favorite pool in Vegas.  I especially like that they have an over 21 pool where no kids are allowed.  And the partying doesn't kick in until later in the afternoon, so if you want a nice relaxing swim without kicking and screaming kids, head to the Flamingo Go Pool.  The family pool is also nice with a few small water slides added to it.

STAFF - 5 Stars
Overall, the staff in general (front desk, casino, restaurant\/bars, housekeeping) are great and deserve 5 stars.

I have stayed at The Flamingo twice now and I have to say it has great charm.
It is Las Vegas through and through, in all its kitsch glory.
The service is excellent, rooms are spacious and well maintained.
The hotel has all the facilities you would need - bars, restaurants, beauticians, hair dressers (beware of their prices though!!!).
The gambling is good, plenty of winners.
The Flamingo is not as slick as The Bellagio or Caesar's but it has old-school charm.
Would recommend

The reason to stay at the Flamingo is for the location and the cheap rooms.  The rooms are not great, the service is pretty poor, and getting what you want requires some work.  If you begin your stay with this in mind, you can make the most of your time.  

First, go for the room upgrade.  Do not stay in the "FAB" rooms, they are far from it.  Instead opt for the "GO" rooms.  I was able to use the "sandwich" to upgrade my room.  Here you place a $20 in between your ID and credit card and ask the individual at the front desk if there are any courtesy upgrades.  Sometimes they bite, and sometimes they don't.  If they don't bite, ask if they can come down at all on the price of the upgrade and they usually will.  Either way, don't stay in a FAB room.

Second, the pool requires some maneuvering.   There are two pools, located near each other.  One pool is family friendly.  I did not go to this pool so I cannot say much about it.  The other pool is 21 and over.  Starting at 7:00 AM there will be a line to enter this pool.  They check your ID, and sometimes your room key (seems like on the weekend is the only time they check the room key).  You get a wrist band that is good for all day, and they check your bag for any alcohol or food which are both prohibited since they want you to purchase your food and alcohol from the vendor at the pool.  While I was there, I entered the pool around 8:00 and was able to find a chair with some effort.  I then placed a towel and a t-shirt on the chairs to save my spot and then went back to my room to start my day.  I was able to come back to my place later on.  There are not nearly enough chairs for all of the people at the pool, so you have to save a spot early if you want one.  There are also day beds and cabanas available.  The day beds go for $120 and includes 2 drinks during weekdays, and $220 for weekends.  I did not ask about cabanas because the day bed price was already higher than I was willing to pay.  

The pool plays club\/hip hop music all day, they do a "bootie-shaking" contest around 3:00 daily, and there are a few gambling tables.  The alcohol specials seems to consistently be a bucket of beer (six) for $25, or (12) for $48.  Even though this may seem to be for people only 21-35, I saw people of all ages everyday I was there.  The majority of the people there are not your crust of society, so if you prefer to be around a higher-class clientele, you may want to check out another pool.  Flamingo is partnered with Ballys and Ceasars and you can utilize some of those resort amenities for a discounted price.  

Third, customer service is practically non-existent.  You will wait and the employees will be rude and that is the status quo.  Check in and out are both nightmarish because of ridiculously long lines.  I suggest checking in at an odd hour (I did an 8:00 PM check in to avoid lines), and I suggest settling your bill before hand and checking out by calling the front desk at 11:00 AM and leaving the keys in your room.  

If you need anything during your stay, do not expect to get it.  Extra towels?  Go find a cart and steal them.  Need help using the ipod dock?  Forget it.  Nothing will be delivered to your room, and no one will be able to answer your questions.  In addition, they will probably be rude that you even asked a question to begin with.  Save yourself the disappointment and stress and just figure it out yourself.  

The upside of the Flamingo is the location.  It is directly across the street from Ceasar's and generally in the middle of the strip.  Also, it has a monorail stop.  The monorail runs on one side of the strip and is great for getting around.  It is $5 for one trip, or $12 for the day.  Being centrally located, and having the monorail is very convenient and probably the main selling point of the Flamingo.

My Fiancé and I are avid Las Vegas visitors. We make approximately one to two trips a month to Las Vegas. We made a recent trip from December 13-15, 2013 and we decided to stay at the Flamingo. One we decided to stay there because of location and two because we were going to stay there again at the end of December. We arrived at the hotel to find the valet full, so we self parked where parking was impossible because half the structure is closed off for valet purposes, which I did not understand that the areas that were closed off were empty and valet stated it was full. Next, we checked in and got our keys, walked all the way to our room in the Habitat tower, where the carpet in the hallways were in disrepair, walked to our room which was 71 where it was down two long corridors to get to and only to find out that the keys did not work, and they were not stuck into a wallet or purse to be demagnetized. Had to walk back to the front desk to get new keys and walk all the way back. Once in the room, we find out the heater was not working and there was no TV remote. We called and waited over an hour and half for a remote to arrive, and the repairman did not arrive till the next morning around 1030. The repairman did state that he needed parts and had to leave and would be back, we ask if we needed to stay and he stated no. When we arrived back to the room later that day, we found out the heater did not work still, and called to get no repairman visit and no working heater for the rest of our stay. Meanwhile, we had also found out we were being double charged for our room since we had already paid for it through Priceline. We went to the front desk on December 14, in the morning, and talked with Emilio from Managua, Nicaragua. He was very rude and uninterested in explaining or looking into any reason why we were charged extra. Also, the first receipt we had received showed that we were charged one price, yet on our card statement, it showed a different price. After several questions and showing Emilio our online statement from our card, he looked into it and stated that the first charge was a mistake and gave us another printout showing we will be charged the other charge. As for being charged double, he stated for us to contact Priceline. Once talking with Priceline, stating they needed to talk with someone from the hotel, Emilio stated that he could not do anything further and that they needed to call the general number. Also, while standing there talking with Emilio, two female customers approached where we were standing and started talking with Emilio. He decided to carry on a conversation with them and not having them wait until he was finished with us. Once he was done talking with these women, his attitude changed and came back to poorly addressing our situation. Once off the phone with Priceline, and after being rudely treated by Emilio with his poor attitude, we asked to speak with a manager. Emilio turned around and walked past his manager, who was standing at the computer which sits off the front desk, and went into the back. I walked over to the area where the manager was standing and asked if he was the manager, he acknowledge, and I proceeded to tell him about Emilio's bad attitude and unwillingness to help. The manager stated that Emilio went on break and that he never gets complaints about Emilio. I am not sure if customer service is key in your hotel, but it is not with Emilio or the manager. We left very unhappy with that experience. However, later on that day, we talked with Priceline, and they stated that we needed to talk to the hotel because they were unsuccessful in getting through. We again approached the front desk, the same as earlier. We let the people behind us go first, so we did not get Emilio again, and we were greeted by a very friendly representative named Jennifer from Yorba Linda, CA. We explained our situation and she looked at our statement and looked into the hotel records and gladly worked through the problem and found what happened and what went wrong. She explained everything thoroughly what happened and how it will be fixed. She was very pleasant and she should be recognized for listening, working with the customer, taking extra time to look at things, not be narrow-minded, being polite and pleasant, and customer satisfaction( nothing Emilio displayed or even attempted to).
Just reviewing the slot gaming. Older type of casino, plenty of games, max bets are cheap and the pay out was actually pretty decent here. We gambled and had fun for quite a while.

BED BUGS BED BUGS BED BUGS!!! I have video proof! I shoved one in a glass and brought it down to the lobby! So here goes the novel that is my review. We booked because our friends said they had stayed there and wanted to again now that it's been redone. We arrived, took 30 minutes to find parking. Check in not realizing our luggage was in a puddle. Even though I had booked on their site and had been charged they claimed there was a rate adjustment and the room was now more expensive. Off to a bad start but who cares, I'm in vegas for a week! Up we go to our room. I tripped over the carpet in the hallway. It was threadbare in areas, covered in stains and pulling up from the ground. I said "This carpet is..." and before I could finish a passing guest said "disgusting...that's what the carpet is." We open our non smoking room to a big face slap of cigarette smell. Again, it's Vegas...oh well. Our view was a parking lot and construction. I am horrified of bed bugs and have my ritual. No luggage touches the bed and nothing happens until I do my mandatory inspection. The bed is white and there are specs of brown and tan (like sand and dirt) near the foot. There is also a dead brown bug. I try to move the bug onto something so I can look at it and it drops onto the carpet. My boyfriend tells me I am paranoid and I agree. So I pull all the sheets up off of the foot of the bed to start my check and before I can do anything...BAM bed bug just crawling around doing it's thing. If you know about bed bugs...those are all signs of a set in...well feed...long lived...full blown infestation. The poop, the completed life cycle and a bed bug so big that you can easily see it...in the middle of that day?! They normally stay out of site until around 3 am. I flipped out, video taped the bug, made him get a cup to bring the bug to the lobby in and held all my luggage while I called the lobby. Saying bed bug, video and "it's in a cup" should get you straight through to a manager yes? Not at the flamingo. I had to ask for a manager. The manager asked if we would like a cleaning lady. uh huh. I told her I was coming straight to the lobby bed bug in hand. I get there, put the cup on the counter and loudly say "we found bed bugs in our room". She offers to put us in a different room. I tell her that since the linens are cleaned together and the guests use the same towels, wear their now bed bug infested clothes around the hotel..etc that the whole place is unsafe and I want to be put in a different hotel. Remember our friends are staying there too. She tells me she will refund my money and allow me to use their phone to reserve elsewhere. I tell her that Bed Bugs are a big deal and have to make a huge scene and threaten to tell everyone waiting to check in (and show them) before she finally calls Planet Hollywood and reserves for us. She hangs up the phone and tells us that it will be more expensive. Again, I have to make her call them back and get the exact same rate that we would have been paying at the flamingo. Finally this manager says to me "You know, there are bed bugs everywhere" Which disgusted me even more...No..not every hotel has bed bugs. They use bed bugs protectors on their mattresses (unlike the Flamingo) and use high heat in their dryers. So...2 hours later we are finally in line to register at PH. The lady that checks us in is so disgusted that she immediately upgrades us to a mini-suite overlooking the bellagio water show and the pools. No bed bugs, nice clean beds and beautiful rooms. So our friends say they want to leave too and expect the same deal. Flamingo tells them to drive to PH and if they have availability that Flamingo would refund them. They get to PH, no one from Flamingo has contacted them and they see that Flamingo booked and then immediately canceled a room with PH. Thank God for PH because we went to the same lady, she got on the phone with Flamingo, which is a sister hotel of PH, and got our friends the exact same deal one floor above us. Flamingo is SICK and their customer relations are atrocious. Go look at trip adviser...everyone says the same thing. And unless you want your world to be rocked by a bed bug infestation...STAY AWAY

This is a old hotel but it seems to have been restored.  The best thing is it is located very centrally on the strip.  The habitats in the property are also pretty nice.  The bad thing is they randomly charge you $32.43 daily for the "resort fees".  Even if it is a prepaid  group reservation where we are not required to pay any out of pocket expenses!  Their reps are also non-co-operative who are willing to assist you with this!

It took my wife and I one hour to check it. We walked into our first room to find the bed without sheets. We first thought, no problem lets call the front desk and get someone up here ASAP. After waiting 40 mins for someone to bring the sheets, we called the front desk and asked for another room. We got the other room BUT our keys didn't open the room. We finally got everything worked out but it took too long.

I stayed at the Flamingo last week for my first vacation in 6 years!!! Holy overdue! Anyway, I had picked the Flamingo because of its vicinity to so many other strip attractions and yet rooms are so much less than surrounding hotels, minus Ballys and the Quad. I had been planning this trip for over 6 months and am not going to lie, some of the reviews here had me super worried....thankfully that was not the case and I have nothing but good things to say about my stay!

We arrived at 11am on a Friday...check in isn't until 4pm unless you want to pay a fee. I had already joined their Total Rewards program at home and printed our temp cards so we went to get the real cards at the TR booth and found out TR members can check in early at no charge...at noon! It wasn't quite noon but there was only one person in the TR guest line so we gave it a go. At that time we were able to take care of everything but had to come back to get the keys at 12. Piece of cake! The guy that helped us was awesome... Removed the resort fee for me since I had booked back in February but had changed to a better packed after they started the resort fee (on his own, I didn't even ask), gave us some tips on ways to get around quick and was super friendly and fast. 

Our GO room was really cute and clean with a view of the pools. We were on the 25th floor of the Spa Tower. I was excited it had a mini fridge and a coffee maker...nice to have cold water available and store left overs to eat for breakfast. The bed was super comfy, there's a huge mirror for getting ready and lots of lights in the bathroom. We had no problems at all with the room, keys or house keeping during our stay.

Some tips....the coffee place in the hotel sucks and was way overpriced. Maybe we are Starbucks snobs, but really, yuck. None of the restaurants here were impressive, but like I said, it's in the perfect spot to walk to better restaurants. Serendipity across the street is FABULOUS! 

If you hit the GO pool go early if you want a lounge chair. They open at 9 and there will be a line to get in.  The party goes all day here...if you want beer buy a bucket before noon and save your self 10 bucks! The pool food was pretty good too. 

My only 2 complaints were 1. Who ever had the room before us thought it'd be great fun to set the clock radio alarm for 2 am, full blast on static. Yes it's Vegas and yes I was asleep at 2 am and that really, really sucked. 2. The iPod docking stations are great, until you are awakened by a ridiculous alarm at 2 am and then forced to hear the base of your neighbors techno music til 4 am. Not the hotel's fault some people are inconsiderate...maybe if I'd had some good coffee I'd not be so grumpy about it. 

Check out was easy. I went down early (10am) to pay my pool tab and took care of everything in about 5 min. Was told to leave the keys in the room and that was it. I vote stay here. You'll be close to it all and save money for fun on the strip...winning!

The carpets in the hall were pretty grimy.  Spotty and lose.  My room was a nice size but the AC was horribly loud and there was no refrigerator.

The resort fee is outlandish.  It gives you free local call, two passes to the gym and ONE device to use on the wireless internet.  If you want to use more than one it will be 13.99 per device.

I checked in online as the hotel sent me a link that it would be faster.  However this caused me to have extra charges on my account.  When I called the front desk about it, the office manager insisted I was wrong and said I could come down to the desk and she would call the bank.  When I came down to the front desk, the clerk saw the error right away and said I was dually charged because of the online check in and again when I actually picked up the keys.  I said, "so you'll take it of?"  I was told I could call the bank to see if they knew what to do to reverse it otherwise it would occur in five business days.

No one apologized for the error and I left in frustration.  I will not be returning and would recommend others not to go here.

VEGAS IS NOT FOR KIDS

There I said it. With all the things that kids have in the world (Disneyland, playing consoles, smart phones, etc.) adults need to have their own playpen. People say I'm an old soul. I like the Vegas of old - a swinging town dominated by gamblers. Even though there are more visitors in Vegas, Macau has become what Vegas was -  the gambling capital of the world. People say the Flamingo is run down. To that I would respond is that if it wasn't for the Flamingo the Las Vegas Strip that we know today wouldn't have existed. The Flamingo isn't kid friendly but if you want that then go to Circus Circus. Let's be honest casinos like Circus Circus wouldn't have made what The Strip is today. The Flamingo represents a lot of history through good times (Rat Pack) and bad times (mob). There's a certain character the Flamingo that exhibits through this day. My favorite old time Vegas movie is the original "Ocean's 11" in 1960. Of all the hotels featured in that movie Flamingo is the only remaining.

During the Presidents' Day Weekend my friend and me stayed here for 3 days. I never stayed at the Flamingo before. My original review of the Flamingo was a 5-star rating because I won over $700 about 2 years ago that paid off my Vegas trip. When we arrived this past Thursday there was a long line in the check in line. However there was no line at the Total Rewards Gold Member line. Being a Total Rewards Gold Member I went to that line to quickly check in. (Here's a tip be a Total Rewards Member so you don't have to wait for a long line at the regular check in.) 

We stayed at the Go Room. This room represents a modern feel that includes a 42" HD TV and a TV in the bathroom. One of the features I love about the Flamingo is the layout of the casino itself. Even though the casino is smaller than most casinos all the gaming activities are centralized and not spread out as some casinos in The Strip. This makes people gamble more. Another great feature is the garden that includes a wedding chapel and swimming pools. Unfortunately the swimming pools were closed due to renovations. 

You might ask if I love the Flamingo so much then why on my updated review I didn't give a 5-star rating this time? Two years ago I stayed at the Roman Tower at Caesars Palace. That room at Caesars was twice as spacious than at the Go Room of the Flamingo even though I paid a little more at Caesars. That was the only knock on the Flamingo. 

The Flamingo remains a gambling playpen for those adults who want to relive the Old Vegas the without the hassle of a kid friendly atmosphere.

Con: Been to this hotel a couple of times. This time around, it was no different, the place needs some serious repairs, but for the price on the strip, ehh. Staying at the Flamingo is always a gamble like everything else in Vegas. Sometimes you get a good room and sometimes the room gets you.

The problem was that my car was broken into, everything of importance was stolen, I talked to security, of course, no camera's, the hotel told me they wouldn't be able to do anything and after being in there for 2 hours. You could have saved me the trouble and told me to contact Las Vegas M.P.D.

this happened on 4\/20 - 4\/21, so  when I went to LVMPD. Guess what, I was told that many police officers had "called in" on 4\/21 and where short staffed... Ohhh Vegas... that's why I love you, the Devil's Taint doesn't disappoint.

Thus after all this, I went on a alcoholically induced walkabout like my ancient ancestors did before me on the strip. 

*Insert Hangover Scenes*

Pro: Woke up with a lot of money in my Wallet after that walkabout. Black Jack $$$$

Pros-Super close to everything, clean enough, inexpensive.

Cons- $35 to get a cot for our son (Husband accidentally booked one king bed), up all night due to no sound barrier in room (neighbors partying, tons of traffic up and down the halls at all hours), $28\/night resort fee, no in room accommodations like a coffee pot, mini fridge, extra pillows or blankets (I called for 3 extra blankets and two pillows- the guy made three trips to us and  never brought what we needed- either one pillow no blanket and then a comforter and no pillow, etc), tiny bathroom. 

Wouldn't want to stay here again...

I've always wanted to stay at this hotel after visiting Las Vegas 8 times... my 9th time was this past weekend and I stayed at the Flamingo.  I was a bit apprehensive after booking and THEN reading Yelp reviews...there seems to be a black & white feeling about this place, no grey area at all.  Love it or hate it... I will summarize what I loved and hated about this place.

Love!
We got in around noon, and I knew check in was at 4.  I called in advance and asked what the early check in process was.  I was told it depended on the day, situation,etc.  basically, you won't know till you get there.  We stood in a short line and Jamison waited on us... he is THE MAN!!!! Seriously... after asking about upgrades and early check in, we were able to check into an upgraded room on the 28th floor with a strip view for $20 more a night along with a coffee maker and fridge as well.  So Happy!
The location is ideal if you don't plan on spending much time in your room.

As time went on...

Hate....
Ok, the elevators... I had no idea what to expect after reading about the problematic nightmares till I experienced this myself.  Also, I might add this was EDC weekend which only added to the nightmare.  Having a top floor room was amazing....the ride up or down to it, not so much!!!  This elevator would stop on floors with no one there, the doors would remain open, or closed... just ridiculous!  Plus, I don't think they were all working.  I'm referring to the Habitat Doors.   I'm not sure if the Spa Elevators had the same problem.

After spending the night, the next day our room was never cleaned.  We noticed that the cleaning people were still on our floor, yet no one cleaned our room.  We called housekeeping and they assured us it would be clean.  Nope... and that meant a shortage for three of us to share towels for two.

Be prepared for Wyndham time share people to corner you everywhere...they are by the elevators and the check in desk - just ignore them and keep walking, they are VERY annoying!!! I don't recall getting bothered by these types at any other hotel I stayed at.

If you want a seat at the 21 & over Go Pool, be sure to stand in line well before 9am...by 9:15 there is a long line and NO seats in the place.
