There is a nice money making thing going on in here where there are less chairs and more day beds to rent for $100\/day plus you need to spend at least $50 there on drinks.  Needless to say we spent time at the FREE Family pool with plenty of seats and no line to get in.  Also keep in mind it was this way during the week, I can't imagine what the weekend would be like.

I haven't sorted through our final bill yet, but I will say the resort fee here is a joke too.

I like to stay at different places when I go to Vegas so I probably won't stay here again.
This is not one of my favorite casinos but it has a charm that shouldn't be missed.  It's more old school in looks and fun to be in.

Had the cheapest non smoking room and it was completely remodeled.  Everything tip top shape.  We stay there because of the great pools and gardens.  Sad to say the main pool is now geared to 30 year olds with the worst  X rated, ear splitting, rap music.  Would have given 5 stars except for the music.

Pros:
.....................(I am still thinking)..............................



Cons:
**Dirty ass room, when they say "clean' means you will find trash under the sink
**Scary a$$ looking bathroom
**stain on the carpet
**Rude a$$ servers at their restaurants
---the list continues--

I will NEVER EVER EVER EVER stay here. 

P.S. 5min international call cost us $65

Omgosh! This place is a big rip off!
All the perks... Aren't actually in place.
They charge amenity fee even though check in is 4pm. POOL CLOSES AT 5pm!!
By the time you get your belongings upstairs you're unable to utilize any amenities .
The slides and 2 of the pools are closed until May! But they don't tell you this when your making your  reservations. The BBQ food promised and burgers.... Not available!
Many people are wandering around in circles complaining. The attorneys are going to have field day! Never staying here again.

this hotel is what it is. it doesn't purport to be the classiest of fanciest hotel on the strip. (nor is it) but it does do a few things really well. chief among them...its affordable. the staff is polite - both dealers and hotel staff. the tables are cheaper than the name brand casinos. the pool is substantial though not the fanciest on the strip. it is also very well situated in the middle of the strip and close to all of the big casinos. 

does it have good shows to go see? no. are the rooms spacious and fancy? no. 

this hotel is for those that want to save a little money on their stay, so they can eat good food, go see shows, or gamble it away.

If you're staying at the Flamingo, stay in a GO room, no exceptions. We originally booked a regular room, and after the first night decided to upgrade to the GO rooms that everyone raves about.

The regular rooms aren't terrible, but they're not much cheaper than the GO rooms and there is a BIG DIFFERENCE between the two rooms. We took to Twitter for a coupon code, and they gave us a code that let us upgrade for $20 each night.

The GO room is excellent. It has a big flat screen TV, great bed, a TV in the bathroom mirror, both a shower and tub, a nice lounge chair in front of the big window, a great closet and everything is pristine and clean. I can't express how much happier you'll be with a GO room. And for $65 a night during the week, you really can't beat it.

The location is great. It's across the street from the Bellagio (see the water show outside every half hour) and Caesars Palace. Behind it is this neat little Italian joint (not fancy, just fun) called Battistas that gives you free unlimited wine with your meal and a guy with an accordion who comes around playing to all the tables.

The outdoor area is huge, which I love. They have a lot of land here. The pool area is HUGE, they must have at least five pools. They also have a little area with real Flamingos (which were freezing their patooties off while we were here) and there's plenty of places to walk around and explore in a semi-quiet environment.

My only complaint is the lack of good food. The Burger Joint makes a decent greasy breakfast, but the rest of the food is crap. Sin City Brewing company is the biggest highlight only because they have a fire pit out back.

As for the Casino... it's OK. There's nothing spectacular about it except that there are dancing girls in one corner on a little stage every once in a while. The fifty year old boob-implanted waitresses are few and far between and I wasn't offered a drink even once despite the amount of time I spent in here one night.

So as far a Casino goes... go next door to Bills Gambling Hall for some fun. If you want a good place to stay, I have to thank the numerous people who told me to stay here because the GO rooms make me feel like I'm staying at the Bellagio, but just a little more pink.

Yikes!  I will start with what was good (since it will not take too long).  The price was quite reasonable (I booked a Black Friday special on the Flamingo website).  The location is great!  The grounds are nice, with a wildlife refuge complete with birds, koi ponds and more.  We got to the hotel a couple of hours before the 4 PM check in.  We were allowed to check in early (for a $15.00 fee)... Our room had a fabulous view of the new Ferris wheel and the animal refuge.  And the room is nicely updated.  Sadly, the bathroom had rusty drains and BUGS (ants?) in the shower.  Yuck.  The hallways were DISGUSTING!  Carpet was dirty and in desperate need of a stretching.  It is a trip hazard!  Tears and huge waves of wrinkles.  Also, be wary of anything promised to you before your arrival.  We called to request a fridge (they were able to deliver on this) and a coffee pot.  Due to a special diet, I need hot water.  We called before our trip to request this.  Once there we were told we had to be in the "Gold Tower" (at an additional charge) in order to have a coffee pot.  Since we drove, I would have brought my own but did not as we were assured we could have one.  I was on at least 2 (Habitat) elevators that did not work.  As for the casino, on three occasions we were at slots for 30 + minutes and NEVER had drink service.  The "free" parking is great if you can find a spot.  The first day we were fine.  The second day (after returning from a hike) the parking garage AND the Valet were both full.  On our last morning, we (reluctantly) went to one of the hotel restaurants for breakfast.  Again, dirty carpet (yuck...in a restaurant I'd like to see some cleanliness).  I ordered the french toast (quite a treat for me as I usually do not eat this).  It looked lovely!  Lots of fresh berries, three thick slices of french toast.  I poured a little syrup on one piece.  Had a few bites, poured more syrup on and YUCK!!!!  an empty wrapper from  sweetener poured onto my toast.  It took about 8-10 minutes to find our waitress.  Another 8-10 to get a new plate (delivered with attitude) and this plate had very few berries...of course my husband was long finished with his meal.  This is not a hotel I would stay at again.  There are much better choices in Vegas

I have ready many negative reviews about the Flamingo and since we sort of had to stay there, we were nervous.  Because of the poor expectations, I really feel compelled to share my experience at the Flamingo the last few days and address the "issues" that were brought to our attention while reading reviews on this and other forums.

We booked this trip to join some friends of ours that had gotten an excellent deal on flights\/rooms and they asked us and another couple to join them about a month after they had booked themselves. I had never stayed at the Flamingo but we booked the cheap Fab King rooms because we hadn't really budgeted for this trip. Our reservation didn't allow for cancellations because of the low rate and our upgrade offer (about a week from the trip) was just too much to justify in our eyes.

My wife was very apprehensive because she read many reviews was really buying into the horror stories of the condition of the rooms, rude staff, pushy timeshare salespeople, etc... When we arrived, we inquired about an upgrade but they didn't have any available unless we wanted to change rooms during the stay which we declined. We were placed on the 16th floor with a partial strip view. When we got to our room and it was the closest room to the elevators and there was a sign stating it was a dog accessible room so my wife was really irritated before we entered the room thinking of the noise at the elevator and dog hair\/mess potential (and we are dog lovers). To our surprise, the room was clean and nice and we barely ever heard a noise from the elevator area. We examined for bed bugs, pet stains, pet hair, etc... and found NOTHING wrong with our room. This room was basically like staying in a newer LaQuinta IMO. The mattress was firm, but comfortable. The pillows were a little firmer than we prefer, but they were completely fine. The bathroom was a little dinged up but again, completely fine. Our water pressure in the shower was excellent and not shortage of hot water. We were greeted by timeshare people about once a day as we walked through the lobby but they were not pushy and all we did was smile and say "no thank you" and they left us alone.

The pool was fun. Drink prices were a little higher than other places but it is what it is. They searched my wife's bag and asked me to empty my swim trunk pockets (had my phone and wallet in them) and they checked our ID. 1 morning they allowed coffee into the pool area and another morning they didn't so it depends on the person at the gate. I found the security people to be pretty friendly but we are polite people so that probably helps. The line did start forming at 8:15, but I am talking 2-4 people. By about 8:30 there were 15-20 people and if you were in line by about 8:45 you were able to get multiple chairs together still and I would say there were about 30-45 people in line at that time. We were able to get 6 chairs together in several locations and we were in line at 8:30AM. If you are a diamond or above player, you have a separate line so you can get there at 9AM and have your pick of chairs. It was the same each day (Monday-Thurs mornings) so I bet the weekends are a little tougher.

We were greeted by timeshare people about once a day as we walked through the lobby but they were not pushy and all we did was smile and say "no thank you" and they left us alone. This wasn't even an inconvenience to us. It was WAY less intrusive than the guys on the strip pushing their bars\/clubs\/events.

Honestly, we enjoyed our stay so much that we will be looking to stay there again in the future if the price is right. I preferred my room at MGM and love their pool options, but the location of the Flamingo and price is really hard to beat. We may have just gotten lucky by having one of the better Fab Rooms or it is just that we don't expect to receive a suite on a super 8 budget....

My main complaint was that the WiFi kept kicking you off and you had to login multiple times each day and that is so minor I feel bad writing it.....

Hopefully some of you have the same experience!

The overall of this hotel was wonderful.  There is live flamingos outside the garden.   It was lovely staying here for my 30th birthday. But one thing,  I am not happy about is the beauty salon downstairs. They charged an arm and a leg for a fill and pedi, well as back home,  I pay half a price. This lady DOES NOT know how to do nail,  paint,  put ayrilc and it chipped the next day. Never ever ever in my life or anybody's life should we goback there. Horrible service with beauty salon.

Elevators are sketchy and dangerous. Housekeeping failed to bring up blanket when requested. Stayed in large suite and paid a lot of money. Furniture was dirty and ugly (think 1970s). Manager was unhelpful. They failed to inform me of extra resort fee ($28). the people at the hotel that I talked to also agreed they would never stay there again... Me either.

It is a scientific fact that people tend to remember their first impression, and last impression much more than anything happening in between those times.  That is our experience at the Flamingo!

In a nutshell: everything worked out in the end... once the requests were made.

Booked a "Deluxe room" through Expedia and got a good rate (but not as cheap as the good rate at some of the other Strip hotels).  We thought we'd spend a little more and get a better room.

Upon arrival the check-in went quick and smooth, but the room assigned us was really nasty.  Dirty and dingy.  Not "Deluxe" at all.  Hotel says the Deluxe room is distinguished from the Classic by the decor.  I can't even imagine what kind of craphole a Classic room must be.

Request for room change was quickly satisfied, but the next room (nonsmoking) reeked of smoke.  Again, sincere apologies and request for room change was quickly satisfied.  The room shared many characteristics of the other rooms, namely the "decor", and was slightly cleaner and was acceptable to us.  Kudos for being responsive, but WTF?

Maybe it was out fault for not upgrading to a "GO" room.  Next time, if there is a next time... it's a GO room or another hotel!

Odd observation:  ther appears to be a lack of standards for how the 
rooms are stocked.  One room has 3 pillows on one queen bed and 2 on the other.  A single shampoo\/conditioner.  Maybe that works for a bunch of guys, but not for a family with girls!  The room we settled into with two queen beds only had 3 towels.

We asked for more towels, telling them that there were 4 of us in the room, and within 15 minutes a smiling man appeared with a sack of toiletries (4 of everything, I think), 4 bath towels, 4 hand towels, 4 wash cloths, a box of tissues and a spare roll of toilet paper.  WOW... more kudos for being responsive.  Unfortunately the next day we were only resupplied with 3 towels.

My heart almost stopped, though, when my young son started pulling stuff out from under the bed.  First it was a half-used bottle of lotion, then a half-drunk bottle of water, and then I pulled him out for rear of what might be found next.  ATTENTION HOUSEKEEPING: When, or if, you vacuum the carpet please check under the beds for whatever the prior occupant may have left behind!

Nice surprise... no "resort fee".  Pool(s) and habitat area are very nice.  We didn't have time to use them as much as I would have like to.  Slightly odd pool hours: 8 AM - 6 PM.  No evening swimming????

Lobby and casino are inviting.  Not the newest or most glamorous, but still quite nice.

Good variety of eating options.

And then it was check-out time.  Given a choice between a line of people waiting to check out and a self-serve checkout machine, we chose the machine.  Quite anti-social of us, eh... but whatev!

There is a bank of about 6 machines and as we walked up someone was walkling away shaking her head.  Not knowing, we read the directions: swipe credit card or "Total Rewards" card.  So we swiped the pretty gold card that served as our room key, which had boldy emblazoned upon it "Total Rewards (italics and fancy script lettering) GOLD"  The machine kept giving a message... something like "I have no idea who you are".  At the next machine over there was an employee training a presumably new employee on how the machines work.  When they finished we asked if they could explain what we were doing wrong.  No she couldn't... she's a trainer and would have to call an "Ambassador".  So we stood by for a few minutes wondering why she couldn't tell us how to work the machine, but she could tell a new employee how the machine works.  Perhaps union rules... who knows.

Well, then a very mature, tall, hansome and well-spoke gentleman approached us and informed us that the card we were using is a room key and we should be using a credit card.  Then the system would search based on our name.  When we pointed out the instructions and showed him the "Total Rewards Gold" on the room key, he smiled and asked us to swipe a credit card.  We did, the machine printed a receipt, the nice gentleman handed it to us and bid us adieu and a nice day.  Kudos!

... but do we have a Total Rewards card, or just an old room key?

Great hotel!! 
The rooms are very clean and it's close to everything - you're literally on the strip itself
I'm giving them 4 out 5 stars just because I was staying on the 22nd floor and the cell reception wasn't that good and they didn't have free wifi.
other than that - a great hotel!!!
There is something about the flamingo I really like.. I gives you kind of a old fashioned Miami Beach holiday feeling !! Did lose in the casino though but I liked the atmosfeer....

I stayed here last year for a couple nights and had a good time. The hotel is nice and the pool was a blast, that was the best part. One of the days they didn't clean our room, we got back at 4pm and we had to call the front desk and ask someone to come up and they just handed us new towels and garbage bags. Other than that, the stay was pretty good.

The Flamingo has a very dated decor. I was staying in a Fab room which was supposedly a renovated room. That was untrue, since the only thing that looked new were the pink curtains. The bathroom vanity and other furniture in the room had chipping paint and finish. When I travel for a short period, I rely on hotel toiletries, the hotel does not provide hair conditioner. 

The house cleaning staff was nice and provided us with ample amount of towels! The hotel is good for people looking for something cheap, great location and aren't too picky about the room quality.

We stayed here for one night over Labor Day Weekend. It was a Thursday night and we were able to get a room for $39, what a freaking deal! 

The room looked like it belonged in Barbie's Dream House - White with Bright Pink accents. The hotel is a homage to old school Vegas, and I dig that. I wouldn't wan to spend a whole weekend there, but for one night, solid choice.

We also went to the Breakfast Buffet and it was SO AMAZING! So much food, and it was GOOD. Typically when you go to a buffet the waffles are soft because of the trays they keep them in - Not this one! Crunchy like they just came out of the waffle iron! Yum!

We recently stayed at the Flamingo to enjoy some time away from everyday life.  Prior to arriving at the hotel, we had read reviews about the Flamingo to discover the hotel booked through Expedia described as FAB Deluxe, is not actually deluxe at all.  We called Expedia to change our reservation and they made a note on our account addressing our concerns.  When we checked into the hotel, the people at the front desk made it sound like he was "hooking us up" by giving us a strip view, and not charging us additional money.  Once we arrived in our room, we discovered the room was in need of much work.  The windows were hard to see through because they were so dirty.  The walls were cracked and had water marks on the ceiling.  The bathroom was outrageously small, not fully painted and the molding was falling off the counter.  There are no fans in the bathrooms, the bathtub looked as though it was never cleaned.  They were either dirty or corroded.  There was hair all over the tub and shower wall.  We didn't get to sleep until 2 am and at 5:30 am, someone else close to our room, must have taken a shower because it caused our plumbing to howl!  Then again throughout the morning, it kept happening.  That was the push to request a new room.   

The next morning we requested a room change and were told to come back later that day.  The front desk met our request for a room change and moved us to a higher floor.  The bathroom was larger, but still no fan, and the paint coming off the walls.  The furniture in both rooms looked like they have been there since opening day.  Totally trashed and falling apart.  Upon Check-in we were charged $50 per night for incidentals, but there was no mini-bar or more damage we could have done.  When my wife asked at check-in, what the resort fee included, she asked about the pool and the front desk said that access was included in the resort fee.  Come to find out, we were told guests pay $10 to get into the pool (hopefully this person was just wrong).  Wi-fi is "free," but my guess is that's where all of the resort fee applies.  

The buffet is alright, but nothing fabulous or brag worthy.  One set of elevators was up to date and in great working order.  The other set, 1970, and stop at EVERY floor, even when nobody is getting on.  At one point, there was a ringing bell which sounded like an alarm, and someone yelling.  Worried much? Carlos N'Charlies was a decent breakfast, but dinner was poorly serviced and there was no way it was considered "busy."  The Casino itself was good and fun to play in.

We gave 2 stars because it just wasn't the experience we were hoping for.  We have stayed at other locations, with a very comparable, if not better prices, and they were decades ahead of the Flamingo.  Our thoughts were, center of the strip, great price, and it's history so it should be good.  Next time we will spend the extra money to be in the center of the strip with a great experience.

Stayed here and have major concerns about management and house keeping. They do not have enough parking for the hotel guests. Valet was totally full, and It took me over 30 minutes to self park. 

The first room I received had antiquated furniture,   floors, wall stains and the bedspread spread was not cleaned properly.

 All issues were finally resolved but it was way more draining to stay here for a "vacation" than it should have been. If you choose to stay here, be sure to ask the front desk staff for a renovated room.

Other items to note is they did not have 24 hour room service. Room service closed at some ridiculously early time.

Considering this hotel has been open since the 40's they should have had ample time to have all these rooms renovated and parking situations fixed by now.

If you are looking for quiet hotel in Las vegas book Budget rent flamingo hotel. Hotel somethimes offer discount on accommodation. I stayed here and i cant tell anything bed on this hotel. Rooms are nicley decorated, of course clean and nice. I love the budget hotel services. Las Vegas is nice city and if you come here book Budget rent Flamingo.

The Flamingo is billed as Las Vegas's first Luxury hotel, and does not disappoint. We stayed in the High Roller Suite, and what a beautiful suite it was. I recommend booking a session at The Spa while there, as well as dining at Center Cut Steakhouse.
Our only issue was with checking in. We did show up slightly earlier than planned, but we still had to wait over two hours for our suite. When we pointed that out to the Reception Agent, she offered to give us another room, but lesser than the suite we had booked, so that didn't make sense. Our room wasn't available until AFTER check-in time. Also, make sure to clear all the details of your booking; we booked two nights, but only the first night was placed as a "hold" on the credit card--why?? The total amount is NOT charged to your card immediately. Beware that the "free wifi" is actually part of the room fees you are charged at the end of your stay, and it never even worked.

Kiosk broken.  Rude service. 2 check in guest for a 1.5 hour line. I'm disgusted. The hotel is tacky and gross. SpongeBob is playing on the tv. Although Judi at customer service was outstanding and was able to make our situation go right.

I have stayed at other hotels on the strip and this one was nice but it was clear that the rooms had seen better days.

My boyfriend obtained the room for free with his Total Rewards points so I cannot really complain, however, the rooms are definitely tired and in need of a deep clean.

Unfortunately, I was sick most of the trip so I spent a lot of quality time in the room. :)

The casino itself was your typical vegas standard casino.  I have to say I didn't spend a great deal of time on the floor as I'm not much of a gambler.

I loved the live flamingos outside and the pool area (which was closed for winter) looked like it would be a great place to catch some rays.  

I was just grateful to be outside in the sun in January.  I would probably try this place again but I would prefer something a little more up to date.

Let's add one more review to the Flamingo Hotel pool shall we?

This place is affordable, its well known, and hey the pools are cool even in 2009. While its not the most fantastic place out there (umm check my Venetian stay review?) it is a landmark and a respectable one at that. And it has been recently updated in hot pink room accents, or dark brown and cream.

The flamingo exhibit is not to be missed. I have never seen nor heard of a black swan in my life! I wanted to feed him\/her so badly. She was elegant. Very cool. 

Pools and pools of cold water surround you after leaving the flamingo exhibit. And mind you, its 100 degrees in August so you will be totally refreshed by the spray hitting you even if you just walk by. 

Check out my flamingo pics! They were also published in a website online recently! I had so much fun being a tourist at the Flamingo Hotel.

I love the Flamingo.  It's my absolute favorite hotel to stay at on the strip.  It's close, it's cheap, they generally take care of everything.  This time was not the case.  

We came into to town for work and to visit friends and compete in a weekend long tournament plus a couple days and here is how it went down.


 check-in 1
1.  Check-in from the diamond lounge, service is stellar as usual
2.  Get to our room and it is a standard king sized room
3.  About 5pm we realize we're situated over carnival court can hear EVERYTHING
4.  Our neighbors check in and clearly plan to rage in their room. Awesome.
5.  I go to shower and find myself standing shin high in grey water (tub won't drain)
6.  I am greeted on my towel by a cockroach...this has never happened before  

Check-In 2 go to diamond office and change rooms

1.  All is well at check-in again
2.  We move rooms
3.  Our new room over looks the high roller (cool)
4.  Towards the evening hours we realize our neighbors have a dog
     - dog whines, barks, yelps for hours after being left alone
5.  We come back to the room after a long day of competition and dog is still upset 
6.  At 4am....our TV turns on blaring to the menu screen
     -the remote control doesn't turn it off and pushing power on the tv itself doesn't turn it off so we end up just unplugging it
7.  The lamps in the room are either broken or have some sort of short, once you turn the, on, they don't stay on

Day 3
1.  Elevator 1 doors will not close 
2.  Try to take a bath after another long day at competition and THIS TUB won't hold its water.  Ironic.  
3.  After everything else we just give up.  

By day 4, doggy couple checked out, reasonable neighbors checked in and we spent the remainder of our trip on the casino floor.  

Side note to housekeeping:  is it really necessary to slam the vacuum against the walls???  And two...why when we have a do not disturb card out do we get woken up at 9am to make sure we're checking out???


Not my favorite stay here....but it could've been worse.  I could've stayed off strip.

I travel frequently for personal and business and this hotel truly does not fit the bill. Disappointing customer service and rude pool security staff, which is disappointing when you are paying $17 for a drink which has no alcohol. Wait times for check in\/out and valet are ridiculously long. The Go rooms are supposed to be upgrades, however ours seemed to need a lot of work with broken light fixtures, dirty air vents and missing fixtures.

Never staying her again. Got  a good deal from Expedia, and I got what I paid for. Room is ooooooold and rough. It's good if you aren't going to spend much time there. It's also located mid strip which can be a plus if you are doing any exploring. And the monorial is located at the back of the  hotel which made for easy and cheap traveling which was a plus.

Worst hotel experience I have ever had. We booked a Go room and when we go there they had put us in a Fab room. I called to tell them this was wrong and they told me it wasn't and said I was lying in a nice way. I told them I wanted to speak to a manager immediately after they said all of the Go rooms were sold out and the lady told me I could come downstairs and wait in yet another line to show the confirmation paper to the manager. After I showed the manager the paper I was told that anyone could have made that up and they asked for the email. We showed them the email reservation. Suddenly a Go room was available after all. We would later find out that they had written this down as a comp upgrade in the system. We got to our room and in a nutshell this is what we experience: a room and hall filled with the smell of cigarette and pot smoke, blood on the sheets and the comforter wasn't replaced for 2 days despite multiple requests, water leaving from the ceiling in our bathroom, stereo in the room didn't work and we were told that this is not included in the room, although it is advertised. I could go on. We talked to the manager at the end of our stay and he said he could comp 2 of the resort fees ($58). Because they had already given us an upgrade comp (which was not true, they simply gave me the room I booked in the 1st place). I am outraged. Will never stay here or at another Cesar's location ever again. Even the lady at the desk apologize profusely for how this situation was being handled telling us it isn't right and how most of the employees there hate it. Says a lot. Do not stay here. It's hell on earth.

This is a grody old hotel with a good location on the strip and fairly friendly staff.

The lines at the front desk are extremely long, and there is a $30 fee to check in early or check out late. The AC in the room didn't seem to be working and it was over 100 out, the shower pressure was horrible, and flushing the toilet was a real nail-biter. Toilet situation was especially fraught after eating from the orange chicken at the food court.

We were 4 people in one room. We booked a deluxe room. Later we got an email that we can upgrade to a go luxury room with strip view for $20 which we did. Our room was great. We could see Bellagio's dancing water from our huge window (from the bottom to the ceiling). We had a Tv in our bathroom mirror. Everything was very clean, the beds were comfortable. We had shampoo and conditioner, soap and towels in the bathroom etc. So It was pretty good what we got for the money:) The front desk was busy but nice and friendly. The pool area was good. They had towels there so you don't have to bring the ones for your room. The only downside: no free wifi, it's about $10 a day!

The location is great.  Checkin was a nightmare, and they tried to charge us $25 to check in early.  What a scam.  The bell hop made it very clear that he wanted\/expected a tip.  The casino was old and smokey with low celings.  The carpeting in the halls was stained and coming up in places.  Rooms had no fan in the bathroom, clock or coffee maker, and had stains on the floor.  Really just a poor hotel, I know its older, but it doen't look like it's been updated since 1988.  I would suggest spending an addition 10 or 15 dollars per night and staying at Monte Carlo, Luxor NYNY or something like that.

This is our second time staying here.  The last time was a few years back for a wedding held at this hotel.  We thought it was nice enough for the price and location to stay there for this recent trip.

I would say it's a no frills kind of hotel.  The rooms are small and the bathrooms even smaller.  They have done some room upgrades since our last stay (some type of synthetic hard flooring, better than carpet).  This is not important to me , but I found it rather funny that part of the room decor was upgraded (bedding, flooring) and some were not (tables\/dressers\/bathroom).  If you don't care about staying in a trendy hip hotel, this is your place.  It's a decent place to rest your head, located halfway down the strip.

There is a new street (Link) located next to the Flamingo, so that's a bonus.  You don't have to wonder too far from your hotel to find a fun place to hang for the night.

We are avid Vegas travelers.
We paid extra for an upgraded room here - thought we would try it out as it is one of the only properties we have not stayed in.
The line up upon arrival to check in was INSANE. Yes, Vegas is about crowds, smoke and line ups but there has to be something this hotel can do to speed up the process. Maybe have staff come through the line with a clipboard and some room keys?
Here are some tips about the "UPGRADE" which is said to involve superior amenities.
We paid extra to check into our room right away after getting our keys and the maids were still cleaning it.  Nice, waiting outside our room after long flights with our luggage.
To stay in our non-smoking room is like sucking on a fresh cigarette every second. The smoke comes in through the vents 19 floors down, or through the smoking rooms. Health hazard, I feel like crap now! A maintenance guy came to spray disinfectant that did nothing. How do you combat incessant smoke billowing into your room without wearing a mask?
Do not expect a quiet room anywhere - the walls are paper thin. Our neighbors are lovely.... So. Not. Front desk are indifferent, will tell you to call security.
Satellite TV is so choppy that a half hour show went out about 20 times. The fact that we are not here to watch TV is besides the point. We are paying for the amenities and the problem as per the engineer that just left here is that our room's TV was not pixilated yet, so it is a known issue at least for our room. Not good.
One day we were half dressed just back in from the pool and 4 guys came into our room to look into the TV issue! ??? I asked them if they would have come in here without our being here and they answered yes. Kind of odd, that made us feel a bit uneasy. Our cleaning lady has been ok (keeps forgetting to leave us coffee!) but I met a couple in the elevator from another floor who stated that their maid rifled through their knapsack's bottom and stole $20 in change. Jeez!
We had to call the front desk to ask about the smoke, the TV and to ask for a do not disturb sign for our door.
The casino itself is OK, older but has character and the pizza in the food court, NY style is really good as is the baked ziti and chicken parm. Large portions. Staff at the shops at Flamingo are hit and miss with their personalities.
The TV built into the bathroom mirror is cool and the extra shower jets were neat. The shower did not run out of hot water once.
The location of Flamingo on the strip cannot be beat and that is why many stay here as well as a cheaper stay for those budgeting all their cash for gambling.
Next door to the north, MargaritaVille Casino has just opened up. Right next door to the south, Cromwells Hotel and Casino has opened up and that is a nice space to go and check out to see the type of atmosphere not offered by Flamingo.
For spoiling yourself and luxury, choose Vdara, Encore at Wyynn, Signature at MGM or Aria instead.

I came to Vegas of a conference. My colleague and I are part of a small business and had to pinch pennies anywhere we could, and thus we thought the Flamingo would fit that bill. The online price was very good and the pictures looked fine. I understand that the Flamingo is one of the older hotels on the main drag but still felt it would be acceptable for our situation.

Well my assessment was completelty off. All we really wanted was a hotel close to our conference hotel (Caesars) that had clean rooms and good pricing. The issues started right at check in. We were waiting on the notorious long check in line. The line was long but it was at least moving at a decent clip..... that is until a group of 20 chinese tourists bypassed the cattle call line and went right to the front desk. I am assuming they were part of a group, and perhaps they were allowed to go to that area to check in. Initially they had 2 front desk employees servicing them while three other front desk employees took us "cattle" in the other line. Its at this point all hell broke out. The group leader started to scream and curse at the front desk employees, flailing his arms and causing a huge commotion. His antics went on for 5 minutes or so until security showed up. The leader then disappeared and surfaced 15 minutes later. He then instructed his group to start going to all the front desk employees. The three front desk employees that were actually helping us in the general line would waive us on to the desk but then a member of the group would run up and cut in front of the person. At this time we were now on line for 40+ minutes, the line was not moving at all and people were getting very upset. Not once during this whole ordeal did the front desk explain what was going on, inform us that this was intentional or apologize. The poor security guard was now getting blasted by folks for "allowing" this group to run wild. He advised that the front desk is in charge of who gets serviced and when and that he had no power to prevent them from cutting the line. One of the ladies that was supposed to be "next" finally had enough and politely asked to speak with a manager. She was informed that there wasn't a manager available . It was 9:30AM in the  morning. I found it very rude that a manager couldn't come out and try and keep order in this chaotic scene. A little info would have gone a long way. 

Once we were actually able to check in it was even a bigger hastle. We had booked online and it asked if we had preferences, ie early check in, late check in, smoking, king etc. We selected early check in. No where did we see that it would  be 30 extra dollars for that. We were here for business and had meetings booked from 4pm on. We had just flown across the country , weathered an hour plus check in line and then were told it was going to be an extra charge. I understand if you don't have rooms available, but 30 dollars is absurd. What makes it even more frustrating is that they had rooms available but only if you paid their ransom.

Now the overall rooms were acceptable in terms of decent linens and working plumbing. The actual trek to the rooms was far from adequate. Half of the elevator bays were "out of service" when we arrived. At 10 am in the morning it was a 10 minute or so in order to grab an elevator that wasn't packed to the brim by fellow hotel guests. It was at night that the elevator issue became a nightmare. At 11 PM you had to wait around 35 minutes or so to grab one of the "working elevators". After you disembark the elevator you were greeted to a hallway that made the shining look comforting and cozy. The carpet was all loose and wavy like it has been through some water damage. It should be noted that the wavy carpet and broken elevator wing of the hotel was after we decided to cut our loses and "upgrade" one of our rooms to early check in. We wanted to at least be able to put our bags down and get ready for our meetings. We were told by the front desk employee that was could keep checking in to see if our other room was available before 4pm.  We checked every hour on the hour and finally at 3:30pm we asked if it was ready..... tadah nope it still wasnt ready but if we wanted to pay 30 dollars we could get early check in. At this point it was comical, 30 dollars for 30 minutes of advanced use. The sad part was that they told us to "keep checking" when I feel that they never had any intentions to allow us to check in prior to 4pm. If there were honest we would have ventured outside of the hotel, but since they were deceitful we wasted over 4 hours trying to get my collegues room. 



This just wasn't a great place to stay. I later found out a business client stayed at the Vdera (sort of in back of strip) for the same price, was able to check in early and had full fridge and a furnished kitchen.

Live and learn I suppose. I wont be going back to this hotel any time soon.

Where do I start, don't waste your money and time here. Cheaper than other hotels on the strip but not worth the savings. 

Wait hours in line to check in - no joke. The auto check in didn't work wouldn't scan my ID. others cutting lines, told the manager he just shrugged his shoulders. Half the elevators in the Spa tower don't work so they are crowded. The room was partially updated. The tub and sink are really old and sink barely drains. The AC is a joke in 2 rooms we had. Set on 65 and maybe got to about 80 the whole time. Old crappy horrible service hotel. I'm sure I'm forgetting something but just don't stay at the Flamingo

Scenario 1: We were finally help at the front desk after waiting in line for 47 minutes.
Lady: last name?
Me: well, hello to you too. My last name is ******
[Lady type type type]
Lady: I'll need the credit card you RSVP with.
Me: since you ask so politely, here you go
[Lady type type type]
Lady: Your room # is 21*** just make a right to the spa elevator and it will take you to your room

*No please, no thank you, no enjoy your stay, no manners, no courtesy, basically just a big fat NO.

Scenario 2: We got to our room and both needed to use the bathroom badly but of course ladies first. 5 minute later she walk out to tell me the toilet won't flush. I called down to the front desk but 27 minutes later no one came so I called again.
Me: hi again, this is an emergency how much longer do I have to wait?
Phone: I can't know for sure, its first come first serve and there were a lot of callers ahead of you
Me: so you are telling me I have to lay here in a fetal position until someone is available to repair the toilet?
Phone: we do have a few callers ahead of you
Me: let me speak to your manager
Phone: please hold
[7 minutes later]
Phone: the manager currently step out but I did found out that you are next on the list so someone should be there shortly.

Scenario 3: when we stay at hotel, we have a tendency to order extra pillows for comfort and towels enough to last us for the stay since we don't like housekeeping coming in during that time
Me: hello, could you please have someone deliver 4 set of towels, 4 pillows and 2 blanket
Woman: you're only allow 2 set at a time
Me: 2 set of what?
Woman: 2 set of towels
Me: ....okay.... 2 set of towels for 4 people?
Woman: hotel policy
Me: okay. fine.

*37 minute later someone show up with 2 set of towels and when I ask about our pillows and blanket the guy look confuse. He told us he'll be back so we waited for another 24 minute and only was told they are out of pillow.

Scenario 4: came back to the hotel after a long night out
Valet: sorry we're full
Me: excuse me? What does that mean?
Valet: our valet is full, we can't take your car
Me: umm... But I'm a guest here. 
Valet: are you a diamond or 7 star?
Me: do I look like a galaxy to you? What stars?!
Valet: okay, just pull right up

Don't think i didn't attempt to do self park but that parking structure is a joke. The first 3 level is for valet only and the next few level have at least over a dozen RSVP sign. 

Overall, Flamingo was a big disappointment. You can kiss my business good bye.

Some rooms are renovated others aren't, so there is a large disparity in rooms. Our a\/c didn't work well but our water pressure was fantastic. Cocktail waitresses seem fewer in number than other casinos, and the ones in Margaritaville area do not wear pantyhose like the others; nonetheless their bikini type outfits are still sexy.

Worst Place to stay! Since arriving customer service is horrible. All started with Valet, very rude. Front Desk, not welcoming. Too many Flipping Rules. Can't do this, can't do that. We are in Vegas!! There should be little rules here. Not A Fan of this place. Never staying here again!!

Its very hard for a newbie to know where to stay when coming to vegas. Should i  go strip or off strip, downtown, south, north? There are lots of options regarding housing but only one old school, and thats Flamingo, the first hotel on the Strip. 

Center strip location, to a great price compared to the quality and service you get. Its not tacky neither fancy, its a hotel, perfectly located to discover the rest of vegas. Pool area is BIG and will leave you two choices, either go the party\/music way or the calmer way in the pool upstairs. Pool area is definitely spacey and one of the better ones in Vegas. Also during season in weekends, they offer a light dayparty in the bigger "Party" pool. 

Overall, Vegas is a cheap place to find really fancy hotels, but you dont have to splurge to stay okay. I always go by the classic phrase "Im just gonna sleep at the room". And since i often stay for a week or so, I rather spend my money on other experiences outside the hotel. 

In Vegas I rank location before stylish hotels since location and distance is the vital thing here. So if you dont want to end up spending most of your time walking, stay centre strip!

So disappointed with the  Flamingo Hotel and the way they are treating my son and daughter in law. He is in the military and this is their first chance to have a few days alone without the children in Vegas. They were so excited  about having a Go room overlooking the strip, but they are so upset with the way they have been treated. Their room stinks of smoke, and they were told that they could change it  if the room still smelled after they sprayed it.  Not so, the girl on the desk  denied all knowledge saying no one ever changed rooms for that reason. 
I finally called (I'm the one babysitting and recommended the Flamingo) and spoke to a manager called Josh. He grudgingly offered that they could change their room to a lower floor as he said that they were sold out.
Last time I stayed there, we were upgraded because of the smell of smoke, these days you get downgraded!!!!!

I had an opportunity to stay here for a conference and paid a well-priced rate. So well-priced, in fact, that when I was offered the opportunity to upgrade one category up ("upsold") for $20\/night I took it. This got me a "Go" room with a fridge and coffeemaker. 

The room was lovely! King-sized bed that was super-comfortable, a thermostat that could be adjusted as low as I'd like (important in the land of 110 degree F temperatures), a large bathroom with separate shower and bathtub and a TV built into the mirror. My only gripe was that AT&T mobile reception was poor in my room (no major mobile carrier should have this problem on the Las Vegas Strip ... ). 

This is one of the oldest properties on the strip, and different room categories will almost certainly turn up different experiences. I'd come back. 

Pro-tip: Join Total Rewards even if you don't plan on gambling. You'll be able to check-in on the significantly shorter members line.

Positives:

GREAT location.
Nice room for the price
Clean and comfy rooms\/beds (even though they are small!!)

Negatives:

Rude\/Not helpful workers
Full valet...had to park ourselves and walk far
Long wait to check-in
Lots of old people (me and my friends are in our 20's and didnt know this)


I wouldn't stay there again unless I was super broke. It wasn't worth the bad customer service we experienced. I know other hotels with the same good location for just a LITTLE bit more and a better experience.

In the hotel we were 9 days in July. Our room was beautifully arranged and we had our own patio. In the bathroom with the shower we liked most, which was large and mainly the massage. Our budget hotel and the room was really quiet and the bed in the room was big enough, so we have slept better at home. The hotel staff is very nice. Budget Rent Flamingo is located in downtown Las Vegas offers free wifi which I really appreciated, because we could communicate with our family.

The Flamingo hotel has two big things going for it: location and pricing. I found The Flamingo to be very reasonably priced compared to the other hotels near the center of the strip. The downsides to this hotel is that it does look a little dated compared to the other hotels. This did not bother me too much though, and I don't think it would stop anyone from having a good time here. The only real issue I had was with the old elevators. I had a very bad experience with one of the elevators. The elevator would go towards my floor (20th), then go back down a few floors, bounce between floors for a while (doors never opening), then back up, then eventually stop at the wrong floor... very scary!  I called and told them it needed inspected, I was assured it would be looked at and was give a $30 food and beverage credit. I was very impressed with this service until I got on that same elevator over 10 hours later. There wasn't anything indicating that the elevator shouldn't be ridden, so I assumed it was fixed.  I experienced the same issue again! I called again to let them know, but I'm now thinking the warning was falling on deaf ears. I wouldn't trust those elevators again, and for that reason I would be unlikely to return.

our 1st room was one of the "upgraded" Go rooms.  We had partial view of the bellagio fountain show. Seemed pretty nice. Then we realized the air conditioner wasn't working well. It was Vegas, in August, and our room ran 75-80° at all times. We decided not to complain, we aren't in the room too much anyway. Just slept without blankets. Then the first person, my friend, tried to shower. The shower head shot off like a rocket nearly hitting her. When me and my husband came back from the pool she had just called maintenance. She was told 20-30 minutes. After 30 minutes, she called again. They said someone would be there soon. We had dinner and show reservations. After 90 minutes still no one. My husband attempted to fix it himself. When he turned the water after it seemed okay, he got hit in the chest by this shower head. So we all sucked it up, in our 80° degree room, and got ready, with no showers. After dinner and show we go to the front desk. We spoke with someone then spoke with the front desk manager Patricia 
She told us we had 2 choices. Go to our room and wait until maintenance shows up, and the hotel has no control over maintenance they show up when they want, or we could switch rooms. I really didn't want to pack all my stuff up but I also didn't want to sit around waiting hours for a maintenance person. So we moved. We packed up and had bell hop to our room in under 15 minutes. She didn't tell us she was moving us to a smoking room. It was disgusting. I have bad allergies and asthma. No way I could stay in there. So we called the front desk. They said they had no rooms left. Finally we are told they will move us to a suite with 1 king bed an a pullout couch. Not the 2 Queens we needed but I didn't need breathing issues either. So we agree to move, they said they would send up a bell hop with a room key and a cart for our luggage. 40 minutes goes by.... here comes the same bellhop who helped us earlier, with new room keys, but no luggage cart. Fine, we can drag all our stuff ourselves. To the 3rd room. We get in and while the Go room part looks great, the living room area looks like it hasn't been updated since 1976. The pull out couch, ridiculous. My dog sleeps on a nicer mattress than this. And where is the bedding....no where to be found. Yay, another call to the front desk. They will send some up. After 30 minutes of waiting, I tell my husband to stay in the room, me and my friend are going to the desk. Now the manager won't even come speak to us and is just relaying messages while calling the bell desk and house keeping to corroborate what I am telling her. Luke I am going to lie just for fun and to spend my whole evening dealing with her eye rolling. For the 2 hours and insane amount of inconvenience they gave us a whopping 2 nights resort fee refund. Yes, just the resort fee. A fee for stuff I don't even use on the first place. Finally bedding gets delivered, by maintenance, yes the same maintenance that can't be bothered to fix a shower head. They send housekeeping a little later to make the "bed" but my friend had already done it. She ended up sleeping on the lounge thing they had instead because the couch was insanely bad. Springs popping out and nasty stains. Just terrible. Lucky for us my husband brought his Leatherman tool on this trip. He had to fix several things in this room. The toilet seat was soo loose if you sat too fast you would fall off. The closet door handle was broke and the security latch was falling off of the door. And this is their "suite" I can't imagine that they actually charge people for this room. Next day comes around and we have the do not disturb sign out as we had a late night if spending 2 hours switching rooms. Room service calls at 12 and asks when they can come clean because our sign is out. My husband tells them they can come clean at 2. At 12:55 they call back, and ask again when they can come clean the room. At this point I swear the hotel is just messing with us. I have never had room service calling like this. When we leave, the do not disturb sign had been removed from our door. Suprise suprise. So for the whole resort fee refund we got back, I asked for a late checkout due to a late flight. 11am is too early for an 8pm flight. We get late checkout at 1. But they charged me $40 for it, so they got all their money in the end. Never, I repeate, never stay here. No matter how good the deal, no matter nice those Go rooms with the TV in the bathroom look. If you have any issues you will receive the absolute worst customer service anywhere. I have been treated better by a motel 6. It's hard to believe this is a Caesars resort. I have stayed at many other Caesars properties and received the best treatment until this. Now I recommend mlife resorts all the way. Again, avoid the flamingo at all costs.

The worst experience I've ever had in Las Vegas not clean elevator keeps sucking no signs to help people this is the real worst experience for me I've been going to Vegas a lot every time I visit a new hotel and casino to see which one is the best so far I will never come back here I don't recommend this place

Older hotel but recently renovated. The hallway carpet was filthy the walls were dirty and it was confusing to find our room. The floors in the room looked like they hadn't been cleaned in weeks, the bathroom was dingy and we didn't have glasses in the room. The valet misdirected us at check in, half the parking garage was not for hotel guests and it was a long way to the smoke filled lobby. Not a good value. We asked for glasses and a more thorough cleaning and neither occurred. The housekeeping staff is substandard and whoever runs them is incompetent. We will not be staying here again.

I will definitely be staying here when I go back to Vegas. The pool area is fantastic, although drink prices are a little high, but that's pretty much everywhere in vegas. 
The hotel staff were by far the friendliest and most helpful I have encountered.
Currently parking is a pain because of construction, but just make sure you turn on "Linq Avenue" and you'll find the parking quite easily.
The room was very swanky with fake hard wood floors - so much better than carpet, and floor to ceiling windows.

Beware of valet parking！！They stolen my money!!
we staying here for 2 nights . we valet our car on my first day of stay and pick up on last day. (never get my car out during our stay.)   we clean up the car after we get back to LA and realize all my coins in the car are GONE..... its big amount of coins got stolen by valet parking.....this is serious... Dont leave any valuable thing in the car on this hotel....


Never come back here again!!

Got reply from hotel...Guess what??They dont care if u  got ur belonging stolen from their staff.....BAD BAD BAD......Beware of this .....take everything with u everytime u go out??....this is ridiculous!!!

Do not be lured in to this hotel by its cheap rates and "newly remodeled" room pictures!!  

Maybe some people will call me a hotel snob after reading my review. But when I spend money for a good night of sleep, I want to enjoy my sleep and not worry.
Perhaps I stayed at the 5 stars hotel more then the regular 3 stars one in Vegas, but even a nice motel is better then staying here.

2 1\/2 stars for the room itself. Minus 1\/2 stars for the disgusting, dirty parking structure and it's hallway to the casino. It's filthy and smelly. The Valet parking is totally on the other side of the building away from the casino and the hotel lobby! Kind of a long walk if you're carrying all those luggage.

I hate jumping from hotel to hotel, but since we wanted to extend our stay in Vegas and wanted a more convenient location on the strip, we searched the Internet and thought we got this great deal for a newly remodeled room.

THE ROOMS: 
It's like taking a 1980's hotel room and "renovating" it by cover ups. The rooms are repainted and floors were redone, and new beds. That's only the best part.
They have new vinyl wooden floor, no carpet except a small rug in the walk way. (Which is a good things so it doesn't stink from the 30 year old carpet.. lol)
The furniture as of the table, night light table, and TV stand are all kind of banged up and so ready for a face lift!

The room itself is OK., but the tiny bathroom is where I draw the line. The door hinges and side panels were all old and rusty. They're mildew stain on the corners and white tiles inside the bath tub. It's clean but it's old and it's falling apart. The bathroom floor tiles were black and dingy, guess when they replaced the room's floor, they couldn't budget another 60 square feet of flooring in for bathroom, instead they rather gross out their guests.  They have nearly to none amenities. No slippers, not even coffee maker. Even the Motel 8 down the street has a coffee maker. They have an old wall burnt out hair dryer. I wouldn't risk it, because it looks like it's ready electrocute you when you turn it on.

If they did a remodeled, why didn't they just rip everything apart and replace it back with a everything new, this way, it really looks like they took the easy way out. Cover the stain up but not cleaning it out!! Although it may not be that bad, but thought of it, is kind of disgusting. There is no fan blower in the small tiny bathroom. So if any one have to go #2, make sure you buy a room spray for the bathroom. Without the bathroom fan, even when I take a shower, I have to leave the door with an open airway, or else I would suffocate in the hot steam.

The air conditioning is hell LOUD! If you're a light sleeper, make sure it's off! 
We were in room 7084 and 7086 with a connecting door with old rusted door knob and chain. We had a great view of the strip right in front of the Caesar Palace fountain... It would have been so much prettier if the windows were clean. It was so disgusting and barely can see through the windows for the view.

Would I stay here again?.. probably not unless I was desperate.. The parking structure and valet is very inconvenience. It's only idealistic to stay here if you go out walking from casino to casino. But we don't. We just drive around and when we get back to the Flamingo, we just stay at the hotel\/ casino.

Spent the past weekend at The Flamingo and had an overwhelmingly positive experience! Fun hotel, great location, great price. I would recommend it as a budget option and not hesitate to come back and stay again. The pool was amazing, great vibe, so much fun!

Never again! We were looking forward to sitting by the beautiful pool at the Flamingo, but there were NO chairs and not even any available concrete. We tried several times and just couldn't get a spot. We would have needed ibuprofen had we gotten one because the thumping, loud music was obnoxious. The room was terrible too. Thin, rough sheets, threadbare towels and rock hard pillows. The first room they put us in had a squeaky air conditioner and no ventilation. The second was an upgraded "Go" room but still pretty bad. The front desk people were unhelpful and rude, the service at the restaurant and buffet was bad and pretty much everyone we encountered -- from the poker room to dealers to valets and bell people -- were unpleasant to surly. We will NEVER go back again. There are so many other choices on the Strip. Do yourself a favor and choose one!

It was my first time staying at this hotel. We arrived at the hotel on Saturday morning. Taking the elevator, I walked through and the doors began to close on me. I put my arm to stop the doors but it would not open my boyfriend had to push the other side of the door to help. Later that night we came across a girl that said she got stuck in the elevators. The elevators were shakey when we rode them so i guess we got lucky that we didnt get stuck too. The next day we were getting ready to check out, i was going to jump in the shower around 10am when I realized the water wasn't getting cold. We called down stairs and was told the engineer would come up, by checkout time (11am) nobody came by and I never got to take a shower. Wouldn't stay here again.

funny, with all the negative reviews I see on Yelp, I'm probably the minority that LOVES this place.  it's perfect for location, monorail, price and atmosphere.   The buffet is pretty average, so off better going some where if you want to upgrade, but it works if you're not too picky.  What rules is having a Johnny Rockets in the hotel that's open 24\/7.  The 2 pizza places are okay, but nothing to write home about.

Funny that I've had more success with the Fab Deluxe over the Go Deluxe.  I've had great views of the strip and the most recent time, I had a view of the entire Caesars, Bellagio and Cosmo from the room. The Fab is pretty basic.  You get the usual shower, safe, flat screen and view of the strip.  The one time I had the Go Deluxe, you get the same, but a mini fridge and a real swanky bathroom with a TV in the mirror.  Once was good, but I'd rather have the basics and the view or a lesser price.  The sports book is small, but cozy.

I'd had great deals too.  the last time was off vegas.com where I got 3 nights and a round trip flight on Virgin for $300.
Hotel is run down \/ old. Employee at check-in was passive aggressive nice. The location is central to the strip and ok hotel for sleeping only.

For the casino only:

It's a pleasant enough place.  Sometimes it can get quite noisy and the music is loud.  On the other hand, they do have Spin Poker Deluxe which is the VP I like to play.

It's not the easiest place for locals to go when compared to the easy in and out of the newer places, but when you're going to see Vinnie Favorito or X Burlesque, you come in the back way to the garage and make do.

The Flamingo is, in my opinion,  the last remaining "old school" casino in Vegas. I can picture some dude named Vinny, who may or may not have some nebulous mob ties, sitting behind thick glass counting money, screaming for a cannoli, wearing a luxurious coat of chest hair and sporting a diamond encrusted pinky ring. Initially, i thought i was being a little racist, but then I met Vinny, our pit boss, and I didn't feel quite so racist anymore. 

The casino does exude that old school charm, though. Perhaps some of that charm is attributable to the fact that parts of the hotel just seem...old. Besides the casino, I would assume that most of the hotel has not been remodeled in a while, or if it has been remolded, someone did  a poor job. But, the good thing about the hotel is that it doesn't share most of the newer hotel's modern decorating flair. There is no worse fad for a fat guy then modern decorating. Yea, the super slim all leather chair\/ottoman hybrid is cool...unless you're bigger than a tiny child. Then the seat gets up when you get up, which is decidedly not cool. Also, the price reflects the older status of the hotel, so you can save a few duckets if you're trying to do Vegas on a budget.

Check-in can be a hassle depending on how you choose to do it. We used a debit card, so we had to pay in advance, and give credit\/debit cards for everyone in he room.   The rooms themselves are nothing spectacular. You'll find the bare essentials inside. The cable has a propensity to go out, so in the strange case you come to Vegas to only watch movies, you may be out of luck. While we were there, some guy doing construction across the way severed a power line and the whole hotel was out of power. The issue was not the hotel's fault and was resolved quickly, though. If you plan on going to Vegas and don't mind a slightly older hotel, perhaps you should give the Flamingo a try.

We stayed here because everything else was sold out. I could clearly see semen on one of the pictures frames next to the bed, all dried and crusted. There was hair everywhere, the walls needed paint and there was tons of rust in the shower. Plus to top it all off, they charge for valet ! Never again !

We went to the Flamingo for my daughters dance nationals. We stayed a week. I have to say our room was clean and kinda retro. Bathroom was huge had a TV in the mirror. We had a suite facing the strip and could see the Belagio water show. The kids really liked that. The staff was very helpful and nice. The pool there is a killer hang out. They have water slides and benches in the pool. The down side is they close early for being in the desert. It's hot there. They have a couple good eating places in the hotel. A burger joint and the buffet..

Possibly worst hotel I've stayed at....for sure worst in Vegas.  Rooms are old and tired.  No hot water.  Vinyl flooring and $29 resort fee for Internet.  Looking to check out 4 days early and find a better hotel.

We came to Vegas for spring break and got a plane\/hotel deal. We arrived at 8am and took the taxi to Flamingo. Hoping to check in and wait just a couple of hours to get our rooms so we can rest, the lady at the check-in counter tells us the room won't be ready until 4 pm! That's 8 hours away! Imagine being dead tired from your plane ride while walking around the casino trying to kill time. 

At the end we waited at the Sin City Brewing Co. and slept at the lounge chairs outside until 3:30 came. Basically a whole day went to waste because everyone was too tired to do anything else. They should make the rooms available sooner like other hotels where you can get your room at the latest 2 pm. I mean come on, the check out time is at 11am.. doesn't take too long to clean a damn room for the next guest.

What a joke of a hotel this is. Zero customer service, rude check in staff, dirty room (soiled men's underwear in the drawer) ..I could go on and on. Unfortunately we are stuck her thru Saturday. Let's hope things get better.

I stood at the FlamingHO in April with a group of guys, we got a Go Room Strip View- The room was ok, nice beds nice flat screen TV. The bathroom was weird, the door was like a shadow box thing, it was kinda weird since there was nothing but dudes in the room.

The best part of the room was the Bose Stereo, you can connect your IPOD to this thing and it cranks! We had music blasting all night, never had security or neighbors knock on our door. 

The beds were comfy, I think I would pass out by the end of the night i think I would have been just as comfortable in the shower.

THe Flamingo was ok, I hate their Casino.. HET table game suck, way tooo many 6:5 payouts total BS. Right next door was Oseahs, we played beer pong there, good drink specials and th vibe was prtty awesome met a lot of cool chicks there.  Once again the table games sucked ass. Nothing but 6:5 Tables.

The only thing we ate at the Flamingo was Margaritaville, or however you spell it, drinks were pricey but it's vegas and the nacho chips were really good. If you go get the balcony view, you can drink each the nachos and talk shit about people as you watch them walk the strip. Good Times.

We saw George Wallace while we were there, he is there Star Comedian Act. he sucked cock and balls not worth 90 Bucks.. If you're going to see a show see Vinnie Favorito

The pool is great though, that's the best thing about the FlamingHO. Awesome pool scene.

A lot of hookers who bother you in the late hours, that's a minus or a plus depending what you're looking for.

Overall, Ok hotel would not stay there again because the Table Games at all HET properties suck ass.

Location is perfect, right on the strip! That's why you choose this place. The room was big but it needs a serious cleaning. Beds and pillows was comfortable, very high bed so this might be a problem for short senior guests. Unfortunately the corridor smells disgustingly much of marujana. Would not take my kids here, or any kids of that matter. Nice staff, casino's good. Good hotel if you wanna be close to where the party happens.
We we're robbed while we were sleeping in our room. The door was locked and somehow someone came in. The hotel did nothing to help us. I would never go back to this hotel or recommend it to anyone.

I loved this hotel.  The Flamingo Wedding Chapel coordinated our entire wedding and we stayed there for all 10 days of our wedding and honeymoon.

Although the travel site we used to book our trip was a nightmare and had somehow missed a step between taking our reservation and sending it to the hotel, the woman who checked us in was wonderful.  She apologized (even though it was not the hotel's fault) and eventually found our convoluted reservation.  As an added bonus, she gave us a huge discount on the upgrade we wanted.

The wedding chapel was amazing; they eliminated the stress of planning a wedding and the package prices were very reasonable.  All I had to do was select the music I wanted and hand them my iPod.  The garden where we were married was beautiful; it was secluded and the gazebo was covered in ivy.  Come on!

As for the hotel itself, I really enjoyed my stay.  The Go Room was really nice with some impressive upgrades.  Who doesn't want to watch TV in the bathroom?  Especially when it's inside the mirror?

The casino was great, although we spent a lot of time playing beer pong at O'Shea's and snagging $0.99 margaritas at Bill's Gamblin' Hall & Saloon.

The Flamingo is in a great location (right on the strip) and within walking distance to other major casinos and hotels.

The hotel also has a stop on the metro which makes longer treks much easier.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

I enjoy going to Las Vegas. I have stayed in a select few hotels over the years but the Flamingo is my favourite. 

I think it is important to understand where I am coming from before progressing with this review. First I go to Vegas to have fun. My wife and I enjoy walking the strip and shopping during the day. We enjoy the huge selection of restaurants and clubs. We go to party. I am 41, didn't party much in my youth so we do so a bit now. I don't get wild at home but in Vegas my wife and I relax and let loose. The last time we were there I think we had 2 or 3 beers while standing in line to check in. So with that in mind please take my review as you may. 

From the description above we come to Vegas to have a good time. Not so spend time in our hotel rooms. We do appreciate a nice room with a view and great service is a must. I am just not willing to let some set backs distract from the real reason I am there. For those of you that are going to obsess about the room I would just say what are you doing? Get out of your room! The Flamingo does not have the best rooms. Non-smoking rooms are still smoky at times. This is Vegas, people drink and party and they smoke. While I do not smoke I accept that I have walked into this environment. I think the Flamingo does a great job accommodating their guests.

So rather than go on about the rooms or service I will tell you why I stay at the Flamingo and you can decide for yourselves. First the location is right in the middle of the strip and barring any construction projects it is easy walking distance to just about everything. Second it has history, it is the essentially the last original hotel on the strip. Sure things have changed greatly over the years but you can't help but feel a bit of the history at the Flamingo. Third the pool is amazing. Is it the nicest pool on the strip? Absolutely not but it is a rockin' party pool there is no doubt. It is one of the key reasons we stay there. It doesn't seem to brag about itself but it certainly delivers. Forth my wife and I got married at the Flamingo so there are sentimental reasons we stay there as well. 

At the end of the day it is not the greatest hotel. Having that said we accept that younger people will be loud, drink and stay up late. I accept that there may be loud music on our floor and that we may walk into a cloud of smoke. Vegas is what Vegas is, and it changes almost daily. If you want a great location, and a great pool the Flamingo is amazing with a touch of history to boot! If you want to stay in room and shake your fists at those young people then perhaps stay away...stay away from Vegas as well. This town is all about that so I think some things are a willing sacrifice for myself and my wife. I dont' want to down play service, but lets face facts, if the service staff in Vegas can handle drunk people 24\/7 I cut them some slack. 

So don't shake your fists as those young people, join them! The Flamingo has their shortcomings don't get me wrong, but please don't miss out on the big picture. I have never had a bad experience at the Flamingo and I have been there in the double digits of times. 

Stay at the Flamingo, enjoy!

Stayed mid November here for 3 nights for a wedding. We had a go room on the 26 floor. No doubt it was tacky and could have used some touch up paint here and there but it was decent. The bed was comfortable and everything seemed pretty clean. Didn't care much for the timeshare salespeople hitting you up before you even get to the room. They act like they are gonna help you find your room but instead lead you into a less than straight forward sales pitch. Bad timing on that. The location is as convenient as you could hope for on the strip. The food was just OK, I'd eat over at Caesars Palace instead ( it's gonna be pricey either way). Overall, if I had to come back to Vegas, I would consider staying here again.

Wow! This used to be my favorite place when I came to Vegas. Stayed here a few weeks ago. Very old and tired looking furniture in my room. No more security at the elevators for guest protection. Instead, sales people trying to hook you into buying a time share. Finally, the buffet was just plain bad! Very poor quality of their roast beef, low grade shrimp and snow crab, horrible side dishes that were just plain tasteless. Very sorry condition. Only one bright spot with a caveat. The coffee shop is still as good as ever. Wonderful eggs Benedict, really good steak at a reasonable price, yummy desserts. The problem is that they are opened a vey short time. Something like 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM. Their best place and they limit the hours! What a shame! Still, I really do not want to come back unless I hear they upgrade!

I have stayed at many hotels on the Strip and Flamingo hotel is by far the WORST in term of cleanliness. Recently I checked into Flamingo hotel for the New Year celebration due to its location and availability. I guess when they remodeled the casino, they forgot to do the same thing to their rooms.

When I walked into the room, the stench was horrible (think stale cigar\/weed + old damp furniture + extremely dusty ventilation vent + yucky nasty rug) and everything was so old and outdated, that it looks like something you would see at low cost motel back in the 1980". My friends and I literally said "we paid $500 for this shit"? Since we checked in late on New Year eve and we were tired and thinking we wouldn't be spending that much time in the room anyway, we decided to let it be and go have fun.

Anyway, when we came back to the room at 3 am, the smell got so bad that we couldn't even sleep. We decided to check out and drove home to sleep. While we were driving, I was shaking my head and just couldn't believe that a major casino would let their rooms be that bad. SMH

if i could give this place 0 stars i would. i booked a stay for a weekend when i got here they were unable to find my reservation. I had to pay for the night until they found my reservation and was told they would reimburse me the money for the night once they found my reservation. When i called to get reimbursed they said they wouldn't reimburse my money because "i chose to pay for the night and i chose stay there". i was on the phone with their accounting for hours waited at the front desk for hours and they couldn't find my reservation. after waiting 4 hours yes i decided to pay with the promise that i would be reimbursed. i booked this room 2 months in advance the staff was not helpful and accounting are extremely rude. DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Nothing really good or really bad to say about this place. I only stayed for one night so I didn't get to experience it to the fullest. My sister booked the room through Hotels.com and used her free night here. Checking in was easy and we didn't wait long. The room was OK, we could have upgraded to the newly remodeled rooms for an extra $40 but decided not to. 

If you're on a budget but still want to stay in a nice area of The Strip I'd recommend this place, Bally's and Paris. They are all really close to Caesar's Palace, Bellagio, and the new City Center.

Avoid this hotel at all costs unless you are on a budget and are looking for a convenient place to stay. Check in is terrible. We waited an hour and a half just to get to our room. The line is terribly long. We waited this long to get a smoking room because their nonsmoking rooms weren't available. I was annoyed because I had specifically booked for a non-smoking. I left the hotel with all my items smelling like an ashtray! Though I must say the rooms are modern and pretty. Wish I could have had a better experience. I will not be staying here again unfortunately.

Ah to be very honest I never really been to flamingo in a VERY long while and just visiting the place recreated those memories. I remember having a room which had a wonderful and beautiful view of the High Roller. Another thing I remember was that they had a candy store which when I was younger I would ask my mother for a few ounces of candy there. Many other memories reminded me that they are in a good place on the strip and they had good pricing. The ambiance on the other hand was casual not as much formal and it is a very interesting hotel. Like when I mean interesting I mean it has a lot of history or backstory to it and it was very beautiful just listening to it. My stay there was very enjoyable indeed. It is also a very good place to stay if you like birds. ;))

Great on a budget!  We read all the reviews..Yelp!...Trip Adviser...you name it...so we decided on the GO Room and that I HIGHLY recommend as the other parties in our group did not, they went with the Fab Rooms (one the deluxe aka view of the strip, the others with the regular Fab Room) and were let down.  I'll start with their room reviews then go on to our room - 
Fab Rooms
- They told you on the phone the rooms had wood floors when in actuality had wood looking tile floors. In my opinion I like that better than carpet (which was in ours).  Seems a bit cleaner.
