(I usually stayed at TI or MGM but now I'm switching to PH). After a long day of flying from the midwest I finally got to the hotel and wanted to get settled before we started hitting it. The check in line was long and there were few clerks.

After being called up to the desk I gave the lady my ID and my conf #. She took my ID and went into the back room and disappeared for literally 20 minutes. I became annoyed at this point as my reservation was already paid for so I asked a clerk who wasn't busy to see what the hell was going on but she just gave me a blank stare. 

After waiting 25 minutes at this point the lady returns with some pygmy manager in a cheap suit. He proceeds to meekly tell me they overbooked and asked if I would be willing to stay at another Harrah's property. I told him the only place I'd move to at this point was Caesar's. He said they can offer me a room at Harrah's and they will comp me a buffet. Hahahahaha really dude? Thanks for wasting my time gfy! I told him to give me my room key or give me a refund and I'll call up the MGM. They gave me a room key. I felt like I was stuck at the DMV or something.

The room I booked was a GO suite and there was nothing sweet about it. Stains everywhere, dusty, old dirty furniture, bad smell, and there was nothing new or renovated about it in my opinion. The vibe of the hotel was really lame. We didn't hang out there at all. Not  much of a young crowd and not much action.

This was the first and last time I stayed at the Flamingo.

Only pro: No resort fees.
Cons: Everything else...

If you are into fitness this is not hotel for you. I asked for my room to have a fridge which is $15\/day, my gf & I have special food. So on the phone they wrote that down & when we checked in they said it was ordered. 7 hours later after numerous phones calls that the fridge was literally on the way, turns out they had forgot to even put the order in and ran out :\/. Gym hours are not good, most of equipment down and no AC was working when I was there. Did offer cool towels! 

Then people were screaming in the hall for an hour at 5:30am & we called twice & they never sent anyone up from security. 

Rooms had been upgraded nicely since I stayed 6 years ago but horrible service.

First of all, my receipt says "1 king deluxe". 
I got shoved into a 2 queen bed room. Where it's already suppose to be an "upgrade" with a view of trash and dull buildings. I called and asked front desk, they said it's the right room. 
Secondly, the lamp doesn't work in our room. We pulled the outlet\/wire a bit and it would flicker. We figured the outlet is loose. I called front desk again, and they said they will send someone in an hour to bring up an extra lamp. We left for 5 hours to browse the strip. Came back to the same flickering light. It's 1am now, I called again to complain, they said they'll send someone over right away. Asked for eta, they were not able to provide. I told them I'll call back in an hour. They said it shouldn't take an hour.

I have stayed and the Flamingo a few times, including for a week while on my honeymoon.  I used to think it was one of the best values in town, but they are slipping.

On the plus side, the location is awesome.  Since it was the first hotel on the strip, everything was built around it.  Its central to everything and being close the the Bellagio and Caesars allows you to take advantage of their much nicer resorts without paying to stay their.  The history of the hotel is interesting as well if you can find a tour guide or employee to tell you about it.

That's where it stops.  Harrahs casinos are no longer resort fee free.  They used to campaign against resort fees, but now they are worse that the competition.  M-Life still has a few casinos (Luxor and Excalibur) without wifi.  Flamingo has wifi, but charges you PER DEVICE.  The resort fee is supposed to cover the use of resort amenities like the pool, gym, and wifi.  But, its an additional charge ($13.99) if you connect to the wifi with an additional device.

Flamingo also has a really bad selection of restaurants.  Margaritaville is pretty good, but after that there is nothing worth checking out.  Their show selection is laughable (Donnie and Marie... still) and their gaming areas are subpar.  

If you are looking for a cheap pool party, Flamingo is a decent choice.  If you aren't a twenty-something looking to get drunk at the pool then you will not enjoy the Flamingo.

Finally, if you are staying here, do yourself a favor and pay the extra $20 or so to upgrade to a GO Suite.  These are much newer, higher in the tower, have a decent tv and a fridge.  The standard rooms are beat up and dated.  

Pass on the Flamingo.  Even with the low rates its not worth it.

Slow check in, barely warm shower, poor attempt at modern design makeover, dated infrastructure, dirty rooms, poor selection of restaurants. 

+ Good location, on the monorail line.

Would I stay here again? No

We spent three nights in the Flamingo this year and generally found it to be a great experience.  I was able to book a very low rate ($30 a night), and when we arrived they offered us an upper level upgraded room with a strip view of $30 more.  Usually, I don't take the upgrades, but I also knew that a similar view from any other hotel would be well over $100 (possibly over $200), so I took it.

Anyway, the room was very nice (we were in room 20096 for those looking for a specific recommendation).  My only complaint is the carpet is very worn out and needs to be replaced. The bed was very nice and the bathroom included a tv in the mirror.  Oh the room has a very good sound system, so make sure you bring along a cable to plug in your MP3\/smart phone. 

One of the best features of the Flamingo is the pool.  It is surrounded with palm trees, so if you easily burn (like me) you can enjoy the heat and get some shade.  In the evening, we were thankful for the great location and walked all around the Strip.

Yes, it isn't as fancy or nice as the Bellagio, but if you can snag a good price, it is well worth staying!!

This review is for the casino area only...
Video poker payouts are awful!
Lobby is busy, like the freeway at shift change...
Druids & trolls hanging out by the Race Track betting section...
Meh....I'll stick with downtown, there may be creatures roaming about, but at least their payoffs are better....
Oh, and there are solicitors and massage people hitting you up in the casino...WTF! Geez, at least downtown you have to walk OUT of the hotels to get hit up for stuff.....
On a slightly positive note, the "Carlos & Charlie's Mexican restaurant is good...
Bugsy Siegel would be flipping over in his grave if he knew what has become of his beloved Flamingo....So sad, too bad...
Flamingo, please use this as constructive criticism, Tune up your machines a bit, police the OTB section better, and kick the "approved" solicitors out of your casino....

So I just checked out of the flamgo,I had 3 rooms in my name. I found out at the checkout I had to pay $600 in "taxes" in total for the 3 rooms. I then went up to the gentleman who was helping me and basically said I'm not coming to this place again because of the hidden fees,this is ridiculous
 He then agreed with me and said I would not stay here either....great PR..on top of that my rooms lights did not work,there was no shower curtain and you had to shove the door with your shoulder .. I did not complain about these things because I was barley in my room so it didn't really bother me.. There is a group of 50 of us who come to Vegas every year this place just made $10,000 off of our group in hidden fees at our checkout.safe to say I will never be coming to the flamingo again,

Staff was friendly but a little didtsy. Very very very slow very slow front desk. . My room was on the 8th floor. OMG. Its was like staying at a clean Sanford Arms. Clean but old. Was not happy. Food court sucks. Luckily its in the middle of the strip. Took 9 years to get a drink. The cashier at Magaritaville  store on I think Sunday night at 11pm almost kicked me out n didnt want to be bothered. I dont recommend this casino unless its free or at a way low discount  just to sleep.  Damm, and I was really looking forward to this historic joint.

Good location at an affordable price. Its not the nicest place I've stayed on the strip, but it is smack dab in the middle, right across from Caesar's Palace and the Bellagio. 

My only gripe: it took them 1.5+ hrs to bring me a shower cap!! :(

Me and my husband went for a mini valentines getaway.  We arrived at the Flamingo around 9pm the line was a bit long it must have been  20 minutes wait. However the long wait is so worth it.  I ask the guy if they can give us a  'good room' , he said just a moment i will ask my manager. After about 3 minutes he came out and said the manager approved to upgrade our room to a mini suite at the 27th floor. We paid about $38 per night for a mini suite.  Its awesome!!

The room has a classic look, old furnitures, old TV, king size bed with old white headboard. Big  bathroom with a tub. A vanity mirror , and nice toiletries.
There is a big living room with classic furnitures and carpet that is so 70's i felt like im living in a different generation.The view of our room is the pool area and the newer tower that is pink. The place is massive and it is such a wonderful experience.  Thank you Flamingo for the upgrade you made us very very happy.  I will definitely go back to your hotel.

Stayed here at least 10 times and went away pleased every time.  They've done a good job of updating over the past few years and they are in the heart of the strip.  Poker room is inadequate at best, but Ceasar's is another Harrah's property across the street and their poker room is great, and Bellagio is right next to that, which has a great one too.

I honestly enjoyed my stay here. 
Docked one star because there was not fridge in our room and the bathroom curtain smelled bad. 

The check in process was super easy- didn't have to wait in that long like because we used the express self service check in. The room was nice and spacious and the beds were comfy. I would def. stay here again. It's also right in the middle of the strip which is awesome.

Me and my husband came here on Saturday to shoot a wedding that was happening at the chapel.  I don't even know where to start, I'm so appalled by this place.  You can't even find the entrance for parking to this place it's so ridiculous, and when you do, if you go to valet, you wait forever, forever like, I applied my powder, bronzer, a little more powder, eyebrows AND eyelashes on in the time it took, and we still sat a bit after I was done.  Upon entering the place it was refreshing to see the cute new interior that included pink striped wall paper.  We made our way up to the lobby, and found our way to the bank of elevators where there were 10-15 people waiting, there were at least 10 elevators so it surprised me that people were waiting.  One of the elevators was out of order, I'm assuming, as it had a wet floor sign in front of it and the door was opened.  When we FINALLY were able to catch an elevator we realized that there was no sensor in the doors that opened it automatically when someone stuck their hand between the doors, that's fuckin dangerous, say I didn't know that and I tried to catch the elevator by slipping in and it totally closed on me and my pregnant ass! When inside the elevator it MOVES a few inches when the doors open to floors, it'll drop a couple of inches.  Since the elevators take so damn long so many people will pile in uncomfortably and people use their survivor tactics to catch an elevator and get off.  We only had to go to the 5th floor which was great, but guess what, if you don't push the button before you get there, you have to go with everyone all the way up to their floor and then all the way down picking people up until you get to the 5th floor, fuckin ridiculous.  When we got to the 5th floor we got out and looked down at the carpet and it's all lifted up and wrinkled, it's dangerous, someone could trip and fall.  The room wasn't too bad, it was a cute little suite with a very clean bed with white sheets and a comforter, the couches were cute but didn't seem to match the theme of the hotel, as they were striped red, gold, and black.  The carpet in the room, however was't wrinkled like the hallways, which was nice.  

After getting ready, waiting for an elevator, and making our way through the hotel and outside to the chapel we quickly realized where much of their money was going, and that was to their beautiful chapel.  Everything about their chapel was gorgeous! Everything around their chapel smelled like bird poop and stagnant water. 

Also, did I mention I took the stairs from the 5th floor? As we were running out of light to photograph the wedding party, I led the charge to take the stairs since the elevators were taking so long.  Their stairwell was disgusting, if they aren't going to put money into fixing their elevators or making them more efficient then they should probably use that money for the stairwell and create a stairwell that leads directly to the lobby, because the one we took lead to a door outside of the hotel into the street.  At some point going down an employee opened one of the doors and told us we were at the 3rd story, and that we couldn't go into that door because it was an employee door, or something like that, so we went all the way down to the street.

Don't come here, stick to one of the bigger hotels on the strip, there are much safer, nicer hotels  who you can find much more easily and who also charge the same rates.

Stayed at flamingo for 2 days 1 night, the rooms were great nice, comfortable and cozy. The bathrooms were clean. However we had two rooms our was very clean and the other one for our family...not so much! After a long drive in, my brother lifted the sheets to lie down and both beds had hair...gross!!!!! Okay so mistakes happen but we called front desk and housekeeping 5 times and no one came to help! So we grabbed a random cleaning lady and requested to get new sheets and then after waiting an hour they finally got new sheets. Other than that staff was helpful with directions and questions but other people staying there we grumpy as can be! For $264\/night I expected better service but oh well! Definitely wouldn't mind staying here again as the last option but will look for better options first

I recently stayed in a "Go" room. Sweet!!! Staff was wonderful. Especially the cleaning crew on the 19th floor. Room was facing the strip and the view was breathtaking!!! Room was super clean and the bed was super comfortable. Highly recommend the "Go" room. Saw somebody in the next row win $1,450 on the Wicked Winning machine. Donny and Marie show I saw two years ago is fun filled and great for all ages. Saw Celine this time, just across the street. If you're a winner; treat yourself at Ruth's Chris steakhouse at Harrahs. Pricey; but we all enjoyed it(-:

Not as good ventilation as the other casinos on the strip. The smell of cigarette smoke is more prominent here than at other casinos on the strip, so if you are sensitive to cigarette smoke, stay away! Came here for the wildlife habitat, which was okay. Only okay. They have a decent food court with a Johnny Rocket's. The parking garage is small, confusing, and not labeled. Parking is poor, which is not fun when you combine poor parking with people who have had a little too much to drink. The elevators also weren't working. 

Not gonna lie, I did enjoy the vintage interior and decor.

Older room with outdated fixtures. Clean rooms and nice casino. The elevators were slow and some of the safety sensors were not working and crushed my stroller which had my 2 yo daughter. The restaurants were good. For the price the place was fine minus the elevator issues.

I've been here a few times and my last visit will be my last.  My theory is that the recession has meant that they've cut back their staff to the bare bare minimum, meanwhile they still give away cheap\/free rooms to get people to the hotel to pull in the gambling cash.  So much less staff, about the same amount of guests.

Anyways i arrived at noon.  My room wasn't available until well after 9.  First they told me to come back at 5pm (which i was fine with), then they told me 6, then when i came back at 6 they said they didn't know.  Finally at about 9:30 my room was ready.  It seemed like one maid was cleaning the whole building.

Anyways the nicely renovated (a few years ago) GO! rooms bring this place up to two stars, but in a city with an abundance of rooms I'm not going to spend half a day waiting to check-in.  I'll just go elsewhere.

I have been to Vegas over 30+ times so I think I know what to expect.  The staff are rude, it smells of Pot, the food service at Cafe Breeze or Breeze Cafe was super slow, over an hour.  The rooms need serious updating, the layout is irritating...but most of all....the Rudeness.  I have stayed Everywhere but here...now I know.  Don't waste your money..spend a few bucks more and stay at the Monte Carlo, MGM...$75 a night vs.  $100 on a special deal...don't worry about the $25, it will be worth to go somewhere else.  It is unfortunate that the Flamingo has lost it's sparkle.  If you have no money stay at Excalibur or something.  Best bet I found is to go to Expedia put in 4 or 5 star and take your chances...I ended up staying at the Aria for $117 night!!!  Yes it's more money, but you're paying for things to be working, staff to be courteous, things to smell good, etc.  I will never stay at the Flamingo again.

Terrible hotel. Very old and dated. Service is very poor. 3 calls for a television remote,  No do not disturb sign in room so called for one.  I was told one would be placed on my door.  The next day, housekeeping walks into the room while im in bed. Why, no do not disturb sign on door.  I love staying at the Paris and wanted to venture out and try another property.  I am sad to say i regret picking the Flamingo
Like this hotel. They have pet stay room and it is not smelling!  Staff very friendly and pool is great!

When I first got to flamingo hotel my sister and I went to Check in a one of the self check in\/out kiosks my sister tried checking in and it say our room wasn't ready so we had to wait we waited until we asked one of the workers there and told him our problem he went to check it out and told us it was his fault that our room was not ready because he was trying to give us a nicer room which was bs cause our room suck!! The bathroom sink was broken the water would not go down ..  on top of that we had to walk hella far just to get to our hotel room our view sucks !

I give 3 stars because great pool, casino and you are at the Link and the middle of strips. BUT.....I would not waste your money on the buffet, the cost of it is not worth it, and the food is just ok there is better ones around. (Price is $19.99 - $25.99) and for being newly remodel, I'm not impress, holes the the wall, rust on door frames, only one outlet and the wooden floor are nice and different but while sleeping or when up the bed move to much. I toss and turns a lot and the bed moves with out carpet and the elevators are a problem also, 1 or 2 (out of 6) were always broken, and even when all were running still they were slow and lines of people were waiting to use it.

I have been to Las Vegas twice before this visit.  Each time I have stayed at Bally's.  Last year, I noticed the significant age difference between the crowd at Bally's and the crowd at the Flamingo.  So this year, I thought, hey wouldn't it be cool to stay at the Flamingo where there seems to be a party going on 24\/7?  Right about the party, wrong about the rooms.

The rooms were below average and quite frankly disgusting.  My boyfriend insisted on a smoking room, so I don't know if that makes a different in the nastiness grade.  The first thing I noticed was the blanket on the end of the bed.  I turned it over to search for bed bugs and found a crusty, questionable, white stain.  Gross.  Next, I inspected the couch by the window.  It was covered in cigarette ashes, so I turned the cushion over and was still grossed out by all the debris under the seat.  

The bathroom looked like it had taken me back in a time machine to 1975.  The newest item in the bathroom was the dinky hair dryer.  The light fixtures were missing pieces out of them and the caulking looked like the original.  

On a positive note, the pools were nice, but packed full.  The grounds around the hotel are beautifully landscaped with a flamingo habitat and a duck pond with koi fish.  They also have a Macaw parrot that is cool.


All in all, it was an fun place to play, but not an ok play to stay.  I will continue with Bally's which is much nicer.

We came here to hang out prior to the Legends show and sat at the bar to play video poker. All of the dealers and casino workers were friendly. We played three card and also enjoyed the chance wheel. The flamingo casino is a great place to gamble, dine, and shop.

Old, run down, a novel stay, but not worth the money. I got a king deluxe suite. Spacious. Nice bed. Large seating area. Horrible cable reception. Bad food.

Yeah it's been around for a while and is sort of a grand daddy of hotels, but it's not been well kept over the years. 

Cheap, decent, close enough to the strip. Other than that, I doubt I'll return.

The main reason I give this hotel 2 stars instead of 1 is because of the location. It is central to most of the nicer hotels and casinos on the strip. If you are looking for a nice hotel to stay at I would not recommend the Flamingo. The casino is one of the smokier ones and the staff is not friendly. The rooms, elevator, and hallway floors are dirty and have either spilled beer or vomit?
In the Showcase at The Flamingo, watching George Wallace. The building is a little dated. The poker table has live girls dancing on tables!

We had tickets for the Donny and Marie show at the Flamingo so we booked a room for 3 nights here. After checking in and walking the pool area we knew we had made a mistake. It's in a great location on the strip but the hotel is in bad shape. The bathroom had a nice counter but the cabinet and flooring were dirty and old. The other furniture was also  in bad shape. The bed was clean thankfully! Waking through the casino area was so stinky and I dreaded that every day. We walked through other casinos and didn't feel the same way.

I guess if cost is the most important and you are aware, this is a good choice but if you like your stay to be a little cleaner and classy, look for another place. Our uber driver recommends Mandalay Bay.

I stayed here last summer when I was in Vegas.  The rooms are pretty standard.  We opted not to spend the extra for the Go Rooms, which I heard are pretty sweet.

We did have a problem because we requested a non-smoking room, which was got, but it still REEKED of cigarettes.  I cannot stand the smell of smoke, and I am used to a city where smoking is banned pretty much everywhere (thank you Bloomberg).  We went downstairs and asked for another room, which they gave us, but basically said that they cannot keep people from smoking in the non-smoking rooms, so there is a chance they may all smell like that.  Wonderful.  Luckily, the room smelled pretty clean.

Had no problem with the cleanliness overall.  It is not a new hotel, which I knew, so I thought it was pretty good.

The over 21 pool is great, and I was surprised that there were a lot more people my age than I had been told going in.  The all-ages pool, while great, is in the shade most of the day, so that kinda stunk if you wanted to lay out.

Restaurants are ehh.  I don't really mind going elsewhere to eat though.  I don't gamble, so can't say much in the way of that.

The best thing about the hotel is by far the location.  Center strip.  I don't think any hotel has a better location than the Flamingo.  We walked everywhere.

Random side note, we came in from the pool one day and there was music playing in the lobby...a lot of the staff was dancing in the lobby to the Cha Cha Slide and a few other dances they may have made up.  It was pretty funny\/entertaining.

Actually going back to Vegas this year and we were planning on staying here again, but I got a deal through work at the Mirage, so staying there mostly because there are more people my age and everyone we met last year was staying at the Mirage.  Otherwise, not a bad deal and a lot cheaper than the newer hotels.

It was okay, nice garden, pool, wedding ceremony was cute. But our family stayed on the same floor and we all found a roach in all of our rooms. So it was gross and we had a leaky bath tub that wouldn't stop. But that's about it.
Great location and value. It's clean. Not a luxury hotel in the least but it was a great place to stay for a week.

I decided to stay here for a wedding in vegas. I booked a deluxe room and got upgraded on arrival to a premium new room. The room was very nice. Two beds, two tv"s one in the bathroom.  The place was clean  and new. Had a refrigerator and ipod hookups. I would stay here again. The only thing I disliked is the 10$ fee to get in the sauna.  I think resort fee should cover that, the sauna was a little outdated not worth the extra $ but staff in the other hand was  awesome!! I will come bk to this hotel

Really Beautiful Hotel!!!

5\/5 because despite being busy, they are able to answer my calls and needs. Only problems are I pressed my floor (23) in the elevator and it took me to 26 and when I pressed 23 before the door closed, it opened and I literally could not get off the 26th floor plus the tiles in the bathroom were nasty. But above all, this hotel deserves 5 stars for its location and efficiency

We got what we expected. We stayed Wednesday night thru Saturday for on average $100\/room if you include the daily resort fees. Definitely one of the more affordable hotels including that Friday night. Most places were asking $225+ just for that night before the additional resort fees.

The location is perfect, right in the middle of the strip. Unfortunately, because we were right in the middle of the strip, we were equal distances from two different Walgreen's that were about a 20 minute walk each way north and south. Our option for soda was a $3 cup at the pizza place in the lobby or a $6 two-liter at their convenience store. I know what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas, but how did no one tell anyone else about these awful prices?!

The rooms were okay. Some of our outlets had exposed wires, the bathroom door lock button was missing it's cover, but nothing too end of the world. We had a pretty poor view for the cheapest room but another couple stayed with us and their view was much more pleasing to the eye. Luck of the draw, I guess.

We signed up for the buffets for one day. This was probably the best part. We had breakfast at the Flamingo itself overlooking their zoo area filled with live flamingos, other birds, and some huge fish in the waters. That was a picturesque way to start the day.

Nothing particularly bad about this hotel. No legendary tales either. Since this was our first time in Vegas, we spent most of the time walking around the city. 

Next time, we'll likely pay the extra $30-$40\/night and stay at the Paris. We walked through there and it was much cooler (literally, must have been 72 degrees compared to 78 at the Flamingo), felt like it had a larger casino, and their 'Streets of Paris' themed mall was incredible to walk through.

Very bad experience, I regret booking this hotel. Not luxurious at all. Not like in pictures. And Customer service was rude and manager Shaun Lawson and front desk associate Teddy stood there and laughed at me to my face and also when I turned around were laughing behind my back. 
I am appalled with this treatment. 

I came to Vegas for thanksgiving\/ my birthday weekend. I cancelled other reservations to stay at this hotel because the pictures and location looked great. I seriously regret staying here. My entire birthday celebration was ruined! 

Upon arrival, valet was full and unclear where to go and where to wait. 

I reserved a standard GO room, but upon arrival was placed into a handicapped room with a hospital bathroom. Very cold and gross.

I called to request a blanket and they ran out. The pillows were pieces of foam, I called to request soft pillows, they brought me another set of foam pillows and I was told this is my only pillow option. So no good pillows and no blankets, and they still want to charge me $33 resort fee, even though I received no amenities. 

I had to sleep on the hard pillows and woke up with a bad back and now need to go see a chiropractor.

I went downstairs to speak with someone about my bad experience with the pillows and hope that they would help me out and make my stay better. I explained that all I want was some good pillows and blankets. The manager (Shaun) had nothing to offer and laughed at my request. He said he would look into it but he never followed through and never called me. I inquired about transferring me to another one of their properties, and shaun told me they would not and that other properties have the same type of pillows. This is a lie. Shaun the manager lied to me. I had called other properties and specifically asked if they have feather down pillows, and they have them. 

I don't even know if they waived my resort fee but I had to go out and buy my own pillow for $70 because the manager Shaun did not cAre at all about my request. How hard is it to get me a good pillow! How hard is it to make the customer happy? Terrible customer service. I have never stayed at such a terrible hotel in Vegas. Even some 3 star hotels have better amenities and customer service. 

I will be escalating this to Total rewards corporation and to the BBB.

Just returned from Vegas.  REGRET my decision to stay at Flamingo.  Someone talked me into it and said that the pool and the newly remodeled rooms are such a great deal.  Wrong!
The Go-room we had, in supposedly new section in the Habitat was horrible.  Floors were dirty, the room smelled like pot and the air\/fan did not work.  We contacted the hotel front two times, once in person the same day we got there and the girl said she would have a manager call me on my cell phone since there was not one available and we were on our way out.  The second call was a day before we were leaving.  The stuffiness and smell were especially bad that day.  No one ever addressed our concern.  No one ever attempted to make it right when checking out either.  I am not used to dealing with hotels like this, I'm used to hotels bending over backwards to make you happy.  I am really shocked at their lack of concern.  I would be hard pressed to stay here again, they'd have to really assure me of great accommodations.

I will say also that the GoPool is very pretty.  It would be SO much better if they kept it clean though.  If you are swimming in the pool and look under the day beds that are all over they are packed with garbage (empty cans\/bottles etc.) underneath them.  The pool closes at 5 PM daily.  They have plenty of time to clean up.  Out of the four service girls waiting on guests only two of them smiled and were friendly.  I never seen such slow, lazy girls!   

The Flamingo has a lot of work to do.  It would be awful to see this historical hotel go out of business due to poor management.

Holy moly! Wow this was the worst hotel ive stayed in for a while. And for the amount paid it was sooooo not worth it to be on the strip. We got there and the people were annoyed to speak with us. Then they charge you an extra 30 dollars a day for breakfast and wifi niether of which were good. When we got to out hotel room, there were holes in the complety white and unappealing sheets, our sink was stopped up, there was mold on the ceiling and you had to run the water for 10 mins for it to get hot.

We had a terrible view. We saw the top of some hotels and the side of the lync hotel. We had to walk what felt like miles to get there. If they give you a room in the habitat tell them you are not and animal and you want one closer cuz that was an insane walk!! 

Then on top of all this they charged us 20 dollars so that we could check in early. Not impressed at all and will not be returning ever!

I'm giving this place 5 stars not because it's all glitzy and glamorous (which it's really not) but because of its location, comfort, champagne brunch and the awesome time we had staying here. Our group had two rooms that were connected by a door so it felt like one big space. You can't beat the location and the price was very reasonable. It's kind of old, but that really didn't matter. The people were nice and the flamingos, fish and penguins outside were neat to see. Gambling was good (my boyfriend cashed in on roulette) and our entire group (of 8+) agreed that it was a good alternative because of its moderate price and location.

Awesome place.

Stayed here over NASCAR weekend back in March...not that I knew it was NASCAR weekend at the time...

Stayed in a GO Room on the 18th floor. While I didn't have a Strip View, I had a view of the pool and habitat areas, which was equally as good. Got a deal on it too...around $86.50 avg\/night with my Total Rewards discount! It didn't have a tub as I was hoping but those seem to be a dime a dozen...sometimes you get one, most of the time you don't.

Arrived at around 2pm on a Thursday and check-in didn't take all that long, maybe like 20 minutes. They also have automated machines at the front desk if you're looking to avoid the lines. I did see some long lines at the front desk at certain times of the day though.

Enjoyed the vibe of the hotel and the casino...even if the slot machines were tight as hell. Thankfully, you can access the Strip from the casino in less than 5 minutes, and wonderful joints such as O'Shea's and Harrah's were very very close. It's also connected to the Monorail if you're looking to head to MGM Grand or casinos located further north.

Everything you need under one roof, definitely. I also recommend Margaritaville and Burger Joint if you're looking for some eats, but there's a lot of other joints... like LA Subs, Johnny Rockets, and the Buffet (which I didn't get to try this time around.)

Loved the bartenders over at Bugsy's Bar. They were pretty heavy-handed with the booze and kept the drinks coming while playing VP. Was a great spot to just chill, smoke, and lose a little cash.

They need to fix the elevators in the parking garage though. I swear, they must've been as old as the hotel. I was heading back to my rental on the 6th floor one day and the lights just went out...like hell.
The casino is clearly in need of an update. It's very old and out of date. The staff was not friendly at all and were pretty rude at the craps tables.

I think I was seriously kind and very generous by formerly giving the Flamingo two stars, as of right now writing this...I am still fuming. 

Basically the flamingo destroyed my would be wonderful visit to Las Vegas. Lets start at the beginning (hold on to your hats this is going to be a long one). Parking is a nightmare, they're "remodeling" and self park was literally full up to the roof top parking, frustrated as shit, I decided to valet. 

Check in was horrendous five people working the front desk at four thirty pm when check in is at four. Seriously? Someone here is being stupid...pretty much took an hour to get to the front. The woman who was helping me was monotone and rude, her tone was extremely condescending. I felt like an intruder instead of a guest. 

The room I booked, a king go deluxe with strip view was sold out. They offered the pet stay king go room I said okay. The room smelled like dog pee, and my "strip view" was looking straight into someone's hotel room this is NOT what I paid extra for. In a rage I stormed back down to the front desk and demanded not only explanation but a room change as well. They irritated me so much I told them to cancel my third night (I ended up staying at Luxor and had a much better experience). 

So they moved me to a double queen strip view, but begrudgingly and told me to come the next day from 11-1 to change rooms for a king (foreshadowing). The view was nice ill give them that, the right side of the room had a familiar stench, I couldn't quite figure it out until I noticed the large stain on the floor next to the bed. Silly me, it was the smell of throw up! I was tired of being a bitch and didn't want to change rooms yet again so I slept on the left side of the bed. 

I woke up bright and early (11)and requested a room switch, unfortunately they wouldn't have a room until 1. Okay, I go gamble and return at 245....the room still isn't ready! The anger was boiling inside me, how incompetent can this hotel be? A mix of angry words and frustrations later they offered me a room on the 28th floor but instead of strip view, I would be looking at the bellagio fountains. Excellent. 

My room is nudged in the corner between THREE staff only doors that kept opening and closing all night. The bathroom had no curtain and no step so when I showered the whole bathroom flooded and with wet feet I stepped onto the carpet in my room. Infuriating. The morning of checkout I ewas rudely awoken at 8 AM by construction above my head and across my room. 

Enough is enough I packed my shit and left pissed as hell. No one offered an upgrade, refund, or anything to help mend the situation when I was visibly angry. I will never stay at the Flamingo again, such a shame because its a wonderful peice of Las Vegas history.

Best Value on the Strip!!! Great location! Great staff! Great room (Go Room 26084)! On the 26th floor (only 28 floors) with a great view of Bellagio fountains and Cesar's Palace with Rio and Palms in the background. Refrigerator in room! Comfortable, I mean super comfortable with soft pillows! A lot of game tables with $5 minimum! I won $125 on Craps and it was my first time. If you are traveling as a couple, stay here in a Go Room. You will not be disappointed. If this hotel was in San Diego or LA everyone would be talking how chic and modern this hotel is, but instead they compare it to the Cosmopolitan or a super new expensive hotel. This hotel is  worth more than what you pay. Every time I go to Vegas, it will be at the Flamingo because if it ain't broke, why fix it. (Not literally though, because they are actually doing some construction which is not even an issue cause the only thing I saw was a back emergency exit taped off by the restroom near the buffet.)
1. Stay at the Flamingo
2. Sign up for "Total Rewards" on Flamingo website
3. Fly to Vegas on Southwest Airlines super cheap, bags fly free
4. Look up "Las Vegas Guest List" on Yelp! and register to sign on Chris Hornak's guest list which is free to get in free to the hottest clubs in Vegas (check out my review on him for details)
5. If you don't do #4, your an idiot! I got into Pure, Tryst, and XS. 

More about Flamingo ...
Buffet is good $20-$25 lunch dinner
Food court has Johnny rocket, Chinese (don't recommend), sub sandwich place, and a pizza place which I recommend the BBQ Chicken pizza. 
There is a convenient store (sells bandaids) and wine&spirits which sells alcohol for same as Walgreens down the street. Looking at $4 for a 24 ounce talk can. 
Also always buy the cheapest seats for Vegas shows because the venues are so small that 9 out of 10 times there is not a bad seat in the house. In fact a lot of the shows don't sell out so they end up moving everyone up anyways.
The Flamingo pool is beautiful. 
A taxi trip to either end of the strip from Flamingo is $10.

If you have any questions about anything I mentioned you can message me!

i usually enjoy staying at this hotel but this last trip was horrible. we arrived on 5\/20\/15 6pm long check in line. the woman who checked us in was pretty nice. our room was on the 27th floor pretty good view. second day we were there we were trying to relax a little bit and kept hearing a super loud jack hammer. apparently they were doing construction 1 or 2 floors above us. did they bother letting us know that this would be going on? no of course not. i called down to the front desk and spoke with a really unprofessional person named Elaine. i told her what was going on and she  told me that it would stop at 4:10 pm she also stated she didn't have any more rooms available to move us.. i said ok fine. 5:00 rolls by and still construction going on. i had enough i went down to the hotel check in and got a nice gentlemen forgot his name but it said on his id tag he was a manager. told him what was going on and how Elaine was super rude and not willing to help. he gave us a new room with no issues.we were moved to the other side of the hotel on the 22nd floor.  now that we are back im having some billing issues that aren't be addressed. i noticed that the room rates changed so i called in to get the current price which was a 30.08 difference but hey it helps. long story short the woman i spoke with on the phone about this in there billing dept is pretty much saying i didn't call in to get it changed even though i have email confirmation she said i can alter an email??? really lady so now im being called a liar. never staying here again. beware of there billing and customer service.

You cannot beat the location of this hotel right smack in the heart of the strip. There are many negative reviews so if you are thinking about staying here just know it is not an upscale hotel. If you are the type who needs to be catered to and need everything perfect this place isn't for you! Also I think its hit or miss with the room you get because we had a very nice clean  updated room (except for the dirty TV remote in bathroom...yuck!) We had  a strip view which was real nice. No overwhelming smells that some people complained of. The bed was very comfortable. There was a mini fridge in the room too. Also we had no issues with the elevators. There was however  always an unbelievable long line of people waiting to check in but we were fortunate and we did not have to wait on that line (I think I would have been extremely angry if I had to wait on that line!) We did not go to the pool but we could see it was very very  crowded. There is a food court that has pizza, chinese, johhny rockets and a nathans. There were two  places to grab coffee, donuts, croissants etc. Restaurants included a buffet,  mexican restaurant, Margaritaville and a steakhouse. Donny and Marie are the main headliners and if you want to see pure talent this show is a must. The location is perfect! Right smack in the middle of the strip so it's perfect to walk to everything.

This summer, my partner and I went to Las Vegas.  We decided on the Flamingo, as it was within our budget, and we heard good things about it. The worst thing we heard about it was that it was an older hotel, but old doesn't necessarily mean bad, so based on reviews and personal recommendations (a few of my co-workers recommended it), we went with the Flamingo.

Well, I do not recommend it, and unless I get a super cheap deal, I would not stay here again. 

First, the room was quite big (unnecessarily large, actually), but there was very little light! The only lights, aside from the bathroom light, were three lamps--two bedside lamps and one lamp on a desk.  Not enough for a room that large, and the lamps were too far away to give any light by the entrance. 

At the entrance of the room by the door, there were full length mirrors (points for that), but because there was no light, they were useless. Whoever designed the room was a fucking moron. 

Second, if you were charging your phone, you couldn't access it while in bed. The outlets were too far away from the bed to allow you to plug in your phone and place them on the bedside tables. Very annoying if you wanted to quickly check the time or your email. This may seem like a minor thing, but it irritated both of us. Poor room design. 

Third, there was no hot water. Lukewarm, not quite hot water, yes, but no hot water.  I did not have one refreshing, enjoyable shower while in Vegas. 

Fourth, I could hear the people in the next room. (Sounded like a bachelorette party or girls' vacation. Ugh.)  Quietness is my number one priority in hotels, and this hotel didn't cut it. However, I wasn't bothered by external noise, which I was concerned about.  (I was afraid of hearing noise from the casino or concerts.) 

Fifth, the elevators were terrible. They were slow, and not adequate for a hotel of that size.  Sometimes you'd be waiting nearly ten minutes for one! 

Lastly, the wifi sucked. It kept cutting out and was very unreliable.  It is "free" (although you pay a pretty high daily "resort fee"), but I was charged for one day of wifi, but luckily it was easy to get the charged removed.  (Always check your bill!)

Is the Flamingo the worst hotel ever? No.  But it's not good enough for me to go back when there are so many other hotels to choose from, and I don't recommend it.

This was our first trip ever to Las Vegas (20 years in the making). Just return  from two nights at the Flamingo. Everytime we left our room we where harass by time share people.  Be prepared  to wait a long time for the unsafe elevators. The doors don't completely close. We got stuck twice in them.  Paid way to much for a room with a view of a roof, holes in the shower, dusty vents and no coffee. The room didn't have any information about the hotel, let alone tell you to bring your ID to the pool (more waiting for the elevators).  The breakfast buffet cost more then it's worth.

Honestly, the location is the only thing that's good about this hotel. The rooms are awful! The first room that they put us in smelled of urine and then the next one they put us in was dingy. They told us that we could upgrade for $25 a night to a smaller room but that was all they have offered. I still have two more nights to stay here and if I had some extra cash I would stay someplace else but I'm stuck at this dump. Even the walls and doors are dirty. I have stayed at many hotels on the strip And this by far is the worst. I will not be coming back here.

We really enjoyed our stay here. We were in a Fab room on the 4th floor which was nicely renovated except for the bathroom. The bed was really comfortable, in-room thermostat helped control the temp, and it was very spacious. They did a laminate wood flooring that made it much nicer than old carpet. The bathroom definitely left a little to be desired, so if a fancy bathroom is important to you, go elsewhere (or maybe another upgraded room). 

Amenities: The pool is wonderful, the connection to the Linq really expands the immediate food offerings (In-N-Out is right outside!) and the central strip location gives so much access without having to walk for hours. I used to stay Downtown and this is a big step up for saving time getting around. Stay away from this food court, there are much more delicious and cheap offerings nearby. 

This is by no means a completely upscale hotel, but for our vacation on a budget it really upped our Vegas experience.

Horrible experience.  The rooms are falling apart and gross.  The furnitue is so banged up it looks like they picked it up off the street.  The covers to the outlets were ALL broken, talk about a safety hazard.  Shower is disgusting and has next to no water pressure.  The cabinets that were supposed to be sealed shut are falling open, exposing the underside of the sink.  Just plain dirty.  I felt like I was going to catch something funky in this room.  Probably the only hotel on the strip that doesnt give conditioner as a toiletries, instead you get "conditioning shampoo" that left my hair feeling like straw.  The toilet ran all night and the AC sounded like a semi truck going through our room.  And to top it off their slots don't pay out.  Their pillows are flat, but i will say their bed is pretty comfortable.  Valet is a disaster in and of itself.  45 minute wait to return our car that had ready been in valet earlier in the day.  Valet was never like this when it was free, now I pay to sit in line.  And to top it off, Caesar properties don't share parking like MGM properties do.  So that parking I paid at Flamingo is ONLY good at flamingo.  Customer service stinks.  Order extra pillows and they bring extra towels.  Overall a horrible experience.  And  that was just our room.  Our group had a suite and other rooms too.  The WiFi in the suite was out all weekend and we had another room get flooded by their running toilet.  Never again Flamingo, never again!
I was charged a "resort fee" of $32.99 a night for wifi. The beds were uncomfortable and the decor was out of an 80's porn movie. Horrible

Where to start.... well after long lines at check in finally get to the room.  Price the ice machine isn't working. Figured it was out of ice and making some more. Went down to casino for a bit came back up to room to shower have a drink and get ready for the night. Again ice machine won't work. Call guest services. There's nothing they can do but sent me to another floor. I go to the floor below and that one is empty. I call back and just ask for someone, anyone just bring me some ice. "Room service
Is closed from 2pm-6am sir (something like that). Every hotel I've ever been at can provide ice. Not this one there's nothing they can do. No one can just bring up some ice? Told them I was checking out then. They didn't care. Crazy you'd think a Cesar's entertainment business would be so much better. Don't go here. Not worth the hassle

The first room they gave us was unacceptable. Even though it was in the newer part of the hotel, the room was very, very basic with laminate floors, old furniture, no view and the hallways smelled of cleaning product.  It reminded me of a dorm room. We went back to front desk to explain that we booked a view and expected a much bigger, nicer room. They were able to accommodate us and what a difference. The room was beautiful. Huge room with a great view of the Bellagio fountains.  Switch operated sheers and drapes.  A stereo with USB ports for your phone.  Large closet and coffee maker. Nice pink bathroom with separate tub and shower. The shower even had separate jets that hit your back and there was a TV built into the bathroom mirror. The room made our trip! Avoid rooms in the Habitat tower and ask for a room in the Spa tower.

Seriously, there are some hotels on the strip that just need to be bulldozed in favor of new stuff.  This place has lived past its prime and caters to acts such as Toni Braxton and other has beens.

The gaming was ok - but man, for a Total Rewards casino, this one is the lacking property in Vegas.  Granted, I've seen worse in AC - but hey, this is supposed to be the town of "bigger and better" so I'm not expecting run down places with chipped cheques and worn felt.

Meh.

Got comped for 2 nights and decided to book the Go Deluxe room at the Flamingo after reading the Yelp reviews.

What's the deal with the parking structure?! Worst design ever! And half of the spots are reserved for valet and the Hilton. Really?! This is Vegas. Knock it down and build a better one! 

Oh, and of course the valet was full at 10:30pm. So pissed and so frustrated after circling around the lot for a parking spot. I just drove for 3+ hours, and all I wanted to do is check-in and sleep.

The check-in line was ridiculously long, but it was Christmas week so it was understandable.

As we got in the elevator, someone else was getting out around the 12th floor... It looked pretty scary when those elevator doors opened... The lighting was dim, the carpet was dark... Eeek!! But luckily we were on the 25th floor. And when the elevator doors opened, I see a bright hallway and elegantly tiled floors. Whew!!

The room was not bad at all. Very clean and modern. Bright room with a big flat screen TV, with a little 2.1 sound system. The windows has a electric switch for the drapes. The bathroom has a frosted glass sliding door. There's a TV embedded in the bathroom mirror, with a Bose ceiling speaker. Modern sink - like a bowl on the counter. Separate shower and tub. The king sized bed is soft, with lots of soft pillows. Comfy.

Okay... Here's my rant... The resort fees. $20 per day. And for what?! Phone? In today's day and age, who uses a telephone? Internet? They only allow access to 1 device per day. For 1 person maybe it'll work... But serioulsy... how often would one go to Vegas and stay by themself? If you're going to charge me $20\/day, at the very least you let me use WIFI on all my devices.

Overall... meh. Only paid $40 for a 2 night stay on Christmas. I suppose I can't complain too much.

Horrible I do not recommend this hotel to any one the pictures are not what the hotel looks like the rooms are old ugly and nasty! There was no hot water when trying to shower in the halls there were spots taped up. We moved rooms 2x the first room had a loud noise from the washing machine above us the second room no hot water finally they gave us a decent room which was actually nice but I still will never stay there again! Don't do it your better off paying more for a decent room

We just needed a cheap place to stay on the way through vegas so this was perfect. Payed next to nothing for the room on priceline and was shocked to see what we got for the money. The room we had was updated and extremely roomy, bathroom was the largest of all the hotel bathrooms we stayed at on our trip. Everything was clean and employees were nice. The hotels location was the best part because it was in a great spot on the strip. The only thing I could really complain about is the parking was awful and the casino smelled sorta like urinal cakes.

Ordered Go Delux Two Queen beds with Flamingo $167 including tax and room fees, they gave us one king room. we asked to switch back and they said they were out of rooms. We then called 3 times to front desk for extra blankets and pillows, it never arrives...

I also reviewed the Flamingo on Trip Adviser but figured I'd do a Yelp as well.  I stayed there for the LVBDI over Sept 5-8 and had a group convention rate.  Even with the regular rates for the Flamingo, it still stays firmly in the mid-priced hotel range for the strip.  With the amenities it has (pool, spa, food court, restaurants, garden area) it really is a good value for the money.  Yes, it's old and the renovation didn't seem to take care of the hallway carpet or the bathroom cabinets, but if you're looking for new then you've come to the wrong hotel.

I had a FAB room with two beds that looked out on the strip and it was perfectly acceptable and cleaned each day.  The walls are thin and the large window area does let in some noises from the strip so bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper.

With check-in\/out, I had a diamond card as one of the convention directors so the VIP check-in was quick and easy.  If you don't have a diamond card and do not need any kind of consideration with your room, try the automated check-in\/out that is to the side of the hotel check in desk.  I used that last year and it was much better than standing in the long line.

As already noted, as they work on the Linq construction the parking garage and valet is only for the hotel guests and convention attendees.  However, Bill's right next door usually has open spots and is an easy walk right to the casino.  Note that the best access to the garage and valet is not off Las Vegas Boulevard but at the back of the casino off Audrie Street.

The Flamingo has evolved into a decent mid-sized option for Vegas.  It won't have all of the bells and whistles of the megaresorts, but it has a lot more to offer than the budget hotels.  Call it a nice medium.

I've been to Vegas maybe 30 times and I've grown into a more relaxing pace, which the Flamingo is good for.  It's big enough to offer a lot of services but not too big where you're walking 5 minutes to get from place to place.  The casino, elevators, and restaurants are all close by.  The staff are friendly and the people are relaxed.

It's probably not the best option if you're looking for amazing nightlife or a wild weekend, but it's centrally located so all of those things are close by if that's why you want.  Great access to the beautiful Paris and Bellagio, and City Center is a couple of walkways away.

The rooms are the same, much better than the budget hotels but obviously a bit older.  The renovations are nice and the size is good, and so is the bed.  The bathroom is small if that's important to you.

I went mid-week during the slow season so the price was $26.  Definitely worth the price considering you'll be paying the same for Excalibur or the Stratosphere.  It's a big step up from those places if those are your options.

Stayed at the flamingo last week. We stayed in a FAB DELUXE room. Everything was great except for the bathrooms. They are a bit old, the sink was leaking from the handle, and the curtains could use a little updating.  There was some hair in the bathroom but not too disgusting. Overall for the amount of time you spend in the room it's not too bad, but I would definitely recommend the Flamingo update their bathrooms.

- LOCATION is the only saving grace for this place.
- We checked in 10am and had to pay a $30 early check in fee. 
- The main room was semi renovated with update floors but the furniture was dated and the bed squeaky. 
- Bathroom was super tiny
- The shower pressure was like a fire hose.
- Hairdryer cord torn and taped with scotch tape... coincidentally it did not work.
- The shuttle pick up\/drop off was far from the entrance.
- We were suppose to get $20 a day food & beverage credit, but the hotel did not tell us of this during check in.

We live nearby in Cali, so I've stayed at well over 20 hotels in Vegas through the years. The location on the Flamingo is excellent as it's located walking to distance to so many things. That said, the hotel is older, has been undergoing a remodel for over a year (stayed here a year ago and same holds true). Pieces of carpet cut out of floor, baseboards missing, elevators floors caked with spilt drinks and dirt. 

Our room was missing an iron so called down to the guest services and was transferred 3 times, and then disconnected. Wasted 45min on hold trying to get an iron and then...it never actually came.  No coffee makers in the room, so line for a bad very overpriced cup of coffee was about 30min each day. Hotel has huge potential. As one of Caesar Entertainment's properties, I would have expected more (this time and last year), but the Flamingo seems to be the ugly child of their fleet with little effort being put into making meaningful changes.

Wir hatten 2 Nächte im Flamingo gebucht, aber nachdem in der Hotellobby Betrunkene schon um 13 Uhr rumtorkelten und die Poolarea aussah wie ein billiges Springbreak und das Zimmer dreckig war, haben wir direkt gecancelt und sind ins Bellagio umgezogen.

A 3.5 is probably where this goes, but debating between a 3 and a 4 I'd say 4.

It's a tough rating to give because I also rated Aria a 4 as well, and most people would not put these 2 hotels in the same category.

However, Aria is advertised as a super luxurious hotel and Flamingo is just another "cheap" hotel on the strip.

Well, maybe it's because of the low expectations but to me it's a 4. Since it's not that popular, lines weren't an issue. 

The rooms have been upgraded and I think they did a great job. Mediocre beds, they stayed with the color scheme but added some modern twists to it. obviously not the most trendy, but for what you pay for its' a great value. I found the day bed by the window very comfortable to lay on.

The location is right int he middle of the strip. You can take a walk to Caesar's Forum shops, and planet hollywood's miracle mile pretty easily.

Downstairs there's a solid cheap late night hamburger spot. Nothing fancy but it's cheap and readily available.

Casino is nothing to rave about, subpar especially when Caesar's and Bellagio are right there. But if you're balling on a budget, these tables would be the way to go.

If I  had high expectations of this place. It would probably be a 2. But it's very cheap, especially for its location on the strip.

People of color not welcome. Do not stay here. They will berate you at the tables. The pit boss will not defend you. If a bigot playing Pai gow (the cheapest of all the fucking games available) offends you, both the dealer and the pit boss will tell you to stand down. They are not friendly. Fuck this hotel and everything about them. To the people of color working here: you should quit your jobs. This place is a white man's sanctuary.

Probably one of the worst Vegas experiences we have ever had. We booked a "high roller" view and let me tell you, it was NOT high roller. The lamp shades were dented and dirty, the rug was filthy, we had the view of the pool (again, NOT high roller), and the bed was the worst part...it was a thin sheet that laid over the bed, not fitted or tucked in, with another sheet as a comforter. The room was freezing and we had it on 75-80 the entire time, so we were basically shivering at night. Each day there was a resort fee charged of about $33 bucks (on top of original price of room). We paid the $30 early check-in fee, and after some room confusion didn't make it to our room until after the early check in time. Instead of taking care of the fee they gave us a "resort credit" that still has not shown up as a credit. Absolutely ridiculous. We will NEVER stay here again, EVER!

Goodness, this place is a mess. Booked a GO room for a weekend and was very disappointed with the overall experience of the resort. First off, if you have to stay here, book through  Chase Ultimate Rewards - lower rates,  no resort fee ($20 a night savings) and they give you a $9 per person continental breakfast credit for Club Cappuccino. The rate was good, and the location is hard to beat. The GO room product itself is pretty nice - newly renovated, some new tech (motorized blinds, tv in the bathroom, sound system). Our room, however, was pretty worn out - scuffs on furniture, broken furniture pieces, etc. Housekeeping was also inconsistent - our first day, they didn't clean our room, but provided us with the extra toiletries we requested. 

The Flamingo's parking garage is a nightmare - very confusing layout, slow, and trashed elevators. **Tip** The hotel\/casino connection is on the 3rd floor. Arrived for check in around 11:30 pm and the line was pretty long... it took us over 40 min just to check in. Wear and tear is evident throughout the hotel. I know the Flamingo is one of the Strip's older hotels, but just b\/c something is old, doesn't mean it has to be busted up - broken elevators, dented buttons and furniture, clogged plumbing. The pool area is a redeeming quality - we checked out the GO pool, which is the 21+ pool area - nice chill place. Overall, I would recommend spending a little more to stay at Monte Carlo, NYNY, or Luxor.

You get what you pay for, and that's how I would think of this hotel.  

The location was flat out great....right about in the middle of the strip, with one of the Monorail stations right out in back of the hotel.  

We got the base model room, and I agree with the last guy...our room was never what I would consider 'cool'.  The A\/C was running the whole time(at least the fan was running) but the room never seemed to cool down...and it never let set it cooler than 65.  Also, the light switch just inside the door was on the verge of breaking...

But, since we didn't plan on using the room for much more than sleeping, it met our purpose.

The casino floor was not big...but I may have been spoiled by living too close to Foxwoods.  Drink service was not fast....had much faster service at Paris and New York, New York.  Also....the damn people camped out by the elevators trying to convince you to listen to their 'Vacation Club' Spiel were ANNOYING.  I started taking the long way into the elevator to avoid them 

The breakfast buffet was passable(Paris was better) and the Habitat Trail was an enjoyable distraction for an hour or two....

All in all, downtown prices in an on the strip locale...

I went to the Flamingo hotel for my B-day, but was disappointed by the whole affair. 

1. Harassed by the beauty store employees to purchase their beauty cream and didn't understand the word no.

2. Check in took over an hour to get a room.

3. Did not receive the room I requested when making reservations online, but had to nominate. 

4.  Room was dirty.

5. Found an empty beer can under the couch.

6. The room was too hot.

7. Call for service to repair the air condition and no one showed up.

8. TP was horrible, however the casino bathrooms had great TP.

9. Harassed 3 to 4 times a day by the Wynn time share people, which I stayed in the hotel for 4 days

10. The matterious was not firm and uncomfortable

I enjoyed the bird sanctuary!! And the diner next to the all you can eat Buffet. And  will visit it next time I am in Vegas. however, i will not be staying at the Flamingo Hotel again.

We stayed at the Flamingo Las Vegas this past weekend July 6 - July 8, 2012 for the first time ever. We purchased two of your Fab Luxury Rooms which are very misleading from your on-line photos. We had connecting rooms  . There were several major issues with our stay as you will see listed below.We are very upset at the level of customer service and accommodations of a major hotel such as the Flamingo with a huge reputation on the Vegas strip. 
Room Issue
First off the room photos on your website are misleading I upgraded to your Fab Luxury suite only to find it was no where near "Fab". We entered our first room to only find the head board off the wall and on the floor and the pillows at the end of bed as you can see in the attached photo. So your staff was accommodating and moved us to another room, but that was not a good first impression and we waited like 45mins to 1hr to be moved as we sat in this room. So we move to another room connecting 20138 and 20140 only to find holes in the wall and a hole punched in the bathroom door as you can see in the attached photos. At this point we were so disappointed and tired and your hotel was too full to move to another connecting room. We went down to talk to the guest service mgr. Cassandra and she offered us a $30 credit to the hotel which I think was a slap in the face considering how much we spent on our rooms and the inconvenience of moving from one room to the next. She also offered to move us again which at this point was useless we asked just to have maintenance come up and repair the damage while we were out for the day. We were ensured that maintenance will be up to repair. Well with that said we checked out with the room looking just how it did in the attached photos. It is very un professional to not follow up with your guest on the status if the repair was going to happen or not. I understand your do not charge resort fees, but I see why people pay resort fees to get great customer service and not TWO damaged rooms!!!! 
Parking
We pulled in to Valet parking both nights of our stay to only find the Valet was FULL and only Diamond Customers can valet. Which is so unprofessional if you know you are limited on parking you need to refuse parking to visitors and accommodate your paying customers. I was told to park in the self parking structure across the street. So we proceed to the parking structure only to drive around from top to bottom over 30 mins looking for a parking space. After our frustration we go back to valet to tell them there is no parking in the structure and not only was I there their were several very upset guest there too looking for parking. At this point I was so over my stay at this hotel, so in disbelief I was told to park at either Caesar's Palace or MGM Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! First of all I cannot believe that you would send your guest to another hotel chain to find their own parking. I went to guest services and spoke with Charles the manager and we were told you lost a parking structure so basically its nothing you can do!!!! I cannot believe that a huge million dollar hotel chain does not have a contingency plan for busy summer months and accommodating your guest with parking. Does MGM know your sending your guest to park at their hotel????That is so tacky and unprofessional. Also, we confirmed you do not offer any type of shuttle for the guest your sending to these other hotels. We felt basically like its not our problem so go find your own parking. You should let your guest know your parking situation up front and not leave them hanging after they spent their money to stay with you. So I had to park at another hotel blocks and blocks away!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and walk to your hotel Saturday night at 1am!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am super irritated!!! We also were leaving the next morning sooooooooooooooooooo we had to get our car and come back to pick up our bags!!!! Never ever in my life at any hotel in Vegas have I experienced such NONSENSE!!!!!!!!!!
Overall
Our stay and experience at the Flamingo was very bad and disappointing. You were not accommodating and your hotel did not follow through on any of its commitments to your customers. I also met one lady in valet and other man on the elevator who shared the same experience. Also your facility needs to be cleaner I have attached photos of your elevator which also had graffiti and the dirty carpet in your hall ways. I plan to put this on yelp and other customer websites of the dissatisfaction of your hotel. Your customer service is very unacceptable and working in the Aerospace industry and serving customers on a daily basis. Customer satisfaction is number one...You need to re-evaluate your facility and put in place various contingency plans for all these types of situations. Its not fair to your valet staff and guest services staff to have to deal with the back lash of customers because of poor planni

I have stayed at the Flamingo twice in the past couple months. Both times have been fairly good, one a little better than the other. When I stayed in December, we upgraded to a view Deluxe room and it was pretty nice. The bathroom was redone with a glass shower...nice lighting...tv in the mirror...great view (slightly obstructed by their peeling 'skin' of Donny and Marie). I went and stayed again last weekend and we were in the area that hadn't been renovated so recently. The bathroom was kind of disgusting.... the tub was tiny and had an AC vent in it that was full of grime...yuck. The room itself was clean and had a hard floor (which I liked) and the beds were comfy. View was not so good, but it was a less expensive room. The prices weren't bad (40-50$ per night), but the resort fee of 18$ per night was a little ridiculous considering you don't really get anything for it...especially in the winter. I would stay here again, the location can't be beat and the rooms are fine for the price.

Pretty crappy all around. Nasty, old rooms with barely a bathroom. Terrible service at every corner and every facet of hotel service. Of all the casinos theirs is the lamest, we always went next door to Ballys to play. The pool and the flamingo garden were the only decent part of this crummy hotel. They also charge you for everything! Seriously even the wifi wasn't free, plus they added all these extra fees on daily. Totally would rather have stayed somewhere else, seriously don't waste your money, go to a different hotel on the strip.

Honestly, the room was better than I thought it would be. It was nice looking, but definitely could have been cleaner. They only provide low quality shampoo (no conditioner) so I advise bringing your own. The rooms were cleaned and restocked every day, but the skimped on the towels. They really mess with the cellphone reception in the building so you have to pay $20 per day for Wi-Fi. As far as the rest of the hotel goes, you have to dodge sales people in the lobby continuously which gets very annoying very fast. They will actually walk after you. The pool was okay. Nothing spectacular. They do a full bag check getting in and you can't bring your own drinks in. The line took some time and there is no cover from the sun while waiting. I feel like i could go on about little things, but the one thing that made a return to The Flamingo a total deal breaker was the fact that not only did an employee knock on our door hours before checkout to wake us up to get out, but she proceeded to use her key to open the door  seconds later. What an unfortunate way to end the trip. 
Leaving this hotel, we are still unclear what time checkout is since every time we see contradicts one another, and aren't sure if a random charge is going to crop up since they don't make it clear what you are paying for in the beginning. 

We still had a good trip and the location was ideal, but man, this hotel is not worth it for the money.

Okay...I am giving this place 5 stars.  Not because it is the biggest and best hotel I have ever stayed at, but because the sheer number of things that you have to do. There is much construction going on right now, so I am expecting this place to get bigger and better as time goes on.  I also like that they have not fallen into the resort fees none sense that everyone else is doing.   I truly wish they had free wifi!  The hotel is really a high 4 rating, because of minor things that could be coming in the future, but I am comfortable giving it a 5.

Let me start off by saying that I did not get a chance to do everything that is in this place.  I really do not have the time or resources to splurge to that level!  If you are not a member, sign up for the FREE PROGRAM of total rewards, or something of that nature.  You get so many discounts just for being in the program, plus you have your own line waiting on you to check in.  You start off as a Gold member, but as you progress, you get more perks, of course.  The card is used at many hotels and casinos. 

I must have stayed in a King Go-Room because my room was awesome.  Nice lounge chair thingy in the room.  Ultra comfortable king bed with nice comforter on it.  The air condition works heavenly.  Nice sized television with dvd player and external stereo system.  Spacious.  Standing showing and detached tub.  Nicely designed sink.  Television in the bathroom, behind the mirror.  This room had everything you needed, except a microwave!  

Outside the room, you are going to have many types of alcohol and ways to gamble...being that it is Vegas, that is a given.  I did like that this hotel had some great main acts just an elevator ride away from your room, inside the establishment.  They even gave away many types of show tickets, via a DJ, at the pool!  The pool area is really nice with a huge swimming pool with waterfalls and a slide that was not in operation yet.

There is a quality buffet, that was kind of pricey, but with your total rewards card, you get a discount on that as well.  There was always a huge variety of items to choose from, but given that I am from New Orleans, no foods were spiced as if you were in New Orleans!  Take that aside from the food experience, some things were seasoned well enough to get a couple of smiles out of me.  The tell the chef what type of pasta you want option was cool, just like the build your omelet option for breakfast.  The dessert menu was pretty decently sized with two types of ice cream cones to go, as well as cotton candy to go.  Fondue pots and a build your own fresh crepe option was a nice touch.

It is called the Flamingo hotel because you actually do have flamingos and other birds on the property.  You can see them while dining at the buffet.  If you go outside, on your way to the pool even, you can see them a lot closer.  Huge fish and turtles are found throughout the waters with the many types of different birds and waterfalls.

I can go on and on about this hotel and the excellent set up, but I leave you with this, plenty of high quality shows, drinks, food options and fun in this hotel.  There is even a special place for your dog to do his business!  Check it out for yourself and see for yourself.

Went in here for a poker tournament and well it's an older casino so of course the decor is dated but I was surprised how shanty like the bathrooms were. I went to several other casinos on the strip and in old Vegas off of Fremont street and this was the dirtiest one I have ever been too. 

The poker room would have been nice except for the tables seemed to be falling apart. The cup holders didn't stay attached when I picked up my drink so there was that to contend with. There is a $5.99 charge to use the ATM which is about standard. But what caught me off guard was the fact that I wanted to play in the tournament and not a cash game....and they wouldn't let me pay the tourney fee with my card. I was told I had to go and get cash to enter. So to me it was....pay $65.99 to get the money to play or just walk away. So I payed and played but they will not get my patronage ever again and if you're in Vegas I recommend you avoid this place. 

If you like craps, almost all tables I have been to from Vegas to New Orleans to San Diego, and this is the only casino that I have been in that plays double 2 and double 12s.  All others it's triple 12s. Ridiculous. I'd avoid this place like the plague

Booked a last minute trip with parents and little bro and couldn't find anything reasonably priced. Flamingo was the only family friendly hotel (with a great location on the strip) that I could book so last minute and stay within my budget. Since it is an older hotel, I didn't want to take my chances and booked a GO room. It was only 16 dollars or so more (per night) and totally worth it. The GO rooms are the remodeled rooms and come with views. We had a view of the fountains\/habitat area which was really pretty. The room also came with a small fridge and coffee maker. The decor is really cute. The bed posts and pink walls were my favorite part. The rest of the hotel is just so so. Not the type of hotel I would want to spend time in outside my room. The courtyard area is cute though. Has a bunch of fountains, koi pond, and a flamingo habitat area (flamingos stink when its hot out though). Food wise it's somewhat limited and boring. I'd go to the surrounding hotels for eats. Location wise, its pretty great. Right across from Caesars and walking distance to Planet Hollywood, Cosmopolitan and a few other great spots. The pool is one of the best parts about this place. It's separated into two parts. One is a family pool for kids and the other is the Go pool which is 21 and over. Lots of trees so for those of us (like me) who burn easily, its the perfect spot to lounge. It starts off slow but turns into a full blown pool party after noon. Pretty fun and the pool itself is spacious enough to where it doesn't feel like a million people are bumping into you. My only major annoyance was the customer service. It's not a hotel I'd get excited about staying in again, but not bad for a last minute option.
