Stayed during Super Bowl Sunday Weekend. I wanna give you a heads up if you book third party reservations (orbitz, travelocity, hotels.com, etc.) expect then to give you the crappiest rooms they have. I was a platimum member and they still didn't give me the best treatment. 

The room was fine, but the bathroom was disgusting!! The shower ceiling was full of mold and rust and when I complained to the manager, she had me on hold for over half am hour and said they couldn't do anything. They said they would have housekeeping come uo and remove it but they didnt come uo for another 45 minutea and we were losing time getting ready to go out!!

The housekeeper finally showed up and said he couldnt remove the filth and needs to be painted over!!!

At the end if the night, I asked to change rooms the next day because they couldn't today and the agent said "Try back between 11-1 tomorrow."

No effort at all to help me and no one took this issue seriously. Also throughout my stay we had to continuously get new keys because they kept deactivating and we were not close to the front desk at all!!! AND THE KEYS WERE NOT NEAR A CREDIT CARD OR CELL PHONE. I never had such bad service from a Caesars property like this one especially being a platinum member.

What's with the super long line for check in?  This place sucks!  I've been waiting for an hour literally and still have 20 people in front of me.  Get more staff on check in.  Total turn off with first impressions!
Needs to be put out of its misery and donate its signs to the Neon Museum boneyard.

The first time I stayed in Vegas I stayed at Caesar's Palace.  The rooms were bright and sunny and the pool was full of hottness.  The beds were super comfy and the location was clutch.

Of course, the expenses that weekend were covered by work.

Our most recent friendcation was on our individual dimes and we decided to book a room at the Flamingo.  It's the perfect spot to cut lodging costs so you have more expendible income for booze and the blackjack tables.  We were given a "junior suite" (non-updated) that was massive and plenty of room for the 4 of us (we could have easily slept 8-10).  The pool was great, too.  Lots of people everywhere, friendly bartenders, and just enough sun to get a tan.  They could have more bathrooms, though.

The only bad part of the stay was the broken ice machine outside of our room.  We needed ice... to keep our drinks cold in the room, and the other ice machine was at least 1\/2 mile away down the hallway (oh yeah... you could drop 10lbs just walking from the front entrace to your room depending on what wing of the hotel you are staying in).

The location is awesome and the hotel met our expectations.  Also, the food court in the casino was perfect for morning, mid-day, and late night eats.  Great experience and I'll definitely be back!

I have been a loyal guest and proponent of The Flamingo Hotel & Casino for nearly Twenty Years. In the past, I came to enjoy your property for the history, customer service and friendly policy on dogs.  

Conversely, during a recent stay, over the Christmas Holiday, my entire experience was disenchanting to say the least. 

After driving through oppressing Holiday traffic, I arrived to find both the Valet and Self parking (unapologetically) full, leaving me to locate  parking off site (at another hotel), paying non-guest rates, not to mention  the inconvenience. 

As a whole, the attitude among the Staff was unhelpful and brusque. I (along with other guests I briefly spoke with in passing), felt as if the simplest of requests or inquires were impositions upon the staff. This was a complete change from my previous stays at The Flamingo. 

As a frequent traveler both professionally and personally, I use my American Express Platinum to book all travel in the instance I should ever encounter any issues or for any reason need to utilize their customer service.  Following this wearisome and disappointing experience  I feel it my responsibility to inform Amex, along with -fellow travelers of the substandard Customer Service and unavailable parking.

Rooms are small and dirty. They smell like BO. They let people smoke on non smoking floors and the service is awful.  Everyone has an attitude when you ask them anything! Elevators are complete shiitttt. They go up when you press down and broke down twice when I stayed for a week.  WOuldn't recommend!!!!!!!

I didn't stay in the hotel so this review is strictly for adventuring, sightseeing, and service.

A couple of punk rockers on a whim decide to go to Vegas with very little money.  As far as the Strip Casinos were concerned the Flamingo was the best that we explored.

You can take the elevator to the top with no key, which allowed us to get cool views of the city.  There is a little courtyard area with flamingos, koi, turtles, ducks, and swans that we wasted some time in that was pretty neat.

We played some cheap slots, tipped our server $5 each and she brought us two strong drinks at a time every time she came by, which was awesome because at the other casinos that didn't even warrant servers coming back very often.

As far as playing blackjack goes, yeah the rules suck and you're being ripped off.  I played for awhile knowing I was going to lose my money but I played because unlike the other casinos (even the El Cortez which is where it's at for good blackjack) the dealers were friendly, helpful, and funny.  Everywhere else the dealers were dead eyed and barely spoke and you were playing your games in complete and utter silence.  Which was kinda creepy.

All and all we had a lot of fun screwing around at the Flamingo.

Had a great stay! Rooms are a bit old but the hotel and pool are awesome! However the resort fee was an awful lot especially when the Internet service sucked and I got no service and the shower water was COLD!! could NOT get hot water :( And we were extremely upset we were charged for 5 drinks to our room when we are 110% positive we only charged 4. Was very upsetting.. Most of the employees are very nice however the store workers are very very rude! A lady and man handing out face cream samples asked if we'd like one and when we politely said no thank you, the woman decided to get very angry and proceeded to start screaming at me saying "excuse me lady I want to give u something!" We again said no thank you and were called rude after that! That was highly wrong!! Otherwise stay was good and Las Vegas rocked! Idk if I'd stay here again, lines for checking in and out are very long bc of only a few desks open to help..

I have never stayed at the Flamingo before but I did like it very much. I had a double queen strip view room located on the 28th floor. The view was a perfect, unobstructed view of the Las Vegas Strip facing Ceasar's Palace and the Bellagio. Seeing all the lights at night was awesome. Don't get me wrong, this hotel isn't really the top of the line, it definitely needs some freshening up, but all in all I really enjoyed my experience here and feel that I got what I paid for. Never really had any problems with the room, other than the AC never really got cold. It did get cool, but I like my environment cold. 
The pool area is beautiful. The security at the pool club are kind of stoic. There is no emotion there. They are very serious and can come off as rude. But I don't blame them, they work in the heat and around drunk people all day. The only thing that I didn't like was that I bought a tumbler at the pool club for my drink and they didn't let me take it in again, even though I bought it there and it was empty. That part did annoy me because I feel like it doesn't make sense. Other than that, great experience.

I only am giving 3 stars for the location and the customer service that are great. The elevators don't work!! The wait for an elevator is 15-20 minutes, once one dies come, it's a fight among the 50 people waiting to get in it. The rooms are kinda gross. I stayed in the habitat tower, it wasn't the nicest. The go pool charges hotel guests $10 on Saturday... I understand it's a public pool, so to alleviate some of the crowd, they charge. At least that's what I'm assuming. The drinks are $17 for a small cup, $25 for a tumbler, and $42 for a pitcher (fills 2 1\/2 tumblers). The drinks will not get you drunk. And the tumbler is a one day use, don't expect them to allow it back into the pool the next day. Pretty shitty.

It should be closed for repair and cleaning from the elevator to the hallways and than the room . Location is wonderful but the rest is not worth. It . From the smell and the black mold in bath room . Old and tired is one thing but dirty is inexcusable. 
When we pulled up with check in there weren't any luggage people so we brought the luggage to the line than found out we could go into the special Line because of my husbands statues go some where else   .

I love this hotel!  First I do have to say check in is kinda chaotic!  The line was very long but I went to the express checkin kiosk.  At the kiosk I also had trouble...later I would find out it was definitely something I had done wrong during booking thru an app online.  A extremely nice man who worked here when to the front desk and then later ushered me into the "gold member" area bc I did have a 5 year old with me!  He did this so I would not have to wait.  The gentleman in the "gold member" area helped me figure out the issue and got me all booked in.  My son and I were headed up to our room and my son was having trouble with his bag.  The gentleman who helped check me in carried my son's bag all the way up to our room!!!!!  I wanted to tip him but he refused to take my money!  What could have been a really bad situation for me, turned into being extremely easy and I appreciated the help by these two gentlemen so much!  They absolutely made my long tired trip with a kiddo so much easier!  Thank you Flamingo!!!!!  You are the best!!!

Stayed 8\/3\/2016 - 8\/6\/2016

Decent enough stay, as I was in town for a conference.

Opt for the kiosks in the lobby for check-in, otherwise you'll be in line for a while.

While the lobby is a throwback to the Flamingo's glory days (shiny marble floors, lots of smoke, and some hustle and bustle), the hallways and rooms are tired. While my room offered some relative peace and quiet from the strip, it could use some updated furnishings, fresh paint, and attention to your standard wear-and-tear. Some areas of the room were worn out for some time, so much so that I'm not sure that they will be attended to in the near term.

Hotel staff was nice enough, casino was clean, and there were plenty of slots and tables.

Best feature of this hotel, by far, is that you are in the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

While it's not the nicest or newest hotel, it's located on the strip and you can get a room here for dirt-cheap.  The best part:  The pool area has an endless river which equals endless joy-gasms.  The only other one I know of is at Mandalay and it's usually 2-3 times as much to stay there (on a good\/cheap day).  

While you won't run into basketball players or celebrities, it's a solid casino to stay at if you come on a budget and are looking for some solid pool-lounging time.  The rooms are clean, the service has always been efficient, and the location is convenient.  

The last time I stayed here, I kinda felt like I was in Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas.  The casino has that old school feel of 80's Vegas with the flamingo vomit carpet.  Hopefully, they've updated since or will be updating soon.

So in summary: Come for the pool and try not to have a Hunter S. Thompson reaction to the decor.  3-stars (and how much more do you need in a Vegas hotel anyhow?)

When my wife called and asked housekeeping to bring up some towels they gave her attitude and told her that it would take over an hour for us to get towels.  

In the casino a machine had our money in it and malfunctioned and it took us almost an hour to get an attendant to get the machine to print a ticket.  

I suppose this is a sound business strategy:
1.  Be severely understaffed on personnel able to help customers withdraw money from a malfunctioning machine.   This saves money on payroll.
2.   A certain percentage of the customers will become frustrated with the long wait to get money out of a machine and will just leave and abandon their money.  Genius.

That being said, this place has an awesome location, has reasonable prices and is pink so it gets two stars.

The Flamingo looks like a ton of fun on the outside but the rooms didn't blow me away. We got the basic room, which I expected to have the basic amenities but we didn't even have a mini fridge! I was honestly surprised that in Vegas we didn't have a mini fridge equipped with overpriced booze\/snacks for us to room charge. The bed was also not that great, with springs sticking in your back half the night. The door to the bathroom opened right to the toilet and shower so it was not a very easy to navigate bathroom. The door should have opened out into the room in my opinion. I think the hotel in general is pretty fun with the huge casino floor and tons of shops available throughout the property. Also parking was only $10 for 24 hours which was incredibly surprising. I assumed parking would be as overpriced as everything else in the city! All in all we received good customer service and a decent stay for the price we paid.

On the surface, rooms look really cool, but once you start settling in, there are numerous things that make the design and lay-out not work or function well.  This, combined with restaurant choices, check-in set-up, and comps that were not automatically applied (so we had to hassle with host on check-out) will have us going to another hotel for our next trip.

Before getting to the room, the check-in set-up is BAD.  Valet the car in the back, go up an escalator with your bags, drag it all to the middle of the hotel\/casino to check in (long lines!), then hoof it to room in the front or the back of the buildings.  This was one of the worst set-ups we've ever seen.  This alone, will keep us away from this place.

Not sure if we got a mini-suite or studio, so see pix.
1) Rooms are equipped to handled all the latest in tech gadgetry, but most of it was unplugged!  So, do people actually use them (or do they not know how?)  In fact, one of the plugs was broken, so I'm thinking people don't use it.  There were 2 TVs that were synched, but we couldn't figure out how to turn off just one, so we unplugged it.  (We're pretty techie, and it drove us nuts that we couldn't figure it out.)
2) Mini-fridge was UNDER a counter table - Had to bend over and squat to get anything in\/out of it.
3) Bathroom (see pic) - Clean, but again, once you start to use it . . . Nice glass sliding door, but gaps when closed, so no privacy.  TP holder forced you to reach behind and it was impossible to tear any paper so we ended up putting the roll on the sink counter.  There is also little space between the commode and the sink - forget sharing to get ready in the morning!
4) Stains - brown spots on the carpet, pen scribbles on the leather sofa, and pink stain on white coffee table (see pic) . . . Sorry, but it made me question what else was lurking and how clean things were . . .
5)  Bed was enclosed by 3 walls (see pic) - pretty cozy, but actually too warm . . . we had the fan on most of the night.

We wanted something on the strip - This definitely is central to a lot of places, but it was the only good thing about our stay.  We had higher expectations of this place, but so disappointed!

The star is because I like flamingos, yep that is pretty much it.  I would like to say that this is the poorest run "resort" in Las Vegas.  Upon check in, they did not have a room available in the class that I had reserved.  Being that I clearly had a reservation, I inquired about why I was not receiving what I reserved and paid for.  I was informed that the reservation does not promise a room.  WHAT??????  Well after 35 minutes of addressing that ridiculous statement with a manager, I was told that I would have to   stay  in the small room for 1 night then would be given the room I reserved for the 2 other nights.  Apparently, a reservation does not ensure a clean room either, there were clumps of hair in the shower and food on the floor.  The final straw if that was not enough is parking.  The lot was full and they said valet was full even for hotel guests.  Um what?????  So what are hotel guests supposed to do?  Park at a different hotel.  Yes, that is the statement I just received from the manager along with a statement that the hotel does not ensure parking for it's guests.  Between fighting to get what you paid for and having to drive and walk all over the casinos so that you can pay them for a dirty room.  I would stay pretty much anywhere else.... and from now on that is exactly what I am going to.

It's not the best hotel on the strip but it's not the worst and it is enriched in Vegas history. The rooms are very affordable especially if you are on a budget. The employees are pretty friendly and professional here too particularly the management team. We hosted an event here in the sunset ballroom and everything went off without a hitch thanks to them. 

The rooms are decent and basic. I had a nice view of the high roller through my windows. The casino is also pretty decent in size too. I won 100$ on the slots my first night here which was cool. Of course I spent all of it back by the time my visit was over. I still had a great time nonetheless. Some of the vendors in the lobby shops are a little pushy but I like having the convenience of going right downstairs to get something I need. Housekeeping was cool but I didn't need very much from them. I tend to keep my room pretty clean and I brought all my own stuff. The rooms could definitely use some upgrades like a better shower. I was in a non-smoking area but there was definitely cigarette smoke coming through my bathroom vent. 

The walls are pretty thin. Expect to hear the people in the next room getting it on. The beds are on the firm side which took some getting used to and the pillows were flat but I like a flat pillow. No microwave or fridge in my room since it was a standard room but there was a safe and a decently sized closet. Only two available outlets and most had applicances plugged into them already so I had to unplug some lamps and the clock to charge up my stuff. I'm going to bring a multi port adapter next time.

I would recommend Flamingo to any pet owner with a dog under 50lbs. The newly rennovated GO rooms were clean and perfect for my family and our pet. Flamingo provided a pet relief area, a beautiful park, and a coffee shop with a patio that were perfect places for our ENTIRE family (including our dog) to venture around and enjoy. The other hotel guests and staff were extremely friendly during our entire stay, which didn't surprise me the dog is a big hit with the ladies. The only issue we encountered was with a couple employees during check in but what could've ruined our entire experience was recovered by a security guard named Kenny who went above and beyond what was even asked of him and a Front Service Operations Manager named Raina who took the time to listen and address the our concerns. Both employees could have ignored us or ignored the situation all together but instead ensured our stay was met with exceptional guest service. Thanks Flamingo, see you again soon.

If you've ever tried to use their "Best Rate guaranteed" promise, you'll find that they are full of crap. I filled out the form per every request and still they would not honor their promise. Upon further emails to ask how I can do better next time to ensure the promise, they've stopped emailing me. 

As it too late to rebook, I had to keep my reservation. Nothing exciting about the hotel, which was actually disappointing. Paid $308 for two night stay. Lighting in bathroom was poor. Water from sink and shower smelled like sewer. The actual room was clean and bed was comfortable. I'm giving it one star bc of the poor customer service before arrival
We upgraded our room and was well worth it. On the weekends it's super busy so the elevators seem very packed and take forever but I bet thats almost everywhere.

Memorial Weekend 2015. Arrive on Friday. Depart on Monday. 

Pros- 
1. Great view
2. TV in the mirror in the restroom. BOSE    ceiling speaker had a great sound!
 
Disappointments- 
1. Checked into 1st room on 16th floor- Lobby Elevators. Went to our room; room was not cleaned. Beds, bathroom and room needed housekeeping. We had to go back downstairs (with luggage & bags) and waited in line, again. 
We were re-assigned our 2nd room on the 24th floor - Spa Elevator. 
Rooms looked fabulous, view is fabulous, bathroom was fabulously incredible; approx a 20" built into the mirror color TV with ceiling BOSE speaker which sounded fabulous! Room had a standard flatscreen TV but the audio system was this DENON receiver, 2 speaker and a sun woofer, looked impressive.
2. DENON receiver- disappointingly it did not work. Red power light kept blinking. I unplugged unit to see it would reset but to no avail. My wife called Guest Service for extra towels help to get this unit working. They had indicated someone would come and assistant us. 
3. Room safe we were using, noticed on Sat morning indicator screen displayed 'low battery' Called and advised room service. 
4. Wife and I, finished watching Mariah Carey Concert at The Colosseum at Caesars Palace. Wife and I walked back to Flamingo. Arrived at our room put the key in and the red and yellow light lit up. We tried it again, again and one last time. From the hallway phone I called the front desk and they forward my call to security. I spoke to security named Mas (this isn't his real name). I explained my situation and gave him my room number. He asked me because my wife checked us is she there. I said she is standing at our door. He says (with a sarcastic tone), "I asked you is she there!" I said, "she is there and is standing at our door" He said "sir...." I cut his conversation off and told him I didn't need to have this confrontational conversation with you, right now. Can you send someone to get us into our room?" He says, "I'll send someone up"
15-20 minutes later, security lets us into our room. Security advised us to call front desk and have them send up new keys. We do just that as soon as we enter the room, my wife calls front desk and explains what just transpired. They indicated we'll have someone come up with your new keys. 
We change our clothes and wait, wait and wait some more. One hour and fifteen minutes later, a knock wakes us up.

You can learn a lot more detail from other reviews, but I'll keep it simply.

Very clean but dated rooms.  Good casino, great room service, and fun pool.  The best location you could have on the strip.

I feel it's the best bang for you buck in the city.

I stayed here during a business trip in April 2013.  I was excited before I arrived because it was my first time in Vegas.  However, this quickly faded.  My room was not what I expected in fact I have actually stayed at Holiday Inns that were better.

The furniture had ink writing\/drawings on it. The windows were very dirty, and 2 nights I had no hot water.  Not to mention WIFI is charged, and there the room only has basic cable.  Once again Holiday Inn's offer free WIFI and HBO.  The elevators are horrible graffiti and missing wall mounts.  They writing and scratches all over it...reminded me of the mall elevators.

Most of the staff at the check in counter are very friendly but the rest of the staff not so much.  I called to get my hot water fixed and it took 25 mins for someone to come to the room.  Then the maint. guy step with his dirty boots all over the floor mat.  The hotel did not offer any comp. for the bad service.

The best thing about this hotel is the outside area...its beautiful with the water falls, ducks, birds, and fish.

I am looking forward to going to Vegas again but I promise it WILL NOT be there.

When we arrived for our vacation we checked in and headed fur our room. Hallway carpets are disgusting! They gave got to be replaced!! So gross!! We entered in to our room and heard water running. Someone left the hot water running and all the walls were wet from condensation, making the room moist and smelling like B.O. We went back swung and got a new room. This one was better but not by much. Floor had white spots on it., which if mopped I'm sure would come up. Shower has mold. Wallpaper is ripped and pealing. Shower took 15 minutes to become warm enough to step in and no water pressure! Stay somewhere else! Gross, gross, gross!
Oh! Lets not forget the elevators that were broken down!! Lovely!!

Inadequate parking (not enough space and no elevator to top floor). Room didn't even have an armchair. Ice machine stayed broken four days after reporting it. Elevators strange and irregular (to the point that I expected to get stuck at any time). Noisy. Pizza from the pizza place downstairs had a Bisquik crust and was cold and flavorless--including CANNED mushrooms. Maybe there's something better in the "food court," but that's closed for "sewer repairs."  Because of construction, it took a half hour to find the parking ramp in the first place. Pro tip: the "Flamingo Hilton" is a different hotel--one that actually has checkin-parking in front--unlike the Flamingo.

By accurate measurement, it was 0.4 mile walking from the parking ramp to my room. 

I've stayed at Caesar's Palace and it really IS a palace compared to the Flamingo.

Final indignity: took a half hour to CHECK OUT.  The 700 year old clerk (who was on oxygen, probably so customers would feel sorry for her and not spring on her like a panther when she says something sarcastic) told me "you could review your bill and check out on the room TV."  Well, not if I wanted a receipt.  Also, the "express checkout kiosk" suckered me out of line and didn't work, and ten more people were in line ahead of me when I returned.

Second pro tip:  ALWAYS do valet parking.  There's no charge--just a tip.  It's worth five bucks to not walk through the 110 degree (no, that isn't a typo) ramp.  I've stayed at four places on the strip and the Flamingo is the worst so far.

Oh yeah, I almost forgot: they want $14\/day PER DEVICE for wireless Internet.  Balls.  Lucky they don't have a quarter-a-sheet paper dispenser in the bathroom.

The worst hotel ever.
The room is dirty
The heaters doesn't work
It's crazy cold...
I call the front desk 10 times, they send an Engeener that didn't fix the problem and the floor is now full of water.
The front desk agent brandy said that she was going to send another engineer, no one show up.
I asked to move in another room, not for any upgrade just another room like this one, they didn't do nothing.
I asked to speak to a manager no one answer the phone (they seems care).
Book any other hotel in Las Vegas but not this one.

We brought our kids to Vegas for first time to go to a concert. We had heard decent things about Flamingo so decided to try it. We come to Vegas a few times a year and have stayed at TI, Mirage, Paris, New York New York, Monte Carlo, Golden Nugget and Downtown Grand. I paid more online to get the "Strip View" and the rooms looked updated and remodeled in pics. 

 First thing we rolled into valet and nobody to be found. Went and parked in garage. The walk from garage along outside is littered with trash and cigarette butts. We did self checkin and got to our room at 2am. The elevators are dirty and the walk to our room is long. Doesnt even have a fridge or coffee pot which i heard is an extra charge after the fact. We could find two outlets to charge 4 phones that weren't in the bathroom.  Room is run down with furniture delaminating and falling apart. Our strip view was an alley between hotels that you could look to right to see Hi Roller or left to see Mirage hotel sign if you press your face against the filthy windows. Not a strip view.  To top it off we got to listen to nightclub blaring music until 4am every night from the alley. We got 3 towels in our double queen room. Requested 4 and next day only got 3 again. The vent doesnt work in shower so when one of 4 of us showered it fogged the mirror so bad nobody could use it and there was 4 of us. Hot water in sink takes about 5 minutes to reach the room. The beach club pool which is for families is small , has no pool service and all water slides talked about are in adults only pool. Interaction with employees was mediocre. Nobody seemed to care. It was like an overpriced motel 6. Have always had great experiences at mentioned hotels but this was a joke. Would never go back or reccommend anyone else going there. Paid over 800 for 3 nights.....what a rip off.
The rooms are dated and the furniture is sparse and old... no chairs to sit on.. the hotel is to spread out and it takes a long time to walk out to get a cab...

My wife and I just spent 4 nights here and this is a different and difficult review. The hotel is in a prime spot on the strip and this will always appeal to people no matter what the price or condition of the resort and there's nothing wrong with that. We didn't use the pool but it looked nice and was always full. The poker room was great (2-4 limit) and I was always able to get a seat with just a few minutes wait. Dealers were out- standing and a pleasure to interact with at all times! Gaming in general was good and won some money on slots (maybe I can but a dinner our two). Centered in a prime location it's easy to get to other locations by walking to see what else might be available for you to explore. Our room was very nice on the 24th floor right across from Caesars Palace and we could see the fountains at The Bellagio go off. This was one of our better views we've had in Vegas. The room was clean and on the newer side. The bathroom was large and clean, overall the room was a pleasure to stay in. Now a bit on the down side with no stretching the truth. The hotel it's dated and does not appear that they are trying to put any serious money into it. The elevators are a serious...serious...serious joke (see photo). Buttons missing, buttons that as you left the ground floor they would go blank and would have to be pushed multiple times to reach your floor. I stepped on one elevator (working) ALL the lights were out...totally black inside...got off right away! Check in, WOW if I live to be a hundred I'll never see anything like that line again. Talking to some employees all they comments were "...it's very embarrassing that they done have staff to cover stuff like this...". All in all it was a ok stay. Some good out weighed the bad...Some bad out weighed the good. Would I stay here again....probably not, but someone might and that's ok, I just prefer to get what I pay for, no matter where it is on the strip.

Our vacation was this July 3-7, 2017. We arrived very late. 1am on the 4th. The weather, was great. 100+ every day. I love the heat the hubby not so much. We were not able to check in until 4 pm. So we went to another hotel for the night. The Best Western down the strip was able to accommodate us immediately. And for the same price.  The next day we finally checked in at the Flamingo and went to our room. It was a king bed. There was a great view of the pool from the tenth floor. I also liked that they did not have carpeting. The room seemed to be renovated recently.  Although, my husband thought the lamps were from the 60's. Lol. We did not spend a lot of time in room except to shower and sleep. There were a few things that needed attention though. 

The bathtub faucet continually ran. Not dripped but ran. We put a towel in the tub so we did not hear the constant drops.  The wallpaper above the window was peeling in the corner. The lightbulb in the bathroom was not working. I couldn't figure out why it was so dark. Until the second day. The drain in the sink was very slow going down. My biggest concern was the outlet next to the bed appeared to have a prong broke off in it. I did inform the clerk when I was checking out. I told him it may be a fire hazard. He did note that in the checkout notes. But nothing else. 

When you stay here, at least in our room, there is no refrigerator there is no microwave   You need to pay for the shuttle to and from the airport, about $7 a person. That is about the same as a cab. 

It is a beautiful hotel.the only problem with walking the casino or going sightseeing is the people who stop you constantly to purchase shows and stuff. It gets really pushy at times. If I wanted tickets I would get the or ask how to get them. It's not just in the casinos or hotels it's everywhere. The one concierge was extremely helpful  was named Ron. The self check in kept telling us to see the clerks. He was able to explain what we needed. 

You can also check your luggage before check in if you are early. Then , they will deliver it to your room when you get there. The people working the luggage check in were great. Very helpful. Gave recommendations for sites and where to eat. 

Would I stay there again? Probably, if I went with my brothers who are high rollers. They get comps and upgrades all the time. This was our first time. My daughter gave us a tip, to get the three day bus pass. Unlimited ridding. Use the phone App. You will need to update every day the app. 
Even with the bus pass I logged 15 miles on my Apple Watch for three days.

I stayed in one of the Go-Deluxe Room, Pretty nice but my TV Remote in the bathroom was missing the battery cover but nothing major.  The pool was very nice and clean. The only complaint i have is i bought coffee\/ food from the lobby and when i brought it to the pool they didn't allow it because they wanted you to buy it inside. I wish i knew that before i bought the coffee\/Food!! They should allow drinks\/food if i bought it from the same Hotel or at least notify people with a sign in the rooms or something. Anyways, they need to figure out a system for that.

We stayed here October 20th & 21st, 2012.   The Cons: The Hotel is worn down, rooms have been upgraded, but poorly.  The floors are the plastic wood and the TV's are small 32' flat screens.   The carpet in the hallways are so old they are buckling up.  Yes, in Vegas, the rooms are mainly for sleeping, but a decent room always makes the stay all that much nicer.  The air is stale and rooms have low ceilings which I can touch and I am only 5'3".   We used to stay here regularly in the mid to late 90's, but the Hotel has definitely gone down.  Sunday night the electricity went completely out in the north wing -all 28 floors!  The elevators worked, but no water on the upper floors.  Electricity was out for about 3-4 hours, but was restored by 11:00pm.  
The Pros:  The Lobby is still presentable and their pools are still nice. Lots of plants, birds, waterfalls, picture spots.   Self-check in is a plus.   Carlos and Charlies is an ok close place for drinks and decent meal.   Margaritaville is conveniently located for a nearby drink hangout.  Conveniently located in the middle of the strip.  Don't think we'll stay here again anytime soon.   
The Recession shows on this hotel and per the reviews, it seems like other Hotels are in disrepair.  
Sad.

Stayed at the Flamingo in Las Vegas for a few days haven't been there in a few years and surprised how much the hotel has been run down from lack of maintenance the faucet in the tub in the bathroom run the whole time we was there air conditioner made noise all the time the buffet don't look any different than it did last time we were there several years ago when we checked out elevator we waited for 10 minutes for the elevator to stop on our floor it never did  only stopped on the upcycle  we got on the up cycle took elevator to the top floor and then push the lobby button and went to the Lobby non-Stop buffet was also disappointing compared to previous visit overall I guess you get what you pay for but they still get over 30 a day for their fee which includes internet and weight room but we use none of them

I must say the upgraded rooms aren't that great unless u get the room with a jacuzzi tub in it. The rooms here are out of date and the rooms contained a radio that doesn't work. Their were bulbs missing in the room and the staff uphold the room\/upgrade to us but it was nothing like they described it as. However I LOVED how we were close to everything! At night be sure not to let random guys follow you upstairs because they have a few creepy men that'll linger around in the lobby\/casino area.

Staff was alright they can be friendlier but the view is AMAZING! I'd book here primarily for the location!

I've decided that the worst job ever would have to be a dance by the penny slots at the Flamingo. And the girls were actually really hot too. Maybe one of these days they can work their way up to the dollar slots, gotta dream big.

Our entire Flamingo experience from top to bottom was nothing short of terrific. From the check in that zipped right along and where the desk agents made you feel like a valued guest (shout out to Mike who was super accommodating) to the dealer's, the shopkeepers, housekeepers, and bar tenders we never felt like any less than honored guests. Our Fab room was sparkling clean, fresh and modern. Prices are super reasonable. We had a view of the Bellagio fountains from our bed out of the floor to ceiling windows with electronically controlled drapes and black out curtains. Note to sports gamblers, this might be the only book on the Strip where you can gamble while you smoke and lounge in your overstuffed leather chair. We will be staying at The Flamingo when we return in a few months. Heck, we might just make them our go-to Vegas home away from home. Do not hesitate to book your Flamingo stay because of some harsh past reviews. The price, location and welcoming vibe is unmatched by other hotels on the strip whos rates are far higher. Thank you to the Flamingo staff for making our stay such an awesome vacation.

I think this was great. The price was okay and the location is perfect.
They re-did their rooms and are still undergoing renovations. The rooms are re done but you can tell the place is aged- oh well.

The staff was all friendly. The parking was easy, and the pool was fun.

I gave it an A-OK because its a good place \/location and I've seen nicer, and worse places. There also was no mini fridge?!

The place that built Las Vegas. They have flamingos and pinguins in the gardens. The shops and restaurant selections are not as good and diverse as other hotels, but they fit the bill for some late night snacking.

It was my first time staying at the flamingo , and it would be my LAST !! We spent 3 nights for the holidays in a pet friendly room . As I made reservations it said our pet would have treats and a bowl to welcome it , but to our disappointment there was none. That was my first complain, second the bed that was in the room had a big whole in the center as if it was attacked by a dog and they didn't even bother to replace it, I mentioned it to the housekeeper but she even said she wasn't surprised that it hasn't been replaced. Third complain was the dam elevators ! We stayed on the 17th floor, as we were leaving 2 out of the 6 elevators were working !!!! It was ridiculous, my sister and I decided to take the stairs since it was impossible to keep waiting for the dam elevators so we had to carry our luggage straight down from 17th floor , talk about a dam work out. My mother waited for the elevator because it would of been to much for her, as she waited people would fight and I mean FIGHT just to get a spot inside those none working piece of crap elevators. So much money is invested in the hotel and the owners are so cheap not to bother for renovations or even fixed those old school elevators! When it can to check out they had two lines one for check in other for check out , I waited 30mins in line just to be told we were all in the wrong line , clearly the sign said "check out" everyone got really upset at the staff for being super unorganized with the line mixed up. I brought the elevator situation up to front desk and told them I was really bother for the fave that only 2 elevators were working and of course their reaction was " I will bring it up to the manager ." Uuuumm okay then .  I'm so upset that I didn't take the moment to check reviews on this hotel. I'm not writing this review to throw shade but it wasn't worth all the hype at all. No wonder it only has 2.5 stars. I go to Vegas often and NEVER EVER ! Did I have a horrible experience as this one  .

Ive stayed at almost every hotel on the strip and this is by far the worst!  The view from the room was terrible, the amenities were nil to zero, and the room was dirty with cobwebs in the corner.  I asked to change rooms and they never got back to me.  I could have been a dick but its not my style. Caesars\/Harrahs needs to do a big renovation to this place.  The problem is the place was still packed.  Must be nice...Own a dilapidated hotel\/casino and still print money.  Ill never be back.  Flamingo you suck!

I agree with Becky C (reviewer below) - if there was a zero star for this horrendous place I would have given it. This hotel is vile - it's designed to extract money from you from the minute you set foot in it- it's tacky, the staff are robots and they even charge to use the safe! We upgraded to a remodeled room and it was okay nothing special our friends had a room that hadn't been remodeled and it was horrible. I will never ever set foot in this place again.

I got exactly what I needed and expected for $35 a night. But what I needed and expected may not be the same as your needs and expectations.

While the rest of the Strip resorts were priced at $99+ per night (except the God-forsaken "Quad" next door), the Flamingo offered a standard, partly remodeled and generally clean room for $35\/night. It was perfect for my trip with friends. If I were out to impress someone; if I were on a romantic get-away; or if I were a hotel inspector, I'd upgrade or choose another property.

Here are the pluses and minuses.  If all you need is a comfortable room, a prime location, and a great price, definitely consider the Flamingo.

PLUSES
--Spacious room. Newly redone with faux hardwood floors. 
--I requested a room away from Quad construction, near an elevator. My room faced Bally's (perfect) and was 10 steps from the lifts.
--Friendly housekeeper saw me step out of my room at 11am and asked if I enjoy beer. Of course I do. She pointed down the hall toward a cooler full of Bud Light that another guest left upon departure. After she declined my marriage proposal, I flipped her a five and drank some breakfast. 
--Comfortable bed, pillows and linen.
--Quiet. I didn't hear any room-to-room noise. My room was directly next to the door housekeepers use to access the back of house. These rooms are infamous for being noisy as employees bang carts and vacuums and slam doors. Not at Flamingo. I heard no staff noise whatsoever.
--Outstanding location for Strip activities and easy access to downtown buses.

MINUSES
--Mold visible along tub grout.
--Air duct cover screwed on haphazardly.
--Dim bathroom lighting (no bueno for the ladies)
--No fridge.
--No blanket on bed--only a couple of sheets and a VERY creepy pink\/white\/black fake fur throw. 
--My room was ready when I arrived at 8am, but Flamingo charges $30 to check in before noon; $15 to check in before 4. If the room is ready, early check-in fees are nothing more than gouging. This was my least favorite part of the experience.
--I experienced no line upon arriving at 8am. However, I saw very, very, very long check-in lines during the evening hours. The front desk is clearly understaffed for a property of this size. Self check-in kiosks are available. Consider using them.
--Debris--a dry cleaning tag, a small pile of white stuff that looked like drywall--remained in the hall way on my floor the entire length of my stay.  I saw a room service tray discarded by another guest sitting in the hall for at least two days. Considering that, as stated above, my room was directly next to the door every member of the housekeeping team uses to access my floor, the fact that these items remained in place is....telling.
--$13.99\/day Internet fee.

My husband and I just got married in Vegas.  We had never been to Las Vegas before, but we chose to stay at the Flamingo because of its central location on the strip.  We even created a room block there to accommodate our 25 guests.  Most of our guests ended up right in the same hallway as us!  I think everyone would have if it hadn't been for people arriving different days, and it being the busy holiday time.  

Even though it was xmas week we were able to stay for 50 bucks a night for six nights.  Rates went up to 150 on Friday night because it was the weekend before new years.  I think for $50 per night and a little more on one day this was the perfect hotel for us.  We got the cheapest room you could get, but we still had a pretty good strip view.  We could see the Bellagio Fountains.  The room wasn't too fabulous, but it was just fine for us.  If we did it again we would probaby get a go room.  One of our friends had a Go Room and for not too much more the room is quite a bit nicer.  No, these rooms are not what you will find in the fancier hotels, but for a young couple staying there for a whole week it was just great.  Room service tasted pretty good too!

The casino was fun, and we LOVED Margaritaville.  We ate there three times and spent a decent amount of time, and money, in that casino.  

The best part of the Flamingo is the location on the strip.  You really can't beat it!  We took turns walking south one day and then north the other day and really got to see all of the neat places\/hotels that we wanted to see.  WHEN we go back to Vegas we will definitely stay at the Flamingo again!!!  : )

After looking for the best deal, and most conveniently located hotel, that was somewhat affordable in Las Vegas during CES, Dan and I settled (and SETTLED we did), for the Flamingo Hotel. Within walking distance of the Venetian, where we could visit many of the exhibitors, and easily catch a shuttle to the Convention Center, the Flamingo Hotel turned out to be the SECOND MOST DISGUSTING PLACE in which we have ever stayed. Rooms at this hovel (not a typo) range from 35.00 in the low season to 289.00 for rip off season. They have a lot of nerve.Arriving at midnight after a LONG ASS day of flying due to a snow storm in our layover city, Chicago, all we wanted was a quick bite and a comfy bed, on which to rest our pretty heads. Sadly, the line to check in, had at least 20 people in front of us. We waited patiently, knowing that would happen very soon. We checked in, then walked through the smoky filled casino to the FOOD COURT to grab a bite.
We waited on line to order a burger and salad, at Johnny Rocket's. seconds, I finally go to order my long awaited tuna salad, at 12:00 midnight and 3 seconds. "We don't serve tuna after midnight". I perused the menu, and SETTLED on a turkey burger. "We don't serve turkey burgers after midnight", said the fellow at the cash register.
"Are you kidding me?", I asked. He wasn't."We serve burgers or eggs", the young man told me.
Dan ordered his burger and I sauntered over to the other seemingly healthy food option, a Chinese Chicken Salad from L.A. salad and wraps.
Suffice it to say, the CHICKEN that was on top of this lettuce, green onion, fried chinese noodle mix, was not EXACTLY chicken. It was other worldly. I think maybe it was chicken roll or something else fashioned into a flat cutlet type thing.
We guzzled the food, and couldn't wait to get upstairs, proving that when I'm hungry I will eat anything.
Arrving on the 8th floor, it was clear that they place was a well worn. The halls weren't all that clean. I take that back. They were gross. There were rips in the carpet, along with gum smooshed into it. The doors were all dirty too. I chalked it up to old age, and was a little forgiving, but still not happy.
The room came with a view (this was NOT it), and all the loud sounds that come, an entire city block of construction. Right outside my window! The room, with its ancient furniture, wasn't HORRIBLE.
The roach crawling on the wall, on the other hand was.The bathroom was replete with toothpaste. Oh, not toothpaste to use with my toothbrush.
This toothpaste, was in the air conditioning grates....Perhaps the maid missed it...All five days, that we stayed there.
She also missed the q-tip that was stuck in between the missing tiles. Well, they weren't missing, they were just behind the toilet. She did miss the giant hair that was stuck to the ceiling also.
None of this was nearly as nauseating as the 2 inches of dust, that was living in the bathroom lighting fixtures. Let's just say the place is a little run down. Understatement.
The toilet was also DISGUSTING. ALL FIVE DAYS.
After checking for bedbugs, assuming that the housekeeping staff, would make sure that the room was really clean the next day, we HAD TO GO TO sleep. It was already after 1:30AM, and I was in no mindset, to call to bitch and moan. Did I just say that? We had to be up and out by 8:00AM, and I needed some rest.
I woke up with a stiff neck from using pillows that ranged from 6-8 inches high. Right before we left in the morning, I called housekeeping and asked for one, only one, DECENT pillow, explaining that these were all too rubbery and hard and I couldn't afford to work CES with a neck ache. She said, "Sure thing. No problem."
Later that night ( it was actually the next morning at around 1:30), we arrived back to the room after a LONG day of press events and parties, ready for sleep. The beds had been made, the garbage disposed of, towel folded, and sink cleaned. The toothpaste, dust, broken tiles and q-tip all remained untouched. Doesn't the housekeeping staff get trained in CLEANING?In addition, as far as I could tell, there was no pillow replacement. They all ranged from 6-8 inches high, and impossible for me to use. I slept without one.The next morning, with another crick in my neck, I called to ask about the pillows. This time the answer was, "Those are the ONLY pillows that we have. They are all the same. The housekeeper brought you a new one". I scratched my head. We spied these two pillows on the floor....yes I said, "on the floor", in front of another guest's room. They were there for at least 8 hours. Clearly I am not the only one, that doesn't like sleeping on HARD RUBBER. But I digress.

Ah Vegas, We were at the Flamingo this weekend. The building was like an IceBox all weekend. Since I test a\/c units everyday my guess is it was 60 degrees in the whole building. When at the ProLabs Inspectors conference and Picking up some CEs at a Plumbing class. I heard something dripping, looked over to see water running down a wall in the Reno room near an electrical outlet. The elevators gave every rider and I, the shared concern and worry that we might not make it out alive. There were noises of rattling and unusual elevator behavior. Looked up to see the ceiling of the elevator vibrating back and forth. A lot of this place needs some serious upgrades. While heading to our room we were met with high sale pushy vendors trying to sell time shares. While gambling one night was met with another dubious caractor who asured me, he could help me make thousands at the crap table. Yeh right dude. The remodeling of another building across the way started early and woke us up at 6:am. The last morning the fire alarm went off somewhere at 5:30am. When we called the operator she didn't have a clue then checked with security who told here it was a test..........for an hour? Finally I check my bill on the peace of CR$P TV in our room to find out they over charged me. They corrected my bill. All and All the convention was great, I learned a great deal and appreciate ProLabs sponsorship. Perhaps they should find a new location next time. We had some great meals at the big mall down the street one of the best was at Buddy Vs. We couldn't eat in our hotel because neither my wife nor I thought about bringing a sweat shirt to stay warm in Vegas!

Just got back from Vegas yesterday. I missed my bed and my shower.
Gave this hotel 2 stars... Let me tell you why:
- Elevators sucked. One was down the entire time. Another one was possessed. It kept on opening and closing and then at times, the floor button lights disappeared so if you are not paying attention, you will miss your floor.
- Rooms: not bad.
- Bathroom: in order to be on the same floor with my friend, I got a handicapped room. First night, I showered and enjoyed the hand held shower but when I got out, half the bathroom floor was wet! I ended up having to turn on and off the water during my shower bc if I left it on, the water will spray right into the other side of the bathroom.
- Housekeepers: awesome.
- Front desk: not really welcoming... I needed packing tape and searched all of the hotel shops but could not find any so I decided to call the front desk. They didn't even try to find any for me. My husband works at a hotel in Waikiki and he said their hotel will try to accommodate their guest's request.
- Habitat wing: sucks a$$! Change, stretch or repair your carpets!!!! Wth! I tripped I don't know how many times! Room was so far from elevators. It was ridiculous! AND THE MUSIC BLASTS TILL 4 AM! Really?!!!
We came for a conference, so at 8:30am, listening to speakers was very hard to keep awake! Walls are paper thin. For some reason, I had a connecting door in my room! I could hear everything! Omg!
Will not ever stay here again!
Sorry so long!

Our first room was disgusting. We had booked a suite and got up to the room and there were stains all over the carpet. We were in the non remodeled side of the hotel. We immediately went back downstairs and told them the room was unacceptable. They upgraded us to a bigger suite. It was big however still in the non remodeled portion of the hotel. Very old and also carpet and bathrooms were gross. Walking To the hallway to our room the carpet was ripped in places and was coming up from the floor. I don't think we will be staying at the flamingo any more.
Got a cabana with buds at the pool for the pre Jimmy Buffett party. Was definitely worth it!
Not nearly as run down nor outdated as I had expected. Great history nice grounds to go walk around. ADULT only pool ROCKS!

We live in Souther California and we travel on a regular basis and we travel to Las Vegas at least 3-4 times a year.  We are no strangers to nice hotels and great service.  

Before you make your reservation, please note that the Flamingo hotel is very old and unkempt.  It is very dirty, the elevators are broken and unsafe (they will tell you that they are in the process of being repaired).  There is no safety switch on them and they will close on you; it hurts!   

The hotel staff provides an extremely low level of customer service and they have an excuse for everything.  "Busy weekend","Undergoing repairs." or "Sorry I have not heard anyone else say that there was a problem with that before."  A great example....Guests on the 8th floor were locked out their room 3 times in two days - with an hour wait for security to come up and get us in each time.  I spoke to the front desk and they claim management had no idea.  Well, house keeping was locked out of the 8th floor, security was locked out of the 8th floor and your guests were locked out of the 8th floor.  How did you not hear?  So many excuses!  

Want something to eat or drink at the pool?  Well, you'll have to go to the snack bar because there are no servers to take care of you at the pool.  At any given time you'll stand for 30-60 minutes at the snack bar for food and drink.  And yes, you have to stand in two lines.  

This entertainment group is struggling and it is no wonder why.

Absolutely the worst experience in any Hotel in Las Vegas ever! This is the Worst of the Worst., an absolute dissapointment  by far, everything from the horrible Valet Parking, to the broken down elevators, to the broken shower head, and to make it the number 1 worst in Las Vegas?? Roaches! That one just did it for me.. Overpriced, and completely run down! No fridge, no Microwave, and horrible check-in! I'm honestly surprised they are still in Business..

I stayed at the Flamingo from Sat-Monday last weekend, 2 beds in the Go room. I paid $90 the first night and $30 the second with my players card.

The GO ROOMS are the only way to GO! Way worth the extra $15 a night if they offer it. The Flamingo has restaurants that are affordable, never had to wait for a cab, check in was easy, casino is awesome, I love love love this place. 

Call me crazy but I would rather stay here than the Wynn!!!!!!

It took over an hour to park. I called the hotel and said the lot was full, they said to park at another hotel. The hallways are full of loud drunk idiots at 2am. The elevators are messed up. Who's running this place? I'd save your money and go somewhere else.

The Flamingo is one of the last standing hotels on the strip that is over 10 years old. You can tell this when you walk in however first appearances here are not the whole experience.
Did my family stay here over my graduation from college weekend, yes.
Did I love eating at Margaritaville, No
However lovely other surprises such as the pool came about while wondering the grounds.
The rooms are decent and if you get a strip view, its a fantastic view!!

I'm not really sure where to start.... I'll be honest, I like to travel to Vegas for a little bit of pampering and spoiling and tend to stay at either the Venetian, Bellagio or Wynn when in town... But his time round I was on a work sponsored trip for a conference that was being held at the Flamingo and so I thought it made more sense to stay at the conference location regardless of my hesitation..... Big mistake!! 

Arriving on Sunday at 5pm I proceeded to wait in the check in line for 45 minutes before finally making it to the front of the line and then being told that I had booked a room that had not been updated and was, in the receptionists words, 'very old, very outdated and a little smelly' but they could move me to the updated GO rooms for no additional charge - I agreed and grabbed my keys.  

The elevator trip up to the room was interesting to say the least (forget the rooms flamingo! Maybe it's time to update the elevators) and a couple of times I thought I may end up spending my night in the elevator trapped!! Unfortunately this experience occurred everytime I got in the elevator and some times it was even more 'exciting' as I had to dodge the vomit or other miscellaneous liquid on the floor.

However my biggest concerns while staying were the fact that (1) upon checking in you sign away all of the hotels liability for anything that goes missing from your room (what?!?!?!) or any damage or theft to your vehicle if parked in their parking structure via valet or self park (double say what?!?!?!?) during your stay (2) the hotels wifi digital security certificate had expired and I therefore couldn't connect my work computer to the wifi the entire time I stayed and (3) there is room service only between the hours of 6am and 1pm and the menu is limited to say the least... Talk about and uncomfortable and inconvenient stay... Next time I have a conference I'll stick with what I know, regardless of where the conference is being held!!

Got here and finally got checked in,  my friend almost stepped in a puddle of blood getting into the elevator... I yelled at her and she stopped before carrying someone's DNA around the CASINO. The room smells kinda bad, we've been here about 40 minutes and the clock still says 12, but it's  not even flashing...there are kinda sketchy outlets and the lights are flickering sooooo kinda afraid to plug in the phone chargers. Jen
has been on the phone TRYING to get anything else,  even another hotel. This it's a DEFINITE no star experience. I REALLY pray it gets better!

Update.... for 200.00 we can upgrade hmmmm NO!

Where shall I start we had so many issues it's hard to remember them all! 
1 The line to check in took over an hour they only had 3 check in windows open, asked if they could open more but they weren't able to. AFTER waiting patiently for more than an hour we get up to the window to check in we are informed that the rooms he booked we're not able to be adjoin, if we wanted adjoining  rooms we would need to get the older not upgraded rooms. 
2 We we're basically forced to upgrade since they no adjoing "Go" rooms. The reservation ajents should be aware of what rooms connect and what rooms don't. 
3 When we finally arrived in our room 21-107 it was beyond dirty!!!! When I pulled the sheets back to double check I was shocked to find a pubic hair and a long black hair. There we're splatters on the restroom mirrior from someone brushing their teeth or washing their hands. The tray where the coffee was had a layer of coffee on it!! There we're also empty toilettre boxes on the vanity area. I went down to complain and spoke with Shaun the guest relations manager he apologied for the room and assured me that the house keeping manager would be up to take care of these things.  Needless to say the hk manager never showed up, instead he sent a housekeeper who was shocked to see that the rooms was so disgusting, she did a wonderful job cleaning it up. 
4 The pool was freezing cold, it supposed to be heated but I really doubt that. Kids we're disappointed that the water slides weren't open. 
5 Friday morning they had to "shut off the water boliers" leaving us no choice but to take freezing cold showers. 

If I wasn't with a group off people who were also staying at the hotel we would have not stayed after seeing the digusting room but I  didn't want to ruin anyone elses time! 
 
Our stay was March 23rd check out on the 25th

Completely Not satisfied with our stay

Flamingo is the WORST hotel EVER. I would recommend not going. They need better customer service and a new manager. I have never in my life dealt with such rude staff ever. I booked four rooms at the flamingo a couple months in advance for a bachelorette\/ birthday party and when I came to check in, a staff member told me that I owe more money without explaining herself. When I asked her to explain, she gave me attitude. Once the manager arrived, he explained everything and helped me understand that our rooms have been paid for, but it has only been charged for one night and then it will charge the rest of our stay. Finally, things were going well. Then all of a sudden at 1am (the morning before check out) one of our rooms were locked and we couldn't get back in. I called once and then said a security guard would show up to unlock the doors. When he never came, I called again and I was informed that I had to come to the front desk to solve the problem. So at 1am, I came to the front desk to figure out why we couldn't get into one of our rooms, and the manager gave me attitude and just said someone made a long distance call. I had no idea what that meant or why he mentioned it. I just wanted to know why my group couldn't get into their room and get some sleep. Finally, he explained that when someone makes long distance calls, you get charged but because the card hadn't been authorized, they locked us out. After he explained so rudely, he then said someone needs to pay $250 to open the room. After I paid, the manager gave us new keys and checked that they worked. I walked back to room and what do you know, the keys don't work. It's now 2am, and I have to call again to get the room unlocked. By 2:40am, we finally got the room unlocked. I can't understand why we would get locked out or why it took 2hrs just to unlock a simple room. I will never stay at the Flamingo hotel again and I hope no one ever has to deal with terrible service here or at any other hotel.

Might not be fair reviewing this hotel AFTER staying at the ARIA. Check in was really quick since they had the kiosks for express check in rather than having to stand in a line, one star. Had a room on the 9th floor, 122.  The view was literally the back of the main flamingo lights and an obstructed view of Ceasars Palace.  At first glance, the room looked ok. But when I slept on the bed, I noticed I started to itch. Don't know what it was, but I didn't bother to say anything and just slept on the leather couch\/bed.  ( I was only staying that one night.) 

The walls seemed paper thin because I could hear the conversation in the room next to me... it was Tagalog.... LOL

The bathroom was very basic, nothing special. The tub faucet kept dripping. I tried to see if I could shut it completely, but could not. My Ice bucket was still partly filled with water, don't know if it wasn't cleaned from the previous guests.

I give it another star for it's location to the strip. You can easily access the strip which was a big plus for me.  It's also within close vicinity of the monorail.

Arrived 11.30pm. 1 hour wait to check in. Toilet was clogged and flooded when we arrived in our room. Waited half hour for a guy to come fix and waiting now for a cleaner to mop... Its 1am!!! We want to go to sleep (and use the restroom!!) Very unhappy and so far have offered no compensation or upgrade for the inconvenience nor would they just give us another room! We will avoid their casino for the remainder of our trip and will not stay here again.

Update waited til 230am.

all of ceasers property. gaming room have very likeable dealers and floor persons. wen cards are not running your way and you r losing in a consistence flow. personnel workers r kind. they understand and dont want u to lose your whole life earnings. they actually tell you to take a break. they can see if a person is losing too much. i respect all of their property. gambling is a tough hobby. i have been to vegas many of times. and i feel that they are the most forgiving and generous hotel. they offer great comps and staff is so caring. i recomend all of ceasers property. its the best place to game
 all though the poker is a smaller game. the heart of the employees is awesome. i would like to offer my thanks for the morral support and all the free comps that they have offerex me. keep up the good work . Aloha. from the people of hawaii

Can I give this place no stars?

Pros: It was cheap and the room was clean... at first. 

Cons: When I slept in past noon the first day -- in part because it took more than an hour to find a parking spot since there is little to no parking, not even valet parking, at the hotel itself -- the room did not get serviced. I even called housekeeping to tell them when I was leaving since I had the "do not disturb" note on past noon, but when I came back in the evening the room had not been serviced.

When I called the front desk, I was told that putting up the "do not disturb" sign is the same as "declining service," and that once service was "declined" there is no guarantee you will ever get it. 

Declining service pretty much describes this place. Also, the patio at night -- don't look around too closely. It's crawling with some of the most amazing insect life you'll ever see. 

Also, booked a strip view room. I was 'upgraded' to a room with a view of... I dunno... it looked like Lebanon, but I was told it's a construction zone. When I told them that's not what I'd call an upgrade, they told me the room is slightly bigger, therefore it's an upgrade, and don't ask them to do anything else about it. 

If you have a limited budget and low expectations, go ahead and stay here. If you except hotels to have any even limited standard of service, there are much better options on the Strip for the same or a little more money.

A bad situation was skillfully turned into a great experience by box office manager Sherice!

A few days ago I had reservations for a show (Jeff Civilco) at the "cabaret" inside the Flamingo Hotel Casino. Went to the box office (will call) to pick-up the tix and was told the show was cancelled for the rest of the year due to an injury. Having driven quite a distance to see the show, I was disappointed. I asked the box office employee about possible things the Flamingo could offer to help resolve the situation. She had to ask her manager.

Enter box office manager Sherice. She immediately understood the problem and, with a smile, gave me some options. She was so kind and helpful, I was tempted to accept anything she offered. But, my schedule did not permit me to return later that evening for a different show. I explained. True to form, Sherice completely understood and offered other options. Of these, there was one that worked. Although still an inconvenience, I was impressed with Sherice's generous efforts.

This is an example of how one employee, Sherice, was able to change a customer's experience from bad to good. And, along with the experience, an overall appreciation for the Flamingo was turned from negative to positive.

My 5 star rating is more for Sherice than for the Flamingo. But, such was my impression of how she handled the situation!

Stayed at the Flamingo last year, stayed at The Mirage last week, and honestly, I will stay the the Flamingo again.  It's not super shabby and the building itself is anything but fancy-shmancy like the other hotels (it looks like a giant concrete box) BUT the GO-rooms are fabulous & the views are wonderful!  I love the pink, the separate shower and tub and the lighting is great!  The size of the hotel makes it just good enough to get in and out quickly, the employees are super nice and it's got that awesome old-school Vegas feel to it.  The pool was outstanding when we stayed, not crowded at all!   The taxi line was short and sweet, check in and out was a breeze and the casino dealers are fantastic!!  Super nice, friendly, and helpful.  And the location.....oh my!!!  It can't be beat anywhere on the strip!  Afterall, isn't your stay in Vegas all about location, location, location???  I won't even entertain staying at The Venetian, Caesar's, Bellagio, Paris or MGM...you spend more time walking to and from your room than actually enjoying your stay in Vegas.  I love the Flamingo!!  BEST stay on the strip!

Hot room! No...like 0 water pressure. Dirty floors, dirty & ripped bed sheets\/blankets, there was old food by the windows and under the chairs!!...seriously loud and vulgar neighbors, 15 plus ppl in one room. Lights don't work, no upgrade was available when we asked supposedly, yet online shows several available. Maintenance never showed up. 3 different guest service ppl and no one offered to help.  Fab deluxe 2 queen bed room. Stay away!!! Room smelled awful of smoke as well. Oh, and there is NO WiFi. They say there is WiFi, but our computers and phones never could even find the flamingos name to connect to.

Stayed two nights and had three rooms... Don't waste your time or money. I won't go back even if it is free.  If they demolish it, I want to be the trigger man on the dynamite and I'll pay big bucks to make it happen.

The elevators are a death trap. We had one drop about a foot while loading.  You talk about a scare! Doors wouldn't close over and over, more than half were not working at all, and the staff knew.  We were even told to avoid a certain bank of elevators but the entire hotel is full of dangerous, dirty, old elevators.  I heard stories of people being trapped while we were there.

While walking (sober) I nearly tripped and fell because the floor is uneven and carpet is loose and torn in various areas everywhere. They have taped some parts while others they did not even bother to patch so you can see concrete.

Room 1 was decent but the bathroom was ridiculously small and dirty.  I don't think we had shampoo and our A\/C went out.  I was sweating. The fan wasn't moving air and it certainly wasn't cold.

We advised them of the problem but the girl at the desk mentioned it was booked completely.  I asked to speak with a manager because we'd be leaving if that was the case. I'm not sleeping in a sweatbox.    Our second room was issued and we were pleased that you could actually have more than one person in the bathroom at a time....but...we think someone committed suicide in the room...and recently.  I wish I could ask law enforcement and find out for sure, or even taken a swab to have an analysis done.  Seriously folks.  A giant area of blood spray on the wall above the door connecting to the room next door.  You could see that the other walls were recently cleaned but apparently they forgot this section.   We were not sure we wanted to deal with it but we informed the management, showed pics, and they gave us some food credit so they could clean up.  We were out of the room for over two hours, came back, and nothing had been done.   I called and they were shocked.   I told them we wanted a new room, didn't care what they needed to do, didn't care if it was another total rewards property, I was not going to look at that mess and frankly I was a little creeped out.  They told me they didn't have a room, I sent my wife down to talk face to face.  Minutes later housekeeping showed up asking us if we vomited, "You have Bio?" was the exact phase she used..   She thought we had thrown up and was checking or coming to clean...I'm not sure because she had no supplies.   We showed her, she freaked out, took photos to send to her manager and then my wife text me to tell  to meet her at a new room. Room number 3.

It was the last room on the entire floor and I hate that.  When we opened the door it was cold, had a decent bathroom size, and was large....but... That was it.  We now had a room styled in the 90's, the bathtub shower was disgusting. They haven't seen a commercial for CLR apparently and don't know what mildew is.  I think the TV was a 19" tube. The channels had static, and the cabinet looked like it was rescued from hurricane Katrina based on the water stains.  Our beds were not queens but doubles.  I almost fell out many times, could feel springs in my back, and I'm sore like none other.  I would have slept on the floor but it was filthy and stained, like the entire hotels carpet.

In closing, visit the casino, Margaritaville, maybe even the pool, sure, but do not take an elevator, do not ask for a room, and I wouldn't waste time at the buffet either.   If you're rich and stupid, go enjoy the $16 pool drinks that are so sweet you can barely drink them.

This hotel was terrible. Checking in and out was a headache. Apparently they have four people working the front. 2 for checking in\/out and 2 for mail and key pick-up. No free wifi, the pool closes super early, and the sheets had stains in various parts of the bed, there was this disgusting fur like throw over the end of the bed that looked infested with dust and the towels in the restroom also had stains. I swear that there must have been bed bugs in room 6021 because the first day we checked in and went to take a nap, I woke up and a few minutes after I had a major bug bite welt on my back! My overall experience was horrible and to too it off I went to Vegas to see Celine Dion at Caesars palace to find out the a few hours before show time her show was canceled. But I'll write that review on Caesars later. The staff there at The Flamingo was not helpful and very nonchalant about everything. I will not go back there and I might not even visit Vegas anymore! Just not my kind of place :(

The Go rooms are ok, but the place needs a major make over. Its old, but fun to gamble at. I do like the tables and love Margaritaville. Staff was very nice. It was to cold to hit the pool but I walked around and it looks like on a warm day this place would be fun. So I like to gamble here, but thinks it needs some upgrades.

Well, we can say that this hotel is not too bad. The hotel itself is so-so. 

The garden with the animals is good. Pools are ok. A lot of people but it is not fault of the hotel. The staff is friendly and kind. 

I give 2 stars to this hotel because our room smelt to tobacco smoke every time. We hate this smell and sometime it was unbearable. The housekeeper tried to fight against the smell, but nothing changed (it is not his fault. He was very kind). Also, our room was connected with another room by a door. With which, if somebody wants to do a party you are in, even if you don't want. The bathroom was old and it needs to be upgraded. And the lifts too. 

In addition, you have to pay for wifi 15$ dollars per day!!! For us this point was important because we are from Spain and we want\/need to be in contact. This was very annoying for us above all because you don't pay in other hotels. Even if you are not a guess.

After our recent stay at the Flamingo, I have to delete a few stars due to the new Drais outdoor nightclub.  We stay for extended periods during our Vegas trips, so we do TRY to sleep.  The constant base beats til 5 a.m. proved to be a little much.  As Diamond members we are given rooms with beautiful views.  But the trade off for the views is too irritating!  So if we chose the Flamingo again we will now have to look at the backside of the Flamingo instead of the views we have spent the money to be comped.  We still love the people and the rooms, but will be moving on to another property!  Not great planning there Cromwell!

Just stayed the weekend at the Flamingo. First let me say it only cost about $400 to stay there for three nights. Very affordable. I only stay at total rewards casinos because I like my points. We thought staying at the classic flamingo sounded cool. There was mixed reviews online due to renovations. We ended up with a "partial renovated" room according to the desk. Only thing bad about the room was the bathroom. Very small. Can't fit two people in. Shower leaked water all night. Kinda annoying sound. Oh well. Casino was fine. Very casual atmosphere not ritzy so that was nice. Center of the strip which is perfect. The pool was awesome but it was jam packed with people. We rented a daybed so we didn't have to lay towels on the ground and get stepped on. So worth the money. Biggest downside of the whole stay was the elevators. Horrible conditions. Seems like only two worked at a time. Got stuck in one once. Very outdated. I'm very surprised their local code enforcement doesn't make them fix those. Where I'm from the elevator have to be inspected and ate very strict. Sometimes it was 20 minutes to get up to our floor. Overall stay was fine. It's very affordable strip hotel. It's due for more renovations. I'm sure they'll keep the improvements coming.

Where do I even start with this? Last week was my vacation\/wedding weekend and we've stayed at the flamingo twice already in the past with no problems. This was also about 6 years ago. I'm not sure if they've switched owners or new management but it was night and day from our past stays. We chose this hotel because of the location and our own personal reviews and boy, were we wrong. The moment we got there was just a hassle. From older woman coming out of every corner asking us if we want a vacation deal to just straight harassment. It got old staying there for two days and ALWAYS getting harassed.
