I consider my next maneuver and decide upon saying, "This is not a cosmopolitan." The bartender says, "Yes it is! It's all computerized!" I leave without paying

Avoid.

The rooms are pretty decent looking after the renovations. The bathroom sink however needed to be fixed or upgraded. There were a slight crack\/hole on the sink. The shower head shoots out water very slowly! I need stronger water flow. The bathroom was pretty small and not comparable to other casinos on the strip. I shouldn't complain since my room were comped but since I get comped at a few other casinos, I should try Harrahs next time around. Nothing too spectacular about Flamingo. However they do have a pizza place by the elevators that is open til very late which is great for the party goers.

I have always liked the Flamingo. Never got to actually stay there but a few years ago, my cousin did so zip got to check out the pool, spa, slot machines and the actual Flamingos. I loved the atmosphere actually but there are better places you can stay. The grounds itself were on point, cocktail waitresses serving the drinks while gambling were on point. It really is just a very old property in Las Vegas.

Rooms are relatively cheaper compared to the other nicer hotels on the strip.  Definitely nicer than ones like Hooters and Best Western (quite significantly so) but looks like doodoo compared to places like The Cosmopolitan (pretty expected).

Rooms were generally well furnished - we had the 2 queen bedroom.  It came with a 32" lcd tv, a single seat couch, and a small table.  The floors were also laminated hardwood floors.  However, it did not come with a minifridge...

We were in the smokers' room and it smelled pretty terrible.  Like constant burnt marshmallow (the smell you get once you go beyond the toasty marshmallow aroma...not nice).  The smokers' room at Hooters was surprisingly odor free (although the place had burnt marks all over the carpet).  

The main problem I had with this place was the lack of soap and hygiene products left by the housekeeper.  They gave a small vial of shampoo (which didn't really lather...strange...), small bottle of lotion, a small bar of facial soap, and a small bar of body soap.  I don't mind sharing the vial of shampoo and lotion but if I opted to stay in a room with 2 separate beds, it is pretty reasonable to assume that I do not want to share the same bars of soap with whoever I am staying with.  Why would I wash my crotch with the same bar of soap my friend washed his crotch with and then proceeded to wash his face with afterwards?  That would almost be giving an indirect.....nevermind. 

The pool is quite nice with a waterfall and EDM music playing in the background.  The water temperature was also perfect and warm (probably from everyone's pee).  I will say that 90% of the men had moobs that were bigger than majority of the women there.  Their nipples looked like salami.....ew...sorry, too descriptive.

DRUMROLL, PLEASE.... AND FOR MY 500TH REVIEW, ....I PICK  FLAMINGO!! 

I don't need a lot out of a hotel. I don't go places to sit in a room and I think we only turned our TV on once this trip. So fancy TVs don't impress me and I don't need much more than a comfy, clean bed. Our room had no fridge, no coffee maker, no plasma TV, but it certainly was clean! Perfect!

I was super excited when we checked in on a Saturday afternoon.  We had valeted our car for free and the neither the valet nor check-in lines were very long. Crossing through the casino to get to the room elevators, we could see the garden area outside. Couldn't wait to check this place out!  I've been to LV a million times but never stayed here. Now, I don't know that I'd ever stay anywhere else.

The walk to our room from the elevator was pretty far. Surprisingly far, but walking is good for us and so I wasn't complaining.  Our room was on the 10th floor and had one lamp with a lightbulb out, a faulty shower with a slippery floor and a broken ice machine on that level. It had pink and black decorations and a very clean wood-like floor. I hate gross carpets so this caught my eye first. One night of sleep and we agreed the bed was comfy but the pillows were not. Bummer - I love lots of fluffy pillows.

The second day we stopped at customer service and asked for a room closer to the elevator. Lots of people had checked out (since it was Sunday). The lady at the counter hooked us up with a similar room but on the 21st floor, very close to the elevator and with a working ice machine outside. Everything about the room was great and it was very clean.

Good experiences with valet all week. Great experiences with the staff.  Even the cashiers were extra friendly; drink service was fast; and bartenders had heavy pours. Bugsy's Bar is one of our favorites. 

We sat at the pool in the mornings. The GO pool (21 and up) wasn't open yet but will be in a couple of weeks, so it was important to get there early to get a lounge chair in the sun. This was not a problem. I had been getting up early every day. There was a bar at the pool, and you could not bring your own drinks in here. They ID'ed and checked for alcohol. I did notice a couple flasks around though.

One of the best features of Flamingo is the location. It's on the strip and centrally located. It's not one of the newest hotels but has undergone nice rennovations. We walked lots of places, even though we had a rental car. The watershow at the Fountains of Bellagio are just across the street. Quad is recently rennovated and closeby and Bills is presently undergoing construction. Paris is near, but we really liked the open-ness of the casino rooms at Flamingo best. We went next door to Margaritaville a couple times, since they're connected by a fun bar and some machines we bet pennies on.

The outside area had waterfalls and fountains, big sitting rocks and wildlife that included turtles, fish, and real flamingos. It was all fantastic. There aren't many stores inside, but there are a few for shopping (even one just for adults with some fun stuff!) and only a few restaurants (I recommend dessert from the steakhouse). The Pizza Joint stayed open till 2am, but we were in bed before that every night. 

You have to pay for the fitness center, but 30 flights of stairs are available for free. Save your money and run on the strip for free. Make sure to do it early because it sure gets HOT in Vegas. Spend that saved money on a show. The X Burlesque show was in the Flamingo and very, very sexy. Make sure to search for cheaper tickets online, and ask for discounts at the Players Club desk. The Total Rewards card you get will save you money in restaurants at other casinos, as well as the Flamingo. We also received free tickets to comedy shows and the Auto Collection showcase from the Players desk.

Spent a wonderful 5 days there and I already can't wait for the next stay here. Couldn't have asked for a better room for less than $100 a night! (A lot less with the deal we found!)

Spent a week at a conference hosted at the Flamingo. In general the hotel feels "tired."

Elevator buttons failed to work on several occasions. Numbers would not show on the elevator screen confusing folks.  Pressed floors would disappear completely causing the elevator occupants to go scrambling. 

The conference area thinks gaffer's tape is an acceptable carpet hold down as it was used in many places.l to fuse two pieces of carpet together.  And the temperature was sub-arctic. I was wearing a long sleeved shirt and a sweater and I was still cold. 

On our final night at the hotel our room was not cleaned. I called at 16h00 and was told they would do it. My wife called at 17h10 and they said they would do it. She then called at 18h30 and asked if they would instead simply bring us fresh towels. At 19h15 I finally went down and spoke to the hotel manager. Eventually they cleaned the room. And then threw in extra towels for good measure. 

Food was fair at best. My colleague visited the buffet for breakfast. When asked how it was he responded, "like the hotel."  This made another colleague laugh as she heartily agreed. This was her assessment too. 

We stayed in an updated room. The decor is pleasant and I appreciated the very large side table\/desks.

Water pressure was severely lacking in the shower. And I could never seem to get the water quite hot enough. But perhaps I have differing expectations about what is hot and what is enough pressure. 

Overall I would not stay here again if I had my choice. I typically choose to stay in the hotel where the conference is being hosted out of convenience. And this is the only way I would choose to return to the Flamingo Las Vegas.

Good and Bad.

I was working at the hotel with a seminar. The staff in the banquet staff we worked with was SO helpful. 

However, my room wasn't ready for me when I arrived and I had to kill time in order to get the correct room that I was supposed to be assigned. They didn't even really apologize or offer anything because i had to just sort of wait around for a couple hours. I was even a diamond member with the seminar that I was working with.

Its not a bad hotel and overall I would go again, but I would just say that I wasn't woo'd any which way.

I've been told the flamingo was recently renovated, and it showed in the rooms. The floors were nice, the beds comfortable, and the view of Vegas was probably the best part. I didn't visit the casino much, but it didn't seem like anything special. 

There were a few annoying things during our stay. They would only give us two room keys for four people, and coordinating between people with different agendas can be frustrating. We requested extra blankets for our room, and were told there were none available. That seems slightly ridiculous for a hotel of this size.

When you book the Flamingo - you know what you are getting into. This is a place where the ratchet come and be merry. You really only need a bed to crash in vegas - this will do the trick. It is also centrally located, so it is easy to get to the other hotels. HAVE A DRINK FOR ME AND MAKE SOME $$$.

This is a review for the pool only!  We stayed at Bill's Gamblin' Hall next door and got free entrance to the Flamingo pool.  This is an awesome deal because Bill's is cheap and the Flamingo pool is a great place to party!

It is quite a walk from the front of the casino to the pool.  You are not going to make a quick 15 minute stop at this pool.  

There is a security check when you enter the pool.  You are not allowed to bring in your own food or beverages.  They do allow you to bring in bottles of water though... 

The pool is a party from the moment you enter.  Packed at all times, loud music playing, and even girls in hot pink bikinis dancing on islands in the middle of the pool.  The day we were there a local radio station was hosting the party.  We had a great time watching the limbo contest they hosted.  

The downside is that seating is at a premium!  If you arrive anytime after about 11am, you will have to stalk people leaving to find a seat.  Hint: Get your seats at the pool the second you wake up in the morning.  We put towels, a bottle of water, and a magazine on two chairs at 10am and then went and had lunch.  When we came back 2 hours later, all of our stuff was still there and we had seats for the afternoon.  

This is a great way to spend the daylight hours recovering from the events from the night before.

I know 5 stars may seem a bit over the usual, but you gotta think about the entire picture here. My friends and I have stayed at the Flamingo for the last 2 years and are actually going again on May 2nd-4th of this year (2010). The Flamingo is right in the center of the strip and very many cool old-school casinos to which offer very inexpensive drinks. O'Sheas and I think its Casino Royale are fun places to gamble at and they are a mere 2 blocks from the Flamingo.  

The decor in the hotel rooms have been renovated. At least most of the rooms have been. They are funky-retro but classy modern. Flat panels everywhere even in their bathroom mirrors! 

Now we can talk about the pool......OMFG. Its such a nice pool! Really nice to just hangout or play volleyball and if you feel like, maybe head up to the top-less area if you want. Its very tropical and also has been renovated. Beautiful women everywhere, for the single men out there. And I guess there are guys for the ladies too. Tropical\/Chill\/Relaxing. 

Sure the Flamingo may not be thee most classiest of the hotels nor have the nicest pool, BUT for the price, you sure get a great deal.....besides, how many people hangout at their hotel room or pool anyway? SO having a hotel in the middle of A LOT of other nicer more prestige hotels is super nice. Cant wait for MAY!!!!
Thanks Ruth for the great customer service you provided!!! Executive suite had an amazing view!!!!

that Flamingos hotel was so dirty the rug looked like it was never clean or washed ugly smelly rooms, dirty!!! everything including the bed sheets ewww!! Eeukkk!
will never go back to that one for sure.

We were just robbed in our room at this death trap. After I came back to my room I shared my successful winnings with my wife while my children slept in the adjacent bed. After a while - I went to bed - not before placing my wallet filled with cash on the dresser. I woke this morning to find to my horror that my wallet was cleaned out - only a single dollar by the door. The fact is someone came in last night and robbed us while we slept. Security was called and an apathetic form was filled out and I was told they will basically get back to me. I was shocked to find out that they have NO cameras on the guest floors! I can't begin to stress how the LACK OF COMPASSION OR CONCERN left me even that much more incensed! I understand this is surely not the 4 Seasons - but I sure as hell didn't expect this pathetic excuse for a dangerous crap hotel! This is by far the worst!!!
I have never felt this raped in my life!

This will be short sweet and to the point I'm sorry I will stay at the best Western on the strip next time instead of the flamingo.  The waitress absolutely assholes when you ask to break money so you can tip them never seen someone bitching about free money.  Keep making tips acting like that.  And sec are you kidding me.  The rooms freaking suck what a waste of money and time here.  I went to the other hotels and was treated how I expected.  And I wasn't even staying there.  All I have to say is don't go here its absolutely horrible I'm not coming back ever.  I'll go stay somewhere else

I am currently staying here and want to leave a quick review. I'll add more detail after I get home. I was really nervous about staying here because of all the bad reviews so I wanted to let everyone know about my stay. We did the self check in from the automated email and requested to be checked in at 11. Our amazing room was ready 10 minutes early. All of the staff has been so nice and helpful. Our room is so cute with an amazing view. I'm happy I took the chance and reserved this room. I couldn't be more pleased. We are in a 2 queen smoking Go room and the smoke smell is not as intense as I thought it would be its not bad at all. Def stay here. It's a great value for the price.

I've stayed at the Flamingo twice too many times and I don't see myself staying here again (unless otherwise).

Both times I've stayed in the Fab Deluxe room and there's nothing really 'Fab' about it. Sure it's remodeled but it's just a basic room with two comfortable beds (I stayed in the Queen room both times), fake hardwood floors and a flat screen. The bathroom was NOT remodeled and looked like it's seen better days.

Both times I've stayed here, my keys stopped working....ummm that's not ok. Especially when I had to go downstairs and wait in a long line just to get a new one ughhhh.

The second time I've stayed here, we had some toilet issues and after about 2 hours someone finally looked at it (I could've fixed the toilet myself instead of waiting that long for a maintenance worker ha!) I was even offered a $30 credit for the 'inconvenience' but I ended up not using it (oh well).

Once thing I did like about this hotel is, I didn't have to wait in a line to check in. I checked in & out at one of the kiosks by the front desks. Now that was very convenient!

Another plus is the location! Right in the heart of the strip! I can't complain about that!

All in all if you are looking for a hotel in the heart of the strip & a room to take your naps, then the Flamingo is the place for you!

Booked a room from Thurs-Sun in mid November.  Less than $44\/night for the weekend, say what?  Keep in mind that I had a standard room, not a Go Room so I wasn't expecting much.  

A few days before my trip to Vegas, I came on Yelp to check out the recent reviews and got nervous considering how many reviews were complaining about getting a room where someone was already occupied in it.  A few stains based on wear and tear, I can live with (it is one of the oldest casinos on the Strip), but I really didn't want to walk in on strangers and have to deal with that awkwardness.

Alas, my trip came and went and all I have to say is THANK YOU FLAMINGO for giving me a good and cheap place to shower and sleep during a crazy drunken Vegas weekend.  No strangers to be found in my room, the stains on the carpet were minimal, the beds were comfortable and the shower was clean.  Plus, our view was not QUITE the strip as we were mostly facing Ballys but we had a great view of the Bellagio Fountain Show when it came on!

Location made it easy to get to almost anywhere without having to take a cab (except when it was late and cold) and when we got tired of getting robbed by the upscale casinos, we got to go back to our own casino and lose at a slower pace.

One more plus -- The Burger Joint at Flamnigo is awesome and is way better than Johnny Rockets.  Review for that coming soon.

If I'm on a budget, I'd come back to the Flamingo in a heartbeat.
Me and my family stayed out here couple weeks ago and I loved the rooms! Very clean atmosphere as well. Vegas I have no complaints; )

It's a mixed bag here with some definite strong pros but a few cons but I think overall, you can't go wrong if you know what to expect.

Pros: LOCATION, LOCATION!  It's in the middle of the strip so everything is within reasonable walking distance.  Room rates are a great deal, even for the weekend.  To get the deals, highly suggest that you sign up for their Rewards Card.  The rooms are decent and the remodel helps.

Cons: Despite their efforts to re-model, the parking garage is still dirty and old, the elevators too.  Speaking of the garage... way too small and not enough stalls and they directed guests to valet or park at Caesar's during the weekend.  I find this shocking for a hotel this size and on the Strip.  The check-in line is long 24\/7, there is never a time where a quick check-in is even possible.

Plus, when in Vegas, how much time do you spend in your room?  All you need is a decent place to stay and shower, so Flamingo is recommended in my book.

My husband & I went to Las Vegas on our honeymoon last month. We chose to stay at the Flamingo because we liked the idea of staying at the hotel & casino that has more history than any other in the city. Also, we wanted to have a great time but cost was definitely a factor & something we had to be somewhat conscious of while on this trip. We did some research on the more affordable options, including Circus Circus, the Stratosphere, etc. I am so grateful we chose the Flamingo. It is nicer than those mentioned above & several other older hotels. One of my favorite things about the Flamingo is the location. It is centered in the heart of the strip, next to Bally's, the Paris & Harrah's... across from the Bellagio, Caesar's Palace & the Mirage... not far from the Palazzo, the Venetian or anywhere else you could possibly want to go. 

Honestly, I thought the hotel was pretty nice. There are nicer, newer, flashier hotels on the strip, for sure, but the Flamingo is certainly nicer than your average hotel. I love the flamingo's, storks & other birds that guests can take a gander at. The pool was very nice also! It was very tropical & we thoroughly enjoyed our time by the poolside. The view from our room was nice too. It overlooked the Flamingo Habitat, the chapel where we were able to see several weddings taking place (from a distance, of course), and the pool. 

I hope they continue their renovations because, while the hotel isn't getting any younger, it still has the potential to be something great. However, nothing was a big enough issue to take away from our time there. I was also very appreciative of the little cafe right outside the elevators when morning would roll around! 


Our experience with the staff was only so so. We dealt with three front desk employees: one older gentleman had to assist us with our keys when one would not open the door & was very polite. The man who checked us into our room was alright. He definitely wasn't anything special in regards to customer service but I wouldn't call him "rude." He offered to "upgrade" us, which sounded all well & good at the time. The "upgrade" took us out of one of the remodeled rooms & put us in a "suite" that was very dated with old curtains & furniture. It was also the furthest room on the floor from the elevator... literally. I really did not mind our room, though. It was clean & nice but I feel like I was tricked into staying in a room that was not as nice as the room we booked. We also had an encounter with one woman who was incredibly rude. I wish I would remember what her name was because she is terrible at her job. 

Also, I know Donnie & Marie's gig is their big seller, but they have this enormous billboard promoting the show directly on top of one of the hotel's flashiest signs. It really takes away from the awe factor when the strip lights up. They would be smart to move it. 

One of my biggest complaints is the hotel imposed fee. I know people complain about them all the time & the hotels in Las Vegas just don't care. Its a ridiculous fee to begin with, but what's worse is, the internet in our room was a joke! It was so slow. Fortunately, we did not spend much time worried about the internet.

Overall, I had a wonderful experience at the hotel. They should have some staff meetings about customer service but other than that, I would recommend the Flamingo to people.

First time staying at the Flamingo (Feb 6-8). I was a little worried after some of the reviews I read but we decided to give this place a try. It was a lot nicer than expected. We had a normal king size room and we were more than happy with it. Check-in was super fast and the lady who helped us was very friendly. The room was very clean and we loved the big windows! The bed was a lot more comfy than I expected also. The Flamingo has a great variety of restaurants\/fast food. The casino was pretty good too. We seemed to stick to the video poker but they had a big variety of different machines. I will definitely consider staying here again.

My husband and I went to Vegas for the night for business he had close by the next day.  Check in was a breeze.  There were tons of people standing in line at the front desk, so we went straight to the kiosks and were done in 5 minutes.  

We were surprisingly impressed by the accommodations.  The rooms were spacious, clean, and they smelled nice.  The decor was very simple, but went very well with the historic theme of the rest of the hotel and casino.  We booked our room off a discount website, so the horrible view of construction wasn't too surprising.  However, the construction was so much that we didn't know how to get into the hotel.  Some direction at booking confirmation would have been very helpful.

We had a really nice dinner at Center Cut Steakhouse.  We started off with the servers suggestion, the bacon tasting.  If you love bacon you will love this dish!  Beware if the spicy roasted jalapeño!! It's REALLY spicy! My only complaint was the seating pattern the hostess was keeping.  I used to be a server in a very similar place, so I understand how the rotation works and how much more convenient it is for the server to have their tables close together, but I find it tacky and lazy to cluster people together in the dining room when there are so many open tables.

We hit the roulette table next where my husband came up on $600!  It was a nice, comfortable vibe at the table.  Cocktail service was on point too.

The gardens were beautiful.  We loved the rich history all over the property.  This is where all the old time mobsters hung out.  We didn't get to enjoy the pool, but we got walk around it and grab a drink at the bar.

The location of the hotel on the strip was ideal.  We saw a guy sucking on a girls boob just outside the Flamingo's casino on Las Vegas blvd as we walked over to serendipity.

I stayed at the flamingo in June for a bachelorette party because the bride-to-be loves the pool there. The pool is nice but don't think a day by the pool is going to save you money over staying on the casino floor.  There were 12 of us and we rented two daybeds, which requires at least $200 and bar tab in addition to the bed rental. Not a big deal but after an afternoon we racked up well over $600 for each bed and no one was drunk. A bucket with five tiny water bottles in it cost almost $40 to give you an idea of what I'm talking about. Meanwhile inside, everyone in our party had some kind of problem with their room. Four girls, including the Bride to be, had decided to rent a suite and share the space. Despite the fact that this was reserved months in advance, the front desk said they had no suites left and could only offer a room with two double beds instead. At a discounted rate. Which I'm sure was the standard rate for the room that they got. I'm pretty sure since the hotel was overbooked that they decided to give the suite to a guest they thought was more important. Someone else had a bathroom light burned out. This was requested to be fixed upon check-in but four days later it still has not been resolved. In my room, the space was really showing wear and tear. Parts had fallen off of various pieces of furniture and were not repaired, giving the overall sensation of being in a rundown hotel. There was so much dust on the dresser that I could write "dust me" in it. This went unnoticed by the maid service for two days, but the new shift on the third day took care of it. Someone else in our group had a fingernail on the floor and a water bottle from a previous guest sticking out from under the bed. The problem I have with all this is that the prices are not commensurate with this quality of lodging. It's not cheap to stay here! Basically I give the place two stars because it has a very desirable location in the middle of the strip and a nice pool. Don't think you're going to get a good deal for the experience you have though. It's overpriced and undermaintained. I don't see it changing. They have no reason to invest in upgrades when the place is constantly booked and overbooked.

I'm currently on the second night of a two night stay with my family. I usually prefer to stay at the Venetian but my family visiting from Europe wanted to stay somewhere cheaper. This hotel reeks of smoke and sewage. We are on a non smoking floor 22 floors up and the smoke is coming through the AC vent. The hotel is old and dirty. We called for extra towels and they never arrived. They refused to let us check in at 3.45pm because check in was between 4-6. We went to the Buffett for dinner and it's basically just frozen food heated up. Don't waste your time or money here.
Horrible experience at this hotel. Customer service was not even decent. The worst part was their valet and bellman. Never coming back ever again.

My husband's family was gathering at this hotel to get together.  I had warned my husband it is an older property, but he looked at the photos online and decided to stay here with the rest of the family.  I had thought about upgrading the room, but knew we wouldn't be in the room much so did not want to spend the extra. The bathroom was absolutely horrible!  Broken fixtures and the drain pulled completely out of the tub and sat in the soap dish all filthy!  He almost left to go and stay at my uncles house in Summerlin it was that bad.  His brother had paid for the upgraded room and it was a completely different room!  I suggest if you decide to stay here to definitely upgrade!!!

I stay at the Flamingo every year. I have had regular rooms and GO Rooms. They have all been great. Upgrade to GO if you can. The place is not a palace but its clean and not too massive. You can actually get to your room without a map. 
The location is right at the main 4 corners of the strip. Everything is close. The Paradise Garden Buffet has the best breakfast buffet around, I've seen Donny & Marie twice and am going again. Perfect show. 
Go for it and enjoy your stay!

The website shows nice remodeled rooms however the room I received has giant TV from a billion years ago, no cable a broken coffee table, and it reeked of weed when I walked in to my non smoking room. I called the front desk and they said they would bring up an air purifier but instead they sprayed nasty smelling spray all over the room. I was looking for ice while they did this and my friend was in the room. After walking around for 10min I could not find a working ice machine on my floor so I walked back to our room where two employees said oh yeah there is no ice on this floor so I walked back to my room. When I was about 6 rooms away from my room I could smell this crazy strong nasty fragrance... Then I walked into the room and it kicked me in the face. When I called to complain they said they would make sure housekeeping brought up an air purifier this time. 5 min later I received a call from house keeping that if we would like them to plug in the air purifier we would need to leave the room for a min of 30 min. REALLY! I worked all day and then drove for over 8 hours to get here, the last thing I wanted to do was go down and find somewhere to waste 30 min when I really just wanted to go to bed.
Love the place. They have a lot of cool animals and such recommended here (: wonderful people n  rooms

WOW!! Another weekend trip to VEGAS, yayyy!! This hotel is one of our favorite strip locations to stay. It's pretty centrally located for w-w-walking and you don't really have to TREK miles to get to self and\/or valet parking. Captainm the green wing macaw, greets you upon entering from the pool and valet areas. He talks, it is too cute! Check in lines are LONG when you get there ANYTIME between 12-3pm but this line moves quickly . . . why you ask? . . . because they choose to open ALL of their windows for maximum guest service.  **Side note** . . . this trip proves that Karma is alive and well too . . .  when we arrived to the line there was a gap in the line, so the kids and i walked right up to there. Well, i guess s lady behind us said, "exxxcuuuuse me, the line is back here". Well, I didn't hear her as I am kinda' hard of hearing so i turned to find the kids. As i turned i DO hear her say, "M'am . . .  then she GOES DOWN to the floor! Apparently there was a small puddle of beer on the marble floor and this biyatch slips in it and her flip-flops don't do that good of a job stopping her so . . . DOWN she goes!! I laughed my ass off when i saw her do it, especially once I learned what she'd said earlier. Lauren said to her, ok, you don't have to be such a bitch about it . . . then she slips . . . Karma is AWESOME dont' you think? ** Lol!! 

ANYHOW . . . our room was clean and comfy as usual. Our maid met us in the hall on arrival and introduced herself, Judwiga was her name. Soooo sweet and service was great! I've never tipped a maid before but i left her $$ in her little envelope, she was great! 
If you've ever stayed at the Flamingo you KNOW that the pool area is freakin' PARTY CENTRAL!! . . . nothing different this weekend either! The Landshark Lager folks were the "sponsors" this weekend and they left no drunk unturned! Lol!! Volleyball net was set-up and water slides were open . . . need i say more? 

Suffice it to say that this is one of our favorite destinations in VEGAS and, unless they close their pool, it will continue to be so! Hope you get the chance to enjoy.

We stayed at this property for 4 nights and reserved a fab room, upon check in we were told that even though we booked a King bed room they were already given out to other people who checked in earlier.   The window overlooked Caesars Palace and was decent, but the screen was all torn up and the window was filthy, the beds were very comfortable but the bathroom was disgusting, no water pressure whatsoever in the shower, very low ceiling and it looked like someone screwed in a large slab of plywood above it.  Also the vent in the bathroom was plugged up with tons of lint and dust behind the panel, and maid service was very slow and not very thorough as far as removing cups on the tables and general cleanup.  Also they charged $14.95 per day just to use the internet.  Not ok.  Although the location is supreme in my opinion that is all this property has going for it,  oh and the fact that Margaritaville is there.   Do yourself a favor and spend the extra $ for a room at Treasure Island.....you will be glad you did!

True Story:  this happened just 2 days ago so its still fresh in my head.  I reserved a room at the Flamingo thru Expedia for Mon Nov 18th.  I arrived around 11pm in my car, and had 2 large suitcases with me.  I needed to valet my car and receive bell service for my luggage.  Well, I received neither since the valet parking lane was jammed with cars that appeared to be parked there permanently, and there was no valet in sight.  Hmmm.  No bell captain either, so I end up parking in the garage and lugging my stuff to the not-so-close reception desk. 

And there waiting for me was a really long check-in line.  I tried to avoid the line by using a kiosk to check in (nobody else was using them, btw) but it only offered "non-smoking" rooms.  This was unacceptable to me because I am a heavy smoker and offer no apologies for my personal habits.  (I also pay a zillion percent in tobacco and "sin taxes" too, so next time you see a smoker give him\/her a big ole smooch because YOUR taxes and cost of living would be higher without the zillions of dollars us smokers pay in taxes each year.  Remember that.)

Moving On: with no luck at the kiosk, I'm back in that dreadful looking line.  And it was every bit as painful as it looked.  Worse yet, there was a separate VIP line for next-in-line service for their VIP players, which made us poor wretches feel evern more miserable watching high-faluting people take cuts in front of us.  Simply stated, the line sucked out any joy and happiness from us new arrivers and made us all quite miserable.  After FORTY FIVE minutes of this pain and suffering, I finally make it to the desk, only to be informed that their entire tower which offers smoking rooms was being closed for renovation and they had NO smoking rooms available of any kind.   W-o-W.  Seriously?  I then advised the clerk that I needed either A). a smoking room or B). the manager because I was cancelling my reservation.  

Let's Be Fair Here;  the manager was calm, cool and collected and assured me that they were cancelling my reservation with a full refund for being unable to accommodate my needs.  My call to Expedia 10 minutes later confirmed that and I have since received a full refund.  So at least I didn't get jerked around on my refund. 

BUT I had a simply miserable experience at the Flamingo -- and worst of all, as I'm driving away it's midnight in Vegas and I didn't have a reservation anywhere (look out, Motel 6!).  Instead, I had an Expedia app which steered me towards the Gold Coast and my experiece at the GC was a complete 180 and they totally saved my night.  Feel free to read my review on that experience as well.  As for the Flamingo.....NEVER again.

I love this hotel mostly for the historic significance of it and its location on the strip.  You cannot beat the location for the price.  The rooms are decently sized and are cleaner than some other hotels in Vegas.  

The garden in the back of the hotel is neat and is quite different from the other hotels on the strip.  The flamingos and penguins are also cute and fun to watch.  

Staff is friendly and accommodating.  Buffet is cheaper than most others in Vegas and is very good.  

Try the champagne brunch!  One of my favorite things in Vegas!

This place is a D.U.M.P.  We were in Vegas for a conference held at the Flamingo.  Fortunately we chose to stay at the Bellagio, but still had to be in the Flamingo every day for the conference. 

The first thing you notice when you open the door is the stench of stale cigarette smoke, food , and overwhelming carpet or air "freshener" that only makes the odor worse.

To say that the Flamingo is dated is being kind.  There is no excuse for dirty and torn upholstered furniture .   We tried to sit outside the Sin City Brewing company (to enjoy a drink and escape the stench), but the furniture was badly stained and covered in bird droppings.

It appears that there is no on-going cleaning or  maintenance happening here.  How the Flamingo gets conferences to book at this hotel is a mystery.

Add tacky shops, limited and awful eating establishments to the general ratty atmosphere - really , this should rate a no-stars rating!

Well, looks like we will NEVER be staying at Flamingo in LV ever again. First upon checkin, we walked into a dirty room. Had to go back into the line to "confirm my identity" for guest services. 20 minutes of waiting in a line for the manager to be a complete unapologetic jerk (Rodger 2\/19\/2016). Just blamed house cleaning, took off 1 night of resort fees and said it wasn't that much of an inconvenience.. Finally over it, then when we come back to our room at 4am, our room is 80 degrees when we set it to 65 before we left. A hotel engineer is sent up here... Plays with it for an hour, has to call someone else to help. Finally got to bed at 5:30...and this is only day 1! The rooms have not been maintained (old, dirty bathrooms, and a complete lack of customer service) I was appalled that the manager was talking over me and treated us like garbage. 

I attached photos of our original room. Looks like Harrahs will not be getting anymore of our family and friends $.

I just got back from a Labor Day trip to Vegas.  Some buds and I stayed at Flamingo.  We had a regular room on the 17th floor.  This hotel is great!  We got there really early, about 1030am and the staff allowed us to check in early.  The room was clean and nice.  Great view of the pool.  Plenty of tables to gamble, especially craps.  The pool scene was fantastic!!!!!!  Lots of hot chicks, ratios were nice.  Plus the servers were really hot.  The misters definitely helped since its was 100+ outside.  Plus the whole tropical theme was really cool, especially the flamingo habitat, it reminded me of Cancun.  Another great feature was that Caesar's was across the street, so when your ready to hit Pure (definitely worth the wait), its a pretty short walk.  Plus, Bill's is next door, which is a great place to gamble since the table limits are $5.  Note: to any of the peeps going to Tao, make sure to wear a button down shirt, otherwise you wont get in, we learned this the hard way and avoid JET in the Mirage, the door man are totally scammers and the place was a total POS.  Overall, I'm definitely coming back to Flamingo.

I stayed at flamingo in july 2015. When i checked in the lady at the front desk was very rude. I got a non smoking room on floor 21 . Elevators which lead to rooms were very dirty. Carpet in the walkway was dirty and covered with cigarets (it is suppose to lead you to non smoking rooms) walls makes you feel that u r in a motel and not a hotel.
The room had wood tile which is better than carpet. Stained glass and sheets. 
I stayed at excalibur and sls for same price before and they were much better .
So stay away. Ver old hotel needs a lot of renovatiins to reach 3 stars .
I will never stay here again. So disappointed in the service at checkin and at the pool. I'm used to staying at MGM properties and tried something different, boy did I learn my lesson.

We stayed in a Go Deluxe room, which ran about $400 for 2 nights, and it is exactly as it looks in the pictures! I was a bit hesitant about our stay due to the mixed reviews, but I can honestly say we loved our room! The room was new, really nice and very clean. We had a view of the pool area which was actually pretty nice and an added bonus was being able to watch the sunrise from our room. 
The dealers at our tables were fun and really friendly, the bartenders at the bars were super helpful and gave great insight on places to eat and visit. I would however, not recommend the buffet; the food was cheap quality and not worth the money. 
Overall our stay was pleasant and we will definitely be staying here again!

MY STUFF GOT STOLEN OUT OF MY ROOM WHILE I WAS SLEEPING...do not stay here unless you want to risk your safety and your belongings. My friends and I stayed at the Flamingo for 3 nights. Our first night there, we came back at night, closed the door, and put up the do not disturb sign. We had all of our belongings when we got back to the room, and when we woke up our iphones, wallets, laptops, and more, were gone, and someone had taken off the do not disturb sign as we found it on the floor inside the room. 
We immediately went downstairs and spoke to hotel security and filed a police report. 2 of us did not have wallets and therefore no way of getting money, and the hotel would not even give us food vouchers to eat. We had to BEG to speak to the manager, and after all of that they basically made US feel like WE were the ones who did something wrong. They did nothing to enhance our security after we were all horrified and scared. 
After that, we had to deal with risk management for 2 weeks and supposedly the hotel insurance did an investigation. According to the hotel, they have no responsibility for what happened, and said that there was no negligence on their end. When we asked to see the investigation report, they refused to show it to us. 
This hotel does nothing to protect their guests: there are no cameras in the hallways, no security around the elevators to check room keys, nothing. Not only have I had to replace all of my belongings, I am also unable to sleep at night because I am so scared and traumatized from this experience. We are lucky that all we lost were material belongings, and that no one was injured, raped, or murdered.

Was a horrible experience overall. When my boyfriend and I first booked our room we booked a suite to stay in for his birthday weekend. When we got to the hotel they said they see the notation in the system that we wanted a suite but they never reserved one. So they put us in a basic room. Took us about 45 to find our room because they put is in a back section of the hotel. Once there my boyfriend decided to relax and take a shower, only to find that our hotel had no towels. At all. I called the front desk and it took them 45 minutes to bring just towels to our room. Our ice machine didn't work so we had to travel to different floors to try and find one that worked. When we tried to speak to a manager about this all they said was there was nothing they could do. Will never stay here or gamble here again.

Stayed here for our honeymoon and the place was disgusting... Smelled like cigarettes mixed with bad perfume. Room was non-smoking but had a lingering smoke odor. Did not look like the room in the pictures at all. Staff at the reception area were rude and not welcoming at all, plus it took way too long to check in and out. The ONLY reason I gave two stars instead of one was the brunch buffet. Omelet bar was awesome! The hostess and other restaurant staff were very friendly and accommodating. My advice is don't stay here! Stay at another hotel and come for the brunch.

My friends and I stayed at Flamingo during a spring break trip.  Best part was the price.  Really affordable and even cheaper in the beginning of the week.  The customer service during booking and check in was really good.  If you don't want to wait in the long line during check-in, become a rewards member and you will get through much faster.  

The pool was nice but only one was open during our stay.  It looked like there were two others with water slides and a lazy river.  Awesome!  Too bad we didn't get to use it.  

They have real flamingos and other birds walking around which was pretty cool to see.  I would only give the buffet 2 stars, but the buffet pass allows you to eat at the other ones that are better.  I would totally stay here again.  Even though we had a basic room, it was everything we needed.  Who hangs out in the room when you are in Vegas anyway?

Was A good trip and the Suites are awesome. 

HATED: the damn pull and jacuzzi are closed during the off season? Wait it is 75 outside and I came from OR to hit the pool. The hotel was fully packed! 

Next time I will make sure the pool is open because I know the MGM pools are open!

I know, a little late, but here is our review for our stay, four nights at the Flamingo, just before 4th July 2014.
We may have been lucky, no queues at check in at all, and agreed to the $30 per night upgrade. That was our first win of the trip! Took a twin Go Deluxe room, loved having the fridge by the bed. View was sorta over to Caesar's, but hey, we weren't there to look out the window anyway, just check the weather in the mornings :-)
We found the Flamingo pleasant, clean, fun, bright. My only gripe was being charged $120!!!! For a blow dry in the salon. That's just pure insanity! 
We also rented a cabana on one day (over 40 degrees Celsius, glory be it was hot!) by the pool, and appreciated the towels, water, fruit, service, and safe. Having said that though, next time we'd probably just grab a daybed, and leave everything but the room key in our room, we spent so little time in the actual cabana! 
Vegas is over 12 hour flight away for us, but we're planning our next trip, and seriously considering the Flamingo again.

I've been stopping at flamingo for many years. But this time we went with family to Vegas. And decided to get a room at flamingo again. It was Tuesday.  
Basically no matter what king of room you going to book online and who cool it's going to look on picture , they will put you in old room. They need to change beds and mattresses. Don't feel comfortable it all. 
Also the lady who helped us at front desk was rude to us. I will probably not to stay at flamingo no more.

I have been to Las Vegas three times this year and each time has been a different, but pleasurable experience. My first time I stated at the Orleans Hotel & Casino (off strip) and the 2nd I stayed at Bally's. 

I'll cut to the chase, I DO NOT recommend staying at the Flamingo. I flew in with my wife the day after my birthday and arrived at about 9:30 am. After waiting for about 15 mins to check in I was told that I'd be charged a $33 early check in fee OR I could pay $30 extra per night to upgrade to the new "GO" room. I would have liked them to have waived the early check in fee because it was my birthday weekend however the young woman I checked in with acted as though she's never had a birthday. I paid the early check in fee and proceeded to my room. The room was small but clean and nice. I had a decent view of the wildlife habitat and the pools so I have no qualms about the room itself. 

Here's the BS
-Was charged a $200 incidentals fee without being advised at check in. I asked to speak to the supervisor and some Russian sounding fellow rudely explained to me that they "we're not required to advise guests about the incidentals fee anymore."
I promptly asked them to remove the hold and that was enough to seal the fact that I would never return. To me, that's shady business. 

-I called front desk for extra pillows to be brought up to my room every day I stayed there and no pillows were ever received. Go figure. 

-Cleaning women walking up and down the hallways at 8 am gossiping. "Bitch this, Bitch that". They didn't even have the courtesy to stop cursing even as my wife and I passed by them in the hall. My wife and I curse as well but not at our place of business and certainly not in the presence of customers. 

Long story short: At Bally's I got my "on strip" experience with a great room quality and awesome customer service. At the Orleans, I got great amenities, great value, awesome buffet and even though it was off strip the shuttle was so frequent and convenient that it hardly made a difference. 

Whether its your first time or not visiting Las Vegas, I'd avoid the Flamingo altogether. It's not so "Fabulous".

This company ran a campaign blasting MGM for their resort fees 

Three years later they appear on my bill.  Flamingo stuck me for $100 resort fees in addition to what I paid through travelocity.  Hypocritical and underhanded.  Especially since the buildings were once wrapped in banners that read "We don't charge resort fees."  They tricked me.  

Note as of August 28 it is on the newspapers list of restaurant establishments gives the buffet a failing grade:

http:\/\/www.reviewjournal.com\/restaurant-inspection-guide

The TV check-out didn't work, then the customer satisfaction survey didn't either (why I decided to give feedback here.)  almost every elevator was falling apart and room service didn't have three things I'd asked for from them menu.  Sportsbook is small.  I wanted a "GO" room  which is newly renovated.  I liked it even for the upgade fee of $25.  

The room-rate advertised on tracelocity was low but by the time we checked out the nightly rate was calculated at 198.50.

If you can get a room at the south strip hotels for less than that .. I would.  The south strip rooms are nicer (yes I've seen them all), the hotels are intact and the charges don't multiply themselves.  

I'm giving an extra star because the chamber people were really nice.  I know words aren't cash so I tipped our room attendant too.

I didn't stay here so I can't really comment on my stay. Having said that I love the old school memorabilia the flamingos & other fauna & fowl on the way to the pool. Super good happy hour deals & the bartenders at the bars we tried were helpful & patient at all hours of the night. Just awesome. Wish all bartenders were as nice at all of the casinos. So head on here to have some Vegas fun.

Weren't aware out teens would be forced to use a pool with infants that was small and over crowded, meanwhile the nice pool was utilized by 21 years plus. We came to Vegas to use the pool and jacuzzi. Way over paid and weren't able to check into room until 4pm!

Just checked in today and was completely shocked at how dark and unclean the room was. I found a used straw near the nightstand, countless hairs on the sheets and pillowcases, and small pieces of trash throughout the room. The shower is small and disgusting. When I called to complain, the only thing they could do was waive the resort fee. The only reason I gave this review two stars is for the awesome pool area and dining.

Flamingo was my favorite with GO delux rooms, but my goodness their customer service is so terrible I would never go there again! There is a manager by the mane Ron or starts with the letter R, maybe Ramon. Total jerk! You do not believe me please go ahead

It's very cheap for Vegas and we didn't experience any problems. Centrally located on the strip; we could see the Bellagio and Caesar's from our room. The best part was being able to watch the Bellagio Fountains from our window! This hotel has the basics down, nothing fancy, no frills kind of place. Outside the hotel, you can check out their birds and waterfalls. 

Flamingo's buffet isn't that fancy either. It's cheaper than the other buffets, but not as good. I remember there were some choice pieces of dried fruit (esp. papaya) but it was only slightly better than a typical brunch buffet you'd get at a typical restaurant. You get what you pay for in Vegas.

Checked into my room to find that my view was a concrete wall. Made the room very dark and depressing. Ben, at the front desk was less than empathetic with the situation and told me he could put me in a different room for more money. What??? He didn't even attempt to right the situation before telling me it was going to cost me. If they are going to book you in a room that stares directly at a wall they should be forthcoming with that. My colleague's room had a view of the flamingos, koi and the Highroller!! The rooms were booked together at the same rate. That's just bad business Flamingo!! Was here for a convention and the location was good so that's the ONLY reason the  I gave it two stars.

hotel staff was ok. long waiting lines for checking in and out!  go room we upgraded to was ok a couple towels were still dirty day after day! bed was comfy the room we stayed in had an ok view. the water got cold after 3 people used it.. every elevator we used was shaky and scary! overall i wouldn't stay if I don't have too and the resort fees is way too much!!

One and done won't be returning 

Reasons are: room, pool, beds, casino and charges explained below

Like most people one of the reasons I chose this place was the price although it's not so cheap after they add another $28\/night on for a resort fee and even that was expected since it was mentioned on Expedia but then to get here and be charged another $50\/night deposit?? Refundable or not, over kill if you ask me.

My second reason for choosing this hotel was for the Pool that was advertised since I would be coming here with my child and would probably be spending a lot of time there. I called two times before booking and was told twice the pool was heated....it is NOT
When we finally head to the pool we find out that the 15 acres of pools etc they advertise, 90% of it is blocked off for adults only and all that is left for families is this tiny pool that could hardly contain everybody. No hot tubs
And the water slides and waterfalls advertised are inoperable and I'm not meaning broken I'm saying they weren't even turned on and hadn't been since at least last season which was evident by the leaves and gunk that had accumulated. If I had known all of this I would have never booked at this hotel when there are so many amazing pools at other hotel locations on the strip. I feel ripped off and feel that if anything the "resort fee" should be refunded or not charged at all when your amenities are not fully available.

Now that I've been disappointed by the pool area let's move on to the room. Old, dated, rusted fixtures, small TV etc but even all of that is tolerable for a lesser price.
However the beds are awful, I woke up with my back hurting every morning and I don't even have back problems. Then when I go to take a shower the water pressure is almost non existent.
But the worst part was the "a\/c" which does NOT work. Whether I turn it up hoping to warm up the room or turn it down for a\/c the same thing happens the temperature doesn't change and it never turns off just runs constantly unless of course you shut it off completely. I have come to the conclusion that it is just the Fan blowing and there is no heating cooling system. I called the Front Desk who said they would send somebody and they never did. I am also starting to believe this is just how it is and how they cut costs. Definitely not somewhere you want to stay in the middle of the summer when it's 116 degrees outside.
The walls are very thin you can hear everybody in the halls all night long. And I have no idea what was going on above my room it sounded like a bowling alley which they don't have

Ok the Hotel itself. Good Location, shops, decent restaurants and a fitness center. 28 floors but the elevators are sketchy and feel like they are going to break so maybe this time around don't stay on a higher floor like I did Lol 
The casino is lacking and smells REALLY bad of cigarette smoke I'm sure because it's one of the older casinos. The newer ones don't seem to have that problem.

And last but not least the front desk staff could be a little more welcoming and less robotic like. My last stay in Vegas was 4 months ago at New York New York it was a little more money but my overall experience including check in was 100x better.
If it weren't for incurring cancellation charges I would have moved to a different hotel after the first day at the Flamingo.

So there you have it. I give the hotel 2 stars and that is mostly just for location

So you say to yourself yeah but I won't be spending much time in the room. Ok neither did I but just the sleeping part sucks with these beds and showering for the day isn't any better

So you say oh I just need a cheap place for one night on a business trip well you won't be very comfortable in these rooms for long not a place I see myself hanging out in for even an hour and I travel for business as well

So let's find some pro's because there's always at least one positive you can find if you try....
The Flamingo habitat with birds from South America is a nice touch.
The resort fee does include daily wifi for up to 2 devices and also includes use of the fitness center where some hotels charge extra for those items 
But not enough to warrant ever staying here again

Check out.....most hotels allow you to check out through the TV in your room. The Flamingo requires you to stand in the very long line at the registration desk to check out. Allow 30 minutes for this

Our stay was completely awful! The room we stayed in (17045) was disgusting. There was rust around the shower and bath tub. I don't think anyone even attempt to clean the bath tub it looked gross and filthy. Water barely came out the shower head. The bathroom door would not close. It's a sliding door and when we would try to close it it would just go back. The bathroom light switch was cracked. We couldn't get any reception on this floor. All my calls dropped. The mirror had a black stain. Not sure what it was. There were marks on the wall and on the door. The room we stayed in looked a mess. I never experienced anything like this in my life. We stayed at the Flamingo twice prior to this stay. I'm extremely disappointed with the customer service. We complained to the manager, Frank, who did not seem to care. I felt like he just shrugged it off. All he did was went back in the back room with his employee for about ten seconds and then the employee came back and told us that we could not get another room and offered us a fifty dollar food and beverage credit. Really? We just complained to you guys about how our room is filthy and all you offer is a food and beverage credit. Mind you fifty dollars is not good enough since we stayed there for six days. That was a sorry excuse. I know that there were plenty of rooms available they just did not want to give us one. There are like twenty-eight floors and you mean to tell me not one room is available? I don't believe that one bit. This was my third and final stay at the Flamingo. I was in Vegas to celebrate my 21st and was very upset at how they treated us. Hell I even had pictures to prove how disgusting our room was. Frank did not seem to care at all. He has the nerve to call himself a manager...what a joke. If he was a real manager he would have gotten us a new room that same day. But no. If you are reading this please stay away from this hotel!

I was very apprehensive  to book this hotel because of all the horrible reviews but I was greatly pleased to have had really no complaints at all about our stay! we arrived Sunday at 900am and no rooms were available but luckily they have a free luggage hold meanwhile a room become available.  we gambled and walked around, and ate some did
food from the food court.  this is where my only complaint comes...there are not great choices of food within the hotel itself like quick fast food. no mcdonalds, burger King,  Jack in the box.  only a buffet and some random food stops. well anyway...we went back to the front desk ,all the workers were great, still no rooms available for early check in.  3rd time was a charm when we were told we could upgrade to an executive room which would bypass the 30 early check in fee for 25 more dollars a night which would only add 50$ (2 night stay) to our stay so 20$ more than we were prepared to pay got us a beautiful room on the 27th floor with a beautiful view of the bellagio fountains! and a mini fridge  no stains or mold or horrible service at all and I was very pleased. elevators were quick near the check in desk never had to wait more than 2 minutes.  over all I would come back again.  u can't beat the price or the location on the strip!

Your Experience at the Flamingo is TOTALLY what you make it. If you opt for a higher floor and a GO room then it will be a great stay. If you stay on a lower floor in an older room, totally different experience and one I wouldn't be cool with. It is like staying in 2 completely different hotels. Our room was clean, the hallway carpets were new and clean, and our view was probably the best in Vegas. (stayed on the 22nd floor facing the strip). The elevators were haunted I think. Going downstairs, the elevator in the lobby tower would stop on the 11th floor almost every time. Other times, different lights would light up as the elevator was moving. Strange but kinda cool if you want to imagine that the mobsters are still haunting the place. Wasn't an inconvenience just strange. The Pool is Awesome, the Casino itself was so-so. I didn't see any big pay-outs so definitely on the tighter side but it is the Strip. Cocktail waitresses were awesome if you tipped them. Never had to wait for a drink. All in All, the Flaming is a really fun place to stay if you are cool with a relaxed vibe and not a lot of frills and luxury.

My Very 1st Yelp! Review - I just owe it back for all the good tips I received from others.

As the guy who booked and organized the stay for 4 guys in their older 20s, I think it was great! We booked through a booking website for $360 for 3 nights for a deluxe room. We were there for a bachelor party and did not plan on being in the room much other than sleeping.  (4th time to Las Vegas - 2nd for "guys weekend")

I arrived before the other three guys on a Friday night about 8:00-8:30. There were only 3 or 4 people in front of me in line.  I asked for any possible complimentary upgrades (based on a tip) but they told me nothing was available. We got a low level room that faced the pool area overlooking the Sin City Brewing Bar patio.  It was loud from the dj at this time, and I was a bit worried that it would be loud when we went to bed, but it was not - we went to bed late all three nights.  I don't think that going to bed early should be an issue for many people reading this. (Not sure how late the dj went - you may want to ask)   The view was great during daylight - overlooking the giant pool and all the palm trees.

I am not sure why so many people have complained about the mobile phone reception. I have Verizon and my phone worked just fine - no issues, anywhere in the hotel!

Pros:

-The window shade was great - it made the room very dark in the morning when the sun would have otherwise been shining bright into the room.
-Good air-conditioning (102 degree outside high temp during day)
The showers had hot water and good pressure, just a normal bath-tub style shower. 
-Beds were quite comfortable
-Great location the the strip - middle of everything
-Good on-site food.  Buffet was very good, and reasonably priced (~$16 with reward card). Food court was good for late night eats before bed.
-Staff was pleasant from Check-in to casino dealers to dining servers to maids - everyone was a pleasure to work with
-The pool reviews are why I booked here. We partied there for about 5 hours on Saturday. Cool pool. Read the reviews on the pool elsewhere. Not for people that do not like crowds. Definitlely a great place for social people - but you don't have to be. There was a line to get in so they can verify that you are a guest, but it moves pretty quick.

Cons: (very minor)

-No exaust fan in the bathroom.
-Pillows were awardly thick - a bit uncomfortable.
-no outside food or drink allowed into the pool, (drinks are not cheap, but reasonable for Las Vegas)

Tips:

-Get a rewards card - it's easy and free and you'll get discount on the buffet, shopping, etc.
-Bills Gambling Hall next door is a sweet "dive-bar" like atmosphere. Although they do not have $1 New Castle like some website comments have stated. I had $3 tall boys of Coors Light. Play beer-pong here.
-Very close liquor store - 2nd Stage casino on Flamingo Rd. (right out the back door of the hotel and a block away)
-Tip your servers - at the tables they came back before I could even finish a drink.
-Remember that this hotel is a casino hotel. There are cameras everywhere! Don't do anything stupid.

I got a great price. 67 for one night. Room was nice, but the bathroom was really small. Great location. Right in the middle of everything. The hotel overall was in my opinion a bit run down. I give it 3 stars.

Love this hotel. Rooms were clean equipped with coffee maker and refrigerator  they even had a tv in the bathroom. Have stayed here twice now and have enjoyed it each time. The garden outside is fabulous.  Can't wait to go in warmer month to check out there pool

I'm not sure how this place used to be before the renovation but I definitely had a great experience here.  First of all, the Go Rooms were awesome.  Cool funky decor, a 42" flat screen tv with another smaller one built in the bathroom mirror, a translucent bathroom door (very sexy) and a fantastic view.  The bed was super super comfortable and felt very luxurious.  

I had a fantastic time walking around the habitat with all the beautiful waterfalls and animals.  Plus, the pool was great and had these cool caves that were fun to play in.  The casino was okay...a little too cold for my liking but still fun.

I also got to try one of their restaurants Voga and was very impressed.  Great service and wonderful service.  I will definitely not mind staying here again.

Absolute dump. Our "suite" hadn't been remodeled or fixed in years.  Furniture was old and dirty. Old tube TV, no flat screen.  Carpet in the hallway was completely bunched up.  The tub didn't stop running the entire time.  3 nights and the maid service didn't come once.

Had a terrible experience yesterday at the Flamingo around 2:30pm. While I was showing my folks around Vegas we decided to play Roulette so we stopped for 2 secs at a Roulette table to show my folks. Surprisingly the worker at the Roulette table called"Ping", in a very rude way, made us show our IDs and passports if we wanted to watch the game, she also said if I had questions about the game I could ask. So I thought okay. She stopped the ongoing game to check all our 4 passports and IDs. She couldn't figure out my wife's age on the passport and made us feel really awkward. But went on. After I asked the first question, she ignored me. So I thought, she did say if I had questions I could ask, só went on to the second, this time "ping" told me to look it up on the internet. I thought that was ridiculous and unacceptable. Why did she check all our IDs, said I could ask questions and when I did, told me to look it up on the web? I was interested in wanting to play Roulette but that worker just treAted us so bad that I just left. Not going the again and don't recommend it either.

Quite disappointed in our room at the hotel. The website really gave the impression that all rooms were clean, updated, with many amenities. To my dismay, the room was super outdated, smelled like smoke (even though a non-smoking room), the bathroom small with an awkward full mirror placed next to the toilet. 
The water in the shower went from hot to cold while showering. 
Our shower curtain was replaced 3 days into our stay. The packaging was left on the floor of the bathroom. The do not disturb door hanger wasn't in our room. 
There was paint drippings on the outside of the window. 
Very disappointed in the rooms. Won't be staying here again in the future.

Worst Hotel Ever!  The staff does not care. If you're not a BIG gambler in their club they treat you like street trash.  I "upgraded" my room and was given a room on the 28th floor right below the night club, so my walls vibrated with the bass from the stereo until 2AM. I tried to get a new room, but they were "sold out", so they sent me earplugs, which were completely ineffective. 

The next day I asked for a new room and was placed a few floors down away from the nightclub, but the hotel thinks that it's a good idea to give each room a stereo system with a subwoofer placed next to your neighbors wall so that it vibrates your headboard. So if you want to sleep choose another hotel, if you party all night, any terrible hotel will do.

There are too many options for other hotels in Vegas to even consider the Flamingo, choose any other hotel, you will be glad that you did.

I just returned from a three day stay at the Flamingo.  Overall the price and central location in the middle of the strip makes it a great value for the money.   A few observations on my most recent trip.  

1. Pool - The main reason I stayed here is because of the pool party and once again it did not disappoint.  The pool is beautiful.  Get there early in the summer months because the chairs fill up quick.  Depending on the time of year you'll get a slightly different crowd.  Way more college students in the June-August time period.  There always seems to be a good mix of people here and the people watching is great.  The staff working the pool area has been great every time I've been there. 

2. Casino - its an old casino.  Other than the pink decorative cues here and there it pretty much looks like any of the other low-mid budget resorts on the strip.   It tends to be an older clientele.  If you want to go somewhere that feels less like a retirement home you're a short walk to nearly all of the newer casinos on the strip.

3. The food here sucks.  By far the worst is the Center Cut Steakhouse.  Pricing is on par with Mortons or Capital Grill.  I got the "Center Cut" NY Strip.  The cut of meat I got was extremely tough and overcooked.  The person I was with got a Filet and it was similarly bad.  For a ~$45 steak I'd expect a lot better.  Sides are ala carte.  We got a potato and vegetable based side and both seemed to be seasoned with a big pile of salt and their homemade popovers were so undercooked it was like eating bread dough.   

Carlos and Charlies wasn't good either.  The food court is mediocre even by foodcourt standards.   The buffet was ok but nothing spectacular.  I haven't eaten at the other restaurants in the resort but given they're track record at the ones I have eaten at I'd go somewhere else.  If you must eat here, get the buffet.

4. Rooms and Decor - The decor in the casino is fine for an old hotel.  The decor in the actual room areas is kind of junky especially in the tower that runs parallel to Imperial Palace.  The carpet in the hallway was filthy and the carpentry work on the hallway walls was pretty shoddy.  Empty pizza boxes and room service trays sat in the hall way for most of the day.  In the room, there is cheap faux hard wood floors and two of my electrical outlets did not work.  The suites look like they haven't been updated since the mid 80s. 

Overall despite the many negative comments, I'd still stay here again. The pool party makes it worth while (this effect is negated in the Nov-April months).  Plus for the price and the location so close to most of the newer resorts you can't beat it.  Afterall, you probably won't spend much time in your room anyway.

Great hotel!

Highly recommended!

Check in was crazy. A single line through the ropes of about 60 people. Luckily, my wife spotted a kiosk for computerized check in. No line, quick & simple. 3 choices of rooms. We took higher for better view. Got better view of construction & top of Imperial Palace. Want coffee? Mrs. Fields has it & a 15 minute line with a single employee. 
Room needs to be remodeled. The pink\/grey fur at the foot of the bed could have been leftovers from a cousins van, circa 1979. Spotty electrical in the room is making recharging of electronics difficult. Tough to take pictures with dead batteries. 
The adult pool was nice. Cool water & lots of hormones. It made for an amusing afternoon for these 40 somethings. The booty shaking contest was the highlight. 
Having stayed at The Mirage, Luxor, et al. I won't be back.

This is our favorite hotel in Vegas. Granted there are better overall hotels, this one just feels like home to us. That, plus, I get comped my rooms here everytime we stay.  :) 

My free rooms are just for the standards. I'm not THAT big of a roller, but, I put in enough to get our bi-summer trips in. The rooms are good for sleeping and showering and other recreational activities that usually require a bed and a locked door. 

The best, BEST part about this hotel is the Pool. I made a concerted effort in the early part of this decade to stay at EVERY hotel in Vegas. I covered about  60% before I just gave up chasing every new hotel that popped up. I still have to say that the flamingo has the best pool around. The tropicality of it all is very inviting and soothing. We spend as much time as possible here. It gets crowded quickly in the summers. Get in before 10a. They have a waterfall here, a big one. Sitting underneath helps to get those kinks out of your neck. Awesome pool. Oh, and they have poolside blackjack. But, don't play. Unless you're really really drunk. 

I don't do very well with the gambling here. I tend to stay away for the most part. Luckily, because they're a Harrah's property, I can play most anywhere on the Strip. 

The buffet here is pretty good. We've caught all dining options (breakfast, lunch, dinner, brunch) and the food is about a 4 star. 

Love this hotel.

We are staying at the Linq that only has a 21+ pool, but luckily they have arrangements with the Flamingo for people with young families like my own. My 2 toddlers were so excited to go swimming at the Flamingo once we found out we couldn't swim at our hotel's pool. 
Once we entered the bird area that is on the way to thw pool we noticed an awfullllll smell. It Continued on and off as we walked to the pool. It smelled like moldy water mixed with death. After hanging at the pool we walked back to the flamingos, and noticed a huge koi fish belly up right in front of the beautiful birds. It was gross to see and pretty sad. 

I am giving 5 stars because I appreciate the Flamingo sharing their pool with the Linq. The pool itself was very family friendly. I would have much rather been at their day club pool though haha. The music that I heard through the trees that was coming from the day club sounded awesome. My pre-kid self would have really enjoyed it.

Last week was my first trip to Vegas and the only reason I gave the Flamingo a two star rating was because of location.  

ROOM:
My Non-Smoking room smelt like smoke and weed was being pumped in through the vents.  The bathroom water pressure was intense, TOO intense.  You could barely fill a glass of water.  The paint was chips on all the woodwork.  There was no vent in the bathroom.  The bed was nice and there were nice big windows.

ELEVATORS & HALLWAYS:
The carpet in the hallway was like something you would find in a crappy Motel 6 in the middle of nowhere.  It was heavily stained and bumps ever 5 feet.  But the elevators were the WORST!  The main elevators between the casino and registration desk only were garbage.  One elevator was pitch black.  One shook the whole way up and down.  One kept moving after "stopping" at each floor.  A couple of them were missing floor buttons and half the buttons on one side didn't work.  One elevator said 2V at each floor.  Plus not to mention the stopping at floors where no one was there to get on.  Oh and forget waiting for the elevators over by the pool area.  Those never arrived and when they did, they were jammed packed.  The one time I used the stairs, I also got lost and ended up on the alley outside the hotel. 

POOL:
I will never stay at this hotel again.  The "best" part of the hotel is supposedly the GO Pool.  WRONG!! WORST MONEY SCHEME EVER!!!  First the line to get in to the Go pool was easily 50 feet long all day.  That was just to check IDs and look inside bags.  Then they wouldn't let you bring in any outside food, drinks and even cups\/bottles\/container.  That includes the fancy Flamingo glasses you buy inside the Go Pool.  One piece of advice, DO NOT BUY A FLAMINGO CUP unless you only want it as a souvenir.  They will not let you bring them back into the pool.  They will not let you refill it at the pool.  You can buy another drink and pour it into your Flamingo cup but it's still $16-23 for a blended drink.  Plus good luck filling a chair, bench or spot to sit.  Get there at 8:30am in order to get a chance at a spot.  My advice, go to the Family pool or the kiddie pool.  The Slide was fun!

PARKING:
Parking was horrendous!  The park spot lines were invisible, so one car was diagonal and the next was straight in.  There were only 5 levels of parking and some of those were reserved for the Hertz rental cars.

I felt sorry for the poor people that had to wait in the 10 mile long line to check in.  I was able to check in online and my line still took over 45 mins to check in through.  

One nice benefit to the Flamingo is that it has a montrail stop near it....near is being nice.  The hotel is centrally located and Margaritaville is inside it.  But with the amount of money I spent, I sure hope they use all of it to fix up the place.  Luckily it's in Vegas because if it wasn't, it would be shut down in a hurry.

I used to stay here a lot when I went to Las Vegas with my parents when I was a kid and I absolutely used to love this place.  I would have given this place a 4 or 5 for sure back then, but I went back and stayed here the last time I visited Las Vegas (this time with my SO) and we did not have as much of a pleasant experience.  
The hotel looked the same and was pretty nice, though a little old in some areas (many Vegas hotels look like this though) but the thing that got to me was the people at the reservations desk.  We had reserved our hotel room for two nights weeks in advance and when we got there they tried to get us to move our hotel room to the Imperial Palace (no offense, that place is sort of a crap hole).  WHAT?  We had reserved rooms at the FLAMINGO and they tried to get us to move our room to the Imperial Palace, a completely different hotel?  The messed up thing about the whole thing was that the people before us in the reservations line didn't even have reservations for the flamingo and they went up and asked if they could stay there and switch from another hotel and they were given a room at the flamingo!  We had reserved weeks in advance and they tried to move us over to another, crappier, hotel!  Uh, hell no.
