We got our room at the Flamingo that we had reserved in the end, but were met with rudeness, as if it was expected of us to move to another hotel.   We would not have booked at the Flamingo in the first place if we had known that we would be met with such rudeness.  We had to stay at the reservation desk for 20 minutes.  The woman behind the counter said she would be right back but didn't come back for 20 minutes.  We stoood around, waiting, while others were being served.  And I had to go up and practically yell at another of the clerks behind the counter that we had been left there waiting for 20 minutes.  She didn't come back for another 10 minutes after that and they all looked at us as if we were crazy for being pissed off for being left there at the counter for nearly half an hour.... Uh... what?  They were extremely rude, said they had overbooked the hotel, etc... Well, that's not my problem that they were overbooked that night.  They should first make sure all the people who had PREVIOUSLY made RESERVATIONS got their rooms before they gave rooms to walk-ins!  DUH.  How hard is it for them to understand that? ... 

In the end we got our room, but that was extremely annoying.  The room was pretty nice, but they gave us a really crappy view (of the parking lot).  

The pool was ok, though it was super crowded and was way more like a club.  We ended up just chilling at the family pool for a bit because that was a lot quieter and more chill.  The regular pool was really too club-like - loud music, annoying people, etc.  
And we're in our early 20's and generally like going out, but this was way too much for us. 
I used to love the pool here.  I think they have the nicest pool here, in terms of layout. There are a bunch of slides and there are several different pools and a waterfall too, which I haven't seen at any other Vegas hotel pool.  It's usually really, really nice, but it was just way too crowded and "clubby" for me this time.

Anyway, in all I don't think I would stay at the Flamingo again. The experience at the reservation desk alone was enough for me to not stay there again.  You can stay at a lot of comparable or nicer hotels - Monte Carlo, Ballys, Treasure Island -  for a lot less of a hassle, I'm sure.

An older hotel for sure, but it underwent some renovations to the rooms in the past couple of years. The hotel could use some overall upgrades (like the elevators, which either didn't work or were scary to ride if they were working), but the hotel is by no means grimy. I stayed in a suite with some friends and the room was overall comfortable (although the pull out bed was old and very uncomfortable), clean, and spacious. The best part of the Flamingo is its location. It is across the street from Caesar's Palace, and right next to LINQ and its stores and restaurants. The check in process was very simple and quick using the automated check in booths. The casino area is fairly small, but that didn't bother me much since I don't gamble. Staff, from the assistants by the check in booth to housekeeping, were very nice and professional: I would definitely stay here again.
Never go here, smallest rooms and worst customer service ever you can't even get a complimentary toothbrush! Shaking my head , hates my stay here!

I'm so upset about our recent stay here (checked out yesterday 10\/10). We came for my birthday 10\/9 and was not aware of them doing renovations, which is usually not a problem, but this time I was surprised early morning Monday AND Tuesday to them doing construction - hammering, drilling, pounding - in the room above us. We could not sleep what so ever. I made a complaint Monday morning and was told they could not do anything about it and could not change us into another room. Yesterday before checking out I hopped in the shower only to get surprised by our water getting turned off mid-shower. I had soap spuds still on and was left this way. I sent videos of the noise and was ignored!

Sadly, this is not a good representation of Vegas, you can find places for as cheap or cheaper, and actually clean.

Positives:  Margaritaville, Location on the strip

Negatives: Dirty (there was even something spilled or, well...on the side of the chair in the room), $14 per day for Internet. Old and unmaintained, terrible customer service (when I asked a house cleaner if they could come back in 10 minutes, after I was gone, I was told "I dont want to come back"), Noisy (we were on the 15th floor and it was like we were down on the street), uncomfortable bedding, even though it was a non-smoking room, everything in there smelled like old smoke, did I mention dirty!!, they didnt have the room we requested, so instead of upgrading us for free, they offered to downgrade our room, witnessed two employees fighting (thats always a nice touch)

Obviously I didn't have a good experience, which is too bad, with the prime location on the strip, they could do so much more with this place.

3.5 stars.  
Great location conveniently located in the middle of the strip with friendly staff. The hotel rooms are not fancy but got all the basic stuff and feels pretty clean.  Some rooms can be far to walk to though.  The garage felt a little dirty.   My complaint is having hard to reach the house keeping staff as I had to wait on the phone for 10 minutes every time.

we stayed in a fab deluxe room with 2 young kids. room was clean, water pressure in the shower was strong, it almost hurt. fab location right in the middle of the strip without paying the high prices of ceasars and the belagio. pool and wildlife habitat great for the kids. watch for the time share salesmen in the lobby. hertz rent a car booth in lobby very convenient.

We checked in to the Flamingo hotel and opened the door to our room to find it smelling like pot, towels all over the floor, bed trashed, and alcohol beverages all over the tv stand. It wasn't even the type of room we reserved for the extra money we spent. 

Then we are given a new room. Still not the one we reserved. Now for the slap in the face from #FlamingoLasVegas its in the furthest place from any type of elevator or other life form! I was the one that wanted to stay here because it was great last year.

Affordable!
Convenient!
Comfortable!

I went with relatives to this hotel, it was a great starting point to walk the whole strip.  They had a nice breakfast bar with pretty much everything.  They had a great place to play in the pool or lounge in the chairs.

Lots of fun in the hotel but we mostly walked the strip and checked out the other places.

My family and I have stayed here several times and normally have a great time. However this trip will be the last time we stay on this property.  First off: the room they gave us was not updated and was musty. While I was in the a bath, the room above us began leaking into ours from their toilet creating a hole in the ceiling. We called the front desk and got the run around not once but 3 Times. We finally were able to switch rooms, and guess what: the room they moved us to was already occupied(they were traumatized). So then they moved us once again to a room that smelled like smoke. So once again we went to the front desk and finally got moved to another room. Talk about a nightmare.  Will not be staying here again after the fiasco. The staff was rude and made us feel like it was a hassle to comply with us. Oh well.  Plenty of other hotels to choose from for next time.

BED BUGS! Don't even know if they deserve this one star. 

Here's my big beef, it's not like I was even that upset to begin with. Although most people would probably be very upset, I called in being completely understanding to the fact that the last person could have brought it to Flamingo. At first I wasn't even looking for a refund, but seriously, after all the calls and complaints not only did they not offer a refund, they didn't even offer a discount to give me a better experience next time or anything. You would think they would at least go out of their way to show their customers they are sorry and try to win my business back, no, they were content to just write me off. What I am upset with is the lack of customer service that was provided. 

Details:
I checked in Friday and by Sunday after checking out I noticed spots on my feet. I didn't think much of it but by Sunday night it started to itch. Monday is when they started to really itch and by Tuesday my toes and more were showing multiple bites. 

Info on bug bites:
Look it up, my doctor confirmed with me as well that bed bug bites take a few days to show, IF AT ALL. Depending on sensitivity to the skin and other factors, some people never show signs they have been bit. I have a very sensitive reaction to bug bites and this was no different. 

What happened when I called to inform Flamingo:
1) upon calling in was told we would need a doctors note to even proceed!
2) after complaining of the customer service I was transferred again to security to which the security replied "there are people in there now and they aren't complaining". So, are you telling me I am a liar? Who does this? 
3) Going through hoops I finally filed a complaint and was told I would receive a call within a day or two from risk management... never received a call. 
4) I went to the doctors on Thursday and received my doctors note about the bites. I called to forward these documents they requested only to be told they need to do their own investigation and will respond within 24-48 hours. It has been 5 days... no call.

I have stayed at MULTIPLE HOTELS, I am literally a gold star member with hotels.com and currently have 30 pending hotel bookings with them from now through to August. I have never had such terrible customer service, lack of empathy, lack of care,... just the worst. I think it's absolutely funny that Caesar's palace is part of this crap establishment. 

Bottom line: I will go ahead and keep booking with Cosmopolitan, Wynn, The Signature, and the rest of these people who have gone above and beyond to not only keep my business, but ensure that I am satisfied with their establishment. A place like this is a type of place that doesn't care about their customers and only wants your money, once you're out they don't care about you or your health or experience with their company as they already have your money.

Worser place to stay at. They do not have "do not disturb" signs so if you forgot to bolt the door, they will open it in the morning and ask if you want room service regardless if you're dressed or on the toilet or even awake. 

The hotel creaks and it's cold. The heat and ac sucks. Everything is old and lights don't work. 

If you're looking for a cheap room to crash and shower this is the place. But for privacy there is none. There's people sitting in hallways at night talking. Late night wanderers that likes to knock on people's doors when they're not there. Noisy. 

Not family friendly. No coffee pot to brew hot water and no fridge.

OH GOD. WHERE DO I BEGIN.

I am a Vegas connoisseur. I go to Vegas twice a month, pretty much every other weekend, just because I can.

My friend's birthday was a couple weekends ago, and we decided to stay here. Now, I've stayed here two other times, and just to make sure I hated it, we stayed there one more time since the rate for that specific weekend was cheap.

We arrived at 1am in the morning thinking that the later we leave the better. BAD IDEA!!! the past three times I've been here the valet has been full every single time. How is that good customer service at all? 

We walked up to the front desk thinking our check in would be fairly quick and painless. NOPE. Waited 1 hour to check in. Our reservation was for a two queen bed regular standard run-of-the-mill smoking room. I had booked our reservation about 2 months before hand to make sure that we would get the rate we wanted and the room we wanted. On our confirmation sheet it said: "two queen standard room smoking." When I finally crawled up to the front desk, they told me that they had first of all, no smoking rooms available, and no queen bed rooms available. I was ppppiiiiiissssseeeeeedddd. I explained calmly that I had made these reservations in advance through my credit card company and I demanded we got what we ordered. I showed her the confirmation sheet and she just said "I'm sorry but it's subject to availability."
OK. FINE. We'll take the damn King size bed with no smoking room.

We get to our room, after walking what literally felt like a mile, and threw our bags down. We tried to turn the air on, because when we were there it was 1am in the morning but still 100 degrees. The air conditioning didn't work. GAHHHHHH.

We called down to the front desk and told them, politely, that we wouldn't stand for this both nights. The manager was nice enough to give us a mini-suite, but for the next night. OK, we'll take it.

We wake up the next morning, pack up our stuff, and move our stuff to the mini-suite. The mini-suite was better, but not much. Everything seemed like it was from extended stay (i've stayed at some nicer extended stays than the Flamingo!). Nothing was durable. The table broke when we put our room service on it.

Speaking of room service, we didn't have a book in our room for any kind of room service, so we called down, got fed up because we waited 30 minutes for it, ordered our food because we were hungry, the room service came, we ate, took a nap AND THEN the menu came!!!! over a three our time frame!!!! oh boy.

We tried to go to the pool, and since we had a little bit of the brown bag flu, we had to get some alcoholic beverages. We paid 8 dollars for each, brought them and stood in line for about 30 minutes. They wouldn't even let us bring the drinks inside!

My point is, DO NOT waste your time, take my advice, stay somewhere else, even if you have to pay a little extra.
If you have any questions feel free to ask.
CRAPPY HOTEL!

My Stay here Was Awful you had to pay for parking which was $8 every time you would leave and return. They don t offer anything In the room no microwave no refrigerator. The room in which I stayed had a hole in the door  in which I took pictures which was helpful because they we're trying to charge for a door that was previous damaged I've also notice other hotels have free parking the resort fee are outrageous which wasn't a problem but  the parking was almost the amount of the resort fees in which when I call they said parkin was free I do know that I would not be stay here again I will be staying at a hotel that offers Free parking because that's the purpose of renting a car to get around because it's more to see in Vegas besides the strip By The Way I'm only choosing a star because Yelp Won't let me continue without choosing what a way to spend your Birthday weekend

Great location, good casino, good fun. Our stay was pretty good, our rooms were decent and clean. Housekeeping was on point for 2 of the rooms we booked. If only they were a fridge in the room. We brought our cooler and fill it with ice. They do have a ice machine located near the elevators which is a good thing. If you don't have a total rewards card I suggest you sign up for it. It makes checking in and out a lot easier. The pool well it wasn't all awesome as I expected it to be. If you have kids they get the smaller pool while the adults get the bigger and nicer pool. The only thing good about the kids pool is the slide and that's about it. By the way there's a charge for Internet and no phone services in the room which is why I give it a 4 star.

We picked the Flamingo because it was affordable and convenient (located right on the Strip). Bad call! Customer service was a disaster and the place was not very well maintained.

Our experience with early check-in epitomizes our customer service experience at the Flamingo. The website says that they cannot promise early check-in, but when we arrived at 8am from the airport, we were told that the room we booked was vacant and just needed to be cleaned, so we should come back in half an hour to an hour. We come back about an hour later, and are told that we need to come back in another half an hour to an hour. Finally, we go back another hour later and are told the same thing. It takes until past noon for us to check in. I wouldn't have minded if they had just told us up-front that we wouldn't be able to check in until later, because then we would have checked our bags and gone to explore Vegas, but by continually pushing us off for short periods, we were not able to leave the hotel and just had to wait for them to figure their shit out for hours.

Customer service disasters (sadly, there were others) aside, I will say that the Flamingo is very convenient. Right across the street from Caesar's Palace, etc. We also liked how many cabs, party buses, etc, were easy to access from the hotel. Other amenities? Huge casino, multiple Mexican restaurants, a sushi restaurant, a food court, a convenience store.

The upshot: The Flamingo is probably good if you really like to gamble and you want a good deal on rooms, but I'll definitely be looking elsewhere for our next Vegas weekend.

Sad to give this place a 1 star, but I gave them a 1 because of the constant room key problems I had. I was only here for 2 days and never got the room key\/door lock fixed. Other than this and the one rude lady at the front desk made my stay here upsetting. Will I come back here? I'm not sure yet.

We stayed at the Flamingo for 2 nights and we're very pleased with our stay. We arrived out of town early (around 12) and wanted to see about checking in early. There was a $30 early check in fee, which I thought was silly. But, we were over 4 hours early, so we didn't care. Check in was easy, and the reciptionist made sure to give us a decent view of the high roller. The rooms are outdated as far as furniture is concerned. I believe we had a 'fab room'. But, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable, which is really all we cared about. The complimentary valet was awesome as well. The hotel is extremely central to everything! We would definitely stay here again in the future!

We stopped through here as an In between to cool off and play a couple hands of blackjack. Seemed like an older hotel but still had the charm of the new ones. Blackjack bets are as low as $10. It's a fun spot.

We stayed here for 4 nights b\/c my husband had a class located in one of their conference rooms.  I really had my heart on staying at the Encore, however, it would have made for a pretty long walk at 8AM every morning, and I figured he could enjoy his time a little bit more given he could literally roll out of bed and go downstairs to his class (I know, I'm a great wife ; ).  Also, it would have been about a grand to stay at the Encore and the Flamingo was paid by the govt...so this put us over the edge to just suck it up and stay at the Flamingo.

We stayed on a upper floor in a go room, which wasn't too bad!  I will give the room 3 stars for view (overlooking pool), cleanliness, and it seemed relatively quiet.  The shower is also pretty nice!  But they sure did waste a lot of space putting in a tiny tub that no one would use.  

I give the Flamingo as a whole 2 stars because it just wasn't our scene, especially in the evenings!  We typically enjoy going out and then coming back to our hotel and having the option to gamble before crashing for the night, and we just didn't do that here.  Also, their restaurant choices are not too great, and is it too much to ask for a Starbucks???

On the other hand, the pool is really nice and it is funny to watch the line start up at about 8AM every morning (I even waited in line one morning in fear that I wouldn't get a chair, haha)!   Just an FYI, for all those that have questions\/concerns about their pool....YES, it does get very crowded!  They advertise that they don't open till 9AM, but I saw them letting people in as early as 8AM.  If there is just a couple of you, you will have no problem getting a decent chair as long as you are there before about 11AM M-TH.  However, if you go Fri.-Sat. you will probably need to be there by about 10AM to ensure you get chairs together, because it really does get crowded.  And if you aren't an early morning person, then I would wait till about 12-1 to go because by then people start leaving and you can usually snatch their chairs as they are leaving.

Flamingo makes for an okay stay...it just didn't do it for me (maybe I was asking for too much).  If I could do it all over again I think we would have chosen to pay for another casino because it would have made for a better overall stay...but that's just me!

I'm sometimes torn about whether to praise or lament about Flamingo - I've stayed there many times over the years and have had many different kinds of experiences. 

I want to stress that the staff is wonderful - no matter what problems I've encountered, every single person has tried their best to alleviate them.   One night I actually had to change rooms three different times, but didn't get angry because they were so nice, and of course upgraded me each time at no cost.  I've even gotten free suites and a limo ride home from a pit boss.  

The location is great if you like the Strip, as you can walk to everything and get that "bustle" that belongs only to Vegas.

Good variety of machines and table games.  Very nice coffee-shop type restaurant is my choice for most meals, although of course there's the ubiquitous buffet available as well as fast food.  There's a row of shops, and Donny and Marie were the staple entertainers at my last visit.

So what's my problem?   It's the rooms.  There always seems to be something wrong.  Even if all seems well, the all-glass bathroom is not for the modest, and if one person gets up before the other who would like to remain sleeping, having the bright lights through all that glass makes it very difficult.

The upgraded rooms have a fabulous king bed with the most luxurious mattress I've ever slept upon, a bath and a half (the "half" is off the sitting room, which is really nice for guests), and a TV in the mirror (although mine didn't work).  They also provide hair dryers in both baths!  However, my shower barely functioned and the toilet ran incessantly, so that wasn't much fun.  

If they could just get the room issues solved, this would be 5 stars in my book.  It may not be possible, considering the age of the place, and goodness knows they've spent a lot on renovations over the last few years.  As long as the customer service is so good, though, I'll put up with the problems and continue to patronize the Flamingo.

We have stayed at this hotel many times, and we are even platinum members of total rewards. However this last time they "gave" us a "comp" room for $34 a night in resort fees. The rooms furniture looked like it was from Goodwill, the toilet seat wasn't attached and the paint was peeling. If you get a fab room, run. Will not be staying here again, maybe time to join the mlife.

Let me start off by saying I usually don't write reviews, I just read them. But I felt  the need to write this because I had a different opinion as to what I had read. I visited the flamingo on 4\/19\/12 untill 4\/24\/12 . I must admit the check in line was very long. And they only two people working the desk . But then I saw a line that said for reward members only so I went to that line and only had a five minute wait . There's a desk right there that lets you sign right up for a rewards card take about two minutes then you can use the rewards only line. I was given a new fab room which was a regular room with a few new pieces in it but was fine with me because the room was comp. Free and free is always good . With this said I will be returning to the Flamingo again this year

I have stayed at the Flamingo several times before and my most recent stay is the first one that really left me disappointed. Something happened with our reservation, but they were still able to get us a room. The guy tells us he is going to upgrade us to a jr suite. Thinking this is a good thing, I get excited. Anyway, we walk into the room and it's totally outdated. The hotel had recently done a lot of renovations, and those rooms are great. It's just super annoying that they still rent out the crap ones like ours-- stained carpet, mold on the carpet in the corners, broken fixtures, mold on the shower curtain, dirty tiling in the bathroom. The bedroom section had such a low ceiling that my sister, who is 5'2, could touch the ceiling. We crawl into bed at night and realize there are no plugs on the nightstand to charge our phones-- so the phones have to be plugged into the wall across the room and just lay on the floor.

Parking is horrendous. Half the garage is of limits because it provides parking to a surrounding property and to Hertz. I wanted to valet since I was with someone who has joint problems, but they were full every single night. Finally I just gave up and started parking in a lot a way down the road. 

Another thing that bothered me is that the room service only goes until 1pm. I was looking forward to being in my pjs the night we arrived and watching tv, but there were no options. I get that there are other food places nearby, but im would have paid a pretty penny for someone to deliver it to me. 

The saving grace for this trip was the spa, which I will write a separate review about. It's only $10 to enter for the day for guests of the hotel, and it's totally worth it. 

I will stay again so long as they guarantee me a refurbished room.

The check-in went very quick, we had to change our room once - that process went a lot quicker than expected and without any problems - we booked a second room for our kiddos and the hotel was able to get them across the hall, the pools were still open which we loved and enjoyed.  Overall we've been pleased with our stay every time!  Thanks Flamingo for another great stay in Vegas!!!

READ NO OTHER REVIEW! I HAVE A BLACK BELT IN KEEPIN' IT REAL AND WILL BREAK IT DOWN FOR YOU BULLET STYLE..
* Walls are as thin as that paper football players break thru
* Every room has adjoining doors that are not insulated and a 5" gap on bottom
* As of 6\/24\/12 there is construction on NORTH side of hotel, they're demo'ing a 
    parking structure and lots of noise from 6am-4:30pm, loud!..loud! loud!
* If u want peace and quiet in your room, you won't get it, Flamingo is a frat house
* Security is actually "The polite police"..if a party happens next door @ 2am and you
    can't sleep, the polite police come up and ask them nicely to stop partying, then fist 
    bump the party goer's as they leave...no matter how many times they show up.
* Valet is always "FULL" even when they are not. Parking is a bitch in the structure.
* YES! Rooms are redone and that's it. Hallways still have the 1957 carpet and 
    wallpaper. The Flamingo is like 5 hotels in one, Identity crisis.
* If anyone from the hotel asks you "HOW LONG ARE YOU STAYING?" or "ARE YOU  
    STAYING WITH US" just say NO TO BOTH AND WALK AWAY. It's a time share
     scam with a free breakfast and show tickets followed by a 2 hr conference hosted 
     by Bernie Madoff. We did not attend but inquired deeper. Get my point? Tacky!!   
* WIFI IS HELLA EXPENSIVE!!! $25 for 12 hrs, etc. AT&T iphone gets ZERO SERVICE ANYWHERE INSIDE THE FLAMINGO!
* Go to the "BEACH POOL" for peace and quiet it's off the chains good. The other BIG 
     pool is pretty much hosted by MTV (not really but really) and is AWESOME if you 
     are 21 - 21 and a half.
*  Check out the Flamingo's, they's is cool. :)
* Bring your own coffee maker and fixins. Smart people do anyway.
* The "Cut" restaurant is AMAZING!! $50-$85-ish a plate but the atmosphere is 
   superb, the service is 5 star. Marcos was our server and he treated us like we
   were paying $1000 a plate. Food is Perfect! Hats off to the Chef!! 
* Last Tip! Don't stay here!!! but DO go to the restaurant "The Cut." 
PS. Partying is so bad in the hotel rooms that we actually packed up at 2am (our third night), got a refund and left back to LA, drove all night just to get away from the Flamingo who didn't do crap about the 30 people going from room to room on our floor. What a shame! Fist Bump!

The hotel is great location, pool is always a good time. Great location on the strip. 2 complaints... 1. There was a dirty wash rag in the bathroom when we arrived. 2. One female working the daybed\/cabana rental station is an absolute buzz kill. Not polite, zero smiles and the least helpful girl on the floor. Everything else is worth the $$$ I'd say!

I honestly have no complaints. My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights and had the best time ever. We had the Suite Deluxe. It was all we could ask for in a room. Yes it wasn't a huge room or suite like Caesar's Palace in The Hangover, but so what? It was clean, it was air-conditioned, had a great view of the pool and the High Roller, and so much more. Plus you weren't gonna spend that much time there anyways aside from sleeping and getting ready. You're in Vegas, after all. 

I will definitely return here again and again. I love you Vegas!!!
Don't be confused by the location, this place is a dump. My cloths smelled like the room for a month after my stay -yes, I washed them-.

I stayed here for a business conference, and for my first time in Vegas I was disappointed.

I have never paid so much for such a shitty room. The rates for each night were 160, 78, 180 and 270 dollars (this is with booking two months in advance). I've had better rates in Hilton hotels in Downtown locations and honestly, much more impressive rooms. 

The carpets were covered in dirt and stains. The walls looked like they had been subjected to multiple groups of drunken idiots going crazy. 

The bathroom had a fan (i think) but it sure as hell didn't work. The shower was nearly impossible to use because I would pull the mechanism for going from the spout to the shower head, but the spout would just spray everywhere. When the shower head did work, the pressure was low and I had to watch my feet because the spout was like a pressure washer at a car wash. 

When it came to getting food, I regularly would have to wait as long as a half hour for a line not more than 15 people long. In addition to the wait, the employees at many of the service establishments in the hotel itself looked as if they hated their lives and jobs, and treated me like it was my fault. The food court was the only place that seemed relatively quick, but even those establishments redefined the meaning of fast food with their slow pace. 

I have never felt so mistreated by employees of a hotel in my life. Ironically the only polite employees were the house keeping staff, and I only had two opportunities to interact with the kind lady keeping my room.

The only good thing is the location, which I am convinced is not worth the price. It has to be one of two things with this hotel: One, the ownership\/management literally doesn't care because they own so many casino\/hotels on the strip that they have no chance of going under, or two, the flamingo is literally the poorest performing casino the Caesars entertainment group owns and they don't care to invest in making the place respectable. Either way, I will never return to this hotel. It's better to be treated with respect and care than to save money.

Margaritaville is the highlight of this property, in my opinion.  I love their volcano nachos, and the show is worth seeing.  However, the drunks do seem to congregate here, as I read in another review.

This hotel is not somewhere I would choose stay, so I cannot speak to the rooms.  I have a feeling that would take a star or two away from this rating.  In looking at their site, the rooms appear to be updated.  Regardless, there are so many deals at even the top properties in Vegas that there is no reason to try a room here.  The location is fantastic, right in the heart of the Strip, across from Caesar's Palace and close to everything.

I have played in their casino and it is nicer than a few of its neighbors, but not by much.  Just a casino.  I will tell you that if you like playing on the cheap, the neighbors have lower minimum bets on most tables.

We have stated at flamingo twice now. The first time, we felt we got our money's worth, we paid $40\/night and it was okay. The second time, we were extremely disappointed! We just came back from spring break where they only had the family pool open! They squeezed hundreds of people into a pool meant for only about 100 people. We were all sitting on the cement, in stair cases, wherever we could find a spit for our butts. On SPRING BREAK! They had their huge 21 and over pool closed on spring break!! Needless to say, we were extremely disappointed as we came to Vegas on spring break for some pool time parties. There were no signs to let us know that either, no pre-warning of any kind. Second, this is a hotel who 2 years ago said charging resort fees was wrong. Guess who charges resort fees now?! And not only that, but they charged me $129 security deposit to make sure my $60 resort fees went through okay. What?! Third, there were countless things wrong in our room including huge holes in doors. We definitely will not be back. Stay at Mlife resorts in Vegas.

Do NOT stay here. I'm usually not too picky about hotels as long as they are clean, but this hotel is the worst hotel I've ever stayed. We stayed in one of the remodeled Go Luxury rooms and the faucet on the bathroom sink was not even attached to the bowl. The cords from the tv mounted on the wall were hanging, twisted, jumbled up down the walls, the carpets were filthy, only had 2 towels, keys to room quit working numerous time and we couldn't use the courtesy phone on our floor because it didn't work, had to take elevator to another floor to wait for security to let us in. Most of the elevators weren't working so we had to wait 20+ min to even get an elevator and by then the lines were so long it took even longer. After our keys quit working on 4 different occasions we had to wait in a line to get a new key each time, sometimes waiting in that line over 20 minutes. We spent more time trying to get to our room than enjoying Vegas and add the frustration to all this and it came close to ruining our vacation which we had planned for my daughters 21st birthday. Don't stay here. Trust me!!!! Even the security guard was frustrated because it was happening to a lot of guests. She stated she was embarrassed to work there. Don't stay here no matter what the price. It's horrible!!!!

This place sucks! I've only stayed here once before and now I remember why I hate the Flamingo. Elevators and escalators were out of order. They seem to not want to fix anything here. Customer service at the check in is a joke. I will never come here again. It's just a dumpy shit hole!

In town for a friends wedding.  Checked in on a Saturday around noon.  About a 20 minute wait for that.  The room DID look exactly like the one in the picture.  Exactly, in fact.  King sized bed (pretty comfy), flat screen tv, REALLY cheap and ugly pink\/black furry.....thing and all.  Didn't really appreciate the ghetto tagging etched into the window.  But that was small and easy to ignore.  And we really loved how centrally located the Flamingo is on the strip.  The Paris and Caesar's are a short walk away (well, "short" in Vegas terms).  We were enjoying our stay and the casino (did really well at Black Jack and the dealer - his name was T.G. - was alot of fun!!).  Had breakfast at the Paradise Buffet on Sunday morning.  You pay for the buffet up front and input your tip (kind of weird to tip before you've had your meal).  I input $6.00 as the tip.  The girl at the register mistakenly input $600.00!!!  No problem, though, she caught the mistake herself and said she would fix it.  Midway through our breakfast, she brought us a new receipt showing the corrections.  Cool.

Next morning, we want to check out.  So we go to the handy dandy "Express Checkout" function on our TV.  I've done this many times at many hotels.  We go through the whole process only for the TV to tell us the "Express Checkout" is not working.  Great.  So we go to the Lobby and head for the Registration Desk.  The line is huge.  And, yes, there were only 3 people at the Registration Desk.  Someone else here commented that they have WAAAY to few people working the desk for a property of this size.  And they are absolutely right.  And the 3 people that were working were so SLOOOOOOW!!!  After awhile, and realiziing we were going to be late for our flight, my partner noticed one of those old fashioned express checkout boxes where you fill out the card, drop your keys and the card in the box and you're on your way.  Fine.  Did it.  Done.  Rushing to the taxi stand, we notice there are about 6 people ahead of us.  And no taxis waiting.  No taxis.  None.  At a Las Vegas hotel.  In the center of The Strip.  The "helpful" taxi attendant said that the hotel shuttle was right around the corner and waiting and it's only $7.00.  We were pressed for time and couldn't afford to go to 6 different hotels to pick up more people (we took the shuttle from the airport to the Flamingo and stopped at 7 properties before they dropped us a block from the hotel entrance - they said it was due to construction but, it's funny, to pick people up, they pulled right up to the door).  So, we told him no, thanks.  We'll wait for a cab.  He says, "Ok, gonna be awhile."  And walks away.  5 minutes later, the shuttle leaves the property.  And wouldn't you know it, as soon as the shuttle leaves, taxi after taxi after taxi showed up like the Flamingo was the only resort in town.  That got me so mad I couldn't stand it!!  What a scam!!!  The taxi ride only cost $15.00, with tip!

So, outside of the Flamingo's influence, the flight home was fine.  

Except when I looked at my bank statement today.  Guess what $600.00 charge went through??  The torment continues.

I definitely will not be staying here every again.
The only highlight of my stay here was the very cute bell boy who I saw on my way out on my last day there.

I would give 5 stars but have to subtract one because of the crappy elevators .....my husband and I stayed in the GO room and it was clean, beds very comfy, big bathroom,  great view of the strip.  The casino floor is laid out nice,  not a maze like Harrah's....fun atmosphere at the table games, LOVE Sye at 3 card poker and Ross at Texas Hold Em!! Love the flamingos habitat,  so beautiful and serene...Will definitely stay here from now on,  just wish they would put in new elevators.

Everyone knows the history of Vegas and should know that the Flamingo Hotel was the first hotel operated by Benjamin (Bugsy) Siegel but alas people think this is the original Flamingo but NO it's not! The original Flamingo was demolished around the 70's to make way for bigger up to date resorts just like they are doing currently.  

I picked the Flamingo because we got a comp room for a Go Room Deluxe Strip View room over the weekend (which can be very pricey) and thought it would be a great deal since it's free on the weekend, recently renovated and right smack on the central strip.  We were transferring from Bellagio after staying 2 nights and stayed 2 more nights at the Flamingo and there is comparison between the 2 resorts other then the location. Valet parking was horrible as the line to valet was long until the attendant came and told us the parking garage was full and we had to leave our car outside for it to be parked. We needed the bell guy to take our bags from our car and when he arrived and waited around 20 minutes for him to arrive and when he arrived he picked up the bags and put his hand out and and wanted a tip right away and I thought that pissed me off but I didn't to make a scene so I tipped him a $1. 

Going to the check in area was a bit of a stretch from the the valet area, you'd have to take the escalator up to the lobby area and walk across the mall area and a few restaurants to get to the front desk where you are greeted with a long line. Also the some of the Flamingo Hotel employees were doing some dance around the lobby area, probably for some employee appreciation thing which I find odd since I never seen that before. The ventilation is a bit smokey and you can also smell a scent they pump in the air like a tropical or coconut smell probably to help clear out the smoke smell. Elevator area was very outdated and very retro 70's like and needed a massive overhaul, the hallway up to the room was very clean in our tower with the pink and white color tones that blends in the the renovated go tower. Not all the towers were renovated as you can tell when walking from one tower to another the hall goes from clean and vibrant to just filthy, old and smokey. 

Our Go Deluxe Room very nice and clean and appreciated the fridge and complimentary coffee maker and 2 coffee packets. The TV was a flat screen but the remove didn't work and so I called housekeeping and found out the batteries were dead but were replaced right away. The beds were very soft but what bothered was the no wifi in the room so I can check for any important email on my phone and check the news on my smart phone. But I'd have to pay $30 for 6 hours  only for the hotel part and if I wanted to use it throughout the Flamingo property, I would have to pay more I thought was a total rip off. The bathroom was pretty nice but needed some maintenance with the bathroom door not closing all the way and the shower jets on the wall was a nice touch but it would leave the bathroom partially flooded. I liked the small TV built inside the bathroom mirror but I hardly used it but the AC was very strong in the room ad felt like an ice chest, the view of the strip was a nice touch with the Bellagio fountains in the left side of the window and Caesars in the front but at night you can hear the music from Pure nightclub with the thumb thump sound which didn't annoy me a lot and it did stop around 4 am when I would be getting ready for bed. =P
 
After coming from the Bellagio pool, I didn't expect a lot from the Flamingo pool are other then the pictures I've seen on the website but average and not too classy but was very disappointed. The music was very loud with beer bottles all around the pool and trash floating on the water takes away the ambiance and the crowd was full of undesirables but had some eye candy and that helped out, not too much. The security guards at the entrance felt like I was going through a TSA checkpoint in Los Angeles and asked me to open my bag and checked my ID if I was over 21 so I can stay with in GO pool area. Sadly I always look forward to staying in the pools in Vegas especially in the 100+ heat but I only stayed for less then an hour and decided to just walk to the strip to shrug off this horrible pool experience. 

Customer service and restaurants were average and the casino needed a major overhaul, they did have a food court in the lobby but it wasn't worth the money spent. 

I gave the Flamingo 2 stars for the location and 1 star for the comped renovated room. 

Would I stay here again?

Maybe if it was free but I'd rather pay more for a more upscale hotel.

We stayed there 6\/25-7\/2\/2011 for our daughter's dance convention, that is the ONLY reason for staying was for CONVENIENCE since the convention was there at the hotel. 

Upon checking in the bathroom was dirty with hair on the toilet, counter and the floor was filthy! I called the front desk to ask if we could change rooms, but because of some Dance Rave that sold out the entire strip there were no more double beds. So we had no other option, but to stay in the room assigned. Thank God, I brought Clorox Wipes and Lysol with me, I personally had to clean the place myself! 

The following morning, I followed up about moving rooms and they said I didn't give them an opportunity for them to clean it up, which I did, no one ever showed up! Anyway, they finally said they had a room available, but it was the exact same room on a different floor. I told them I would not stay in an old room, they offered a Go Room, which supposedly is an upgraded room for an additional $30, they did not even offer anything for the inconvenience! Finally, they decided to give me a F&B credit...Whoppeeee!!!! After moving rooms, the Go Room, wasn't all that it was suppose to be. It was more like they put different furniture to make it an upgrade all the while it's still an old dirty room. 

Housekeeping had an attitude and was rude when asked for extra sheets, she said "You need to call for them," which was fine, but she didn't have to be rude about it. 

The swimming pool was ridiculous! The larger pool was designated for the adults anyone 18 and older. While the smaller pool was for the kids & family which we were so cramped we couldn't even swim! Didn't they know that they had a Dance Convention that would be bringing their families??? Everyone was so upset! 

The front desk Agent was rude as well! No empathy for the problems we were having. 


I DO NOT RECOMMEND this place for anyone! Rooms are disgusting and dirty, the rugs throughout the property were filthy! If the hotel is not similar to your home, why would you settle for less??? 

We will NEVER EVER STAY HERE AGAIN! You couldn't pay us to stay there again! The WORST HOTEL, they need to BULLDOZE IT and START OVER!!
The elevators were broken except for one. The check in line was ridiculously long. The room was ok besides having spider webs on the ceiling above the bed. I wouldn't stay here again.

LOL these positive  reviews are funny and written by people who don't know what hotel accommodations and hospitality is about. We stayed at (in this order) Bally's, Planet Hollywood, Paris, Caesars, RIO & Flamingo. And the only place worse was Bally's. The Valet parking is hard to find and very far from check hotel check in which means to go anywhere u practically can walk there before u get to valet to get ur car. And Kate night there was only one person working. The carpet is filthy in most of the casino & hotel, the elevators are gross filled with spit, mucus, vomit and possibly urine. In the hallways leading to our room the carpet was bubbling up as if it was installed by rookies. The casino dealers are clueless on payout so if u don't know ur payout u will be short changed or sometime overpaid. Most could careless about being tipped apparently. The slot machines were half working many cannot accept money or vouchers. Poor sound if working and buttons not working. Many ATM\/change machines out of service or unplugged. The worst QUALITY Control I've seen in a long time. If I ran this place I'd be embarrassed or if the person who ran this place for me I'd fire them tomorrow. What an embarrassment. 

The only positive note was the restaurant Center Cut was amazing! Excellent service, courteous staff and great food. Maybe the person running Center Cut should run all of The Flamingo.

Finally to there defense maybe it was so horrible because the are remodeling and replacing this crappy decor? All the other locations mentioned above made us extend our vacation another day or two & that's why we stayed at so many hotels but this shit hole is making me consider ending a day early, what was up until now the best vacation in  a long long time. 

I'd rather be in prison then stay here again under these same conditions...and I've never been to prison.

Wow, really surprised at how dated this hotel is! The rooms are extremely tired! The furniture has dents and dings, scratches etc. there are no charging ports in the room so you have to root around to plug in. I thought it was odd there weren't any coffee makers in the room. I will say everything was clean and the staff was nice but I'll not stay here again. Plus the added resort fee is just a rip off.

If you are thinking about staying at the Flamingo hotel in Las Vegas ...... Reconsider.    AWFUL hotel.   Service is absolutely awful from the checking in to the room service to the cleaning people.   AWFUL!!!!!!!!!

I stayed here for one day on a Tuesday for 35 bucks. Check in line was long but since im a total rewards member check in was immediate. It has all the ammenties one would need. Hotel room was remodeled and well priced for being on the strip.

We stayed in one of the renovated GO rooms and for two nights, it came out to $180. This was the first time I have stayed in a gaming hotel and it was really great. The location of the hotel can't be beat, parking was free, and if you are a Total Rewards member, you can check-in\/out way faster than the rest of the hotel guests. There are various eateries (a steakhouse, pizza window, cafe, buffet, and coffee shop). 

The room was VERY nice. The bed was comfortable, room decorated very modern and we had a nice view. We did have an incident at 5:30 a.m. this morning that the group of girls in the room next to us kept shrieking and screaming in excitement for 15-20 minutes. My husband called the front desk and security promptly handled it. We were very pleased. 

The only small complaint I had was that they tout no resort fees but you had to pay for the internet. Other than that, I loved the hotel and look forward to staying here in the future.

Revised Review: Mike Willinsky; hotel manager heard our concerns as we were walking out and considering cancelling all together. He went above and beyond to accommodate us and make the best out of a bad situation. He was polite and treated us with the upmost customer service. Thank u Mike :)  


Worst hotel EVER!!!! They remodeled the inside but not the staff nor costumer service. They are basically calling us liars talking about "we will trace the call to see if we can offer compensation after 24 hours"...i would rather pay the extra cash and stay at the Cosmo, Belagio, Venitian  then go through this again

I would have given this place a star and half if possible.  The only positive thing, was the pool, even though half of it was closed. They closed the other half early (4 pm) because there was a private party that night.

The service is horrible. I checked in on Sunday and there was a room service tray full of half eaten\/ puked food in the hallway right out of the elevator. Made me almost vomit walking by it. The next day, I tried to put the tray on the room service cart she refused to take it, I did take one of her towels to cover the the food. I later told the Hotel Manager about it, thinking he would have someone do something.  Next day (2 days) later, the tray was still there.  

The lines to check in are horrible.  

The bathrooms are tiny. 

The room was fairly clean, the tv worked. 

The way the tray ordeal was handled, has caused me to never stay here again.  They obviously are way under staffed and the staff there, doesn't care about customers.

This is the worst hotel ever! Well my family paid for the cheapest room, so not quite sure how great the expensive rooms are. First off, the parking structure is HORRIBLE! So we decided to do valet.

Anyways, We were on the 16th floor, as we walk in, our jaws dropped, literally all the way down to lobby! Everything was so old inside, the dresser was falling apart, the tub faucet was leaking, mold everywhere, drain was so.....slow! Around the sink area more.....MOLD!  The motel at Disneyland area is way better! 

Even if the room is at a medium price .. don't give customers a dirty presentation! 

Also this place gave me a phobia of elevators! My dad and I decided to get some breakfast downstairs. We entered the elevator, and got down to 3rd floor, all of a sudden the light for lobby goes out, and I was thinking to myself why it wasn't lit anymore (we haven't even reached lobby level) and that's when chaos started, the elevator decided to do a Hollywood Terror Hotel Mode. It would literally go up really fast and bounce for the longest time until we reached the 22nd floor,and it was a relief that the elevator doors opened! Then we saw this housekeeper and told her that this elevator is malfunctioning, and all she did was stood there and said, "I know." UH OKAY?!?!? what.. NO COMPRENDE INGLES?!

Fix your parking structure and do more improvements in your rooms and hire better housekeepers! 

Overall I will never stay here again!
I recently stay at the flamingo and it was awful. Awful customer service. Just absolute crap! Don't stay at this hotel!!!!!

Pros:
-Good location on the strip.
-There was a lot of food places on the ground floor and nearby, which was helpful because I was sick and couldn't venture far.
-Room was relatively clean, only complaint was there was some shower gel on the shower curtain that no one cleaned off and there was stained\/flaking drywall on the ceiling above the shower from what I presume was a leak.
-Check-in and check-out was really easy at the self-serve kiosks.
-There's a nice little shopping area on the outside of the casino where there are shops and restaurants.

Cons:
-I felt bad for the caged birds on the main floor. They are around the hustle and bustle of people all day, which can't be healthy. I think they need some secluded quiet time without people around.
-Not enough hot water in the morning when everyone was showering
-The heat did not work in our room the first night, but when we called the next morning they did send someone to fix it.
-Parking situation was terrible.  It was free in their garage, but the night we arrived it was like they had run out of spaces?  It was very confusing and there was no one to direct traffic and we got stuck in a dead end at one point and just, ugh.

Overall, a fine experience for the price of the hotel room.  Next time I might consider upgrading to one of their nicer room options.

Had our national convention here last week. The outside grounds were very nice with the pool and the pink flamingos. Having Margaritaville bar inside hotel was nice. There was ample free parking which was nice because the hotel is huge. 
 It is nice because you are in the middle of the strip. The rooms were just ok with stains on the carpet and outdated bathrooms. The first morning there was no shampoo which was disappointing because I did not pack shampoo. Some of the elevator buttons were missing. The attention to detail was lacking.
 The food provided for the meetings were good. Overall it was ok for the price.

never stayed at this hotel. Just being in the lobby creeped us out! it was humid and just filled with smoke. We almost RAN out of there. We just wanted to see all the famous hotels of LV. couldn't imagine staying there. Oh we went to the restaurant there just to look, and we died laughing. lol it smelled terrible. We cld not understand why or how cld ppl eat there.

Stayed here with a group of girlfriends. We booked our rooms as a package deal with the flights via Expedia. We called them months in advance to make sure that our two rooms were adjoining. We called the hotel on the day of check in to confirm our reservations and they told us that we didn't have any! After a 2 minute mini-heart attack and a transfer to someone else our reservation was found. We also confirmed again that our rooms would be adjoining. Flash-forward. We get to Vegas and check in. Our rooms were not adjoining. The closest that we could get was across the hall from each other, which worked out okay for us. 

The hall carpet desperately needed replaced. It was bunched up in the hallways and was not easy to walk on with heels. The hotel room itself was okay. The TV was turned on once and we could not get it turned off. We tried using the remote and the power button and that sucker was on for good....We had to unplug the TV to eventually get it off. The only other complaint would be the toilet seat. At first we thought it was dirty but turns out it was just yellow stains... ALL over the seat. It was kind of gross. 

The location of the hotel is amazing and the 21 and over pool was perfect for a day of lounging and partying. I would defiantly stay there again on my next trip to Vegas.

Luxury Go room with strip view.  Dissappointed to find no bath tub. We watched peoples youtube videos of this room & saw a tub so thought we would have one.  Bell boy says only some have tubs but not all, and most dont.  I say, all rooms labelled with the same name should have the same amnetities. Oh well, we could live without the tub. 
-TV didnt work, okay so they sent up a new remote. 
-showerhead has to be pointed all he way to the side, if its aiming straight out, the bathroom floor will be flooded. 
-bodyjets in the shower are awesome tho, & good water pressure for sure is a plus. 
-sink drains very slowly so make sure you dont leave the water running too long. 
-staff so far has been nice.
-We like the casino, not too crowded but not dead. Atmosphere is great. 
-location is perfect.  Our view is very nice as well. 

I would say despite some of the problems we had, Id stay here again. We paid 300 for 4 nites & its worth the price so far.

This place is a dump.  The only redeeming quality is the rooms were dirt cheap when I stayed there and compared to the surrounding hotels significantly less expensive.  I can see why.  My room had grime on the walls and peeling wallpaper.  The bathroom toilet was broken (minor issue as I was able to self-repair) and the lamp shades were cracking.   The room had almost no water pressure.  There was graffiti on the hallway walls on my floor.  The elevators were borderline scary and only semi-functional for the duration of my stay.   Sometimes the doors scraped against the elevator car when opening, or the doors would open very slowly.  One was out of service altogether for the entire 4 nights I stayed here.  There was also colorful graffiti in the elevators as well.    

     The staff was otherwise nice but don't expect any helpful amenities (no toothpaste delivery to your room for example, you can buy that in the lobby for $4 for a travel size).

     Internet was 15 dollars a night, which I guess is understandable since the room was so cheap.   

     Casino floor was typical if otherwise unexciting to look at.   They do have a decent poker room with limit games if you prefer that to no-limit.  A lot of the surrounding hotels don't have limit games so I guess that's a draw.   Nothing special about the restaurants here but they weren't terrible either.
   
     The Flamingo should probably invest in a maintenance person to actually repair the broken things all over the hotel.  Either that or they should demolish the place since it's clear they aren't interested in keeping it in presentable shape.   My expectation is this place isn't here the next time I come to Vegas, because no self-respecting hotel would keep a property in this condition without upcoming plans to destroy it.

Okay so here is my problem with the flamingo, this USE to be one of my favorite hotels on the las Vegas strip,  but this time will definitely leave a bad taste in my mouth, I arrived around 9 pm and the check in line was way to long to wait in, I went up to a woman standing in the "mail and keys line" and asked her if where hotel invited guest (comped players) check in she looked at me as if I was speaking a different language, then said there is only fast check in for diamond members only, I said well sense you're just standing behind the check in counter not doing anything can you start checking ppl in to make the line move faster. She didn't think that was a good idea so I left and decided I would come back later to check in. I came back around 11 30 pm 2 hours later and literally the line was longer, this time I had no choice I had to wait, I stood in line for what seemed like eternity a elder lady in front of me FELL DOWN and had a medical emergency due to standing for so long, after 15 minutes of her on.the ground the medics made it to her and they expedited her check in, finally at 1 30 am I had my room.keys in my hand, to me that's entirely to long, there were 10 check in lines and clerks behind 4 of them, managers and clerks were also behind the counter watching and not helping the other 4 clerks checking ppl in, my room is a "go room" with a strip view, remote control curtains , tv in the bathroom mirror and a king size bed, I love the casino here and will always be a player but after experiencing that gruelling check in process I dnot know if ill ever be willing to go thru that again, back to M life properties!

For the amount of money you pay at this place for 2 nights, its definitely not worth it. The holiday inn express is better and cheaper. But for convenience I had to stay here. I guess its what you make it..

Old and outdated and I could hear the big air conditioner and hotel's mechanical equipment going non-stop. It sounded like my hotel room was attached to a jet engine. The furniture and decor looks like it hasn't been updated in 20 years or longer and the bed was sort of comfy but could you hear the springs squeak every time you moved even the slightest. Disappointed!
The only good thing about this place is the location. Do not stay here!!! Too much to write about.

This was all last minute to prepare for an unexpected production change. Lots of that in the biz, and the better run hotels handle our bobs and weaves as matter of routine. Our Hendersonville videographer, Asheville videographer, and, Brevard videographer, met the Burbank team at their choice of hotels, the Flamingo. They have some sort of corporate deal with the hotel. Despite our plane arriving early in morning, we still got to check in right away. Thank you for that Channel 70 Video Productions!  The Burbank Channel 70 people have a long history of using the Flamingo as a venue for affordable meetings. Again, the hotel handled our small meeting with their expected professionalism. For privacy purposes, we always scatter our rooms. I drew the short straw and ended up with a small and rather plain (as compared to LV standards) room with a partial view of the IP, but it served the purpose. The next morning the sounds of construction acted as an alarm clock. It's good to know people are employed doing construction in these tough times. It was a good sound to hear.  On our second night we ran long on the job and worked through. I ordered meals for everyone from room service and the meal was on time and was good. Kudos to the room service operation. We hired local Production Assistants and that night one of them hit Keno for $3500. What a town. The Flamingo serves us well for small meetings and the next one will be here for sure.

This review is almost a year old.  I stayed in a basic room for 6 nights in mid-August of 2014. Don't really get what all the hate is about.  Yeah its not the best hotel on the strip, but if you are like me and not in the hotel much at all, it shouldn't matter.  This was purely a poker trip, so I wanted something centralized on the strip.  You can't beat the Flamingo in that area.  Also wanted a clean room.  Check!  I did have a minor issue where I was staying on the 18th floor.  There was lots of marijuana smells.  I called the front desk and complained, and they very easily gave me another room, didn't have a GO room upgrade, but were able to give me a room with a view of the strip.  It was actually quite awesome to wake up every morning\/afternoon and watch the business that is the strip.  The basic cheap room they usually give you is just the back of the hotel, a much uglier view.  As for the elevators, which people seem to be having an issue about these days, they were not bad when I was there in 2014.  All were functioning, even though a little worn and beat up.  The weekends do get a little more crowded with many drunks and sloppy people going up and down.  But what hotel doesn't have that.  If you want the best price, for a clean room, centralized location, Flamingo still wins!

I was very happy with our decision to stay at the Flamingo Hotel and Casino. The place is located central on the strip directly across from Caesar's Palace. It's also right near the High Roller and the hourly water show. It is large, flashy, and fun. There were even actual Flamingos outside. 
Our room was a non-smoking double queen room on the 27th floor. Very high, but the view was amazing. We could see the other casinos as well as the mountains in the background. The room had a couch and the beds were incredibly comfortable. We also had a coffee machine and TV. I felt right at home and very happy here. 
When we had to book an extra night at kind-of the last minute, the service desk was very accommodating and made the process easy. We even got a lower rate for the extra night. 
I would recommend the Flamingo to anyone looking for an affordable yet exciting place to stay on the Strip. 
The reason why this is a 4 star review instead of 5 is because 
1) We originally booked a studio and they told us that they no longer had the studio for us (not cool bro)
2) The wifi only worked downstairs, not in our room.
Other than that, all good things.

We stayed for about a week in their base room called "Fab King" I thought it was cool that as we walked in that they had a few massage therapists working on people in the lobby and in the casino........but after staying in their horrid beds.....NOW I know why.......by day 5......My neck and back were so messed up........I was in so much pain........I was going to hire one.......Instead we checked out and went to PARIS hotel........just because we would get to sleep in a better bed. The pillows are not down filled......they are hard......more like an old stale marshmallow......the bed....hard as a rock.....Yes, they have cool flamingos and parrots and the casino area can be fun........but I will NEVER stay here again. I seriously need to send them my chiropractor bill.......I'm not even an old person.....Wth! The parking was a nightmare......we'd drive around the garage forever trying to find a spot only to come up empty handed......when we complained to the parking attendant.....they told us that we'd have to go to the overflow parking located behind the dark alleyway.......it was a long walk to get back to hotel. If you must stay here......go for the super upgraded room.....There are just soooo many other hotels to stay instead of this one.......even holiday inn has better beds. Did I mention my neck is still hurting?

This place was AWFUL! Let's start at the beginning:  the first evening as I went to get ready for a night out I discovered the shower had little to no water pressure, so my beautification ritual didn't go smoothly. After we returned at 1 am ( been up since 5 traveling) we couldn't sleep because the people in tedium next door were having A party in the hallway. I couldn't call security because our phone was out, the entire time we were there. after a sleepless night we went to the cafe for breakfast but it was so bad I set my food back and just has coffee.  By the second day we were miserable. Unshowered and unrested we were very grumpy. First vacation we've taken in 10 yrs. The party next door continues until 7 AM the next day. When we got up that morning there was garbage, including an overturned plate of honest food strewn across the hallway. It sat for hours

The elevators were a whole othe issue as well. Rickety and sketchy describe them best. At one point a little girl was crying to her parents "I don't want to get in here!". They were filthy as well, garbage and cigs just sat there. 

The 3rd night we switched rooms due to our unruly neighbors. The water pressure was better, but partway through my shower I discovered some goo on the shower curtain. I'm pretty sure it was vomit. So I jumped out of the first good shower I'd had in 3 days. when we went to bed, exhausted, we discovered the heater only blew ice cold air. We turned it off and called for extra blankets. 40 min later I had to call again. 

I wouldn't stay here again if they gave me a free week.

Please, please do yourself a favor. This place is awful. Room was switched mid-vacation. They gave me a one night resort fee, which was stupid because my flight was delayed and I wasn't even there one night I paid for. Then they gave me a buy one get one buffet at check-in. Nice! It was for a day I wasn't going to be there...really? Then, I got an email back from the "general manager" just to find out it was a front desk manager. A blatant lie...I've got the email for proof. Then, I was forwarded to a "customer service" manager. He was nice but still, the vacation was ruined due to the hotel. I told them to keep their resort fees because they are in bankruptcy and need it more than me, obviously. And what are resort fees for? It was too cold to use the pool, so...? Why don't they just charge more for the rooms? There is NO "resort." The place is dirty and they treat you like that unless you're a "diamond"  member. Quite frankly, if you spend enough money here to earn that status, you're an idiot, let alone "platinum." There's NOTHING diamond or platinum about this place. This was my 9th time to Vegas and have never had a complaint...until now. What a joke. Hopefully, I'll be there in 5 years to watch them implode this place and make room for something useful. If you don't heed my warning, it's on you. Don't complain later. You've been warned.

Im not the type to gamble but after visiting the garden and checking out the koi fish and flamingos my family started walking  back to the cars. I had 1$ in my pocket so i said what the heck whats 1$ dollar i walk up to a pennie slot machine put my dollar in push max bet and lord be hold  i hit a small jackpot.

This review is from 3\/23-3\/26

So my friends and i decided on this hotel due to the fact it is 1) inexpensive, 2) conveniently located in the middle of all the action. and 3) we had stayed there once before so already knew what to expect. 

Hotel has check in kiosks i tried using one for faster check in, but doesn't let you check in and use cash to pay for the room\/deposit.... so i has to wait in line since i prefer paying cash and leaving a cash deposit rather than with a debit card.... so back in line i go, check in was easy but semi-long line. 

hotel lobby and casino and literally outside of the casino have a gross cigarette smell to it, quite disgusting especially if you're hungover. LOL. 

elevators suck and are really slow :\/ 
my room wasnt cleaned at all the 3 nights i was there, toilet paper wasn't stocked we had to call the front desk to bring us some, which took literally 1hr to deliver a roll....

-no microwave or fridge in the basic rooms and furniture is outdated, dirty floor mat, small bathroom, and super dim lights. also, AC wasn't working it was so stuffy in the room and also no window to open. :( 

i think the worst part was the bedding itself. it causes my friends and i to become super itchy an develop a rash, either the bed had bed bugs or the detergent they use for the sheets caused an allergic reaction..... at this point i'm starting to think it's probably bed bugs...

pros....
-located in the middle of everything 
-walking distance to drais & Tao nightclub 
-casino waitresses were pretty quick to refill your drink while playing the slot machines 
-lost my car keys and realized once my flight landed in CA, contacted the flamingo lost and found and they made it super easy to have my lost items delivered to me. 

would i stay here again? maybe, if i was on a budget , this is a good hotel if you're literally just going to party in vegas and rarely stay in the room. it sucked to get ready to go out in a dim room :\/ 
 
i think it's time i find a new hotel to stay at when i go to vegas. goodbye flamingo. you have been warned.

Gorgeous hotel! Make sure you get a suit with either a strip view or pool view- totally worth it. The pool is nice but get there earlier to reserve you space. The food options aren't that good but you're on the Vegas Strip and you're surrounded by food places. The casino is big and yes it smells like smoke. Many amenities in the hotel. Great location very close to Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, and Paris.

The Flamingo is home to some of the best shows in all of Las Vegas. I love their intimate show room, and they are in a GREAT location on the strip. However, the hotel itself was disappointing. The room was in serious need of repairs, I had a giant hole in the ceilings of the shower and absolutely no hot water or water pressure. I told management about the issues but they were dismissive. Internet is also not included in the resort fees, it's a additional $24 per day per device. To me that wouldn't be a big deal as my phone has it's own hot spot but somehow I think the hotel has a way to block the connection as it didn't work at all. Lastly, I reported a case of theft to management. Management said they would have security come to my room to file a report, nobody ever came.

Come to Vegas and stay at the World Famous Flamingo Hotel.  Luxuriate in our 25-thread-count linens on pancake flat pillows.  Our bathroom products are Suave exclusives so you know you're getting the best.  And why go to the spa when at no extra charge, you can exfoliate your ass on our sandpaper single-ply? We'll even save you a trip to our casino, because it's always a gamble as to whether or not room service will actually arrive or your room will get made up today.

This and so much less is waiting for you when you book your stay at the Flamingo Las Vegas.

First impression: Road\/parking lot under construction. The parking structure has limited spaces (many ppl can't even find a space, we were lucky tho) and far away from hotel lobby. Valet line was a long wait too and often full. Check in line was long and moving very slow. Front desk staffs unfriendly. Room was newly renovated, pretty nice, but the habitat tower was very far away from lobby and not luggage friendly, I have to go thru stairs couple times which was very troublesome. Despite all this, I was still excited to live in flamingo cuz I was prepared parking would be a problem until....

Here is why I gave out a two star rating. When I booked my room thru totalrewards call center, I had a promotion code buy two nights and get one night free. The receptionist told me if I don't use the promotion code, they are offering me free helicopter rides. I was pretty skeptical and asked "Really? Free helicopter rides around the strip for one or two? Cuz we have a total of two ppl stay in the hotel room." The receptionist asked me to hold and she came back to me saying they will give me two helicopter VOUCHERS at the front desk when I checked in. I was so excited and thinking it is a great deal. However, when I got to the hotel, checked in and they have me a COUPON for the helicopter rides which is buy one get one free. My local friend told me the helicopter prices on the coupon are more expensive than what they can get me. I asked the front desk about the VOUCHER totalrewards told me about over the phone. A lady at the mails and keys gave me attitudes and funny faces while she looked up on her computers, she even gave me silent treatment when I asked her questions. And I told her it's fine I don't get the helicopter rides but I want my buy two get one free promotion code applied to my bills. She said she can't do anything and brushed me off. I only spoke to her 5-10 sentences and she made me wait and looked at her computer for over 20 minutes before brushed me off. I am like, if you can't do anything about it, it's fine but don't give me attitudes and hold me there with your funny faces and not solving any problems. I don't even blame the call center receptionist for wrong information but the mail and key staff made me really angry.

Booked a last minute suite here on the 23rd floor with a view of the pool. We were quick to get in, room was clean, spacious with a great ambiance for my other half and I. We had the breakfast buffet two mornings on a row and it was incredible every time. We ate at the Mexican restaurant there and had a few really good margaritas with some fish tacos. We had fun walking the strip but never seemed to stray from our hotel. The casino was lit almost all day long and we felt a very friendly vibe from hotel staff, floor and drink girls and card dealers. Overall great experience and want to take another weekend off to do it all over.

I have stayed at the Flamingo multiple times in the past, all good experiences.  I am not a gambler, so I cannot comment on that.  My family booked the Flamingo for three reasons: location on the strip, good experiences in the past, and the rating of the family pool.  The service this time, though, was without a doubt, the worst service I have ever experienced in Las Vegas...at ANY hotel.  

It started with check in.  I arrived at 3:00pm to a very long line of people at the front desk.  There were two desk agents.  After finally making it to the front of the line I was immediately informed I would be charged the "early check-in fee" of $16.00 because at that time it was a few minutes before 4:00.  No "Hello."  No "Thank you for waiting."  Nothing.  I wasn't going to wait in line again, so I agreed to the fee.  When my family and I made it to our room, it was the wrong kind of room - single King bed - which was not what we reserved.  I called from the phone in the room they told me to go back to the desk.  After a bit of protest, they sent me to the key desk to avoid the line.  We were sent to another room on the other side of the hotel.  The process took 1.5 hours or so by the time we were finally in the room.  No apologies for the screw-up, not even a "Please" or "Thank You" or even a "Thanks for picking the Flamingo."

As mentioned, the pool got good reviews for families.  Well, it was awful.  I had been to the pool at the Flamingo multiple times in the past before there was a 21 and over pool and a kid's pool.  In order to carve out a kid's pool, it appears they took about 1\/3 of the total pool space to allocate to families.  As a result, the kid's\/family pool was packed! Poolside service was nonexistent.  Lines at the snack\/beverage counter took on average, 30 minutes.  My wife was quick to point out, though, that the only place there was no line for the restroom in Las Vegas was at the Flamingo pool.  Hmmmm.

We were supposed to stay five nights, but left after three.  We just couldn't take it anymore.  When my wife called down to the front desk to change our departure date, 40 hours in advance, the agent said that she could not waive the early check-out fee.  Apparently, that could only be done by a manager, who was not available.  When she asked when the manager would be available, the answer was, "they are very busy and may not be available."  I called down to ask the same question about 15 minutes later.  That time, the agent said that since the manager was not available, she would waive the fee.

As mentioned previously by another person, you get what you pay for.  The room rates were good, but it doesn't make up for the poor service and the misrepresented facilities. I will not stay at the Flamingo again, regardless of the price.

We stayed in one of the newly remodeled GO rooms. It's the hotel's take on mid-century modern, but it's definitely more modern than mid-century. Yes, there is a large flat screen tv and a tv in the bathroom mirror. Large bathtub, separate shower. There is an audio system with a hookup for an ipod, but you need a cable (not your iphone or ipod charger) to hook into the system.
