We called the front desk to get one and they said they were out and that the cables have been placed on backorder. 

The location of the hotel and the hotel rates really can't be beat. It's in the middle of the strip right across from the Bellagio and Ceasars. We had a view of the Bellagio water show thingy from our room. The strip is really walkable from this location. And there is also a bus stop for the Deuce ($7 bucks for a 24 hour pass) right outside the hotel entrance.  If you want to go up to Fremont Street from the strip, I recommend getting a pass for the Deuce or the Ace (which is the express bus).  Cabs to downtown from the Flamingo can be $15-$20 depending on the time of day and the route. 

A tip when you are checking in...if you already have a reservation and you have the credit card you reserved the room with you don't need to wait in the long line to check in with a human being. There are computer kiosks towards the end of the front desk. You can check in there and get your room keys dispensed from the kiosk. Otherwise, you may end up waiting up to 20-30 minutes to check in.

ive stayed at better for the amount i paid. spent the past weekend there, and was disappointed! 

pros:
- location! located right in the middle of the strip, it was easy to go to surrounding hotels, although due to the insane summer heat my friends and i taxied it to most of our destinations
- mini fridge in the room was great! kept our vodka ice cold! :P
- burger joint: flamingo's all night diner had a great deal - the burger deal or whatever, but basically a burger and fries for only $2! cant beat that

cons:
- room cleanliness: the carpet in the room looked like the floor of a frat house; stains everywhere - even in the closet! ... i was also unsettled by the beginnings of mildew on the shower curtain
- check in: i wasnt expecting the long line at the check in counter at 1am on a friday. i had to wait an HOUR in line just to check in. i didnt understand it considering it only took me about ten mins when i got to the counter

would i stay here again? probably not. i came on the recommendation from a friend that the renovated rooms were very nice, and im sure they are, but if you get stuck in the older wing of the hotel, dont expect anything! its only slightly better than a motel. so not worth the amount of money i paid ($240 for two nights!)

Very low budget.  The hotel will nickel and dime you to death.  We arrived at 12:45pm on a Wednesday and was informed check in was at 1pm and it would be an extra $20 to check in early or go to the kiosk to check in. The kiosk area was a complete zoo as is the Lobby area. Oh they did offer us $10 off if we declined housekeeping services during our stay.  Really???  Then to get to our room we had to pass the time share folks who are trying to sell you every time you walk by.  Seriously!!! WTH!!! The casino is out of date and the rooms even more out of date. The bathroom in our room was tiny and the shower pressure was horrible. There are two pools one that blasts loud music and the family pool where you can still hear the loud music thumping from the party pool. By the way, it was a Wednesday and Thursday.  I can understand doing the party pool on the weekends but for the love of God give it a rest during the weekdays.  Check out is 11am asked for a 12pm check out but that of course is an extra $20.  Basically, this hotel caters to the young kids on a budget.  I could have stayed at Treasure Island for the same price and it's much nicer, more modern and has great customer service.  Unfortunately I wanted to try a different hotel and was not happy at all. Avoid the Flamingo Hotel.

Went back in August for a slot tournament and stayed 3 days at the Flamingos and everything was great, had no problems and everyone was pleasant. Shuttle service make it nice so you can go to the RIO and back, but You Have to walk to catch the shuttle service and Platinum, gold card members get priority 1st to get on the shuttle 1st, and if there is a seat available then you can get on. So you might have to wait a couple of shuttle to get over to the RIO.

I reserved a room 3 months ago to celebrate my birthday.  I read tons of reviews so I knew about the "Fab" (not so fab) rooms and the "Go" rooms.  I booked a mini suite which didn't state either fab or go but I assumed since it was more expensive than the go regular rooms it was nicer.  Not so much.  Upon arrival we went to check in at the platinum desk.  Then the dreaded words came that this room in not remodeled.  I knew from the reviews that this room would be nasty and I would not be spending by birthday there.  They said they could give me a normal Go room for an additional $100.  This made no sense to me why I would have to pay more for a room that was originally less.  They had no good excuse.  She even went to talk to her boss.  She came back with the rude answer that since we were newly upgraded platinum due to getting their credit card they couldn't wave the charge.  So now we are basically being told we don't matter due to how we got our platinum status.  Sorry but platinum should be platinum.  Quite rude and demeaning.  I immediately called Total Rewards and pled my case.  I asked for another hotel and I ended up getting an awesome room over at Bally's.  I will never ever attempt to stay at this hotel again.

This place is old and worn out. It reeks of cigarette smoke. If you check in at 4:30 pm, expect to stand in line for 2 hours. They also did something that really made me mad. Without disclosing to me at the time of booking or discussing with me at the time of check-in, I discovered when I got home and looked at the receipt they emailed me that they added a so-called "Resort Fee" of $22.40 per night to the bill. I have no idea what that was for and I am challenging it. This was my 4th time in Vegas. The other places I stayed at were the Excaliber, San Remo (now Hooter's) and MGM Grand. All prior experiences were fine\/no issues.

A throwback of a hotel (who doesn't love that about Vegas), but a good time gambling all around.  I was able to play cheap Pai Gow and stay for a while, drinking dozens of beers.  The cocktail waitresses and dealers are very nice.

I have not stayed in the hotel, so I cannot speak to the rooms.  But if gambling is your thing, this place is pretty awesome!  Not a lot of flash, but a nice amount of cash...in your pocket.

Stayed here a couple nights last month and I would stay here again!  Pretty quick check in and check out process, did not use any of the check in\/out machines.  Our room had a pretty good view of the pool\/habitat area along with the high roller! We slept with our curtains wide open for a nice view of the wheel! There was also wifi that actually worked!!! The hotel is also on a central location on the strip and close to the Linq with in-n-out and the high roller ferries wheel! 

The bathroom in our room was a bit dated though and would fog up after taking a shower. The AC in the room needed a cleaning because the room was always so dusty. And I hated dragging our luggage down the small flight of stairs because our room was in the tower that was on the opposite end of the hotel quite a bit away from the lobby! Never ate and any of the hotel restaurants

Service no good they forget to bring you the drinks you asked for they take about 20 minutes to bring you what you asked for. No, coffee refills no napkins we were calling the hostess and she ignored us. Bad service period !!!!

Been here my first time when I was a wee lil laddy. 10 years old with my parents. Didn't matter to me if the room was wack or super-dooper.

When I came back in Feb. 08, we got comped for $90 for a weekend. I must say, the place is cool. We did the $20 trick and got upgraded to a great view of the fountains and a larger room. I was very happy with the location. Easy access to everything. Right smack in the middle of the Casinos.

Been staying at Venetian, Paris, Planet Hollywood, Westin and now Flamingo. 

I also slept in my friend's car for a couple of hours when we had no hotel room for new years. That's another story.

For the price, and location, Flamingo gets 4 STARS!

I will go back again in Sept. 08 and I will try to get the "GO," room for an extra price. I will update with the results.

Im not sure what the negative reviews are all about. We had a BLAST! It is prime location, and if you get a view towards the fountains you can see the show as many times as you want from the comfort of your room. Do take into account that this hotel is being renovated, so some of the elevators don't work or you will see construction here and there. This is one of the oldest hotels in the Strip. So for its  age it is pretty well maintained. Their weekend DJs are fantastic.  I would not recommend getting in The pool once it gets super crowded, it looks kind of murky, but you are in for a great time. The buffet is pretty decent and the flamingos exhibit is super cute! This hotel is as close as it gets to "old Vegas". It was financed and build by Bugsy himself. There is still some art deco details here and there in the walls of the hotel. The staff is kind friendly and very helpful   It is definitely worth the stay.

We recently traveled to Vegas with a group of 10 people to celebrate birthdays and get silly in the desert. Mrs. M and myself have stayed at the Flamingo several times before and found it to be a good value In terms of price, gambling stakes and location on the strip.
When checking in for the love of God, do yourself a favor and use the self check kiosks. The lines are ridiculous at almost all hours but the kiosks always seem to be empty for some odd reason.
When checking in, Greg helped us out with the process but the machines went down so he took us into the private area for VIP's and there we found out that they lost our reservation for an upgrade to a Go Mini Suite. This was not good since our room was going to be the starting point for partying and we needed some space. I explained this to the check in person and she worked with her manager to get us into a junior neopolitan suite at the same price.
The room was great with two bathrooms, a wonderful view of the pool and garden area and a few couches to sit on while we had our warm up beverages. The only draw back was the smell of the hallway in the evenings which gave the aroma of cat urine. Thankfully the room didn't.
The casino is great at The Flamingo, the stakes are near the lowest you can get and most dealers are pretty cool. We were a large group and could get a little silly and most were tolerant of our loudness and occasional salty language, however a few did give us warnings to tone it down.
The pool is still beautiful is it was a few years ago, but the theme is very different with the booty shaking contest and people swimming around all loaded trying to hook up. I wish it was little more upscale and relaxing, but I guess they aren't trying to appeal to middle age people very much these days.
Checkout was smooth thanks again to the kiosks as the line up on Sunday morning was crazy long. The same fellow who checked us in, Greg, was there to help. When I was done I tipped him and asked if he could help to get my wife to the front of the bag check line and he was more than happy to oblige so I could get back to some final partying with my brother who was set to leave in a short time.
Flamingo I love you, you introduced me to Vegas almost 10 years ago. Although you have changed over the years, you still create wonderful memories for myself, my wife and my friends and family. I can't wait to come back and there is no doubt I will stay there again.
Small collection of Slot Machines and crappy pay outs. This casino used to be one of the better ones a long time ago but it has gone way down hill.

Loved our stay! We had an awesome view of the strip. And the bed was amazingly comfortable! We were on the 16th floor and had spectacular views of the Bellagio fountains and of Cesears Palace! My only complaint is that there are more tv channels available on the bathroom tv instead of on the room tv. And that you could hear the music from the street performers outside, Drai's nightclub at the Cromwell and the music from the mirage volcano BUT that's Vegas for you! If the room was better soundproofed then I'd give 5 stars.

If I could give less than one star I would... we decided to stay here after friends of ours told us that it was a good hotel and they liked it and didn't have any issues in November.. 
so we decided to book the high roller king bed room.. we checked into our room, changed and went to dinner. As we got back we noticed the room smelled like throw up and the bathroom lighting was terrible, a dull yellow color, and the tiny tv seemed to be a mile away from the bed.
My boyfriend called down to get he room changed or see if we could upgrade, they told us we had to come down and do it in person, so he went down and did so, they told him it would be a $25 a night up charge for the Go room, fine no big deal... 
we get to our second room, the go room, and it's filthy.. a used bar of soap, cigarette ashes, can of opened coke and coffee and crumbs and receipts laying around. So he had to go back down and to the lobby.. they then placed us in another room which the key didn't work so he had to go back down to the lobby, after being placed in the fourth room, as we walked in there were dirty linens on the bed.. the only thing they did for us was give us a $40 dining credit I really think this is unacceptable. 

Mel, in house keeping, came in and changed our bedding and made sure we had everything we needed and chatted with us for a little, she was absolutely amazing, and is one of the only reasons we did not take our business elsewhere.

We just had a 5 night stay at the Flamingo. For the price we paid the rooms were decent. Location and view was fantastic. Two complaints...the wait staff in the buffet was horrible. Our server was so rude she was bordering scary. At one point she didn't even speak to my son-in-law, she just stuck his glass in his face and expected him to know he was suppose to take the straw out. She asked us how many juice we needed, so we individuallly said, orange juice, coffee and pink lemonade, she would not take that as an answer and repeated very rudely " how many juice'? The food was ok, but the service was so bad, we probably won't go back to the buffet. The other huge problem is the Windham time share booth. You can't get to the elevator without passing them, and every time we passed them going in and out for 5 days we were appoached. When my husband and I explained that we were leaving the next day the employee replied " ya ya, everyone is leaving tomorrow". This alone, has us looking at another hotel for our next trip.

We stayed here for my sisters bachelorette party for the weekend with a group of 10. The problems started right at check in. I had a confirmation code since my sister booked the reservation and I was checking in before her. They would not let me check in even with the code. I had my hands full with tons of decorations, desserts, and my husband carrying the champagne to surprise her. I actually started crying! They did not care. Finally one of the the other girls got us up to our room, but the temperature was freezing cold and so was the hallway, the front desk sent someone to fix it but it wasn't truly fixed so we needed a lot of blankets!!! Also, in the morning at 7 am there was a couple next door who were literally screaming at each other every morning At 7 am on the dot! I had to put my headphones in each morning. Needless to say I wouldn't stay here again.

This was our second time staying here we have enjoyed each time. 

When we got there we were placed in a handicapped accessible room that also happened to be adjoining with another. During my finances shower someone in the room next to us tried getting in. In the morning we called down to the desk and we were told a room would be put on hold for us. When we got to our new room it was a strip view room what a unexpected treat. 

All the staff that we in countered were very friendly hence why we keep coming back. My favorite experience was when I left both room keys in my room, when I went to the desk for new ones her response was "hey it's Vegas" . 

The casino was nice for one of the older places on the strip. All the dealers were awesome. 

The buffet was not that good. We went during lunch and we found that it was very similar to the dinner buffet at Harrahs. The all night pizza place is five star great for the 3am snack.

The flamingo USE to be a free resort but at checkout we were told about the twenty plus dollar a night resort fee. Guess there is no free resorts anymore. 

A word of advice when checking in, make sure you specify that you do not want to be near the construction going on. That is of course you are planning on getting any sleep.

I had reserved a room for my brothers as part of the birthday package. I reserved a room for 3 days not knowing that our flight leaves a day early. I spoke with someone at the hotel check in desk and informed them of the situation. I asked if I were to checkout Sunday evening as opposed to Sunday around noon. Would I still get a day refund since our flight leaves around midnight on Monday. I was told yes. When the time arrived, I checked out around 8pm on Sunday, confirmed it with another receptionist if I was going to get refunded for Monday. Once again, she said yes. She even printed out a receipt with the billing invoice of what I will be charged with and the amount that will get refunded back to me. Two weeks went by and numerous phone calls and transferring got me nowhere. I guess I could kiss my $186 refund goodbye! Poor attitude and customer services. Definitely not true to their word and a bunch of coy! 
On another note, my boyfriend checked into a room for us on that same weekend. Also got screwed over by them. Their King suite was not worth the price. They're old, smells horrendous and falling apart! 
You can bet your bottom that Flamingo hotel will NOT be on our future agenda!

We recently stayed at the Flamingo Las Vegas April 23-26. This was our third trip to Las Vegas and the Flamingo is the only hotel we've stayed at there. We've always had a great experience and love the location and the pool. Unfortunately, this time was very different.

We checked in after midnight and met a friend at the bar where we were informed the beer taps were not working. We are beer drinkers, but since it was late we stayed put for a while before heading to our room.

When we went upstairs to our room, there were no blankets on the beds, a brown crusty smear on the chair and some very large moths flying around the room. Room service brought up the blankets and helped us to get rid of the moths - with the washcloths from the bathroom. Guest services had offered to move us to another room, but we were tired and decided to stay.

In the morning (4\/24), we went to the pool and came back to the room in the afternoon after maid service cleaned the room. A tissue that had fallen from the trash in the bathroom the night before was still there and the sink looked about the same as when we left. It was obviously not cleaned thoroughly. 

On Saturday, 4\/25 we headed to the pool in the morning to find that it was reserved for a private event. While this is understandable, we were disappointed because it was not posted anywhere and we only found out because another guest informed us while we were waiting in line to get in. If we had known in advance, or if there were signs informing us of that, it would have been a different story.

That same day it rained. We were gone most of the day and returned at around midnight to find large buckets in the hallway collecting water from the ceiling. The ceiling in our room was also leaking and there was a large puddle on the floor. I called Guest Services who told us they would not move us until the Engineer arrived to confirm that the ceiling was in fact leaking. We waited for close to an hour and called Guest Services again to find out when the Engineer was coming. While on the phone, the Engineer did arrive and said that the roof leaks every time it rains. 

At that point, we were told that a bellman would be sent up with new keys and would take us to a new room. Again, we waited and had to call Guest Services for an update. The manager said that we could have late checkout at 2:00 the next day, but that our keys would be deactivated at 12:00. If we were to leave the room after 12:00, we would be locked out. 

The bellman arrived and loaded our bags onto the cart. While we followed him to the elevator, I noticed a cigarette butt that had been on the same place on the floor since we had arrived. He also mentioned that the roof leaks every time it rains and gave us a heads up that he had heard rumors of hotel employees who rummage through guest's personal belongings.

We arrived at the new room on the 15th floor where other guests were already sleeping. He called the desk and then took us to another room on the 22nd floor. The room was very nice and clean. It made us realize how run down the room was on the 28th floor; not to mention, there were menus for room service and a coupon for the buffet - both of which were not in our original room.

Finally, we went to sleep after 2:00 AM. Two hours later between 4:00-4:30 AM, we were woken up by another guest trying to get into our room. Apparently, we were sent to their room so they had to go back downstairs for a room change. I called the manager at Guest Services again, but she was unavailable to take my call.

At 7:30 AM, I called the manager of Guest Services to confirm our late checkout as we were both exhausted and needed sleep. This time, it was a different manager who was very nice and apologetic for everything we had been through. She guaranteed late checkout for 3:00 PM and assured us that the keys would not be deactivated before then. We couldn't sleep and decided to go to the pool. Fortunately, we checked the keys before leaving because they had been deactivated. So again, we called and new keys were sent up.

I am very disappointed and believe that the Flamingo ruined our vacation. We were comped the daily resort fees, but I don't think that is enough for what happened to be forgivable.

At first I was hesitant to stay here after reading reviews, but it had pretty cheap prices so we decided to stay here. We got the go deluxe room. The staff was overall friendly and the hotel is conveniently near everything since it's on the middle of the strip. The hotel isn't that nice though... They need new elevators. They were pretty old and shaky every time. The room was nice. A stain on the floor though. Our sink wasn't draining and our shower was leaking, but after they fixed it everything was fine. I really liked the shower- it had jets that shoot out on the back like a mini-massage. Overall, nice room for the price. The rest of the hotel could be nicer though.
Horrible customer service. Manager didn't even bother to help, slow service and really smoky that your eyes is gonna start bothering you. Never had a great experience here and not worth the money.

Hideous sums it up. Won't go into detail, too much negative. There are, a couple ok things about staying here, but not really worth a mention. Do yourself a favor and do not stay here. Plenty of other hotels on the strip to stay in.

Great rooms for a great price! We were in the rooms near the Habitat elevator, which had been renovated. The hardwood floors were really nice. There were also a lot of elevators, which meant that we were never waiting long. 

The Go Pool is 21+, which was a very nice surprise. There were ample lounge chairs and plenty of space in the pool and no line at the bar. :) The cabanas seemed a little less than luxurious, but I think everyone knew that already, since they were mostly empty. 

The buffet was pretty good, especially the taquitos. I ate several . I also enjoyed the taco bar, with tons of salsas and toppings, chocolate fountain and dessert bar. Lots of yumminess to choose from. 

My one complaint is that housekeeping seemed a bit slow. We requested extra towels that took several hours to arrive and I passed by someone's room service tray in the hallway for a good 36 hours. Seriously, couldn't that have been cleaned up??

Other than that, this place fit our needs perfectly. The location was awesome and the price was just right.

I just came back from Vegas and first thing I am doing is writing this Review
We stood 1 hour in check-in line. After checked-in, we reached to room, keys were not working and person asked to stand in line again. After 20 mins they gave us new keys. Bathroom was not cleaned, hairs were everywhere on floor. We booked Street View Luxurious room and stayed there for 3 night 4 days. 2nd morning 9:30 AM someone started knocking the door. My husband woke and opened the door they need to replace some filter. We slept 6 in morning and 9:30 we woke up. 2nd night, we were playing electronic roulette and i called waitress 10 times for water. Every waitress was saying give me 5 mins I will be back or let me send another one. Then some security manager came I told her same thing she also said give me 5 mins and no one came so we started playing in Paris or Aria instead of Flamingo. 3rd morning we again reached at room around 5 AM and some room service people opened our room and came inside and standing in front of our bed. They don't even knock the room. This was my 9th visit to vegas and I never experienced this in any of the hotel. I don't recommend this hotel at all

The Flamingo is a decent older casino! They are always upgrading some piece of it and seem to be getting it right for most part!  If the food was better this is an easy 4 stars because of the incredible location on the strip and the value....but I will be honest...the food SUCKS!!!  Stay here cheap and eat somewhere else is my recommendation. 

The rooms: Many have been upgraded but the bathrooms seem to be off the remodel list!  It takes 15 minutes for hot water to come out, even after they fixed it!! And those shower heads, oh my , 1970's originals! My GO room though was nice inside .. I liked the look and the view from the 19th floor!  Wood  floors , very clean, Ipod hookup. Be warned though the walls are paper thin. I could hear the  old couple next to me farting as they arose at 6:15am. I actually thought they were even showering in my room!! If your gonna have a sexual adventure, just know that every room around you may be hearing the fun! Families with kids, or friends looking to party before bed, same problem. 

The Flamingo pool is really great! With flamingos even included! Waterfalls, slides, palm trees, its very nice! Totally love it! 

The shopping in casino is limited. The sportsbook is fine. This is either a warning or good news for some of those out there, but hookers seemed to be plentiful around the bars located throughout property, the solicitations can get annoying. Couple of guys were even followed to room elevators. It is Vegas.  

The casino itself seems to always be busy! I really enjoy the craps tables and the personnel in charge of them! They are always a blast!! They have a nice high roller area, lots of slots, and the drink ladies are always around! Table limits are very reasonable at the Flamingo. The Flamingo's air filteration system does not throw out nice smelling fragrance like Aria, you are gonna smell smoke! The doors are always open at the entrance to casino on the Bills Casino side, and enjoy the beautiful Black Jack  dealers that await you!

The food! AVOID!! The fast food area.....ughghhhghgh......The buffets....honestly the worst..The steakhouse, why call it that?  ...anyway I think you get the point! Praying that the new Carlos and Charlies thats opening soon is a huge success with good food!!! 

NOW an important hint when checking in. When checking into the Flamingo the lines at all hours of the day are quite large. I find them the worst in Vegas. Not sure why , but it has always been this way for years and years. New though!! And this is huge!! If you are a Total Rewards member, you can bypass the check in line and go to  the new kiosks located to the right of check in desk. Have your id, your cc, your rewards card ready. I checked in within 3 minutes! It even prints your room cards for you!!!  Its $14 if you want internet\/per day at the Flamingo.

Enjoy the Flamingos location , cheap rooms, and pool!!  Good luck!

gute preis Leistung an guter Lage

Die Auswahl an Hotels in Vegas ist riesig. Das Flamingo ist eins der älteren und kleineren. Die Lage neben dem Caesars Palace ist aber definitiv gut, obwohl man in Vegas eh alles mit dem Taxi macht.
Der Pool ist zwar klein aber hübsch und es hat auch die obligatorischen Poolparties. Die
Frühstücksrestaurants werfen nicht gerade vom
Hocker, aber es hat genügend Alternativen near by.

Die Zimmer sind durschnittlich gross, bequemes Bett und sauberes Bad. Die neueren Go Rooms sind etwas moderner eingerichtet mit Dusche und Bad. Frag nach einem Upgrade beim checkin.
Von der Südseite hat man einen schönen Ausblick auf die Fontänen des Bellagios.

Klar sind die Zimmer im Caesars oder MGM etwas hübscher, aber die kosten auch mindestens doppelt so viel. Zum erkunden von Vegas ist das Flamigo ein guter Startpunkt.

The Casino smells like stale cigarette smoke, old men, and cheap scotch.

Their "Wildlife Habitat" is small and sad, with 5 flamingos on a mound of dirt and some old pathways leading around to some small, fake waterfalls.  It claims to be 15 acres, but it didn't even take us 15 minutes to get over it.

The whole atmosphere reeks of cheesey, '70s Las Vegas, and is sorely in need of an overhaul.

The self parking garage is tiny and unmaneuverable, run down, and dirty.  It's also a long, long, long walk to the hotel\/casino.

I love "old style" Vegas, but this is just depressing.

Looks nice here. Enjoyed viewing the live flamingos although the smell was bad. Pew!!!! Gift shop when you enter had stuffed animal flamingos to purchase & magnets. Cute stuff. Only visited , did it stay long.

Not at all good hotel experience.  Would not recommend this property at all.

Customer service was horrible (we had to call guest services - SIX TIMES...and eventually engineering - for a problem in our room.).  The attitude of the staff taking the call was absolutely terrible.

There was a perpetual elevator problem - 30 floors of rooms and guests left with only two elevators (when 6 were broken), and when they were "working" they would get stuck, and have alarm bells ringing.  Not just an inconvenience, but also a major safety issue with dozens and dozens of guests herded into small waiting areas on every floor.   When we tried to talk to a Manager, we were rudely (and dismissively) blown off.

Cigarette butts and beer bottles in the hallways, heavily stained couch in the room, and rust on the ceiling - in addition to peeling wallpaper.

Other than friendly staff at the pool, this hotel is a PASS.

We just left and honestly had a great time! Checkout was quick with the express checkout. Never had a problem with our room or elevators like many other reviews. Margaritaville was a blast. Everyone in the hotel and casino were friendly and very helpful. We had the buffet for breakfast and it was great. Will definitely stay again when we come back!

This hotel gets a 1-star rating because they run what I consider to be an overcharging scheme. They charge EVERYONE an extra $200\/room for incidentals but they don't tell you that when you check in or check out.  They eventually make sure that it's returned 7-10 business days later.  I booked 3 rooms...which means I had a $600 extra charge showing on my credit card account a few days after I checked out...that was a shock that  I didn't enjoy.  If they wanted to tie up $600 of my money for 2 weeks they should have been more forthcoming about it.  I researched it and it's technically in the very fine print when you check in...but I still consider this inappropriate.  I travel a lot and they are the only hotel that ever did this to me.  

Just to be clear on this:  I made sure to check out in person instead of doing their "quick" check-out to make sure there were no surprises.  They told me I owed $72\/room.  In fact, they initiated a $272\/room charge to my credit account.  If they had told me "we charged you an extra $200 per room" and then explained it to me I would not have been as upset. It was the fact that they were sneaky about it that turned a bad experience into something I consider an overcharging scheme.

This review is based on the fact that I couldn't take my 7 year old son into the pool to swim and play on the water slides. I was told that unless we were hotel guests he wasn't allowed in the pool area. I was more then willing to pay the $20 charge for my son and myself to enjoy a day of water slides and swimming.

I stayed here for 4 nights. It was my first time at the Flamingo and I was disappointed. In short, for the price of the room at $35 a night,i cant expect anything less. The location of of the hotel is great and in the middle of everything and the room was clean.

 Room: We stayed in the basic room they offer and i fail to see the updates. First of all on our way to the room the elevator.lights didnt work and when entering the elevator some of the floors had the numbers written on with marker. We finally get to our floor and there is glass all along the hallway and a fire extinguisher glass smashed with large shards of glass.(this stayed like this the whole trip). Our room had a few an old wooden bed and chipped old dresser which did not match there updates. No seating apart from the bed.

Pool: The GO pool is the biggest of the twopools at the hotel. However please be aware that the line can get big early on and the pool is.open to non guests and actual guests dont get have a priority line to enter the pool. The family pool gets very busy as a much smaller pool. They have all the loungers crammed together and your practically laying on top of your neighbour.

This hotel is in dire need of a refurb.  I was pleased to walk up and only wait in line 3 minutes to check in at 11:30 a.m.  Well, I now know why.  First, they charge an early check in fee.  I was in the hotel industry for 10 years and this was my first experience with such a thing.  To avoid this $28 early check in fee, I was given the option of paying $30 to upgrade to their hip "GO" rooms over their substandard rooms.  I say substandard, cause the last time I stayed in one, I wouldn't walk on the carpet barefoot.  Needless to say, the upgrade wasn't worth $30.  Holes in the lamp shades, burnt out bulbs through out the room, an ironing board the was bent and contorted to the point of uselessness, closet doors with broken latches so they wouldn't stay closed, a rattling air conditioner that never cooled the room colder than 74 degrees no matter the temp it was set on and the topper, a testing of their Emergency Life System over the loud speakers at 7:04 a.m.  

By the way, did I mention I was staying there for free besides the $30 I paid for the "GO" room?  I won't be staying there again for $30 or for free.  Oh yea, I just found that they charged my credit card $103 for something.  That should be fun phone call.

This place is a dump...

We went to Vegas for the first time this past Easter weekend. We arrived late Friday night and were very disappointed to have to wait in an hour line just to get our room key. Not only did they tell us they were "overbooked" for the weekend, but that the room would not be available until tomorrow. They offered us a night without paying the resort fee and a $20 food\/beverage credit, so we accepted. However, we checked in 3 times over the course of 5 hours the next day before we were even able to get into our original room. It was highly inconvenient for us to waste time during our vacation to do this. If you do stay here, make sure you leave at least an hour or more just to check-in\/check-out. The location was prime, right in the middle of the strip and within close walking distance to the monorail. We stayed in the Go Deluxe room facing the Strip, which was very comfortable. Pool area was excellent, just make sure you bring your id with you to gain access.

Just pulled up to the Vegas Strip! To park at the hotel we had to show a confirmation number or a room key(but we just got here???).  Thank goodness for iPhones.  Most people here were not in my age group but still fun none the less.  

Casino could you a little fixer upper.  Not nearly as nice as the other casinos but it was 110 degrees outside so all I cared about was air conditioning.

The room was pretty nice.  I don't know how the beds were since I was the one shunned to the floor for the weekend since all my buddies grabbed it.  The rug did feel really comfortable when I blacked out on it for an hour or two.   

Decently priced and far nicer than IP.  Smack in the middle of The Strip so it was really convenient to walk everywhere.  Would stay here again for sure.

Heads Up: Don't eat at the food court.  That was some nasty food.  I mean I was really intoxicated and I thought it was bad so it must have been terrible.

we rolled into town starving and the flamingo was right next door so we hit it up for the brunch menu. it's not fancy but the food was pretty good. 

price is reasonable for stuffing yourself compared to other hotels, but like i said, it's not fancy. the salad bar...very good. some of the hot food...a little dried out looking. shrimp were a bit watery and soggy and crab legs req'd more work that was worth, but hey...we came in our elastic pants and left with no room to spare...so it couldn't have been that bad!

This hotel needs to be renovated and maintained.  The hallway rugs need stretching and cleaning.  Our room was clean. The shower spout put more water in the tub then in the actual shower head. The sink was cracked. The floors are laminated and are actually quite boring an drab. Outside the property the area is strewn with garbage. Do yourself a favor and stay someplace else.

If you love your non-smoking room to smell like someone is smoking in it, this place is for you. The minute we walked in our non-smoking room it smelled horribly of smoke. I asked to change rooms and front desk said we couldn't. So basically, deal with it. They sent someone up who sprayed the room then a few hours later and the rest of our time it smelled like smoke. Usually right before we went to sleep and waking up in the morning before heading out for the day. 

Front desk not very pleasant. Housekeeping didn't clean the floors in our room the 3 days we were there. Security guard at kids pool was rude, every day. Should not be working around ppl. 

It gets 2stars because the wildlife area and lushness around the pools is great. Room was quiet even though we were right next to the elevators, and valet and bellmen were really sweet. 

Chances are we won't be back to this hotel our next trip.

I've read most of the reviews complaining about the many problems with this hotel. As far as I have seen, they have fixed most of the problems except for their sketchy elevators. I'm sure it would take a huge amount of time to fix these especially if they are thinking about replacing them entirely which I think they should do. 
Other than that they fixed the wifi problem in the rooms, you can check out via TV, great customer service  at check in, and the cleaning staff was so friendly. 
Yes it does have a smokier smell than most casinos but I did notice in some spots that they added a pleasant fragrance to be released in the air. If they added that fragrance everywhere in the hotel's public areas, it will be much more inviting. 
I heard that the Fab rooms are old and not so great. The hotel should work on renovating all of their rooms to look like the Go rooms. Our Go room was great. We had a great view of the strip, it was very clean and modern looking. The bed was very comfortable and I had a great sleep. They do need to update their iPod docking stations to accommodate the new iPhone. It looks a few years old. TV was huge flat screen but would have been better if it were hdtv.  
The pool was fun but packed. There was a really good dj spinning and the bartenders were very friendly. Even security was sneaking in a few dance moves. Last time I was here, they didn't have the day beds that you can rent. They have them now which is nice but they take up a lot of room which leaves every one else who didn't rent to be stashing their towels on the concrete poolside. But hey the early bird gets the lounge chairs(they had only lounge chairs at the pool 7 years ago so it was a little easier to find a spot to sit.)
Once they replace the elevators and freshen up the cigarette smell in the public places then they will get a better rating .
Overall if you're looking for a great party atmosphere at a great price, then this is the place to go. It's definitely for the under 30 crowd but I did see quite a few people 50+.
It's in a great location- right in the middle of the strip. Close proximity to the Linq Promenade, Ceasar's, Mirage, Paris and even Bellagio and Venetian. They have better restaurants and only a short walk away.

Usually when we go to Vegas we always stay at different hotels but decided since we hasn't been to the Flamingo in 10 yrs perhaps we would have a better experience since the last time we stayed there. Our toddler found pills on the floor & ate them thinking they were candy. We spent most of the night with the fire department in our room. The hotel said they would comp our room but forgot when we checked out. Figures. 

Anyway, love the new stores, food court and love the pools as they are great! Pool for toddlers, another for kids and more for the adults. But they're not open in the pouring rain. Didn't discourage us as it was expected. Next...staff was absolutely wonderful!! 

On the way to our rooms, I noticed it's the same carpet from our last stay! Don't wear heals if your don't want to fall flat on your face! I was ok though...moving on. Get into our rooms and noticed they cleaned up the rooms nice but not the bathroom. This is when it went down hill. Pillows suck as they were cheap & only sheets for bedding. Beds are firm and not very comfortable. No fridge, no coffee pot...no nothing. For the price they charge, I was really expecting a whole lot more. We stayed at the condos in the Palms and had a suite for the same price. Go stay there.

By far the worse hotel I have ever stayed in. Customer service is rude and not helpful. The rooms are outdated and disgusting. The computer systems were down our rooms were not ready even for a 9:00pm checkin. Extremely long lines. I would not stay here ever again!!!

We stayed at the Flamingo on a spontaneous weekend getaway. Cheapest rate for a non players card holder was through your choice of third party sites. Valet was friendly and checkin using the kiosks was super easy. Strip view upgrade was offered at the kiosk and was worth it. The habitat tower has had its rooms touched up, but furnishings and furniture show their age. The elevators are hit or miss too.

For less than $80 for three of us, the buffet is no Wicked Spoon but filled us up and had bottomless mimosas, so long as you go to the mimosa window and pick them up yourself. Again, it's what you pay for. If you want better, hit up Caesar's across the street and pay double.

We didn't gamble this trip, but the casino seemed clean, well lit, and not that smokey. If we didn't bring our son with us, we probably would have played.

One big miss was that we placed a 6 second call using the room phone and got charged $21 for it. After my wife politely pleaded, they were willing to knock it down to $10, but that's just ridiculous.

All in all, checkin\/out was super easy (+1), the room clean and comfortable (+1), the casino and shopping impressive (+1), but extra fees exorbitant (-1). 3 stars.

When we arrived we used the self check in service which was cool, but we got given the worst room I've ever saw in my life. Couch dirty, TV not in same room as the bed and decor was atrocious. I went down, tipped the receptionist $20 and gotten a room on the 27th floor with an amazing view and all in all better room. Bed was very comfy and was a very good size. Room wasn't the cleanest, some mould and dust in the room and one night the taps stopped working, when they came back on the water was brown and didn't work until the next morning. The pool situation was an absolute joke, you can't take any lotion or drinks to the pool area unless it's bought in the hotel, had to queue for 20 minutes and got body checked like in an airport and had to lie on the concrete floor after because it was crowded. Was a nightmare just to go for a swim. We went to Caesars over the road, walked straight in no problem and had a good time. Location is perfect but got hit with an $80 check out fee, but Vegas is expensive so I've got to deal with that. It's an OK hotel, but would stay somewhere else if I came back to Vegas. But if you need a place to stay for an ok price. It's perfect.

Pretty much the worst hotel experience I have had in a long, long while. 

I booked a "Go Room" from their website and paid a one-night confirmation fee. The night before I arrived to check in, I called the hotel to confirm my late arrival and room availability. I was told the room I booked would be available when I check in. Added to that, I was told to use the Valet service as that was the best for that time of night.

Once I arrived, I was greeted by a tired valet who informed me that only "Total Rewards" members were allowed to valet. I told him that I was not one and was instructed to valet. He, thankfully, took my car and only after I tipped him, did he offer the "Total Rewards" valet ticket.

Waiting in line to check in took 60 minutes (this is not an exaggeration). Once I got to a Front Desk agent, they informed me the room I booked was no longer available. This is after I was told it would be only 24 hours before. I was down-graded to a lesser room, which was not renovated nor was a smoking room (as I found out in the room) which I booked. I tried to dial the front desk from my room, but the phone did not work. I had to call using my mobile to get a different room. There was a downgrade option with smoking available and that I would have to come to the front desk the next day to move to the room I originally booked. Additionally, the front desk manager (who, after 25 minutes on hold did I finally speak to) told me to come down to the front desk to get my new keys for that first night. I am the one that had to tell him to send a bellman up. 

After relocation, I had enough. It was an okay room and I didn't want to keep moving around the hotel, every night. Oh, and also, to add insult to injury they told me the would adjust my rate to reflect the cheaper room. Upon getting my folio, I saw they did not. Instead of calling them AGAIN, I decided to pay it anyway just so I don't have to deal with them again... ever again.

In review:
Worst Check-In experience
Downgraded 
Inaccessible front desk and reservation agents
Do not trust reservation teams
Hotel is NOT renovated
Casino floor is dirty
Elevators need updating
Double check your folio
World's smallest glasses in the rooms

My family and I were extremely displeased with the level of customer service at the Flamingo Hilton and specifically Roemon Murphy, the hotel guest service manager. Our family booked three rooms for three nights at The Flamingo. Our reservation was made and paid in full three months in advance through American Airlines Vacations. Despite requesting three non-smoking rooms at reservation, two were smoking rooms. We were told at arrival that they were fully booked and we could switch rooms the next day. Not only were our rooms smoking rooms, they were also dirty and dilapidated - dirty footprints on the bathroom floor, dust on furniture, furniture finish gone, paint missing on bathroom cabinets, and more. After two family members waking with allergy issues the next morning including one with a bloody nose and another with a swollen throat, we immediately called and requested to be moved to another room. The operator instructed us to go downstairs at 11 to request a room change. We did as told, actually arriving early, and were promised at that time that the two rooms would be upgraded at no charge and we were to return at 1:00 to receive our keys. The customer service rep assured us the change was secured in the system. We arrived at 1:00, after rearranging our morning vacation plans, only to find that one room was re-reserved by the previous customer and another was not clean and ready at that time.  After determining the customer service rep at the counter could no longer assist us any further in making the agreed upon change, we requested to see a manager.  Roemon Murphy, the guest service manager who deceptively wears a pin identifying him as the hotel manager, arrived but never apologized for the inconvenience we had experienced.  He did agree to move us to non-upgraded rooms on a different floor that were available. We agreed to move into those rooms with the agreement, offered by Roemon, that the resort fees for all three rooms for all three nights would be waived. However, at check-out, we were mortified to find that Roemon went back on his word and only waived the resort fee for two rooms for one night.  After our customer service rep made multiple trips back and forth to Roemon directly without him offering to come forward and assist, we once again had to ask to see him. Roemon arrived and denied making that agreement, even though four of us witnessed the exchange. Roemon Murphy lacks integrity, and concern towards his guests and the reputation of the hotel. The hotel itself is not well kept but could have easily been overlooked had we had a better customer service experience.

If you book, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE book a Go Room. We stayed this week in an old room. I think someone was murdered and they didn't clean up the carpet. We had a room facing the strip and heard the hotels  nightclub across the street until 4am. The Go Room will still have this problem  but it is Vegas. :) Our room was just dirty though, wouldn't walk on the carpet without flipflops. The casino is nice, not a fan of their slot machines really and the table games didn't have any cheap options. Pool area was OK.....they didn't have anyone out cleaning so the adult pool had beer bottles and cans and cigarette butts everywhere. 

Good coffee at coffee stand. Fast check in. Had to wait three hours to get our room though. Terrible valet, just park yourself because they're understaffed. Parking garage is pretty good, enter on Koval and avoid strip traffic!

Since Flamingo is located close to the middle of the strip, we decided to give the hotel a try. We arrived late on Thursday night to check-in; since it was so late, they didn't have too many people available to check guests in (and the check in kiosks were not functioning) which caused a bit of a delay. The check-out process was much quicker, however as we were able to utilize the kiosk and were on our way out.

Their rooms were reasonably priced, they had a deal when we booked our room. The hotel itself is older and the room definitely reflected the age although it was relatively clean. They didn't provide us with any soap or shampoo when we got there so we needed to call in to get some.

The nice part about this hotel is that there are many dining and shopping options right outside. Their parking structure seemed smaller than the ones for other hotels, but we were able to find a spot. If interested, guests are able to look at some real flamingos there as well! Overall, I'm not sure if I would stay there again but it's a fine choice for the price\/location.

The Flamingo has many highs and lows, and nothing in between.  Super smokey casino that leaves your clothes reekin'?  Check.  Right in the center of the Strip for perfect access to anywhere? Check.  A clientele that looks as though they enjoy the early bird specials?  Check.  A casino that has that old-Vegas touristy nostalgic feeling?  Check and check.

Everyone should visit the Flamingo once.  Even if it's just to stop in and make a lap before classin' it up at Bellagio or classin' it down at Bill's.  I wouldn't recommend anyone spend most of their vacation there, however.  It's crowded because it's in the middle of the Strip, but I get the feeling no one really wins while gambling here.

For a side note on the rooms.... my friend stayed in a "Go Room" this past week that I got to check out.  It's large and has a mini-fridge for personal use.  But it's got an odd design to it.... everything looks really plastic-y and there's opaque glass walls around the bathroom.  And speaking of the bathroom, I hope you're comfortable with whomever you're shacking up with...you can hear everything that goes on in the bathroom and there are no locks on the door.  The Flamingo is not a bad place to stay if you get a great deal, but I would consider elsewhere if the prices are comparable to other casinos.

In all, this a tourist casino.  I can't imagine locals hanging out as regulars.  Stop by to say you've seen it, and then move on to the next.

I stayed at the flamingo for my sisters wedding and from start to finish it was a horrible experience. I live in Vegas and decided to stay at the Flamingo for the convenience, but there was nothing convenient about it. We checked in on a Thursday but the kiosk would not allow my boyfriend to check in, even though his name was on the room. He then waited in line for an hour for them to tell him he couldn't check in. When I returned from my sisters bachelorette party the kiosk would not let me check in so I had to wait in line for an hour. When I asked why I was unable to check in with the kiosk they said I don't know. Coming back to the room after dinner my boyfriend placed money in the night stand and noticed that the money didn't fall flat. When he went to grab the money he also grabbed a sex toy that was left behind by the last guest that stayed in the room, I would post a picture but I feel it is inappropriate to post. When I called front desk no one seemed to care and they only offered to clean eventually they did offer a minor compensation for our disgust. When it came time to check out again the kiosk did not allow me to check out so I had to wait over an hour to check out. After all was said and done my credit card was also over charger. Next time I'll just uber.

This review is for their pool..

It's beautiful with free towel service, great music and cute flamingos.

Terrible terrible terrible room. I will never stay in this hotel again. They placed us in a room (for an additional $30 to check in "early") that is louder than the TV and air conditioner. Furniture is damaged and the tub looks filthy. I will NEVER stay in this hotel again. My wife is downstairs now trying to get a new room. I am so disappointed.

I stayed here over the Labor Day weekend. The room was comp thru Total Rewards. The carpet was spotted and dirty. I should upgraded to the GO Room for $30 a night...The window faced Ceasars Palace, which was nice. I liked the location and the fact that security doesn't check keyes every time you come in. The hotel accommodated my requests. I got a room close to the elevator and two queen beds. Housekeeping gave me more towels, pillows, and blankets. But they want to questioned how many people were in the room. I found that rude. I would stay there again but not pay for it again!

Flamingo is old and run down now...Owned by Caesars Entertainment (Formerly Harrahs)
I haven't stayed here in over 15 years and probably woudln't unless forced to.
Only reason I was here was the sponsored Poker Tournament was held in here and they barely have enough room for that...

A+ for character and value, but if I stayed at a hotel in the condition of the Flamingo anywhere other than their stellar central-strip location, I would never return. The carpet is stained, pulled up, and smells like used gym socks. The rooms are a bit austere (e.g. laminate flooring), but much cleaner. Advice: bite the bullet and pay for an upgrade. The crowds tend to be older\/families\/college kids. I'm not super impressed with any of their bars or restaurants, and the prices are as high as nicer casio\/hotels'. The habitat is nice though - love that they have real flamingos and a fun adult pool. Despite the you-get-what-you-pay-for factor, customer service is friendly and helpful for the most part.

Sometimes it's the little things that let you know the kind of hotel you're in. 

We were in one of the renovated rooms.  Here were some of the little "touches" we noticed: 

* The fancy-ass sliding glass bathroom door does not actually shut all the way (one inch gap around the edge) and thus is not even remotely soundproof.  (Guess what I'm doing in here?)  It was also impossible to open and shut quickly or quietly in the middle of the night.    
* Both of the gooseneck lamps installed on either side of the bed felt like they were falling apart, and were so rickety the light would cut out if you jiggled them the slightest bit.  
* The cheap silicone caulking in the shower and bathroom was already developing mildew spots.  
* There was absolutely no way to turn on the light fixture above the bed.  Either we completely missed a light switch after looking around the room for five minutes, or the switch next to the bed in our particular room was miswired.  (It turned on the inexplicable pink go-go lights in the bathroom, as did the switch by the front door.)
* The Ethernet port in the room wasn't assigning IP addresses.
* There was a sign on the sound system that if we took the white iPod cable in the drawer, there would be a $50 replacement charge.  There was no white iPod cable in the drawer.
* There's a TV in the bathroom mirror...showing the finest standard definition cable channels available.  

Anyway, I'm not saying this was a pit by any means, but the little things here and there kind of added up to the overall "meh".  We were here because we got a fairly decent deal and it served its purposes, and it's fairly central on the Strip without being as expensive as the Bellagio et al.  That said, next time the Vegas urge hits we might well look for a deal elsewhere.  (Frankly, one big reason to look elsewhere is to be near decent dining.  We left the hotel for every single meal and there was one night when we reeeeally did not want to have to walk four blocks to get something worth eating.)  

It's Vegas: YMMV.  

FWIW: You can sign up for their rewards program in the lobby to get early check-in for free instead of waiting till 4 PM or paying $25.

I come to Vegas 2to 3 Tues a year. This is the worst experience I have had to date. I have been in better Best Westerns (not to disrespect BW). The air filters and vents have dust, no make that fur growing on them. The bellman agreed that the room was in crappy condition and said that they are understaffed and mngrs just don't care. My grievance list is long and I don't have time to list them all.
Bottom line.......if your a twenty something that's going to be drunk for a weekend and aren't concerned with your living conditions this place is great. If you do care, go somewhere else.
I think I'm done with Ceasar's properties.
By the way, this is the first time I have been moved to review a business.

Great location, even though some rooms are outdated it's still clean and maintained. There's one lift on the habitat tower that was dodgy as, wouldn't close, and parking was a nightmare after about 5pm & weekends but besides all of that I'd stay there again.

Real shithole.  Stay clear.  Built in 1946 and probably not remodeled since.  No parking or vallet when we arrived.  The elevator wouldn't get us to our floor (twice).  Paid $20 for the kids to watch an old on demand movie we could see on iTunes for $4.  Paid $16 for wifi.... Etc. etc.   fuck me... Never coming back here

The rooms are ok.  What do you want?  It's a place to lay your head at night.  The pool party is the hidden gym.  Share a cabana with your friends.  It's one of the most low-key pool parties that still is super fun without all the douches.

Manager came to room to look at the booger on the couch then left without cleaning the booger off the couch, by the way.  Forgot to add that.  We found a maid in the hallway who was nice enough to come to our room and clean it off for us. Also blankets didn't come until 10:30pm after 7 phone calls starting at 5:00pm.

Me and my girlfriend went here back in April during our road trip. The building is very beautiful but be prepared to walk from the parking lot! We checked and the staff were very friendly. They saw that we were exhausted from driving all day and upgraded us to a suite on the top floor! Can't wait to go back!

Yay for $10 black jack on a Friday night! Woo woo! We came here to gamble and had a blast. Gambling goes a lot further here when all other tables are a $25-50 min. The drinks came often enough and the dealers were kind.

1) 26th floor room facing away from strip. Extremely noisy (outside music) until 2am. 
2) Shower alternates between extreme hot and cold every few seconds.
3) dilapidated walls\/floors - this is not a big complaint since it was  cheaper option
4) one elevator was so creaky and did not work, another elevator button did not indicate the selected floor.

I would go for a slightly pricier newer option on the strip, or better shun the strip and stay in nugget at downtown.

One of the last bastions of "Old Vegas" still standing on the Strip.  Decided we were going to make a 2night trip to Vegas and they still had rooms available at a decent price for 1\/1 and 1\/2 (no way we were going to come for NYE - I've heard its a zoo in Vegas and based on the amount of people still around on New Year's Day, I'm glad we weren't there for "America's Party").  The staff is ridiculously helpful and friendly which somewhat makes up for the issues at this hotel.  We had an air conditioning unit that would not cool the room - it stayed at 75 degrees at all times (we like the room to be around 70) - I called guest services who said they would have someone come up to take a look - no one from maintenance came in the next hour and I wasn't in Vegas to stay in our room anyway, so we left and figured we'd deal with the stuffy room.  We were in the "FAB" room selection - my guess is that anything in that room category are basically the rooms that have not yet been renovated - the furniture was from the 90s, there was a luminous ceiling over the bathroom vanity, chips and nicks in doors and moulding - everything looked well-used.  So I would definitely recommend going with the "GO" room category as those are fully renovated rooms with all-new furniture (and hopefully air conditioners that work).  So based on our stay, the Flamingo was nothing dreadful but also nothing terribly special.  I hope they manage to up their quality game as I would hate to see yet another Vegas landmark be imploded to make room for another new behemoth.  It was nice to be right in the middle of the Strip, but we would probably try out a different hotel next time.

I am bumping this to two stars because I did get an upgrade while there. I stayed at the Flamingo June 2014 for 4 nights for a conference for work. Checking in was an ordeal, but not entirely their fault. When I finally got into one of their "updated rooms" I was shocked. The bathroom is always the first thing I check out in a hotel room and the bathroom in this room was horrible. I have stayed in hotels in third world countries with better bathrooms. 

I will say that the nasty room that I was in for the first two nights had an incredibly comfortable bed and pillows, they were actually better in the cheap room than they were in the upgraded room.

Another positive was that their cleaning staff does a good job. I stayed at another hotel after I left the Flamingo and they had a horrible maid service and everything just felt dirty. The Flamingo is an older hotel but you can tell they've been cleaning up messes for years. So my hats off to them for that. 

The third morning I was there my friend went to retrieve something from the closet and the whole closet mirror\/door fell on top of her. She tried to put it back together but found that it had been duct taped together!!! After two nights of being directly above one of the bars and getting NO sleep because of the bumping base well into the wee hours of the morning. The closet falling on my friend was the straw that broke the camels back. We had to be at our conference at 7 am most days so it was rough not to have quiet until 3 or 4 am and having people run through the halls at 5 am who had been partying all day scream WOOOOO!!!! VEEEGGGASSS!!! Not the classiest bunch of people were staying there when I was there. 

The front desk people were very kind to us and got us into another room that had a great view and was much nicer and quieter than the other one. The only problem with that room was that our door wouldn't close properly. I was scared to death and thankful when I heard a knock on my door around 1 am. It was a security guard who let me know that my door was not shut and was stunned to see that no one had noticed the door malfunction. 

All in all I loved the location (in the heart of the strip) and it was a very laid back hotel. I think if you were a kid who wanted to party cheaply it would be fun, but for a professional person there on business it was awful the first couple nights. The pool is def a party pool, but if you don't like a whole bunch of 21 year olds rubbing all over each other drunk with a loud DJ its not for you, but it is VERY Vegas! If it  was on my dime I wouldn't stay there again.

Management" needs some training in handing patron issues with a bit more finesse. Nothing amazing going on here so unless you want a sub par room and bad service- avoid. 

For casino: someone in group was robbed of 109 dollars from a slot machine. We were momentarily not paying attention when the robbery occurred (which is our fault). Apparently there is nothing that can be done-not even a comp or a room credit, a free drink, a I'm really sorry here is a voucher for a meal..... I get it-we should have been paying more attention, but seriously- there are a million cameras in here and apparently they aren't covering all the necessary bases to try to handle these types situations- we were told this is common. We were told that there may or may not be footage of the robbery- cameras are not watching you constantly here- according to the management. To my knowledge no review of anything was done. The ticket was immediately cashed so there was nothing to be done. 

Watch your pockets here, friends. Or better yet just don't come here. I won't be. 

Assistant manager, who I will call *Ken*, was a poor representation of the casino in his behavior. Actually walked away from us when we were discussing the situation with him. Will be making a few calls to discuss better customer compassion and concern for those in this establishment. A few calming words or a I know this is a terrible feeling, let me help by writing you this voucher to a free dessert would have gone a long way in this situation. He could have stayed with us through the filing of the security report. 

For the hotel: visited someone staying here and could not believe the clientele or the condition of the rooms. Everything was old and shabby. No blankets on the beds and the worlds most disgusting bathroom.

Rather dated, but clean enough, doesn't smell like smoke or old person. Room service is only available until 1pm, not cool when you are here for business and need to get work done. Check in is also rather slow.

For my second time in Vegas, my husband stayed at Flamingo in February. Last year, we stayed at Ballys. I can honestly say I had a much better time at the Flamingo. Much more to do. Check in was a pain in the ass. The wait time was insane. 

The main highlight of our stay was when my husband booked the wrong flight day home. We were out of a room and scrambled to get one for one night. We told the lady our situation, and she comped us a suite on the 28th floor.  It was pretty awesome!

Overall I'd definitely go back.

We came, we ate, we won, we lost, we drank, we drank, we drank. Compared ot the other Vegas hotels the Flamingo has much to offer. Fittingly it couldn't be more conveniently located, in the middle of the strip. Go outside & you're looking at Caesar's Palace, to the left Planet Hollywood, and to the right the Mirage, all just 10 min. walking distance.  

The rooms are reasonably priced comparably. I wont talk about their rooms b\/c unless you're here for 2 weeks you shouldn't spend much time sleeping. Breakfast is bonafide after a long night of parlaying and partying. Gambling here isn't as... flashy as it's competition. A cool feature is it's connection to Margaritaville which is a comedy club on Karaoke nites. 

Lord willing in my lifetime if we're able to visit Vegas frequently we'll stay here again.

I really love this hotel. I think it's a perfect blend of old school and well....new school.

The GO rooms are amazing and you will love them. If you step down to the casino you'll feel like it's the 90's. See old and new.

The pools have slides. I always have the best time at their pool area.

It's cheap to stay AND you are centrally located AND if you go next door you can grab Subway or Burger King and cheap drinks. Love it!

I'm pretty lucky for the fact I love Vegas and I have some really great family and friends that live here and get me super cheap rooms at any number of strip hotels. You cant believe how cheap employees can rent rooms at strip hotels. I love paying less than $80.00 for a $200.00  room with all the amenities. The Flamingo is a great place for gambling, dining, and drinking. Somehow everytime we stay at the Flamingo we end up in Margaritaville downstairs right across from Caesar's getting just monkey-shined shitfaced and knowing the inevitable "technicolor yawn" will be coming shortly after we hit that 4:00 a.m. buffet somewhere. The Flamingo Garden is a great little area to stroll through and get some nice pictures. The hotels location makes it easy to head out and access the strip. Vegas Baby.

Was awoken to very loud jack hammering and construction noises at 6:30am.  No one told me there was construction going next door when I reserved the room or during check in. Don't stay in the wing facing Harrahs. Asked for my money back. Hotel only refunded $10. I'm extremely unhappy with my stay.

Flamingo is very hit and miss. 

The good - great location, stripside rooms have awesome views of bellagio and ceasers and sunsets.  High roller side has the Ferris wheel. Also it's usually a lot cheaper than some other hotels nearby. 


The bad. Old building and casino. They renovated it recently so new bedding and paint, but the ceilings are claustrophobicly low, parking sucks, and most of the rooms are awful views tucked in weird spots. 

If you stay here make sure to get a room in the strip facing tower and you'll enjoy your time. 

Or bite the bullet and remember you won't spend much time in the room in Vegas anyway and enjoy the town.

I stayed here this past week for a conference.  The hotel is outdated and the rooms have paper thin walls.  The guy next door was blasting TV so loud it sounded like it was in my room.  I moved rooms as was so noisy I could not sleep first night.

The new room was much better but the phone cord ripped right from the wall.  No biggie as wasn't going to be paying their rates.  

They charge for wireless which is ridiculous.  

However, all this doesn't make it a 1 review.  What made it a 1 was the front desk customer service.  Hands down the worst I have ever experienced at a hotel.

I arrived on Monday at 11pm PST.  There were 68 people in line and two agents, one of which was checking in large group.  I waited almost 80 minutes and didn't even get apology, comp meal, or anything.  People were actually leaving.  A manager would come out every few minutes, and laugh at the size of the line.  People were extremely irritated and they did nothing.

At one point, one of the two agents disappeared for 15 minutes but nobody stepped up to do help out.  Upon her return, she proceeded to organize her desk for 10 minutes.

On my way out yesterday, I saw an equally long line. 

They need to fix this.  I will not be back.

Visited for Friday\/Saturday nights stay.  Asked for a upgraded GO-room but of course they were sold out.  
Our room was on the 7th floor, facing pool (small view of pool). Room was nice, but bathroom was SO small.
Friends stayed on the 5th floor with a horrible view, but their bathroom was bigger than ours???
The GO-Pool is the real treat of the Flamingo, we reserved a cabana and it was AWESOME!
Tiffany was our server and she rocked.  Bottle service is spendy, but you get a lot of perks and shade, which is key.  And cabana has TV, comfy couch, padded lounge chairs, frig, etc. etc.
I dont know that I would stay at the Flamingo again, but I would hang out by the pool!

God, every time I come back to The Flamingo, I wonder why I ever come back and remember that I had vowed to never come back. 
The rooms are still shit, doesn't matter if they are "executive" or not. Sheets are dirty and old. And the "fridge" and "coffee bar" are barely existent. 
Stupid Ranjani. 
Keep your eye out for Sherri at the front desk though. Super nice lady.

Update: I ended up having to switch hotels and check into Caesars Palace because I started to wheeze in the room at Flamingo :( check out and switching was a breeze. But never again, Flamingo :(

The hotel has friendly staff and I like the self check-in capability to avoid yet another line, but I have to only give one star because I paid $30 extra to check in early to a room that smells like an open septic tank and my $48 steak I got to go from the steakhouse came with a plastic fork and no ability to get a knife from the hotel. 

So, I ate my NY strip with my hands - tasty, but not the enjoyable meal I was looking forward to (& paid for)

No room service after 1pm is understandable since its Vegas, but not convenient for business travelers.

On the plus side, it's Vegas & a casino with some cool shopping.

If you want to learn some patience and aren't too fond of great customer service, stay here.

I booked a suite back in January for my bachelorette weekend that happened April 25. As a local, I picked the Flamingo for me and my girlfriends to stay because of its central location and the "Forever Fabulous" suite was just perfect for our theme. It's pink details throughout the room and spacious floor plan were just what we were looking for. When I had spoken to a lead guest services rep in January I had specified that we needed two roll aways in our room and she assured me that would be no problem. I called again earlier this month to reconfirm my reservation and again made sure the note was on my confirmation about the roll away requests. It was. 

We arrived around 11:30 knowing our room might not be ready but decided to see about checking in early and getting some pool keys anyway. The line was SO long. We waited over thirty minutes just to check. Of course the room was not ready so the woman let us know to check back but gave us some pool keys. We checked back around 3:30 and the room still was not ready. (It is supposed to be ready by 4:00 pm) Once again at 4pm we checked in, they told us the room was ready, but when we went to go try the room key it did not work. May I also mention right now that their elevator system is HORRIBLE! Six elevators and every time we needed one it was a solid fifteen minute wait! This took us an extra 30 minutes just to get in our suite!! When we entered the room we noticed there were no roll away beds. We called the front desk over TEN times to try and get someone to bring them up! They transferred us, put us on hold and then hung up on us each time. We finally gave up. 

At check out good luck trying to get a bell hop to help you bring your bags down. We called for that to and they told us 45 minutes to an hour wait. How are you supposed to check out on time if you can't even get your bags downstairs?? Another twenty minute wait for the elevator and four trips downstairs to get all of our luggage down. We headed over to valet to pick up my car and waited another thirty minutes! We had reservations at noon for brunch for 10 girls at another hotel and we were an hour late for it. This was completely out of my control. I was more than disappointed with the quality of service, delay of absolutely everything we needed, and what we asked for we did not receive. I have family and friends coming in for my wedding in October and I will not be recommending this hotel. The only way they could remedy this weekend would be to give me a refund.

This is one of my favorite hotels to stay at and casinos to gamble at. We stayed here about a year ago, and I can truly say that I have no complaints about the service or cleanliness at the hotel. 

It is probably in the middle range as far as cost. I think weekend rates are about $100ish a night. But the reason that I really like staying here is the convenience of the location. It is in the middle of the strip and all the great hotels\/casinos are pretty close. 

Also, the pool area is neat and good for the kids. The flamingo area is a bonus and free to everybody (whether you're staying there or not) which is cool. Margaritaville is also here and is okay. The music is decent but the drinks are just okay.

I had one night in Vegas and I chose this place for cost and for basic necessities. I paid around $35, but for whatever reason they gave me a suite instead. Pretty cool.

Although it was a suite, it wasn't as nice as what I'm used to; chipped paint, semi-stained carpet, old sheets, and the overall feel had a dingy taste to it.

But at the $35 for a suite, I was pretty much satisfied overall. Sure it had that old feeling, but it was sanitary and clean, and I'm good with that.

I was a bit disappointed that their gym was closed early so I couldn't do my workout. I like their convenient $7 shuttle to and from the airport.

The Flamingo is truly one of my favorites.The history behind it is just amazing. With this, it is  after all one of the oldest hotels on the strip. Of course the building will have issues.

However, the minus is for the LONG check in line. It is ridiculous. You have 3 people working with an outdated system for a line of 100 plus guests. This would be the only reason why I wouldn't want to stay here again.

The elevators are old, and not that fast. However it is an old building. The room was clean, everyone was courteous.

I came here for my wedding. I picked this hotel because of Hunter S. Thompson and Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas as well as the fact that the price was okay.

The hotel itself is very pretty. The staff is fair - not rude but they don't go out of their way for you either.
