I paid for the upgrade when I got there and I wish I hadn't as the room they upgraded me to had a broken bathtub and broken closet. I realized the bathtub was broken at 2am on my wedding night. I called them after we woke up the next morning to see about getting it fixed and having part of my stay comped since we were checking out and was told I should have called at 2am... on my wedding night... no. They would not have wanted to come up to the room because it's my freaking wedding night and I'm going to continue doing whatever I want to in the hotel room we paid for. Eventually they comped the resort fee. It was something.

Bottom line: If I was clairvoyant I would have picked a different hotel.

Tired casino. They really should tear down this place and build something newer and more exciting. Everything here looks and smells geriatric, especially when you see Donnie and Marie plastered everywhere.

I've only passed by or walked through this casino on the way to other places on the Strip. Happened to go through the back and was amazed how big this place actually is. They even have a "wildlife habitat" in the back but that was pretty lame. They had some famingoes (of course), a couple of swans, ducks, turtles, and coi. If you have 5 minutes to kill, this may stimulate you slightly. 

Bottom line: Flamingo and Donnie and Marie - not for me.

Hazel Q nailed it when she said its an A-ok for her book.  

I had a room on the 29th floor and the view was fantastic.  The faux hard wood floors were a nice touch, and the bed was confy.  The bathroom, however, plumeted the rating from a 4 star to a generous 3.  Its old, tiles were chipped, the clothesline was broken, the vanity light wasn't working... awful.  

I can't complain about the price.. I was comp'd and given spending money (pays to be a Total Rewards platinum). Its MUCH better than Imperial Palace (ie: the Quad).  I think next time I'll try for the Go Deluxe rooms.

Worn-down, overcrowded hotel. No refrigerator in the room. Room service closes at 11 PM in LAS VEGAS. Five out of the eight nights I stayed, I had to call the front desk to get someone to clean my room. Once nobody came even though the desk told me they would. Once I just gave up after returning at night to find housekeeping had not been there, forget about it. Other hotels have a hanger you can place on the door to beckon service. Not here; you have to chase 'em down after 2.  Other than that, friendly service. But I'd never go back. Too much like a smoky frat party.

The worst hotel experience I've EVER had on the strip. I am a local and was looking for a place to take my nephew, that had a great pool, for a little staycation. First, when we walked into our room all lights were unplugged and we had find our way in the dark. Then we noticed a poorly patched up hole in the wall, all the furniture was dusty and old, the bathroom was very outdated with scratched, peeling cabinets and the sink didn't even drain. Because we were only there for a quick night, we chalked it up to being an old hotel. But then, the next morning, we found bed bugs in our bed. When we called the front desk and it took four phone calls and an hour and half wait time for he security guard to come to our room to make a report. After the report, we had to go down stairs where we were rudely helped by the front desk and then had to wait another hour to speak to the manager.  The manger was nice, but couldn't help us, all he did was give us a card of another manager and told him to contact him in a couple days. We spent the rest of the day in the pool, which was very small and crowded for families as they have cut off 3\/4 of their pool (the main reason we chose the Flamingo) to accommodate their go-pool (adults only) which I can understand, it is vegas, but they took away their lounge chairs around the slide pool (where my kids wanted to spend all of their time) so we had to sit on the hot concrete. Overall, this was the worst experience I've ever had in a hotel, I will NEVER stay at the flamingo again or even visit it.

My Hubs and I go to Vegas a couple times a year and we have stayed at a lot of different hotels that for the most part are just fine and we don't have any issues with until now and it comes down to personal safety. 

The power went out in the hotel for some time during the morning and we were stuck on the 23rd floor. Ok, no big deal, we get it and relaxed for a while until the power came back on.

The elevator... Later in the day we were going up to our room and we ended up DROPPING several floors. Yes, I said dropping. As in, three times on one way up to the 23rd floor we dropped several stories at a time. When we finally crawled off the elevator I was grateful for my life! We called down to let them know and yet they didn't close off that unit. We ran into others at this resort who say they exact same thing happened to them. 

So, the power has gone out, the elevators are hostile and then the fire alarms start going off at 1am in the Casino and nobody looks concerned! We were lucky to get out of this hotel alive! I guess no one at this property will learn until Caesar's is hit with a major lawsuit.

A few small details. The pool, I am so sad to say that we did not get to enjoy this. The website indicated that the pool was closed for the season and this was not the case. Room fees. We had a free stay, but by the time you upgrade your room and pay for resort fees you might as well be paying a full rate.

Originally had a great stay. I had 3 rooms for memorial day weekend. There was an issue where they could not charge my card for one room for one day i assume it is because they ran my card individually for each room and my card company saw it as suspicious so they blocked it. Flamingo did not notify me of this issue and i was able to stay all 3 nights with out anyone saying anything to me. In October 31st i recieved an alert from credit karma saying they had sent a bill to collections for an unpaid room charge. My credit score dropped 30 points. I have perfect credit, this is the only derogatory mark on my credit score. When I called to ask why they did not bother to notify me of the issue durring my stay or even after, the representative Jessica L from business corporate told me they were not obligated to do so. All this for a $100 charge which i could pay at any given time. Thank you for ruining my credit Flamingo Las Vegas! Shady business tactics, be forewarned!
was this one of many casinos that didn't offer asian gaming opportunities? i forget. so many didn't. it didn't matter.

I agree w Milo's reviews...even though I'm here on comp..not worth it w\/ the resort fees...run down elevators and rooms..broken wall sockets,dents on doors, sagging wall paper, etc.....Casino's great though

Oh dear.  I can't vouch for the renovated section of the hotel - it was sold out.  I can say I stayed in the un-renovated part of the hotel and it was pretty much the worst.  It bears mentioning that probably 10% of the hotel rooms are renovated.  The Spa Tower, the Habitat Tower and the Shite tower or whatever it was called are not renovated. 

The hotels in Las Vegas have themes: Paris is done in a French motif, Bellagio is some kind of balloon motif, and the Flamingo is done in the stain motif.

Where to begin?  The heavily stained carpet?  The wallpaper & paint peeling off the bathroom wall?  Yuck.  P.U.   When I was trying to come up with positives for the room, I noted that there was hot & cold running water and also an electrical outlet.  And a window. The outlet turned out to be one of those stretched out ones that your plug just falls out of.  (Insert dirty joke here).

My friend had a somewhat more cheerful yet un-renovated room, and, I'm not exaggerating here, we had to step over strange, gigantic, sullen-teens to get into and out of her room.  Weird, overfed she-teens converged and just hung out in the door-well of her room.  Was there a Beiber impersonator rumored to be there?  It is a mystery that will remain unexplained forever.

The pool is lovely.  When the temperature drops to a balmy 104 in the late afternoon, that's when to head over.  The security guards wouldn't let us in - it closes at 6pm.  6pm!!!!  Total BS.  6pm. How bout closing when it gets dark?  Go crazy, Flamingo - stay open til aaaah, 8pm in the summertime.

OH I did give it two stars instead of one because a) the people at the counter really really tried to help and were very very nice.  b) the room for all it's beige-stainness thankfully didn't smell.  I'm curious about the renovated rooms tho, reading the wholly other types of experiences other yelpers had.

Hotel is OLD, even though parts of it was recently updated it is just still old. But it is a great location. If you do not plan on spending too much time in your room this is the place to stay. Price is reasonable for what you get just dont expect luxury. 

Walls are very thin so you might here more than you want too

The pool is decent, lots of Palm trees and shrubbery but not much swimming space as it looks like there is from the pictures online. It closes at 6pm when it is still blazing hot, especially in the summer, so get there early to enjoy.

The Flamingo was better than I thought it was going to be.  After reading all the reviews here, I was beginning to believe I might have made the wrong choice of hotel. The hotel room was pretty big and suitable for our needs.  I booked a group of five rooms and every room was okay except for one, the bed had a really big lump in it. The hotel did change that room immediately so I don't have much to complain about in that area. The one concern I do have is that they will charge you for an early check in and we were only early by 25 minutes. This is not something I am quite used to, as I gamble pretty heavily and most other casinos will normally let me do this free of charge as long as they have the rooms ready. I wouldn't have minded if we were able to just get one of the five rooms early so we could drop off our groups stuff. Unfortunately, we were left walking around the casino with all our luggage.  The elevators were not as bad as most other posts had stated. I would say that they are slower than other casinos though.  I definitely wouldn't have a problem staying here again. However, my first choice would be to stay at the other casinos that allow to me to check in early and check out late, free of charge, as I am always rushed away from the casino floor to go check out.

Rooms are small and especially noisy when you have strip view.  Ceasars palace across street had outdoor night club with speakers pointed right at flamingo. Expect your teeth to rattle from the music In your room until 4 am.  Sound proof windows would be nice.....or management at flamingo grow some and tell their sister casino across the way to lower the volume especially after 2a! Btw, it was very difficult to get our room changed the next day to quieter room at hotel (not facing strip).  AND, we got married there. Thank god I love my new wife because I did not feel the love from flamingo! Btw2.....even in our new, difficult to change room, it was still noisy as hell as the doors do not have hinge dampeners and slam loudly when closing....now I know why they call vegas the city that never sleeps....unless you visit gold and silver pawn!  Read my review on that one!

The rooms look like they were recently remodeled as they were clean and comfortable. Unfortunately,  they didn't extend the remodel project into the bathroom! The aged fixtures were rusty and the caulking in the tub had mold\/mildew all over.  All of this would have earned at least 3 stars except my room had a very leaky faucet in the tub.  At checkout, I notified the desk clerk of the leaky faucet and told her I didn't sleep well because of it.  She said "is it a drip?" And I told her it was more like a constant run.  Her response was "thank you, you're all set."  I was not expecting a comp on the room, but maybe a "I am really sorry that the faucet prohibited the one thing that you came to this hotel for... sleep!  We would like to give you an incentive to give us another try next time you are in Vegas." 
Didn't get that.... one star.

If your looking for the "Vegas Experience" (Tacky pink rooms, old people at slot machines with oxygen tank and a cigarette, etc.) this is the place to go. Be prepared to be nickel and dimed to death (pay for Wi-Fi, etc.)

Let's make this short and sweet, shall we?

For reference, we stayed in the Go Deluxe Suite. 

Pros: 
- Smack dab in the middle of the Strip
- Cheap tables (for the Strip)
- Affordable rooms
- TV inside my bathroom mirror (awesome for getting ready)
- That awesome "Flamingo-ey" smell that you can't get anywhere else!
- Late night food court

Cons:
- Rooms are clearly older, including carpet, TV's, lighting, and decor
- Elevators are scary as hell. (This coming from a person who takes an elevator every day to get to my apartment)
- Valet is so slow. It pained me to tip after waiting 30 minutes to get my car. 
- Hotel is next door to the Bill's remodel and construction is loud and constant. (Has been going on for about a year and will continue for at least another year)
- BLACK HOLE of internet and phone service.

After staying at Flamingo, I think in the future I will just come here to gamble rather than to sleep. The hotel is a little too outdated for me and I missed some of the glitz and glam that you get when you stay at places like Palazzo.

All three of the rooms I changed to because of mildew around the bathtubs got worse in each rooms!

I would not invite my family to stay in such an awful rooms.

It really is a shame for such a landmark of a place.  I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Wrote a letter with pictures describing my experiences; no reply from management.  Again, very disappointed.

Long story short, the flamingo has shitty customer service. They put us in a room where the door doesn't shut all the way, despite it slamming behind us and looking closed. We went out for the night and came back to change shoes. We found our room in shambles and stuff thrown everywhere. We had over $1,000 stollen from us in cash and jewelry. We called the hotel and they sent security to come check it out and take pictures and statements. They did NOTHING for us, so we called the police. The front desk did NOT care and didn't seem worried about it at all! They said they're hands were "tied." They were a joke! I'm super upset. I won't be back, and they are about to have a law suit on their hands.

I go off season so maybe that plays a role (roll pun) and I saty in one of the nicer rooms but ill give my three for the value prop. lookit this aitn no ballers casino k? now that weve established that for the price especially during the week and the location its not quite as bad as all that. sure its dated but my experience has been 'normal' check in times not crazy and when I needed wifi the courtesy desk picked right up and gave me fast insructiosn that worked. granted I was already paying that casino fee or whatervrz its called. Its all about the price and location here. assumption is mostly you out bangin it at the tables or elsewhere partying anyway. its vegs cmon  lol

Want to give this hotel more than 2 stars but I cannot.  Let me start with the first impression.  Upon checking in, we were approached by a lady in nice looking black suits.  She directed us to a booth where we were to "receive our welcome gift".  There, we spent over 1\/2 hr with another lady who tried to get our IDs to sign up for a "free 2 hour tour" in order to get our "free gift" such as free buffet pass, free show tickets, and so on.  We were not sure what the "tour" was all about so we told the lady let us get to our room first then cone down and talk to get more but the lady would not let us go and again kept asking for our IDs to sign us up.  We then let get know firmly that we wanted to get our room first and she hit really upset.  Later on, as we read more about their "tour" that we learned it was nothing other than a deceiving way to get people sign up for time share, and that these ppl are really pushy and bully, and the tour could take up to excruciating 6 hours.  Thanks but no thanks "ladies".  Why do Flamingos let these ppl continue harassing their guests? Idk, but one thing for sure, I will not waste my time with these ppl ever again.

Our hotel room is extremely small, old, and run-down.  The card dealers and the pit managers I encountered were  really rude and they treated their guests with no respect whatsoever.

On the positive note, the buffet has nice atmosphere with the view of the flamingos, and really good service and yummy food.

Don't recommend staying here.

I thought most of the people here were very helpful but our room was plain and kind of sad looking. None of our furniture matched, paint was chipped in the very plain bathroom. It was clean and that was good. They gave us an upgrade to a room with a view...of a roof and ventilation system! Gee thanks! Buffet was fine and the pool was nice and clean and cold.

Have stayed at Caesars properties on trips to Vegas for over 20 years. Came to Flamingo for the superbowl party, SO disappointed in the room, not just aged and in poor condition, dirty. Dust sitting on top of the phone and the lampshade actually looks furry with the dust. No hot water. I attempted to let the front desk know, was very curtly told to wait in line. A huge line of people checking in, this will be my last trip to Flamingo, clearly the art of customer service is gone. With rooms $100 a night plus the service charge of $30 on top of that it is sad that the place has declined so badly and no one cares.

Flamingo, you try. You really do. However, everything can be lost in the details. The three stars go to your awesome phone reservation crew they deserve 5 stars, really. The hotel deserves two. We had a suite for our wedding. The suite was renovated. The view wasn't at all bad and the hotel floor was quiet. The renovation looks like me and my friends got a $500 budget and watched YouTube videos. The part that bothered me was the bathtub. It was discolored but the renovated shower was fine so we just avoided that tub. They had a coffee maker and when I went to use it there was old water that was already in the Maker, I don't know how long that was sitting there so I just put the lid on it and pretended it didn't exist. I will say again that the phone reservation crew was great. One of our party got waylaid due to weather and their flight got in a day late. The conformation team was able to switch rooms and save us $15. I appreciated that.

2.5 stars, but I will round up (I really liked their TVs in the bathroom mirror though).

Definitely go for a GO ROOM and you won't regret your stay here. The Go rooms are actually pretty nice, clean, very affordable, and have some spiffy elements to them. The hallways and Go room atmostphere makes me think of a candy\/cupcake shop with a color scheme of pinks\/browns everywhere, but I love the fact that they have a built in TV in the mirrors of each bathroom (Genious!). Bathroom door was a frosted glass sliding door without a lock, and is easily pushed off hinges when you close it too hard. Sometimes it feels like the door does not close all the way. They have an ipod docking system with a pretty good sound system, but you have to obtain the cord form the front desk. 

The hotel itself is in a pretty prime location, smack dab in the middle of the strip and walkable distance to many other bigger hotels\/tourist attractions (bellagio fountains, etc.).Taxi lines were never long and the casino area is alright. 

Turnoffs: Hotel front desk is quite small compared to the other bigger hotels. Lack of front desk staff made the check-in line take forever. There is only one check-in and check-out line, which made checking-out take forever too. PLAN accordingly if you have to make a flight. Obtaining internet connection was a pain and there is a charge for internet here. Demographics of the guests at this hotel was not as hip and young as I would have liked it to be, but it makes sense because this is one of the older hotels around. 

P.S. They have real flamingos and other animals in the pool\/patio area. Pool area is quite big with multiple pools, but I didn't have a chance to check it out.

Worst experience at a hotel ever!! We show up at 1:00 pm and first they say they don't have any of the strip go rooms available facing the strip. I paid more for a strip view but he said all reservations are only "requests". After asking again a room mysteriously became available. I was then told to come back in an hour because cleaning staff were in the room. Sure, no problem we were early anyway. He said it should be less than an hour but he wanted to be conservative. So we come back in an hour and wait in the mail and keys line. We ask for the key to our room and are told it is not yet available and that the maids are still in there. We had already walked to the car to grab all our stuff. I asked when it will be available and they said they have no way of contacting the maid staff. Then I ask if they could give me a call when the room is ready and they said they don't do that. I waited in the mail and keys line again to speak with another of their "customer service personnel". This one started snapping at me and giving me attitude. So I walked off and waited another half hour. When I spoke with the same woman again she said "we told you to wait at least an hour". At 3:30 pm they say the room is still not available and may not be by 4pm. "But check in is at 4?" "Check in is actually 4-6pm" is the response I get. This place is completely disorganized. The check-in staff make promises then the key people say they aren't supposed to do that and apparently Nobody has the ability to actually get in touch with the cleaning staff. The whole time I was waiting people were complaining about rooms not being ready when promised and about the rude staff. I won't put myself through this again and I recommend that you stay far far away. The rooms are cheap for a reason.

Where do I start? This was my first trip ever to Vegas and at 53 was so excited. The first night of the stay at 2 am a very drunk woman was going up and down the hallway pounding on doors and screaming to let her in. After about 20 minutes I called the desk. They tell me they will send security. 26 minutes later she is still at it and no security so I call back. I am told that they will call security again. 20 min later still no security. It was scary. The next morning we talk to the manager on the floor and was told that he would call security and follow up with us. Guess what. No follow up. So far the only really good thing I have to say about my experience with the flamingo is the housekeeping staff is amazing. I have one more night here and am hoping for the best.

We stayed here for our honeymoon and reserved a GO Luxury Room with a strip view. The room was cute and stylish, bed was comfortable. The automatic drapes and floor to ceiling windows are a nice touch. The sink however would fill up very quickly and drain extremely slow. Our strip view that we paid extra for was covered by a Donnie and Marie banner outside. We also paid extra for an early check in, and was told we would be contacted once the room was ready at noon. By 2:00 we still had not heard anything so I called and sure enough it had been ready the whole time.

My biggest concern and complaint is the valet service.  We parked our car valet on Sunday and picked it up Wednesday, so who knows what could have happened in between.  When we picked it up we immediately noticed our gas tank was 1\/4 tank lower then when we left it, but decided we couldn't really do much about it. Later down the road I noticed a starbucks napkin next to the seat. We have not been to starbucks in this car, its brand new. And finally and most damaging when we stopped for gas 2 hours down the road we noticed a huge deep scrape on the back passenger wheel and a large chunk out of the tire. I have attempted to contact the hotel regarding this and have not received any response. 

The elevators are HORRIBLE, dirty, rickety, some feel very unsafe. The casino was just okay, nothing special, old. Margaritaville was okay, cool decor, lots to look at, food was nothing special but good, same with the drinks. The animal habitat was nice to check out, although from other reviews I expected more. 

We had to pay $20\/day resort fee which is supposed to cover the gym and wifi. Our wifi did not work at all. We also noticed a sign in the room saying wifi was $13.99\/day. Kinda pissed at that!!

The best & worst part of the whole place is the pool. We had lots of fun the two days we spent at the pool. The drinks are strong and the music is fun. The pool food was far better then any of the restaurants at the Flamingo! That being said, shame on Flamingo for allowing just anyone into this pool. We had to stand in line for an hour before the pool even opened just to get a lounge chair. This pool is not just for hotel guests witch is appalling to me! Anyone can pay to get in. In fact they didn't even check our room keys or IDs (21+) upon entering. We could have been anyone off the street. 

Watch out for the various booths around the hotel with people offering you a free show and buffet. It sounded like a great deal and the people were nice, so we signed up. When we went to our free buffet, only then did we find out we were stuck in a Wyndham timeshare scam for 5 hours!!! 

We saw Vinny Favorito at the Flamingo. The show was great! We laughed the whole time. Hes not for everyone though, they do warn you when you buy the tickets. He performs in Bugsy's Cabaret, its almost disgusting in there. They really need to update that room. We were seated on very small chairs placed extremely close together. Chairs and carpet looks VERY dirty, we almost walked out before the show started due to the state of the room. Glad we stayed because Vinny was hilarious. 

We also ate at the Paradise Garden buffet during our stay. It was truly gross. Everything I tried tasted was nasty. Oversalted, stale, real lack of any kind of quality. WAY over priced for what you get to choose from. No dessert bar at all! Very outdated seating & decor. In fact I had the worst stomach ache later that night. Pretty positive it was the buffet food.

All in all we would stay here again if the price was right. Our room and the pool was the best part, and thats what we would come back for. I would take our dining elsewhere. They really need to update the rest of the hotel to match the new style of the rooms. Especially since the Linq is right outside and the Quad is so new and updated.

I read an article about Ceasar's entertainment being 20B+ in debt. Yes, that is a "B" as in billion. I wondered, how is it that they are so deep in sh*t? A few nights at the Flamingo would have any customer putting the nails in the coffin for CZR. 

I know Flamingo is one of the older, cheaper, discount hotels on the strip, but I could not have predicted how dire the situation here was. Had I not had my rooms next to everyone else in the company, I would have left and rebooked elsewhere.

Location: 1 star for location. It's the Las Vegas Strip and its next to Drai's newest series of clubs @ the Cromwell (which is owned by Ceasars). 

Rooms: -3 stars. Rooms are clearly outdated. I felt uncomfortable lying in my bed for fear that it had not been clean. My fears of unclean rooms were reinforced by the cockroaches that crawled up my bathroom windows as I washed up in the morning. The bathroom vent next to the old shower and musty shower curtains were also filled with lint. Even if I had wanted to get sleep in the bed, the music from 8 floors below was blaring through the window into my room. I figured it would stop at 4am. Nope. Guests lucky enough to enjoy people watching those in the new Linq outdoors area are also blessed with 24 hours of live music ranging from Ke$ha to all your favorite edm tracks keeping you up all day\/night.

Service: -1 star. I asked to change rooms for only a few hours because by the second night I was dead tired and desperately needed sleep. After being redirected twice, I was told they were sold out and couldn't do anything about it. Thank God for Bose QC15 headphones I have otherwise I may have slept in the bathroom.

Food options: You have a Mexican cafe that services a decent breakfast, a food court with Johnny Rockets open very late at night, some bad Chinese place, a bad pizza place, and a bad subs restaurant. But food isn't really a reason anyone stays here anyways. 

Never staying here again. Good luck to all employees here, I wish you the best on your future job searches.

If I could give them 0 stars I would !!  We stayed 3 nights and 4 days in this hotel and it sucked every night. Everything started when we walked in the room!! We asked for a non smoking well we got a smoking room !! Then we realized the tv was broken!! Also the fire detector was cover !!! We called and it took them 4 hours to fix everything and we only got an I'm sorry !!! If your are trying to get down to the casinos around noon well good luck. it took us 30 min to find an elevator that will take us down because for some stupid reason this hotel doesn't believe in stairs.

My hotel room was being flipped by a man when I returned to my room.  I actually caught the man in my room going through all my belonging.  It turns out it was the maid that let him in the room.  Then the Flamingo (every manager I have spoken to and there have been several) argues that they are not to blame and will compensate me for my room charges.  I even had to insist for a room upgrade after they moved me to another room after the incident (as they call it).  They were not sympathetic at all that my belongings were all gone through and that it was their maid that let him into my room.  Now if something would have been stolen then they say it would have been a different story.  Thank god I caught him in the act.  I WARN EVERYONE, NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!

I made on line reservation at the Flamingo.  Remembering the last time I walked through the casino (10 years ago) and their online pic's of the rooms it looked OK so locked it in for 3 night mid week business trip.  The rates were fantastic, I paid $29 a night (when I checked a week earlier the rates were in the $50's).  The rooms were OLD.  Carpet stained and worn, they had an old beat up chair at the computer desk, the windows were dirty, the elevators were scared with graffiti that was removed, the elevator coming up from the valet had tiles broken and exposed plywood. 

For the money, a good deal. For Las Vegas strip, outdated and tired.  Wouldn't had been so bad if they maintained the place better.

The hotel is located in a busy street. We slept three days in this budget hotel. It is located on the main street in Las Vegas. The room was small and it was dingy. It was dusty and dark. Moreover, the room smelled of smoke. The second day I went to complain to the reception room and exchanged for spacious, clean and brand new. We were happy. Services were in charge. The hotel had a tennis court. At the reception lended tennis rackets. The hotel was in a good spot. Everywhere we should close the hotel but the noise from the main road has been adapted. The hotel I booked on the internet and we got a discount.
i love they casino floor... hot girl dancing around... and all dealer are hot... i love it ... and wining money with free deck of used playing card !!!!

One of the original hotel\/casinos in Las Vegas.  The Flamingo with its natural habitat is worth the free stroll through to see the beautiful birds up close!  However, there's not a lot to it, but certainly worth seeing as one of the few last free things in Vegas!

I expected mid-level service and quality, but I did not expect the 1.5 hour wait for checkin at 11:45 PM. This place runs like a ship... A very slow moving ship that is understaffed and shows its age. The carpets were coming up in the hallways, there were holes in the bathroom ceiling and the buffet was abysmal. The pool is this place's only saving grace.

I recently came back to Flamingo for EDC weekend. I had vowed never to step foot back here after my last experience about 2 years ago, but my friend was the one in charge of booking the room so I had no say. I was prepare for an old, terrible room like I had last time but much to my surprise, we got the GO room and it was great!

The GO room is one of the newer, renovated rooms at the Flamingo and it was very cute. The room has a mini fridge and a coffee maker, things that I consider important to have at a hotel! The bathroom is very spacious and clean with a mini tv! The room itself has plenty of lighting along with a big mirror for us girls to get ready with. The beds were comfy and the tv was pretty big. All in all, I really enjoyed my stay here the second time around and would come back again if I get to stay in the GO room!

FYI: If you have made a reservation online you don't have to wait on their very long check-in line. Trust me, you can go to the "High Roller" line.  It's shorter and for some reason 2 people are at the front desk. Quicker service!

We stayed on the 19th floor, paid about $100\/nt for the view of the High Roller, very pretty! You can also see the pool area and surrounding palm trees. Room was very clean when we first got there but within the 6 days I think they only swept the room once. The room was newly renovated, cute and chic with a lot of hot pink and black with modern wooden floors. (See pictures)

The bathroom? Not so much. It was clean but the ceiling was low and definitely looked dated, a little dingy but useable. 

Also, 2 employees randomly walked in while we were still in the room around 5pm without knocking and said they were doing their rounds of checking the rooms. Felt a little shady but thankfully nothing was stolen.

The first time I stayed at The Flamingo me and my wife were still just dating. I had only been to Vegas once before and stayed at Bally's but she had been there about 4 times already. Since neither of us had stated at the Flamingo, and since we had a good deal on the rooms, and since it was right in the heart of the strip we decided to book it.

We were not disappointed. Sure the rooms were a little outdated but we didn't spend much time sitting around our room. I do believe they are in the process of updating all their rooms to the Go Room style which will be nice.
 We were out exploring and seeing all that Vegas had to offer. And that's were the Flamingo shines. Sitting in the center of the strip makes it easy to get wherever you want go, plus it has it's own monorail stop which was awesome. I don't think there is a better location.

The grounds at the Flamingo are gorgeous. It's beautifully maintained with live flamingos and a pond with turtles and koi. Cute little Gazebos and two outdoor swimming pools. It's a nice place to take a morning walk and see the waterfalls and all the colorful flowers. 

The casino itself is cool because it's pretty open for the most part and you don't feel suffocated. There is no theme unless you count the color pink as a theme. The sportsbook is really just some seating and the counter\/screens\/big board. But really that's all I need while I'm there. I just usually put down a small bet then go about my day. I can't really sit still long enough to watch any sports so I just check the scores later.

We didn't eat at the buffet but Tropical Breeze Cafe was ok,  Burger Joint was pretty good, and Margaritaville was really good. We also got room service which was good as well. Also the little coffee\/sandwich\/breakfast counter was good and we utilized that quite a few times. Also last but not least was the Sin City Brewery. It was a convenient place for me to grab a cold one before heading out or heading back to the room.

The second time we stayed at the Flamingo was after we had decided to get married in LV. We checked out packages for all the hotels in our price range and ended up going with the Flamingo because of our previous experience and the beauty of the grounds. We had several family members and friends stay there too and everyone seemed to enjoy their stay.

The planning of the wedding couldn't have been simpler. We chose a package (I dream flamingos) and made a few choices and our flamingo wedding planner took care of the rest. Neither my wife or myself really wanted anything to do with a big wedding or picking out center pieces and that sort of stuff so it was perfect for us. 

Our wedding package was supposed to include an outdoor Gazebo ceremony but it literally started storming 10 minutes before our time and only lasted about 15 minutes. But we moved inside to stay dry and had the ceremony in a small chapel. It worked out great and apparently it's good luck to have rain on your wedding day in the desert.

The man who performed the ceremony was great. We asked for a non religious wedding and what he said was very sweet without being corny. He kept us loose and laughing and it was over pretty quickly without seeming rushed. The piano player was good too and performed the songs we picked out beautifully. 

Right afterwards we went out with the photographer they provided. We had purchased an extra hour with the photographer to make sure we would get enough pictures. We really happy we did because we got some really cool shots around the grounds. It really seemed like the perfect amount of time. We were also able to look at and pick out our pictures the next morning right at the Flamingo.

For the reception dinner we booked a party of about 25 at Margaritaville. It was an awesome dinner and I will review that separately. But everything (except the weather) worked out perfectly. We couldn't have been happier. I would easily recommend the Flamingo to anyone going to LV. The price, location, and service were all top notch. I know part of the fun of going to Vegas is staying at the different hotels, and I'm sure I will, but I will certainly stay at Flamingo again.

I booked our room online and confirmed I needed 2 beds, had pets and was checking in really late. The lady on the phone told me the pet go rooms would be an additional 40 per night, so I booked\/upgraded the room. 

Now, online the rooms looked amazing. The GO rooms for pets were lush with all sorts of pet friendly amenities. 

The room they put us in had dirty stained carpets, the bedside lamp was missing a shade, there were candy wrappers under the beds, dirty ashtray in the drawer, missing glasses, corroded bathroom fixtures & a clogged sink. when I laid down to sleep the bedding smelled like someone had been chain smoking for weeks in the room. 

I won't stay here again. Its disgusting and I'm leaving early because of it. Blah, yuck

I stayed here recently for the second time. When we were there last time (2009) we had to haggle to get the room we had booked but overall enjoyed our stay. That is why we stayed there again this time. It was not as good. We did not get the room we had reserved and didn't bother to haggle, I'm at a point in my life where I'd just like to get what I paid for, if your not going to give it to me (and tell me I can possible switch rooms tomorrow) I'll just suck it up and not visit again. The room was dated, there was cheap but decent décor, but the room itself was junk. The price was great but I'd pay more to get what I want in a decent hotel. The food was really bad this time too and last time we really enjoyed it. There is a horrible sweet smell in that casino which drives me nuts too, it's gross. That overall is enough to make me not want to personally come back but I would have still recommended it for someone going to Vegas on the cheap if it was not for our last night. We were approached by a guy named Chandler in the hotel, telling us about a party that was going to be held in the Carlos and Charlie's restaurant and since we were guests we could have free drinks, he gave us a wrist band. When we came back later to the "party" we were told that we had to pay a $15 cover at the door but were given blue cups which would allow us to drink for free. We were seated at the bar when an older man in a suit came up and started yelling at my husband that he couldn't be drinking out of a blue cup, they were for ladies only. I said, fine it's mine. The guy went nuts! He got in my face and started yelling at me, cussing me out and spitting in my face. I was appalled, it was unbelievable. I asked the guy who he was, he yelled, I asked him if he was the manager, he said "f you" I asked him if he worked for the hotel and hey just yelled and cussed and spit. UNBELIEVABLE! I left my husband and girlfriend at the bar and went to the bell desk. I asked to speak with a manager. I told Kathy, the women at the desk, what had happened. She informed me that the party was being put on by a promotions company, not the hotel or the restaurant and that there was nothing the hotel could do. Really? That just seems like bad business. She suggested I tell security what was going on so there would be a record. I did this and the security guard said the same thing. I went back to the restaurant. At the door a young man said "your boyfriend can't drink out of your cup" (hubs had his own cup). I asked him who he was, trying to find out who's party this was. He was obviously trying to not give me any information or he honestly didn't know who he was. He first said he owned the party, then he said his company owned the party. Obviously I was confused so I kept asking, trying to figure out where to complain. He went back in forth several times first saying it was Carlos and Charlie's party then saying it was his and finally settling on his company owned it and his company was called Ulta. Because of this experience I'm not going back to the Flamingo. FYI, I hadn't even started drinking yet, so it wasn't one of those drunk people experiences. Crappy business for the hotel to let their guest get taken advantage of, but since they seem to do the same thing I guess they don't care about their guests at all at the Flamingo

Great hotel for the price!!! Great service and great location.

We stayed here 12\/9-12\/12. 

The hotel and room were very clean and very nice. We got upgraded to a bigger room with a beautiful view. 

We had a problem with our card being double charged. We went to the front desk. They explained why and then they called our bank and got everything reversed so we got our money back*

Only critique would be they need to add more gambling options and do a little more updating. I would for sure stay here again!!!

Ok, after reading all of the negative reviews, was not sure what to expect. We got there and it was actually ok. I mean, no it is not fancy or anything like that, but our room was a standard room, it was big enough, clean and housekeeping did a great job. We stayed there for two nights and our stay was very pleasureable. The downside was the pool, yes, it has pretty waterfalls, but it was wayyyyy too crowded and it looks like they will let anyone off the street in, since they do not ask for a room key?? Also, the pool was very dirty, a lot of drunken debris flowing about....We did not go back to the pool for the remainder of our stay....but overall the hotel deserves the three stars!

Seniors..disabled have to pay resort fee ever when pool is closed, we can't use gym, have own wi-fi. This is totally unexceptable. Additionally, we valet parked our luxury car and we think it was joy ridden. Car was filthy when returned. When were checking out they couldn't find it. Attendant drove us around in some other guests car to look for it. Took an hour at 7am???
This was a major breach of valet procedure. 
Valet manager was rude and said this could never happen. Upper management promised to review and report. They also just gave us the stone wall.
Avoid the flamingo hotel.
Relating to cars filthy condition..they offered a car wash (never given to us) which would be unusable for we were out of towners. How would you like to have an attendant drive me around for 20 minutes in your car with all your stuff in it. A less honorable man could have stolen stuff. Valet is important for my wife who is disabled, but never again will we visit this joint.
Manager said car was put in construction zone. That is why I could not be found in an hour. Finally..After waiting over an hour I found it not 50 yards from garage entrance... we felt it was being used as well and just dumped there.
Bugsy, is the right word

The Flamingo has been a mainstay in Las Vegas for as long as you can remember. Old Blue Eyes frequented this joint often with his Rat Pack and you can really tell age hasn't always been the kindest to the interior and design of this heirloom hotel & casino. However, if you can look past the cheesiness of some of the decorum and look more into the amenities this place has to provide, you'll see this is still one of the best budget hotels to stay in Vegas.

Exterior\/Interior - 2 stars

The glitz and glam of a former era still speaks loudly at the Flamingo. The tacky designs of aged light bulbs and over-the-top glitz just doesn't fit well with the ultra sleek and clean look of modern Las Vegas hotels. Walking outside and the facade hasn't aged well; walking inside and it's old school, and not in a good way. If all hotels & casinos were based off face value, the Flamingo would be the unpopular kid getting hit in the head with dodge-balls. Luckily, the Flamingo is more than looks.

Room - 4 stars

Walking through the casino floor you would expect the same tackiness to fill up the rooms of the hotel but the Flamingo did an excellent job of renovating their rooms. Dark stained laminate looking somewhat like wood is your floor. The rooms are spacious enough where you can easily fit in a party of 6 or 8 people comfortably. The water pressure in the shower is excellent and hot water is available within seconds. And most importantly, these rooms have some of the most excellent views out onto the Strip. When you see the gold of sunset slowly drip onto the Strip and neon lights bring the city to life, you fall mesmerized by that window view. It was my nightlight to sleep and captivated me more than anything I could find on TV.

Yet, there are downsides to this room. The laminate isn't exactly smooth all around. The lamps in the bathroom are rusty. The vent was crooked in the bathroom and the TV was way too small for the size of the furniture. Still, other than some minor things you honestly couldn't ask for more in a room.

Amenities - 3 stars

I'm going to include location into this part as well. If this entire section alone was based off location it would be 5 stars. The Flamingo is located right in the heart of the Strip (or at least where it matters). You are right across from Caesar's Palace, side-by-side with The Linq and The Cromwell and you can walk all the way to Wynn or the Cosmopolitan within 10 - 15 minutes. It really is a fantastic location; however, location isn't the only factor. As far as in house things like gym or just the casino itself, you'll find yourself drifting to other locations. Why stay and gamble at the Flamingo when you have much nicer casino floors 100 feet away? The gym itself is nothing more than a small room about the size of a store. In fact, it is squeezed right between a lingerie store and jeweler and since there are no doors for privacy if you're doing those incredible effective glute exercises, anyone walking by can see you sweating. Still, the Flamingo does have some cool amenities like seeing their flamingos out in the garden, exotic birds for show and tell near the buffet, and Center Cut is still one of the best steakhouses on the Strip, a hidden gem really.

Conclusion

In a time where EDM, day clubs, and the Buffet of Buffets exists, the Flamingo can feel like a remnant of the past. Still, with excellent location, gorgeous views of the Strip from your room, affordable prices, and a great steakhouse, as long as the Flamingo can continue to improve itself this hotel & casino ain't going nowhere.

I really liked this hotel! The only con was that I was OK with a smoking room and I regret that. I didn't realize how much I smelled like smoke when I got home from my conference trip.

Pros: 
- Location. Close to lots of places on the strip. Walkable to the Venetian for conference.
- Affordable.
- Rooms were decent! Very spacious. I did not have a great view, though, but I'm sure other rooms did.
- Casino. 
- Buffet
- Restaurants
- Flamingos! The wildlife section here is my favorite part. You can walk through and see bird and koi exhibits, feedings, photo ops. Plus the buffet can give you a view of some of the park.

Cons:
- My coworker hated this place. Thought it was really tacky and horrible. If you're picky like that and would rather pay a little more for elsewhere.

Got a comped suite room here :) View was amazing along with the location since its in the middle of the strip. I love pink, so the room theme of pepto bismol all over did not annoy me. Showers were so cool and the heater light was pink which was unique! You could really tell they maintained and renovated the place since the bathrooms, furniture, and TVs all looked really new! I mean what do you expect it is hilton owned! Its nice no doubt, but if i was to pay for the room I'd much rather stay at the wynn where the whole hotel is new. Brownie points for the Flamingo for having real flamingos all around the garden area. I hope this hotel stays it's a classic and one of the very few originals of vegas left!
